Reviews.Title: “Double Charge”
Reviews.Author: Danny B
Reviews.Content: We originally booked to stay here but after the hotel no longer had the Hilton name, many of the reviews on here were poor. For this reason we cancelled our stay. Having booked with the Hilton we were not told about the change, they also could not find our booking when I rang to cancel. Eventually we were told our booking had "slipped between the Hilton and LVH booking systems." Under the conditions of our booking we were supposed to lose our deposit, the hotel however were good enough to refund our deposit as we had booked with the Hilton and now it was no longer a Hilton. End of story? Not quite. Having lost our original booking, they somehow duplicated the booking a month before our trip and charged my credit card a second time. They also refunded this money but they insisted I had made a second booking. I most definately did not, why would I when I had booked elsewhere? So I cannot review the hotel having not stayed there but having had the experience I did, I would never book this hotel. Also having been to Las Vegas this last week and seen the location of the hotel, it is too far off the strip and to use the monorail every day is expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Worst stay ever”
Reviews.Author: mgavett
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the property a month before and staff was friendly and things were open and things were good. This time we stayed the room was upgraded to a suite which was smaller than we booked and was in disrepair so we opted to go back to our booked room. We found things closed all week long when the signage said open daily 7am-11pm never opened the entire 3 days we were there. The monorail closed early at 12am instead of 2am (this was not presented until you had paid for the tickets and entered to monorail) the entire week we stayed, this made us return to the room 2 hours earlier than planned every night. The staff was over heard just begging to get a different job to get out of this hotel. One hostess was even trying to land a job with a local patron right there on the spot while she was working. The bars had drink offers but were never open to honor them. The offers we did use had failed to mention they were for cheap beer or rail drinks only, so the offers were horrible. The entire stay was miserable and service was aweful. Even the gaming staff was looking like they didn't want to be there. Never once got a free cocktail while playing an hour of roulette and slots never paid out at all. This was the worst stay ever. Not to mention it looked like a ghost town. Our upgraded room, when we had trouble the clerk stated they didn't have anything else they were all booked 'NOT TRUE' the hotel was at a minimum all week and the number of people walking around showed this to be true. The only friendly help was the bellman who hailed the cab as we left the property. Think twice before staying here again. The only saving grace was the package price was pretty good and the buffet was tasty and dinner included beer & wine for $19.99. Never did see any of the other restaraunts open but we did see people in the cafe but it to was closed. No lounge acts or music and shows were high school quality. Definately not worth the price of admission. When we checked out we mentioned the issues to the desk cleark and they could care less never once asked to elaborate or if there was anything they could do to make the stay memorable just here's your receipt, thank you, goodbye. Even the gaming offer didn't work right and took a long time to get the $10 credit applied which was lost in 2 pulls of the slot machine, was definately not worth the effort or time waiting for them to figure out their own system and offer. The going green credit was nice but we were told we would get the credit each night and it never showed up after the first night. A really nice earth friendly concept but a failed execussion, oh well we did get one credit but not the other, they even argued with my wife which is never called for. The only pleasurable part of the stay was the spa/fitness & pool area, nice and relaxing, this is what you would have expected the entire stay.

Reviews.Title: “Same old, Same old”
Reviews.Author: kidsareallgrown
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here almost a dozen times over the last 15 years. I love the fact that it is off the strip and therefore a little quieter. Rooms are spacious and clean but the bathrooms are in need of a little TLC - although it just may be the age of the hotel. No complaints, good rates, and easy access to the convention center if that's why you're in the city. Restaurants are very good.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay During a Convention”
Reviews.Author: Jack2148
Reviews.Content: If you are going to Las Vegas to attend a function at the Las Vegas Convention Center this is by far the best place to stay. I will stay here during my next convention for sure. As far as the rooms.... the room I had was in bad need of some updating. The plumbing fixtures are old and not working well, the sick would not drain, the shower barely had enough pressure to take a shower. We found dirty socks under the bed when we checked in, but all in all the room was clean. The mattress, sheets and towels are not the quality of what you would expect in a 3 or 4 star hotel. These all need updating badly. They offer a deal to wave the daily maid service for a $10 voucher. We tried that option and never did get the voucher. They want to charge $14 a day to connect to WiFi. They charge $3 a day to use the room safe. It is always some charge that is not necessary. I would not consider staying at this hotel during non convention trips.

Reviews.Title: “Had no choice - needed to be close to LVCC”
Reviews.Author: jonibook
Reviews.Content: We exhibited at the convention center (For those of you that travel internationally, check out pluggenie.com, coming soon) and by far this was the easiest and most convenient hotel to stay at. The rates were higher than better hotels b/c of trade show. Rooms were just OK. Internet was $14.95 per device per room where at the Palazzo which is fabulous, it was free. The business center charges to print out an airline boarding pass. I passed. This is just gouging business people who stay here for the convention center. Casino was very quiet, no ding ding from the slots... quite weird. Not sure what we will do next year. There are so many hotels that are actually "fun" to stay in, but the taxi fare and extra time to get to and from the LVCC is a tough call. The monorail does stop almost at the side door which is convenient but at 7AM, who knows? Unless you are going to work at a trade show and have to be there early in the morning , might be much more fun to be elsewhere and the internet charges - absolutely obscene.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location”
Reviews.Author: Fakapuna
Reviews.Content: Best hotel for Tram access, ok rooms, elevators can be slow at times, best sports book in town with free drinks, however very smokey. They need some better dining and quick eat options.

Reviews.Title: “sportsbook”
Reviews.Author: Anthony T
Reviews.Content: one of the best sportsbooks in Vegas good food at sportsbook deli

Reviews.Title: “Down and Out in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Orkestrel
Reviews.Content: What a difference a few years makes. We have frequented this hotel in the past when it was a Hilton Property. In fact when making reservations for this trip in late 2011 the hotel was still owned by Hilton. Sadly, as of January 2012, the property had been sold (I was told to an Atlantic City investment company.) Although a few Hilton branded items remain in inventory (laundry bags, pens, etc.) Hilton standards are long gone. We stayed here for a five day convention in mid March 2012. Several problems were encountered and reported, none of which were corrected or even addressed. We paid the "conference rate" which was about twice the rack rate or "special" rate available at the time (but included a few conference registration items.) Value was probably about half of what we paid. The first indication that there was trouble ahead was that there was absolutely no one in line at the check in desk. The experience was pretty much on a straight downward trajectory after that. Compared to the well kept properties just a few blocks away on the strip, this hotel is definitely third tier and fading fast. I expect it will be razed and replaced within a few years. The trip was salvaged from "one star" status only by the extremely helpful front desk agent encountered on the last day of the stay. She was very apologetic and courteous, gave us a modest food credit, and sent a bottle of $9 champagne to the room for our inconvenience. However, in a prophectic quote she said "...some of us think we would be better off if this place just imploded." My sentiments exactly. For the cost, almost any place on the strip will be a better value for your money. I can't recommend this hotel any longer. And now for the specifics: Pros: 1) Due to declining attendance, the casinos and public spaces are less crowded. Subsequently, there is less smoke choking the public areas. Parking garage was also quite uncrowded. 2) The rooms are adequately sized and clean, if not well maintained. Definitely better than some of the sleazy hotels just off the strip. 3) Some decent eating establishments inside the hotel. The TJ Steakhouse was very good and the prices while high were not exorbitant. Food quality was very good and service was excellent. 4) Staff is friendly. 5) A nice "green" program whereby you receive a $10 food credit for each day you keep your linenes and decline to have your room cleaned. (Not offered on day of arrival or departure.) Cons: 1) Room air conditioning didn't work (I understand this was the case with most of the rooms in the central tower.) I reported this twice by telephone to maintenance and four times in person at the front desk. It was never fixed. In fact, on the last day I was told that there was no recpord of the problem ever having been reported. We were offered to upgrade to a room in another tower with working air conditioning at a cost of $20 ($40 if wqe wanted the "resort" upgrade.) When I protested that upgrading to a room with working air conditioning at no cost was not an unreasonable request, I received an ambivalent response of "sorry". 2) No hot water one night. None. Not even lukewarm. 3) Shabby maintenance throughout. Elevator call buttons missing, worn and dirty carpeting (I counted 14 pieces of dirty, flattened chewing gum on the carpet just between our room and the ice maker), rusted metal on the tub, leaking faucets in the lavatory and tub, dirty windows. 4) Very noisy elevators. For some inexplicable reason, we could hear every up and down trip of the elevators even though our room was located about six rooms away. I pity the poor occupants who were closer to them. 5) Location - many visitors will not like the location which is a couple of blocks off the strip (and they are long blocks.) 6) Security was not very good. We were panhandled in the elevator immediately upon arrival by a very shady looking character who was just hanging around the elevator lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Conference experience”
Reviews.Author: Brian S
Reviews.Content: Stayed several times at the Hilton and now the LVH. Rooms are really nice and very comfortable. Overall it is much less chaotic and easier on the eyes than many of the strip casinos that swamp you with lights, sounds and questionable events. Room with a view of the golf course is perfect. Monorail stop on sight is very nice. Losing the Star Trek themed restaurant was a disapointment and now the Hilton brand name. Hope in the future they can bring in some entertainment that will make it worth the trip. Otherwise its simply a room and a bed.

Reviews.Title: “Really enjoyed my stay”
Reviews.Author: Scott G
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at LVH a few times now and have always enjoyed my stay. I am a big sports fan and I love the fact that they cater to the sports bettors so much. If you love football, you have to go in September when they have the theater open for Sunday NFL. I try to go two to three times a year just for that. I would recommend LVH for anybody looking to get their moneys worth.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms are Huge, Prices are great, Buffet is just OK”
Reviews.Author: A U
Reviews.Content: NOTE: We stayed during a non-convention time so this review could be totally opposite if there were events going on. The LVH sits next to the Las Vegas Convention Center off the strip. We got a non weekend last min rate on hotels dot com for less than $50. The hotel is one of the older ones on the strip so I didn't expect too much. But I was pleasantly surprised!! PROS: NO RESORT FEE Inexpensive Huge Sports Book Room with dozens of large Movie size TV's with leather lounge chairs to park your self till next week if you want. And its next to buffet. Easy parking, checkin, ect Rooms are huge. Twice the size almost from The Palms where we stayed the days before. CONS: Buffet is average (desserts are terrible) except fondue. What is it with Vegas buffets and their crappy desserts? It's not that hard people! Players Card gets you 2for1 so it is pretty cheap. Bathrooms are dated but still large and functional. Faucet heads are sized for under 5 foot height persons. Water pressure is pretty low. Beds are ok, could use some improvement in the softness area. Nice linens and duvet. We didn't use the pool or business center or try any of the other restaurants so I can't comment on those. But for the money this is a great option if you don't want to be on the busy strip.

Reviews.Title: “This place 'is essentially' a Hilton”
Reviews.Author: lurch1
Reviews.Content: LVH change-over has changed nothing from the old hilton. The decor, cleanliness etc is not horrible as many posters challenge. This place is nice and its fine. IT IS A HILTON STANDARD HOTEL and I see the same complaints on just about all other Hilton Hotel reviews I have seen around the US. I have no idea what people are talking about...I don't get it. Oh that note I had as usual a great stay. Just a nice comfortable casino-hotel with some NCAA action for MARCH MADNESS. HOOPS CENTRAL is the thing and can't beat the theatre with 5 screens for play nor the multi-viewing screens and couches in the old Star-Trek bar area for viewing pleasure. Extra books for placing bets, $2 hotdogs and buds, kick-[--]brunch buffet for $20 with crab legs. Suite upgrades and good deals on priceline. Can't go wrong. If you are some hick from the midwest expecting a 6-star hotel with personal attention for $100 a night stay home.....you aren't gonna get that unless you are willing to fork up $500 a night on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “The LVH - Las Vegas - WHAT A GREAT PLACE! ! ! !”
Reviews.Author: Dan R
Reviews.Content: Recently spent a week in Las Vegas, for business and pleasure. Was fortunate enough to book a room at TheLVH (formerly the Las Vegas Hilton). EVERYTHING was fantastic from check in to check out. The front desk service was cheerful and efficient, the restaurants provided a wide range of options at great prices and EXCELLENT taste (I personally enjoyed Casa Nicola's Picatta Di Vitello and the Tiramisu). Rooms were spacious, well appointed and very clean. The pillowtop mattresses provide for a very comfortable night's sleep. Large windows afforded a wonderful view of the Strip, especially at night with the glow of lights. The gaming area was large, well laid out and the staff was courteous and helpful. The table minimums were best in town, yet there were pleanty of options for playing higher stakes if so desired. The Sportsbook Room was a dream come true for true sports fanatics, especially with March Madness games. The multiude of horse and harness races from across the country on VERY large screens was 1st rate. The Sportsbook's comfortable and plentiful leather chairs, friendly wait staff made this area a big hit and I made frequent visits. Shows at The LVH were enjoyable, with spacious seating and reasonable ticket prices. The Rat Pack show certainly was entertaining and harkened back to the early days of Vegas. What also made the LVH a good and affordable location was the Monorail Station right at the hotel. This was a wonderful way to get to and from The Strip within a few minutes and a few dollars. Saving the best for last is the level of customer service. I did not feel as if I was lost in the shuffle, but was genuinely treated very personably by everyone at the hotel, from the coffee barista at the Fortuna Coffee and Wine Experience to the dealers, Pit Bosses (Monty was a great guy) and front door staff. The management of the hotel have done quite well and The LVH should be proud of Eileen Nepomuceno and her staff. Will I go back to TheLVH? ABSOLUTELY!

Reviews.Title: “Fine But Beware at TJs Steakhouse”
Reviews.Author: luv2travel879
Reviews.Content: Our room was clean, spacious and quiet but the decor in the lobby, room and hallways were a bit of a disappointment compared to some gorgeous hotels on the Strip (although it wasn't as bad as I was expecting based on comments from other people I know who stayed there). No resort fee but there was a charge for WiFi. Staff are friendly. Bathrobes would have been appreciated. Tub was chipped. Restaurants in the hotel are very expensive. Food at TJ's Steakhouse was delicious but we left feeling like we'd been taken advantage of as it hadn't been communicated that the $25+ beef or chicken dish, etc. didn't come with anything like salad (which cost something like $8 extra), or a potato (which cost about $10 extra), etc. so when the waiter asked us if we wanted them, we assumed they were included based on our experience at other similar types of restaurants. Our meals came to about $50 each and we didn't have dessert, coffee or alcohol! Stay on the Strip if you can.

Reviews.Title: “LVH, formerly the Las Vegas Hilton”
Reviews.Author: Al R
Reviews.Content: Las Vegas Hotel and Casino, formerly the Las Vegas Hotel is OK, but some improvement is needed. We went there for the NASCAR race. LVH has a very nice race package including room, tickets to the race, and luxory coach rides to and from the race. The rooms are clean and functional, but they could use some updating. The casino also has some good video poker machines, but in general it is dark and in need of an update. The change machines did not function the entire time I was there, so everyone had to use the casino cashier. All in all, we had a good time, but the hotel needs some updating.

Reviews.Title: “That 70's Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DexterEarth
Reviews.Content: Elvis performed at this hotel in the 70s and I don't think the decor has been updated since. That being said, the hotel is only so-so. The first morning, I had lukewarm water and the shower head was installed in a very low position (people must have been shorter back in the 70s lol). The comforter on the bed was paper-thin. The restaurants were okay, but kind of expensive, even for Vegas. For the same money, I'd stay probably somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Las Vegas Hilton - Yes Please !”
Reviews.Author: MichaelandAnne
Reviews.Content: We've stayed here a few times (5 ?). Once or twice for tours. We also picked it as our choice on non-tour stops. It is not on the strip - but this is not really a problem IMO. Rooms are good - and can be great. Buffet is good. Casino - not my thing - but seems good. We also went to the Barry Manilow show there - excellent. Not too glitzy but fun. Easy cab to anywhere - including the airport. Shopping outlets are also close - as is the mono-rail. We felt safe and sound at all times and enjoyed all our stays there. And - we'd go back.

Reviews.Title: “Its ok but....”
Reviews.Author: D M
Reviews.Content: The LVH is ok, but for the money you can get better a better place in Vegas. On our first night we could not get the upgraded room we reserved and had to settle for a room with twin beds. The heating and cooling system in this room also squealed every time it turned on, so this made for a bad nights sleep. In the morning we called to let them know we did not want the room cleaned since we would be changing rooms when we came back in the afternoon. We left items out that we would not have if we wanted room service and luckily they were still there when we came back since they still came in and cleaned the room. After telling them about the squealing heat/cooling system and that they came in and cleaned when we requested for them not to clean all I could get was a "we are sorry and we will get you into the upgraded room you originally reserved". Oh gee thanks LVH....

Reviews.Title: “Seen better days”
Reviews.Author: writegirl7
Reviews.Content: The LVH - no longer the Hilton, but now The Las Vegas Hotel, has seen it's better days. We stayed for a convention/tradeshow a couple weeks ago and while it's convenient (work wise) it's nothing spectacular for the location. There's nothing horrid about it either - it's just average. There are a few decent restaurants and shops, it's farily clean, there's a good business center and overall not a bad place to stay. There are more vibrant, lively places closer to the strip and nightlife, but if you're looking for something more quiet and perhaps a better budget value, the LVH isn't a bad option.

Reviews.Title: “Needs lots of work, but decent convention center hotel.”
Reviews.Author: FJSjr2
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the LVH while attending a trade show at the hotel. A lot of people seem to give the LVH a bad review based on it's location. It is not on the strip - you will need to take a cab or the monorail to get to the strip casino's. If you didn't know that when you booked it, you didn't do your homework. First, the good. I had a basic room on a package deal. It was clean and comfortable. Electrical outlets were plentiful in the room. Elevators were quick. TJ's Steakhouse was awesome. Parking was convenient. The breakfast buffet was okay, but definitely not great. As to the bad. I had my air conditioning on the coldest setting, and my room remained very hot the entire time I was there (seems to be a common complaint). My king size bed came with only two pillows. While the TV was nice, the remote control was a piece of junk. The bath towels were like heavy sandpaper. My room had a door for adjoining rooms, and there was about a 1"gap on the bottom - not good for preventing noise from the next room or for that matter a nosy neighbor peeking under the door. If you like new, modern slot machines (like I do) the LVH is not for you. The machines are old and outdated. I like Pepsi, not Coke. The LVH sells only Coke products in the entire hotel. The staff was okay, but there is a general air of uncertainty about the future of this LVH and that is reflected in their attitude. The front desk seemed a little understaffed and lines were at times long.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Vegas Stay Ever”
Reviews.Author: Rick K
Reviews.Content: Started a 3 day stay with a room that had a non working air conditioner, transfered to another room on the second night that had out of control guests next door, spent 30 min on the phone to front desk and security to get problem under control, finally got dressed to go look for security, and he was out in hallway just leaning against the wall.......went to front desk to file complaint in person at midnight- only to be met with a smart mouthed gal behind the desk. There are plenty of other places to stay in Vegas, and I'm sure they would at least control their guests better than this place. Stay anywhere in Vegas but this place. I make about 2 trips a year to Vegas and Reno, this was by far the worst possible trip with rooms to date in 10 years of travel to this city.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice - if you get the right rate”
Reviews.Author: omareliwi
Reviews.Content: We got this place on an unbelievable deal via lastminute.com , booked in the UK. We paid £37 for 3 nights in late January,2012! Based on that, we were delighted with this hotel. Some of the public areas are a bit souless and the place is clearly in a transition period ( with the Hilton name being dropped etc), but the lobby and casino areas are well kept and a good place to gamble. The room we stayed in was very modern and large with an impressive marble bathroom and a view of the strip. Exactly what we wanted out of our Vegas accommodation! This hotel is off strip but well connected via the monorail and has a lot of free parking. We never used the monorail as I thought it was expensive for what it was - if you have the use of a car during your Vegas stay and don't drink, my advise would be to just use the free 'self park' parking that all the big hotels have. We didn't eat at the hotel as there are too many other choices in Vegas, but I understand their Japanese Teppanaki place- Benihana- is pretty good ( especially with a 20-30% discount that you can get from one of the discount voucher places near Fashion Show Mall). The only disappointment we found with this hotel was the price of the Wifi connection - $14 per hour?!! Wow. I know you aren't in Vegas to go on the internet but for the occasionally convenience, like booking your onward travel, 1hr or so of free internet for guests would be ideal. I would definitely stay at this hotel again, for the right price, but wouldn't pay over about 60 bucks a night whilst it is in its transition period but it definitely is a cut above the likes of Circus Circus and other budget hotels on the Strip.

Reviews.Title: “Run down convention hotel”
Reviews.Author: Yellotail
Reviews.Content: We just got home from 5 days at the LVH, Now.....just simply the Las Vegas Hotel, rather than the Hilton. We stayed here because we were attending a convention next door. It's run down, tired, and the rooms are just used to death. In the casino they feature older chubby cocktail waitresses (which is a sad phenomenon in my opinion) being made to stuff themselves into these black sparkly corset outfits. sad. In our room the curtains were falling down, the noise outside was UNBEARABLE..... Cleaning a stain on the carpet at 7:30 AM, housekeeping using walkee-talkee's on full volume in Spanish at 8 AM. One day the housekeeping never even showed up. Just annoying! The workout facilities were average, but cost $20/day. Which is a bit steep, unLESS you're a HHonors member (which they still honored...as a courtesy for some reason). The Mexican restaurant (Tres Rios) was busy at cocktail hour, but the food was only appetizers, and ALL fried and very poor service. I would NEVER stay at this hotel again. Even if we were part of a convention (like this trip), I would stay somewhere else. There are TONS of options available in Las Vegas at a much better price.

Reviews.Title: “Never again!”
Reviews.Author: David C
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a conference at LVH, and can't come up with anything redeeming. There was a pool I never got to use as it is only open from 9-5. Using the workout room was $20/day, so I didn't get any workouts in. No free wi-fi. That cost over $12/day.They provided a safe in-room for $3/day which is bizarre as safes are primarily to keep hotel employees honest and owners less liable. There was not a single recycling can anywhere in the place. I was shocked that there was nothing,so I either had to throw away things or carry them to a bin in a different establishment. Had one morning of no hot water. Met the biggest cockroach in the first floor men's room that I have ever seen. We took the 'green option' of declining maid service & restocking. Some days they cleaned when they were not supposed to. They did not give us the $10 coupon promised on days they didn't. When I called to talk about the issue, the employee I spoke to said I would need to talk to her supervisors. I assumed she would give me their number or name, or patch me through. Noone got back in touch. I would rather stay in a rundown econo-lodge or like where everything is included in the price of the room, and there is free breakfast to boot.

Reviews.Title: “Glow of former Hilton starting to wear off”
Reviews.Author: MazzyMae
Reviews.Content: A convention brought me to LVH (formerly Las Vegas Hilton) in March 2012. I'd never been to Las Vegas, so I was pretty impressed by the long driveway, the glitzy chandeliers and the expansive lobby floor. The staff was polite, which helped make up for my long, long hike to the outer reaches of the north tower to get to my room. At least there were shops to peek at along the way. The room was fairly high end, which justified the price, and I had a good view of some of the nearby casino/hotel signs. (It's off the strip, next to the convention center.) The problem was this: A few things were off with the room. Some PR material had been knocked onto the floor and not picked up; there was an empty grocery bag left behind in a bathroom drawer and there was a USED washcloth drying on the shower rod. Yuck. What else had the maids not cleaned that I wouldn't know about? That said, there was a variety of stores, bars, restaurants and gambling options in the hotel. Since it's not on the strip, you can't walk around much. You could, theoretically, strap on sneakers and cut across the Riviera property to get to the strip. But you probably picked LVH to be by the convention center. You'll walk about 3/4 of a mile to get to the furthest conventions (and it's not a scenic walk). But you won't have to cab it. I like conservation as much as the next guy, but it seemed strange that the hotel is using all of the old Hilton materials. The Hilton H was still on the hotel, and virtually everything in the rooms -- from the keys to the menus -- still said Hilton. I guess it's good to not throw those things away, but I did wonder about other ways they were cutting corners to save money. Because I like conservation, I opt to skip maid service when I can. I don't mind not having new towels or a freshly made bed each night since it saves water. It also saves the hotel money, and LVH will reward you with a $10 coupon for any "food or beverage outlet" in the hotel when you "go green" this way. Nice!

Reviews.Title: “Would never stay here again”
Reviews.Author: Foxmitchella
Reviews.Content: This is not a hotel I would ever stay at again. My husband and I stayed in a premium room there was no coffee maker in the room and Internet was 14 dollars for 24 hours, we had to ask for extra toilet paper and towels and water was $4 a bottle. Our room was not even touched by house keeping until the day be for we left we were there 4 days. When we went down to the casino it took forever to get a drink. This hotel did not have a medic on call incase of some one hurting themselves and the closest hospital is at least a 6 hour wait on a week night. This hotel to my husband and I is a far cry from the awesome place that Las Vega is I think Elvis would be furious

Reviews.Title: “Off strip great choice”
Reviews.Author: wen_c82
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for an off strip hotel, this is a great choice. We have been staying at this hotel (formerly Hilton) 2-3 times a year for the last 5 + years, it is our first choice whenever we go to Las Vegas. We like to be able by pass all the traffic on Las Vegas Blvd while being close to both downtown and strip. Another reason is that you don't have to go through the casino to get to your room like many other hotels. This is especially nice if you have kids. Check in was easy and fast. The room is your standard hotel size - if you stayed in premium room they have the new pillow top bed that is very comfortable. And the bathroom is a little nicer. As like many Vegas hotel, their rooms are in different stage of 'renovation'. We've stayed at standard room and it's also fine. One thing I did notice that perhaps due to age of the hotel, the air conditioner in some rooms can be louder than some other. If it bothers you just ask to change. LVH casino is smaller than most and tend to be a bit quite, which is just fine with us. Buffet is pretty standard fare, nothing to write home about. It's convenient if you don't want to go out.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel just off the strip!”
Reviews.Author: rykelmom
Reviews.Content: In the past I have overlooked the LVH because it is not on the strip but never again. I have stayed at a few strip hotels and none have been as nice as the LVH. Even though it is slightly off the strip the LVH has a monorail stop right outside the hotel which makes getting to the strip very easy. The hotel lobby are nice with very little smoke and the staff is helpful and kind. Our room was clean and the bed and pillows were comfortable. We will most certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel, but they could certainly work on a many things.”
Reviews.Author: David C
Reviews.Content: Alright I was pumped when my boss told me I was being flown out to Las Vegas for the Annual IWCE trade show. When we arrived I was sort of let down. Showing up in a limo and no one to help us with our bag's no biggie, must of been a really busy Tuesday night around 9:30. When we arrived we checked in. My room was supposed to be 600 square feet and non smoking. When I got to my room it was only around 400 square feet ( i'm an engineer I measured) there were also 2 ashtrays and my room reeked of smoking....Obviously a non smoking room. Complained and they told my boss they would bring the new room key to his suite as we went out to eat. When we came back I got my new room and it was 100x better (non smoking and about 600 square feet). A bump to floor 26 from floor 4. Gross alert but I have to say this as this may turn some people off to the hotel. That made me happy but when we were in the elevator going down to the lobby a middle aged obvious lady of the night was getting dressed (next to the elevator) and she spit bodily fluid (obviously from a man) into the black sand ash tray near the elevator door then proceeded to spill her money all over the place.....made the elevator ride very awkward....but the place is vegas....just would be nice to keep some of the riff raff out. So now I have the fun stuff out of the way heres the pro's and con's. Pro's Most bartenders make killer drinks, though some had no knowledge of simple drinks. How ever I thought that if you were gambling drinks were free, some drink girls would charge x amount for a drink some would not. Not sure what that is all about. I slept well every night. The room service made the room very well. Good Staff Good dry cleaning prices Monorail Station Good distance to Convention Center. Very professional and cool dealers. Actually taught me how to better my odds at roulette! Thanks to them I left vegas with more money than I Flew in with!!!! Who ever reads this give Tommy the Doorman a raise or bonus! he is the man and suggest several great local eateries to me! I left somewhat satisfied. Con's Lots and lots and lots of little kids running around the property ( I remember being a teen in Vegas and If I walked in the Casino Security would ask me where my parents were and what not.....not this place though I did not see any kids gambling) Seems a little bit dated on the inside. Breakfast buffet was miserable and over priced. Restaurants had weird hours. They were never opened when we were around. They would always say....go to the pizza hut. I can get pizza hut anyplace I don't want to eat that crap. My boss's suite had lots of mold in both of his bathrooms. My boss's hotel floor reeked of Vomit and Jack Daniels for 3 days. Very Uncomfortable toliet paper. Actually went out and bought my own it was that bad. I am 5 foot 11 and the shower head in my room came up to my chest. I have a really bad back and it pained me to bend over in the shower to wash from chest up......I'm not a dwarf LVH...... Pool closed way to early. I understand about an early swim if your there for pleasure but I was there to work.....coming back from the show nightly to see that the pool was closed was depressing. The thing that got me was they kept telling everyone its not the Hilton anymore ( I understand that) but everything still says Hilton. In the rooms the poker chips ect ect. Room service, some of the food items were insanely over priced ( Ritz Carlton would be comparative) but then again some things were very cheap, regardless everything I ate was tasty. Finally the huge sign out front. Does not light up any more :( I remember being a kid and seeing it light up and I would of loved to have seen it do that again. Not sure if its down for good, none of the staff I asked could answer that for me. All this being said with some work and money this place could be as good as a on strip hotel. Though it is a bit dated on the inside it is still not a terrible place. Next time I do a show I might even consider staying at this hotel again since it is just that close to the convention center and regardless of it's off strip location being able to take the monorail down town is easy, though the monorail 3 day pass's and taxi fare get expensive. Also I am not going to lie. When you go to the Wynn, Bellagio, Palazzo, MGM, ect ect for dinner and what not and you go back to the LVH its almost a sense of depression that you get. Especially when some nicer rooms in other hotels on the strip could be had for cheaper. Regardless though proximity to the convention Center is a win if you are a businessman like me.

Reviews.Title: “The most terrible experience ever. Dirty, old, stinky room, horrible service. Ugly strip view.”
Reviews.Author: Helen F
Reviews.Content: We got the room in old part of the hotel. Last remodeling and cleaning of the room was probably the same time with hotel gand opening. Toilet seat was brown like after the fire, the chair was so old, we can see through the upholstery. Also this chair was wet ! The side table has marks from bottles, or caps. Walls has black palm prints, as well as doors. Design of this room was very popular in 60th. Non smoking room smells like an ashtray. We left our car on the vallet parking and spent 45 minuts in the lobby, waiting for the car. We never got it in that day. Never again!!! Ever!!!

Reviews.Title: “Seen better days”
Reviews.Author: HAF61
Reviews.Content: I have to agree with the other comments re Hilton, Same hotel just poor and dated rooms. The ground floor is ok and reasonably well presented but the rest is past it's sell by date. If you are going to Vegas this hotel is off the beaten track and takes a good 10 minutes by monorail to get to the strip. If its the convention centre then fine as a business user just about. I'll be honest if I was paying my own account I would have checked out and found somewhere a lot better.

Reviews.Title: “Don't make the same mistake....”
Reviews.Author: MM5757
Reviews.Content: I just stayed here the last week of Feb. 2012..... was working a tradeshow next door at the convention center and was assigned this hotel by the tradeshow. This place has dirty carpets, stained walls, spotted towels and is just bad. The tradeshow rate was over $150 per night and only $80 for anyone else. Total ripoff to the convention attendees.... We could have stayed at the Wynn or Encore for the same rate and felt clean when we left Las Vegas

Reviews.Title: “Good price for the room but too far from the strip”
Reviews.Author: salamiboi
Reviews.Content: The price for the room is reasonable, but it's too far from the strip. We ended up having to spend too much on Monorail and taxi fares.

Reviews.Title: “Time has passed this place by”
Reviews.Author: NittanyL
Reviews.Content: This is not the place to stay in Vegas, unless you want to be in walking distance to the Las Vegas Convention Center as that is the only thing worthwhile that is remotely close to this hotel. Although it has a nice appearance from the outside, the inside is a huge disappointment. It is dated and totally does not have any of the energy of a Vegas property. In a word, this place is DULL. In all fairness, my room was decent and clean, but the rest of the place (the casino, corridors, stores, restaurants etc) simply needs a total overhall. Do yourself a favor and stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Read too many reviews”
Reviews.Author: Jacqui B
Reviews.Content: My husband booked the LVH on a website that didn't allow him to see the hotel until it was paid for (yeah, you know the website I'm talking about). When we found out it was the LVH, I came here to read reviews. I was terrified to stay there! There were so many bad reviews. I did my best to go in with an open mind since we didn't have a choice at that point (unless we wanted to lose all of that money). When we arrived, I was impresssed. The lobby was beautiful. Upon check in, I expected to be told that we needed to upgrade, but that wasn't the case at all. The front desk staff was friendly and helpful. We headed up to our room and I was impressed further. The decor was up to date, the view of the golf course was nice (I don't care much to see the strip, I've been to Vegas many many times, it isn't anything special). The room was clean, smelled like bleach. Linens were clean (I'm the crazy lady that inspects them as I open the door to the room)! If I want to nit pick, I can say that the tile in the bathroom needs updating. However, the things that can easily be updated (walls, curtains, etc) were, and the overall feel was nice, even if the tile was a little outdated. It was still clean and presented fine, which is what matters to me. We headed down to the pool area. It was great. We have a toddler, and the pool has a nice, big shallow area (knee deep) that was perfect for him to play in. The spa was well maintained. The pool area had more of a "resort" feel than just a hotel. I was glad that there was a lifeguard on duty as well. There was an abundance of clean towels. It was a freak weekend of gorgeous weather, so there were a lot of people buy the pool, but it never felt crowded. The staff was friendly, greeted us upon entering and leaving. Overall, I was very happy with our stay at LVH. I would stay there again, in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Don't even think about staying here”
Reviews.Author: FreqFlyer S
Reviews.Content: I used to live down the street years ago and was curious as to why the Hilton name was stripped off the moniker. After checking into my room and dealing with some of the staff, it became clear. The rooms are old, dirty, outdated - bordering on truck stop quality. The staff is incredibly rude and act like they wish you had stayed somewhere else - which we should have. I was here for a business conference and was using the company card, but if all the upcharges ($13.99/day for Internet access and $20 to use a treadmill from 1980) were to come out of my pocket, I would have stayed somewhere else. Biggest complaints: water in the rub has been dripping for 5 days now, broken door to the bathroom, scratchy towels and toilet paper, marks on the wall, dirty windows, paper thin walls. I've been able to hear both my neighbors cough, talk, shower as if they were in my room. I'm telling you, this place will be imploded within a few years.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible!”
Reviews.Author: Angela15227
Reviews.Content: Upon checking in, I was told that when I made the reservation that my card was declined and that I didn't have a room. I showed the woman my several confirmation e-mails and confirmation number. She rolled her eyes and told me that I was lucky since the hotel was completely booked. She also told me that an e-mail was sent to me stating that the card was declined. I asked for the date/time of that e-mail; she told me that she could not give me that information. In addition to this, the room was disgusting. The drawers on the dresser did not close, there was water damage on the walls/ceiling and the counter tops were cracked (see pictures below). Also the room was supposed to be non-smoking but it had a musty part moldy part stale cigar smell.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel ok, but service...”
Reviews.Author: Oliver B
Reviews.Content: The Hotel itself was ok, but the level of service was below the standard of the average Highway Motel (maybe this is typicl for Las Vegas, but I did not like it): * There was no free Internet, they charged ~13$/day (which is insane) * room safe costs 3$/day (and you have to read the flipside of a small sign to recognize that) * small bottle of water: 4$ * room was not cleaned propberly (I had taco chips on my feet after walking cross the room the first day...) * no coffee machine in the room on the plus side, the room itself was nice (even though one drawer did not close properly) and relatively quiet. The staff was very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Stay someplace else”
Reviews.Author: KVanderstouw
Reviews.Content: While size of room was a suite, the bed itself was a fold down from the wall. Very hard and uncomfortable. No easy end tables with lamps, TV at awkward angle for viewing. Bathroom very old and tub side high and wide, difficult to get in and out if. Internet access costs additional $14 per day per computer. Business center charges for use too, cost $10 just to print flight boarding passes. Better places and values directly on the strip!!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: croozn33
Reviews.Content: On check in, I was offered a room in the renovated tower. The room was large and comfortable, no problem there. However, the tub had not been cleaned since the last guest(s?) and had layer of scum and hair in it. A disgusting start to the stay. This place has certainly faded since its heyday, but it is convenient to the convention center and a bargain compared to other large hotels in the area. On check out, I had another surprise. I had logged into the hotel WiFi service from three devices, a laptop, a smartphone and an iPad. The fee of 13.99 per day is clearly to be charged per room, not per device, but they tried to charge me three times the daily rate for each day. I told the check out clerk that this was an error and he insisted that I pay the triple charge. Refusing, I asked him to get the manager. He went to the manager, who did not at this point even come out to discuss the matter, and came back with the "answer" that they would only charge me DOUBLE per day. I said this was not what was described on the login page and he insisted again that the charge was per device. I asked him if he had read the agreement...and he said no, he had not. Now I insisted that the manager come out and I showed them both their own agreement. After all of this, they finally agreed to adjust my bill to reflect the correct 13.99/day charge per room. Overall, the service at this hotel is good, if not great. Probably not a bad choice if you are on a tight budget and cannot get a better deal elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Do not spent ur time at that hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jodonn
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel online. Found a good deal, that's the only plus about it.... The room was very cold so I mover to another and had the same problem. Wanted to get Cleaned up for the Vegas night life and there no hot water. I'm truly unhappy. Makes my hole trip suck. Don't did it go some where else. You'll feel better about your stay.

Reviews.Title: “Huge room, wonderful staff!”
Reviews.Author: theroaminpages
Reviews.Content: Very nice room for the price! Just a few picky things like having hand towels not near the sink and slightly smoky smelling pillow. Overall a very nice experience for this very picky traveler!

Reviews.Title: “Pretty to look at, but nothing really there....”
Reviews.Author: DenverBobH
Reviews.Content: The room was nice enough, but I could hear the couple in the next room like they were staying with me in mine. Not a problem at mid-day, but when you get in around midnight and want to go to sleep to be ready for a 7am meeting, it's kind of annoying. It's kind of a pin-up hotel, looks good on the surface, but not a lot of depth when it comes to details. Something supposedly this upscale with a 4 star rating shouldn't have paper thin walls! Internet in the room is not high speed, nor is it free, which in this day and age leaves the back side a little sore and violated. If you're going to charge $13 a day for internet, shouldn't it be at least fast? It took 30 minutes to send and receive a dozen emails...30 minutes! When I asked at the front desk, they said that the connection is provided by Cox and can be slow when the hotel is full, no offer of a discount or anything, just here's your bill. OK, waiting on emails so I try the TV...remote doesn't work. Turn it on manually, and then you can change channels, but that's it. No volume, no sleep timer...want to turn it off, ya better have reallllllly long arms if you don't want to get out of bed! Also, if you're an early riser, don't count on any breakfast options outside of the coffee shop before 7am. The coffee shop is OK, but for a Chai Tea and a bear claw, it was $11 - yes it's a captive audience and all, but really??

Reviews.Title: “everything's great at the Las Vegas hotel”
Reviews.Author: Berryessabill
Reviews.Content: As you may or May not Know, The Las Vegas Hilton is no More. Who Cares Everything Changes". The LAS VEGAS HOTEL is just as damm good right out of the Gate. Great FOOD,GREAT GAMING, GREAT DRINKS, and best off all. Off the Main Strip! They work hard to PLEASE YOU THERE, and when you want to get to the Action. All you do is walk out the door, and Hop on the Tram. It takes you to all the Hot Spots. If you like to Bet at the Sports Book, I have never seen a better one, to Relax in, Try the L.V.H out the rates are very GOOD, The Beds are Really GOOD, and The SERVICE IS PLEASING. And if you Like Luxury~~ Hell This was the Home of the KING!! Sign up for the Reward Card, and Watch the Offers start Building Up. My last 6 Vists, It is the only Place I was going. This place can save you big $$$$$ Get the Card, STAY, PLAY, Reap the Rewards.When it's Cold~~ "VEGAS BABY~~~~

Reviews.Title: “Needs improvement”
Reviews.Author: sokrmom88
Reviews.Content: Arrived from the airport with 18 girls from a soccer team at 11:30 at night. There was apparently some large concert going on at the convention center and the parking was completely full. We had to drive around and around waiting to find a place. All we got was the run around. The parking attendants said valet parking was full and the parking lot "bouncer" said the entire lot was full. Nobody offered any suggestions. When we checked in I got the rooms for the girls and was told I was given an upgrade for my room. I was excited until I overheard the guests on each side of me be told the same. When I got to my room I realized it was worse than the room I had reserved. I had paid for an upgraded room to get either a golf course view or a strip view. Instead I was looking at the top of an ugly roof. Other parents in our party were also given rooms that reeked of pot and were right on the elevator shaft. Also, with a property this huge they should have somewhere to get some late-night food other than the sports book. The line was so long and took forever.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel for a Hilton, Could Use some Updates”
Reviews.Author: char540
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in Nov. of 2011 and the room was clean and fine for our three day stay, but the door had some paint chips and the inside was a bit dated. We hadnt been to Vegas in a couple years so I got if for $40 a night so it was definitely worth that. The service was fine and the buffet was better than I expected.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: Tricali
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 days at this hotel in the North Tower. This hotel has recently changed its name from LV Hilton to LV Hotel Casino. They recently renovated the interiors but I had to complain about the bed. It's SMALL. We asked for 2 beds and it was 2 full. It wasn't even a queen size. But the nice thing is that they have a small fridge. When you have kids traveling with you, it comes in handy as we used it to store milk and juice. Front desk was fast but they forgot to give me all the coupons/free buffet in my package when I booked so I had to make another trip downstairs to line up and ask for those coupons. If you drive in then forget about valet parking. It was full the entire time we stayed there so we had to use the North parking structure. The buffet was small and didn't have a lot of selections. Just skip it and head to Bellagio/Wynn/The M Casino about 15 minutes off strip for some good food. If you plan to go to the M Casino for buffet then be prepared to stand in line for about 2 hours. Overall I will stay here again if they comp for the room.

Reviews.Title: “We were completely disgusted with this hotel property Rude and very Dirty.”
Reviews.Author: uclanm1
Reviews.Content: From Checking in to Check out nothing but issues. Premium Room upgrade. All 3 Keyes Didn't work and when I called from house phone she stated " Lady were very busy" Dirty, Hair in sink, shower curtain and slime. Front desk Rude and food terrible. Property stated they Honor Hilton Diamond members until March. Wrong they talk to you down right rude.

Reviews.Title: “magic market...”
Reviews.Author: mspkn
Reviews.Content: i love staying at this hotel,,new name but same tlc! the staff are always very helpful and i never have any problems .

Reviews.Title: “Not a bad Option”
Reviews.Author: Jason C
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed there in January. We booked a room with a king bed. When we got there they told us we had double beds. We told them that we booked way ahead and didn't want double beds. They said that they had a room next to the elevators. We thought no big deal, we will have some drinks and sleep right through it. Wrong!!!!!! If they offer a room next to the elevators don't do it. They are so loud and run all night long. I am usually a hard sleeper and don't have a problem sleeping through noise, but i was up all night. We complained the next morning that they need to turn that room into a broom closet. We didn't want to pay full price for such a bad room. They said that they would upgrade our room for the next two nights. So we changed rooms and the only upgrades were the bed and decorations. No elevator noise so we did sleep much better. If you get a normal room the stay was pretty good. The monorail comes right to the hotel which is nice.

Reviews.Title: “Sales Kickoff Meeting”
Reviews.Author: Ron M
Reviews.Content: The hotel is tired, the staff is tired, the food mediocre at best and the service was slow and unresponsive. The rooms were in various states of disrepair. I am responsible for sales and marketing for a global telecommunications company and we made the mistake of booking this hotel last year when it was still the Las Vegas Hilton and not knowing it would be sold. We had roughly 180 folks at the hotel for 5 days and used almost every facility that was available. The pool and spa which are part of the fitness package were both closed but the price was still $20/day to use what they called a gym. It was small and much of the equipment was not in service including one of the larger TVs. it was cramped and more like what I would expect at a Motel 6. The banquet service was poor as was the food. I will never go back but then I suspect they plan to tear this place down anyway.

Reviews.Title: “LVH suites are much better than the rooms for businesswomen, families, or guests who do not want to stay on the strip”
Reviews.Author: safaridoc
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the LVH hotel, because we had an upgrade available to a huge Napa Suite on the 28th floor. The suite was designed so that you could lock out the bedroom from the entertainment area, and had two separate doors to each part of the suite. The door connecting the entertainment area to the bedroom could be locked closed or it could be opened. This could be ideal for business travelers, particularly women, who want to keep entertainment guests from getting an idea that the bedroom is nearby and available. The setup also works for spouses who are here to play or rest while the other works in the entertaining area or families who want to sleep separately from their children (who are sleeping on rollaway bed in the living room). The suite was very spacious, approximately 800 square feet. The huge entertainment area was divided into a living room and a dining room. The lighting was recessed and bright with two additional standing lamps. The celings had crown moldings and a marble finish floor that gave the entire room an elegant and high end feel. The entertainment area was configured around both a large cocktail table and an armoire with a large flat screen tv. Great for watching sports events with colleagues. There was a central seating area for entertaining up to 8 guests and a cocktail table and plush cushioned chairs. The floor was marble. There was an elegant wood dining room table with seating for eight in the dining area of the suite. The drapes were floor to ceiling and controlled by four automatic buttons which worked perfectly. There was a bathroom with a shower in the entertaining area. You could not ask for more in a business entertainment space. On the other side of the entertainment space by a separate entrance (although connectable with the opening of two doors) is the bedroom space. There was a desk with ethernet modem, a huge, plush king bed with high thread count linens. The bed was terrific, and it made sleeping a pleasure. The mattress was plush but supportive. The bedcovers were of a high end luxury quality. There was a tv in a wall unit and a large bathroom, with marble heart shaped Roman bathtub with jacuzzi jets that would be great for a couples bath. Room service was prompt and professional, and when we had a problem with the handle to the Roman tub coming off, engineering was prompt, professional, courteous and fixed the problem. We were entitled to VIP checkin at the lounge, and there was no waiting because of that. The other services of the lounge were not impressive. There was morning coffee and cookies, but only prepackaged creamers, not milk. There were mixed nuts from a bowl and not much else. As a VIP lounge, it was pathetic. There were small bottles of bottled water in the refrigerator. We still had our expensive morning lattes from Fortuna's which serves Starbucks coffees in the lobby near the elevator. The monorail to the strip is clean and convenient, but at $5.00 each way per person, you are better off if you are more that two taking a taxi which are available all over Las Vegas in front of hotels. There is a green rebate if you forgo housekeeping, but that made no sense economically if you are in a large suite (for the environment is another matter). We ate our meals on the strip in the Mesa Grill (excellent at Caesar's) and the Carnegie deli at the Mirage (I recommend the corned beef and pastrami combo named after Woody Allen--avoid the turkey which was dry and unexceptional) The gym and spa had a number of ellipticals and treadmills as well as some weight machines and a bench with dumbbells. There were also a steam room and sauna, clean locker room with showers and spa services. There were oranges, apples, bananas, coffee, tea water and plenty of clean fresh high quality towels available. The spa would have been great except for the $20 per person charge per day! Until the end of April, they are waiving the gym fee for Hilton honors members. I don't know about after that. That struck me as a high usage fee. Lastly, for families with children, or people who are disgusted by the being offered cards with photos of nude young women available for flesh services, the LVH casino, being away from the strip is a bit of a refuge from all that, and other than the casino, a quiet space. In summary, the LVH is not the glitter and party atmosphere of the hotels on the strip, but for the customer who is more in Las Vegas for business or has a family in tow, with the room upgrade, LVH can be a great fit.

Reviews.Title: “Off the Strip = Peace and Quiet When You Want It”
Reviews.Author: PFD-Canada
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here every time we go to Vegas on our own. The gambling is the same :), the food is great, the service is wonderful and the ambiance is subdued. There is hardly ever "strip" people here as it's just a little out of the way for them and the hotel itself doesn't boast the flamboyance that several of the strip hotels do. The rooms are spacious and clean, easy to get to via multiple elevators and did I mention that the gambling is the same. :) When you choose to go to the strip for shopping or sightseeing, it's just a quick (inexpensive) monorail ride away. The monorail stops right at the Hilton, so there's no walking or standing in the heat for any period of time. The monorail is secure, fast and fun. The Hilton is the closest we have found to adult accommodations in Vegas and has all the necessary requirements of the Strip resorts. So if you like quiet times, great pool, clean rooms, great service, great food, huge buffet, huge casino and NO KIDS, this is definitely the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Worried about some reviews, but upgraded room was great!”
Reviews.Author: bridude98
Reviews.Content: I had read the negative reviews extensively, and even spoke about them with the female LVH reservation agent. I speculated she was talking about the regular rooms when she strongly recommended the $10 per night upgrade to a "Premium" room. I did the upgrade. So when I arrived, I was pleasantly surprised at the room! Very spacious, newer carpeting and bedding, newer tile in the bathroom, and well appointed. My view was of the nearby Las Vegas Country Club golf course. I'm guessing I would not have liked the regular room, and further guessing that the negative TripAdvisor reviews and some pictures are of the regular rooms. The hotel has gone green, and they offer you a $10 resort voucher every night you decline housekeeping service. All you have to do is press the green button on the room phone before 1A, and they'll leave the voucher under your door the next day. Since I traveled alone this trip, I had plenty of towels to use for my 4 nights, and I only messed up one bed. So I was willing to get $10 a night (not valid your first or last day) to take 3 minutes to make my own bed and straighten my room each morning before I went out for the day. They actually left me more towels one morning anyway. Not sure if this was a mistake or if you can "go Green" and still order more towels. Also, the hotel is away from the Strip, so at the end of each day, it was nice to go to a nice quiet, clean property. If you're a party animal from L.A. looking for the newest UltraLounge, the LVH is not for you!

Reviews.Title: “Off Strip Hotel”
Reviews.Author: dugdug
Reviews.Content: The LVH was an average older hotel. Was it a 4 star hotel? No, more of a low 3 star hotel. Location is off of the strip however having the monorail station stop at the hotel was a plus. The rooms are in need of some TLC however nothing was too bad when considering the rate that we paid for the room. If this hotel does not recieve the make-over it needs I can see it eventually being demolished in order to compete with the new Las Vegas ultra-modern resorts.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value - Best Sportsbook”
Reviews.Author: 88CitySlicker88
Reviews.Content: The Las Vegas Hilton has undergone some renovation and a name change. It's now the LVH and the rooms are a bit nicer than before. It's no Wynn or Bellagio but for a value hotel in Vegas it works quite well. The number 1 asset of this property is the huge Sportsbook and all the unique wagers they accept. If you are going to Vegas to gamble on Sports - you've found the spot. For Poker, Blackjack & Craps - there are much better venues.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing wrong with the LVH”
Reviews.Author: PB69
Reviews.Content: I was very hesitant to stay at the LVH with reading the reviews. We had a chiropractic conference at the conference centre and decided to stay at the LVH since it's adjoining. We didn't really have any issues except a few minor glitches. First off, the hotel is older and off the strip, but that's mostly it. The monorail station is right in front and you can get a three day pass for $28 which is well worth it and takes no time to get to the bottom of the strip. It's not as glamorous as some of the hotels, but who cares, it's nice overall. I was concerned about the rooms. We requested an upgrade at booking and they told us they can put the request on the file but it will depend on availability, but to come between 12 and 3 and shouldn't be any issue getting into the renovated rooms. Well, not quite. Long story short they upgraded my room and my staff stayed in two 'regular' rooms, 624 and 627. Otherwise they wanted $20 per room per night to upgrade. Elected not to do so, wasn't told about the fee on the phone. In any case, I checked the regular rooms after checking in and there was nothing wrong with them, they were all nice. Our renovated room did not look much different, maybe a bit better bathroom, but that was it. Staff was friendly, limited eating on site, but again, if you have a monorail pass, you're fine. Once again, this hotel was perfectly fine, the service was great, we had a good time!

Reviews.Title: “Off strip dinosaur, but has a lot of great comforts.”
Reviews.Author: Mikebrez
Reviews.Content: The hotel is huge be prepared for a lot of walking, an older gentleman with me had to stop during walks to his room to rest at times. the casino itself is lacking in gaming area but its also not as packed as on the strip so it equals out. the limits on the weekend are that of downtown so if our looking for a spot on a table on a saturday night thats not a 50 dollar bet and up its a good place to be. the pool is not over the top or anything but cabanas are easy to attain and affordable, tvs, and refrigerators. diamond members get them half off. they have a diamond lounge area to check in at that is very nice and helpful. i had been bringing in 7 rooms with me and they upgraded me into a suite fit for a king very nice. I have been back since then i am a diamond member and not treated like that though. gamble decent and be a diamond member you will get anything you want i feel. The staff inside the casino are union so that equates to old lady's during the day not caring about helping you at all, i always had to flag them down. Between the union and tip share they were not that helpful. the rooms are very nice and comfortable/updated. its and easy trip to the strip and lets face it even if you are staying on the strip if your lady is wearing heels your cabbing anyway. a pretty nice place to stay and the keep reinventing themselves.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Super Bowl Weekend at the LVH”
Reviews.Author: Videocka
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Napa suite for four nights. The room was large, clean, had good lighting and an outstanding view. We had the lock off so it was great for a couple guys sharing the room. The living room and wet bar were a nice added touch. We utilized the Resorts level floor for quick snacks and drinks throughout the day. The gym, although a little small did the job. The spa area was very nice and I got an excellent massage. The LVH people know how to throw a great party. The pre-game party was excellent as well as the big game party. We found all the food, including the buffet to be outstanding. The dealers at the casino were extremely friendly and helpful (even though I did not win).

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel on a budget price”
Reviews.Author: Brendon P
Reviews.Content: We stayed here over NYE. This used to formerly be the Las Vegas Hilton and changed name while we were there but was no where near the standard of a Hilton Hotel you would expect. The room was slightly out dated with visible repairs that you could see needed doing. Our bathroom door base was slightly rotting and there was a crack in our sink. Having said that therooms were nice and staff were nice and friendly and very helpfull when it came to asking for directions/advice and booking trips. The bars and restaurants were very nice. The hotel is good value for money but not a 5 star resort. There is no resort tax which si good but it is not on the strip. About a 7 minute walk from the strip.

Reviews.Title: “"Had a great time."”
Reviews.Author: Angie R
Reviews.Content: I had a very pleasurable experience during my stay, I stayed in a very nice, spacious, comfortable, and well maintained room. I found the hotel staff to be very helpful, courteous, and accomodating. I had agreat time, I will stay at this hotel again on future trips, and will recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Not So Great”
Reviews.Author: bigdra
Reviews.Content: Yeah we booked New Year's at the "Hilton". When we got there, there were no signs saying Hitlon. Everything outside was taken down already. Then when we got inside we saw the beginning of their clever re-branding to "LVH". Not such a subtle way to associate yourself with a luxury fashion house. I hope LVMH sues. Anyway, yeah, place a bit run-down. Bathroom pretty lousy. Terrible light, bad shower head, old school linoleum and a toilet almost at floor level. Room's are spacious, but don't smell that great. Beds were ok. The pool area looks like a low-budget public swimming pool complete with family bbq pavilion style gazebo things. Lobby/casino/shops downstairs made me want to run, instead of walk out of the building. Location not so great. Near the strip at its worst at the Golden Nugget and Circus Circus. Oh yeah and the reception folks were not so helpful and sort of surly.

Reviews.Title: “Las Vegas Hotel and Casino”
Reviews.Author: NickM22
Reviews.Content: This was the Hilton Hotel but the name has changed. But that's all. I have been going to this hotel for the past 7 years. Their comp system is generous and the Sports Book is the Biggest in Las Vegas. They are always offering me to return f with Comp rooms and meals and even on weekends. Maybe I like LVH because my luck here is better than other Casinos. I will always return to this hotel even without the free rooms and food. It's off the strip but the Tram serves this hotel. No problem getting to the heart of Las Vegas Blvd.

Reviews.Title: “Ok room,Average service...”
Reviews.Author: Jon R
Reviews.Content: Paid for resort room, Received Good room, Great access to lounge on 24th floor which has some light food and alcholic beverages complimentary. Room service food was ok, Ruben sandwich first night was worthy of price, second night Appitizer of Southwestern eggrolls was POOR in comparison to say applebees rools.... Better off paying for something else there... 25 bucks for 6 rolls the thickness of your thumb is not worth it whrn applebees gives you for 1i0 BUCKS less double the size rolls!!! Other than this app. room was good and loved the access and feedom to the Lounge until 8pm, but dont buy the Southwest eggrolls WASTE OF MONEY PERIOD! RUBEN SANDWICH AWESOME!

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to see the upgrades”
Reviews.Author: Sarah H
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the LVH when I was in town for a conference. I've been to Las Vegas many times before and this is my first time staying at the former Hilton. I upgraded and got a remodeled room in the north tower - thank god! In seeing some of my colleague's rooms, this was the right thing to do. Now that the hotel is being rebranded, I will be interested to see if/what they upgrade. The hotel has a lot of that Vegas history which is cool, but the halls smell like stale hotel and old smoke. The remodel was nice - the furniture, bed and bathroom were all great. Everyone at the front desk was really nice and helpful. We ate at the steakhouse and it was good. The Fortuna coffee place was always busy, but the wraps for lunch were tasty. Since I was staying for the conference, the LVH was the best option. For my next trip back, I will stay on the strip again. My advice would be to pay the extra and get an updated room - you won't regret it. If you're looking for something a little quieter or close to your convention, LVH is a nice spot. I wouldn't recommend it if you plan to spend a lot of time on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel, slightly off the strip”
Reviews.Author: Rocklayer
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the LVH, or Hilton, as it was when we were there last fall. The facility is a little bit tired, but still had a certain flair to it. Conveniently located on the monorail service for good access once your feet get tired. The casino is a little small, but the experienced staff made it feel decent. Great spa facility, well worth the extra costs.

Reviews.Title: “Tired hotel”
Reviews.Author: Clare D
Reviews.Content: The LVH is tired, even the recently renovated rooms are still dreary and old. The bed was reasonably comfortable and it was quiet. The service was standard. Pizza delivery menus were pushed under the door on a few nights so I wonder about security. The gym was a disaster - two of the seven treadmills were broken and one of the three ellipticals were also broken. The room was a crowded, dak interior space that could not be called a spa by any standards. The final insult was the charge $20 a day for facility that was woefully inadequate and substandard.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing to write home about!”
Reviews.Author: drdlm2000
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the LVH while attending a seminar mid-January. I decided to upgrade the room to the club level rooms due to the amenities they had listed on the website. Needless to say we got to our room and basically saw what I would consider an average "Motel 6" room...No amenities! No robe and slippers, no business printer, no complementary water. I called the front desk and was greeted curtly with "Well we can move you back to a regular room." They did send up the water and I chose to stay in that room (what did the regular room look like!). We didn't get the daily newspaper like the listed amenities promised. I was very disappointed! The beds were comfortable enough but the carpet was frayed where the tile floor met the carpet terribly. It was not the upgraded room that I thought we would get, was not happy with the hotel's reaction to my complaints and however am happy that our convention will be taking it's 5000+ guests to another venue next year!

Reviews.Title: “Lacking a few things.”
Reviews.Author: j w
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 days. Cannot believe $14.00 for WiFi (a day!!!!). Even Motel 6 has it free. No coffee pot for morning.Have to get dressed, go downstairs, and then pay $4 for a cup of coffee after spending $100 gambling,(I'm not a big spender) What a deal??????? If I flushed the toilet, couldn't get cold water from the sink till the tolilet bowl filled. A little ucky, but a pain in the butt. Felt like the hotel went the way of the airlines. Most employees much older then I remember from 5 yrs. ago. They seemed to really struggle to be friendly and that they were just putting in their time. I not against older people working (I'm 66) but at least be friendly. I other BIGGGGG thing. No Golf Channel. Can u believe it !!! Even the hospital here in Phx has that. Good thing? ummmmm, price of room, kind of!!

Reviews.Title: “LVH -”
Reviews.Author: graynas
Reviews.Content: Friendly staff, Tired rooms need some new life, reasonable rates, food was a little on the expensive side (internal restaurants). Would recommend staying closer to the strip as taxi rides will make your pockets bleed green. I will mention the staff were very accommodating as we got sick and they moved us to late check out.

Reviews.Title: “clean and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: lisagge
Reviews.Content: I was a little apprehensive about staying "anywhere in Vegas" because of all the hype about bedbugs...YUCK! My room at the LVH was clean, my bed was comfortable and I slept well all 5 nights I was there. Not a sign of creepy crawlers anywhere. I would stay there again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Do everyone a favor, just lock the doors.”
Reviews.Author: worldguy2312
Reviews.Content: Bad, so very bad. Bad staff, dirty rooms, falling apart. Hilton did the right thing and had their name taken off this bad hotel. Just shut it down. Do not stay here! It was never that great of a place but now it is just so bad.

Reviews.Title: “Vegas, Baby!”
Reviews.Author: JoeRFreitas
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for a business trip in 2008. It was amazing to stay in the same hotel where the King Elvis Presley performed when it was still called The International.

Reviews.Title: “Things have changed”
Reviews.Author: deckhandoug
Reviews.Content: Well, there is no doubt things have changed, we still had a good time, our room was clean and updated and the staff seemed to be trying really hard. The Casino is really dated and didn't have much activity. No free wifi, no breakfast, no in room coffee.

Reviews.Title: “Not as good as before.”
Reviews.Author: Zong24
Reviews.Content: The hotel is dirty. I think they did not vacuum thoroughly. The paint on ceiling in the bathroom seems falling. I am not sure if I will go there again. This hotel used to be my favorite hotel in Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Take Your Slippers”
Reviews.Author: dreamdestinations
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at LVH because of a convention my husband was attending. This is about our 5th yr there. The hotel has a great workout area in the spa, the service was adequate for a 31/2 star. There's plenty of variety in dining options. The room was made up promptly each day. Our room (1911) itself was tired - dirty, spotted, frayed carpet; bed linen is worn (but clean) and the furniture is chipped and dated....desparate for an refurbishing. The bathrooms however were mold free with plenty of water pressure in the tub (small tub)/shower area. The pool area was being resurfaced but was closed for the winter months. We would not go back again unless it was the venue for the convention again. We lost our Hilton honors points for that stay because of the switch and were not pleased about that. The Spa did honor our Hilton honors but for how long that will continue is the question. One plus is the monorail has a stop at the hotel and goes from the Stratosphere Hotel to MGM.

Reviews.Title: “I understand now why they lost their HILTON status.”
Reviews.Author: conniesculinary
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at this hotel because it was the site of a business convention we were attending. We booked our rooms months in advance and paid for them in advance. When we arrived the rooms that we booked were not available and so we ended up having lesser quality rooms than what we actually paid for. The rooms were in need of renovation. The staff is not very friendly and if you are wanting quick service for anything, don't stay here. Most of the wait staff is older and I believe most of them were working there when Elvis was still performing at the casino. Room service was faster than trying to eat anywhere in the building but they did not always get it right. The casino is small and service there is beyond slow and the employee attitudes very indifferent. The best part about this hotel is the convenience of the monorail sytem which made it easy to go anyplace else.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Customer Service!”
Reviews.Author: WiSenioRita
Reviews.Content: Its not what it used to be - that is All I heard from Everyone in Vegas, mostly the cab guys who have been around and seen it all.
