I was there in August, when it was the Hilton and the same crap. They pretend they are 'upgrading' you, but either don't or want you to pay more. Let's say you ask for a bigger room (with a couch) and king bed, but then they try to 'upgrade' you to a smaller room (without a couch) because it has a king bed, but then the don't offer to refund any money because you actually just got downgraded to a smaller room, The moment you check in they nickel and dime you. You even need to pay for the safe in your room! Its not enough you just way over spent for the room, now you bring your gambling money and can't even put it in the safe. I had been at the $20 buffet 4-5 times over the week and the last night we just got some take out to relax in our room. They truly have the best soda, so I went to the buffet to buy a pitcher, they wouldn't do it, you have to go to the gift shop or the cafe for take out soda. The cafe's take out soda was a big as a Dixie cup. I had several people to get for, so I Finally convinced a manager to sell me a 'pitcher' of soda - only because I brought down my own empty bottle to put it in. Its Soda! Its a better profit than jewelry!! And I need to Beg to buy it. Just no customer service at all! Calling the concierge and getting the wrong info. Those are just 3 of 10 examples and they only get worse. The only credit I will give is to the maids and the valet people. They were always courteous and nice. Its just too bad. When this place opened years ago, it was the place to be, now, I don't think you could pay me to go there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice if you're going to the Convention Center”
Reviews.Author: skaterdude
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for the second night I was in LV for CES. First night was at Circus Circus and I wanted to try a different hotel. This one was more expensive, but they don't charge a resort fee and it adjoins the Convention Center - ultra convenient for my purposes. I arrived very early and shortly after booking the room through an online site. The reservation had not made it into their system yet, so there was a little wait. It was OK though, because I wasn't expecting to even be able to check in that early. The desk clerk was nice and very accommodating, so that outweighed the delay. The room was nice. I didn't get either of the upgrade choices, yet I was not disappointed. It had a nice view over the convention center into the mid-Strip area. Linens were good, bed comfortable, bath and shower very nice (I'm tall, so shower head height and roominess of the bath is often an issue - not here). Be aware that, since there's no resort fee, there are charges for things like high-speed internet that are included at other places. That was fine with me as I could access the Internet through my phone. Plugs were a little hard to find near the desk - this is becoming a pet peeve for me when I have my laptop with me. Seems like plugs in older hotels are hard to find or filled up! All-in-all, I liked this hotel and it was convenient. I'd stay there again for sure. I had a round-trip return on the shuttle and was a little concerned this might be considered an off-Strip hotel. It wasnt. There seemed to be shuttles to the airport constantly available too. Each time one left, another pulled up and waited, so no worries about return to the airport here.

Reviews.Title: “Needs Upgrades!”
Reviews.Author: tats802
Reviews.Content: While the hotel is convenient for the convention center, it needs to be redecorated and re-done! It's aged and needs help!

Reviews.Title: “Pre-paid heaven!!”
Reviews.Author: dwhite2011
Reviews.Content: I am on every discount email site known to man, I think. When I got a link to a great deal for 2 nights/$55 I thought it was a scam... NOPE! Checked in and they did not even take a credit card for incidentals. THE ROOM IS VERY NICE...garden-size(?) Tub- great water pressure...scary flush with that...though! Queen bed, decent view and very well insulated,from noise, room. Love the bed and pillows - hotel rooms are always so dry- but that is our only complaint. ITs on the monorail, $12/ day pass...and we walked to a nearby Denny's for a real and well- valued breakfast. Casablanca Nicola, their Italian restaurant we loved for taking a reservation, getting in earlier, having great food and wonderfully service. NOT Italy, but good value for hotel place. NO waiting is very important to us. FREE self- serve parking- use your own Wifi, save $$. That was $55 for 2 nights, not each! Our second time here, off strip and we r fine with that!

Reviews.Title: “No Real Reason to Pick LVH”
Reviews.Author: STEVENSNY
Reviews.Content: You can change the name to be cool and hip, but you also need to change the furnishings and everything else. I travel to Vegas quite a bit for business and Hilton or LVH as they now would like to be called is my last choice for accommodations UNLESS I have to work at the Convention Center. If you are traveling for recreation there is no reason on earth to pick the LVH - it is too far removed from the action, it is shoddy, the restaurant selection is miserable. It really is just old school Vegas - casino, bar and a couple of food places. I stay at the LVH a few times a year when I work at the Convention Center - this is the closest hotel to the center and it is possible to maneuver through the hotel into the center without going outside if the weather is bad. For this reason only I stay at the LVH - the convenience of working a trade show. Otherwise I would not recommend this property to ANYONE - ever!! The Hilton does run another property - Grand Vacations closeby (non casino) and it is well kept and nice for leisure, but again WAY off the beaten path. With so many hotel choices in Vegas stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Unimpressed, but no big deal”
Reviews.Author: PIKTRIPPERS
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at this hotel before. So, I wasn't expecting much. Upon check-in, we were told that we need to upgrade or put up with a room by the elevators. So, of course we upgraded. We got to our room, and there is only one small inefficient light work in the bathroom. We called up to have it fixed and they took care of it within a few hours. It just seems to me that "newly renovated rooms" wouldn't have that problem. Also, getting ready to tuck ourselves in, and I noticed there's only 2 functional pillows. The others were itchy and not intended for use. One more thing to call the front desk about. Still, it wasn't that bad, but not amazing either.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Than Motel 6”
Reviews.Author: javidtwins
Reviews.Content: One of the biggest disappointments in my 12 years of being a Hilton customer. This hotel has THE worst, filthiest, and most uncomfortable rooms for a Hilton brand. The shower floor has a dead bug, hair, and a rust stain the size of a grapefruit. The beds are lumpy, sagged, and my brother's pillow has a tan patch on it - someone's makeup I guess. I can not wait to get the hell out of here tomorrow morning and check into Aria. YUCK!

Reviews.Title: “WORST HOTEL IN VEGAS !!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: emma w
Reviews.Content: dont book this hotel - for simlar price you could get SOOO much better in vegas!!. we went for christmas and new year family of 4 adults and 2 children. the hotel is very dated, dark, dismal and down right filthy! the cleaners only hoovered the rooms every 3 days yet the rooms where soo bad, we all got infection and flea bites (HOTEL MANAGEMENT SAID SORRY). The atmosphere in the hotel is like a retirment home! the Startreck ride that is advertised on the website is closed down, The kids archade is closed down, The pool is closed for cleaning until the middle of feb 2012 - There is basically nothing in this hotel, even the casino's are morbid. We went out everyday and most evenings as there was just nothing to do in the hotel. The Elvis show was good but overpriced for what it was, He was too good for the LVH and im sure that a better hotel will snap him up soon enough! ,The paradise cafe was crawling with cocroaches. They just wonder round the walls whilst your trying to eat, The whole hotel needs FUMIGATING!!!. THERE ARE SOO MANY BETTER HOTELS OUT THERE, This one is overpriced and all you get is a dirty room, I definatly wouldnt recommend this hotel - stay there at your own health risk!!, Its vile and boring. I would never stay there again - i have stayed there alot in the past but never again, it either needs a full spectacular refurb or closing down. Its not surprising that the Hilton have removed their name, I'd be ashamed to put my name to this hotel (its a disgrace)!!! Also, one nice member of staff was a theif, a few small items went missing but then a brand new bottle of Christian Dior purfume was stolen - hotel management and security did nothing. FOR A SIMILAR PRICE LOOK AT THE MGM OR STRATOSPHERE - THERE NOT TOO POSH AND HAVE A FANTASTIC ATMOSPHERE, VERY CLEAN TOO AND THEY ARE SAFE TO EAT IN!!!! - NO CREEPY CRAWLEYS!! - trust me, BOOK a different hotel then when your in vegas visit a few hotels then have a look at lvh - you will see how bad it is for yourself and you'll be glad of this review!! AVOID THE LVH!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Meh”
Reviews.Author: btravels20
Reviews.Content: This is just a Hotel. Period. If you are in Vegas for business this will do just fine. However if you are here for a Vacation this is not the best Hotel for you. It is seperated from most attractions, and the Monorail to the strip is 5 dollars one way, which adds up after a while. The rooms are clean, but getting old. This is one of the most avarage Hotels I think I have ever been a guest in. Nothing stood out, except the thin walls. Expect to hear other conversations in srounding rooms and people in the hallway clearly. They did have free parking

Reviews.Title: “Not the Hilton!”
Reviews.Author: D R
Reviews.Content: It appears this properties class and service left with the Hilton name. The casino/hotel is alright for the price and promotions however the rooms arent kept that clean, poor housekeeping as all our our granite counters were sticky and unwashed or wiped with a dirty clothe. Some area's had unfinished interior repair (missing drywall/ceilings/etc) with no hazard signs, cones or employees. We asked the players card club associate where's a good place to eat inside the hotel and he responded he doesnt know he never eats there but stay away from the buffet its terrible....the employee said that and since we had a free breakfast buffet w/our room we decided to get the free breakfast anyway....the associate was right...buffet consist of a nice variety of B rated food that appears to come from cans and frozen stuff, nothing fresh, I think they shop at food for less! I only had the coffee which was watered down. We caught a mark curry comedy show at 20% off and ate dinner at TJ steak house which was great, pricy but good. We wished the chinese restaraunt stayed open later they close at 8pm...isnt this vegas! You could always settle for Benihanas but they're pricy and do not have traditional chinese cuisine. Since this hotel stis by itself in the back/rear end off the strip your kinda of stuck there unless you want to walk a mile in either direction. They should market the mono rail system which takes you to other casinos on the strip however we had no idea it existed unitl we were leaving. This hotel should be good for conventions and business groups. Overall we had a good time there as we won all of our money back on 2 different dollar machines as we were leaving. Hotel is average but good for the price!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient for a convention - period”
Reviews.Author: Babybite
Reviews.Content: It is convenient for a convention because you are already there and every place else is a cab ride (with traffic) away. The monorail stops nearby, but once you get off the monorail (anywhere in Vegas) it is such a long walk to get to where you are going - not to mention hotels/casinos take about 20 minutes to walk across each one. The accomodations were clean and the food was very expensive. I wouldn't come for vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid if at all possible”
Reviews.Author: atima
Reviews.Content: I've been staying here for years during CES. While never the most luxurious hotel in Las Vegas, it's proximity to the convention center made it an adequate trade off. This is no longer the case. This property has been in a steady decline and now with it's split from Hilton, it's in a freefall. The rooms are dingier than ever, stained carpet, loose/missing tiles, no stopper in the sink, etc. I'm not even 6' tall and I have to stoop over in the shower to get my head wet. Also, beware the hidden charges. I used the safe in my room only to be surprised with a $3 per day fee. There was nothing to notify of the charge, even though I had to call a number to have it activated. All this for $300 per night. The atmosphere of the hotel and casino was depressing, with no headline attractions and a ghost-town of a casino. Even if forced to stay at this place, it's clear that everyone goes elsewhere for entertainment at the first opportunity. I will gladly trade convenience for a passable room in the future. Time to raze this dinosaur and start over.

Reviews.Title: “Not the same hotel”
Reviews.Author: Travel4fun777
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this hotel for several years for the annual CES convention. Upon arriving we are told that they are no longer a Hilton hotel not sure why no one told us this beforehand. The service was not the same although many of the staff were the same. Over priced rooms 350.00 per night due to the convention - Food was over priced the coffee shop was fairly reasonable however on this trip we had to send our foos back several times because it was cold or not cooked to order.. Needless to say were not going back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “I would not consider this a Hilton”
Reviews.Author: Anonymous49463
Reviews.Content: I used my Hilton points to check into this hotel. I asked for a Refrigerator and Microwave in my room as I have a special needs child and she cannot eat outside food. Thinking it was a Hilton and their service would be good I booked here. I begged them to provide these even at a cost per day and they would not. I had no choice but check out and ask Hilton Customer service to provide another accommodation for my points. I was reserved in Homewood Suites and loved the location. I would not stay at Las Vegas Hilton ever.

Reviews.Title: “Faded Glory”
Reviews.Author: traveloften028
Reviews.Content: The LVH has a long way to go to regain the stature that the former Las Vegas Hilton used to have. We booked into one of their "upgraded" rooms which are advertised as newly renovated. The steel frame on the bathroom door was rusted out at the bottom and there were rusty screws in a plate above the shower. Clearly, the renovation either occurred years ago or was just a paint job. The hotel is old and looks it. The Hilton let it slide and LVH needs to address that. The big plus is the proximity to the convention center. Also, the employees were fairly nice although none seemed happy about the new name change if you managed to get them to talk about it. The price was good but other newer properties are competing for the dwindling tourist dollar so LVH needs to step it up. Also should consider a spiffier name. LVH doesn't have a lot of zing.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised...”
Reviews.Author: Tiffery1
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here one night so we could attend the Lee's Annual Wine tasting Experience and not have to drive home. Another couple we were with also stayed in the hotel. Upon check-in the front desk staff was very nice and very helpful. I have to say, based on the old look, feel and smell of the property and casino, I was pleasantly surprised by our room. We did have an option to pay an additional $12 for a room upgrade, which we did - to a Grand room in the North Tower. We were on the 7th floor and had a view of a small pond behind the property. The room was very well kept and newly renovated. It smelled clean, the water pressure was great and it had everything you needed - hair dryer, soap, shampoo, plenty of towels etc. The casino however was very very smokey and smelled old, but it's an older casino, so what do you expect? It is a bit of a walk to the center strip, but if the weather is nice then it is a nice walk. It is one of the stops on the monorail line so you can always catch that if you don't want to walk. If I was coming to Vegas for the first time, or even for a return trip, I most likely wouldn't stay here. It is pretty far from all the action and it is an older property with not too much entertainment... but for someone staying for a convention or meeting, it is perfect. It's quiet and out of the way, it has plenty of places to eat (Bennihana is my favorite!!) and the rooms were decent. However, our friends paid for a "strip view" room and said that they really got a monorail view room... so they confirmed that it was not worth it. I guess if their room was on a higher floor it would have been better - so if you do book a strip view room... make sure you are on one of the top floors. They also said our room was much bigger than theirs and a lot nicer... so if you don't care too much about the view (though, ours wasn't bad at all) then stick with a grand room. Also - don't forget to tip housekeeping every day...don't wait till the end of your trip or you may end up tipping someone who never cleaned your room for you!

Reviews.Title: “Does what it should”
Reviews.Author: margoworldtraveller
Reviews.Content: Swift check-in. All the information in the room you need (except how to lose money in the casino - where are the instructions for those 20 types of poker?). A range of dining - posh to functional. Loved the $10 voucher (to be spent anywhere in the hotel, even in combination with discounts) if you skip the daily clean - now there's a good way to initiate environmental awareness! But if you look closely the hotel is over its hayday - tiles coming off, toilet blocked, shower curtain nearly coming down.

Reviews.Title: “LVH is not what it used to be - HILTON”
Reviews.Author: kapustaCanada
Reviews.Content: We arrived on January 4 to an almost empty hotel. The holiday crowds were gone and when we checked in, discovered that on Jan 3, the hotel ceased to be a "Hilton", It was a comedy of screw ups from the get-go. We had two rooms booked, one of which needed to be accessible for a wheelchair/scooter. A roll-in shower was requested and when we arrived at the room discovered that the bathroom had a tub.....back to the desk to inform them and get reassigned. New room had the right kind of shower but the shower curtain was 8 inches too long and would get trapped in the wheels of the scooter. Cell phone photo and back to the desk to advise of this new hazard, along with education for the staff on how this would be a liability.......maintenance arrived minutes later to trim the curtain to floor length. First shower.....in their wisdom, they have installed a curved rod over a straight line shower. With a poor floor design and drain, water was all over the bathroom in no time. Informed staff, and the lady on the desk never lifter her eyes from the keyboard in front of her but was able to say "we are sorry to hear that" in her most insincere and uncaring voice. Room number 2, was about 100degrees F when we entered with the temp control not functioning. Phoned desk - said they would send someone from maintenance up. Waited at least 30 minutes (remember, hotel is pretty much empty) and called again. Was told that the issue had been added to the list for maintenance and I asked what they would do in the meantime. Finally had to go again to the desk and demand to be moved to a different room. This room, still near my friend's room was fine, until the suite at the end of the hall decided to have a Latin music festival starting at 3 a.m. My young daughter woke me up (I wear ear plugs!) and I couldn't believe the noise. Had to phone hotel security and they did respond in good time to remedy the situation. Day two, the key stopped working on Room 2 when we returned at 11:00 p.m. I phoned the desk from the hotel phone located in the hall of our floor. When I explained the situation, the guy said that our key to room 166X did not work because there was no one staying in that room. They had not bothered to update our room situation. They said they would send someone up so we could move back to our original room....what a bunch of clowns. I said "I am not moving! We need to get into the room. The guy said to come down to the desk (we are on the 16th floor, East Tower, about a mile away from the desk). I then said, "that will not be happening - this is your mistake - you need to send someone up with the keys". I would not stay here again. The only bright light was I parlayed $20 into $525 at the slot machine. I considered this to be aggravation money! With all the choices of hotels in Vegas, this one is on the bottom of the list.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, cheap... but not the best location”
Reviews.Author: anton73
Reviews.Content: Rooms are pretty standard, I had a basic king and it had all the features I would expect in an LV hotel room. Hotel was kept clean, and I had a breeze at check-in, sadly I never got to try the pool (work). I really have no issues with the hotel other than the location. It sits all by itself away from the newer hotels and you are forced to either take a cab or the tram. Typically I like to be in a cluster of hotels that allows me to walk to several, but it's really not possible here.

Reviews.Title: “Won't stay again ever.”
Reviews.Author: eddie b
Reviews.Content: Booked this trip over the New Year. Got there and our room wasn't ready. Had to stand out side of our room for 45 minutes till maid finished cleaning it. Room is out dated. Mold on shower tile in bathroom. No coffee pot for in the morning. A/C didn't work. Swimming pool was closed for repairs. Went to there New Years eve party in the Grand Ballroom. Over 600 people there and only 4 bartenders. Had to wait for 30 minutes to get a drink. This place has really gone down hill. Won't stay there ever again.

Reviews.Title: “No longer a Hilton, but still is great!”
Reviews.Author: arts123
Reviews.Content: This hotel has lost its Hilton status, but I have noted no changes this week since the switch over, other than loss of the name. Same great buffet, same room furnishings, same service. All very good. The spa is good, with friendly and helpful attendants. Prices have gone up, but still a good buy just off of the Strip.

Reviews.Title: “Good, but not Great”
Reviews.Author: AZCasualTraveler
Reviews.Content: We booked the Las Vegas Hilton for the New Year's celebation 2012 and found the check-in service quite disappointing. We had arrived at the hotel at around 3:30 pm, and we were told that the room would not be ready until after 4:30 pm. So we decided to drop-off the luggage at their baggage hold room and look for a sit-down restaurant here at the Hilton for a meal. We were disappointed to find all of the Hilton's main restaurants are open only for dinner and their "coffee-shop" style restaurant was closed from 3:00 to 5:00 pm. The buffet was too much for us to eat, so we had to settle for one of their fast-food restaurants. We picked-up our room keys at 4:30 pm and went to that room only to find litter (paper) scattered about the floor and food items on the table, and the bed linen disturbed - it appeared that someone came in the room after it was cleaned. So we went back to the check-in counter to tell them about this problem and we received keys to another room. No apology was given by the clerk at the front desk - only appeared suprised about the situation. When we went to the second room and opened the door, we found several pieces of luggage and shoes on the floor for another group, but luckily no one was in at that time. So we went back to the front desk again to tell them about this problem - again no apologies was given. On the third try, however, we did get a good clean room. So front-desk service at the Hilton Las Vegas does not rate very high for this situation. We did find the hotel room clean and fresh, nicely appointed, comfortable bed and clean bathroom. The hotel casino was just OK with an older design that does not compare with the newer casinos found on the Strip. The hotel is located about a mile from the strip, so it is a long walk to get to that area, but there are many taxis at the front door of the Hilton to take people where they want to go.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay, relax, romance...”
Reviews.Author: morloff
Reviews.Content: We always love the las Vegas Hiltons. This Hilton is different than the usual layout since it's a casino and major resort destination. The Hilton service ethic is excellent, loved the accommodations. They upgraded us to a strip-view (subject to avail). We went there to unwind from a working conference down-strip, so didn't have a lot of time to explore or golf. The buffet was AWESOME, as always. They have such a wide variety of foods and desserts that it makes everything so much more enjoyable! The parking is smooth and conveniently close, the bell staff were pleasant, the health gym people were wonderful, and they had everything in the locker room you could expect. I would love to spend more time at the lv Hilton -- and no, I'm not related to anyone who works there.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty panties left in bed”
Reviews.Author: quintin w
Reviews.Content: my overall experience of this hotel is terrible,my stay on 12/31/11,ended with the hotel manager having security escort me from the hotel when i did not do anything wrong.when i check in to the room,that i paid $340.00 for the nite,there were dirty towels,and dirty glasses in the bath room,i called the front desk,they sent housekeeping an half an hour later to take care of the problem,in the mean time i could'nt take a shower and get dress for a party that came to town for.after a nite on the town i came to my room around 4.30am to get some sleep,as i rolled back the covers,there was a nasty,smelly dirty pair of panties in the bed,i called the front desk to speak with a manager,the gave me a supervisor,i asked her to come up to the room and look at these dirty drawers in my bed she said she would not we exchanged words and she hung up in my face.needless to say i was very upset,i then went to the front desk to speak with her,and she begain yelling at meand called security i keep my cool and asked to speak with a manager,one finally came,i aske for my money back,he said i will give you your money back but you will have to leave the hotel,the supervisor continue to yell at me,they had security follow me to the room ,get my things,and escort me through hundreds of guest as though i did something wrongout of the hotel,i did'nt know a hilton hotel chain would treat it's customers this way.i was thinking is it because i'm black,i don't know.two years ago at this same hotel i check in to my room only to find a couple having sex,they were very shocked as i was.

Reviews.Title: “Great for conventions, terrible for food choices.”
Reviews.Author: wwtravelsalot
Reviews.Content: This hotel is defiantly one of the early Las Vegas Hotels, it looks tired and the rooms have a tired feeling as well. I stayed here to attend a conference in the Las Vegas Convention centre next door, for this purpose the hotel was fantastic - just a quick walk and I was there. The other problem is there was cues for everything, for Breakfast there was a cue, for dinner there was a cue and the food was expensive, to check out there was a cue. Also a bit depressing was the Casino, it was basic, and added a poor feel to the hotel. Food options were varied, but to get the real Las Vegas feel a monorail ride was required, which in 5 minutes had you on the strip - our stumble back to the hotel took about an hour though. The wireless internet connection was good, but costly.

Reviews.Title: “Good experience”
Reviews.Author: rh59
Reviews.Content: We checked in on 12/29/11, and out on 1/2/12. We booked for New Year's Eve relatively late, and this was the best option available as a Hilton reward (I'm hhonors diamond). There were a lot of negative reviews and that made us nervous about the stay. Things turned out fine. We were given a remodeled room, which was supposedly an "upgrade." It was a very nice room, new furniture, comfy bed, etc. As a diamond we got free breakfast every day, which was the buffet. For Saturday and Sunday breakfast was incredible, everything from eggs to prime rib. And it was more than the abundant quantity of food that made the buffet good, it was the quality of the food. The location is off the strip; however the hotel is directly connected to the monorail system so getting to the strip was fast, easy and convenient. There were a couple of small things I didn't love: We had to wait in line to get on the elevators (although the hotel was jammed with people over NYE, by 1/2 this problem seemed to have disappeared). The flat panel had a regular-dev signal (I didn't come there to watch TV, so no biggie). The "renovation" didn't include changing the doors or hardware, and they looked old compared to everything else (which is what almost all hotel ":renovations": do). As you can see my complaints were minor, If the hotel were remaining in the Hilton chain, I would definitely come back. Since I'll lose my room upgrade, free breakfast and free internet, I'm not sure the overall deal will be a good value going forward. If you don't have a hotel loyalty program to consider, this is a good option.

Reviews.Title: “Isolated from everything”
Reviews.Author: Sw02jco
Reviews.Content: Nit a bad hotel for the price, but you can tell that the Hilton are pulling out as some basics are being let go, like customer service! Bell desk was good though. We left to find another hotel as felt so isolated there now that Sahara has closed and it is a good walk even to the riviera. If you don't get your room cleaned on a day, you do get a $10 food voucher which is a great idea!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, great value!”
Reviews.Author: Charnelle W
Reviews.Content: We are Hilton Gold Members and love the chain. We had a great stay in a beautifully renovated room in Dec. 2011 with a great view of the golf course. The restaurant buffet was incredible and we truly felt well cared for. I would highly recommend this hotel even though it will not be a Hilton after Jan. 1, 2012. Where else in downtown LV can you play golf at the hotel course. The location is perfect, the staff very caring and rooms are very nice. We love this "Grand Lady" and will look to stay here in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Will have to wait and see”
Reviews.Author: aspd3815900
Reviews.Content: I've been to this hotel several times primarily because I'm a Hilton diamond member and the rates have been great for the amount of time I actually spend in a room or hotel. With the change in ownership I'd still consider the property, however it would be based upon price alone. My guess is Hilton customers will be courted to the Hilton Grand vacation properties but there aren't too many people talking.

Reviews.Title: “Off the Strip Haven”
Reviews.Author: gillbhai
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three days in the hotel. Unfortunately the first night was constantly interrupted by a fighting family next door which moved out the next morning but was testament to the thin walls of the hotel. Other than that the hotel is actually really good with off the strip rates but on the strip amenities. Even though it is off the strip, one of the stops for the Las Vegas monorail is the hotel so access to the strip is very easy. The hotel is big with various shows playing and great restaurants and of course the casino. I also was one of the last people to get points as an HHonors members as starting January 1, 2012 the hotel will change its name to Las Vegas Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: baron48
Reviews.Content: The story here is that you can get a room for $50 just off the strip (and free parking to boot!). It's a $5/person monorail ride or $10-15 cab ride to most places on the strip. The rooms are good by Las Vegas standards, but below what I'm used to seeing at other Hilton properties. The building is aging pretty good, but as with most everywhere in Vegas, smells smokey in most common areas. Staff was super-friendly and no shortage of things to do on the property. Would definitely stay again (this is the 3rd time I've stayed here) just because it is such a super value in a place that is designed to extract every penny out of visitors.

Reviews.Title: “Her Glory Days Are Past”
Reviews.Author: AbnSarge
Reviews.Content: A word to the wise: avoid this place for a while. Hilton is parting ways with this once grande dame of that chain and like most divorces, this one has taken a toll. Had I been aware that this property was leaving the Hilton brand within the week, I would have booked elsewhere. I know from hard experience that hotels leaving major chains tend to be in decline and that upkeep by the departing owners is minimal. It is certainly true in this case. I hadn't stayed here since the hotel's glory days of the 70's and 80's when it was the primary convention hotel in Las Vegas. The present facility is a husk of that former grand property. The one area where the quality and ambiance haven't declined as dramatically is in the restaurants. TJ's Steakhouse serves a fine if pricey meal and the coffee shop still makes a decent sandwich. The buffet is pretty typical for Vegas. What the new owners will do with this old dowager is anyone's guess. Until that is known, I'd book elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Complete excitement”
Reviews.Author: Sexyteddy007
Reviews.Content: Great rooms especially premium ones,great& loveable customer service,saw Trent carlini show which was awesome,play safe at casino!

Reviews.Title: “The Hilton Hhonor Gold member to see the last days as a Hilton”
Reviews.Author: jdealman
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at several rebranded hotels which had previously been a Hilton. The former Flamingo Hilton in Reno, the former Reno Hilton, a Radisson in Sa Luis Obispo, cA which used to be a Hilton, and this Las Vegas Hilton soon to be The Las Vegas Hotel (LVH). I have stayed numerous times at this hotel over the years. I remember going there many years back to see Bill Cosby perform on my 21st birthday. While the Las Vegas Hilton was off the beaten path I would stay their for my Hhonors room upgrade, points, and 2free buffets per night. While I stayed there in the past and as I saw the staff white wash over the old Hilton logo. I new that I would most likely not return to this hotel. No points, no free buffets means no loyalty to you LVH. To be honest for the past 3 years' visits I could roll a bowling ball down the casino without hitting anyone. So if anyone at Hilton Honors marketing reads this.... Please affiliate with another full service resort in Vegas! Your minions known that Vegas is too important of a city for you not to have a resort casino!

Reviews.Title: “Not again”
Reviews.Author: Tom M
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the LV Hilton 12/17-20. I will never stay at the hotel again. It was dirty and smokey. We were on a non-smoking floor but you couldn't tell. Everything has gone downhill. The casino is the worst. Do not stay at this hotel. If you want to stay off the strip...look at the Marriott or some other chain.

Reviews.Title: “Not well kept”
Reviews.Author: BAHShooter
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this property on a business trip. The hotel fell within my company's per diem and was one block off the strip. The lobby and gaming floor are clean and well kept. The room, on the other hand, was a bit dated and beat up. I reserved a superior room, one step above a standard room as I recall. The door facings were beat up, there were scuffs on the walls, stains on the ceiling and some of the bathroom tiles were cracked. As I recall, there were two towers, and maybe I just got the 'party' tower, I don't know. I do know T.J.'s steakhouse was only open on weekends during my stay, and the Casa Nicola may have been the same. Tres Rios Cantina is open, but only the bar area and only for app's. Lastly, when I went to check out, I wanted to adjust my bill to help me file a voucher with my company and the person that checked me out said they would not make any changes to the bill, and they didn't! To finish on a positive note, the Elvis show is pretty good. Bad experience. I'll never stay again and I wouldn't recommend it to anyone. If you are looking to experience vegas in a big casino hotel, stay at the Luxor. It's usually the most affordable resort/casino property.

Reviews.Title: “Ok for Conference, but would not stay there again....”
Reviews.Author: Sorpheus
Reviews.Content: Bathroom was not really clean and the room was ok. After the conference you had to wait in the line in front of the eleveters for about 20 minutes... Also they charged a early check-out fee :-(

Reviews.Title: “Not by Hilton Standards”
Reviews.Author: 3Pingouins
Reviews.Content: Hotel is old; since I'm HHonors Gold I got a "superior room". Can't imagine that some room are worst. The only good thing is the breakfast buffet that got plenty of choice. Better watch other casino; pretty eays to find better place for half the price and directly on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with lots of services”
Reviews.Author: skrash
Reviews.Content: Big hotel with lots of services available. I had no problems at the hotel. Room was nice and functional. Downstairs there where several restaurants and the monorail has a station just next to the hotel. The hotel is also well situated if you are visiting the convention center

Reviews.Title: “Love Hiltons but this one needs help!”
Reviews.Author: jerseygirlinaz29
Reviews.Content: I understand this will not be a Hilton after January 1, 2012. We stayed here in December, 2011. I am Diamond member and I had to ask if I get any priviledges, apparently they can't check Hilton status on their computers. The check-in person had to look up my last stay and get my Hilton number from it. I got one internet access free and the VIP Lounge access (after I asked) and free breakfast for two even though we had a child with us. We had to pay at the buffet for the child. Now comes the bad stuff.....in the room next to us they started playing rap music in the afternoon so loud it shook the room, the bass sound was so loud. Then they started smoking and we had a connecting room so it came under the door. even though I have no-smoking room on my profile it was ignored. I called Security and they came up and asked them to turn the music off. About 6 hours later at 10:30 PM they turned the music on again. My husband called Security and they came up and told them to turn it off. No more music after that. The tub was hard to turn the water on, from then on out the tub leaked and was noisy. When I checked out they asked how I enjoyed my stay. I told them about the problems and they said that's too bad!. I loved this hotel back in April, 2011 when I visited due to the perks but I don't know if I would stay here again, especially since it won't be a Hilton,

Reviews.Title: “a little off the strip but its perfect!!”
Reviews.Author: may0529
Reviews.Content: I love staying here when I want Vegas but without the craziness of the strip. Everytime we're in town and we visit faily we stay here cause its easy access to the street we take. And theres a monorail that takes you to the strip so you don't have to drive. Its perfect if you want to gamble but still want to relax without the hustle and bussle of the strip

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: JTM6
Reviews.Content: We stayed at LV Hilton during the Thanksgiving weekend and were happy with the price and service there. Except for the reversation refund. We had to cancel 1 reversation which was $155 on the Z specials, but only get $101 back. Almost a month later, and we still can not get this resolved with the front desk nor the guest service to get the rest of the refund. Coming back anytime? NOT!!

Reviews.Title: “Won't be a Hilton much longer, but comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: saranger
Reviews.Content: Spent one night here last week with spouse. We are non-gamblers and in town for other tourism activities (museums, nature, etc). This was our last night in Las Vegas after three others at the Hampton and Doubletree by Airport, and the Grand Vacations Club on Karen. Check-in clerk seemed to be too bothered to care about checking us in (John). Given room in North Tower on 25th floor. No upgrades or special privileges for diamond HH members. Only ONE computer/Log-in for free Internet access. Not resort club access (upgrade for $30...per night?), but you do have free buffet in the Sports Book which included free beer/wine/mimosas on weekends. Room was pleasant, albeit a bit loud (thin walls/door). Casino off lobby makes it smokey and a tad loud, but we figured for that when we made the reservation. For the price ($52/night) we couldn't resist and were overall pleased with our stay. Shares parking with Hilton Club. Easy drieto restaurants and Strip activities/casinos. Will be re-branded the Las Vegas Hotel early January 2012 due to foreclosure/ownership change. Sad to see this iconic property de-Hiltoned. Have stayed here before and were glad to get one last stay. Saturday buffet was pretty busy and actually had a much larger selection of food than I would have thought. Hot foods were hot, lots of fruits, vegetables, and healthy options and also fried chicken and BBQ ribs at 9am. Wait staff were very helpful and attentive and kept my coffee cup filled. No coffee maker in room.

Reviews.Title: “An icon from the gone era.”
Reviews.Author: avchamp
Reviews.Content: Las Vegas Hilton, one of the last remaining icons from the Las Vegas golden age is begining to show it's age. The room we stayed in was quite large with walking closeth, but everything in the room was really old with an exception of flat screen T.V. In our room shower door handles were missing and the bath tub was placed so high up that if you are an old person you would have difficulty getting into the it. property is nice but requires a major renovation in and out. Bell services is erratic or non existent at times. Pool is suprisingly small despite the large amount of space that has been allocated to pool/tennis area. If you can get the rooms on the cheap side with promotiuon, coupon or points by all means go for it. If you are going to pay a high price there are betterl alternatives in vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel Off the Strip”
Reviews.Author: chervin18
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this hotel at least half a dozen times. What I like about it is the bang for the buck. The rates are cheaper than the hotels on the strip but this hotel is not too far off the strip either. There is a monorail station at this location which makes it very convenient going to the strip. The monorail day pass is highly recommended because you can drink and not worry about driving, parking, or taking the taxi which can be tough on a busy weekend in Vegas. If you are a Gold or Diamond member, you get a free breakfast buffet ($20 value each) for yourself and a companion. I always look forward to the breakfast especially on weekends because they have mimosas, carving station, chinese food, bbq, salad, dessert, seafood like smoked salmon and crablegs, omelette station, etc. If you're a gambler, the hotel casino and sports betting place (I'm not a gambler so I don't know what it's called) they have is nice too. I hear many gamblers screaming and yelling as if they're having a great time. They must be right? Haha I highly recommend this hotel if you're looking for alternative hotel off the strip and good rate.

Reviews.Title: “Looks like Hilton @ Las Vegas has lost Hilton theme”
Reviews.Author: nhlivefreeordie
Reviews.Content: Hilton Las Vegas has lost the Hilton name now. It is old, unclean and not to the expectation. Internet and gym charges are expensive. Internet is not per room but it is per device you connect. Gym use is chargeable for $20 per day. Room shower not working. Breakfast is so so. There is nothing good to write, except it is close to Conventional center so if you have any event then you can save some money as conventional center is at walking distance. But at same price, one can stay at better place at Bellagio or Caesar Palace, close to major attractions of Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Another solid stay at the LV Hilton”
Reviews.Author: RyanLV
Reviews.Content: Not a bad place still. Stayed there for one night during the last weekend of the NFR (didn't go there specifically for that, though). A good hotel for a good price. The room was clean, we had a view of the Wynn/Encore, and our check-in was quick. One of the best reasons to stay here is monorail access. It's right out back, and it'll take you all the way to MGM Grand. If you're looking for a good deal and a good place to sleep, this is your best bet.

Reviews.Title: “Stress Free”
Reviews.Author: Felipe G
Reviews.Content: We always stayed at Las Vegas Hilton every time we visit my son in Las Vegas.The service is is very good what else can you ask.

Reviews.Title: “Try somewhere else first.”
Reviews.Author: KanDwb
Reviews.Content: Stayed for my daughters wedding in November. We had a group of about 40 staying at the hotel. Rooms were not ready on arrival for any of us. We were early, but even when they would give us a time that our rooms would be ready by they were not and extended their projection multiple times. It took 5-7 hours for us to get rooms. All of which were spread out over multiple floors and towers. When we were finally given a room that was ready the beds were not made, the old sheets still on them. Towels in the tub. Room had not been turned over from prior guests. We were able to move rooms but it was from a newly remodeled room to an older one that was pretty dank. (Later that night we learned that they had tried to put another person in our party into the gross room before it had been turned over as well. Really people?) Aside from the wedding coordinators we didn't run into any staff at the hotel who were polite or even seemed to care. They even charged the bride and groom to pick up a gift bottle of wine ($10 at the business center, because they refused to deliver it to the room). If you have any other options to stay elsewhere it Vegas take it! The Hilton is not worth your time.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Stacy7201
Reviews.Content: I stay here several times a year for work. It's off the strip but attached to the monorail. It's quieter which is nice for work. The service is always wonderful and the rates are really reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Lack Luster”
Reviews.Author: NomadKBB
Reviews.Content: Heavy dust around the room perimeter, baseball sized hole in the wall under vanity, plumbing under the vanity would leaak on my feet while brushing my teeth and shaving, one of my clean towels in rack had blood stains when unfolded, live crickets on the wall in my room, broken shower curtain bar, bottle caps and other pieces on the floor when I checked in, temp. control was very difficult - either to hot or to cold - restaurant options very limited in terms of price point, Cantina Bar that serves limited mexician food served on plastic plates and plastic cutlery, chicken in the taco was still on the bone. Need I go on?!!!

Reviews.Title: “Repeat visitor”
Reviews.Author: Tim H
Reviews.Content: Nice off strip location, monorail rocks but can add up and drops to rear of other strip casinos. Desk staff really has issues and complicated check in / ? time consuming. Arrive with disabled person and they have no clue of room layout or grab bar accomdations other that they exist. If half of ones body does not work it kinda important. This has happened more than once. Had to go to several rooms for a match. They attempt to accomodate but really dont get it. There only accomodation was sending a crappy fruit bowl. I was pretty mad and ready to leave day one, not a great way to start out. They have Sav-more car rental in house, mobility scooters too. They had an acceptabe spa that I enjoy but might not meet others standards. Big pool as seen in many pictures. Sports bar has 24 hr sandwich type food. Tres rios cantina has specials nacho, margaritas etc. The views are golf, loading dock and strip from a far. The north tower elevator takes forever and has dirty windows. Surface and garage parking available. Some staff are nice and very helpful, the woman weekdays at the bell desk is definetly NOT...I am supposed to return in July but with all the changes am thinking twice, I really enjoyed my past experience but feel the time may have unfortunatley come and gone, pretty sad. !

Reviews.Title: “Hilton Buffet”
Reviews.Author: SecretBeer
Reviews.Content: During my visit to las Vegas, I decided to try a number of different buffets near my hotel location. I tried the Monte Carlo which did not serve any sea food and most of the food had little to no taste. The servers at the Monte Carlo could use an attitude refresher course and smile more. I didn't enjoy my experience. The next day I ate at the MGM Grand and according to the sign out front they were supposed to open at a certain time. when they finally opened the line it was 25 minutes past their posted time. and, it took 20 minutes to be seated to due a large crowd. The food was alright but not worth the asking price. Overall not impressed. The following day I decided to purchase a monorail pass to visit other hotels not in walking distance with my first stop being the Las Vegas Hilton. The Hilton buffet is located next to the Hilton Sports area which is nice of you have to stand in a line. This will not be the case as I ate there three times after my first. experience. The Hilton Buffet has a large selection of grilled veggie, meats, seafood, pasta and deserts. I had to convince myself to leave. The waitresses were friendly but only 1 of the 3 times I visited. The food made up for it. And because the hotel is off the strip there isn't a crowd. I would suggest eating at the Las Vegas Hilton..

Reviews.Title: “No wonder Hilton is taking their name off the Hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: Paul H
Reviews.Content: The quality has gone down the tubes on this property. We have stayed there at least 20 times in the past, and it has been great. I understand in January 2012 it will be known as the LVH- Las Vegas Hotel. Perhaps, our most recent experience is why Hilton is pulling its name off. The room had (2) pillows and (1) in the closet, for a total of (3) pillows? We stayed for 5 days, and each of the days we were informed there were no extra pillows, but there was a waiting list. Mind you, we paid the "resort room upgrade" price. As we were going for my 40th birthday, we booked (2) rooms, but just before leaving my mother in law suffered an injury and could not go. I was informed that cancellation would be no problem. Well, the problem is that I got 1/2 refund and the other 1/2 will take 4-6 weeks to receive??? I didn't pay in 2 installments, why is my refund spread over 6 weeks?!? We had a purse taken from the room, and not wanting to accuse anyone, I chalked it up to being misplaced. After personally scouring the car, and all suitcases, I can say-Yup, it was taken from the room. Sink had no hot water, but we "made due" with the hot water in the shower. Sad day to see what was a nice property turn into what it has.

Reviews.Title: “Great Housekeeping!”
Reviews.Author: Gigglynay
Reviews.Content: There was a group of 8 of us (girls weekend) staying in two connecting double bedded rooms, and housekeeping did a phenomenal job! It is true the Hilton Las Vegas is a little off the beaten path (but we didn’t mind as it is so easy to take a cab, or the monorail isn’t too far if you want to do something less expensive) and the rooms are a little “run down”, but the rooms are ok. The amenities in the rooms are ok as well. But the nice part is the rooms were really clean and even with 8 girls all weekend in two rooms the housekeepers did such a great job replenishing towels and amenities and keeping the rooms clean! We did eat at their restaurant Paradise Café for breakfast on both mornings… the first day the service was pretty good, however the second day it was terrible, it took over 20 minutes just to get water and an hour and a half to get our food. The manager of the restaurant was nice about it and apologized and gave us 25% off our bill for the inconvenience.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms in Central Tower are Run Down”
Reviews.Author: Jeff_MN
Reviews.Content: Tiles falling off of shower walls; TV service in the room that is worse than the basic cable service in a small town (no ESPN or other real cable channels); Charges for EVERYTHING like $3 to print boarding passes for air travel and the concierge would not assist with shuttle service. It is a good location for convention center business but the hotel just "phones it in" whenn it comes to providing customer service and amenities. Automated check out service on the room TV was broken. Sorry, the Hilton is only interested in collecting your money and if they offer to let you stay in the vacation time share property, take it. The vacation property on the strip is miles better than the main hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A Suite that's not so sweet”
Reviews.Author: James S
Reviews.Content: This was my 2nd stay at this Hilton Hotel. Both times were in a corner suite with a view of the strip. My first stay was almost 8 years ago when I attended a Star Trek Themed wedding. This trip, I stayed in suite 23-138. Comparing this stay to my last stay, I can honestly say that these hotel rooms are a bit run down. As soon as I took my first steps into the room, I stepped on a loose tile and it "popped" up, causing me to stumble. The shower dripped, and required herculean strength to turn the handle to stop the dripping. The cold water faucet handle was also extremely stiff. The motorized window shades have been removed, not all the bulbs were working, and the radio/clock was broken. Of all this, the only thing that was truly serious was the loose tile. Actually, there were loose tiles all over the entry and into the bathroom. However, the one at the entrance actually "pops up" when you step on the corner of the tile. I informed the day manager of these issue and she said that they will be resolved before I get back after tonight's show (10pm). I returned to my room at 1am. When I walked in, that tile "popped up" again and I almost fell on my face. It caused a scratch on one of my leather dress shoe. The next day (checkout) I spoke with another manager, and they were very apologetic. I would never ask for compensation. I leave it to the business to determine if they feel that it may be appropriate to compensate me for my loss, my ruined stay, or anything. I feel that it is a testament to their willingness to show true Customer Service. However, after all that I've been through, they never offered to reduce or refund any portion of my room cost (which was $300), replace my shoes ($200), or even offer me a complementary meal. I was truly disappointed in this. I like the Hilton family of hotels and resorts. However, I seriously doubt that I will ever return to the Las Vegas Hilton, and will seriously think about returning to ANY Hilton hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A little tired...”
Reviews.Author: brucejkirch
Reviews.Content: This was my first visit to the Las Vegas Hilton. I have been in many of the newer casinos but a great rate and my Diamond Status made me give it a try. Well, my non-smoking room, rreked of old smoke. The towels, the bedding evrything ! yuch! Even know the room was designated a non-smoking room with a big fine if you did smoke. The buffet (inc as a gold or diamond member) was great! And the weekend it is a brunch with carving station. Really, great, even if I would have had to pay the 20 bucks The advertised "state of the art" gym, was a bunch of old loud machines crammed into a very small room. Quite noisy and unacceptable. The monorail is very easy to use and takes you to the heart of the strip. A big plus

Reviews.Title: “Great place for conference and easy connect to strip”
Reviews.Author: Wish2travel2
Reviews.Content: Excellent location to attend a conference. Rooms are nice. Easy access to strip with tram. Fods a little pricy no matter where you eat but found buffet was most cost effective at $20.00 on average.

Reviews.Title: “Great location near monorail so easy to get to strip.”
Reviews.Author: Mich77c
Reviews.Content: Rooms were bigger than expected with good views from the north tower. They were clean and well kept. Staff were helpful, we needed more towels and blankets, they were quickly brought. Located just off the strip but had a Monorail station located at the hotel. Making it very easy to get around the Strip and not having to worry about parking. Parking at the hotel is free. Reasonable priced per night. Has a glass elovator that gives you great views daytime and night. Only down point was the lack of quick affordable dining in hotel only one chose.

Reviews.Title: “Best place to stay for food,funroom and spas loved it”
Reviews.Author: patsyp77
Reviews.Content: Everyone was fabulous. I always stay here. Las Vegas Hilton has been my hotel of choice for morethan 15 years. It never disappointed me.

Reviews.Title: “Never been to a hilton so gross!”
Reviews.Author: Lena C
Reviews.Content: I will never stay at this hotel anymore. I atayed here a few times before and we had great rooms, this time was not the same at all. The first room they put us in had light collored carpet that was covered in brown stains and had cigeret burns in the carpet, I called down and they moved us to a new room but still in the same tour and I was still not impressed, it was less about the fact the rooms were both old and aout dated and more about the fact they were dirty. Even the second room had dirty light fixtures, durty walls and windows. Had it not been late I would have left but after changing rooms and dealing with the front desk staff that did not care about the rooms condition we gave up as it was only an overnight stay. My guess is because we go the room for cheap that they put us in an old crappy room, but the fact is there were 10 hotles on the strip with rooms for less we stayed at the Hiliton because of the brand name, I have stayed a many hilitons and have never seen such a dirty hotel. The did not have a resort fee that many hotles did but they charge u if u want to do anything in the hotlel, internet wifi was 14 a day! I will not be staying here anymore, I would have rather payed 1/2 tthe proce and stayed in a hotle that I had less expectations for. After my second trip to the desk I heard them offering other people room upgradeds so clearly they had better rooms for a higher priced, but after my second complaint they never offered my an upgraded even for a fee, guess my husband and I did not look like we could afford a nice room!

Reviews.Title: “Good value weekend in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: NeilHa
Reviews.Content: I used the Hilton for a weekend stay-over whilst visiting Vegas in Sept 2011. Weekend charges are high in Vegas but the Hilton offers great value, albeit a little out of the way fro The Strip. But this was fine for me as I was moving to the Treasure Island for the rest of my stay. The Hilton's rooms are massive, even by Vegas standards, though they are looking a bit dated having stayed here about 5 years before and there was little evidence of any refurbishment. Check-in was delay free and the communal areas were bright and airy. The swimming pool area was clean and tidy and plenty of waitresses to take orders, and the cost of drinks and cocktails particularly, was very reasonable compared to those on The Strip. Most people gain access to The Strip using the monorail, but this can prove expensive if used frequently so I walked down the road (turn right out of the hotel) to get the Deuce bus near The Stratosphere Hotel. This also gave access to Downtown - a must do whilst in Vegas! Overall, a great value stay in Vegas, especially their weekend rates!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable Time”
Reviews.Author: LovesToTravel2_11
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews prior to our stay, I was a little worried about our long awaited trip; 4 nights Thanksgiving weekend. We reserved 3 rooms and got off to a bumpy start. One of our reservations was cancelled for unknown reasons, however the front desk was able to reinstate it at the original price (lots of rooms available). Be aware and take your confirmation sheet with you as proof of a reservation. All our rooms were excellent, the housekeeping staff was prompt and professional. We were on the resort level and with our 'gold' key had access to the club room, were snacks, fruit, cookies and drinks (juice, water, wine, beer, champagne) flowed appropriately. The exercise room has plenty of equipment. The SPA worked for me, the staff again was well trained and attentive. Unfortunately the steam room (missing part) and one jacuzzi were out of order. Available was one jacuzzi and dry sauna, large showers, lots of fluffy towels, well lit dressing area, and clean bathrooms. The buffet (selection and taste) was a dissapointment but the staff was good.

Reviews.Title: “Reward Stay - They just don't care”
Reviews.Author: JackRI
Reviews.Content: Asked for and received an upgrade... To a room with a view of parking garages and air vents. And with a shower that does not work. Complained about the shower. No consideration. It is very clear why this place is loosing its Hilton affiliation. I would have preferred to have heard that from Hilton though. Don't stay here if you have to pay out of pocket.

Reviews.Title: “Still OK BUT!”
Reviews.Author: Finchale
Reviews.Content: Visited Las Vegas Hilton middle of November 2011. I was quite concerned after reading several reviews. We paid VERY little money for our 10 night stay . We were offered an upgrade as we checked in for very little extra money and I must admit the room/ bathroom were excellent , modern and very clean. Ate in the hotel about 50% of the time at either at the buffet or Paradise Cafe. Food was fine in the Paradise Cafe and staff were very good BUT over a few nights I noticed some people waited more time than they should have to receive their orders. One night a party of 6 left before ordering they got fedup waiting. Buffet still had plenty of selection BUT at least 1 night the hot food was not hot, only luke warm. It was better the next night. And now onto the public areas . Clean BUT glasses left outside rooms for 2 days, Glass with spilt drink left in the lift for 12 hours , it was eventually moved. Stairs not cleaned for 2 or 3 days If the rate was cheap enough we might stay there again but only for 2 or 3 days. It has lost the 'crisp' quality it once had. To few staff to maintain the once excellent standards. Typical 3 star hotel standard. I understand now why how it is about to lose the Hilton brand.

Reviews.Title: “Not so bad on business or on a moderate budget”
Reviews.Author: materielgrrl
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Hilton at least 3 times in the last two years mostly for business and overall this is a pretty good hotel. My room has always been clean, updated, with a comfortable bed and pretty decent bath. I'm sure there are rooms that will give you the view of the strip from right off one block, here on government business I get the non-strip view; and that's okay. The back view is a view of the beautiful French (aka Sunrise) mountain. It was here at the Hilton I discovered how beautiful the view of the mountains are around this town. When I have to stay here, I beg for a mountain view and I keep the drapes open so I can get a view of the cloud, smog, sunlight, around the mountain from sunset to sunrise each day. Back to the Hilton, again the rooms are nice, not huge but they've definitely done them over. I've used the spa services at the Hilton and I have to say the staff of masseuses are very skilled; I'm sorry to find out that Luther retired but the other staff do a great job. The whirlpool area is basic; nothing fancy like the Mandalay or other hotels I've stayed at, but the tubs function like they are supposed to. The spa staff are always nice and pleasant, the gym is small but functional. I've also used their salon services, the esthetician on staff did a great job in taking care of my needs when I needed. I've eaten at the restaurants there, the Hilton does a good job of making sure there are good places to dine, no complaints. Also when I was there for vacation, they offered me a club access package for @ $40 a day. I took advantage of it, with small variety of breakfast food, but most important a selection of beer, wine (including a sparking wine) in the early evening, I figured I'd spend that and more each day especially with the cost of booze. I learned about this from the front desk staff who checked me in; I appreciate that they are pleasant and tell you about offers the hotel has during your stay. I've been spoiled at other hotels in Vegas, but if I have to keep coming here for business, I'm fine with the Hilton, I am treated very well, plus I get some more of those points I love to collect traveling and staying within their chain.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms Need to be Updated”
Reviews.Author: MTravelerI
Reviews.Content: OK place, but the rooms (especially the bathrooms) need to be updated. Kind of an odd mix within the room.......new, large flat screen tv, nice bed & bedding, but old worn towels and a moldly shower. Advised the front desk upon check-out, but the clerk either didn't care or had heard it so many time it didn't phase him. No better location for visiting the LV Convention Center.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, great sportsbook”
Reviews.Author: mattyboy81
Reviews.Content: I went with a friend of mine wanting to go do some sports gambling. I read somewhere that the Hilton had the best sports book. They couldn't have been more right. I've stayed at the MGM, Bellagio, and TI, and this had the best sports book. Drinks seemed free if you were betting, and the servers were friendly and came quite often. We were there on a Saturday and Sunday, but they still managed to come by often enough. They had a non smoking section which was nice, with confortable chairs. The people placing the sports bets were patient with me, as this was my first time betting. The table dealers also seemed friendly. This hotel is NOT on the strip, so it's not quite as crowded as hotels on the strip, and the rooms were spacious and clean. All in all, a fun stay!

Reviews.Title: “Stay Away! I spent 1 night at the Hilton, then 4 nights in the hospital!”
Reviews.Author: JBridi
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the LV Hilton in October for a business convention. After being in my room for only a couple of hours I took a nap and got a spider bite. The next day the bite was so bad I ended up in Urgent Care, ER, and then a 5 day hospital stay. I was on heavy pain killers (dilaudin) and antibiotic drip for the entire time. When I notified the hotel they took no responsibility and said their hotel is clean. They didn't even comp my 3 night stay, that I was never there for. Not even an apology. I have been a Hilton chain customer for about 13 years. I will never stay in one of their properties again!

Reviews.Title: “Return Trip”
Reviews.Author: HobNob35
Reviews.Content: We recently returned from our 5th stay at the Las Vegas Hilton. Check in was a breeze and our room on th 27th floor met all our needs. We make a yearly trip to Vegas and have been so satisfied with the accomendations at the Hilton that we don't find a need to look else where. They have an amazing buffet which is free for breakfast if you are a Hilton diamond member and the handy monorail stop right outside the hotel makes it easy to get to the strip. My biggest complaint is that there is no coffee maker in the room and at $4 a cup, it gets a bit pricey - but then we are in Vegas aren't we? We haven't taken advantage of any of the shows there and there are better casinos, but we like it and will no doubt return next year.

Reviews.Title: “Why are you charging me for fitness center and wifi?”
Reviews.Author: Up4Anything76
Reviews.Content: Two friends and I went to Vegas for one of the girl's birthdays. It was her and my first time to Vegas and we were all on a budget. Although we knew the Hilton wasn't going to be like the hotels on the strip, we weren't too bothered b/c we knew we wouldn't be in the room or even at the hotel much. We actually picked it b/c the monorail to the strip has a stop there. The room was average. Clean for the most part. No fridge, no microwave, none of that, even though it purports to be for business travelers. The casino and bars were also average. Again, we were on a budget and so weren't expecting it to be a VIP type getaway. But here is my problem with the Hilton- you pay $15 for wifi A DAY and $20 A DAY to use the fitness center. Why are they still charging for wifi? I can go to the La Quinta here in Little Rock and get free wifi at a room rate of $50 a night. So I expect it for free from any hotel in a place like Vegas. You can't tell me the hotel isn't making enough money to cover this. I'm also a huge workout junkie and find it necessary after indulging in places like Vegas to get at least one good sweat in. The rate to use the fitness center (and I use that term loosely) was $20 a day. You could get a "deal" on two days for $36. I decided one workout would be acceptable for the 3 day trip, paid my $20 and entered a room that was literally no larger than the room my friends and I were staying in. It was packed full of average equipment so there was barely room to move around. Add to it the 12 people that were in there already and you have a hot, cramped space where no one is having a good workout. WTF Hilton? I have to call BS on your fee and your description of this room as a "fitness center". So, if you want a workout and are a guest at the Hilton, I say skip the hotel, take a run outside or find a local gym that you can use for the day at a similar or cheaper rate. Like one poster has stated, know what to expect when you go there and you probably won't be disappointed. It is a good rate for the room and access to the monorail, but that is about it. Use your smartphone to get your internet fix and don't bother with the fitness room.

Reviews.Title: “Front desk had a bad day....”
Reviews.Author: Jonathan M
Reviews.Content: Checked in once....first "Grand Room" had a refrigerator larger than our bed. Looked like my daughter's twin bed at home....I thought we left the kids at home? We were moved to the "only" king room available which was a "smoking room." Sat in there for about 5 minutes and got a contact high. The room was noted to be "seldom used for smoking." I looked for the "seldom used meter" and noticed it had burned up. Third call to front desk and Julie from "I'm Niceville" answered the phone. Amazing how they miraculously had a non-smoking king room become available. We were given a key and moved rooms for the third time. The third room wasn't the Wynn but it would work......I had made plans to move across town to the Aria if this third and final straw went up in smoke! Review of room.... 1) Apparently they think a broken couch won't go noticed.... 2) It wasn't the coffee that woke us up....it was the carpet pulling back from the spikes stabbing me in the foot that woke us up......I think I ruined three or four pairs of socks! 3) The bed has more dimples in it than the poor girl on the Proactive commercials! 4) The closed captioning on the TV never worked consistently.....i watched every show with it on! AUGHHHHHHH!!!!! 5) The bathroom sink handles were broke... 6) When you flushed the toilet the bathroom sink burped every time......weird! 7) The shower head leaked.......for this reason I left the A/C on high to ground out the noise.....If they could've let me know this was gonna happen I would've brought my 2 year old's sound machine! 8) Really, I got to number 8? Sorry Hilton......you are overrated.......I'll be staying at the Wynn next time.....

Reviews.Title: “We received VIP service!”
Reviews.Author: Vonnie O
Reviews.Content: We reserved a very lovely 28th floor suite for a welcome reception for both families the night before our son's wedding. We received every assistance even though the hotel was very full. The view was breathtaking, beds very comfortable, everything clean. We had planned to move to a much less expensive room for our second night, but we realized it would be dreadfully inconvenient and asked if there might be any way we could stay in the suite. Not only did the hotel staff accommodate us, but they allowed us to stay in the suite the second night at the same rate we had paid for the basic room we had reserved. Their courtesy made our son's wedding day so much easier for us, and we were immensely relieved and grateful.

Reviews.Title: “Highly disapointed”
Reviews.Author: Jenni M
Reviews.Content: I stayed here over this past weekend 11/11-11/13 to attend my best friends wedding. I made my reservations in advance knowing that the weekend had a major event, and would be very busy. I reserved a queen non-smoking, and paid a night in advance. After a long 5 hour drive I arrived to find out that my "requested" 2 double bed non smoking was no longer available. After correcting my reservation it was quickly found out that they no longer had any non-smoking rooms, because they had over booked the weekend. I was offered an "upgraded" smoking room. I inquired if the upgrade was complimentary, and was told no they couldn't do that.It was then vaguely explained that due to the weekend there would be a hold on the charges on my boyfriends card. Had no idea what they meant, but said ok. We arrived in the new room that smelled like an ashtray with two small double beds. My boyfriend is 6'6, and a little double doesn't really work. Called the front desk that found us a queen smoking room in just a few seconds. Room still smelled bad, but we were ready to start the weekend. My BF checked his bank account, and found he was charged double the amount for the night of the room. Confused we inquired at the front desk. Turns out if you use a debit/credit they hit your card with a $50 a night charge for any misc. room charges, but will reverse those charges once you check out. The explanation "Yeah it's stupid, but the hotel doesn't want to get ripped off". As people traveling with a moderate budget this caused us a lot of stress. Housekeeping NEVER cleaned our room. On check out we were informed we had a balance. Obviously confused I asked for an explanation, and was met with a very curt response. I wrote them a letter of complaint with no response as of yet. They really need to learn how to communicate to the clients. I suppose the weird explanation that the charges would be held for the weekend was their way of telling us about the $50 hold, but that wasn't good enough. I picked them due to what seemed like reasonable rates, but now realize they have hidden fees. I left feeling stressed out, uncomfortable, and smelled like I smoked 20 packs of cigarettes. Next time I will spend the extra money at another hotel to have a higher level of customer service. I feel like they took advantage of a stressful situation. Oh and as a bonus they never reversed the additional charges, and my BF is on the phone fighting to get this money back right now.

Reviews.Title: “Outdated, expensive and needs a facelift”
Reviews.Author: Michael S
Reviews.Content: Just stayed at the Hilton 11/10-14 and I have to say I was disappointed with the hotel. The rooms are old and outdated. The shower is horrendous. The main air filter in the ceiling looks like it hasn't been changed in over a year. The restaurants are expensive and the food is just ok. The only good thing about the place is the sports book. The number of screens and their size are impressive. The downside is that the cocktail waitresses came through about once an hour (if you were lucky and tip well). The hotel obviously doesn't respect the betters and doesn't provide the service you would expect when laying down some $$ on the games. The crowd there is a mixed bunch of betters, tourists and some mental patients. I will most likely not be staying there again. I would prefer a smaller book in a better hotel for a cheaper rate.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised!”
Reviews.Author: Mamarude
Reviews.Content: We approached the check in desk with some trepidation after reading the reviews here on trip advisor, and were ticked when the king size premium non smoking room we had ordered was not available. (There was a Marine ball at the hotel the night we arrived). The first night we ended up with 2 full size bed, not what we wanted for a getaway weekend sans children. She did promise to upgrade us the next morning, and we were surprised to find that we were moved at 9 am to the room we had reserved, so all was well. The rooms were perfectly adequate, bigger than the rooms we've stayed at in Monte Carlo and had upgraded toiletries and a large bathtub that I loved. The tv was flatscreen but not too many channels, and it was nice to have use of a refrigerator in the room. Our package included quite a few bonuses, including the use of the spa for one day and that was a wonderful experience! The spa was lovely, use of robes and slippers, sauna, steam room, and hot tubs. They had fruit, tea, juices, and bottled water and it was a lovely facility. We also got free buffet passes, it was fine, nothing special. Not a good place to eat if you are on a gluten free diet, but they did have made to order omelets and bacon so I had plenty to eat. Mimosas were included on the weekend. We did have a rental car but chose to use the monorail and found that to be convenient. Wish it had a few more stops, be prepared to walk to wherever you're going, but you'd be walking if you parked at most of the hotels anyhow. The casino was pretty fun, we even won a bit. Since it was off strip, it was quieter and we slept better. Easy drive to downtown to enjoy the Fremont Street Experience.

Reviews.Title: “wifi”
Reviews.Author: dlomangino
Reviews.Content: I was forced to stay "again" at the LV Hilton due to a meeting. Get with the times -- it's like TP and air -- to pay $13.99 a day for wifi is outrageous! When Wifi is free it gives you a good feeling about the hotel And, to charge for a Boarding Pass!! Oh, and you have to pay extra to have your room cleaned every day/

Reviews.Title: “Dirty Rug”
Reviews.Author: Kathy149
Reviews.Content: The staff was friendly and the food was good, but the room was a dump. The rug had big black stains all over it. Room 1434 Central Tower. Old furniture, cracked pink tile, would not come back. I took a higher price room thought it would be nicer, boy was I wrong.

Reviews.Title: “Find somewhere else to stay!”
Reviews.Author: CrazyBooey
Reviews.Content: It's a good thing this was free. A friend and I had two rooms booked with Hilton points. Arrived and they could not find the second reservation.
