Even though we had the emails with the confirmation numbers, they basically said it wasn't their problem, it was the Hilton Honors problem, and we had one room instead of 2. The room shower was terrible, housekeeping would sometimes not leave towels, and the ones they did leave had hair. Would NEVER stay here if I was paying for it. Hilton FAIL.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel away from the strip, but bring your own coffee pot!”
Reviews.Author: suzdog
Reviews.Content: Everyone was very welcoming, nice and helpful at this hotel (well, except for the Concierge staff). It was like pulling teeth to get the concierge people to share information. We had a room on the 3rd floor with a great lanai to step outside. I'm not sure if this was a remodeled room, but I'm guessing not because I could feel the cold when standing at the aluminium sliding glass door. However, two of my three 'musts' were met: The room was quiet, the bed was VERY comfortable, but - and this is the first time this has ever happened to me - there was no coffee pot in the room! They were going to charge $40 to have a pot in my room, and had we stayed longer I would have done it. It's not my favorite thing to go downstairs for coffee when I just rolled out of bed (and looked like it). I came with my 90 year old mom, and the hotel did offer wheelchairs for free to use, which was a great perk. However, if you are not a Gold or Diamond member, the extras will cost you. I believe it was $20 extra to use the fitness facility and around $14 for internet. Overall a comfortable place to stay away from the main strip, but had I not been a Diamond member, I'm not sure I would have stayed here due to the extra costs involved.

Reviews.Title: “Five enjoyable days”
Reviews.Author: geoff h
Reviews.Content: We stayed five nights in this hotel in October 2011, in the renovated North Tower. The hotel has every amenity you would expect in such a property. Having stayed for one night in the older section earlier in the month, the North Tower is the way to go, if available. The hotel is one block back from " the strip", but this has advantages. Traffic is not so hectic, the monorail goes right through the hotel, and the walk to the strip is down an open safe street. Parking at the Hilton is excellent. Easy access, good signs and proximity to the main building make vehicle use non stressful. We didnt use the gaming facilities, but the shows, restaurants and services were very good. We would recommend this hotel as good value for money and would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: craftyfoxmob
Reviews.Content: We stayed as a family at the Hilton and loved it. Terrific rooms, great restaurants and its a surprisingly good location at the end of the strip but well connected by the mono rail.

Reviews.Title: “Price and value still the best in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Dirk W
Reviews.Content: Even the hotel rooms are old fashioned and the bath rooms completely old and damaged the rooms are really huge. Be careful sometimes the doors don't like to lock well. Once we came back to the room and the housekeeping didn't close the door correct. A call to the security and a check up together, everything was still there, the safe of the room untouched, so all in all nothing to complaint. Compared with other hotels you do not need to walk kilometers and the check in is much faster than with all the other hotels at the strip. The hotel takes better care of wheelchair bound people than any other hotel at the strip area. The coffee shop and bakery is much cheaper than in any other luxurious hotels and the restaurant landscape is great. The Chinese Restaurant has a fabulous flair, the Steakhouse offers Steak which are so huge that you can't eat them and the best entertainment you definitely get when dining in the Benihana Steak House. It's not only great food it is great fun too. The chef is fixing your food at the table and telling you jokes and stories, it is also artistic, never had so much fun like that night. Gambling in the casino is also fun as it is not as full as in the other places and the choices are great too. The Hotel is connected to the Mono Rail Station. We had our new years eve and christmas there and we were really happy with our choice. When going back to Vegas the Las Vegas Hilton would still be one of my choices. As the flair of Liberace and Elvis and their spirits are still in this great place.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: vykena w
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed this stay lovely big room.Very nice staff members. great pool. breakfast lovely omelets cooked as u like . Will stay again. Also big lcd tv

Reviews.Title: “Not on the strip, on monorail”
Reviews.Author: hollydancer
Reviews.Content: My BF and i have now stayed at this Hilton twice, the first time being New Year's Eve 2010 into January 2011, and just last week (November 2011). Both times, we had nice rooms that were clean, had good bathrooms, very comfortable bed, and good amenities. Is it the fanciest hotel i've ever stayed in? No. But i must disagree with other reviewers who didn't like it. (I am also a Hilton HHonors member and have stayed in Hiltons of all types on my travels.) The hotel is also running a promo that if you stay Thurs-Sat, you get Sun night free. I thought that was a pretty good deal. Check-in was fast and courteous. The breakfast buffet had a very good selection of typical breakfast foods like pancakes & french toast, as well as different kinds of sausage (regular & turkey), corned beef hash, requisite bacon, etc. It also had lots of fresh fruit, a complete salad bar, and many hot items. You could definitely have brunch with the variety. On weekends, brunch includes mimosas. We love the fact that the hotel is NOT on the strip; the metro (monorail) stops at the hotel, so you can get to the strip within five minutes but you don't have to deal with the partiers when you're ready to relax (this was definitely a bonus on NYE, but helped even on a non-holiday weekend). The monorail is in need of reupholstering, but it's a fast, good public transit for a reasonable price (get a two- or three-day pass if you stay at the Hilton). We did not eat at any of the fancy restaurants; just at the buffet and the sports/booking area sub shoppe. And had cookies from the coffee shop in the lobby - those are yummy. You can decline maid service and get a $10 voucher each day towards food anywhere in the hotel, so our subs, cookies & snacks were free just because we didn't need new towels every day. I applaud this program from a green/environmental viewpoint as well as having enjoyed the vouchers. Overall, after two stays at this Hilton, i can say with confidence that the BF and i would definitely stay here again should we return to Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “In need of refurbishment”
Reviews.Author: Beartowners
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed (October 2011) at the Las Vegas Hilton as part of a coach tour package. As a long standing Hilton Honors member we were pleased that the tour stayed there, but we were disappointed with the rooms that we had at the start and end of the tour. The rooms in general were in need of refurbishment and one room even had sellotape over the window seals. It would also seem that the hotel does not enforce the no smoking in the rooms as the room smelt of smoke and it kept coming back each night. We were impressed with the service of housekeeping in spraying the room. The breakfast buffet was very good and all staff that we had any dealings with were very helpful. Having stayed at many Hilton hotels world wide we have to say the rooms were the lowest standard of all. The hotel is also a few blocks away from the main strip and the other main attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms need updating, a three star rating,Restaurant service bad and had to wait a long time for the food.”
Reviews.Author: Sue_6883
Reviews.Content: We do not recommend this Hilton to anyone. We stayed at Hiltons all the time on our travels. We've always loved staying at Hilton's throughout the world. This is a three star or less Hilton.

Reviews.Title: “our recent stay”
Reviews.Author: rick w
Reviews.Content: to whom it may concern, my wife and I just returned home from spending two nights at your property. we were in Vegas to celebrate our 21st wedding anniversary and my 47th birthday. reservations were made October 5, 2011 and I received from you two emails confirming the registration on that day and then re-confirming the reservation on October 28, 2011. we arrived in Vegas the morning of November 4 last Friday and came to the hotel mid morning to let your clerks know we were in town understanding actual check in was after 3. we rented a car from savmor in your lobby so see some sights before returning. upon returning to check in around 5 ish, we were told that there were no rooms available for us (grand room) as reserved and reconfirmed. the solution we were offered was to maybe wait to see if we could get the room we reserved for Saturday night. left with no real choice we were downgraded on room at the appropriate rates but were stunned to see our reservation so flippantly disregarded. we have been coming to las Vegas for 22 years and have stayed in many different places, but this was our first and last stay at your property. the room was below average, out dated and the tile looked moldy. despite our disappointment with the room we tried to make the best of it paying for room service, spa service and gambling in your casino. upon check out I was asked how our stay was and I told your clerk we were very disappointed and just got a half hearted "oh" in response. I know you serve many people at your property and have been for a long time, I wanted to let you know in this case I feel we were treated poorly and we will share that with anyone who will listen.

Reviews.Title: “First visit to Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: CGriffiths
Reviews.Content: I'm a faithful Hilton Diamond member and always try to stay at Hilton properties. The lady at check-in was very nice, gave me an upgraded room, and the amenities we usually get as Hilton Diamond. The price was very inexpensive. However, the room and the hotel itself had a very tired look compared to most of the Hiltons I've stayed in. But what shocked me the most, was that call girls were offering their services to men walking by themselves right next to the East and North elevators. As I say, this is my first visit to Las Vegas and I'm not sure if this is a normal thing that happens in every hotel, but I honestly didn't expect this would happen at the Hilton and that security wouldn't do anything about it. To be honest, I wouldn't stay there again. The property is far from the strip and you have to take the monorail to get anywhere from there.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel is getting old”
Reviews.Author: t0winsto
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this Hotel for Lee's Wine Walk. We are local and didnt want to drink and drive. We paid $90 and we felt like we really over paid. We had two rooms, 1 for my wife and I, and 1 for the in laws. Of course the in laws room was right next to the elevator and it was pretty bad. They moved us upon request. Our room was nice, however, the bath room area had a cracked sink, lots of stains on the bath tub, and the hot water was inconsistent. It wasnt worth it for us to go down and complain since we got back to our room and found most of this out around midnight. Our friends stayed in a room and they asked to move rooms because it smelled like pot. As a local I dont like to write bad reviews for places in town, but this was pretty bad. I am sure not all the rooms are like this and we had some unique situations, but if you are coming to Vegas to stay, this hotel is not on the strip and it is getting old. Try another place.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: Transcend68
Reviews.Content: This hotel is clean, fun, off the strip and an overall good time. I like staying here because it is inexpensive and great quality. The casino is nice and the restaurants are good. Rooms are clean and the hotel is great. I would not stay anywhere else. This place has all that I need.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed many times, good if you get a cheap rate”
Reviews.Author: mpgyvr
Reviews.Content: I have stayed many times at the LV Hilton, each year for a convention which takes place in the hotel. Room: The rooms are decent, with good beds, but are certainly not as good as the newer hotels in LV. New flatscreen tv, nice work area. The bathroom was cramped, certainly would not want to try and share. The prices used to be almost $200 night for the rooms but last couple years have been under $100 which is an ok value. Facilitates: Like many hotels in LV you pay extra for just about everything from wifi access to exercise room access. I just don't use most as on a tight budget for travel. Food: There are a good selection of restaurants, but half the time i eat outside of the hotel being Vegas or I will grab a quick snack. The snack/coffee bar near the front desk is decent, but often a lineup and not a lot of seats. Location: The location is off the strip and a long way (by walking) from the main strip. However it is next door to the main convention centre so if you are attending a convention there it's convenient. Also the monorail is at the hotel, which does make getting to the strip somewhat easier. Like everything in LV, expect to do a lot of walking though! Gambling: The gambling area is one of the smallest around in a hotel it's size. But that can be seen as a blessing if you are not much of a gambler. You don't have to walk through miles of gambling area just to get to different parts of the hotel. They used to have the Star Trek experience rides and exhibit, which was fun, but unfortunately was closed years ago.

Reviews.Title: “Much Nicer Than Last Stay”
Reviews.Author: kiwisteve57
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 nights here starting Oct 27th/2011 and I admit I did not have high expectations after a 5 night stay in 2008. However this time I did pay for and receive a "Premium Room" and it was very nice. Recently renovated (according to the front desk),22nd floor.Very comfortable bed,high end linens,lots of room and geat maid service. Some other parts of the Hotel have changed very little since my last stay-the prices at the Paradise restaurant are ,I think,the same as 2008. A pleasant surprise! No resort fees and the pool area is very pleasant and NOT crowded.

Reviews.Title: “Hilton Hotel LV, Dont believe negative reviews !”
Reviews.Author: madhsesb
Reviews.Content: I had the pleasure of staying at the LV Hilton last weekend. Having read some of the negative reviews I did not have very high expectations. Let me tell you from the Valets to the Front Desk and room ( parlor suite ) I could not have been happier. Don't believe everything you read ! This was our first stay at this hotel and I would return for sure. The casino was not too busy which made it nice for gambling. We took the monorail up to the strip one night, 5 bucks each way, what a deal. Nice pool area with hot tub, really seemed like a more local crowd, everyone real friendly. Only negative was the buffet for dinner, I don't know if we were a little late but some items were a little picked over :( They did have plenty of oysters and shrimp though. I must acknowldge Chris at the front desk, He was so warm and friendly, great customer service ! If you want a nice hotel off the strip I would highly reccomend the Hilton

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Review”
Reviews.Author: Telemon_9
Reviews.Content: I have been to the Convention Center Hilton many times over the years starting back in the early 90's. The downward progression of the appearance of the property, the gaming experience, and the quality of the rooms has been disheartening. The last time I visited was in June on a business trip and the facility was just not up to par. Long check-in lines, low staffing, and visitors that bring coolers into checkout are just not something you expect from a Hilton property. The room was ok, but the carpet was dirty and there was a slight musty odor in the room. This may have been from the thousands of people that have stayed there, but it was not appealing. Food was decent in both the buffet area and the sushi restaurant, so there is a bright side. Unfortunately although I am a long time guest, I will be staying elsewhere in the future.

Reviews.Title: “disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Rod B
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my wife and 2 kids on a family vacation. I've stayed in Vegas many times over the years, including every January for the CES show. This time we wanted something nice but not too pricey. many of the hotels show wear and aren't maintained well and this is no exception. You can tell when the maid and maintence crews don't work to keep things clean and in good shape. 'sloppy repairs and poor maintenance (bathroom fixtures and sloppy patching and caulking work by maintenance, maids not cleaning behind the bathroom door or wiping fixtures, nor reporting problems they can easily see to mgt or maintenance. The clock radio was tricky, I'm a technical guy but couldn't figure how to set the time, and any maid could see it wasn't the correct time, not even within a few hours. Internet wasn't free, 'kinda lame. AC blows right onto the beds from a vent near the ceiling. Checking in was slow and though the clerk was polite, I didn't get the idea anyone was really concerned about people waiting nor how long we waited to check in. Convenient, good parking, and a good view from our room.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, though not on the Strip”
Reviews.Author: irishforevermom
Reviews.Content: We really liked the Las Vegas Hilton. Rooms were clean, spacious and very comfortable. We wanted a King bed and the desk clerk told us we might not want the one available, as it was on an upper floor, next to the elevator. We assumed that her warning of noise had to do with guests getting on and off the elevators. Don't get a room next to any elevators, as it sounds like you are next to a rollercoaster! The noise was definitely loud! The hotel is not on the strip, but they do have a monorail stop! We had breakfast at their buffet, and it was fantastic!

Reviews.Title: “Why the complaints?”
Reviews.Author: DAVID S
Reviews.Content: Was just there last week, if you don't want to spend $400/night and want great accommodations, real personal service, and one of the nicest classiest casinos in town than come on. No celeb chefs just great food in the restaurants..Not a place for a non gambler, but wonderful if you like to play, rest, eat good and enjoy yourself!

Reviews.Title: “Good option off strip”
Reviews.Author: jsolt
Reviews.Content: Used this hotel quite often when in Las Vegas due to special rates and attactive packages. However, this Hilton is not brand new, but we found our Grand room, which we got as an upgrade from reception clean and comfortable. The pool area is also attractive as well as the fitness center which is free of charge for Hilton Honors Silver members and higher. The only restaurant we used was the buffet for dinner, which was good. Parking is free, internet is $13,95 per day, which is not state of the art in these days. Strip is an easy ride with the pricey monorail or by car as plenty of parking garages are free of charge there as well. If the rate is right, good value for money

Reviews.Title: “This is a Hilton?”
Reviews.Author: FlyingSiren
Reviews.Content: This is the first Hilton I have ever stayed at and I have to say, I was expecting way more. The rooms were incredibly outdated and the room was nice-ish at best. I paid to stay at a high-end hotel and in Vegas, this isn't it. I could have paid a lot less and actually been on the strip instead of off it. If you want to be away from the hustle and bustle of the strip, this is a good place for you. The casino isn't very large inside and I can't comment on the restaurants because we didn't eat at any here. We were also asked to go to a timeshare meeting (which we did actually go to and were actually suckered into as well so I can't say what happens if you don't buy it) and got a limo ride and a couple hundred bucks to spend at our Hilton hotel before we left. Room cleanliness was average and the beds were comfy enough. Just not what I expected from a Hilton, I thought I'd be amazed by the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Vegas Hilton, Not what it used to be.”
Reviews.Author: Don S
Reviews.Content: I stayed here before and had a good experience so I thought one more time would be a good idea. I'll think twice next year. The main reason I choose this hotel was because of how close it was to the convention center and the mono rail was right outside the door. These were the two BEST features of this hotel. The check in was ok, be prepared to wait in a LONG line. I just couldn't understand why they have such a long font desk area and only 2 or 3 people working the desk at any one time. I had booked a King room and was told that they had no king rooms so they bumped me up to a Jr. Suite type of room. Same thing happened last year, so I was ok with, that is until I got to the room. After a LONG trek through the hotel I finally got to my room. It was at the end of the hall and it looked like it was designed to be part of a Double room set up, the other half of the room was across the hallway and there were a set of double door that could be closed to block it off from everyone else. The bed was a Murphy bed. Not bad, but not very comfortable. The room had a nice bar area and a pretty comfortable couch (more comfortable then the bed). The TV didn't work. Took three trips by maintenance to get it working. Even then, the remote didn't work the TV unless you were right in front of it. The shower leaked so bad that the carpet got soaked, I mean there was standing water on the carpet. The food was not that good. The buffet by the booking area was horrible. I've had better at Golden Corral. One afternoon, I wanted to take lunch up to my room without ordering room service. That was not a possibility. The food was WAY too expensive. So was the WiFi. $9.95 a day?? I had to have it for my work, so I forked it over. In a hotel like this, it should be free. Most other hotels of a lower class have free WiFi. Don't think about using the business center to print out anything, $2 per page for a black and white copy of my boarding pass. Print it out at the airport and save your self some money. Get to the airport early when you leave, the security lines are AWFUL!!!!! I don't know why they are so bad in Vegas, Atlanta is a much bigger airport and the security lines move twice as fast. The Casio area was old and out dated. I think it is the smallest of the major hotels in Vegas. The area where the Star Trek Experience used to be is still there and still decorated with a space theme. It's been gone for 3+ years, don't you think they would do something with the area, it looks like no one cares any more. That is the whole feel of the hotel, no one cares anymore and I think I know why. Found out that Hilton has sold the property to another company and the Hilton name will stay until the end of the year. Don't know much about the new owners but I hope they put some love and attention to the place. It has a great location in relation to the strip that you can walk there if you want, but far enough away where you don't get the noise and light. I know the economy is bad there, but there needs to be some work done to the area around the Hilton, just a bunch of empty parking lots. Pay a bit more and stay on the strip, better hotels, better food and better staff. At least they get the new owners in place and they make some changes. BIG TIP: If you take a taxi from the airport, tell the driver to take Paradise. It will save you some serious money. For some reason the drivers like to go the long way around to the Hilton.

Reviews.Title: “Great for convention!”
Reviews.Author: surfer143
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for a convention he was to present at. We stayed at the Venetian before so I prepared myself so as not to be disappointed...I knew this was not going to be as nice. It is further north on the strip, close to a lot of the older stuff. BUT. We were put in the new tower. Our room was great, clean, quiet, super efficient staff. With our hilton honors status, we had free access to the spa, which was really nice. It's not a colossal hotel like some of the more expensive monsters on the strip and it caters to an older crowd (more like grannies lol) but it is clean, has plenty of food choices, can get right on the train. The pool is nice, parking is free so can't beat that. The staff was very nice and polite on every occasion.

Reviews.Title: “Super outdated rooms”
Reviews.Author: Localdj77
Reviews.Content: You see the title. The rooms don't have any amenities that very cheap hotels typically have now a days. No outlets in convenient places close to the bed. Room ac/heater thermostat looks like American pickets found it somewhere and sold it to them to use. It does t work well either. Shower head pelts you with water. Worst of all no wifi!!! Seriously? I'd say this place is more of a 2.5 star. Clean...but that's about it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Sports Book!!”
Reviews.Author: FulshearTraveler
Reviews.Content: Visited the sports book on Sunday October 23rd. What a great place to be to bet on your favorite teams and interact with other fans. Cheap food and drinks. Had the theater set up to watch 7 to 8 games all at the same time. No smoking allowed in the theater and security was on hand to enforce the rule. I'll definitely go back for another weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Las Vegas Hilton - Wouldn't Stay Again”
Reviews.Author: Brian N
Reviews.Content: The service level was acceptable. My room seemed run-down and not updated very well. The shower didn't appear to have been updated at all. The shower head was way to low and the door to the bathroom was chipped at the bottom. Also, wall mounted hair drier didn't work so they left one on the shelf in the closet rather than fixing it. I could go on and on, however, the point is really that when you are a hotel in Vegas, you need to be on top of your game and the Las Vegas Hilton is not. Would not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “POOR”
Reviews.Author: ntlsc
Reviews.Content: I arrived at 230pm, the lines were way to long, was told my room wasn't ready and to come back in 2-3 hours, did that and was told my room still wasn't ready. did not get to my room until after 8pm room did not have a coffee pot, the shower was moldy, paint was chipping off the door the shower head was so low had to bend down to take my shower no fan in the bathroom, the charged $31 a day for wifi and they charged to much money for their food, beer and wine! would never stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel for a convention”
Reviews.Author: Carl W
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed while attending a convention. The property is well maintained, though a bit dated. We ate at the Paradise restaurant where the food was decent. Not a high end place but it has the monorail right there which can get you anywhere you want on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “very disappointed”
Reviews.Author: angeldgood
Reviews.Content: The first room we received had mole in the bathtub; the second room's carpet was so dirty I could see the spots before we turned the lights on. The third room was "upgraded" overall this room was ok except the major build up of lint and dust in the vent in the bathroom. Internet not included $14 a day. Overall the staff was friendly and helpful. We will never stay in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Off the Strip”
Reviews.Author: Travelinlady018
Reviews.Content: I stayed here because I was attending a conference next door at the Convention Center. The hotel itself is older and off the strip. I wouldn't have felt comfortable walking around by myself. However, it is easily assessible to the Monorail as it stops right at the hotel. The interior has be renovated, but the lobby has the low ceiling and the casino reminds me of "old Vegas" with all the crystals hanging down. Everthing was clean. My room was spotless and updated. I had a view towards the strip in the North Tower. However, I had to move rooms b/c of WET carpet and which only frustrasted me more, b/c I had waited over an hour for my room to be ready!! AFTER waiting in a line for 40 minutes. I was told the hotel was overbooked ( as usual). This was very frustrating! I was immediately comp'd for two meals. They do have nice "Go Green" plan where you can opt out of maid service and get a $10 voucher per day. Food in TJs and Benehanna (sp) was great! Their little diner...Paradise was pretty good as well. Definately a quiet hotel off the strip, but is very close to the action. Hotel itself is well maintained. NO FREE INTERNET!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice one bedroom suite”
Reviews.Author: tripsterSoCal
Reviews.Content: We stayed Oct. 22 and 23, 2011 in a one bedroom suite in the North Tower. It was outstanding - very spacious, clean, comfortable and luxurious with two bathrooms, a wet bar, dining table and plenty of comfortable seating as well as a comfortable bed. All the staff were very courteous. We used the valet parking which I highly recommend. The Buffet Restaurant had a huge selection of food and I was very happy that a coffee bar that served Starbuck's Coffee was also available in the hotel. The only complaint I have about the hotel is that the casino area is very smokey with cigarette smoke. But that's very common with most of the casinos. Some just have better ventilation. Otherwise, our stay was very enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “DONT GET MARRIED AT THEIR LA BELLA CHAPEL!”
Reviews.Author: 4Anthony
Reviews.Content: It was our first time in Vegas, so i searched the Internet for a nice chapel with an outdoor gazebo to get married. Before I begin, the hotel looked a bit run down but we only stepped inside the lobby, casino & lifts so I can't comment on the hotel room etc, only the chapel. We went to see the chapel after seeing the lovely gazebo pictures online, what got me was that you were given the cd of all the pictures taken, copyright released, which most places charge for. The girl was friendly & explained everything and it wasn't really expensive. Although you have to get married at night because behind the gazebo there is a wire fence and tatty looking scaffolding up! The girl told us the limo would pick us up out front at 6:30 & the wedding would be at 7. It was a good job there was just the two of us and our little girl because the limo driver didn't turn up and eventually found him at the wrong entrance at 7! I was stressed out of my mind, hot and flustered after running back and forth through the hotel looking for him!! We arrived late but everyone was really nice, the minister was exceptional! He really made it special. The photographer was helpful and we were in and out in 15 mins, which was nice as we didn't have any family or friends but we felt a bit rushed. We told the girl when booking that we were going back home 4 days after the ceremony so she said she would try and sort out that we had our pics to take home. We rang on Monday and we were rudely told that we didn't get any pictures with our package! This infuriated us as we knew we did, so we spent the next few hours waiting in the hotel room for a call back, which never came until a few hours later! Turns out we do get pictures but the email which contains the link to the pictures where we can choose didn't come through, we picked the cd up on tuesday and were told the link had been sent, although I knew we were being lied to and of course the email was still not there! The 'helpful' lady who booked it for us didn't say a word to us when we picked the cd up or even made eye contact with us, which was rude and awkward! Considering it is supposed to be the most important day of our lives it was ruined by the chasing and disagreements over the pictures and basic aftercare through customer service! The reason we chose to get married in Vegas is so it was easy and straight forward, although at the la bella chapel at the Hilton it certainly was not!

Reviews.Title: “Not a bad stay at the Hilton”
Reviews.Author: BMRosenberger
Reviews.Content: Stayed here again for the Indy car championship race Oct 2011, because of the players card offer that the hotel was having. Keith checked us in, and he was the best! Got us a nice room as requested, all with a smile and a helpful attitude! He really made the stay complete. In fact every employee we interacted at the hotel was friendly and professional. My only complaint was that the wine bar was (again) not functioning properly. We like to have a nice glass of wine, while watching the crowd go by, but just like last time the machine was not working. A small issue, didn't mar the trip like the events at the racetrack did, but it was disappointing. We pointed it out to the woman behind the counter who said it was our card, but when we pointed out that it worked on the white wine machine - she said she would get someone to look at it. It never got fixed, so we were stuck drinking just white wine. Oh, that and my players card did not work in the machines - I gambled a bit and I was too lazy to go get another card, so shame on me, but it was annoying that I have to get a new card every time I stay at their hotel. Once again, we went to the buffet as we got two free with the room deal, and were satisfied with the food. Not the greatest ever, but decent enough. They need to work on the deserts though - they look wonderful but I thought they were fairly tasteless. The bread pudding was pretty decent though! They are also still offering a $10 voucher for skipping room service - got another buffet out of the deal which really was nice. My recommendation, don't go in expecting too much and you will be pleasantly surprised! It is an older hotel, so if you want newer, hip style hotels stay at city center. If you are pleased to have a nice bed, good service and casino at your doorstep, then this will do.

Reviews.Title: “Dinosaur Fading into extinction...greatfully Not a Hilton in 2012”
Reviews.Author: SecretAgentReview
Reviews.Content: As a Hilton Hhonors member ive stayed here many, many times ONLY to get the ultra cheap rooms and points. Others do this as well. I do not recommend this hotel. Front desk "manager" known as "Junior" is the most unprofessional, rude and ignorant person Ive had to deal with personally or professionally. I was actually stunned by his ignorant attitude. Some employess are true gems, others the bottom of the barrel. Junior Salvator is an example of the latter and im sure has cost this place dearly. I have had friends and groups in town and have sent them elsewhere due to this ...person Granted its a faded glory BUT that solely due to Colony capitol the owners who had a unique licensing agreement with Hilton, which finally, they lost effective Jan 3 2012. Colony walked away from Resorts in Atlantic City and The AC Hilton, now the ACH, lost its franchise immediately and according to teh AC press hasnt paid taxes since 2009. This seems to be the way this company operates: Buy a property run it to the ground until teh bank takes over and declare bankruptcy. The rooms are old. Even the fantasy suites on the 29th floor feature ( drum roll) A VCR!! I miss the 80's but REALLY?? Rugs look like they just removed the police tape from the crime scene, dirty musty and old. bathrooms are surprisingly clean however. The halls are long , floors uneven and dark. SIGNAGE IS HORRIBLE you will never find you way without a guide. Spa is OLD SCHOOL which, if you like that, youll enjoy the experience. Gym is in the spa. There are separate male and femalespa areas. Great attendants and the manager "Carol" is a gem. Food: its bad but at least its expensive....... LVH is NOT a food destination. benihana is the best outlet but even that is very uneven. check in is amazingly slow- so slow its almost like a seinfeld skit, typing for minutes and minutes etc. Other properties are so fast. Bedding and towels are old. very old and surely the cheapest they could rent. Amenities are hilton standard however that will change in 2012. beds are cheap. Few furnishings in the room TV: Tired old box tvs and some rooms have plasmas BUT only a handful of channels and no HD which most properties have. Complains and problems fall on deaf ears. Its the only Hilton affiliated property that does not respond to emails when all you are trying to do is resolve an issue, which then in itself becomes and issue. Vip lounge has its gems... This access is given to Diamond members instead of the lounge floor upgrade or access as required under Hilton Hhonors program ( they have the resorts club level-named to avoid policy compliance, not worth the price) Parking is easy. Fast to get from car to room usually. Avoid sportsbook parking on sunday of course Sportsbook is giant and loud. Table games frequently have high minimums. Slots run from 1980 models to newer games. Players Card program went from bad to worse. Low payback and comp especially since the other properties have upgraded their programs. Many people have the same complaints over a long period which clearly shows the lack of ACTION from the property. Ive seen the innocous responses to some complaints posted here, but that "lip service" to alieviate the effect of the honest reviews. If you get a cheap rate, and need a place to stay...well... actually, there are many superior properties ( South point, Orleans etc) that offer superior product at a low price

Reviews.Title: “Good Value and Friendly”
Reviews.Author: grascots
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a trifle dated with an urgent need for a refurb. It does however have character and charm although it is a distance from the strip albeit serviced by the monorail. We found it tobe excellent value, nice large dated rooms and the pool area was thankfully quiet without the blaring music experienc ed in the MGM days earler. I would reccomend this hotel if on a budget but it is not luxurious by any standards.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed twice, going back for a third time next month.”
Reviews.Author: TravelMonster71
Reviews.Content: First off, I would probably rate the hotel at a 3.5 - Good. But there is only average and very good to choose from. It's above average, but probably not quite "very good". My husband and I stayed at Hilton twice over the last few years. The first time we stayed there because there was a conference at the Riviera that my husband was attending and the Hilton is close by. We got a great deal on an airline/hotel package. I believe it was under 600 dollars for both of us with airfare and a room for three nights. The second time we stayed for free. We got player cards and gambled a fair amount in their casino. We get offers all the time from them in the mail. We got another offer for 4 free nights, free show tickets and some free dining and we are going back next month. I guess to be fair, it's easier to give it a better review when we didn't spend anything on the room and got other free perks. Again, you do have to get a players card and gamble. We have stayed at many other casinos/hotels in Vegas ranging from Golden Nugget, Caesars, Terribles and the Palazzo. We do have a pretty good point of reference. Location: It is off the strip, but it is on the monorail. It's great because you walk right out of the casino and onto the monorail. Very convenient. I agree with some other reviews that it's easy access at Hilton, but getting to your next destination - the monorail station isn't always that close. Getting off at MGM Grand is kind of a hassle because MGM is huge and you have to walk through that place quite a ways to get out and over to NYNY or wherever you were wanting to go from that stop. Rooms: Rooms are good. They are huge and clean and just fine in my opinion. No - there is not a coffee maker. Why does everyone keep complaining about this? I haven't stayed at a place yet where they have those in the roooms. Hello - they want you to go to the casino floor level people! Maid servie seemed fine and I don't remember anything wrong with the room. Is it as fancy as a remodeled room at Caesars or a suite at the Palazzo? No, but there's nothing wrong with the rooms. Not the newest - but not anything to complain about. Dining: There are a ton of places to eat at here, which is good since it is kind of off by itself. We ate at Benihana, the Italian Restaturant and the buffett. Buffett - pretty standard. Benihana was good and the Italian place was fine. Even without a deal, I believe they always give you coupons at checkin for discounts off their restaturants. No - they don't have the celebrity chef restaturants there, but they also don't charge their prices either. I LOVE Delmonica - but I don't always feel like spending $200 dollars a night on food. Bars: We usually take advantage of the free drinks while we gamble, but we did go in Tres Rios - Vince Neil's bar. Margaritas were good and it had a fun atmosphere. I do remember the waitstaff being adequate, but acting a bit bored... BUT, we had fairly quick service. Pool: I really liked the pool. It was clean, big and not overcrowed. Enough said. Checkin: I think we've had a line both times we checked in, but it moved fairly fast. The desk clerk was always nice and polite. Casino: The casino seemed pretty big. Not as big as the huge hotels on the strip, but bigger than a downtown casino. It also is in the middle as far as slots. Again more selection than the smaller casinos - but it won't have every new machine like the newer, larger casinos will have. It will have a nice selection of old and new machines. Wait service is pretty good. We have found some "dead spots" on the floor before, but once you get a waitress and tip her well, she'll keep coming back. Sometimes we've even had them come back with more drinks without asking. Can't beat that! (yes I realize they are wanting you to sit and gamble longer, but we didn't mind) I guess we never stayed at Hilton during it's "prime years" when it was shiny and new, but we probably wouldn't pay the prices for a shiny new hotel to stay off the strip either. It's going to feel a bit older, not as much flash as some others, but it's solidly in the upper middle class of hotels in Vegas. If my opinion changes after our next trip, I'll be sure to post another review.

Reviews.Title: “LOOK ELSEWHERE”
Reviews.Author: LYNNETTE S
Reviews.Content: I have used the Hilton chain for a good part of my 3 month stay here and this was the worst. No invoice was provided to me and then when my credit card statement arrived, i questioned a long distance phone call which was made from my suite (I have a US cell phone) and did not use hotel phone and no offer of reimbursement was made. I was also charged for 4 days of internet usage and only signed up for 3. Buyer beware!

Reviews.Title: “Managers with attitudes”
Reviews.Author: RJ8814
Reviews.Content: I made reservations over 3 months ago. I waited in line for 45 minutes to find that my reservations were lost. I was given another room, but not until I realized that it was a lower grade room did they offer to refund me the difference. I was unhappy about the style of the room, so a manager by the name of Rodney stated to me with such an attitude "what do you want me to do". I paid for a nice room with a view and no smoking, and I got attitude . I was told by an employee that they over book reservations, and it is first come first serve. You can pay in advance but nothing is promised to you but attitude. Not happy at all.

Reviews.Title: “Good deal, monorail makes location ok”
Reviews.Author: oddtree
Reviews.Content: The Hilton is a nice hotel with all of the normal vegas amenities (casino, pool). It is $12 for a 24 hr monorail pass or a fairly cheap ($15ish) cab ride away from the heart of the strip, so I didn't find the location to be inconvenient at all. The off-strip location means there are often good deals to be had. I think we paid ~$90/night which was cheaper than what any other hotels were offering for the weekend we were there.

Reviews.Title: “Getting seedy. Have some pride, Hilton!”
Reviews.Author: SixthSister
Reviews.Content: The lobby and the casino look great, but the rest of this property is tired and seedy. My guest room in the Central Tower had received some cosmetic updates in the last few yeras (flat screen tv, crisp white linens) but the dusty popcorn ceiling, cracked bathroom tiles and chipped tub reveal the truth. Worst of all, the bathroom smelled strongly of mildewy towels - I think it was the shower curtain. I was at the LV Hilton on business and my group used a conference room. Prices were fair and the service was very good, but the facilities, again, are seedy. The carpet in the Pavilion rooms was filthy, and the equipment was old and dated. Our temporary stage felt rotted and we feared the thing would collapse. My biggest complaint overall was that I did not feel safe in this hotel. I didn't see security around, guestroom elevator access was unrestricted, and even the banquet and event staff told us about major problems with theft. For boasting of this property as "the world's largest Hilton", the HIlton corporation needs to have some pride and restore it a condition worth of the Hilton name.

Reviews.Title: “Not Hilton's finest.”
Reviews.Author: BeakerTX
Reviews.Content: Check-in agent was annoyed and rushed, despite no one in line behind me. A bag of the previous occupants dirty clothes greeted me in the room entryway, and housekeeping was apathetic and unappologetic. AC in my room was not working (arrived at midnight), and it took 30 minutes for an engineer to arrive and fix the problem. The towels smelled like burnt hair, and the bathroom fixtures were in poor shape. Unlike some of the hotels on the strip, there is no security checking who goes to/from the room areas. It's time for Hlton to take this hotel to the next level.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Room, Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: Z2thFairy
Reviews.Content: We were offered a package deal at the Las Vegas Hilton. The Hilton has other properties in LV, but this was the casino on Paradise Rd. Due to a convention, the hotel was packed, but we did not have to wait long to check in. Without asking and for no extra charge, we were upgraded to a newly renovated room with a view of the strip. Nicely appointed, very clean large room with a seating area and desk. We paid $115 ($128.80 w/tax) for two nights. It included a buffet for two (up to $40 value), two for one show at the Hilton, two free cocktails & other dining discount coupons. Really a great value! Highly recommend this hotel---be sure to ask if there's a special.

Reviews.Title: “Check for the correct room.”
Reviews.Author: travelqueen707
Reviews.Content: Booked a non smoking room, upon check in, this was verified. The room allocated smelled very heavily of smoke & on the bedding. There was cigarette burns on the carpet & around the litter bin. The room was small, drab & dated with past there useful life beds! This was reported immediately to reception who asked if we would like some one to come up & spray the room with freshner, this we declined & insisted on a change of room. When a key came eventually for another room, we asked if the person would like to step inside & take a look, No, was the reply, stating that people do smoke in non smoking rooms & not a lot they can do about it, except to change rooms as most other people do. The next room was much better & more modern. No coffee or tea making facilities, no fridge in rooms, something that one would expect from this type of hotel.....being a Hilton???

Reviews.Title: “I don't recognise the hotel we stayed in from the two previous reviews”
Reviews.Author: Peripatetic2
Reviews.Content: The hotel is big (to us) and taking advice from previous reviews, we requested a north tower renovated room. We found this very nice indeed, spacious, the most comfortable bed of our trip (albeit with loose bottom sheets, one of my current bugbears) and a bathroom which had a large vanitory area, storage shelves, and towels changed daily. The room was clean - except for outside windows - but we were so busy looking at the lights at night, it was not important. Plenty of storage space and good car parking. There were things we didn't like, no coffee maker (I like tea when I wake up), the cost of wifi (but good old Starbucks outside). We only used the Paradise Restaurant, which we found very good with extremely pleasant staff. Outside swimming pool not used as it was unseasonably cold when we were there. Reception staff were welcoming - although when our keys didn't work one evening, one muttered that we must have tried the wrong room and we hadn't. Concierge staff were also helpful. Using the scenic elevator made access to the carpark easy, good when packing the car to leave. Easy access to the monorail, but the other stations not so good. We can only review the hotel as we found it and we would definitely stay again if we ever return. We have no axe to grind and I would never write a dishonest review, this was our experience, no more, no less.

Reviews.Title: “Old, Dated & nearly the end of its life”
Reviews.Author: libertyproject
Reviews.Content: Looking back on pictures from 2009 of dirty carpet,filthy vents, dusty areas, etc and it is really no different than my experience from October 2011. Combined with the dirty and dusty conditions, the staff is uninspired, the food quality is horrible and even the newest rooms need a make over. I opted for the $28 lounge upgrade which was a level below United's Red Carpet (if you have never been in a Red Carpet Lounge its akin to what Denny's might serve). Heck even the internet was $12+ per night...horrible! I stayed here for an October 2011 convention, and even if the room were free, I doubt I would stay here again. Even the "upgraded" was from something akin to 2005 (except for the flat screen...big deal). It looks dirty, it feels dirty...they even proudly proclaim they serve "Hormel Meats", the same people who make SPAM. The Hilton brand use to mean something, not so much now. This stay was such a drag, I wasn't even interested in gambling. When I shared my feelings with the executive office, they said "thanks, we'll look into it". If you are looking for a dated, dirty, uninspired and overpriced stay...this hotel is a must. If you are looking for something new, as much as I hate to say it, the NEW hotels on the strip offer a higher price but also offer "2011" type rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Las Vegas Hilton”
Reviews.Author: UNHAPPYsellersquad
Reviews.Content: My husband takes classes offered at the Las Vegas Hilton, and this, of course, is where we always stay. The hotel is very nice with several options for dining. It is not on the strip, so therefore, if going to the strip, you need to purchase a monorail pass. This is a little pricey, but so handy since his classes are right there on site.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms and location”
Reviews.Author: ekatreturns
Reviews.Content: First the good. I love the location of the Hilton in Las Vegas. It is right on the monorail route and is the only hotel that has a station practically inside of it. That makes getting to other places out on the actual strip a breeze. The room was fantastic. Excellent linens and mattresses make the beds a pure pleasure to sleep in. The furniture was well maintained, and the hotel staff very friendly and efficient. The hotel lobby is clean and well lit, and well marked with direction signs making it easy to navigate around. The in-house buffet is well priced and has an excellent choice of entrees and side dishes for all three meals. There are also several high end restaraunts to cater to almost any palate. The only detractors I encountered were the costs of ancillary services and the stakes at the table games. I was charged thirty dollars for two phone calls to toll free numbers from my room phone. The internet is thirteen dollars a day to use in your room. Both of those chages seem greatly excessive.

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: somrtravl
Reviews.Content: Stayed here because I'm a Hilton Honors member on the "escape to Vegas" package. The room was average. The air didn't work. The breakfast buffet was very good and included for one day on the package. The monorail station is located in the hotel which was very convenient, but the rooms are just average.

Reviews.Title: “If you like poor service in a dated hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Gman682
Reviews.Content: The room were old. The AC did not work. There are so many better hotels in the city don't waist your money on this dump

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected based upon other reviews”
Reviews.Author: ljmzta
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel due to the corporate discount Hilton gives us. Later as I was reading the other reviews on here I was thinking maybe it wasn't such a great idea. What I liked about the hotel was that the rooms were comfortable, the elevator service was quick considering we were on the 16th floor of the east tower. The front desk clerk put my adult children in the room next door which was nice, I only wish they would have been the adjoining room. I had the chance to gamble at this location and none of the people in my group came out winners. I ate at 4 of the restaurants in this hotel, the champagne brunch buffet was a good value. Casa Nicola, good food, really great service. Tres Rios...Vince Neil should be ashamed of this place! Paradise Cafe, bad service, mediocre food. The hotel was on the monorail track which we took advantage of quite a bit. This hotel was ok but there are better places to stay in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of used car salesman routine”
Reviews.Author: Norma G
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were expecting a great experience at the Las Vegas Hilton but were disappointed by our treatment when we attempted to check in. We arrived very late (after midnight) and were told that the room we had reserved and paid a one night deposit on was not available. I had reserved a king bed, non-smoking with a golf course view several months prior to our trip. The desk clerk stated that he would have to put us in a SMOKING, Queen room with a pool view. I reminded the desk clerk that I had made reservation months before and expected to receive the room I had paid a one night deposit on. He stated that the "hotel had to accommodate the requests of the other guests". We informed him that we would not accept a smoking room with a queen size bed. He then left to speak with the "manager in the back room" and returned 15 minutes later. He stated he was able to locate a non-smoking room with two queen size beds but no view. He also stated that our reserved room type (king bed, non-smoking, golf course view) would be available after 3pm following day. We asked if we were eligible for a discount for the first night given the inconvenience of having to change rooms and he stated no. I then asked for some kind of comp given the fact that the hotel didn't honor our reservation the first night. He then provided two complimentary buffet meal tickets. When we got to our room the ceiling was peeling, the decor out dated and had a general feel of neglect. I didn't appreciate the desk clerk's attempt to force us to accept a room type that obviously no other Hilton client had been willing to accept that evening. I did report our disappointment with our Hilton experience directly to Hilton and received a less than satisfactory response.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected, good overall value”
Reviews.Author: njgirl05
Reviews.Content: After looking at photos and reviews, I was expecting a really run down hotel. This definitely was NOT the case. I was traveling with my husband and another couple. The Hilton is on the older side; it's showing it's age, mostly in the signage in the front of the hotel. The signs for the parking can be very confusing. However, everything else, for the most part, was fine. Check in was smooth; we were traveling with another, and the check in staff tried to accommodate our rooms on the same floor-there was no king available for them, so they opted for a different floor; however I appreciate the time they took to try and help us. The room was very nice!! We had a premier room, with a king bed on a non-smoking floor. Very clean and very spacious. No COFFEE IN ROOM. That's a disappoint for everyone who wants coffee in your room. No free Wifi either..anywhere in the hotel as far as I could tell. It's $13.99 a day. NO thanks. There is a starbucks and a mcdonalds down the road if you need free wifi. The Iron in our room was in a sad state; I probably could have asked for a replacement, but for 2 days, it served it's purpose. The breakfast buffet was fine. I had my coffee at the Fortuna coffee and wine place in the lobby. Pricey but my friends had their coffee from the pizza hut/Seattle's coffee which was much cheaper, and close to the parking garage exit. The Star Trek area is super dated..I was almost embarrassed for the decor. It just sticks out like a sore thumb and is just, WEIRD. The casino was very quiet and though I had no luck I enjoyed that they had a non smoking section. The monorail is right at the hotel..which is a nice option- a cab ride to the strip, near the Venetian (we went to catch a show) ran us about $11. Not bad. All in all, if I had to stay off the Strip, this is an ok option. Quiet and suited my needs and was budget friendly. I don't know what the pool area is like, since we went on a rather chilly weekend and didn't even bother to look at the facilities. I also appreciated the cleaning people greeted you every single time you passed them in the hallways..customer service goes a long way!

Reviews.Title: “Nice AND convenient”
Reviews.Author: NevadaDale
Reviews.Content: We are locals and the Las Vegas Hilton has been our go to place to stay when there is a concert or happening on the strip. This trip was for my wife's birthday. There was a group that my wife likes playing at Harrah's, but with the a huge concert in town they, and all the other strip hotels, raised their prices for the weekend. The Hilton's prices were very reasonable and we had the convenience of the LV Monorail. We checked in and were upgraded to a suite (reservation was made for a regular room with the option of an upgrade if available) on the 24th floor. It was not one of their "SUPER" suites but it was nice having the extra room. So it was a room with a connecting lounge. We decided to take advantage of it and ordered room service. The food arrived quickly and was very good. After we ate we took the monorail over to Harrah's and walked from there over to the Venetian to see the Phantom (Fantastic!!!). I was concerned about the walking distance because of my wife in her heels. It wasn't too bad. It took us less than an hour from our to the will call at Phantom. I thought that was pretty good considering the walk across the Hilton, Harrahs, and the Venetian. After Phantom we walked back over to Toby Keith's at Harrahs for Marshal Reign and stayed until after 1 AM. We hopped back on the Monorail and safely arrived back at the Hilton. The next morning we had breakfast, at our usual, the cafe. We always have a very good breakfast here and after a late night it is nice that they bring a caraf of coffee to your table. I highly recommend the Hilton because of the convenience of getting in and out of the parking lot and the monorail that can get you most places easily.

Reviews.Title: “No better place to watch the games”
Reviews.Author: Stephen B
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a football weekend, Oct. 1 - 3. Room was solid. Sportsbook was busy but in a good way. Opening up the theatre for football central was absolutely great. I have been going to vegas on a guys football weekend for 15 years, this was absolutley my be experience yet....it would only be better if I knew how to pick winners : ) TJ's served an excellant steak

Reviews.Title: “An Economical Alternative to the Strip”
Reviews.Author: Bill C
Reviews.Content: The LV Hilton is located a short distance from the strip, not far from the Wynn and Encore. It is a low cost alternative to being on the strip. It has easy access, it's rooms are "sufficient", and it has a full range of services. The gaming appears adequate and it's Sports Book is incredibly large and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Nice price but lacking "it"”
Reviews.Author: kbunting
Reviews.Content: Rooms were clean but modest. Charged for the use of the safe and bottled water. No comparison to other hotels on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Not Your Typical Hilton Quality Property”
Reviews.Author: alicerabbit
Reviews.Content: Like many other reviews, I was NOT impressed with this hotel. We are top-tier Hilton members and have traveled around the world staying in Hilton properties. I got a fantastic price (around $50 a night plus breakfast and other coupons, bar etc.) The room we got was BORING - with absolutely NO personality. I stayed in a La Quinta that shined compared to this room. Everything it OLD and not very tidy. Breakfast buffet was good, but people watching was even better - what a weird group!!! I think some people saved up their pennies and ate only one meal a week there having 3rds of everything and stuffing food into plastic bags!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for Non Gambler”
Reviews.Author: MarioYeong
Reviews.Content: Hotel is quite old and the casino tables were mostly empty. Check in is fast and they have a special queue for hhonors members. I booked a Club room and it was great! The room was fairly new and they have a nice oval-shaped bathtub. The beds were one of the most comfortable I have slept in. The lounge was fantastic. It was the first I experienced letting people in by their room key instead of constantly asking for room number. Well stocked, good sized and clean makes it an enjoyable experience. They have 4 types of wine available, including champagne, and they splurge on expensive nuts and a good coffee machine. The hotel is quite old and the lifts look worn with noticable graffiti. The club rooms are worth the buck although free internet is for gold and diamond members only. All others pay a ridiculous price of $13.99 a day, even for club rooms. Perhaps the hotel is needing more than a good face lift. That aside, hotel is still good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Las Vegas Hilton”
Reviews.Author: chris a
Reviews.Content: This hotel was the worst hotel I have ever stayed in. A motel 6 would have been better. The room was so dirty when we checked in that I had to ask for another room. There was dust build up along the baseboard, the blinds wouldn't close, discoloration on the wall paper, the furniture looked like it was 30 years old and the beds very small. I requested to change rooms and the first thing the desk clerk said was that I paid for a standard room and it will be a extra $25.00 a night for an upgrade. I told her I just wanted a clean room. This first room was so bad, that I felt it was a setup room to push the upgrade. Once we switched rooms the second room was somewhat cleaner, but the carpet had numerous stain marks throughout the room. I didn't see a maid cart in the hallway cleaning rooms the entire time I was there. This establishment was so bad that we paid for another hotel for our second night in town and ate the cost of our last night at the Las Vegas Hilton. Terrible experience!

Reviews.Title: “A few rough edges but I'd certainly stay again”
Reviews.Author: swisstony123
Reviews.Content: I had to change my plans for a trip to Vegas and the hotel I was originally going to stay at on the strip had rocketed in price, so did some shopping around. Hilton had a good offer (incl. B'fast) so given it's on the monorail I thought I'd give it a try. Arriving very late there was no line to check in. I'd opted for a standby upgrade for $15 and this was granted, bagging me a huge corner room with sofa and view of the strip on the 19th floor. Room was well furnished although the bathroom sink was sporting a great big crack. There's a bit of nickel and diming going on, presumably to prop up the cheap rate. $4 for a bottle of water! $3 to use the safe!! But even with this it was still a bargain. Also some problems with elevators leading to a bit of a line at times. Rate included a very good breakfast (on the Friday morning) and an even better champagne brunch on the Saturday morning. Shame it didn't start until 7am as I had a flight just after 9am so it was some quick eggs and a glass of fizz then away on the second morning. No problem jumping into a cab in the morning to get back to the airport. Bar staff were friendly, hotel ticked all the boxes so for what I paid (avg $120 or so a night) it was a bargain in my opinion. Also pleased to think I've stayed at this 'iconic' Hilton before it leaves the chain.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent one night stay”
Reviews.Author: World_Is_Beautiful
Reviews.Content: Stayed at a 21st floor room in the North Tower. Room was nice and spacious, although not very modern. One minor issue was trying to use the safe in the room, it was locked and I could not get it unlocked even after following the instructions and talking to the staff over phone. So we just left our valuables in the room and not in the locker. Everything was intact when we returned to the room so this was not a big deal.

Reviews.Title: “Would Stay Again”
Reviews.Author: glado50
Reviews.Content: While a somewhat older property with dated decor, we very much enjoyed our stay. Our room -- East Tower Suite -- was large, clean and very quiet. The room did have a fridge, but an room coffee maker would have been nice. The staff was exceptional! Despite being very busy with convention traffic etc., the staff was always smiling and very accommodating. The monorail stops at the hotel making access to the strip convenient; cost is $5/trip; $12/day or $28 for a three-day pass. The hotel's pool area was clean and didn't require walking though public areas to access. We'll be sure to consider the LV Hilton again the next time we travel to Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent rooms and services”
Reviews.Author: UD d
Reviews.Content: We stayed with Hilton and it was wonderful experience very nice rooms and excellent service.

Reviews.Title: “Close to the strip, far from madness”
Reviews.Author: cherokawa
Reviews.Content: Clean, spacious room.... conveniently next to the LV Light Rail - to get and from the strip.... plenty of places to eat close by..... not too expensive.... what more can one ask for....

Reviews.Title: “Good choice for it's price”
Reviews.Author: Pshadow C
Reviews.Content: I like this hotel. Room is clean and the price is cheap.

Reviews.Title: “Cold Hilton”
Reviews.Author: Sequel
Reviews.Content: The Hilton's casino and lobby were VERY cold. Much colder than other hotels in the area. Had to wear jacket/sweater, etc. at all times.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sankum
Reviews.Content: Nice place to live. Pretty neat and clean. The room service did a good job. The receptionist was polite. Great place to go back. The pool was a good place to relax too.

Reviews.Title: “Fair To Average Rating”
Reviews.Author: rx007
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a one week stay. Check-in : Easy enough - they try and upgrade you for a higher price, and the rooms are usually not any better. Rooms: We had a Premium Classic Room. NO big deal, even if you have a view of the strip, the windows are so dirty from the outside that it really doesn't make a difference. A room is just a room, the beds were comfortable though. TV is flat screen - so that was good. Had a small fridge and safe. AC worked ok. Scenic Elevator: I would be embarassed if I was Mgt. The windows are so dirty - it makes you wonder how the rest of the place is maintained. Pool: Kinda small for the size of the hotel. Bar prices at the pool are a bit on the high side. The pool water is like ICE----- and it was over 100 degrees and they still can't keep the water at a swimmable temperature. Everyone was complaining and not happy about it. They have a Pizza Hut Express, which is pretty good, but one day they had some conference there and the line was like a 30 minute wait.... What was upsetting to me was that when I finally got to the checkout, I ordered a sub which is on their menu board, and they wanted me to wait another 15 minutes - I said forget it and just took a pre-done pizza -- they didn't care. Transportation: Monorail is right there and you can get to the strip with no problem. If you have a car - valet is quick and easy. Checkout: Easy, you can do it from your room - but if you want to print your boarding pass you have to pay about $3 to do it. Most other hotels do this for you complimentary. The staff on a whole were very pleasant. Pool:

Reviews.Title: “So many better hotels, don't risk it, HH Diamond honors means nothing”
Reviews.Author: Pr0fessi0nalC0uple
Reviews.Content: Hi there, I write this as I am currently in Room 2069/2070 - an alleged 2 bedroom suite for which I paid way over the odds. I am Diamond level hhonors, virtually no benefits, not even a bottle of water. The 'go green' scheme is just an excuse to remove any level of service whatsoever for $10 a day? NOT WORTH IT. That is a theme which continues throughout this hotel. Long lines at check-in, the very tiredest of decor, like an episode of The Golden girls, without the laughs. (not offence Betty) Please please take heed, your hard earned dollars are much better and more effectively spent elsewhere. There is nothing wrong with the location, the monorail is great but the hotel, from it's sad abandoned Star trek themed room to it's lack luster attitude to EVERY single aspect of hospitality requires a major body swerve. JUST DON'T RISK IT! One last note to the management - there is no return from this review. If you cared just even a little bit, the pizza that was smashed against my door at 4am on the first night of our stay by some overly 'wired' youths, who no doubt paid $50 dollars for the same "suite" I paid $350 for, would not still be there!!! Any chance at all someone from housekeeping might consider vacuuming the carpets on the 20th floor some day this year??? No? I thought not! (ps.thought I'd just throw in a couple more issues - 2 treadmills out of 5 not working, 1 bike not working, ceiling collapsing in hallway - no cleaning whatsoever done in 3 days - $4 for a bottle of water, charge to use safe - huge lines at check in - the worst service ever in the USA at the restaurant - spa bath doesn't work in room - light bulbs out in room - exec lounge closed and not available - IS THIS PLACE CLOSING DOWN BUT NOBODY KNOWS??

Reviews.Title: “Showing her age but still a mainstay”
Reviews.Author: CaptainRonn
Reviews.Content: I read many reviews, good and bad, about the Hilton before I arrived. For her age, not that bad. Compared to the new hotels, Ballagio, Caesars, Luxor, Venetian, the Hilton is older and less glamorous. For the price, however, it's quite acceptable. The lobby and casino look good; but the hotel hallways and rooms are a bit worn. I had a recently refurbished room in the East Tower. It had two double beds, a desk, and a chair and ottoman, also a large flat screen TV. It was nice; comparable to a new Hampton Inn room. The pool area on the third floor is nice; small for such a large hotel; but was not crowded. The restaurants were quite adequate and fairly priced, The Buffet served a good selection at breakfast and dinner. The staff were all friendly and knowledgeable. I was checked in by David who was quite personable and took his time explaining where to find my room, the pool location and the variety of restaurants and the times they were open. Overall, for the price, the hotel is fine. If you want new, go to the Strip; but expect to pay for the difference. To get to the Strip from the Hilton, I recommend the monorail. It's quick, affordable, and boards just off the lobby of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel for the money”
Reviews.Author: montcalmharls
Reviews.Content: Good value hotel. Room was clean, staff was nice,beds were really comfortable. Check in line was the MAJOR drawback. When we arrived there was an hour and a half check in line. When you have been traveling all day and stand in line for over an hour, it can make you a bit cranky. The people behind me brought their children and, well, that was fun listening to also. All of the service people were very friendly and helpful. We stayed in the pyramid section and all in all it was quiet. The cleaning staff should maybe pay a little more attention to detail, as there were gross black, grimy hand prints in the middle of the window all during my weeks stay.

Reviews.Title: “Don't waste your money here!!”
Reviews.Author: LumberGirl935
Reviews.Content: Came here for business. Even though the room wasn't paid for by me, I would never have chosen this place. Run down dirty rooms!! Pool area was terrible, they offered 2 for 1 drinks only on the pool menu which was dinky. They also offered shrimp cocktails for 2 bucks and they were out !!! Our waitress said they NEVER have it. It's only a front to get people down to the pool !!!! DON'T WASTE YOUR GOOD MONEY HERE !!

Reviews.Title: “Sad faded hotel that needs to be put out of its misery”
Reviews.Author: bedfordmom2
Reviews.Content: I recently returned from a business conference at the Las Vegas Hilton. It must have been a glorious hotel during the rat pack years. But it is now run down, neglected and dirty. The decor is the old gold, maroon and hunter green. The furniture is very dated. They did have a flat screen TV Check-in was fine, the staff was very nice to let me check in early. My room on the 10th floor central and end room was very large; L shaped with a huge walk in closet. It was fairly clean though the gold chairs were stained. The bathroom was OK but the showerhead was short and I had to bend to wet my hair (I am only five foot eight). The hotel nickled and dimed you with internet fees, gym fees, fees to print boarding pass, etc. They did have the go green program where you would recieved a 10 dollar certificate if you forgo room service. I appreciated that. I wasn't sure whether they did it because of lack of staff or really believed in being green. There were no paper bills slipped under your door the day of departure. You had to wait for them to send it via email The conference rooms were very dirty and the break foods were mediocre. Away from the strip, we were dependent upon the monorail, so you need to figure that into your budget unless you have a car. The deli; however was a very good value. Overall, I would stay far away from this hotel unless you go to eat at the deli or see a show there.

Reviews.Title: “It Sucked !!!!”
Reviews.Author: greenthumb3
Reviews.Content: My Husband and I had to stay in this hotel two different nights. The first night the phone was broken so we could not get a wake-up call and three of the lamps did not work. This is a very old hotel and needs updating. The second night we stayed, the room stunk, carpet had black stains everywhere. When we tried to obtain our boarding passes for the airlines, all of the computers were down, which made a big difference where we sat on the plane. We will never stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Brink-a-dink
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a two queen non-smoking room on the 11th floor overlooking the pool. Upon check-in we were asked if we would like to upgrade our room for $20. We asked what we would get if we upgraded and they said it was just a nicer room. So apparently they have remodeled some of the rooms that you can upgrade to for a small fee. We did not opt to upgrade and found that our room was nice and well-maintained; perfect for a nights stay as we traveled through Vegas. The pool was nice and perfect for kids as there was a good sized area that was only 1.5 ft deep so the kids could run and play in that area.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Comfy Beds”
Reviews.Author: Collette_Andrea
Reviews.Content: We got a real good deal on the Premier rooms and booked 2 rooms for the duration of our trip. We were traveling with my mum who can't walk too far, so the front desk was helpful enough to give us rooms near the elevators. The rooms were big and clean, but the best part of it were the beds!! Absolutely comfy, ooohh soooooo comfy! We had such a good rest every night! We had a car so the off-strip location wasn't too much of an issue. Pity we didn't get a chance to hang by the pool tho. We were busy shopping at the outlets. If I get another good deal, I'll definitely be back at the Hilton.

Reviews.Title: “Already booted from Hilton chain”
Reviews.Author: SoFLme
Reviews.Content: First, read the Wikipedia entry on Resorts International which owns this Hilton hotel/casino. Billed as the world's largest Hilton, it is a massive hotel. It is also an old hotel, very old by Vegas standards. As a Hilton Diamond member, I booked a king bed deluxe room with a strip view. On check-in, the clerk told me I had been "upgraded". Upon reaching my room, it was a king bed on a non-smoking floor as requested, but the hallway smelled of smoke and there were ashtrays next to the elevators. Also, my "upgrade" was apparently from the strip view I wanted and paid for to a mountain view of the smog which always hangs over this city. Hallways were nasty with carpeting I'd be afraid to touch with anything but my shoes. My room was hardly better with furnishings I doubt Salvation Army would accept. The ac barely worked and had to be left on full the entire stay. The bed was crushed on one side and linens old and cheap. Towels were threadbare and scratchy. This all fits with Resorts International's stated goal of buying distressed properties and then doing the minimum necessary to turn a healthy profit on them. At $50/night this would be a good value in Vegas. At $100 or even $150, you can do much much better.

Reviews.Title: “The little engine that could”
Reviews.Author: Zahava
Reviews.Content: I know there have been many mixed comments about this hotel, but truly, I have nothing but good things to say. The staff is working EXTREMELY hard to negate the negative perceptions. I voiced my concerns right at check in and Randy and Sherry went above and beyond to allay my concerns. I stayed in the north tower and my room had recently been remodeled and was lovely. They have a deal called, "Go Green," whereby you forgo daily maid service and get a $10 coupon each day to put toward food or beverage at any of their establishments. Yes, this hotel is not as modern or glitzy as some of the others but truly, how long are you in your room or at the hotel in Las Vegas?

Reviews.Title: “Las Vegas take two.”
Reviews.Author: finoni
Reviews.Content: As the title suggests, this was my second visit to Vegas and it gets better every time. The Hilton was a very nice hotel for our base for the week. It boasted an amazing buffet, a Pizza Hut and a few other nice places to eat. There are lots and lots of different ways to gamble here but we didn't actually do any. The only thing I can tell you is that the Sports book is massive and is right beside the buffet. The best thing about this hotel is the Monorail which travels the length of the strip and really is value for money.
