We used this every day because it was far too hot to walk to the strip from the hotel. The only thing I would say about the hotel is that it is slightly dated. I think everything needs a like of paint and a general spruce up. Overall though we had a great stay here and I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Ok hotel but nothing special!”
Reviews.Author: Powersmurf
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel to keep up my Hilton base nights in order to stay as Gold level for the Hilton's reward program. The first impressions of the hotel is that its very old. You feel like you are back in the 1980's. Check in was easy and we were given a room in the North Tower. When we got to the room again, the decor was old and out of date. After I had a shower, the water kept running, and no matter how hard you turned the handle, the water would not stop. The walls were also paper thin. My partner was not able to sleep as she could hear the person next door watching TV, and then first thing in the morning we were woken by someone in the room above rolling their bags accross the room. Once we left the hotel to walk to the strip, it was a fair distance to the nearest part of the strip. So, in view of the fact that the hotel is a bit of a walk to the strip, its old and the shower didnt really work, I'd give this hotel 2 out of 5 * due to the price. We paid $109 plus tax for the night, and for that price you could get a decent hotel in the strip!

Reviews.Title: “Good Value, Good Location, Good Food”
Reviews.Author: londonreviewer_11
Reviews.Content: My first weekend in Vegas, ever, was booked for 9th until the 12th of September - traveling alone. Three night stay in a North Tower Superior King Room overlooking the strip on the 12th floor Vegas is one of those places you need to visit at least once in your lifetime, and my first visit certainly did not disappoint thanks to the LV Hilton. My travel agent originally had recommended me the Luxor or Stratosphere, however I was not too keen on staying on the strip because of the noise nor did I want to stay that far out of the action - as a HHonors member, I asked about the LV Hilton and got a good rate here so I booked it up. The entrance hall is grand, and check-in was a breeze - I arrived at about 2.15pm, did the "$20 front desk tip" (which worked like a charm, originally I had booked a Standard Central Tower room, very glad I got upgraded as the North Tower rooms are renovated and lovely compared to Central Tower) and went to my room straight away. Room very well proportioned, coming from the UK where space really is a premium - the bed was HUGE and very comfortable, TV again absolutely huge (although the controls did take a while to get used to) and air conditioning worked wonders - so much so that I had to turn it off for periods of the day in order not to freeze! Housekeeping did an excellent job of keeping the room clean. Overlooking the humungous Hilton sign and the strip in the distance was brilliant at night, definitely recommend specifically asking for one of these rooms. The Buffet at the LV Hilton was good, although not spectacular - some of the food was not warm enough, but the range served was more than adequate - champagne in the morning and complimentary wine and beers in the evenings was a good addition (where else but Vegas could you drink three glasses of champagne before 8am?!) I spent two afternoons at the pool during their 2for1 Happy Hours (4pm until 7pm) and thoroughly enjoyed the time spent there - drinks service attentive with the DJ playing a good amount of commercial dance music. I only would have wished the pool was busier though, as it did not have the "party" atmosphere one would expect when going to a "pool party". Casino well ventilated, as a smoker I do not have problems with people smoking but the air always smelt fresh. During the day, the drinks service at tables and slots was not as attentive as it could be, but the evenings made up for this. Table dealers are nothing to look at, but I did not mind as I was there to play the game and not oggle at some scantily-clad supermodel dealers. Very large variety of on site shopping, the Pizza Hut onsite was quick and cheap, and the food quality was good. I did not try Benihana's and now regret not doing so! Location wise - I felt safe in the area, and it is well served by buses and the Monorail - easy to get to the strip and back in no time at all, and no need to use a taxi! Overall, a brilliant first visit to Vegas - sad to hear as of January the LV Hilton will no longer be part of the Hilton Worldwide brand, so I will not be able to collect HHonors points for stays - this does not mean I would not consider booking here again. 100% Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Overall Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JoC92
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Las Vegas Hilton for 2 nights whilst in Vegas before going to the Luxor. Overall the hotel was fantastic but was just let down by its location as it is quite a way from the main strip. A plus for this hotel was the fantastic pool which had plenty of shade if you did not want to sit in the direct sun (this was a letdown when we arrived at the Luxor as you had to pay at least $40 a day to have an umbrella so we were not particularly impressed)

Reviews.Title: “Not bad at all”
Reviews.Author: kez_ireland25
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hilton for 3 nights in June 2011. The location was ok, a little bit away from the strip and definately on the slightly seedier side of town. That said it has a monorail station actually at the hotel that will drop you anywhere you want along the strip. The room was large, not all that modern, a bit dated really. As was the hotel in general. It wasnt too bad though. I wouldnt be put off staying here again. We got a good rate, you get free parking, it has plenty of dining, drinking and gambling options. The pool is big but always busy, party central!!

Reviews.Title: “Great renovated rooms, but quite a hike from the action.”
Reviews.Author: wandererer151
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hilton for a convention that took place on-site. The ease of hopping on and off an elevator to hit meetings was perfect, but I'm struggling to book again. I spent a good bit of funds on taxis to and from the Strip. It's walkable, but only if you've got the extra 30min. Even just walking across the street to a convenience store takes nearly 10min (Vegas is HUGE) I checked in very late at night, which was no problem at all. The room was very clean, and had been renovated somewhat recently (2008?) Huge mirror and an open floor plan from the door throughout the room. No complaints, other than there are no refrigerators, but you might be able to request them. Great pool, but lacking any real excitement. Though in at the end of March, early April, it was still a bit chilly. I'm not a gambler, so I was only there for the sights and meetings. I'll 100% do Vegas again, but not sure about the Hilton yet...Again, it's simply location that left me feeling out of the loop. Service was never an issue, which is why we gravitate to the Hilton name. Anyway, weigh out your needs, but do consider the location.

Reviews.Title: “Great for a convention center stay - otherwise, go elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: Travel Agent Traveler
Reviews.Content: The Hilton needs updating and better housekeeping. When I checked into my room, there was a tea bag on the desk chair and hairs in the bathtub. The room is a standard room, no big problems there. The decoris average and the room facilities almost non-existent. There as an in-room safe and iron/ironing board. The hotel offers many restaurants in all price ranges, so that works for most people. The parking is free but you have to walk outside to get to it, no matter the weather. Internet is $14 per day - an outrageous rip off. In addition, I had to resign on four times in two days (thrown offline), and was charged for a 24-period each time. I went to the front desk and they took off the extra charges. I found the front desk staff to be pleasant. The pool is old-fasthioned and offers little shade. There as a big frisbee game going on in it when I was there, so that made using it awkward and very noisy. The pool drink I had was small and overpriced - even for Vegas. Although it was a bit of a walk from my room, the hotel is handy to the convention center next door. At Mandalay Bay, the walk is even further. For those people not attending a convention at the center or the Hilton's own conference facilities, there are better hotels in better locations at similar rates.

Reviews.Title: “It has a bed.”
Reviews.Author: John W
Reviews.Content: The room rate may be cheap but nothing else is. $14 a day for internet, no coffee pot in room ( but you can rent one $20-$30 a day), and $20 to use the gym. The shower was terrible you think they could pop for a decent shower head (guess you could rent a good one). $3 to use the internet and another $2 to print a piece of paper. The do have a few shops and about 5 restaurants, these are not cheap. Had a $15 burger and a $3 diet coke. The casino looks very old especially if you compare it to some of the casino's on the strip. Having a monorail stop at the hotel was nice, easy access the strip. Would I stay again no.

Reviews.Title: “Great Vegas Experience”
Reviews.Author: Matt P
Reviews.Content: 1) Location is best place to stay if you are at a convention - walked to the hall each day. 2) Resort Club Staff was the BEST EVER. Courteous, Clean, Friendly - can't say enough Food and drinks were plentiful and nice variety 3) Bed - wow - I got home last night and need to buy a new bed and bedding -to match the Hilton experience. 4) Benihana - Took a customer first night - great food - love the "hot Sake" 5) Tj's Steakhouse - Had a great dinner and drinks. OVERALL - one of the best weeks I have had in Vegas - would highly recoomend.

Reviews.Title: “Apprehensive but pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: Megavegasfan
Reviews.Content: Apprehensive about staying off strip, & after reading so many bad reviews, but we were pleasantly surprised, we usually stay on the strip but our Casino host recently moved here so we followed. Check in/out was a breeze as we were invited to use the VIP lounge, very helpful staff & the bell staff were very quick. Our room was in the East tower right @ the end of a corridor(21st floor) so quite a walk, but it had been refurbished, it was called a suite -really 2 rooms with a connecting door, so huge amount of space for 2 people, 2 bathrooms, 2 wardrobes, 2 flat screen tv's,etc, & 3 beds, as we are both smokers this was ideal for us, we used 1 room to sleep in & the other to smoke!! Rather dark rooms, but the view was nice we overlooked a golf course, & could see the scary rides on the Stratosphere!! Very efficient air con, must be the coolest room we have had in Vegas, Best stocked bathrooms for towels I've ever seen. (which came in handy for a green day) Very comfortable beds, settee & chairs. We often had a green day when you refuse housekeeping , & received a 10$ voucher to use @ food outlets,you also receive food comps if you are a club member in the casino, so paid virtually nothing when we ate there. The Fortuna cafe had a wide range , quick service, with the best chocolate eclairs ever -actually tasted as nice as they looked. The Paradise cafe was also nice with quite a wide choice. The buffet was very basic, but adequate, & very reasonably priced. Monorail was very handy especially during the August heat, & not such a long walk as in some hotels. The casino was comfortable, light, & had a nice atmosphere, cocktail service was also very good. Overall ,all the staff we came into contact with very friendly & helpful, the room was very comfortable,& we enjoyed the casino , we would certainly stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome service”
Reviews.Author: barriosfam6
Reviews.Content: I was very pleased with the service and cleanliness of the Hilton, our room was well stocked with plenty of towels, water etc. Our first day my husband accidentaly left the room keys inside the room, housekeeping immediately called security and in a blink of an eye our room was open and we were on our way. I will be staying at the Hilton again without a doubt so if ever in Vegas and you want excellent service without the outrageous prices consider the Hilton you will not regret it.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: jcf70816
Reviews.Content: Just returned from the Las Vegas Hilton. I chose this hotel because I was attending a convention at the Convention Center right next door. I originally reserved one of the standard rooms, but upgraded for $20 a night, and found it worthwhile. The upgraded room has newer furnishing, including the famous Hilton mattrass. Slept like a baby. The room also included a flat screen TV and a refrigerator. The only complaint I had about the room is that being an "upgraded" room, you would think it would be on a higher floor for better views, but I was on the 3rd floor of the north tower. The staff were very nice, and quite helpful. Housekeeping was excellent, having my room made up early every day. I left my room one morning at 8:00am, and returned for a few minutes just after 10:30, and the room had already been serviced. I was a little dissappointed in the breakfast buffet. The hot foods were just fine, but it was painfully apparent that the pastries were not baked in house. On the first morning I got a cinnamon roll that was no better than what I can buy at my local grocery store. Also, on the first morning, the server asked for my beverage order, brought it, and I never saw her again. The second morning, the server was much better, asking 3 times if I wanted/needed a coffee refill. All in all, I would not hesitate to stay at this hotel again should the need arise, and would recommend it to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great place, great value”
Reviews.Author: S M
Reviews.Content: This is a great place to stay while in Las Vegas. The rooms are very clean with comfortable beds and modern, quality furniture. The hotel has everything you need, including several fine restaurants. A bit off strip but not far at all. The monorail runs right outside for a nice scenic trip to other hotels. We enjoyed our stay here very much and would return without a doubt, the price per night could not be beat and to top it off if you choose to "go green", maid not needing to come in everyday and replace towels etc, they give you $10 (per day) credit to use in restaurants in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Convenient and Friendly”
Reviews.Author: Rz72801
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights while attending a next door convention center event. The best features. 1. You can practically roll out of bed to be at the convention center, which is a huge plus when you have a 9 am meeting. 2. Staff are very friendly, concierge very helpful, and servers in buffet very friendly. 3. Excellent features if you like sports, perfect for shopping-bored spouses. Huge sports area with comfy deluxe movie theater-size chairs and 2 drink cups, a nearby pizza/sandwich spot, and enough huge TV screens to run Mission Control. 4. Its fun. The dealers wear sports jerseys in the casino on Sunday, and it doesn't feel stuffy like other properties. 5. Buffet food and Cafe Fortuna offer good value and the food was very good. I booked on the hotel's website on the Escape to Vegas package, which included breakfast, drinks, and fitness center. 6. Monorail access is really great, you can be at MGM in 15 minutes. 7. Smoke-free sports TV area, and gambling area. Very appreciated for us non-smokers. Other info to note 1. Room (not upgraded) in central tower are not very fancy, but serviceable for a business trip. I really liked the bath amenities, slight citrus scent. Flat Screen TV worked well, and bed very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Get your Hilton points while it's still a Hilton property”
Reviews.Author: Dr_Drew2
Reviews.Content: I stay here about two or three times per year and it serves its purpose just fine. Of course there are lots of nicer properties out there, but if you are a Hilton HHonors member, this is your best bet for Vegas. Everything from the room, buffet, gym, spa, and casino are average. The Hilton has that old Vegas faded grandeur to it that is sort of charming, but it is getting tired. The agreement with Hilton is supposed to end this year, so it may not be a Hilton for much longer. If I won't be able to earn Hilton points here anymore then there won't be any reason to stay here. That being said, if you can get a AAA rate or some other promotion, this hotel is a great deal. Just don't go there expecting the Wynn or something like that and you won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “There is better”
Reviews.Author: philbur
Reviews.Content: Confusing elevators, no in room tea/coffee or fridge, rooms need refurb, but buffet breakfast was excellent as long as you take what your server tells you to take. It's a 'tour bus' hotel not in the Hilton standard.

Reviews.Title: “Could use a facelift”
Reviews.Author: theamatuerjetsetter
Reviews.Content: The casino level of the Hilton is pretty typical of what you find at the older resorts--not much to complain about there. However, I can't say the same about our room. Upon first entering our room, we were greeted with a very stale and musty smell. The sheets did not smell clean. The decor was very outdated, as were the furnitures. The bathroom resembles one that you would The signage that directed us to the room was slightly confusing. The hotel is, however, conveniently located next to the LV Convention Center.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: SLIM02380
Reviews.Content: lets start with a low, would have put my life on this hotel was offering free breakfast but was soon to discover at check in no vegas hotels offer free breakfast. breakfast was a little on the exspensive side if only the would lower there price you the would fill the place instead the see 100's of guests carring in supplies to store in the bedroom fridges. pool area little small for the size of the hotel and a little boring compared to others in the area. however our 5 night stay was a good one the rooms are great with plenty of room just one block walk from the strip or take the monorail which as there were 7 of us we took the bus it was cheaper. 1st time in vagas and i was not dis-appointed. would have paid more for the room if breakfast was included however free car parking was on offer but internert charges are per 24hrs which was not cheap so we did not use it

Reviews.Title: “Doesn't live up to the name!”
Reviews.Author: Janay
Reviews.Content: Stayed there last month. After heavy gambling for four days, checked comps and they were not registering. When card was inserted, it said accepted. Got rude responses from our slot host, acting like it was our fault and we did not know what we are doing. Seeing as I work for another casino chain, doing airplane junkets to Atlantic City, I begged to differ. Gave us nothing at all for our distress. Also, the ac in the rooms, which are very nice, doesn't go lower than 75....couldn't sleep it was so hot. The parking garage is a LONG walk from the casino. The buffet was pathetic. I would not recommend this hotel at all! We just wanted to try something different, but NEVER again.

Reviews.Title: “WORST HITON STAY”
Reviews.Author: Dennis C
Reviews.Content: I knew this was not going to be a good experience when I walked down the hallway to my room and the hallway had glasses and buckets left in front over several rooms including mine. The hallway carpet had not been vaccemed and was not vaccumed for two days after I checked in. My door had black fingerprints all over the door the handles on the dresser and nightstand were sticky (disgusting) and the bathroom counter had water stains on it. Not a great impression was left. I found the staff in NYC Hiltons much mroe freindly and helpfull! The pool is also very small for such a large Hotel. The Hotels only advantage is that it is on the Monorail.

Reviews.Title: “The Hilton is truly a "hidden gem" in Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: Diamond-luv
Reviews.Content: I've stay at the Hilton many, many times when I travel to Las Vegas and it's wonderful. What makes it nice is that is just "off-strip" enough, which give's you a chance to unwind. The pool is relaxing and not overcrowded. If you want "action" the Monorail stops right at the hotel which is very convenient. The rooms are good sized; I like the Strip view rooms as well as the poolside lanai rooms. The Hilton is great!

Reviews.Title: “Good Deal for an average hotel”
Reviews.Author: smm22
Reviews.Content: This hotel was definetly a good deal when compared to the prices of the other hotels on the strip. This was the first time we stayed off the strip and it was ok, i think i will prefer to stay on the strip now because i would rather walk to different hotels than have to take the car everytime. The tables at the hotel had higher limits than other hotels on the strip also, so if you like to gamble with a low minimum this is not the place for you, you wont find anything under 10 dollars minimum. the rooms were nice, i didnt have any complaints and the views were very nice of the strip. Overall this was a pretty nice hotel for the price that it is. I might stay there again depending on circumstances. I had a good time still.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for the price”
Reviews.Author: ahu98
Reviews.Content: The hotel is large, as other ones in LV. The service is ok at the best. The VIP lounge is very small but good if you need a few soft drinks or beers. The hotel rate we had was very attrictive. Otherwise will not stay there.

Reviews.Title: “It was very dirty room and bathroom”
Reviews.Author: Spibee
Reviews.Content: It was a very dirty room and bathroom , bathroom was very dirty that I couldn't use it I had to go down to the front desk and ask them to send somebody to clean it so I can take a shower

Reviews.Title: “Three Star Hotel, Upgraded rooms are Fine”
Reviews.Author: AKK
Reviews.Content: You get what you pay for. The rates at the Hilton Las Vegas are often very low if there is not a convention in the convention center. I paid $38 for a Thursday and $62 for a Friday night. For the price, it was a good deal. But you get what you pay for. The Hotel itself is 2 1/2- 3 star but luckily, because I am a Diamond Member, I got a renovated room which was about 3 1/2 star. It was certainly adequate for what I needed. I was able to take the Monorail to where I needed to go and the Monorail is conveniently located at one end of the Casino. I have been to Vegas before and stayed at the 4-Seasons, Venetian and the Bellagio. This hotel does not compare but neither do the prices. I think I got a very good deal for the money, but the hotel is off the strip, out of the way, Casino and pool need upgrades etc. But what do you expect for the price. If price is of concern, then consider this hotel. But if you are going for the first time or want something more luxurious, there are many other hotels on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and Comfortable!”
Reviews.Author: Time2CheckIn
Reviews.Content: This was the first time I've been to Las Vegas and not stayed in a hotel on the Strip. This Hilton is next to the convention center and was more convenient for the show my husband was attending. The room and hotel were very comfortable. The monorail station is connected to the hotel, so it was easy to get anywhere we wanted to go on the Strip. He's an Honors member, so we had the breakfast buffet, internet, and health club access at no charge. Although the coed workout room was smallish, there was plenty of equipment and the health club access included separate men/women locker rooms, showers, hot tubs, etc., which was very nice. Overall, a nice stay!!

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: Rana A
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a great value for a short business trip for three sharing a room (one couple and one single). I selected the second-lowest level room so we could have a refrigerator for leftovers and our own snacks, and we were sure to request a North Tower room. It was clean and updated, although a light bulb in the bathroom was out and the shaving mirror's light didn't work. It is an excellent location if you will be using the monorail, as the monorail station is right downstairs.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, just nothing special”
Reviews.Author: Buckskinman
Reviews.Content: Room was overlooking an industrial area. Being an honors member doesn't seem to be a very big deal. Beds were great, but it was a very long walk to the parking garage, not good for my handicapped condition. Didn't do anything but sleep at the hotel because it's NOT on the strip. My error for not doing more research.

Reviews.Title: “We Love this hotel”
Reviews.Author: sunstroke2
Reviews.Content: This may not be the most nicest hotel available in Vegas and its not even on the strip. It is located just a little off the strip next to the Convention Center but the monorail goes directly into it and is a very cheap mode of transportation. This was our fourth time to Vegas and the second time staying at this hotel,. We stayed here the first time, then decided to try a couple of different ones afterwards. We came back. After trying a couple of other hotels we knew what we were looking for, and for us the Las Vegas Hilton offers so many little extras that we really enjoyed it. You can upgrad for cheap and it really is worth it. By upgrading you get access to the gym/spa free as many times as you want. Their Spa is really nice and offers everything you need. You also have access to a lounge area where they offer breakfast, and snacks all day, and also free wine in the afternoon until evening. You can 't beat it. The pool is big which we loved , and cabanas are very bnice as well with big screen tv's. The rooms are nice, nothing extra, but clean and comfortable, and the staff were very friendly. The hotels offers a really nice Japanese restaurant, steakhouse and nighclub.We would definitely go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth it”
Reviews.Author: Esther J
Reviews.Content: I read and thought it was an awesome hotel and with their summer package I would save money but I was wrong. Service was not good at all! It seems smiles and being nice to guests are prohibited. The room was average and the ice machine in our floor was a big hole on the wall. The casino is not very modern and compared to other places on the strip a little more expensive. There is nothing to see in the hotel, the pool is very small, when we got there, we did not know which way to go and ended up driving around the block. If you can stay in the strip... do so!

Reviews.Title: “A city unto itself”
Reviews.Author: Fitch7600
Reviews.Content: This hotel is just enormous. It's on the monorail now, but it's a good distance from the Strip. It's very close to the Convention Center and has a lot of convention space on it's own. If you stay there when there is no convention activity they practically give the rooms away. Prices under $40 a night can be found on the Hilton website. During busier times it can cost five times that or more. Even in slow times they get you with the other charges. It's to hell and gone to leave the hotel, and to eat there is overpriced by Vegas standards, as are a lot of the non-casino amenities. The rooms are nice and I've always been treated well there, but unless you are in Las Vegas for a convention, there are more convenient locations.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty sheets, dirty bathroom”
Reviews.Author: Hiheather
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel while driving through Vegas on our way to the airport. I figured it'd be a decent place to stay, due to the hilton name. We got a pretty decent deal, but after staying there I realize why the rooms are so cheap! Theyre dirty, and old! The sheets in one bed had what looked like burgers on the bottom... SICK!!!!! The bathroom counters were dirty, The boards along the walls were dirty and caked with dirt, the paint was peeling off the door to the bathroom. The only good thing I can say Abour this room is that it was quiet. We wont be staying there again. I like to stay in CLEANED rooms....

Reviews.Title: “Tired old Hotel”
Reviews.Author: robert t
Reviews.Content: Stayed four nights - linen not changed at all. Empty pizza boxes, plates, glasses left outside rooms for up to three days. Requested buzzing bed lamp and squeeking bathroom door be attended to - no action.

Reviews.Title: “Sad stay”
Reviews.Author: TravelinMissy
Reviews.Content: Between the booking problems to the down right rude treatment- this favorite has fallen off the list of favorite. When the vacation was booked we booked a 3 bedroom suite. On the arrival day a friend needed to check in for me due to my flight being delayed. I called and spoke with reservations and was told it would be fine. Well it wasn't, by the time my friend got to the counter our reservations had been lost - and to make matters worse the front desk gave the friend a hassle for checking in. After our entire party arrived, the suite we were supposed to be in was just adjoining rooms. The next morning I went to talk to the manager. The manager was sarcastic and rude and asked "what do you want me to do about this ?" I explained the situation again and was offered a free breakfast. Serious!?? All that and just a free breakfast??!!!! Then we had called to participate in the "green" program everyday we were there (4 nights). We were given a coupon for 1 room, 1 night. It should have been 3 rooms for 4 nights- then I called the "green" phone number and was hung up on. And I was also told that they couldn't do anything else, because we "are in a recession". I have been staying here for years- not any more After we got home I tried to email Hilton worldwide only to find out this is a seperate entity.

Reviews.Title: “A solid mid-level Vegas value”
Reviews.Author: PokerStorm
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed four days at the LV Hilton in mid-August 2011 and it was a pleasant experience overall. It’s an older hotel that shows its age in some respects while the rooms have been nicely updated. The rates are much less than a higher-end locale like the Encore, Venetian, or Bellagio while still offering nice accommodations. An Elvis statue greets you upon arrival; the front desk staff was courteous and fairly speedy upon our arrival. (Elvis performed here for several years in the early 1970's). Our room was a standard king and had the traditional appointments: a mini-fridge, nice-sized HD TV, safe, ironing board with iron, and a hair dryer in the bathroom. The 18th floor view was fabulous, overlooking downtown on the left with the rugged Nevada mountains on the right. The room was clean and the bed/pillows were VERY comfortable. You can indulge in pay entertainment via a wireless keyboard control interfaced to the TV, or by the traditional remote. The safe cost $3 a day and the bottled water in the room was $4. I found this annoying but it's SOP in Vegas (and most hotels) these days. Service was speedy: our room only had two pillows, so we called for a couple more and they arrived within five minutes. However, there should have been two extra in the closet so shame-shame on that point. The casino is less raucous than some of the newer spots such as the Wynn which we also visited on this trip. The Elvis feel wind throughout through the period appointments used. The gaming staff was friendly and the table limits were about $5 less for blackjack or craps compared to newer strip locales. Overall it was a pleasant if not overly thrilling gambling experience. The average patron is in their 40s, with younger players a minority but still significant portion of the casino crowd. One disappointment: The Las Vegas Hilton does not have a poker room, so card players need to seek satisfaction elsewhere. There's a pastry bistro on the ground floor with very friendly staff and pretty good coffee, croissants, cake and such if you have a sweet tooth or just a hankering. You'll find the customary gift shop and of course room service is available as well. We did not partake of the available buffet. The facility shows age in the casino appointments. The chandeliers and ceiling décor need a serious cleaning as they are yellow with nicotine and dust. The carpets could use a good cleaning as well, but the place was not dirty per se, and I didn’t see any trash about. The wait staff was quick to pick up used drinks and offer you fresh ones even on the quarter slots. The hallways from the reception area to the elevators are also quite dated; in all the LV Hilton is a hodge-podge of various décor styles with a classy old Vegas feel when you walk in and a “please remodel me” suggestion on the way to your room. The location of the LV Hilton is a bit inconvenient. You will need a taxi to visit downtown or other places on the strip like the Mirage, Bellagio or Venetian. The Las Vegas monorail stops at the LV Hilton so this helps reduce the inconvenience, although the monorail is not cheap. A 3-day pass costs about thirty bucks a piece. Overall, I can recommend it as a good mid-level resting place with comfortable rooms and friendly staff/

Reviews.Title: “Stay at your own risk”
Reviews.Author: Darin_and_Christi
Reviews.Content: Ok I think this was the worst experience I've had at a hotel anywhere. We had rooms at a different hotel and it was crappy so we booked here instead thinking it'd be decent it's a Hilton they've been in the business for awhile. We checked in a little late around 9 pm or so, so check in went smooth the staff was friendly the place smelled beautiful they had fresh night blooming jasmine in beautiful vases at the counter. That was the best part of the whole experience. We went upstairs to our room and walked in I'm sure the couple making love were much more horrified then we were, we at least had our clothes on. Seems they forgot to note the room was taken. Should have remembered why we stopped booking rooms through Hilton This happened to us before on a trip to San Francisco where we walked into a room occupied by two dogs that were none to friendly. So we go downstairs and were apologized to, given an upgrade and sent on our way to yet another occupied room people clothes were strewn about and towels luckily it looked like they were out for the evening so this time at least no yelling. We were given free buffets and an upgrade to a lanai suite and another apology. We were informed we couldn't talk to the hotel manager because he was in a meeting but they'd be sure to let him know about it. So this room was unoccupied and would be pretty if not for the stain on the carpet and the cigarette burn next to the bed. The bed was big and comfy the view of the golf course was lovely though they neglected to clean the ash tray on the patio. The bathroom was spacious but unfortunately there was rotting wood on the walls near the bottom though that is do to I'm sure to the large walk in showers with rain style overhead shower heads real nice place to shower I admit. The countertop in the bathroom was water streaked and dusty but my husband cleaned it with water because by this time we were fed up. The beautiful plasma TV in the parlor was broken so we were only able to use the standard one in the bedroom for us not a big deal but for someone who has booked and paid the asking price for this room yeah it's going to be a problem and if you're only staying a few days be warned it takes at least two to get someone to look at the TV according to the gentleman who came to see if he could help us out. Housekeeping will open the door without knocking here just to let you know even if you leave a do not disturb sign on the door so with all the miscommunication about rooms which by the way according to the front desk is housekeeping's fault I suggest you double bolt I got to see how the couple we walked in out felt the next morning do to this fun quirk. I think Hilton might want to invest in getting housekeeping proper training. After being walked in on, my husband was not in the best of moods so this time he wanted to speak to the manager. Kevin O Brian was the gentleman he spoke to and I have to say though none of last nights problems had been mentioned to him he was very apologetic seemed sincerely to be embarrassed about the situation comped our internet I do feel he was sincere but the whole experience left a bad taste in my mouth and I have no real intention of staying on any Hilton property which is a shame I love Vegas and tend to only gamble at the hotel I book my room in and do most of my shopping on property as these getaways are my me time. I didn't gamble or leave the room much at all! What if the person they gave key's to my room wasn't as honest as we were I bring my laptop and jewelry with me as many people do plus I was going to a wedding in Arkansas after this particular get away so I had a lot of valuables on me at the time. I almost didn't go to the show I'd purchased tickets for but Mr O Brian put a not e in the computer that no one was to touch the room unless me or my husband personally invited them in. All in all I have to say I probably should have stayed at the crappy little hotel downtown at least they gave me an unoccupied room with a working television without a bunch of hassle.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but not so busy”
Reviews.Author: markmctaggart
Reviews.Content: Got a really good deal, paid only $41 for the room and was also upgraded to a suite. Room was really comfy, only problem was casino was not busy so ended up going to the strip for better entertainment. If you dont want to gamble, this is a good option for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent rooms. Excellent location.”
Reviews.Author: angelaj07
Reviews.Content: The Las Vegas Hilton was an awesome value for the money. I will definitely will be booking another stay in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Dated and tired but ok for a couple of nights”
Reviews.Author: tint7003
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights in August. The hotel is huge and has seen better days. Communal areas are tired and dated and the whole place has a rather weary feel to it. The location is some way from the Strip although this is easily accessible via the Monorail at $5 a ride. The room we were alloctaed was ok - good size, reasonable condition, but very small bathroom. With our Hhonors gold card we got a free breakfast in the buffet which offered a huge choice. We didn't appreciate being charged $3 a night to use the in-room safe which seems to be penny pinching in the extreme. Overall we left feeling this was an Ok stay but two nights was enough and next time we'd stay on the Strip.

Reviews.Title: “Clean rooms, great swimming pool & good entertainment”
Reviews.Author: CottonTreeManagement
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here in celebration of our 10th wedding anniversary. We had 8 of our closest friends join us at the Las Vegas Hilton. The rooms and bathrooms were very nice and clean. It was apparent the carpet and furnishings had been recently replaced and the beds were very comfy. However, the bathrooms were a bit outdated, specifically the tile was a bit retro. The in-room amenities included : LCD Television, Alarm Clock w/ Radio, Work Desk, High Speed Wi-fi (for a fee, which was expected as most full service hotels do charge), Pay-per-view movies, In room safe (for a fee) and their is a hair dryer but it's located in the closet. We had dinner in Benihana's the restaurant the first night. The food was good and plentiful, however be prepared to spend $40 or more per person(not including alcohol or gratuity). We enjoyed the buffet breakfast in the restaurant, which was $20.00 per person, but it included unlimited mimosas, champagne and beer. The food was very good ... for a buffet. I enjoyed spending some time at the pool on Saturday afternoon. We enjoyed the live DJ's, 2 for 1 drink specials, and discounted appetizers during happy hour. On Saturday night we enjoyed seeing the Doors cover band "Wild Child" on property. Plus by mentioning we are fans of the Las Vegas Hilton on facebook, received a discount off the show tickets. The location was perfect for us. It is a few blocks away from the strip, but we still had easy access by taxi or monorail. One benefit of being off the strip, was that we were able to come home to a nice quiet room and get a good night's rest. Overall it was a great stay. We will definitely stay here in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Still a Fabulous Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Kimo688889
Reviews.Content: We book one trip in late August to place out yearly football bets. The BEST Sportsbook in Vegas is still the Hilton. We arrived late Thursday and checked out Saturday morning. We were comped and ate at the buffet. The video poker machines were loose and the place was hopping in ancticipation of football next week. Check in was a breeze with a very friendly staff member and she upgraded us from a comp room! There are always 20 taxis in front. The monorail stops at the hotel and can take you to the Strip. We had the best time and you will too. One downer: when leaving our room we passed the most beautiful prostitute and 2 security guards chasing her down the hallway. Lucky guy!

Reviews.Title: “VERY BAD EXPERIENCE”
Reviews.Author: cathchris75
Reviews.Content: We unfortunately had a very old fashioned room need of refurbishment - the worst was to find the bedsheets "dirty" - sorry but never again in this hotel only positive point : breakfast buffet is very good with a lot of choice meals view from strip rooms is although very nice - manager was embarassed and helpful for solving our problems however good luck !

Reviews.Title: “Not bad but didn't care for the smoky casino.”
Reviews.Author: audio1pro
Reviews.Content: I was there for a two day seminar. The facilities were adequate for the classes and although they had attepmted to update the room decor, it was still very spartan and mediocre. I'm 6'3 and barely fit in the shower...the spigot was at my chest. Hated having to walk thru the noisy, smoky casino to get to my classes which were across the way in the convention area. But the price and location were right. Would NEVER stay here otherwise

Reviews.Title: “APA NATIONAL POOL TOURNAMENT AND PLEASURE”
Reviews.Author: raaj_in
Reviews.Content: It was a great stay, very conveniently located and very well maintained clean and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “The most disappointing Hilton I have ever stayed at!”
Reviews.Author: dutchboy81
Reviews.Content: After staying at the Hilton San Francisco Union Square this hotel was the 2nd one on our itinerary and after having a chilled and wonderful stay there we weren't expecting this, from apparently the biggest Hilton in the world. We booked the Grand rooms (as like in San Francisco, we got a good deal on the rate here too so we upgraded ourselves from the money we saved to these Grand rooms). We arrived at approx 11 am and we wanted to leave our luggage (as we did not expect the rooms to be ready yet). The luggage desk told us we needed to check in first due to security. We queued up and when we got to the front of the queue they told me I had to go to the VIP lounge (still unsure if this was because I booked the grand rooms or what but they definitely did not do me a favour!), where we were met by 3 incredibly unapproachable ladies. The first thing one said after we said we wanted to check in was that check in was not until 3 pm. When we explained that we only needed to check in to ensure we could leave our luggage there was simply a silence for like 10 / 15 seconds before one of them went: Oh well, come here then! After all was arranged and we left our luggage we went to explore the hotel's pool area and casino. At approx 1 pm I decided to go and check if the rooms were ready and to my surprise 1 of the rooms was. We got the keys and were told we were in the North Tower. All the way at the end of the corridor, on the right. (approx 5 / 10 minute walk from reception) We got to the room and the key card didn't work so we had to go all the way back down again. With 2 new cards made I ventured back up again and while I am standing in front of the room the doors of the Scenic elevator opened and a lady with EXACTLY the same room number had a working key while we again did NOT! Naturally I was not happy and the lady in the VIP desk just laughed at me which really got me wound up! I asked her if I could go back to being a normal customer and use the normal front desk as those people there seemed a lot more capable then the VIP specialists! She just laughed nervously and found me another room which when we got there was not cleaned! So I went back and demanded to speak to the manager who I was told was not available. I demanded a solution and for someone from the VIP desk to come to the new room(s) with me which again was refused due to staffing issues. We finally had 1 room (JUHUU) but how disappointing. Yes the room was big but it was just so empty, it had a strong smell of smoke in it even though it was a non-smoking room. at 4 pm I went downstairs to pick up the keys for the second room and was told that I had to wait another hour as housekeeping went for lunch (AT 4 PM!!!!) I demanded a room and then was offered a standard room instead. I accepted and told them there and then that I would be checking out the next day (out of a 5 night stay), as I simply had had enough of the whole situation!!! Back in the room, someone was knocking the door so we opened it and to our surprise another couple was given OUR room and problem was that they insisted we'd leave... In the end I had to push the guy out of my room and shut the door is his face! But this really simply should not be happening! Then the safety deposit box... EXACTLY the same safe as they have in San Francisco so I knew how to operate it. However the only difference was you had to call a number to activate it. At NO POINT did it mention I was to be charged USD 3.00 per day! Honestly shocking, FOR A SAFE??? Boarding pass printing, USD 1.50 per sheet! This hotel is just a joke and take you for all they possibly can. There is no excuse about them not having resort fees! Again, San Francisco had exactly the same facilities as the Las Vegas property so I could call San Francisco a resort as well, and they don't charge extra for basic services! Overall, avoid this hotel by all cost! My travel agent got me an amazing deal for the remaining nights at the Venetian, on the condition I was to not ask for a refund for my unused nights at the Hilton, as they said that hotel was a pain to deal with and it would take weeks before anyone from the hotel would have written back. The Venetian was amazing and such a joy to stay at.

Reviews.Title: “Favorite Las Vegas Hotel”
Reviews.Author: RangerBobN
Reviews.Content: It's still Vegas, and has all that atmosphere of being close to the Strip, but without the frenzy of actually being on the Strip. I feel like there's just too much on Las Vegas Blvd to take for more than a few hours. So having the ability to go back to the hotel off the Strip, to eat, hang out at the sports book, drop a few bucks off in the casino, or to get some quiet and sleep in my room for a bit - it seems essential to enjoy what in Vegas if you're staying for more than a day or two. The upgraded rooms are great, which we always feel is way worth the surcharge, and if we want to just enjoy the hotel, that's easy to do as well. This is my favorite place to stay in Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay”
Reviews.Author: Kansas_Girl51697
Reviews.Content: Friendly staff and Ok rooms....stayed in one of the older rooms and it seemed a bit tired. Very clean rooms and helpful staff!

Reviews.Title: “Still a good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: ILuv2Mingle
Reviews.Content: I stay here often because of the location, customer service and rooms. I'm not sure what happened this time, but the floor in the hallway and elevator area was VERY dirty. It didn't appear to be dirt from just a day or two, the carpet needed a serious cleaning. The amount of food, dirt and dust in the hall was unbelievable. BUT, as usual, the room was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Great for anyone who needs to be near the LV Convention Center.”
Reviews.Author: broad_abroad
Reviews.Content: Yes, it's nominally 'off strip' and yes the center tower is older and some of the rooms have seen better days. However, my bed was big and comfy after pulling long days in an exhibitor's booth, the wireless high-speed internet worked without a hitch, and room service was both courteous and prompt with good food. Skip the restaurants and order in! Also, you have an option to skip every day domestic service and get a $10.00 voucher. ACE. I'll be staying here again, there's a skyway walk right to the Convention Center - and on a day when it's 115F, that's a really big deal.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay there again.”
Reviews.Author: pat_ton69
Reviews.Content: It is an older hotel I Vegas but for the money it was not bad. I found the room to be clean and comfortable. The line at check in was long, but it was at every hotel we walked thru. The casino was not busy and was not much fun. The monorail station is right at the Hilton so it is easy to get to the strip.

Reviews.Title: “second visit here”
Reviews.Author: anneknowles
Reviews.Content: We love this hotel! Just the fact that this is the second time staying here says it all! We stayed in a renovated room, it was a premium room so can't let you know what other rooms are like, but it was a good size, clean, nice bathroom and comfortable bed. The staff were helpful and friendly, dining options were good and location fine. Will be staying again when next visiting Vegas

Reviews.Title: “Never again!”
Reviews.Author: DMCITravel
Reviews.Content: I am a travel agent. Of course, Las Vegas is one of the most popular spots in the country. I have used and recommended many of the mid-range and high-end hotels (Cosmopolitan, New York New York, Treasure Island, etc). Given a choice of several hotels with specials earlier this month, my clients picked the Las Vegas Hilton. Not my favorite, but they were only staying two nights. It turned out to be worst than imaginable. They said the room was filthy, the staff was rude and they wound up leaving and staying somewhere else. I have complained, but there has been no resolution (I think my clients should have their money refunded). I would never ever recommend this hotel and if any clients even hinted at staying at the Las Vegas Hilton, I would throw myself in front of the cab,

Reviews.Title: “Love the monorail”
Reviews.Author: qualtyk9
Reviews.Content: We stay in the Hilton for a conference that is held in Las Vegas each year in August. We are Hilton Points members- the most important thing to note is that if you book your stay through Expedia or another aggregate you do not get your points. I not sure why we didn't go through their site this time but the savings was not worth losing the free nights stay over. Bummed about that but back to the hotel. The restaurants are awesome- they've "removed" the star trek theme but the bathrooms and bar are still the same so it's a bit weird now-giggle. The monorail- still a favorite from this hotel- the sun in the summer is just too intense even for this summer lovin' girl. The rooms are the me as my prior posts. Hit Happy hour by the pool. It still has music and games and other fun stuff. Worth a stop if you have down time. The gifts are usually pretty cool and the music lively. Not club lively so it's a nice in-between. The restaurants are a bit overpriced and sometimes crowded. We saw the magician that performs there eating in the steak restaurant. The gaming tables kept my husband's friend quite busy but didn't leave him too broke. He was able to play with a reasonable amount of money for a really long time.

Reviews.Title: “Dont Stay Here!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Wd43sebring
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here the 17th of Aug for 3 nights. Lets just say this hotel has seen better days. I usually love Hilton Hotels, however this place is a dump. The down stairs is fine but we were given the 27th floor. In our room the furniture needs complete replacing, the carpet in the hallways need to be vacuumed. The only thing I can say was good was the fact it was clean. The bed was horrible. We left the South Point Casino which was Wonderful to come to this dump. We will never stay at this Hilton again. There are a few hotels in Las Vegas that have been around a while and this is one of them. Thank GOD this was the end of my vacation and not the beginning. We went to celebrate my husbands 50th. Again we will always stay at the South Point Casino and Spa, I suggest if your reading this you do that same.

Reviews.Title: “Mmmmm”
Reviews.Author: Rsixtysix
Reviews.Content: Extraordinary lack of service. No coffee making facilities and fridge in room. No security in hotel, anyone can access lifts and corridors - worrying esp since hotel is very busy.

Reviews.Title: “The price made it a good choice”
Reviews.Author: EmeraldMoon
Reviews.Content: It is not a fancy place, it is not on the strip and the pool is not awesome by Vegas standards but for under a hundred bucks, it was nice. The rooms were great - not large but clean and modern with super soft and comfy bedding. I would not stay here if coming to Vegas with friends but for a place to stay when passing through, I was content.

Reviews.Title: “Still a nice place to stay and a very good value if you have a players club card.”
Reviews.Author: annieAustin
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here several times over the years. We read about the hotel's debt problem and that Hilton is looking for a buyer, but the room rate specials and coupons were hard to resist. Our room was fine, very clean and comfortable. The service, the buffet, the Trent Carlini show and the pool were all very good, and the Fortuna coffee bar has the best sandwiches and dessserts, so good! The Hilton is not as loud or crowded as the strip hotels, and for us that was a good thing.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for our wedding”
Reviews.Author: ajwm03
Reviews.Content: We had our wedding at the La Bella Chapel her, it was perfect. We had about 20 people travel with us and they accommodated requests for rooms near each other and a request for my new husband and I to be away from the group. The casino is nice, not very busy, cocktails waitresses provided quick fast service. The brunch buffet was just ok, good food just nothing spectacular.

Reviews.Title: “Bad experience.”
Reviews.Author: christina s
Reviews.Content: I'm not much of a review junkie, so bear with me. I reserved a room for a 4 day weekend. My plans abruptly changed, and I cancelled my reservation (08/01) 4 days prior to my reservation date, no biggie. I call the LV hilton two days (08/03) following, inquiring as to when my deposit would be returned and was informed it can take from 10 days - 2 weeks. Again, understandable. I wait 16 days from my cancellation date and still my deposit hasn't been returned. Slightly irritated. I call again to inquire as to when I should expect my refund. As a side note, the card I originally booked the hotel with was lost and was cancelled the weekend I was supposed to stay at the LV hilton. I explain to the woman on the phone that the card was lost, but that my reservation had been cancelled prior to that. Afterward the call goes similar, but not verbatim, to this : Woman: I can't look up your reservation without the card used on the account. Me: That card has been cancelled and is no longer in my possesion Woman: Well as I said, I can't look up the reservation or cancellation without that card number. Me : I have my confirmation for both the reservation and cancellation, can you look it up with that? Woman: No, as I already told you, I need the card number. (To myself : what the hell is the purpose of a confirmation number then?!) Me : Alright, so I'm going to lose my deposit? Woman: No, that's not what I said at all, what I'm saying is, why don't you try and call your bank and ask for the card number, and then I'll be able to help you. Me: Awesome, thank you! In all honesty this employee's tone of voice was extremely rude through the entire conversation. My apologies for not knowing I could get ahold of the deactivated card number. After calling my financial institution and jumping through fiery hoops, I obtain the card number, smooth sailing right? Wrong. I call the LV Hilton back and speak to another individual (who might I add was extremely helpful and personable) by the name of Sheryl. I tell her the situation, she looks up my reservation, then tells me that my reservation was never cancelled. I tell her that I have a confirmation email stating that it was, and she then asks me to forward that email to her address. Ok, not a problem. After all of this runaround I'm told that my refund for my deposit will start to be processed, but may take 2 weeks to be returned. Again, more waiting. I completely empathize with clerical and accounting errors, but with the rude customer service as a cherry on top...I won't consider booking with this hotel ever again! Word to the wise, it'll have been over a month before my deposit for that weekend is returned to me. If you enjoy giving your money away to someone who may or may not give it back based on the proof YOU have that everything was done by the book....by all means, book here.

Reviews.Title: “Best Value for Your Money”
Reviews.Author: AfshinM
Reviews.Content: My family and i stayed at the Las Vegas Hilton for 3 nights. We booked two rooms - which were upgraded upon arrival to a larger suite with sunken living area. The hotel is at the north end of the strip (behind the old Sahara Hotel). The rooms were clean and the service was top notch. If you have a car then this is the best hotel to stay at. Its only 5-10 minute drive to the center of the strip (Bellagio). If you don't have a car you can always hop on the monorail (in front of the hotel). As someone who has been to many 4 and 5 star hotels worldwide, I enjoyed my stay at the LV Hilton. It's not as glitsy and luxurious as Bellagio and Venetian. But then again are you going to Vegas to sit in your hotel room? This hotel is still far better than MGM Grand, Flamingo, Mirage, Treasure Island, Luxor, and many others on the strip. We got a great price with buffet breakfast and many other freebies. The buffets (both breakfast and lunch) were excellent. While the hotel is not as new as some of the hotels on the strip, it has history. Elvis used to live at this hotel back in the 1960s and 70s while in Vegas. The pool area was decent - wish it was a bit larger. The casino did not smell like smoke when we were there. Some of the reviews on this page arenot accurate and aim to discredit the hotel. The hotel is great for people with families who do not want drunk people roaming the hotel. The security at the hotel was tight. I hope that Hilton does not end their contract with this property as it has lots of potential. With a bit of investment and face lift this hotel could easily give Bellagio a run for the money.

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME EXPERIENCE”
Reviews.Author: NORMA H
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel over the weekend and had a wonderful experience. From check in, dining, playing at the casino and check out, my husband and myself had a great time. Staff were very friendly, helpful and accommodating. We used the monorail for getting to and from the strip and it worked out just fine. The walking did us a lot of good. I highly recommend this hotel for your next stay. The Harrison's Edinburg, TX 78539

Reviews.Title: “Just an average hotel now”
Reviews.Author: Mimaboy
Reviews.Content: We had never stayed at the Las Vegas Hilton but the deal was good using Vegas.com. If you are a HHonors member and book via another site other than Hilton, you will not get points from Hilton but will be able to use your HHonors number to use the gym/spa. If you are Gold member and above, your breakfast buffet is comped. Other than that, unless you are a Platinum HHonors guest, you won't receive anything else for your loyalty to Hilton. NOTE - reception did not tell us about the breakfast comp, male representative who checked us in was not exactly rude but definitely needs a course in providing great customer service. (The older hotels little off the main strip need to do that part of a guest's stay better than any other hotel if they want to keep guests coming back in spite of the little inconvenience of not being main-strip located. This guy failed.) We stopped at the HHonors portion of the front desk later next day to find out we could use the spa and get our breakfast comp'd since we are Gold members. Would have been nicer if the first representative when we checked in had been that helpful. While this Hilton is near the strip, VERY close to the convention center, very close to the golf course, and close to the Stratosphere, it's still about a 15-20 min walk to the Fashion Mall near TI. The casino is not crowded, there is no poker room (big drawback these days), and the restaurants/buffet are not crowded. Our room was ok, especially for the price booked via Vegas.com, it was really nothing special. Not sure when the renovation took place but the feel of the hotel is dated. Interior rooms/hallways may have been renovated but the exterior is very 70-80'ish. I will say one great thing about our room was the fantastic bedding. Seriously, I haven't slept that well in a long time, not even at home. Very few cable TV choices. Buffet decor is really tired and seems to have no discernible theme/color scheme. It's a mis-mash of furniture, wall decorations and colors. We didn't eat there other than breakfast and it was pretty good. There are many offerings, the fruit was really good. Stay away from the biscuits, hard, tasteless and definitely not made in the kitchen there. Maybe they are ok if you cover them in gravy? Otherwise, it's a typical Las Vegas breakfast buffet. There is a business center and you are charged by the MINUTE if you don't buy a day pass. It's open 24 hours a day, staffed during normal business hours and you can get mail, send mail, etc when it's staffed. Hotel advertises wireless but it's something like $19 a day - SERIOUSLY - why would anyone pay that when you can go down the street to the Starbucks, taking your money elsewhere for coffee and getting free WIFI. Again, if we hadn't booked via Vegas.com, as Gold members we would have had free internet. This is a little thing to a hotel when it comes to providing great customer service and ensuring return visitors. Even tho our primary loyalty program in HHonors, we won't stay at this particular Hilton again.

Reviews.Title: “Different Style of Hilton, It's All Good.”
Reviews.Author: ypwalter
Reviews.Content: It is a little bit further from the strip. However, the nearby area is clean and quite. It has light rail for people to go to the strip and other places. It is quite different from other Hilton. It has shops and casino in first floor. Also, bar and dancing place down there. Different design of restaurants! By combining many ingredients. It never made you felt any degraded in this hotel. If u happened to be gold/diamond member, you will have 2 free breakfast buffet. It is like most las vegas buffet. All different food and wine! Some little shortages like the room is a little old, the fan might make some sounds. Also, the shower room is not good as expected. BUT, this is based on expectations to a 5star hotel. It is still 5 star, just as time goes (like excabuli and treasure island....)...It became a little bit old. It is all good anyway!!

Reviews.Title: “ALWAYS ENJOYED STAYING HERE”
Reviews.Author: cruiseralmary
Reviews.Content: We checked in on Sunday evening. They DID not have a King/no smoking room available even though we requested it when we made the reservation. We were informed that we could go back in 2 hours when there would be available rooms. We were given a room with 2 full size beds/no smoking in the interm.. The room was OLD and OUTDATED. No way we would stay there. Went swimming for 2 hours then went back to the front desk. They gave us a king bed/no smoking room. The pool was very relaxing. Only draw back is that it closes too early at 8. One more hour would have been fine. Went to the spa, and it was very relaxing and not very many people. Did eat at the buffet for dinner on Tuesday and it was great. Complimentary beer and wine. The prime rib and shrimp tasted great. I would definitely will stay there again. Finally, they will comp you $10 if you forgo the Maid Service. We did because we don't need the bed made everyday.

Reviews.Title: “Did not care that guests of hotel had nowhere to park due to concert at hotel.”
Reviews.Author: drakefamily07
Reviews.Content: Overall pleased with hotel. Pool hours are terrible only 8am to 8 pm so kids were very disappointed after a long day of activities and not able to swim late in the evening. When we returned to our room on Saturday night we were told there was no parking at the hotel due to a large concert and over 6000 attending. Hotel staff and management were not accommodating and all they could say is we didn't plan on this happening. Hotel should restrict parking for public during special events so registered guests have a place to park their car. We chose this hotel due to it being off the strip and more family friendly since we were traveling with our children. Instead my husband had to drop us off and go from parking garage to parking garage for other hotels until he found a place to park and then walk blocks back to our hotel. Also no coffee makers in the rooms!

Reviews.Title: “Great value for a nice stay in Vegas.”
Reviews.Author: Lafdwifey
Reviews.Content: We've stayed in the Hilton twice in the last month, most recently for a work conference. It is definitely driving distance to most tourist attractions. But for the conference, e (at the Riviera) it was perfect. When we first booked a room here we were definitely leery because of all the negative reviews on Trip Advisor. The first stay here made the negative reviews seem awfully silly, I mean for a king size suite for $49 a night its a great value. My one piece of advice would be to check the bathroom before you get settled in to your room because some of the showers have a bad smell of mildew. When this happend we simply phoned downstairs & switched rooms no problem. It may not compare to the Hilton experience in Hawaii but it's a great value & the staff here is great! We'll be staying here next time we pass through Vegas if we get a similar deal through Priceline the next time as well.

Reviews.Title: “Tired”
Reviews.Author: jack1953
Reviews.Content: First let me say that the Las Vegas Hilton is a great value. The room rates are very reasonable and the restaurants were good and inexpensive by Vegas standards. We stayed at this hotel about 10 years ago and nothing seems to have changed. The room was dated but very clean. Reception on the TV was very poor. I don't go to Las Vegas to watch TV but before I go to bed I usually wind down in front of the television. The pool area is the same as 10 years ago also and could have been cleaner. We got there first thing in the morning. There was cigarette butts and papers under our lounges both mornings. This hotel is very children friendly. Kids everywhere and dozens at thethe pool. Many of these children were infants and in their parents arms. A little uncomfortable. I know what infants and small children do in pools and there were lots of them. This hotel was not up to the expected Hilton standard. The Las Vegas Hilton was worth the price but next time I'll spend a little more to get a little more.

Reviews.Title: “Just ok”
Reviews.Author: sandals cay
Reviews.Content: A quick 3 nite stay Aug 7-10.Stayed in a Grand room on the 21st floor,which was supposed to be a non-smoking floor,but this policy obviously was not not enforced.Good size room,nice view,but the included room safe was actually $3 per day which is not what the room description states.Entire lobby,casino,and public areas stink of smoke.Nice to be on the monorail,but would probably not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “we stay here before it was great that why we came back”
Reviews.Author: trina1969
Reviews.Content: the only thing we saw was wrong was that the tub need to be replaced,and the prices on the menu we ordered wings toooo expensive 25 dollars for a 8 piece wings and we ask for them to be crispy and they wasn't we ask for a new crispy order they say they couldn't so we just wasted 25dollars for something we didn't eat cause they wasn't cooked rite i think they should have refunded me my money..that was very bad customer service.we don''t mine paying for what we ask for.but this was a waste to us.

Reviews.Title: “A first class hotel”
Reviews.Author: AFloridaGirl
Reviews.Content: A big thank you to the Hilton senior management for ensuring my 30th anniversary visit was fantastic! We had a beautiful suite and the weekend was perfect. I saw nothing about the Hilton to complain about and many things to compliment. We checked in within minutes in the VIP lounge. As Diamond level we received free brunch/breakfast which offered everything you could want for breakfast and then some. We were in the East tower and parking was convenient right out the back door. All the staff we encountered were very friendly and I can highly recommend the Hilton.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It!”
Reviews.Author: mlmoore3
Reviews.Content: The room was great! The staff was awesome and the buffet was even better.

Reviews.Title: “Very, Very, Nice.”
Reviews.Author: GotuwanPankshin
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights from the 27th- 29th July 11. Loved the complimentary valet parking, make sure you call ahead with your ticket number before you come down (long wait). I had a king room with a view of the strip. Vary spacious, check out the pool on the 3rd floor, they play some good music. Hotel buffet has a great food layout with unlimited wine and beer, $21 per head. The only downer for me was the fact there was no microwave in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Stay”
Reviews.Author: Joemar27
Reviews.Content: I was at the LV Hilton for the Elvis Festival and had an enjoyable stay. Everything you need is right at the hotel. The Paradise cafe has very friendly waitresses and quick service. Short walk to the Rivera to see Gary Lewis and the Playboys one night. One of the best things about the LV Hilton is the monorail has a stop at the hotel. So, I was able to avoid taxi and rentals fees by taking the monorail up to the Bally, Paris and Ceasars Palace. BTW, the 11am backstage tour of the Jubliee show at Bally, given by one of the showgirls, is worth the money. Walking distance to the convention center. This hotel is no longer a Hilton and will be changing it's name. Of course, Elvis fans want it to go back to the International which was what it was called when it opened in 1969. It's an older property now, but for $40 a night ($80 on weekends) it is a very good choice

Reviews.Title: “Guest Services?”
Reviews.Author: lindsaymohn
Reviews.Content: Requested wake-up calls on two consecutive days. On day one, I received a wake-up call at the correct time. Four hours later, an employee knocked on my door, which had the 'do not disturb' tag hanging from the handle, to ask if I had gotten a wake-up call. That's a new one. That evening, I called to report trouble with my internet connection, and was told they would send a tech up. A few minutes later I was able to reconnect, so I called and canceled the tech request. Six hours later, at two o'clock in the morning, and with the 'do not disturb' tag still hanging from the doorknob, a tech arrived, and knocked until he woke me up, to see if I still needed help. When told I had canceled the request, his reply was simply 'oh'. The next morning, my six o'clock wake up call did not happen. Fortunately, I woke up about a half hour later, and made my flight on time, in spite of feeling pretty rushed to get to the airport. Overall, the staff seemed clueless, except at the pool, where they had five cheery people handing out towels. It is often true that you get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed here for the HIGH Hilton standards but was disappointed”
Reviews.Author: teejones111
Reviews.Content: We LOVE Hilton hotels and choose to stay here for our vacation because of the usually very high standards in all that Hiltons offer. Unfortunately this was not even close to living up to Hilton standards. Don't get me wrong the staff was as usual friendly, helpful, and amazing. Our room was large and offered plenty of seating and room! The carpets were dirty. My son instantly found beads on the floor from a previous guest and no not hidden in a corner behind the bed but right when we walked on the carpet. The tile was so dirty I took a cloth to it to clean it so we didn't slip (possible sunscreen, I honestly don't know what it was) but the white towel was black after I cleaned the floor. The sheets had stains and a pillow also had stains on one of the beds. The shower and bathroom smelled of mold or something and the walls looked like their was something growing on them near the floor. The same was found in another bathroom as well on a different floor by people we met at the pool. The pool area was beautiful with plenty of chairs and even shade areas. The pool itself however was FILTHY! Giant hair balls floating around, various other things floating in it, and they allow their guests to smoke in the pool so there are ashes in the pool as well. Very disappointing. Yes it was crowded but we have never had giant hair balls attaching themselves to us as we swam in other crowded pools. These were clearly things that had been growing in the pool for quite some time. Also watch your money with the gals that come around offering you drinks. They don't bring change! This happened twice!! Save your tip money and walk to the bar. No one should have to pay $5 for an iced-tea. This was simply not a hotel that lives up to the Hilton standard. We are not the type of people to complain but we wanted to hopefully save some people their money. There are other Hiltons in the area and maybe they are awesome. This one does offer the monorail system on site which was fantastic but not worth all the other nasty things. Save your money and stay on the strip at that Hilton or somewhere else. We have stayed at MANY Hiltons and this is one you should skip. Sorry for all the negativity we just want you to be aware!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Time!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: soniaLO
Reviews.Content: My family & I stayed at the Hilton for three days. We had a wonderful time! The staff was soo nice, the rooms were very clean and the price was just right. We were celebrating my daughter & nephew birthdays. They were telling 13 yrs old and wanted to do something different. We decided to have a day by the pool. We ended up getting a cabana for the day. The kids loved it and so did we. Our attendant was really nice and made sure we had everything. The Hilton was very child friendly! We will be back for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Wedding in Vegas a disappointment”
Reviews.Author: Steph56002
Reviews.Content: Wow, just returned from a long weekend at the Las Vegas Hilton for a destination wedding - what a disappointment. Guest rooms were mediocre, our room had obviously had a water leak behind the wallpaper and instead of replacing the wallpaper, it was hung back up with masking tape! The chapel is nice, but the air conditioning is so loud that we could not hear the minister - and, we were sitting in the 2nd row of pews! The Las Vegas Hilton is old and definitely showing it's age. Would check out other hotels if you are considering a destination wedding in Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Need to consentrate less on volume, more on quality.”
Reviews.Author: mesagabj
Reviews.Content: First night, couldn't provide my husband and I with a king size bed in a premium room that we reserved even when I called to advise of a late check-in. Second day, moved us to a king bed room in the morning. We unpacked, went to the unskimmed pool for a few hours, and returned to our room to find the bathroom flooding from a leak from the bathroom above. Third room had a king bed, but wasn't in as good condition as the second before the flooding. The surface seemed clean, but lots of stains, scuffed walls and doors, clocks with wrong times, tv remote needing new battery, curtains hard to operate, no bottom fitted sheet. I know these seem minor by themself, but when combined and your paying an average $100 per night for their mid-grade room, I think these small details should be part of the daily maintenance checks. We went on a weekend getaway to get away and stay somewhere nicer than our home. Instead, it seemed we were staying at a motel 6.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel was nice”
Reviews.Author: mom2w-h
Reviews.Content: We stayed here again this past 4th of July and thought it was time to update my review. We've actually stayed here for the 4th of July for the past 4 years. The hotel I read was losing it's Hilton status as of January 2012, so I thought I would out a review in before it changes. The rooms have been remodeled and are very nice--the beds are quite comfortable with higher end mattresses. This visit we stayed in their 'strip view' room, which is an upgraded room. The strip is about 1 mile from the hotel, so you can see the other hotels far away. With the upgraded room there's a refridgerator and upgraded bath ammenities. We were going to stay in the Resort level rooms, but that doesn't include free Wi-Fi anymore, which caused us to change our room. Wi-Fi is $15/day. Location--it's not really on the strip, but the monorail station is right off of the front entrance so you can get to the strip easily. Be prepare to walk when you get to the other casinos if you're travelling on the monorail--all the stations are at the back of the resorts. Sometimes it's about a block or more to get to the front. Casino--some of the slots machines have changed and there seems to be less machines than before. Probably due to the economy. With the closing of the Star Trek experience, that part of the casino has changed into a lounge with multiple couches and chairs. There's a stage area of entertainment on the weekends Buffet--it was truly a disappointment. Luckily, it was free--I would have been very mad if I had to pay $19 for such poor quality. We've eaten here many times before and it was never this bad. This was suppose to be their special 4th of July menu. The prime rib was not 'prime'--it was so tough. I also got the spare ribs--way over cooked, some parts were even burnt. All the grilled meats were overcooked--the lamb chops were tougher than pork chops. No cooked vegetables other than the peppers that were grilled and a medley of carrots, broccoli, cauliflower that appeared to be from a frozen bag. No containers for cocktail sauce, so you were stuck putting it on your plate--which is not the best thing to do when eating oysters. The crab legs were salty and of poor quality. There were small mozzarella balls in a bowl by themselves with olive oil and balsamic vinegar--was that suppose to be a capresse salad?
