If it was, someone forgot to tell the staff to put tomatoes and basil in it. The free wine--the red selection was a burgundy!! Who drinks burgundy anymore?? Wasn't that from the 70's?? It would've been acceptable if it was good, but then again it came from the tap and tasted like it came from a cheap box. I think the food service supervisor and executive chef should be ashamed for putting food out like this. I've eaten at other modestly priced buffets($18-25 range) and their quality was not so poor.

Reviews.Title: “Luxe and good service”
Reviews.Author: Ballyx
Reviews.Content: Stayed here one night. When we came to our room it was a mess. After telling, we got another room that was bigger and better. Very comfortable bed, beautifull bathroom. And a nice view on the 21st floor. Location not so good. Its not on the strip. Much for almost no money.

Reviews.Title: “We loved the quiet, and relaxing vacation”
Reviews.Author: Chevolowski
Reviews.Content: The shopping center is around the corner. So if you need to make a quick run for something you forgot a mall is around the corner. If you want to make the strip, the mono rail is connected to the Hotel. I recommend this Hotel for a Family vacation. Its away from all the craziness on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Hilton Las Vegas - Worst Hilton Hotel- 4 Star ?//”
Reviews.Author: MMN_PA
Reviews.Content: Aug 1-4, 2011- Worst Hilton we ever stayed at....No way this is a 4 star hotel- Our first trip to Vegas...Service is very poor to non-existent. The hotel is run downed in most sections of the hotel. Room smelled of mold only to find out the carpet was all wet. Ruined my sandals. Called desk and they stated they would send someone right up to move us. After an hour of waiting called again, it appears they never put the request in. It took over 3 hours for them to move us, no urgency. Ruined our dinner plans. The clerks @ the front desk are lazy and not helpful. The manager was helpful in getting us moved. Ate at the buffet-f for breakfast. Food was okay. However the furniture is very run downed,outdated and cracked. Not real comfortable when you are wearing shorts. Ate @ the Beliagio Hotel HIGHLY recommend. Only stayed @the Hilton due to my Hilton Honors. BIG MISTAKE. - Avoid all HILTONS in VEGAS. -Hope this helps -from PA

Reviews.Title: “Average Business Hotel”
Reviews.Author: CommentatorC
Reviews.Content: The Las Vegas Hilton is a convenient and reasonably priced hotel to stay at if you want to be right next door to the Las Vegas Convention Center. If you're on a budget and want to splurge your entertainment money more on shows and skimp a bit on accomodations, then you can get a pretty good deal by staying at this hotel. This hotel is going through a major room renovation though so don't let yourself have too high of an expectation when it comes to your room amenities - it's pretty basic but still nonetheless "does the job" if you plan on spending most of your time out on the town! Another option if you're looking for a more updated feel to your room is to book a room at the Hilton Grand Vacation Suites. You can pick up a room there for about the same price as the Las Vegas Hilton. Overall I would rate this hotel a 3 out of 5 if you're looking to save on accomodations while in Vegas!

Reviews.Title: “Worth the price of $42/night”
Reviews.Author: ilovetoswim
Reviews.Content: I found a great deal on Orbitz and got three nights for a total of $144.00, so the price couldn't have been better. The room was large and clean, with king-sized bed, flat-screen TV, hard-wired for Internet access and even had a small desk. The bathroom was separate and clean, though basic. I didn't need to interface with the staff, so I can't comment on Customer Service. The LVH serves literally thousands of travelers each day and does so in an effeicient, albeit impersonal way. - Definitely worth the price.

Reviews.Title: “Great property off of the strip”
Reviews.Author: CrystalDuncan
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a nice property right off of the strip, this is it!! Not too far from the strip, however the monorail is 200 feet from the property. This is also the closest resort to the Convention Center. The resort has been updated and the staff works hard to keep it clean and in good condition. Everyone was really friendly, and went out of there way to cater to my needs. The Paradise Cafe has the best cheese burgers and French fries on the strip. I am a huge sports fan, so the big screen TV's were a huge bonus!

Reviews.Title: “Out of Date”
Reviews.Author: Forreal89
Reviews.Content: This hotel is getting old and the atmosphere is boring. The room is adequate but not even close to luxurious. The a/c is loud and antiquated, the carpet is gross, and there was no coffee pot in the room. As for the entire property - its very dated (even though its been "renovated") The pool area, like the room, is adequate but other properties have much more to offer! The service is also "adequate" but I was hoping for a more lively atmosphere. I felt like the employees were unhappy or bored and the casino was pretty much dead. This was my second and last stay at the LV Hilton and I suggest you look at some other properties before you book here. I really don't think its even worth the cheap room rates.

Reviews.Title: “4th of July”
Reviews.Author: karlsglass
Reviews.Content: Love the LV Hilton! Yes in some ways it's showing it's age but it's still a great place to stay in Las Vegas. It's my home away from home. 3 compaints: ! Fee for internet: but no resort fees. 2. No in room coffee, or Mini fridge, but 24 hour coffee bar in the Lobby area which is always busy. 3. NO 24 hour coffee shop.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: awrycrazy
Reviews.Content: Took a birthday trip to Vegas with my Dad, we stayed at the Las Vegas Hilton. The Hilton is a few blocks off of the strip, but the monorail stops right at it, so transportation isn't an issue (highly recommend buying three day unlimited monorail passes, then you can hop on and off as much as you like). The Hilton is huge, i know probably not as big as some on the strip, but big non the less, the hotel is well mapped out with signs, and once you've wandered a bit you'll have it mastered. Our room was on the 26th floor of the east tower, and we had a great view of the strip. The room was good sized, and the beds were really comfortable. I slept great. Something great that the hilton does, they are going green, so for each day that you opt out of having your room cleaned, and reuse your towels, you get a $10 gift certificate for use in the food establishments in the hotel. (you just have to hit the green button on your phone and tell them).. came in handy for a couple meals. We ate at the buffet once for a breakfast, and it was pretty good, i enjoyed the omelet made fresh. We had a light meal (appetizers) at Vince Neil's Cantina, which were very good. Those were the only places we tried while there. We also took in a comedy show at the Shimmer Cabaret over the weekend, they have their Icons of comedy series, bringing in some big names, we saw Hal Sparks. He was absolutely hysterical. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone traveling to Vegas. Keeps you near the strip, while being a bit quieter!

Reviews.Title: “Much better than I was expecting based on these reviews”
Reviews.Author: Zedcon1
Reviews.Content: There's no question that the Las Vegas Hilton is an older hotel, and when you look closely you'll see signs of dated decor, poor maintenance and general indifference. You'll see those in any hotel if you look closely, or if you stay long enough. A simple $20 sandwich was sufficient to bump me up to a premium room on the 27th floor of the newly renovated North Tower. The room was gorgeous -- flat screen TV, excellent bed, huge desk, comfy armchair, big bathtub, in-room fridge. The fridge didn't quite get my drinks ice-cold, and the bathroom could've used a little more light, but otherwise it was a great room. The hotel hallways looked a little shabby at 5:00 a.m., and the Space Quest bar is, without question, the nightclub equivalent of a brain-dead 104-year-old man kept alive on life support, but the food in the restaurants was adequate, the staff members I encountered were unfailingly friendly and polite, and the standard Las Vegas greed-and-desperation vibe was no worse here than it is anywhere else in town. Also, if you're in town for anything that's happening at the Convention Center, there's a monorail station 200 feet from the North Tower elevators. Short of having a chauffeur, you can't beat that for convenience.

Reviews.Title: “Check it out First”
Reviews.Author: mas4467
Reviews.Content: If you use a casino host make sure that they actually made the reservations that they said they would make for you. Flew in from out of state. Much to our surprise we had no 4 day reservation, because host failed to make them after setting up visit by phone. We were compped a pool side room which looked out at the air conditioning systems. "Check it out First" look at the inside of your room. Ours had no waste paper basket, a broken down bed, which hung below the frame and hugh dark circles of what appeared to be spilled drinks on the carpet. Several circles over 18" in diameter. You did not want to walk bare foot in the room. It smelled and we called Housekeeping to spray the room, never showed up. Also the shower leaked all the time, must save water as they ask. During our visit the hotel was overtaken with a basketball tournement. Lots of young teens from all over the country bouncing basketballs thought out the casino and hotel. Not much gaming action, slots are TIGHT.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and inexpensive”
Reviews.Author: Brian92882
Reviews.Content: My wife and I used to stay at the L V Hilton Regularly. They advertised an incredibly low rate and we wanted an inexpensive get away. The price was so low we were a little concerned the hotel may have deteriorated. We need not have worried. They hotel was still beautiful, restaurants were very good, and the staff was attentive.

Reviews.Title: “A really good stay”
Reviews.Author: Mrdbake
Reviews.Content: I generally stay away from Hilton out of principle. I just can't see paying for internet when it's free at every other hotel. Even dumps. But....there is no such thing as free internet in Vegas. I got a really good rate off of their website one stay and another good rate off of Travelocity. Service:9. Everyone was super nice and accommodating. Except one bartender. Cleanliness:9. It's probably a 10 but my OCD always finds something. Food:7. I ate at the buffet. Get there early. This hotel is off the strip but you can take the monorail there. There is a daily happy hour by the pool. 2 for 1 drinks.

Reviews.Title: “The Hilton was a great place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: eknixon
Reviews.Content: We loved the fact that the machines were placed so that smoke was not a problem for us. (only if someone smoking sat down next to us). We enjoyed eating in the buffet (shrimp was great) and the Paradise Cafe. I like the Green Option that let you used the same linens each day if we wished to get a $10 voucher each day to be used in the restaurants, buffet, or shops. The monorail was located at the back of the hotel so we could go up and down the strip for a nominal fee. The slots were great! Be sure to get a player card as we comped some meals. The only downer was the double beds instead of queen-sized. Also, there were no coffee pots in the room, but we ran out and bought one at nearby K-Mart. We booked several months in advance and got a great rate.

Reviews.Title: “Poorly managed”
Reviews.Author: OnMyWay12
Reviews.Content: We had to cut our trip short by one day and the front desk wanted to charge us a penalty fee that was more than the cost of the room for one night. Property is older, but could have been cleaner. Staff was hanging around the door to the Convention Center smoking.

Reviews.Title: “Had a Great stay”
Reviews.Author: Rosscoe68
Reviews.Content: Hilton Gold member was upgraded to one bedroom suite with comp breakfast and other perks! While it's not on the strip, a lot of the rooms over look the Vegas skyline. Room was booked via the Hilton website for a total of 44.91 US dollars, room was wonderful, the hilton beds are to die for. The resort is huge. It will no longer be a Hilton hotel at the end of the year, planning to stay again before the change

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay just off the main strip - loved it!”
Reviews.Author: adisabatino53
Reviews.Content: The hotel was clean, great place to stay with the monorail that drops you off on the strip right on the hotel site. The people that worked there were friendly and very helpful. The hotel was quiet, not like our previous stay at a casino hotel that will go nameless. If you don't want the noise and all night party atmosphere of a casino hotel I'd highly recommend the Las Vegas Hilton. If we go back we'll be booking our stay at the Hilton. The hotel pool was great, the spa and fitness center were very good with good equipment and an indoor hot tub and sauna if you prefer. The hotel is close enough to the strip that anyone who walks would find it comfortable getting around by foot; the monorail is an added bonus as it's located on site. When we arrived (husband, wife, and wife's mother) we expected two basic rooms. The hotel desk clerk upgraded us to a palatial suite for free! They also have a 'go green' policy where you elect to not have the maid service on any given day by contacting the hotel 'go green' line; by doing so, the hotel provides a $10 voucher to be used at any of their eateries. To me, it's a great place for families and there's also a casino in the hotel along with a night club and various headliner acts. The beds were great!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fun, Energetic and Well Maintained”
Reviews.Author: Lewis_and_Clark
Reviews.Content: We got checked in after only 10 minutes, and after an initial glitch (our room wasn't actually made up . . .oops!) we got settled in a great room with a view of the Strip. The room was well equipped -- the refrigerator was a nice touch. The Buffet restaurant for breakfast was EXCELLENT. The pool area was so-so. It was attractive, but the only shade was in the cabanas which one had to pay for. So it wasn't a good place for me. The beds were very very comfortable and the black out shades were great. The doors do allow a lot of noise in from the hallways but keep the fan on and you hear nothing! Overall, the hotel was quite nice, very busy with lots of energy all about. I'd definitely think about coming back again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: IkkunaGee
Reviews.Content: Fab location, lots of facilities...Monorail stop right outside...nice pool..we have throughly good time there

Reviews.Title: “ok hotel, ok gambling, ok spa, not close to strip”
Reviews.Author: keeks2020
Reviews.Content: we have stayed at the LV Hilton many times because they give us good deals. If they didn't, I would never stay here. The rooms are okay. They are upgrading slowly and some of them are nice. Ours was very basic. The pool is okay but the spa is kinda old plus they charge $20 to use it or the fitness center. The monorail goes directly there but without a car, it's a pain to get to the strip. The worst thing was they charge $14/per device for internet per day.

Reviews.Title: “1970's themed hotel....which is what it still looks like”
Reviews.Author: rrflood
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the las vegas Hilton July 5th,6th and 7th,2011. The entrance is nicely done. Unfortunately,that's the best part of the hotel. This hotel was built in the 1970's and still looks it. The casino is small in comparison to other mega resort casinos in Las Vegas. The room I stayed in was good sized and had been recently remodeled and was a non smoking room. The room was far from perfect. It had a big burn hole in the center of the carpet,looks like someone dropped there crack pipe. The room itself smelled funky,like the hotel was trying to cover up the smoke smell. The caulking around the tub was completely cracking and the shower was odd shaped for putting the soap/shampoo in. I ate at the Paradise Cafe and got a good waiter the first time and a waitress with a big chip on her shoulder the second time. When playing in the casino,the dealers were also a hit or miss. Some were outright rude,one actually asked me to hurry it up because it was just after midnight and he couldn't shut down his table until I quit playing. All in all,it's not up to par with anything on the strip and probably not as good as the Golden Nugget on Fremont Street. I probably won't stay again.

Reviews.Title: “We had a blast! Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: bamagirl74
Reviews.Content: I will have to admit that after reading the posts on TA, I wasn't expecting to be as pleased as I was with this hotel... so glad I chose the Hilton! Checking in on a Friday afternoon during the summer is a challenge and the line was excruciatingly long but once I made it to the front desk, check in was a breeze. The staff is very warm, welcoming and knowledgeable about the area. If you need to know something about Vegas, just ask. They are going to help you out! After check in, I went straight to the counter to ask about shows & restaurants. Once again, I wasn't disappointed. We were able to get tickets to the 2 shows we wanted to see and were given directions as to when & where we needed to be to pick these tickets up. Our room was on the 21st floor and was very nice! Our view was overlooking the city and at night, it was so pretty. Ate dinner @ Casa Nicola and were pleasantly surprised at the stellar service. No waiting for the table (we didn't make reservations) and were served our drinks and our dinner with very little wait time. Good food and great portions... couldn't eat it all! I've had better Italian food, but this was very good. The line for the coffee shop the next morning was long but moved quickly and we were able to sit and enjoy a quick breakfast before we started our day. We managed to hit the pool one afternoon and were pleased with it, also. Pretty crowded and lots of kids but the pool is clean and cool and staffed with lifeguards to keep an eye on things. The monorail being right outside the hotel was the main reason I chose this hotel. Didn't want to be driving around Vegas if we didn't have to and in the heat, we didn't want to walk too far. I must say, we met the nicest people in Vegas who seemed to make it their job to see we had a good time. I had read all the articles about being careful, etc. and did notice the folks standing around handing out brochures for the adult entertainment. All you have to do is smile and refuse and they will leave you alone. On our last night in Vegas, we needed to grab a quick bite and get to our last show so we chose to eat @ Tres Rios Cantina - good food and a very good margarita! All in all, our room was nice & clean, our bed was perfect, the food was very good but the people who operate this hotel make this a place we fully intend to visit again!!! I know we weren't on the Strip and were kind of removed from the nightlife, but with the monorail, that nightlife and Strip were just a hop, skip & a jump away! Love the Hilton, Las Vegas and WILL stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “For 40 bucks, but not much more”
Reviews.Author: andersaxson
Reviews.Content: I read the LVH is about to lose its Hilton fanchise (it's a Hilton Grand Vacations btw) which is a shame becuase it's sort of iconic for an off-strip hotel. I stayed here becuase I arrived at Vegas a day earlier than planned, but late at night, and it was $40. I am also HH Gold so I got upgrade, free breakfast etc etc. In the event I rocked up earlier than planned (I thought it'd just be a sleep and that's it) so decided to go to the strip, for which there is the transport that goes from the hotel to the [back of] the strip. It works well (think it's $5, but unless you are on a budget, why stay off strip?) The hotel itself is fine, free valet parking (usual in Vegas though), but not up to much and not that clean if you pull the beds away from the wall. The breakfast buffet was the usual fayre, big choice okay quality. If this hotel had been not a Hilton and any more expensive I couldn't really recommend it. But it has its place in the market I guess (a lot of cabin crew stay there, I think) so take it at face value and you won't be upset. If you want something a bit more special and to feel like you're in Vegas then get on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Nice updated rooms, but lacking...”
Reviews.Author: musicaltour
Reviews.Content: I stayed during a convention and have visited many times but it seems like it keep getting worse. I know the economy has required them to close many restaurants and only hire on a need basis, but I think it brings the Hilton down. Staff here have always been nice and work hard to provide great service. The one thing I really like that they remolded a few years ago was the coffee shop and wine bar. It's nice to have an assortment of quick eats without having to pay too much. As I mentioned, rooms are nice with the updates they have done. This hotel is large so depending on which tower you get, the size and design of room can be slightly different. Although the Hilton is away from the strip, the monorail is located on property and brings you to many hotels on the strip. Would I stay here again? Probably not unless I was attending a convention at the center next door. There are hotels with a similar price tag that are closer to the strip and/or have better amenities.

Reviews.Title: “big rooms but far from strip”
Reviews.Author: caitlinsPhiladelphia
Reviews.Content: Our room was very large and the view of the mountains was awesome. You definitely have to take a cab to get to the strip, since it s not located very close to it. The breakfast buffet was the best! The Hilton offered a very diverse array of options, including chicken fried steak, steak, and traditional breakfast items. The happy hour at the pool was inexpensive, but beware of the fruity drinks (they taste horrible!)

Reviews.Title: “Great deal”
Reviews.Author: eztravel87
Reviews.Content: I have stayed At many other Vegas hotels and the Hilton has always delivered. These guys will take very good care of you and it's super clean!!!!

Reviews.Title: “We will definitely be back”
Reviews.Author: Ghonchoo
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with our parents and we wanted a decent place which is sometimes difficult to find in Las vegas. They have evening reception and breakfast. Very clean and not noisy. The lady at the counter gave us additional discount for extending our stay to three nights. Make sure you get the rooms on upper floors for the view.

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly nice room”
Reviews.Author: VegasSportsGuy
Reviews.Content: The Hilton is a dinosaur, a giant white building that is dated, dark, and away from the strip. It's got a huge sportsbook that isn't afraid of a large bet. They won the LVRJ best sportsbook in town, although a tough book to beat if you are an advantage bettor. I stayed in the Hilton back in 2009 and remember a smell of mold when I went to my hotel room. I wasn't expecting much this time around, and was very surprised at the North Tower room that I was in. I had a strip view, the room was very clean, there was no odor. The room had a giant bathtub, larger than normal bottles of shampoo, massaging soap (very unique), the bed was very comfortable. The A/C unit had the room chilly, although the unit was old and didn't have a temperature gauge, so I had no clue what I was setting the room to. There was a 37 inch flat screen TV, lots of pillows, and no real issues with the room. I wouldn't recommend this if you are looking for a Vegas Vacation, the food is pricey compared to other 3-4 star hotels, you are off the strip, the pool is tiny (yet deep - unique in Vegas), the casino is dark and lacking in weekday action, like everywhere else you're paying for EVERYTHING (water bottles, wifi, etc.) but there is no resort fee. I would however recommend the hotel to someone who is going to the Convention Center, as you have a short monorail ride (or walk) to the place. The Monorail is convenient however the prices are outrageous and they drop you off in the back of all the strip hotels. Service was very slow during check-in.

Reviews.Title: “Iconic hotel needs some investment”
Reviews.Author: BeenandDoneIt
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hilton in Las Vegas in June 2011. I was really looking forward to staying at an iconic location. Whilst the room was very comfortable and the view was special, overall I was disappointed with the experience - particularly when compared to the other iconic hotels in the city. I think the hotel needs a refrash and bringing up to date from it current '70s feel. We were also disappointed with the restaurant options - one was closed and those that were were not particularly special. The staff at the hotel were general pleasant - althougth there were two or three who were dismisive and objectionable.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: backpackluxury
Reviews.Content: I'd never seen the Hilton so cheap at $49 a night but the competition in Vegas is fierce. Since I knew I would receive upgrades and amenities as a top level Hilton Honors member, I decided to stay there. Awful. Hllton should dump this place. Surly staff, charged to print boarding pass in business center, left toiletry bag in security so called ahead to see if they had basics..."sure, right at front desk" -but they didn't when I got there. Place is tired. More importantly, if you don't know Vegas or aren't attending something at the Vegas Convention Center, location is terrible but I knew that going in.I knew that and it wasn't an issue for me but for a tourist you are totally out of the Strip and the Monorail is a joke. Whatever stop you get off at you have another mile to walk to get anywhere.

Reviews.Title: “If not the worst Hilton I ever went to! I think they ment Motel8”
Reviews.Author: luaidahlan
Reviews.Content: Don't be fooled by the price! You get what you pay for. If you are looking to crash for a night then this is ok, otherwise stay away!! It's def. Not a Hilton quality hotel. The entrance is fancy, one you get to your floor where your room is located, you will see the hospital like florescent lights, worn carpets with holes in them dirty doors and ceilings. My room which was the newer room as they said with new bathrooms. The AC vents and filter and surrounding are is unbelievably dirty, I asked for non smoking but the room smelt like smoke, the curtains had yellow stains bed headboard material is torn, carpets are nasty .... A whole list I'll post all the pictures I'm not exaggerating! Beds are comfy but with the amount of dirt surrounding it felt disgusting Bad coice. Never going to a Hilton again. I'm sticking with starwood.

Reviews.Title: “Not So Great for Vegetarians”
Reviews.Author: Lala053
Reviews.Content: The room and service were good. Hoever, it was disheartening to visit the Buffet which promised "something for everyone" and then find that the grilled potatoes, corn -on-the-cob and grilled vegetables were sharing the same serving platter with the meat! Yes, vegetarians eat salads and there were lots of wonderful salad items but we like substantial food as well. However, I got leery about the salads too because one night when I visited the buffet, people were using the same serving tongs to take out the cheese and the bacon bits in the salad area...and the cheese ended up with bacon bits in it

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel off the strip”
Reviews.Author: mtfrost81
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with a friend last year durnign the NFR. it was a quick trip (Friday through Sunday) and my first tiem in Vegas. This hotel was huge and i never saw most of it as we were SO busy! It was a great location for us as we were mostly interested in the rodeo and Cowboy Christmas next door. The hotel was nice and well kept. The rooms were nice and very clean.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, cheap, depressing”
Reviews.Author: SAS_losangeles
Reviews.Content: There's just something sad about this hotel... they blast the AC, allow smoking, and serve terrible food (unless you care more about portions than taste). The pool was crowded and disappointing and the service was so-so. (They lost our reservation and then took a very long time to get us a room). This hotel just made me feel sad... but then, I think most of Vegas is starting to feel this way. Everything but the price of the rooms is a rip-off. ($6 ATM fees!!)

Reviews.Title: “Package deals are great! Been there 5 times!”
Reviews.Author: msfranni
Reviews.Content: Been to this property 5 times now and havent a clue what all the naysayers ar talking about. In those 5 times I have only experianced great service( very friendly helpful,from the check-in to the housekeeping staff). The package deals inlude room, entrance to fitness facility,2 buffets,2 free drinks,3 nights,( and assorted coupons) This is for for 2 people, all for anywhere from $129 for complete pkg to $69 a night (tip: it helps to be a player'sclub member for the cheaper prices).Also no resort fees, and free parking plus a monorail station connection. Now, I do agree this is NOT party central. But not all of us what to sleep in the middle of a party.Thoe places can be visited very easily and conveniantly (the trick is taking Paradise Rd al the way down to Flamingo or Tropicanna thus avoiding all that traffic on Las Vegas Blvd. To sum it up, save your $ for other activities, the Hilton Las Vegas allows you to do that !

Reviews.Title: “Hilton Vegas”
Reviews.Author: undercoverelephant
Reviews.Content: My third time back to Vegas. The wait to check in can be long sometimes, so if the queue is long go and play a one arm bandit. The rooms facing the strip are the best. The bars in the hotel are not great and the hotel's own food outlets are just ok, apart from the breakfast which is good. The fitness area and spa and pool are above standard and the service is good. Having their own monorail station means you do not really need cabs apart from going to the airport and back. Bit impersonal all in all, but for a week or less in Vegas, perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Great deal for a little bit farther north on the strip”
Reviews.Author: Paleoarch
Reviews.Content: My husband and I decided to stay at Las Vegas Hilton on our last trip to Vegas because we got a great weekend rate at the last minute ($100/night). My husband is an Elvis fan so I thought it would be fun. The room came with additional drink/meal coupons for that casino. One of which was for their wine bar, where you can do wine tasting. Another was for two free drinks in one of the casino bars that could be used during a certain time frame (I think 8-11 pm). We didn't use the food coupons but there was one for their steak house and one for the cafe. We have since gone to Vegas and it appears they offer these coupons every stay! It's an older hotel, but has some character. It has an Elvis store that we enjoyed with some old photos and fun stuff to purchase. The self parking wasn't too far from the casino entrance and check in was a breeze. Our room was roomy. My only complaint about the room would be that the water in the sink drained really slow. The room came with a full length table/desk (whatever you want to call it) that spanned the length of the window which we used to set up a mini bar to make cocktails and check out the view. The casino is too far to walk to most other popular casinos (Mirage, Ceaser's, MGM), but there is a tram that runs to multiple locations. It cost $12.00 for a 24-hour period so you can use it as many time as you want, which is nice. We took it to Flamingo and were able to walk from there to the places we wanted to see. We never had to wait long to board the tram either. Overall a fun experience if you don't mind a older hotel a little farther away from the action.

Reviews.Title: “Good value Hilton”
Reviews.Author: Peltt
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this Hilton twice when in Las Vegas. On our most recent visit, the Hilton has a giveaway price for a three night stay, which included a room upgrade, buffet breakfast and access to the spa thrown in. We had a rental car so the location off the strip was of no consequence to us and the parking was free. Our upgraded room was very spacious, traditionally furnished and decorated, and had a good size flat screen TV. We had a view over the golf course. There was ample storage space for bags and hanging space for clothes. The bathroom was smaller than expected though. The buffet breakfast had a very wide choice of food and the service was polite and helpful. The spa has separate facilities for male and female guests. We found the staff in there to be eager to assist, friendly and interested in the guests, and always ready to hand out some juice, water, or fresh fruit. They also had good suggestions on sights to see both in the city and in the surrounding areas. It was a relaxing space and a pleasure to use. I think the hotel was relatively quiet during our stay and many of the shops were closed, leading to a lack of atmosphere in those parts of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “not bad for the money”
Reviews.Author: JanebytheSea
Reviews.Content: we checked in after a long flight from Boston. The check in was efficient, View of strip from room was awesome! We had a huge corner room...sink area was fine but the tub/toilet area smelled moldy! Went outside to view pool area around midnight and walkway to pool had people passed out on the benches near pool shop....pool was closed which was a good thing! Hotel was close to convention center and monorail. This hotel does not charge resort fees as of 7/2011 like some of the hotels I stayed at on the strip. Did not utilize the fitness center or swim in the pool--but did check out the pool in the daylight and it looked inviting.

Reviews.Title: “Very dated Hotel, one to Avoid.”
Reviews.Author: I3ishop
Reviews.Content: Don't stay here, the rooms are so dated and tacky. Its not that our room was dirty, it was just worn, the bathroom walls and toilet were stained, the tiles were old, one wall of the room had a cheap kitchen counter along it. Its too far from the strip. If you're on a budget and all you want is a place to put your head down you should still avoid this place, get a budget room closer to the action like the jockey club.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible”
Reviews.Author: Muskie5
Reviews.Content: Was promised rollaway bed when upgrading room for $40/nt. Still have to pay $14/nt for Internet. Oh well, sign of the times we figure. Get back into room just after midnight, no rollaway. Call it in, tell them we were supposed to get bed, they said there was nothing in notes, we'd have to discuss with Martin who checked us in. So we said ok we need to sleep and will take it up in morning. 30 minutes go by, no bed. Call again, they werent sure we wanted it so we have to order again. Later, no bed, call again. Still waiting. I am dreading paying the $115 per night which has now increased to $200 per night with all these add ons. That is $800 vs $460 for our stay, not counting taxes. No love at all for that extra $340. We will never stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “We loved and we'll be back”
Reviews.Author: kidsfriendly15
Reviews.Content: From the minute I walked in I felt welcomed. The Check in was quick, we had a new employee being trainned but that did not prevented both the trainner nor the trainnee to offer us great tips, provide us with a great room with a view. I thought the food price at the hotel was a bit to the high side, but this is Vegas. Want cheap go somewhere else. The monorail stops right at the hotel, and that made my life easiear, I did nto have to do drive, only when I wanted to. The smell of cigarretes at the casino/lobby is not very strong , about average for Vegas. I would highly recommend this hotel for families with children. Although you are away from the strip, the monorail makes life easier and closer plus you don't have the crowds in the hotels like the ones in the heart of the Strip. It is very close to the convention center, also connected by the monorail

Reviews.Title: “Will never stay there again”
Reviews.Author: KittyKat5
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Las Vegas Hilton before for a conference and found it to be convienient so since I was attending a trade show and bringing three employees decided to stay there again. On the last night, after dinner and a show, my employees came back to their room and found a big, bed bug on the pillow. Security was called, the room was quaranteened, and what followed was a three hour wait, several room attempts (security actually opened a room with people sleeping in it). Finally around 2:00 am, exhausted, a room was found. Security was great, felt terribly sorry for them, wrote up the whole episode. We contacted the Hilton and not only did they not refund the evening, but they never even responded. I might add that they ended up in a smoking room which is disgusting to those of us that do not smoke. In common areas of the hotel the smell of smoke is awful compared to the newer hotels. I will never stay there again and shame on them for not responding to the travel agency that was trying to communicate on our behalf.

Reviews.Title: “Hilton should be embarassed about this property”
Reviews.Author: wineismylife
Reviews.Content: Hilton Las Vegas 3000 Paradise Road Las Vegas, NV 89109 702-732-5111 http://www.lvhilton.com/ June 4-10, 2011 You should stay at the Hilton Las Vegas if: 1. You’re a male business person traveling alone, normally totally oblivious to your surroundings and you get a really good rate per night. 2. You’re a male seeking companionship during your trip at a negotiable hourly rate. Just a few of the specific grievances: 1. I was approached in the hotel bar by a prostitute not once but twice during my trip. 2. One of my employees was approached by a prostitute in the hallway on the way to his room. 3. The hotel uses rent a cop security that’ll allow anybody to roam anywhere in the hotel, including the room floors (I have a nice collection of pizza coupons that were slid under my door). 4. Several of the common areas are filthy, even some with graffiti, the parking garage being of particular note. 5. The ancient elevators are obnoxiously loud. They can even be heard three rooms away, inside your room, all…night…long. 6. Their shows are of such poor quality that they literally sent the door person through the bar areas to offer people free admission just to fill seats. 7. Their restaurants are an almost after thought. I mean, really, Benihana is your marquee dining establishment? I have 3 within a 30 minute drive of my home. We showed up at 2:30PM and were quickly and pleasantly greeted by the front desk staff. Check-in was quick and efficient. Hilton Honors members are allowed to use the VIP check-in line which is an obvious plus (I didn’t need it although I’m Hilton Honors). I was here for a convention so I was placed in the older but centrally located Central Tower (not sure if this is related to my lower convention rate). All of the facilities are dated but seemed clean and well kept except for some of the common areas like the parking garage. Our “Classic” room was a good sized but very plain room. It basically gets the job done, especially if you’re traveling alone on business. There is a large granite work desk area running the length of the window overlooking the pool below and the mountains beyond. That made for a nice diversion while working on the laptop. However, the work chair was of poor quality and needs upgrading. There is also a basic chair and ottoman for reading. The King size bed was comfortable with two adjoining end tables. There was a 32 inch flat screen on top of a very nicely sized chest of drawers. The bathroom was clean but also very dated. There were 12 inch tiles on the floor with decorative tiles lining the entire run of the walls, floor to ceiling. There was a combination bathtub and shower unit that was absolutely nothing special. There were a few tiles in need of some chalking. There was a good sized closet with plenty of hangers for clothes, something of a rarity these days. I have never understood why hotels never have enough hangers for their guests. One thing that is goofy is there are no ice machines in the Central Tower. There are ice machines at the ends of every floor in the East and North Towers, not that it does any good if you’re staying in the Central Tower. Be prepared for a hike when you want ice. Something else that was goofy there were signs on the main level that said guests were not allowed to bring in any alcohol from outside of the hotel. Yeah, right Hilton. That one is going to fly. Especially when your “clientele” are rolling their coolers stuffed full of Coronas right down the hallways past your rent a cop security. The nightly rate was $125.00 at the convention rate which is acceptable for the room and facilities at the Las Vegas Hilton. After all, this is Las Vegas where all rooms seem ridiculously priced. However, I would say $125.00 a night is pushing it for the facilities and amenities offered. You can tack onto that wireless Internet for $13.99 per day; complimentary for Hilton Honors Diamond & Gold members. Personally I find that rate to be extortionary, especially considering there are zero free hot spots in any of the common areas. Las Vegas Hilton: Pass. Seriously, Pass. Do not stop at Go.

Reviews.Title: “Our Most Recent Stay at the LV Hilton”
Reviews.Author: murraygirl29
Reviews.Content: We stay at the LV Hilton several times a year and have been doing so for at least 5 years. We are very disappointed that Hilton has announced the franchise with the Hotel will not be renewed. The hotel has gone down hill drastically in recent years. It is apparent that little money is being put back into the hotel. For example the carpets are dirty in rooms and public areas. The newly "redesigned" rooms have broken furniture (nightstand glass), drapes that won't open becasuse wand is gone, refrigerators that are in need of repair and VERY soiled carpets and chairs. Last visit we had 2 light bulbs that were burned out when we arrived.

Reviews.Title: “A place we love to visit”
Reviews.Author: Tiltedcap
Reviews.Content: This was our fourth visit to this hotel. We love the off strip locacation. The staff is very friendly. And the pool area is nicely laid out with lots of room. The cabana rentals are $100 less than on the strip. I really enjoy the largest Race and Sports Book in town.

Reviews.Title: “Definately did not live up to Hilton Standards!”
Reviews.Author: eyetacs
Reviews.Content: We arrived on July 2nd and stayed until July 5th. Upon arrival at the Hilton, we waited in line for 25 minutes just to check in. We were given a room in the North Tower, 109. We got to the room, went in and found that it had not been cleaned. We called down to the front desk and were told to go to room 101 down the hall and that they would send someone up with a key for us for this room. We waited 15 minutes and no one showed up. I went back to room 109 and called front desk asking where our key was. The front desk said we should have been waiting in room 109 (the dirty room) as whomever that was bringing a key would have called us in room 109 prior to coming up. Really?!! They said they would immediately send someone up to let us in room 101. We waited another 20 minutes and I finally went down to the front desk. There was a long line of people waiting to check in. I went to the front of the line and asked for a key to our room and explained what had happened. There was no apology given nor did he seem concerned. I asked to speak to a manager and I was asked to step to the side while they went in the backroom to get a manager. I waited 12 minutes and no one showed up to speak with me. I was very disgusted and left the desk and went back upstairs to our room. I really wanted to just LEAVE this hotel and checkout and find someplace else to stay. I contacted a friend at MGM who said she would help us out. Over all we were at the hotel for over an hour and a half prior to getting into our room. I have not stayed at this location before and will NOT be staying here again. I am thoroughly disgusted with Hilton’s lack of apology and lack of concern for their guests. The last day we were there, we did not receive maid service for whatever reason. We received it both days prior. They never changed the sheets the entire time we were there either. Internet is overpriced at $13.99 a day and they also charge $3.00 in the lobby just to print your boarding pass! Room service was overpriced per person. The menu by the pool was overpriced. A simple sandwhich was around $20 and chicken wings were around the same price for 6! We ate at the buffet at 10 am and it was good. Everything seemed to be fresh. We also ate at the café restaurant in the hotel. This was mediocre at best. Overpriced and the food was only ok, nothing special. Pool was small and overcrowded. If you want to swim, you could not. You could only wade in the pool. They did have an all day volley ball going and it was packed!

Reviews.Title: “Very good off-strip hotel”
Reviews.Author: OmahaTravel
Reviews.Content: Pros: Renovated rooms very nice,not big, but well-appointed. Fridge in room (renovated) Free breakfast buffet with HHonors Gold or Diamond beautiful lobby Smaller, but quiet casino areas...I had my pick of slots, tables, and anything I wanted to play off-strip, so not lots of foot traffic monorail station connected to hotel, good on-site resturants Prce adjusted at time of stay to current rates, even though I pre-paid the entire stay Cons: No main attractions to get people to visit here; they used to have the Star Trek experience...now nothing Front desk did not honor the priority access lines for HHonors members...I earned that status by being a loyal Hilton customer, you should honor it.

Reviews.Title: “It was okay”
Reviews.Author: heatherneh
Reviews.Content: We thought that the signs were overwhelming--not clear at all. Check in took FOREVER, and there are only a few spots to "wait" in car outside while spouse checks in. Once we arrived, we checked out the room which was really nice---super comfortable beds! We then went to get a late lunch and found that the cafe was CLOSED. So, we ended up at the buffet. It was almost $80 for 2 kids/2 adults which we felt was steep for lunch...BUT, it was excellent featuring a lot of fish, and an awesome pasta bar.... My hubby was super disappointed that the sign said it featured a crepe bar, however, it did not :(... It did include beer/wine. Although the pool was beautiful, there was not enough room in it for our 2 kids to fit, nor were there any available chairs.

Reviews.Title: “Great time other than checking in”
Reviews.Author: Browning245
Reviews.Content: When I checked in, the price was wrong. They overcharged us by $300. I talked with a supervisor and he was a major jerk. He didn't care, he didn't want to help resolve the problem He just said they weren't wrong and pay it. After an hour and a half of going back and forth and trying to resolve it over the phone with the Hilton reservations, because the supervisor at the hotel wouldn't help, we finally got it resolved.

Reviews.Title: “The WORST buffet we have ever seen.”
Reviews.Author: tbrown801
Reviews.Content: Just got home from staying here. The WORST buffet we have ever seen. The food at 7 am looked like it had been put back out from yesterday. AWFUL We checked out early to go eat somewhere else. Upon check out we asked to speak to a manager and were told no manager was available. We are very disappointed in this Hilton property. The front desk staff were rude. The bell desk was less than helpful when we asked them about arranging an airport shuttle. Definitely doesn't live up to the Hilton reputation. Don't book this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “I know there are plenty of Vegas hotel choices, but I keep coming back here.”
Reviews.Author: shakey26
Reviews.Content: A hotel is a hotel and the one thing that always stands out for me is the people that work there. The Hilton has plenty of choices in terms of amenities, but their staff have always made a point to make contact and greet you no matter where in the hotel I find myself. Kudos to a team that seems to like their work environment. I like staying there and have many times.

Reviews.Title: “Regulars”
Reviews.Author: RoxieCris
Reviews.Content: Yes this was my first love. First trip we stayed here thanks to some previous gambling and every since then we have stayed here minus my two nights at Encore. Anywho this is a everybody hotel!!!! Young, old, rich, poor with hope or whatever.... They have the best happy hours at Vince Neils and the largest Benihana that you should definitely make reservations to if ya wanna go. The rooms are like any other Hilton just with a possible view of the strip. The restaurants are good too! Paradise Cafe has alot of options and we always go to the Champagne Brunch $18.99 :) My mom loves the casino and the servers arent shy with the drinks. The staff has always been nice and sometimes we've gotten upgraded to the premium room with a fridge and more space. The cab ride is always under $15 and it's immediate access to the monorail. To me the best thing is THE STAFF!!! Never had any big problems with them so that makes it an even better stay. I'll be back again :)

Reviews.Title: “Felt Safe and Secure traveling alone”
Reviews.Author: Eileencooks
Reviews.Content: (1) liked the Green offer and the $10.00 per day for food and beverage since traveling alone, I didn't need new sheets and towels for the 3 nights there. Also 100% privacy. (2) Liked the easy access to the Monorail but think more than 2-3 ticket booths for tickets would be necessary when large groups who speak no English, and there with kids take too long to get their tickets. I missed two Monorails while 8 people were joined by 20 more from their party who got in front of me. This occured at the second machine I moved to also but here only 9 cut in front of me and each one did their own ticket.. Very frustrating when trying to make a show at Harrahs. (3) Think that the offerings in their Resorts lounge could use some variety. Every day, the same sliced gorgeous fruit, cheese cubes and crackers, pretzels, carrots and celery stix, coffee machine with choices or cold drinks in their cooler and red and white wine afternoons. Always the same 3 kinds of cookies, and never one hot thing. . Not sure if it was worth the extra money. Should offer trays to help carry a cup of coffee to ones room along with a plate of snacks if traveling alone since you cannot open their door or press the elevator buttons or slide your card in your door slot without spilling it all (or bending down to put down what is being carried and then bending down again to pick it all up!) (4) BE AWARE that if you use the boarding pass machines at the end of the long counter of "front desk" that the privacy statement says you agree that they can give out your information to 3rd parties INCLUDING "Adult services and sites". You cannot avoid this since if you say no - no boarding pass. Even if you choose to hand put your credit card number in rather than swipe it, it will provide you with your pass along with likely porn sites coming to your email address they insist on. Hilton should be sure that company is switched since in the business office you can also get your boarding pass from a different company that does not make you sign that you agree to their privacy policy but who knows if they have the same rules but just don't show it. Always be careful especially if you have children under 21 at home since being exposed to sexual adult sites opens them up to unwanted solicitations. (5)Lastly, their facebook site tells of the Hilton being sold and wonder what will happen to all the deals they offer on points earned on the Players cards. My experience with a Hilton in Philly airport was horrible but since it was just "using the name" but was franchised, they refused to offer anything except one free night if I flew there again (for $960.00 within 11 months. Hope this won't happen to the Las Vegas Hilton.

Reviews.Title: “If you don't have to, don't”
Reviews.Author: 5StarBohemian
Reviews.Content: This was a rare occasion where we were in Vegas just as a layover. We chose this hotel because even the crappy Rio was $185 (although I wouldn't stay there for free). Perhaps the WSOP put a stink on the prices, but the Hilton seemed to be immune, so we stayed there. When you're in Vegas for but a few hours, you don't want to spend 30 minutes in a check-in line to be greeted by a grouch bag. Meanwhile the staff at the concierge desk were giggling their boredom away. The room was an odd shape, which actually gave it a little character. The view was the best I've seen from a Vegas hotel room. Golf course and mountains, people sliding down the Stratosphere, that was enough to appease me somewhat. But one look at the dirty a/c vent made me fear for my health. And that old, ugly bathroom won't help you wash that dirty feeling away. We tried to lift our spirits by going to Quark's bar, which is still listed in the hotel directory, but alas Star Trek truly has left the building entirely. Huge downer. Beam me up, Scotty, I want out!

Reviews.Title: “It's only advantage is that it is connected to the Las Vegas Convention Center”
Reviews.Author: beckere
Reviews.Content: Just spent four nights at this hotel and the experience was truly disappointing. There were two primary areas contributing to this opinion. First, the front desk staff was consistently rude and uninformed about the hotel's own processes. This attitude was consistent throughout the stay. More concerning was the fact that many areas of the hotel were dirty. The hallways never appeared to be vacuumed, the ashtrays by the elevators overflowed with cigarette butts at all times of the day and night, dirty dishes sat outside of rooms for hours at a time, the windows in the "scenic" elevator were streaked with dirt, the handsets in the room looked untouchable, several of the hallways smelled of mold-and that just to names a few of the cleanliness issues. To be fair, there were three bright spots. First, the beds (at least in the upgraded rooms) were very comfortable. The second is the complimentary lounge for the upgraded rooms was quite nice. Also, the lounge was the only place that seemed to be clean with friendly staff. Throughout the day snacks and drinks were plentiful and readily available. Access to the lounge was only available if one chose to upgrade the cost of the room, but it actually did make the stay considerably better. The third and most significant benefit tot his hotel is the fact it is connected to the Convention center--it helps a lot when it's 106 outside to be able to walk through the hotel instead. That is really it's saving grace, because otherwise it is substandard on so many levels. So, if you have to have close access to the convention center and thus have to stay at this hotel, I would recommend you upgrade your room so that you have access to the lounge. Otherwise, it would just be too miserable. And, if you can't afford the upgrade or don't have to have immediate access to the convention center, then I would recommend you stay anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “OK but they nickel & dime you for everything”
Reviews.Author: Edistotiger
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed here for a week for a national meeting that was being held in the hotel. I was somewhat dubious after reading several of the reviews posted here but had no choice in where to stay. Check in experience was OK but only because I am a HHonors member & was able to use that line. The rest of the folks (and there were over 600 checking in for this meeting) had a VERY long line for check in. I was originally booked in a standard room but on the advice of a friend upgraded to a deluxe room. The room appeared to have been recently renovated & was comfortably furnished. The bed was very comfortable. The bathroom was almost identical to the bathroom in a Hampton Inn I stayed in a few weeks earlier - adequate. I had no noise issues but my room (in the North tower) did not overlook the pool. The AC is very old fashioned & does not allow for individualized temperature control; either you run it continually & keep the room cold or turn it off until the room gets warm. Otherwise the room was comfortable. The restaurants are very pricey with food that is OK. Even the "fine dining" restaurants had food that was OK but not to the quality one would expect for the price being paid ($40 one night for a small appetizer, small salad, & diet soda). No wonder I saw so many guests checking in Friday afternoon dragging coolers in with them. The hotel does have that neat deal of providing a $10 voucher for food & drinks for each day you chose not ot have the maid service your room. You just need to call the "green" number each day, and the voucher is slid under your door during the night. Not being a gambler, I cannot really comment about the casino. It did seem rather small with few patrons when compared to others I have seen on the Strip. My biggest problem with this hotel is how they nickel & dime you for everything - reminded me of the airlines. The 2 bottles of water in your room? $4 each if you open them. Internet access is a ridiculous $14/day. I was even charged $3 to use the computer kiosk in the main lobby to check in for my flight & print my boarding pass. There is a daily fee to use a safety deposit box (no safes in the rooms). There is also a $10/day fee to use the business center. There is also a daily fee to use the fitness center unless you are a high level HHonors member. At least the parking is free (so far). The pool is also free (towels are provided) but is awfully small for a hotel of this size (over 2000 rooms). This hotel makes a big deal out of advertising "we don't charge resort fees!" but they more than make up for it with this fee for everything approach. The hotel is off the Strip but has a Monorail station in it; the Monorail has several stops on the Strip & runs every 6 minutes. If you use it, buy a multi-day pass; otherwise it costs $5 for each one way trip. Overall, the hotel was OK for my purpose (business conference in the hotel). All of the staff I encountered were all very friendly & helpful during my stay. However, if I were to come to Vegas for a vacation, I would not stay here. I would spend the few extra bucks for the convenience of staying on the Strip

Reviews.Title: “No regard for physically challenged.”
Reviews.Author: DebbieA0918
Reviews.Content: My sister who has Parkinsons Disease and needs a wheelchair checked in to the LV Hilton on June 18. No accessible rooms were available so they checked her into a standard room with the promise of a room change the next day. Not good but ok...we will go with the flow. Upon arrival at the non-accessible room we were surprised to see someone else was already checked into the room! We called the front desk who reassigned her to another room. Upon arrival at that room my sister was unable to fit through the door with her wheelchair. The bellman then lifted what was a murphy bed to give her access. We had to physically move the dresser so she could get to the bathroom which by the way had urine in the toilet. She was unable to use the bathroom because she needs the bars to stabilize herself so we went to the casino to use the accessible bathroom. Well it was out of order. Having had enough I called the front desk and spoke to JR who said it wasn't their fault because Priceline didn't note her reservation that she needed accessibility and they had other bathrooms in the casino. I don't recall the ADA stating they don't need to provide accessibility if you don't notify them. Very long story short....don't stay here. Just read that Hilton is severing ties with this place. Smart move. We are doing the same.

Reviews.Title: “Las Vegas Hilton,not my choice”
Reviews.Author: marykay99
Reviews.Content: We were with a package tour group and this was the hotel Trafalgar chose for the first day of the tour. The room was nice,clean and comfortable but one needed a map to find anything in the hotel,very easy to get lost. The restaurant where we had breakfast ,included in our tour,was excellant,a wide variety of items presented buffet style,but,unfortunately,did not open until seven AM and our bus left at seven-thirty. There were fifty-two in our group and it would have been nice of them to open a little earlier for us.. Also,I missed having a coffee pot in our room,we could'nt find anyplace to get a cup of coffee before seven AM. We stayed an additional day at the end of the tour at a reasonable price but if we come back to Vegas on ouw own,this would not be my choice,too big and no airport shuttle.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: champycottonwood
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a monorail stop, easy parking, and clean rooms. Great place to stay in Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Crappy dont bother, rude service”
Reviews.Author: OklahomaMidwest
Reviews.Content: Rooms are old, outdated...staff rude, gift shop way overpriced , better places to stay

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly good”
Reviews.Author: traveltous
Reviews.Content: The room was redecorated and the bed was very comfortable. Had a fabulous view with a desk facing the view. Included breakfast buffet was excellent. Front desk were just okay. Did not have time for pool or workout. Too bad they charge about $14 for internet, but typical on Strip. No resort fee or other charges. Would definitely visit again. Was able to reserve last minute for about $65 including breakfast buffet, spa entrance, drinks and some other discounts. Did not smell of smoking, in non smoking room. Free, somewhat close, parking - with many hotels in Vegas parking can be very far away.

Reviews.Title: “I've Always Liked This Place”
Reviews.Author: WorfsBabyMama
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here before a few years ago and always had fond memories, so I decided to check it out again June 2011. The previous hotel I'd been in was horrific so I was desperate to change but I was on a budget. I found an excellent Sunday night rate and booked immediately, leaving that other hotel behind. Even though it was only 12PM, I was able to check into a room immediately. The front desk staff was very courteous and the check-in line moved quickly despite being very long. As I went up the room I noted several amenities. There are many hotel dining options, a decent sized casino and retail shoppes on the first level. It was a bit confusing to find my room but maybe I am directionally challenged. The room itself was rather nice. I had a double bed room with plenty of space. There was a view of a golf course that was pretty good. I liked the built in desk thing next to the window. The bathroom is separated toilet/shower and a sink and vanity with plenty of lighting. There are no resort fees here but gym usage and internet usage come with additional fees. I saw there was a pool but I did not participate. Unlike the previous hotel I'd stayed in, Hilton did not have thin walls. I did not hear everything going on in the hallway. There was no screaming and carrying on, but I think it also has to do with the clientele. Since this place is off-Strip, it is not picking up the usual suspects. This is a nice place for business travellers, families and couples who want to relax and be in Vegas without all the drama of the Strip. I do recommend this place but if you're looking for action, you're a bit far away from the Strip so keep that in mind. There is the monorail but when you're ready to party, you're ready to party and you don't want to wait.

Reviews.Title: “Great time in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: FixIt_65
Reviews.Content: I found Hilton's asking charge for Internet access ($13.99 per day for WiFi in the room, or 70 cents per minute in the communications center) to be horrendously out of touch with the expectations of travelers. I get a whole month's access at home for ~$30. This Hilton has 3300-3500 rooms. Monthly cost for a T-1 line to Hilton would be on the order of $500-$600 per month. With 75% occupancy in a month, this would work out to 0.6 to 0.7 cents per room per day. Competitor lodgings within a quarter mile do NOT charge for WiFi access. I went to McDonald's just down the road. NOT a good moment at the Las Vegas Hilton.

Reviews.Title: “I'll Be Back”
Reviews.Author: JMB54_11
Reviews.Content: I read alot of reviews, good and bad. Thought I'd add my 2 cents. When I checked into the Las Vegas Hilton I asked for a high floor and a view of the strip. The clerk went into a room. When she came back I was given a room on the 28th floor. She said it was a large room. I had a living room, kitchen with a fridge, sink and bar area. No stains on the carpet or marks on the walls. Was a nice clean room. Had a large bathtub. There were 3 telephones,in the bedroom, living room and bathroom. I had a view of the strip. When the clerk said it was a large room I asked if I had to pay extra. She said no. I got a great vacation deal on the internet. People complained about the price of the bottles of water in the rooms. It was $4 each. The bottles were large so I thought it was fine. In the room was a card. If you didn't need maid service you could get a $!0 voucher each day. Was under my door before I woke up. Had the buffet for $8. Plenty of food and good too. One night had a personal pizza and large drink at Pizza Hut. This cost me nothing. The pool was large and clean all around. It is easy to get to the monorail station. Much easier then at the other hotels. Had a room across from the elevator. Could hear it but it never woke me up. Used the computer for my airline boarding pass. Only cost $3, good deal. Met a lady at the pool and she also thought the hotel was great. Would stay at the Hilton again.

Reviews.Title: “I loved it and will be back”
Reviews.Author: robynzechel
Reviews.Content: It was very nice and the rooms were really large. It had a couch and two queen beds. It was clean and i could see the strip from my window, considering it was off the strip it was very enjoyable. The only thing I was disappointed in was that the Sushi Bar they advertise apparently no longer does sushi which a number of people were mislead and confused about. I was looking forward to some nice sushi and it didnt happen.

Reviews.Title: “I loved it great peaceful secure experience.”
Reviews.Author: Limeylassalone
Reviews.Content: I was meeting friends for a couple of days 4 thousand them .Celtic Conventionin in The Riviera. I wanted to be with them but not all the time so opted for The Hilton great friendly experience and clean and secure Many Thanks ANNE

Reviews.Title: “Tired old hotel, adequate for convention visitors”
Reviews.Author: Carrie P
Reviews.Content: The Las Vegas Hilton's location right next to the Convention Center is the only reason I can think of to stay there. It is clean and has all the basics you need, but it's a long way from the rest of the Strip and the rooms have seen better days. If you're not there for a convention, give it a miss. I was there for four days and had a room in the central tower overlooking the pool. The pool area looked nice from my window although I didn't have time to go down there. Loud music from the pool in the afternoon, but it didn't keep going into the night and I had no problems with noise at this hotel. There are much more popular pools at other casinos so if you want a pool for swimming/playing and not partying, this will suit you. My room looked like it might have been super fabulous and upscale a long, long, LONG time ago. It was enormous and I think it was one of the room styles that is used for meetings/conventions as well as for a bedroom. There was a large living/dining area and a small bar area, and the bed was a Murphy bed that could obviously fold up into the wall to turn the room into a meeting room. Adequate bed, not uncomfortable considering it was a glorified foldaway, and the pillows were great. The other furniture in the room looked like it came from a garage sale at $2 for the lot. I wish I'd taken a picture of the coffee table - chipped, scarred and unbelievably cheap and crappy. I've stayed at Motel 6s with better quality furniture. Like the bedroom area, the bathroom was huge but very low-quality and gave the impression of being a cheap remodel of a previously high-end suite. One of the sink taps had the top broken off, and on my second night the other one fell off too. Only one of the two large lights at the sink worked. The sink itself was slow draining and would fill completely whenever I used it. The shower was fine, no problems there. Despite the shoddy quality, everything was clean and the housekeeping service did a good job every day. I was impressed that after the first day, some lovely housemaid noticed all the empty packets of allergy medication and used Kleenex in my trash, and left me two large boxes of Kleenex to replace the little one that was in the bathroom. Great service, and I hope that person was still on duty to find the large tip I left for them the next morning. Amenities in the bathroom: shampoo, conditioner, lotion, soap, tissues. Low-quality cheap hotel towels, but lots of them. I thought there wasn't a hairdryer, but found it on top of a shelf in the closet the next day. There was a small safe in the room, and a fridge under the bar (along with a couple of pieces of dirty plywood that appeared to be shoved in there to cover up some holes and damage around the pipes). The hotel's buffet was okay and not overpriced for what you get. Buy some bottled water elsewhere before you arrive; there are two small bottles of water in your room which will cost you $4 each if you drink them, and similar sized bottles sell for around $3 in the hotel shops. I would stay here again if I was attending another Convention Center event, but not for a pleasure trip. It's just too far away from everything and too cruddy.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous and great value”
Reviews.Author: marylou52
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel online and got a great deal at $50 a night. It was by far the best value of our trip. We stayed in the North Tower in a room with a king sized bed - the most comfortable bed ever, huge with a pillow top. The bathroom had a big bath and not much room for anything else but as we realised during our travels - not many hotels have big bathrooms. We appreciated being off the strip, it's only a monorail ride away anyway. But being away from the constant crowds and noise was great. If you choose not to get your linen changed daily they give you a $10 voucher to spend in the coffee shops or gift shop downstairs - getting paid to be green is a great idea. It may not be the most dazzling or modern hotel in Las Vegas but it was quiet, extremely comfortable and great value.

Reviews.Title: “Average Stay”
Reviews.Author: scain7
Reviews.Content: First, the good: Stayed here because Hilton sent us deal which included free room up to 5 nights (we stayed 2 nights), 3 free buffets and 2 for 1 show tickets. So its a great VALUE, especially if you just stay at the hotel and then go to the strip. Another positive is that they have the Monorail that goes from the Hilton to some of the strip hotels. Monorail was quiet and clean and on time every 5 minutes. Also, we saw Trent Carlini, the Elvis impersonator at the Hilton Shimmer Cabaret theater. He was really good. Also, if you like Sports betting they have the largest Sports book in Vegas and it indeed is a nice place to watch sports. Ate at Hilton buffett and its average for what you would find in Vegas. Not a great selection of food but if all you want are the basics....meat, potatoes and desert it will do fine. The bed was very comfortable and the pool was quite large. Now the negative: it is an old hotel built in the 1960's. Our room was near the elevators which we thought was good at first, but at night you could hear the RUMBLING of the elevator....ALL NIGHT. The next morning we requested a different room away from the elevator and were promptly accommodated. Do NOT stay in a room near the elevator, unless you are deep sleeper. Also, our bathtub faucet was leaking even though we turned it all the way off. Also, they DON"T have a food court. They have a small Pizza Hut nook which closes at 11pm....11pm? C'mon!! So, anyway, I ordered room service at 11:15pm and order did not come until 12:45am...YIKES! Also, room walls are thin as I could hear the people in the room next to us talking. In addition, I'm not a snob or anything but the crowd that comes out at night to the Hilton is certainly not the same crowd you would see at the Ventian. Just something to keep in mind. If Value and a Cheap vacation are your main concerns...stay at the Hilton and take the monorail to the strip. If you want a quality hotel with lots of food ammenities then go somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “BLOODY HILTON - DIRTY ROOM - INADEQUATE MANAGER”
Reviews.Author: gameday95
Reviews.Content: I was the las vegas hilton on June 20, 2011 for a one night stay. I should have thre was a bad omen for my nights stay when one of the kids pointed that the T on the Marquee HILTON had burned out and has not been fixed. I proceeded to check in which was way understaffed ( two employees to man the front desk). The person in front of me agreed that for such a large hotel they should have more staff. After they charged my credit card by the time I arrived. I proceeded to the room. The room was stuffy(AIR CONDITIONING PROBLEM). Went to gift shop for snacks. My wife decided to check the SHEETS and the COMFORTER as she always does due her seeing special about DIRTY HOTEL ROOMS. When she pulled back the COMFORTER they was a huge BLOOD STAIN on the COMFORTER!!! She decided to check the SHEET and another HUGE BLOOD STAIN was on the SHEET that was TUCKED IN!! I proceeded to call the front desk regarding the BLOODY BEDDING. She SCREAMED when I told her the BEDDING was a BLOODY MESS!! She said she would call housekeeping to fix the bedding . After 20 MINUTES of waiting, Housekeeping finally showed up with gloves and a large trash bag to pick the bedding. ( I would wear gloves also too! Who knows whay contagious diseases the blood had) My decided to put the new bedding herself minus the comforter. After restless night of sleeping.. I proceeded to the front desk and asked to speak to a manager. After 5 minutes of waiting. R. Callahan one of the hilton managers came out and wanted to know what the problem was . I told him about the bloody sheets and he was very non chalant about the situation. He did not state this was unacceptable or apologic at ALL!! I asked him that our room should be comped but he stated he give me free buffets. It seemed like he did not care about the hotel's status or REPUTATION! He then stated that it was better for me to take the buffets since it was worth more than the comp room and i could not have booth. He proceed to get his standarized form for the buffet . When he was completing the form . I stated that I had changed my mind and wanted to if I could get comped for the buffet and the room and he stated very coldly. "YOU TOOK THE BUFFET" and "THIS OFFER CAN NOT BE RESCINDED" AS YOU AGREED TO THE BUFFET!! AND YOU CANNOT HAVE THE COMPED ROOM. HE THEN GAVE ME THE BUFFET TICKET AND PRACTICALLY TOLD ME THAT WAS IT AND HAVE GOOD DAY! VERY BAD CUSTOMER SERVICE.!! I AM A HILTON HONORS MEMBER . BUT THIS THE LAST TIME I WILL EVER STAY AT THE LAS VEGAS HILTON!

Reviews.Title: “Okay”
Reviews.Author: Mintoto
Reviews.Content: My friend used her points to get a free room. Set a bit of a distance from the strip, which we didn't really mind. Lots of free parking. Hotel was okay, rather unexciting compared to the other Vegas hotels. Room did not have the standard (basic) coffee/tea you see in most hotels, which was surprising, but was clean. Housekeeping was thorough and other hotel staff very accommodating. Probably won't stay there again because there's so much more to choose from.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: esc111
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at Paris for 3 nights I then stayed at the Hilton, much better; less crowded, better value rooms, great deal on food and drink. Access to the monorail is so simple it then puts you close to anywhere on the strip

Reviews.Title: “Too close to the elevators”
Reviews.Author: ketlian
Reviews.Content: Although the casino, grounds and hotel itself is very nice, I cannot say that of the room I was given. My room was a wall away from the elevators and kept me awake all night. One of the elevators has a braking system that squeals. When I asked for a room change in the morning I was told that the hotel was full and would have to remain in the room. Thank goodness I only stayed one more night. I would rather deal with a noisy neighbor than elevators that sound like freight trains waking me repeatedly all night.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT PLACE!!!”
Reviews.Author: sunny070
Reviews.Content: We stayed here last July and it was AWESOME!!! Included with the price was a grand champagne brunch as well!!! I told all of my friends about this location.....I will stay several more times!!

Reviews.Title: “dont like the changes”
Reviews.Author: coach20
Reviews.Content: we stayed in june 2010.liked it very well then .Went back this june off the monorailwent in where i had played slots last yearat the bar area at the entrance from monorail. No slots just couches and dance floor for use on fri &sat .what a waste.Hilton made a poor decision here they just want the young party people not the older slot players

Reviews.Title: “Dated Hotel w/ great Tennis Courts and Easy Access”
Reviews.Author: docgoat
Reviews.Content: LVH is a great hotel that is poorly understaffed and needs to be renovated. The pool size is laughable for the amount of rooms and service is inconsistent (our first attempt to check in was a joke, yet quickly remedied by another seasoned clerk). However, the tennis courts were fantastic and we never had a problem getting a court. Also, the Hilton being slightly off strip made is so easy to get in and out of the hotel and start cruising down to other venues, casinos, and shows. For the price, I'm not sure it can compete with some of the other deals in Las Vegas (even with a fantastic last minute upgrade to a 2 bedroom suite....)

Reviews.Title: “stained carpet, torn wallpaper... Don't Let the Nice Lobby Fool You!!”
Reviews.Author: kn138hc
Reviews.Content: This hotel appeared fairly respectable throughout the main floor, elevator, and hallways, but I opened my door to find several rips in the wall paper, and entered the room to a faint cigarette smell (this is almost standard with old casino hotels in Vegas, even if they are now deemed "non-smoking"). The carpet was stained throughout the room and probably should have been replaced ten years ago. The bathroom area was also in need of renovation, as the grout between tiles was stained and the shower fixture took several minutes to heat and be adjusted to any temperature thereafter. The entire room was an unsanitary environment. The only worse hotel I've stayed at in Vegas was the Fremont in old downtown.
