If you are looking for a nice place off the strip, I recommend Aliante Station. The Bellagio remains my favorite place to stay, and I highly recommend splurging for a night or two if you haven't had the experience.

Reviews.Title: “Large, clean rooms and facility.”
Reviews.Author: jshram
Reviews.Content: The room, which was a standard room and not an upgrade, was very large and comfortable. The room was very-very clean, TV was excellent (new and large) and I even got a nice view (no guarantee about that). Staff was very friendly and the hallways and surrounding areas were clean and inviting as well. tub/shower was nothing special, but I wasn't living in that space. Bed had lots of pillows and good support pillows for TV watching or working on the bed. Nice place. I would stay again but remember it is NOT on the strip and is a good hoof to the strip. It is on the mono-rail system which runs up Paradise road (my big complaint about the monorail is that is is so far behind the strip hotels to be almost useless). Grounds at the Hilton are spacious and easy to get around, parking is easy, much easier than a strip hotel (more space). Oh, I did have the buffet and it was excellent. Interesting and flavorful food, not a pile of bland food that you might get elsewhere. Staff was again very friendly and helpful. No resort fees, but no wireless internet (without a fee) either and no business department to get wireless, you have to go to McDonalds down the street to get wireless... a pain.

Reviews.Title: “never again !!!”
Reviews.Author: FLORENCE06200
Reviews.Content: I went several time in LV but it's was my first time with my husband so (we are huge Elvis fans) we choice the HILTON. bad idea !! this is supposed to be the best hilton hotel but the service left a lot to be desired. We had to move rooms 2 times,due to being allocated lower standard rooms to those i booked or the right type of room, that was still occupied. all of this without any body saying sorry for the inconvenience or any discount was made. We saw no security personnel and were never asked if we indeed were staying at the hotel prior to getting on the elevator. No security outside or inside !!! We also didn't appreciate the fact that there were take out pizza menus slid under our door. We didn't need to be solicited by outside people while staying at the hotel. If you like spending money on things that you get included in other hotels, like using the safe in the room,$3, per day, plastic bottles of water,$4 each. Our second room was near the elevator and was noisy night and day There was an automatic control for the window treatments that didn't work (same both rooms) Staff were not helpful overall. I had to call 4 times to have a bottle of champagne reserved in my trip and the waiter was "happy than a member of adam's family". the room was okay and clean - but at that price we may expect a coffee maker in the room. It was our first and last time !!!! and I will ask my friends to forget that hotel if they travel to LV !!! not worst the price !! we had better cares and attentions in motels !!!

Reviews.Title: “Terrible experience at Hilton”
Reviews.Author: Travel_Amateur_09
Reviews.Content: I've been on the business trip to Vegas last week. Spent 3 wonderful nights at Mirage Hotel and Resort, and 2 nights at Hilton. What can I say: Hilton pricing was 20% more for a standard room which looked and felt more like cheap studio at old dirty motel that can only be used to meet with hookers. Sorry, but this is true. My finding are: toilet bowl had yellow spills over it, towel shelf was broken so towels were ready to fall any minute, shower head covered with so much hard substance so water was barely making its way through, carpet looked like it is at least 25 yrs old, one bed light did not work, windows were totally mess. Besides that, hotel was trying to nickle and dime you: 20 oz bottle of water is $4 (and it's not even refrigerated), to use safe is $3/day, wireless internet connection at moderate speed was almost $14/day, rooms are smelly even at the hallway. AC unit was probably 50 yrs old - easy to figure out just by looking at the antique controls. Shower fan is dirty and not working. Towels felt like sand-paper. No iron or ironing board provided. I will recommend to stay away from this place unless you must to.

Reviews.Title: “Get the Right Room to Enjoy This Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Maxim_LV
Reviews.Content: The Maxim ACES-V Review - Accommodations: If you get one of the "Updated" rooms, you're in good shape. If you end up with one of the lesser rooms, you're going to get a different experience that I think others have covered. Ask for a 20's floor East Tower room. You'll get a decent sized room, nice bed, a tub with jets, marble counters, and a mini-fridge in your room. The pool at this place is small and there's no shade, keep that in mind. Cleanliness: The new rooms seem to not have the issues the older ones do; I'm not sure why, but I've never had a problem with the new rooms. Very clean, pristine white linens and all that. Extras: The room safe is $3 to use - not cool. You get mini shampoo, conditioner and soap. Nothing special. Value: This is a very good value if you're in town for something like a convention, but the gambling options here are limited. They got rid of the Star Trek Experience and still have done nothing with the space, and they took out quite a few machines. The drink service is terribly slow at the tables, too, so be aware.

Reviews.Title: “The Hilton has gone down hill”
Reviews.Author: Paul616475
Reviews.Content: I used to stay at the Hilton every time I went to Vegas but I will stay there no more. The pool had a DJ play some awful Hip Hop music at an alarming volume, my daughter actually started crying it was so loud, when I asked the Pool supervisor to turn it down she shrugged her shoulders and said it was nothing to do with her. Our room smelled of smoke even thought it was a non smoking room.

Reviews.Title: “Not the normal Hilton experience”
Reviews.Author: StuartinFiji
Reviews.Content: We stay at this hotel every 2 years for the DEMA Dive Trade Show as it is the 'designated' hotel, and therefore a damned good deal. Our room was a good walk away from the elevator, it was obviously a remodeled room, and everything looked new. There was an automatic control for the window treatments that didn't work. Staff were generally not helpful overall. The attention to detail throughout the hotel was sorely lacking as was security. We also didn't mind the take out pizza menus slid under our door, but thought this a bit odd in a Hilton... This did raise the question of who was wandering about the hotel though... We stayed at the Hilton because of the cheaper room rate offered by the trade show, but would not have stayed here otherwise, and wouldn't return except for price!

Reviews.Title: “Could never recommend this hotel”
Reviews.Author: pikawolfe
Reviews.Content: I expected better from a Hilton Property. When we got to our room, we discovered that there was water on the bathroom floor because the toilet was leaking. Hilton sent someone up to clean the water off of the floor, but never addressed the fact the fact that the toilet was leaking. We wound up having to wrap the base of the toilet in a towel so the bathroom floor would not flood again. Any other hotel that we have stayed at would have either fixed the toilet or moved us to another room. Then when we went to hook up our medical devices that we must have to sleep, I discovered that the cord for my device would not reach any of the outlets in the room. Called down to housekeeping/maintenance and was told that they did not have that sort of thing for guests and that we would have to rent one from a rental company the next day. Knowing I needed my medical device that night, my wife called the front desk and argued and went around and around with the staff before they agreed to LOOK for an extension cord for us. They did finally find one for us, but it took a ridiculously long time on the phone to get it. Then to top everything off, the Hilton Las Vegas refused to honor the rate that we had booked in at and charged us 10 dollars more per day than our Guaranteed Confirmed Rate. The front desk could not give us a reason why they refused to honor the rate. Definitely one of our worst hotel stays ever.

Reviews.Title: “Better Than Expected”
Reviews.Author: AskDrReg
Reviews.Content: Well it is surprising that I have not written a review of this property before now. I have stayed at this hotel several times over the last five years. My review will be mostly about this stay, but it is fair to say that I have witnessed an enormous improvement in the quality of the service and amenities offered by this excellent property. I cannot give them a "perfect" score because they still have the old box TVs in the rooms. Granted, the suites have the more modern flat screens with great picture quality. If you are into the groove of booming music ask to be put in a room on the poolside of the building. If you are not into the loud noise of the festivities of the weekend pool party and happy hour, then you need to ask to be put in a room more quiet to suit your taste :-). I personally loved being in a lanai suite on the 3rd floor. It is close enough to the spa, gym, pool cafe, and pool bar for those who rather do the beach shorts and flip-flops. If you are into the more casual dressing and casino atomosphere, go for it baby! The room service is okay, I rather go to the buffet or one of the many top quality eateries within the property. If you like to drink, I suggest picking up some spirits from the local grocery store, Walgreens, or CVS (yes they sell alcohol at the drug store - imagine that :-). As far as Hilton Honors goes, take advantage of the VIP check-in lounge. You will NOT see it advertised anywhere, but just as you enter the building from the front, it is on the left side right before the front desk. They serve everything (well champagne after 11AM) beer, water, juice, soda...and the cookies are delicious! You will find the staff at this property (mostly) EXCELLENT. There are a few who make you feel like you are interrupting their day, but hopefully they will be gone by the time you book and stay at this property. The management (throughout) is absolutely guest friendly and will go out of their way to make it right - simply call and speak with one of them and you'll be pleasantly surprised. They really make your stay great. So, don't waste time arguing with an associate. Save the stress and just kindly ask to speak to a manager and you will be handled with kitten gloves. The quality of the housekeeping is simply stellar. These ladies are like stealth boomers. The come and clean your room so quickly and professionally, it leaves you wondering if they are watching you leave just so they can get into the room. By the way, the Las Vegas Hilton gives $10 (FREE) daily if you call housekeeping and tell them you do not want or need service. You have to do it before 1AM and it's not valid on check-in or check-out day. A few words about security. My advice is do not "screw" with them or you'll be out in a flash. If you come to gamble or eat or enjoy the fun, you are cool, but if you even smell of mischief,,,let's just say be on your best behavior. I hope this review helps. I love staying at this property and I'm sure you will too. Hilton Honors members just ask for what you want and if you are not a Hilton Honors member, WHY not? I bid you safe and fun travels!

Reviews.Title: “Find another hotel!”
Reviews.Author: WendyC40
Reviews.Content: The front desk people were rude and most importantly the room was dirty. There was also a bug in my bathroom. This is the worst hotel I have EVER been to and I travel alot. I am a real person and was very disappointed. A fellow worker stayed at a different hotel for about 10 more a night and it was 100 times better.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Wedding”
Reviews.Author: amy67033
Reviews.Content: I wanted to get married in Vegas because price was an issue and for myself and my guests. So I thought I would make it simple. I look around and read the reviews La Bella has mixed reviews but after talking to them decided to get married there. Boy was I glad I did. The chapel was decorated nicely and my photos were great and my DVD came out beautiful. I was very impressed from start to finish how wonderful everything was. Even the limo driver was great. They need an amazing job above and beyond my expectations. I would highly recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “Just not worth it”
Reviews.Author: TCHOW
Reviews.Content: I wrote a lengthy review and TripAdvisor was down when submitted so I will keep this brief and to the point. If you like Motel 6 or La Quinta Inns then this property will not disappoint. If you like fresh smelling non-smoke filled rooms with bathtubs that drain and quiet air conditioners then avoid this place. We went to hang at the pool. This was gross for the fact of a goop of sun tan lotion and body fluids floating around the edge of the pool. It really was nasty. I used my Hilton points and at 40k a night that was a rip-off. Oh well. Not the worst property but by far not the best.

Reviews.Title: “What a disappointment”
Reviews.Author: whyaske
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the LV Hilton in the past, with the most recent stay being March 2011, but this will be the last. Our original room was right off the elevator, was very "tired" looking with a bad odor. When I was at the hotel in March, my room was very nice. We went down to the desk to inquire and were told that we would need to pay an additional $10.00 per night for an upgrade. Not seeing a choice at that point, we agreed to the upgrade and did indeed get a nicer room (at first glance). It was indeed a remodeled room, but the marble tiles in the entryway to the room were missing grout and moved when we walked on them. There was an automatic control for the window treatments that apparently wasn't connected because nothing happened when we hit the switch. I understand the water saving feature on the shower heads, but this one was more like a pressurized spray that felt like needles on the skin. Staff were generally not helpful. When questioned as to why we weren't offered the upgrade option at the time of reservation, we were told that we would have to talk to a supervisor. Interestingly enough, the gentleman at the front desk was wearing a name tag that below his name read "supervisor." The attention to detail throughout the hotel was sorely lacking as was security. Whenever we have stayed at a hotel on the Strip, there has always been a security person checking for a room key prior to getting in the elevator. We saw no security personnel and were never asked if we indeed were staying at the hotel prior to getting on the elevator. We also didn't appreciate the fact that there were take out pizza menus slid under our door. We didn't need to be solicited by outside people while staying at the hotel. We stayed at the Hilton because of the cheaper room rate, but after factoring in the cost of a monorail pass to get to the Strip or a cab fare, we'll stay on the Strip next time.

Reviews.Title: “Good for attending Convention Center events”
Reviews.Author: maryland_traveler27
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the LV Hilton for a professional meeting. This hotel was fine. The fact that they permit smoking inside is disgusting, but I found out that all hotels in LV allow the same. The room was a bit dated, but clean. Both me and my friend felt the beds were comfortable. I didn't have any trouble with noise from neighbors, but I did want to go to bed early on a Friday night, and despite being up near the top floor of the hotel, the music from the party on the pool deck was too loud to allow sleep. The cost for WiFi is usurious at $13.99 PER day PER laptop! Why is it that WiFi is free at cheaper hotels (like Holiday Inn Express) and so expensive at convention-type hotels? What a rip off. Hotel is well-located for going to events at the LV Convention Center. Food at hotel is moderate to poor quality and very expensive for what you get. However, am not sure it is more expensive than other LV hotels or restaurants. The whole city is a rip off.

Reviews.Title: “Not too bad...45 min. to check in at 11:00 p.m., though?”
Reviews.Author: RyanLV
Reviews.Content: Not too bad of a stay. For a Hilton, it worked. Went during memorial day weekend and got there on Friday night around 11:00 p.m. LV time...and had to wait over 45 minutes to check in. While it was ridiculous to wait that long, I suppose the holiday weekend was to blame. Went to the room and was pleased. Bathroom was ok, but the bed was comfortable and the room was pretty spacious. Ate at the Paradise Cafe downstairs. Ordered a breakfast meal (eggs, hash browns, etc.) and a bottle of water...for $18. The bottle of water was $2.95, and I thought I was saving some money from the $4.00 in-room water, but it was almost the size of one of those complimentary bottles of water. Ridiculous, but whatever --- I was hungry. Overall, not bad. Farther off the strip (but right at a monorail station, making strip access easy), and one of the only hotels there (that I'm aware of) where you can use AAA.

Reviews.Title: “Would never stay here again...”
Reviews.Author: KelseyJSeattle
Reviews.Content: Should have written this sooner....But better late then never! I stayed here during a convention for work and it was the most disgusting hotel I've ever stayed at. We had to move rooms three times (which i have never asked to do before at any other hotel in my life) first room was really stinky and the carpet was soaking wet. The second room we had to move due to a bathroom ceiling and vent leaking to the point i poked it and my fingers went through and more water came dribbling out, plus there was mold because of all the moisture. The third room had thick thick dust on everything. They comped us a dinner at Benihana for our troubles of moving a million times (not enough to make my opinion better), we should have just left from the moment we walked in. I have since had to go back for work and stayed much further away for a very comparable price and taken a cab from the strip to the convention center daily to avoid this hotel. The only bonuses to this place are that one of the bellmen is awesome and has worked there since it opened and had GREAT stories about working with Elvis back in the day, which was entertaining while moving from room to room (he gets five stars for being a really cool guy!) and the proximity to the LV Convention Center you can walk there in 5 mins.

Reviews.Title: “Great people and facility”
Reviews.Author: 3kidsama
Reviews.Content: We loved everything about our stay. Thank you Hilton family.

Reviews.Title: “Not the best luxury hotel in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: DustinDD
Reviews.Content: Hard to navigate. Easy to confuse with other Hilton Hotel that is ON the Strip. No microwave in hotel anywhere. Fan in bathroom did not work and is awkwardly placed right above the shower (privacy anyone?) And you dont have a chance at winning big in Vegas with computerized (rigged) slot machines! Many of the Staff were rude. Credit Card machine at hotel check in counter were faulty. Its just not what I was excecting from a Hilton Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Much left to be desired”
Reviews.Author: RLK3
Reviews.Content: While the room was clean and in good condition, the walls were paper thin and I could hear everything going on around me. The people partying above me kept me awake for over 2 hours in the middle of the night. I could clearly hear the TV and phone conversations from the rooms next to me. Also, noise from the hallway including doors closing and housekeeping woke me up numerous times. Also, the dining coupons that were part of my deal were never provided. Lastly, no one from the hotel informed me of the room credit in exchange for not needing housekeeping on a daily basis. When another guest mentioned it and I inquired, the housekeeping dept. was very rude. I was told a manager would call me back to discuss the matter as I insisted I deserved the credits and no one ever responded back.

Reviews.Title: “What a Dump!”
Reviews.Author: Patricia32122
Reviews.Content: This should be the next hotel that is taken down. It is very sad to see how run down this property is. My room was 11119 in the center tower. To say it is beyond repair is an understatement, the carpet was gross, you could feel every box spring in the bed, the bath tub had chips in the porcelain, the shower nozel was ready to fall of the wall and the desk chair was a banquet room chair. When I spoke with the front desk they told me if I wanted to upgrade to another room it would be an additional $20 above $179 rate. the Paradise Cafe and Mexican Restaurant were closed on Sunday at 2 p,m.

Reviews.Title: “10/10 simply the best - a safe bet!”
Reviews.Author: Bently90210
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in many Vegas hotels, Wynn, Mgm, New York New York, Planet Hollywood, The Palms etc even the dire Stratosphere! This is one of the best, with all the strip hotels you get tourists and loads of them all day and all night! If you stay just of the strip here at the Las Vegas Hilton you get none of this and you can always find a spot to gamble, relax and eat. I have stayed here 7 times in various rooms, and the best one for luxury and economy is a Lanai suite, it comprises a bedroom, lounge a seperate washroom and walk in shower, also a patio deck. There are only 27 of these rooms and they are right on the pool deck, you can get these for $150 per night, so amazing value when you consider a standard room at say the wynn or mgm or caesars! If your budget is a bit tighter then the standard rooms and premium rooms from $40 are an absolute bargin - cheaper than a travelodge! You wont find a better value hotel in vegas with all this luxury and history and class. Pool is excellent, relaxing and well laid out, and plenty of space. Largest sportsbook in the world and excellent gaming facilities. Staff are great and the property has a classic vegas feel with a modern twist Good enough for Elvis good enough for me!

Reviews.Title: “I wish I could do 3 and a half stars...”
Reviews.Author: miumiu4me
Reviews.Content: The Hilton is a perfectly acceptable hotel. The room was fairly clean, although I did find a few hairs in the sink. The bathtub dripped, but whatever. It didn't smell and believe me, a lot of Vegas properties stink. The pool area was nice. Benihana was good, but the buffet was just passable. It's on the monorail, so the location is doable. I'd stay again...if I got a good rate.

Reviews.Title: “It's not on the Strip, but you get what you pay for.”
Reviews.Author: izfo
Reviews.Content: Even though this hotel is just off the Strip, Vegas is a bit of a sprawl-y city and we felt there wasn't much within walking distance. to get to the Strip you either had to take their little monorail thing or drive. Same thing with shopping or Fremont St. Other than location, the hotel was great. We had a nice room, the bed was soooooooo comfortable, everything was clean and spacious. Casino and shops downstairs seemed a bit lame but we didn't really spend any time there. One tiny detail that really bothered us was that toll-free calls from the room were $1 per minute, so calling an airlines 1-800 number, etc. ended up costing us a few bucks. I'm not sure if that's normal for Vegas, but we've never ran into paying for toll-free calls before so that was odd. Also, I forget the details, but WIFI wasn't free either. They really get you on the small stuff, I guess.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Britontheroadagain
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed our stay. Great staff, great hotel. Nice and clean, good service, will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “I don't get the bad reviews...I was impressed!”
Reviews.Author: tigerhunt2011
Reviews.Content: After reading the other reviews on this hotel, I was fairly skeptical of what to expect at this hotel. I booked it because of my experience with Hilton in the past, and this hotel surely didn't disappoint. My close friend and I were staying in Vegas overnight for a Kylie Minogue concert and luxe shopping. I booked a Resorts Club Room (do it!) which was an excellent decision. The valet was prompt, despite my busy arrival time of 2pm. Walking into the lobby, I could tell they weren't lying about the recent renovations. Nice marble floors, updated signage, etc. There was a separate check-in line for HHonors, VIP, and Resorts Club Room guests, which made me happy from the moment I stepped in. I waited about 10 minutes before being greeted by a smiling agent who simply collected a photo ID and confirmation number and promptly gave me my arrival packet. Knowing of the renovations, I inquired if my room was one of the newly upgraded ones, and I was assured it was. Proceeding to my room, the elevator was a tad dated, but it was speedy so no complaints there. After getting into the room, I was VERY happy! Two complimentary bottles of water were provided because it was a Resorts Club room. Robes in the closet was a very nice touch. The room itself was very contemporary and up-to-date, from the furniture, to the bathroom fixtures (and upgraded toiletry amenities). Never have I had bell staff retrieve my luggage as quickly as at The Las Vegas Hilton. No more than 10 minutes passed between my call and the arrival of my luggage. GREAT bell service! After the luggage came, we checked out the Resorts Club Lounge. I've frequented Ritz Carlton properties that have a Club Lounge, so I had a vague expectation. At 2pm there was a plentiful stock of cookies, cheese and crackers, fruits and vegetables, soda, and a large cappuccino machine. At a later return (about 6:30 pm), there was a Wine reception which was very nice to enjoy the view with. There were also restrooms, 32inch HD TVs, complimentary newspaper, and internet access in the Resorts Club Room. Very pleasant for a Hilton property. The BED was amazing! One of the most comfortable hotel beds I've ever slept in. It rivaled the Westin Heavenly Bed (only the pillows here were better!) Fabulous down comforter, sheets, etc. The next morning we did the breakfast buffet, which was not only very good, but well-priced at about $15 per person. (French toast and smoked salmon a la carte would've been upwards of $20 anywhere). The french toast was the most authentic I've ever had at a breakfast buffet (better than at ARIA, MGM and Mandalay even). Check-out was effortless, at 9:30 AM, they didn't even need a signature (I did traditional check-out because I wanted to ensure the Breakfast Buffet and movie charge posted correctly). Carried my luggage down, valet was quick in bringing back my car, and then I was off on my way, very pleased and ready to recommend and return to The Las Vegas Hilton. yes, it's off the strip, but a quick taxi to anywhere will make all your dreams come true... only two things to note: -the "electric" curtain control did not work, the track did not appear to even be electric, yet there was a switch for it. -the movie rental of "No Strings Attached" had mediocre quality and about every 20 minutes there would be a quick static overlay OTHER THAN THAT, great job LV Hilton!

Reviews.Title: “There are better options out there...”
Reviews.Author: WNNX
Reviews.Content: This hotel was famous in the 1970s; the hotel has not done much to improve upon it since then. It is hard to say the hotel was horrible cause it is not. Equally as hard is to say it was a great stay. The best that can be said is it is a comfortable stay. You have to talk about 1/4 mile to get to the strip - while the exercise is good for you, some may not wish to walk. There are no restaurants around the location so you have to walk to the strip if you don't wish to utilize the hotel eateries. Checkout was fast and efficient.

Reviews.Title: “The Hilton has gone downhill”
Reviews.Author: ronaldthayashi
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at the Hilton on many previous trips to Las Vegas. We were very disappointed with our stay. We received a very good rate on the rooms. It was a special promotion the Hilton was having. I thought maybe you gave the less desirable rooms to the people who had the special rates. The carpet where the sink was had a large tear in it and was a safety hazard. We didn't fall, but tripped on it a couple of times. The Las Vegas magazine was wet and wrinkled as if someone had dropped it in water. We went "green" and called on the phone as instructed. The second day I had to call THREE times! They still had us on the schedule for the room to be cleaned. The cleaning lady was VERY nice and courteous. We had the breakfast buffet which was very good. The service was very good and the server was extremely attentive and courteous.

Reviews.Title: “I will never stay at the Las Vegas Hilton again.”
Reviews.Author: emmaj805
Reviews.Content: I am a Hilton Honors member. Our stays at numerous Doubletree, Embassy Suites, and Hampton Inns were much more comfortable than the Las Vegas Hilton. My bed was uncomfortable. When returning to our room on Thursday night cigarette smoke was coming through the vents. It was terrible. We called and were told that an engineer would come up with a piece of equipment to eliminate the smoke odor. I told the operator that what would happen if that did not cure the problem. It was agreed that we change our room. I developed a headache which lasted most of Friday. I expressed my displeasure with the manager. She credited us with a room service charge of $20. That was not satisfactory. We should have had a credit issued for Thursday nights stay. It is time to rennovate the Las Vegas Hilton and bring it up to Hilton standards. The Hampton Inn in Seal Beach is a much more comfortable hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Won't stay again”
Reviews.Author: havingfun42
Reviews.Content: This was an anniversary trip with my husband. I had stayed at the HIlton a couple of years ago while attending a conference so I was familiar with the room types and the property. I had reserved a Resort Club king room several months prior to this trip. We arrived at the hotel at 9:30 pm after flying all day and stood in line behind two other people at registration for 45 minutes before one of the two people working the check-in were available. I was informed that the hotel was over-booked and the room I requested was not available. They tried to give me a standard room with double beds with a "bonus" that I could move to the room I requested the next day. By now I had been at registration for 1 hour and was not happy. The clerk gave me several reasons why my room was not available, the people before us didn't check out, they gave my room away to another couple, the hotel was over-booked and then that there was a room available but it was dirty and she had no idea when it would be cleaned. At this point I asked for the manager. The manager had zero problem solving skills but did eventually decide that she could get the dirty room cleaned in about an hours time frame and she would give us a $50 credit to go eat dinner in one of their restraunts. An hour later after eating dinner we returned to the desk stood in line again and was told the maid had been cleaning the room for a while so she should be nearly done and we could head up to the room. We arrived at the room which was still dirty, the maids cart was in the hallway but she was no maid in sight. The maid showed up and said she was just told to the clean the room and it would 20 or so minutes. We sat in the hallway and waited. Once we got into the room we turned on the air conditioner and had the pleasure of listening to a really loud squeal it was putting out. Additionally, this room was next to the elevator so it sounded like a freight train running through the room everytime the elevators moved. It was 1 am so we decided to go to sleep and deal with it the next day. The next morning I called and was told my room would be ready at 3 pm and it was. We moved and had no more room issues or any other issues the rest of the stay. We did zip check-out which avoids lines with them emailing you a copy of your bill. I have opened that bill and have found that they did not credit the $50 as promised on that 1st night. So tomorrow I will have to call and fight with them about it. A couple other things that I thought was strange was they charged a $10 "handling fee" to have a package shipped to the hotel and they charged $1 a minute to use the internet. We travel a lot and I have never had such horrible customer service at any hotel. I definately will not be staying or recommending the Las Vegas Hilton.

Reviews.Title: “Inconsistent. Check in was fantastic, went down hill after that.”
Reviews.Author: Kimbw
Reviews.Content: We were thrilled with the check in process. The gentleman that helped us found out it was our wedding, gave us an upgrade and couldn't have been nicer. We changed our reservation 2 days after making them (4 months prior to arrival) to add an extra night, received an email confirmation, etc.. The last night we got back to the room, key wouldn't work. VERY RUDE LADY at the front desk told us we didn't have a room for that night and no, she couldn't tell me where all our stuff that was in the room was (including cash in safe, wedding dress, etc..) after showing her email confirmation she still insisted that I was lying. Finally got another room, however we had to repack and move ourselves and could only get into the old room 1 time. We never received an apology, and were moved clear across the hotel from the rest of our wedding party. Even after speaking to the manager (after waiting for 25 min) still no reasonable solution. Very upset wedding trip ended this way. Will never stay here again. Restaraunt was awful as well. Not many options here. Benihanas was saving grace.

Reviews.Title: “Hilton let us down on this one”
Reviews.Author: kurtg19
Reviews.Content: I have always been really happy with our Hilton stays but the Las Vegas Hilton needs to be updated badly, I feel like they are struggling to keep it up to Hilton standards. The bathrooms in our rooms were nasty and small, no water pressure to the 14th floor and it took almost 3.5 minutes for the water to turn even luke warm in the shower. Usually Hilton beds are known for being really comfortable but these were a poor excuse and smaller than normal. We requested a crib for our baby and it was never brought up and finally after calling a few times they got around to it. There is nowhere good to eat and the front desk was not friendly and only has 2 people checking a long line of people in. For the price and what Vegas has to offer do yourself a favor and stay somewhere else! Just seems old and run down, kinda dirty and a big let down.

Reviews.Title: “Don't be tempted”
Reviews.Author: TheWanders
Reviews.Content: I stay at Hiltons all the time and am a Diamond VIP (time means I stay more than 60 nights a year in a Hilton property). This was our second Trip to the LV Hilton, and this time will be out last. The hotel is need of major updating. Our room had several issues, such as the toilet not working, light bulbs in the bath room blowing, and just overall age and use. We rented a Cabana by the pool, the fan didn't work, the TV was fuzzy and the servcie was sub-standard for the price paid. I had to go to the front desk several times to get these and other issues resolved. It should not take 3 trips to the desk to get someone to to react. I called Hilton Guest Assistance, they emailed the hotel and the hotel didn't even respond to them. So long story short..this hotel just doesn't care about its guest anymore. They really don't care about their HIlton Honors guests, they didn't even give me credit for my stay, had to fight to get that as well.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: shoni72076
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hilton 4-15/4-18 we went for the bull riding at Mandalay Bay. The Hilton hotel itself was just amazing, but there can be long lines to check in or out. Also, buy a bus pass for around $5 and ride the bus instead of a taxi...........they can be expensive. Try the Rio hotel buffet......again a long line but worth it.....they have every food you can think of from crab legs to soul food. My husband and I will be back in Oct. for the PBR finals. Oh.......One more big one I almost forgot.......WEAR COMFORTABLE SHOES....

Reviews.Title: “Hiltons Disappointment”
Reviews.Author: Mariner91910
Reviews.Content: What a disappointment the Hilton was this weekend. My niece had a wedding scheduled in the Las Vegas Hilton on Saturday and most of our family stayed at the Hotel. My wife and I and immediate family checked in on Friday night only to find out that our king size beds and Non-smoking rooms were not reserved for us. We were told that it was a request only, not a reservation. What we ended up with was a room (non-smoking) that smelled like cigarettes, and two double beds, when I asked to speak to the supervisor he was not available and when I gave them my cell telephone number and room number, he did not return my call. Excuse me....when I call up four weeks in advance and Reserve a room, I do it for a king size bed and non-smoking room always, I am a little to large for a double bed and quit cigarettes fifteen years ago, do not care to be reminded of them. I am trying to get someone to respond to our disappointment, I am not asking for retribution but to make sure this does not happen again. When my wife and I got married a year and a half ago, we put the wedding party up in the Hilton in Rancho Cucamonga, Ca., when we went on our honeymoon in Hawaii, we stayed at the Hilton on both islands we were at. We have never had such a poorly kept room in any of the Hiltons we have stayed in. This hotel was the worst I have ever stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Off Strip Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: TravelingThruEurope
Reviews.Content: This was our second time staying at the LV Hilton. One word "Awesome!" You can't go wrong with the price or location of this hotel. The pool was great, although very crowded on the weekends. We received a complimentary upgrade to a nice room in the North Tower at check in. The views overlooking the golf course and mountains were lovely. Check in/out was a breeze. We would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “lousy hotel”
Reviews.Author: ray9541
Reviews.Content: rooms are old and not cleaned.bed snot comfortable.parking area is mile away.not impressed at all

Reviews.Title: “dissapointed overall”
Reviews.Author: Dede057
Reviews.Content: Conference held here, so I really had no choice. First the postives. Chris from New Jersey was at the front desk to check us in. I felt we got an upgrade, because he said I will get you a quiet room. We were on the 29th floor, with a balcony with a nice view. I think we were in the East Tower. The room was amazingly quiet. Have never stayed anywhere that was this quiet before. The beds were very comfortable, the room clean, and although a bit outdated, very large. I liked being a little off the strip (better price) and the monorail access is right there. The first day we walked to the bus, not that far, and it felt pretty safe. Breakfast buffet was very good and reasonable price. Here are the negatives. The conference rooms were a disaster. Speakers from adjoining room were easily heard, no microphones for questions from attendees, and poor lighting in conference rooms overall (Usually there is some type of overhead lighting to highlight the speaker if the room holds 300 people and you happen to be sitting in the back. Bathrooms were two flights of stairs up from the ballrooms (there was one handicapped stall on the ground level - for hundreds of attendees). The pool water was freezing, even the kids were complaining, and the pool area seemed overcrowded with no one using the shaded "pay to use" areas. Oh, and the worst is that my necklace (a sentimental inexpensive piece from Mexico) was stolen by a housekeeper. I clearly knew where I placed it by the sink when I removed it wednesday morning and it was not there when we returned to the room wednesday evening. Although only worth about 60 bucks, it was the first time I have ever had anything stolen from a hotel room, and that is the last time I will stay at a Hilton property.

Reviews.Title: “Team Room 10 Team Gym 2”
Reviews.Author: BuddyPOxfordNC
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed my stay. Room in the East Tower very nice. I was dissapointed in the gym.I enjoy working out and expected much better from Hilton! Too Small for the size of the hotel, old equipment with Out of Order signs on several machines. Many nice properties I stay in have a super gym located near the top floor with a great view of the city.Hours of operations were to limited. This is a 24/7 city. Gym hours should be expanded. I had to be in line at 5:50 am to use a treadmill when the doors opened at 6AM! Many others joined me.I was in town for a National Show. By the time the show ended and I entertained my guests the gym was closed in the evening (8PM).

Reviews.Title: “clean and comfortable but spa is lacking for the extra cost”
Reviews.Author: thriftyvacationer
Reviews.Content: The hotel is older and not fancy, but the rooms are updated and very clean. For $120 or less I think it is fine. Spa access is $20 a day and the staff are very loud in there. I have never been to a spa where the staff are actually yelling out someones name to find them. However, I had a great massage by Gina. Pool area is nice but the nice furniture is an extra fee. Nothing close to walk or jog to in the neighborhood, it was a little scary outside of the property. The monorail is on property so that was nice. Skip housekeeping service and get $10 ticket for food and drinks at the restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised”
Reviews.Author: Hawaiigirl44
Reviews.Content: Ok, so it's off strip. That's my only real negative thing to say. I was surprised. This room was so much better than I thought it would be. I've stayed in LOTS of Vegas hotels and I'd put this in the top 4. The rooms were clean and large. I loved all of the huge mirrors everywhere, it really opened up the place. Beds were comfortable. Great casino. My boyfriend says it's the best sports book in Vegas. Pool was nice with some pleasant shady places to sit. Beautiful grounds. The only staff I dealt with was the front desk lady who wasn't the freindliest but hey, customer service jobs suck and she got us out of there fast. The line was long but went fast. I only wish the room had a fridge but otherwise it was good. Clean and comfortable. We were in the main tower. I must say this place had the nicest parking garage. Usually they're dark dirty and scary, this one is well lit, clean and had music even. Spacious easy parking as well. The parking garage was close to the room as well as the little coffee place downstairs. I would definitely stay here again. I like to use priceline and that's how I ended up with this room. Got an amazing price. Priceline hasn't let me down yet!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing--especially the service”
Reviews.Author: California_momofsix
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a 20th anniversary trip--but it was less than romantic! We picked the hotel because my husband is a Diamond HH club member--not that anyone at this hotel cared. The hotel might have been great once, but it is old and tired now and the staff is incompetent and not helpful. We had especially requested a quiet room and were horrified to find a room with adjoining doors. My biggest pet pieve, I am a light sleeper. My husband called the front desk and asked for a room without adjoining doors, 20 minutes later a key was brought up to us. The second room was dirty--and had an adjoining room door also, in an even more prominent place. We called again and asked were there any rooms without adjoining doors and the front desk clerk told us he had no idea. How can that be? We ended up going to the first room, fortunately we had quiet "neighbors." I had looked at a map, but didn't realize that the hotel is this far from anything in a rough neighborhood. It is convenient to the bus line to the airport and the monorail though. Breakfast was included with our stay, and the breakfast buffet was pretty nice (not the Rio, but what is?) but the servers were rude and didn't seem to speak English. We did not get the beverage we asked for. Also the stores closed early, and the pool was closed, even though the website had advertised it as open (and I had even bought a new bathing suit for the trip) The Elvis statue was a nice touch, but we will not stay here again--there are many better options.

Reviews.Title: “Stay somehere else!”
Reviews.Author: deepamg
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel because I had loads of Hilton points. I knew the location would not be great but expected more from the hotel in terms of service, shopping etc etc. The hotel was "sad" in front of other Las Vegas hotels. I would not recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “I'll Never Stay Here Again!”
Reviews.Author: kim-ohradiogirl
Reviews.Content: My colleague booked the room because she knew I had a conference in the Hilton and she thought that it would be convenient. She's a Hilton Honors member. It ended up being more of a hassle. The Las Vegas Hilton has nice rooms. They have a nice outdoor walking track. Not only do they have NO FREE wifi, the wifi is $13.99 a day; that is ridiculous. Most people are vacationing or attending a conference and have little time to spend on the Internet; the price point should be lowered and/or other options should be made available. Additionally, they need to have FREE wifi hotspot, if only for 20-30 minutes per day. They have a nice buffet, overpriced, but lots of options. The business center (a third party affiliate) charges a $10 handling fee to receive packages. Again, ridiculous. Finally, the spa is $20 a day and it's the only way to gain access to their gym. So we paid $130 per night, for what? A room w/ no wifi and a stopped up bathtub.

Reviews.Title: “Expected More”
Reviews.Author: FabioR2
Reviews.Content: I had a higher expectation for a Hilton. My bedsheets and towels had holes on them. The only convenience at this hotel was the monorail station. Nothing else.

Reviews.Title: “ok but can get better for the price”
Reviews.Author: Nanatimes5
Reviews.Content: Room was clean - carpet hadn't been cleaned for a while. Shower nozzel very low if taller than 5 feet good luck, low ceiling also. Hotel personnel very friendly and knowledgeable. Casino dull and small, mono rail can be picked u at the hotel which is great.

Reviews.Title: “OK... not great”
Reviews.Author: gala62
Reviews.Content: My hubby (who is a diamond HH) and I arrived at 2:30pm to be told that our reserved king non-smoking room would not be ready for another 2-3 hours! uhhh, no, that's not going to happen. After going back and forth with the desk clerk (who did try very hard), she did find us an available king room. Just none of the usual HH perks (upgraded room, welcome package, etc). To top it off, one of our nightstands had a shattered glass panel. We were in the North Tower, which I believe has updated decor. Also, the service we received was good, it's the property and policies we have more of a problem with. It did get better. Nightstand was replaced after 2 notifications to front desk. Extra pillows delivered within reasonable time. HH discount honored at breakfast buffet (but no one told us about it - I made my hubby ask! LOL). Buffet was actually quite good. Not scenic or worth a special trip, but good quality food prepared fresh. Lots of veggies and fruit options and the roast beef was outstandingly good. The real downsides of the property are the business center (separately owned and expensive) and the pool "complex" (incredibly small pool, cabanas to rent and lots of concrete). Really, for someone who likes to swim - the pool knocks a full star off my review - this pool is better suited for a Best Western in Des Moines (and I'm pretty sure I'm insulting Best Western and Des Moines!!). The casino is dated and basic. Nothing special here. I guess the sports book is pretty big if that's your thing. Overall, with 2 other Hilton properties in town, we'll try another one next time my husband has to come to Vegas on business.

Reviews.Title: “Average at best”
Reviews.Author: c_sperry
Reviews.Content: I would start by saying the hotel front desk checked you through, remarked and checked you out like cattle. Just another number. Was not upfront with the extra hotel charges for the safe, when booked was to be included. Very far walk from anything. In the rough part of town. Perfect for a business person that had to attend the LV Convention Centre. Short walk. Other than that, would not go back. Imperial Palace was much better for half the price and much better service, with an excellent location.

Reviews.Title: “Great Room Rates, Very Nice Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: LJPGeoman
Reviews.Content: This is the largest Hilton in the world and has the largest Race & Sports Book in Vegas. It opened in 1968 as the International but has been expanded and renovated several times since. Our room and the casino looked as if they had been recently renovated. For some reason, their room rates are cheaper than most comparable hotels in Vegas perhaps because of its location about a block off the strip. We stayed three nights. Our room was on the 23rd floor of the central tower. The room was clean, spacious and comfortable. Everything worked although we didn't pay the fees to use the safe or wi-fi. The bathroom was lacking a towel rack by the sink but there were plenty of towels. They gave us an option which we liked - each day you choose not to have housekeeping clean the room, change the towels, change the sheets, etc, you get a $10 credit at the bars, restaurants, gift shop, etc. We used our $20 of credit for drinks. We spent one day out by the very nice heated pool and spa which wasn't crowded at all. Some earlier reviews have mentioned hookers in the hotel. We didn't notice that although we saw some young woman dressed in super short skirts and super high heels which seems to be the style of the day. Only one mild complaint - the first evening, we could hear very loud Cinco de Mayo celebration music coming from somewhere below us. It was so loud and thumping, we could barely hear our TV. We went out for dinner and the music was done when we got back to our room.

Reviews.Title: “For price paid, no complaints.”
Reviews.Author: snausage
Reviews.Content: Only 2nd trip to Vegas (last visited in 2005). I'm mostly a low-rolling slots gambler. I visited at least 10 casinos over the course of this trip and had no luck whatsoever. I will say, though, that the casino layout at the Hilton is really mediocre. A lot of space is wasted in their main casino area, and I can't stand the Star Trek casino. The sportsbook area is as good as advertised, though. As for the hotel itself, the room was decent. Furniture was rather dingy, but at $40 per night, I'll deal with it. Had noisy neighbors on 1 out of 5 nights. Probably par for the course in Vegas... Plumbing is kind of iffy, so be gentle with the john (the less T.P. you use, the better...) Heard the sound of elevator whooshing up and down an elevator shaft at all hours of day and night, but according to fire evacuation map, there weren't any elevators near my room. STRANGE! (not even a service elevator!) Maybe it was a secret elevator to get to some private penthouse :)

Reviews.Title: “What do except for 48 dollars a night.”
Reviews.Author: krpj25
Reviews.Content: Old, house keepers don't care, found pubic hair on bathroom floor, shower leaked and our sink didn't drain...bed was nice but was disappointed with my stay.. Im a hilton honors member and I stay at hilton hotels alot but I will never stay here again if I come back to Vegas...

Reviews.Title: “The Las Vegas Hilton SUCKS!”
Reviews.Author: NikkiJay34
Reviews.Content: The Las Vegas Hilton once was my home away from home, but since the past few years both the hotel looks rundown and the service is terrible. When I walked in the lobby it reeked of cigarette smoke. While checking in the service clerk was very rude. The rooms are old and outdated. You cannot put a flat screen TV in an old room and call it remodeled.The housekeeping staff is a joke. No one speaks English. I registered 2 guest, they kept leaving me 1 set of bath towels so I had to keep calling for more. Had breakfast at the Paradise Cafe. The food was okay. But when the server tried to serve me coffee from a pitched that looked as if it had never been cleaned ever, I was done. I notified the server, she said it was foam. What coffee pitched has foam? I didn't order a latte. I should have called the Health Department. The only good thing about the hotel is the Valet staff.

Reviews.Title: “I was checked into a uncleaned room and customer service was NOT good!!”
Reviews.Author: BELUVALICIOUS
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hilton becaue my brother was getting married there on Saturday! I requested an early check-in and that went well. Do to the fact that I was traveling alone I requested a room close to my brother and was told that would not be a problem. I was given a room on the East and my brothet was onb the north. When I checked into my room, I walked into a dirty, uncleaned, smelly room. I called down to the front desk and they act as if they didnt want to assist me, and advisd me that I was lucky I was allowed an early check-in. I requested a manager who atfter several min agreed to change my room. I waited 20 min for another room key to be sent up to me. I asked the manger what would he be willing to do for my inconvenience and he told me NOTHING! I had a bad flight, luggage was lost, I had to travel at 5am and to top it off i get to the Hilton and my room was not cleaned and the service was not acceptable.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: wanderlustgyrl
Reviews.Content: Our first night here was not so good. It was like 'party central' next door. We were awaken around 4am by some partying kids with loud music . Security came and ended their party soon though. Other than that, our stay was fine. Room was clean and comfy, and we were located near an elevator as requested. I only ate at the Paradise Cafe, which is nothing fancy-just a simple Denny's type diner. This Hilton is located about a mile away from the Strip; but a big plus is that there's a monorail stop right in front - and you can earn or use Hilton Honors rewards points for your stay. The cost of our hotel room was cheaper too than staying at most center Strip hotels. Overall, a good value.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Value”
Reviews.Author: Dogswood
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 days each at the beginning and end of our Northern Arizona vacation. Based on some of the past reviews, we were expecting something much worse than we got. The hotels website allows you to easily shop for lower rates based on the time of visit. While the hotel has a huge casino, it is one major street off the strip. But it is very easy to walk, drive or take the monorail to the strip. When the hotel is not busy, it is relatively easy to get an upgrade. It helps to sign up for Hilton Honors (free) because you get priority check-in and a better chance at an upgrade. We paid for the basic room but got a beautiful double size room for both our visits. Check-in was cheerful and quick and our room was clean, quiet and modern. This hotel has a program whereby if you elect to skip a daily maid service a $10 voucher is left under your door each day good for services in the hotel. Two such vouchers allowed us to have the excellent buffet breakfast one morning for a few dollars. A great deal especially if you are a smoked salmon lover. While our stay was right at the beginning of April, the temperature was in the high 80's. We sat out by the pool for a whole day. One of the few major LV hotels without a resort fee. Just show your key and you get chairs and towels for no extra charge. The only gripe is one that is standard for most major hotels in large cities. The absence of free internet or wi-fi. However, this is not a major problem since there are several McDonald's and at least one Starbucks within a 15 minute walk or 2minute drive. All in all a terrific stay albeit off the Strip. Will definitely return

Reviews.Title: “My First Visit to Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: aronrana
Reviews.Content: I drove to Las Vegas from Riverside, CA. The trip to Vegas was unbelievable. Once we arrived at the Hilton Hotel, we made a quick check in and headed for our rooms. Our check in was at night. I loved the view from the room. It was extraordinary. I also loved the motorized curtains. Overall, my stay at the Hilton Hotel was great.

Reviews.Title: “Off Strip - On Monorail - At Convention Center. Nice for the Price”
Reviews.Author: pcsanity
Reviews.Content: Okay, lets start with the point....if you are looking to be in the center of the action on the Las Vegas Strip, this location may not be for you. If you want to be at the convention center, or at a location with easy access to the central strip by car or monorail than this is a great option. The Las Vegas Hilton is an older hotel with a casino but is well maintained. We were in town for four nights staying three of them at the Hilton Grand Vacations at the Flamingo. (Excellent Property by the way....see my review of that location) Friday night prices on the strip were crazy, and we had wanted to ride the rides at the Stratosphere arrival night and do the Neon Boneyard tour the next day, so this was a great fit for an inexpensive overnight. Glad we did, this is a nice hotel and it fit the bill for the night. Upon arrival it is a bit hectic and confusing to find where to check in if you don't want to use valet parking but we found a 15 minute zone spot and finished our check in. There was a long line for check in but as a Diamond HHonors client we went to the the VIP line...so our check in took about 5 minutes. Though we had a confirmed King Non Smoking they tried to put us in a room with two double beds...unacceptable and I had to get a bit pushy but they finally put us in a room on their "resort" floor....though they did not give us access to the lounge...cheesy to do that, given Diamonds are supposed to get lounge access, but we checked in late so would not have gotten much benefit from the lounge. Our key worked to get into the lounge but the lady at the desk would not admit us without additional documentation from the hotel. The lobby is large and welcoming with a casino, multiple dining options, etc. The room and bathrooms are nicely appointed and are roomy enough. Room decoration is warm. The room had plenty of desk space. The bed was very comfortable and the hotel had plenty of TV Channels and flat screen TV's. Climate control is acceptable and you can leave the blower motor on for white noise while still using the climate control. Absolutely no noise from the nearby boulevard. They did have a couple of bottles of water in our room. (no charge) This was only because we were on the resort floor. Oddly enough there was not a clock in the room and we had to call down to ask for one. The bathroom was properly appointed....small but acceptable. There was no charge for in room internet access as a HHonors diamond member for 1 computer...the second (or first for non HHonors members) is $13.95. The one connection per room....also kind of cheesy in the world of multiple laptop using spouses. One Diamond amenity that was provided was full breakfast in their buffet, which was a nice step up....given only continental is required. This was the best HHonors buffet I have had in the US. (Not as good as Europe locations, but by far the best in the US) Full breakfast, chmpaign , mimosas, (on the weekend) full omelet station, lots of food choices, great option...excellent buffet. Good Service. Awesome! Honestly, even if we had to pay for this buffet it would have been a good deal. Another amenity that they provided that was excellent is that they did not blink at offering us 4pm checkout. Self parking is free, Valet is $10, unless you are a HHonors elite, then it is free. The hotel had an outdoor pool and hot tub area that was rather nice. They also had an excellent health club / gym / spa. Access to the health club / gym / spa was complimentary as HHonors Diamond members. (I am unsure how much it cost for non elite guests) We would stay here again in a heartbeat if we did not need to be right on the strip. Other than a few minor hiccups with check in and clock, the hotel was perfect....though they did not give us lounge access the other perks more than made up for it.

Reviews.Title: “Aging Property, Mediocre Casino, Good Steakhouse”
Reviews.Author: mjm19
Reviews.Content: I came into town for an overnight stay to attend a convention. While I was pleasantly suprised to be able to get an early check-in on arrival, the property itself does not impress. There have been some superficial updates to the guest rooms, but as a whole I would classify them as "1980s Vegas Dingy." On the plus side, the filet that I had at TJ's Steakhouse was excellent, as was the gracious hostess and fine service. Compared to the other steakhouses in town, it was an excellent value. The workout facilities are a $20/day charge unless you are an HHonors member and are clearly not worth it - a small room jammed to the gills with equipment and people. Opt for the outdoor jogging track instead.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: wonderla
Reviews.Content: I got a good weekend deal since this hotel is off strip...its cheaper than others. But it is connected by monorail which can be accessed from the lobby. Spotless room ,comfy beds, great room service, few in house discounts and store credits.

Reviews.Title: “We were disappointed”
Reviews.Author: ramblinro
Reviews.Content: We stay at the Las Vegas Hilton every trip to Las Vegas but I don't think we will be staying there any longer. This trip we were quite disappointed. I specified a King and what I got was 2 Queens. We specified the central tower clost to the elevator because we have knee problems and can't walk too far without pain. We have always gotten exacctly what we asked for before but not this time. Our room was 1670 which was clear at the end of the hall. Yes, it was near an elevator, but the walk downstairs, from the elevator to the casino was horrendous. We don't like the way you make the beds, either. What's wrong with the old fasioned sheet and bedspread? Also the rooms are quite uncomfortable. Not enough comfortable seating for 2 people. I think you need to do some upgrading and though you have been our hotel of choice for many years, I believe we will be staying elsewhere in the future.

Reviews.Title: “you make a reservation, after the confirmation you get the response not pet friendly and no refunds!!!!”
Reviews.Author: wmanoth
Reviews.Content: after making a reservation, you get the confirmation not per friendly and no person is willing to make a refund on the first night charge, bad service!!!!! several sites are advertising that the hotel is pet friendly, but they are not. after contacting the hotel very unfriendly responses from the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, off the strip so not noisey!”
Reviews.Author: reidy67
Reviews.Content: Helpful staff. Buffet excellent. Have stayed many times and each time has been a good experience!

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel away from the strip and near the convention center”
Reviews.Author: unklez
Reviews.Content: The Hilton in Vegas is very large and, inspite of being off the strip, quite busy. It is next to the Vegas convention center. The casino is on the small side - I only saw 1 floor with maybe 20 tables and lots of machines. There is also an OTB arena on the premises. The rooms are large, clean and well maintained. I wish they'd advertise clearly that the rate did not include internet, breakfast, fridge and gym :-( The pool water was colder than expected.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms, excellent hotel staff, not a great casino.”
Reviews.Author: shanetron
Reviews.Content: Arrived at the hotel for a short trip from LA. The doorman, Tommy is a real class act; his manner and humor were greatly appreciated. He's a busy guy though, so I was a little dissappointed when he was engaged when I came back down to head out for the night, fortunately, his colleague Eric was there to take the reigns. He set me on my way for a great night in Vegas. Also the gentleman and lady working at Fortuna in the evening were good fun and whipped me up a mean red-eye. Thanks guys!

Reviews.Title: “GOOD DEALS RIGHT NOW!”
Reviews.Author: kjk64
Reviews.Content: I just booked here and will write a review about my stay after I return. But wanted to share the pricing is $139 for 3 nights (promo QX74DB) 2 free buffets, 2 free fitness passes. I just cant believe this price! So wanted to share...

Reviews.Title: “Aging Property”
Reviews.Author: tazmansd
Reviews.Content: When we arrived the room type (premium king, nonsmoking) we were promised twice on the phone wasn't available. Then after some wrangling, we were given an "upgrade". The upgrade was a big room with a beat up bed, cigarette burns in the carpet, with ash trays everywhere, plus cigarette smoke was literally being pumped into the room thru ventilation system. An hour later we had a king nonsmoking room. The room was OK but small. And periodically the ventilation system pumped cigarette smoke into the room. On the plus side the spa service and staff were 1st rate. I would only stay here if the location and room price is right for you. And you have a good tolerance for smoke.

Reviews.Title: “great package value for vegas; easy in/out”
Reviews.Author: dakotakidz
Reviews.Content: Stayed here using the "escape" package that included breakfast. We got the premium room versus the classic room, as they claimed they were remodeled and nicer for just a bit more money. room was fine, except the tub was a large garden tub and difficult for older people to get in/out of to shower...it was alos in need of new grout. The rest of the room,however, was remodeled and fine. The breakfast buffet here was GREAT! So good, we went back and got the $20 dinner buffet that night ... well worth it, especially if you do the package. We had some problems with the 1-800 room reservations when we canceled our last nite there due to a change in plans, however when we spoke to the front desk directly, they had no problems with our change, and assured us it was fine - they phone line had made a mistake. Eating places OTHER than the buffet are a bit limited ... a benihanas, a deli and a higher end steakhouse are your other choices. However the buffet was excellent - we didn't expect it to be THAT good! Stayed in the east tower. Also saw Nunsense, which was cute,but not a "big time" vegas show.. it's in the Cabaret, and while good for the money ($32 tickets), know that it's only a 5-person cast.

Reviews.Title: “A little old but still good”
Reviews.Author: Marcowatty
Reviews.Content: I read a lot of reviews about the Hilton and i was a little concerned. I think that I you go their expecting a 5 star Hilton hotel, you will be disappointed. If you go for a cheap hotel with excellent amenities, you'll be pleased. I was upgraded free of charge to a suite on the 24th floor. It was wonderful. I had a massive bath tub and a very large room with a nice television. The monorail makes everything easily accessible and I enjoyed the ease win which I could travel abou. Make sure you heard the one stop north to the sahara and straosphere casinos as they were both good for cheap ears and gambling.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: tim805
Reviews.Content: We checked in around 1:00 and the front desk was very nice about gettting us our room. The room we were booked into was actually not ready so the nice front desk clerk gave us a upgraded 1bed/parlor suite. The room was huge and from the 10th floor had a nice view. No parking fees or room resort fee which I liked. We booked through Vegas.com and no problems with that process. We used the Monarail to travel to the Strip and had breakfast in the Buffett which was very good.

Reviews.Title: “The only place to stay and play in Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: smemonk
Reviews.Content: We stay at the Hilton at least one week a month. The buffet is one of the best you will find anywhere. At dinner the price includes free beer and wine and all the oysters you can eat. The prime rib is actually prime rib, not steamship roast like many places. The rooms are lovely and spacious. The gaming is good as well. The only problem with the Las Vegas Hilton is that you won't want to leave.

Reviews.Title: “Best Bargain in Town”
Reviews.Author: zildana
Reviews.Content: Hip and happening it definitely isn't but if you want quiet tho somewhat faded elegance at a good price WITH NO MANDATORY DAILY "RESORT FEE" then you could do far worse than the Hilton! They have a great "escape to Vegas" pkg that includes a "classic " (ie, basic, un-renovated) rm, one bufffet b'fast for 2 (worth $28), one spa entry for 2 (worth $40) plus 2 free drinks ($14-16) and several BOGO restaurant discounts (est worth over $100 if you use them all)--all for $46 a nite. Other hotels may advertise rates as low as $25 to $35 per nite but most of them will add a resort fee of $5-12 per nite that doesn't usually provide spa or fitness ctr access or even free wifi. As a Hilton Gold member I was cheerfully upgraded when I arrived after 10pm on a Mon by Jeanelle to a "premium" (ie, renovated with frig in North Tower) room that was spacious and tastefully decorated, with premium bedding, lge flat screen plasma TV, and even a very comfy oval tub with excellent water pressure and good drainage. I was also given free b'fast buffet and spa/fitness ctr access DAILY plus free wifi in the room. FYI: The biz ctr is NOT free but as a Gold you can AVOID the $3 FEE TO PRINT YR BOARDING PASS IF YOU FAX OR EMAIL THE BIZ CTR A PDF WITH THE PASS. By the time I figured all this out it was too late to take advantage of it but will do so next time. There will definitely BE a next time as the buffet b'fast was amazing in both quantity and quality (tho service could be a bit slow esp the later you went) and I LOVED relaxing in the almost deserted spa jacuzzis, steam rm and sauna, (complete with robe, slippers, cold water and chilled washcloths!). It wasn't as posh as Qua at Ceasars or the Canyon Ranch at the Venetian but it also didn't cost $40-45 AND I didn't have to lve the hotel. Also enjoyed the pool outside the spa/fitness ctr on the 3rd floor (neither the Venetian or Qua includes swimming pool access with their day spa entrance fees). Both the pool and spa staff were very friendly and helpful. I also happily took advantage of their unique $10 per nite restaurant cert for passing on daily maid service. My only negatives woulld be the small size of the bathrm--really HATE having to close the door to be able to access the toilet or showe/tub!--and the limited TV channels plus the slow valet parking service (tho having a rm in the N Tower was VERY convenient to self-parking). The only restaurant I tried was Benihana and it was decidedly mediocre and overpriced--even with the $20 I saved by not having my rm cleaned! Wanted to see the Elvis Impersonator but he was booked Tues nite and I had other plans for Wed. BTW, I ALWAYS rent a car in Vegas as traffic really isn't bad during the week and parking is either free or cheap (few $ for valet). This time I got a great last min deal at rentalcars.com for 3 days compact at $50. Shuttle to/fr the airport plus daily monorail passes would've cost more and not been as convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: Laureninvail17
Reviews.Content: We booked a room at the Las Vegas Hilton and weren't expecting much, to be honest. The place is old and fairly removed from the Strip, and we read some pretty terrible reviews on the hotel (after we had booked it and couldn't make any changes, of course). We showed up and while the lobby, shopping and casino areas are pretty outdated and unspectacular, our room was really nice. The room, a premium room, was spacious, clean and had just been renovated. The linens on the bed were amazing, as was the bed itself. The room had great views of the strip, and it was easy to get to the strip either via a $8-$10 cab ride or the monorail, which has a stop right at the hotel. The monorail is $12 for an all-day pass and you can ride as often as you'd like for 24 hours. It stops at Harrah's, Bally's and the MGM Grand, so there's easy access to most of the strip from many of the stops. All in all, while the Hilton isn't one of the fanciest hotels in Vegas, if you're looking for a nice room at a cheap price, this is a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A gem in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: TheInterpreter
Reviews.Content: Check in was quick. My room was large and totally smoke and noise free. Nice view of a lake and golf course with the mountains in the horizon. The pool was not too crowded. The buffet was great at $19.99. Everyone was helpful. Services are excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Very Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Mcopena
Reviews.Content: We arrived Friday night after a long drive from California ... we checked and arrived at our room expecting to be able to rest and freshen up a bit before eating. The room was not ready for use! it was not cleaned yet with used glasses and drinks still in the room, loose articles still lying around as well as the bed not made yet. We called the front desk and were given free meal vouchers so we could eat before returning to the room. We finished eating and went back to the room and it was still not done and the housekeeper still in the room attempting to call maintenance because the blinds did not work. She asked us to call them which we did and waited and waitted for them to come ... after 30 minutes of waiting we called the front desk and had them assist. It took another 20 -30 minutes for someone to come to our room and transfer our belongings to another room. It was a VERY Long day coming from work ...the long drive and for that to happen was just rough and difficult to understand. My wife and son were not happy!!!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed in condition of room, but ...”
Reviews.Author: ebm1973
Reviews.Content: Our room had a well-worn look to include an ugly "stain" at the ceiling wall junction which was many inches long. There were also ugly stains/spots around the bathtub, a chunk of missing wood from the chair leg, and other small things all of which contributed to a worn look, not expected from a Hilton hotel. Upon pointing out these issues to the staff, a new room was offered but we chose to stay as we were settled in already. We were then given some satisfactory comp coupons, some of which we happily used.

Reviews.Title: “Ladies of the night :(”
Reviews.Author: le8383
Reviews.Content: This hotel was nice and affordable but... there is no security checking for keys at the elevators like most hotels. So the Ladies of the night hang around the elevators picking up Johns. The bed frame came a loose and my roomate cut her ankle on it. House keeping and security came right away to fix it and even offered us an upgraded room for the inconvience. But for any medical attention they will refer you to a clinic in the area where you have to pay for treatment up front and the hotel will reimbursed you later what an inconvience for being hurt on thier property! The shower's hot water would come and go on some mornings. after expressing our concerns about the medical protcol mangement comp us one nights stay and gave us free buffet tickets. The buffet was not worth the free ticket yuck!

Reviews.Title: “Ideal hotel for location and convenience. Very friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Nicola61Ita
Reviews.Content: No longer a super hotel if compared with the most recent ones in Las Vegas but it is a Hilton and it shows all its quality. Highly reccomendable.

Reviews.Title: “Not what you would expect at Hilton”
Reviews.Author: bhnow
Reviews.Content: This is a tired hotel. It started off bad when the underwear from a previous guest was in the closet. Other things such as a using a banquet chair for a desk chair and the inability to set the clock to right time were frustrating. The rate was great, but I am not sure I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Rude,Rude,Rude.. Hilton its time for a change.. get rid of the ungrateful EMPLOYEE..”
Reviews.Author: topdog005
Reviews.Content: The customer service at this hotel is horrible. The only good thing about it is that the rooms are large ..The service was the worst I have ever I really cant belive how rude some of the employees are at the hilton. The time was about 10:00 or 10:30 ish I wanted coffee , so I was assited to the FORTUNA Coffee Shop which also serves starbucks coffee. so as I stood in the line at fortuna everything is looking so good to me , with the pastries in all.. and they also serve wine.. I was very amazed.. So as the young lady had taken my drink order she was also very polite , with a beautiful smile. I ordered a large americano . so the cashier ask what did you order ? didnt crack any smile looked totally mad that she had to be there working so I told her the order was a large americano , so I ask her if I could ad something else onto my check , she says its to late she already charged me.. I really thought that was very rude.. I guess she forgot that I AM THE CUSTOMER AN SHES THE EMPLOYEE. IM HER JOB SECURITY . I WAS SO PISSED. I WENT BACK TO MY ROOM SO I COULD CLEAR MY HEAD. BUT I SURELY FOUND OUT THE ANGRY,MAD, NO CUSTOMER SERVICE EXPERIENCE CASHIERS NAME MOUNIQE. who ever hired this mad angry lady must have been desperate.. everyone else was pleasent and curtious. I also went for coffee and a bagle the next day in the early morning totally different staff fresh faces with smiles. everyone was so nice and very attentive to my order ask how was I doing , and have a good day.. the morning staff is on there job. so now we are at the end of our stay I was here with friends . yes I would reommend this hotel and I would stay here again..Im not going to let the rude angry girl drive me away .

Reviews.Title: “Worst Experience Ever”
Reviews.Author: DeeBPickus
Reviews.Content: The customer service at this hotel is all about what is easiest for them. They lied to my face. I upgraded to a "premium" room, was told that my room was a "premium" room and found the oldest, grossest most disgusting room I have ever stayed in. The mattress must have been 20 years old. The sink was a hexagonal tiered, pink sink but that did not matter as much as the black mold around the grout at my sink. I could not understand the handles in the bathroom -- plastic green marble look??. The tub was so high that I had difficulty getting in and out. The tub and toilet were pink. We were there with a group and everyone paid less than me but had various differing levels of rooms. The customer service in Benihana was atrocious. The ability to get separate checks at any of the restaurants we went to was very difficult. The buffet would not let your 16-year-old daughters in without an adult. I had to beg and plead and make my case for everything that I should have just been given.
