Reviews.Title: “Good value non-themed hotel off strip”
Reviews.Author: TheFlyingScots
Reviews.Content: Have travelled to Las Vegas for many years, stayed on the Strip most times, apart from last two (July 2010 and March 2011). Got such a good deal on the first trip, despite some concern (from me!) about being "so far" out of the way. Well, Vegas is changing.....the once heavenly Mirage, is now full of young clientele and geared towards the younger crowd - as are most strip hotels. The use of air freshener to combat the smoke is overpowering in some places (MGM especially). So whilst good to visit all these great/interesting/luxurious hotels - Monorail right outside links to all strip hotels - it was a delight to return to a slightly, less grand old lady, who pipes good rock music around the hotel, has no themes, and makes me feel like a youngster in comparison! Agree it could do with a face lift, but, my superior room *extra $15 on arrival* was great, pillow top bed, good facilities, all working. But, I never spend time in the room - only to sleep. Bars and food are OK. I loved the Benihana (never experienced one before) and the Chinese restaurant was excellent. Pool area good (a bit concretey - could do with a few more decorative palms!) but good service. Think older Hilton needing updated with benefit of a casino..........if that floats your boat, this Hilton will do nicely for you. I'll certainly be back.

Reviews.Title: “rude service at check in”
Reviews.Author: conniep557
Reviews.Content: Rude service at check in. Have never been treated like this before. Stayed a few times before, at LV Hilton. Will probably try another hotel next time.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: ClaimsMachine
Reviews.Content: Overall, I was very happy. The only complaint I had was the AC was not that cold but for 50 bucks a night, I was very happy!

Reviews.Title: “"There ya go"”
Reviews.Author: intelno001
Reviews.Content: Upon checking out of a Hilton property, I expect to hear a "Thank you for staying with us" or "have a nice day" or "goodbye" but checking out today, I got a "There you go". Anyway, the sheets were stained with some unknown yellow substance (a LOT of stains, all over the duvet cover) the AC didn't work, had to call an engineer to come open it up and work on it at 11pm. Basically I felt like I wasn't even wanted there, much less an appreciated guest. Nice pool area, nice casino, nice sportsbook, otherwise, it sucks.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty, loud, and smelled loike cigareyyes everywhere!”
Reviews.Author: megan0895
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed here when I went To Vegas to get married. When we checked in we were told that we were getting an "upgraded" room. When we got to our room there was something all over the bathroom counter and ceiling. The faucet to the shower was on and wouldn't turn off and leaked our whole stay. Everything smelled like cigarettes and the hallway floors were disgusting. I also got my hair done in the Regis salon for the wedding and it looked nothing like the picture I had given to the stylist, I was almost ready to cry. We got married in the La Bella wedding chapel, where the minister was spastic. He tried to crack jokesduring the ceremony and it was ridiculous. I would absolutely not reccomend the Hilton to anyone to stay, or get married.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms but received some poor service”
Reviews.Author: cns1201
Reviews.Content: The rooms were larger than regular standard rooms I have been in. The rooms were clean. Basic amenities were provided in the room with the exception of a coffee maker. The suite rooms were nice and spacious which included a small fridge, small wet bar area, 2 bathrooms and a large walk in closet. The restaurant we ate at had good food, good service and reasonable rates. The Hilton wait staff in the convention room for a dinner was something to be desired. Staff argued between one another in the room while they were serving. We had one server make rude comments while serving about one of our collegues which was uncalled for. My table had asked for a pitcher of water 4 times before the server threw up her hands and said I don't have any water. Let's just say the staff in the banquet rooms need a tuning in. Other than the service during a convention dinner The Hilton was a nice place to stay with good room rates.

Reviews.Title: “Homey, Comforting”
Reviews.Author: dedalus449
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just spend 3 nights at the Las Vegas Hilton, and I have nothing bad to say about it. I know that sounds like a backhanded kind of compliment, but that is how I feel about the place. If you want grandeur, go elsewhere. If you want pretention, stay away. If you want a full-time rush 24/7, forget it. If you want experienced competence at affordable rates, then the Hilton is for you. My wife had to go to a social work conference there, while I hung and explored on my own. I spent part of the time in our ample and spacious room doing work on my computer and part of the time on foot or monorail exploring the strip. The monorail stops at the Hilton, making it very accessible to other venues. I had breakfast twice in the Paradise Cafe, used the coffee kiosk by the registration desk often, and meandered into the casino at random moments when I felt like some slot machine action. The hotel felt like a proper home base: easy to negotiate, friendly, compact in the amenities end of things. And the Paradise Cafe, for casual low-cost breakfasts, is your home town cafe: heavy on waffles, bacon, and granola, light on caviar and oysters. Fine with me. Do I have any complaints? This is minor and aesthetic only. I'm not crazy about being treated as a demographic. This is done by the incessant piping of "music of your life" retro rock into every public space 24/7. I know that it is another "this is your hometown" device, but I resent the demographic targeting. I actually burst out laughing when the Rivingtons blasted me with "Bird is the Word" in the men's room or when Dylan broke out into "Like a Rolling Stone" while I was having a cup of tea. It was ok: I've heard worse, and Big Joe Turner's "Chicken and the Chicken Hawk" went well with my morning waffle one morning. Still, a little less demographic targeting goes a long way with me. But I liked the Hilton. When I wanted my grandeur fix I got on the monorail and went elsewhere, and got out when I'd felt the telltales signs of sublimity overload. (One giant statue looks like all the others.) The LV Hilton knows what it is, and plays its role with easy confidence. It doesn't pretend to be pyramid, a movie set, a French Rue de la Desert, etc. I liked the arrangement of the public spaces, with easy access from cafe to casino to room elevators. I found the staff friendly and efficient. And when I came back from another hotel by taxi, the doorman said to me "Welcome home." I kid you not. Would I go back? Sure. I'm a fussy guy and I found nothing to be dismayed about. That's good, isn't it?

Reviews.Title: “Nice old place that's over-due for a remodel.”
Reviews.Author: N7JLF
Reviews.Content: I can understand wanting to reduce your monthly electric bill, but leaving half the light sockets empty in the rooms leaves one feeling like they are are showering in an un-lit mine. The thread-bare carpet had a lot of cigarette burns and stains making it very obvious the facility is long overdue for a face lift.

Reviews.Title: “Eh”
Reviews.Author: aushleyg
Reviews.Content: We got a good deal and it ended up costing us 5 nights for the price of 2. However customer service is lacking.. people were rude.. I know you should expect that in Vegas but not pleased. 22.00 for cereal, croissant, bowl of bananas, and strawberries was pricey. The food for our convention was mediocre. The shower was clogged the entire time we stayed I went and complained to front desk 3 times. However one neat thing they have is you can get a 10.00 voucher for food and drink there for every night you dont request housekeeping! Just hang the sign on the door by 7am.. its on the night stand. Probably wont stay here again.. bad enough that our 1000+ people convention is moving on next year...

Reviews.Title: “Convenient to the Strip, Prices great, Food and Service Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: Mickey02_11
Reviews.Content: Hotel is not so large that you get tired walking. Cleanliness was paramount. Rooms were spacious and had great views. Staff were very respectful. I was comfortable in bed and all the furniture was very attractive. I loved the duvet covers and sheets were a high quality. Entertainment in the hotel was nice and restaurants and buffets were great. We will stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “I was so disappointed”
Reviews.Author: witchyb
Reviews.Content: We always stay at the Hilton and have always loved it but this was not up to par, not even close. I have trouble walking so asked for a close room, HA! North Tower (the furthest walk) then 3rd floor #130 (another LONG walk down the hall. Then we open the curtains and had a lovely view of the roof and a/c unit. The person in the room next to ours blared his TV 24/7 so got very little sleep. The bed was 1/2 made the entire 6 days. We had free rooms coming from other hotels but chose to PAY for our room at the Hilton because it was our perferred hotel. Never again. The casino has a big lack of slot machines, they seem to have all disappeared and they are using the 20 year old Red/White/Blue machines. The older dealers were all great but the new ones are rude, unfriendly and to damn concerned about hand speed, and that ruins the games.

Reviews.Title: “Great Package for Vegas repeat offenders!!!”
Reviews.Author: Bigguyhappy
Reviews.Content: Listen, the reviews for the Hilton are more up and down than that freaking NYNY rollercoaster, and I'm not denying other people's bad experiences (to each their own) but for Vegas 'regulars' like us who've seen the strip change drastically over the last 15-20 years, the Hilton can still offer unbeatable, old-time Vegas value and charm. Checked in late on a Saturday night Feb 18th, had a young man from Guadalajara at check-in who defines customer service excellence. What a fantastic guy and a great intro to staying at the Hilton (we've partied and played there but never stayed before). Customer service continued from Alita at check-in, Maria at the poker table and all the great servers at the Hilton buffet (we were comped brunch and dinner for our short stay and man, we enjoyed that buffet something good!!!). Room was fine, 1st night in a smoking suite (i prefer non-smoking so we switched next night) but this suite was still outstanding...you could hold a poker tournie in the walk-in closet in that room LOL. As mentioned the buffet was excellent, fresh and vast array of hot and cold items. We consider ourselves foodies and would rate this buffet amongst the best we've had in town. And miracle or miracles...we actually got served cocktails fairly quickly on the casino floor. Sorry gi-normous Strip casinos, but old-time, quick and regular cocktail service definitely seems a thing of the past these days on uber-expensive Las Vegas Blvd. No, the Hilton is not Bellagio or Caesars. Yes we may return to one of the fancy joints another time. But we'll always consider the Hilton first...especially if they keep offering the kind of great package we got (low 200$ range for 2 nights stay, buffet included, 2 spa visits and free drink coupons in the Sports book). And we got another meal comped with our upgraded suite at check-in. Combined with outstanding customer service, the package made for a great 11th trip to Vegas. Keep up the excellent work Las Vegas Hilton!!!

Reviews.Title: “It's ok if you are just looking foe a place to sleep.”
Reviews.Author: casper888
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 night, business reason. Not cheap on the room rate compares to other main strip hotels, room are pretty old and worn out, but clean and tidy. Location is off the main strip. Feeling a bit lonely and quiet. (I dont feel Im in Vegas at all). The matress was old and too soft. The pillows are great. Flat screen TV always nice.

Reviews.Title: “staffin general was not hospitable, seemed to take patrons for granted. like I had to be there.”
Reviews.Author: halexander724
Reviews.Content: need to be more friendly and courteous...I was made to feel like just give me your money and leave.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel In Town”
Reviews.Author: realpamv
Reviews.Content: We really like to stay here. We are always treated with respect. Your employees are great.

Reviews.Title: “Classic Vegas - can't go wrong”
Reviews.Author: SHOWEMTHERING
Reviews.Content: We arrived early (12:30ish early for normal checkin times) and promply got a room, even got upgraded to a Grand Room (for a small nightly upgrade fee). The lady who checked us in was very pleasant and very helpful. Our room was very clean and very comfortable, our room had a couch, flat screen tv, chair w/ ottoman, desk w/ chair, and a king bed. Our view was mostly of the LV Hilton sign, but we could also see towards the strip. I will say the room itself was a little worn but not gross or disgusting as some have suggested. (for example: there was a dent and paint chipped on the bottom of the inside of the bathroom door that maint should be fixing and also the shower curtain had been ripped off of a few of the hooks by previous guests and was hanging on one corner). The bathroom was very nice, (very clean) and even had an oversized tub. With our package we were here 4 nights and received some great dining/drink coupons for the hotel. Due to our schedule of shows and other activites we didn't get a chance to use them all but will give thumbs up for both the coffee shop and the mexican bar for happy hour. Also would like to say thank you to LVH for the great slot win on our second to last day. The casino itself is great (not too crowded and the dealers are pros and friendly).Even though there were a few conferences during our stay we never felt like we were tripping over people. No long waits for the elevators, all in all very good trip. Make sure you sign up for the players card, you can't go wrong. Also, with our Silver HH we were able to get into the spa for free. Very nice facility. And the staff was great and very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Clean spacious room in a large hotel off-Strip...Car needed.”
Reviews.Author: CaptainBly
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel February 24-28, 2011. The hotel is spacious and features a convention area as well as casino and sports book. The rooms were spacious, clean, and pretty well appointed, as a typical business hotel room. The maids were prompt in cleaning the rooms every day, and there were a number of themed restaurant, bars, coffee shops and buffet dining options. The Spa was nice and featured wet and dry steam saunas, 104 degree and 70 degree jacuzzis, and are gender segregated. The fitness center was inside the Spa Center. There is a daily fee to use these facilities. I would recommend this hotel with 2 caveats: A) A car is essential as all other hotels, shopping and casinos are quite a distance away. The new monorail only reaches a handful of other properties on the Strip. B) Be advised the hotel restaurants, Sports Book and shops pretty much shut down about 10-11pm every night and the casinos are large but not very crowded.

Reviews.Title: “Not the quality you expect from a Hilton”
Reviews.Author: sreason7
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a wedding and found the rooms to be very nice (we booked a "premium" room with updated bed and furniture), but maintenance a bit lacking. We have several problems with our room: 1) the air conditioning didn't work properly; 2) the bathtub was plugged up; and 3) our room was not cleaned one day. I must say that that staff who addressed our problems were great; the guy who fixed the air conditioning was very friendly and helpful; the housekeeper who came to clean our room when it was missed was absolutely wonderful; and the plugged up tub was fixed when we returned to our room. It just seemed a bit much that we had so many things wrong with our room. It is a big hotel, and difficult to keep up with all the maintenance, I guess. Also, food prices were really high--you expect some good prices in the coffee shop, but a simple breakfast was $12.00. Coffee prices at the two expresso stands were really high, too. We did have a fantastic dinner at the steakhouse, TJ's. Pricey, but the absolute best filet mignon I ever ate, and so worth it. Starters and side dishes people ordered (baked potato, mushrooms, lobster bisque, salads) were incredible as well. We were there to attend a wedding. The chapel was nice (not too gaudy) and the minister/justice of the peace was great. When the bride and groom checked in around 4:00 p.m., they were told their room would not be ready for one or two hours (check-in is 3:00 p.m.). The desk clerk then tried to sell them a suite (they already had a mini suite) for $200 more a night! Is this why they were told their room wasn't ready? To sell them a more expensive room? Also, they charge for everything--Internet access ($13.95/day, although a cheaper service is available through another source for $9.99/day), local calls ($1.00 each), and use of exercise room (some outrageous fee). Not what I would expect of a Hlton. All in all though, our stay was fine.

Reviews.Title: “Great comps great room and great service.”
Reviews.Author: bigb1728
Reviews.Content: I am an average gambler spending .80cents a spin. The hotel comps me 4 free nights in a delux room, two smorgs, $50.00 cash to show up, $50.00 in meal discounts which I used a Tres Rios, excellent 1 pound steak. The room was great although I am not in it much. The lounge was nice except too expensive on drinks but the free ones on the floor were good. The location is perfect as I don't like to walk miles and be pushed and shoved by the newbies. The tram is just right for price and availability. It is a short walk to the strip and Circus Circus and the people are really friendly. The machines are up to date and plenty of variety. The entertainment changes constantly and is very affordable. What the hell more could you want. Get a players club card and qualify and then wait for the mailers and go twice a year or more. Love it. From Canada

Reviews.Title: “not so bad after all”
Reviews.Author: rbgrot
Reviews.Content: My company made the reservations so I had no choice and after reading the reviews here, I was really worried about staying at the Hilton. My room (a Classic Double , 22 floor, East Tower) was very comfortable, maybe a little shabby. Extremely clean. I slept really well, no problems at all with plumbing, AC or noise. I agree that charging so much(if at all) for Internet is ridiculous in this day and age. I ate at the Paradise Cafe-food was OK if a little pricey. I ate at the breakfast buffet twice-again a little pricey but loved the lox and blintzes. The wait staff I encountered were very pleasant-although, why do they always seat a single woman off in the farthest corner? I guess I would stay here again if working an event at the Convention Center comes up again.

Reviews.Title: “I will never stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: Lisa4Dennis
Reviews.Content: The cold water in both the sink and shower were horrible... it was so hot that we would have been burned alive so we could NOT shower at all. The tub drain was horrible and barely drained. We had to bath using washcloths and running the tub faucet because the shower was burning us. The tub faucet was at least tolerable but it was like camping, seriously. Not what we expected from a Hilton. We complained 3 times and they kept saying they'd fix but never did. They would NOT change our rooms because they said they were sold out so what we got was 2 free buffet breakfasts (whoopie). The bed was extremely hard and very uncomfortable. Last time we stayed here, we had major issues with the heater not working and it was freezing. We are done with the Hilton Las Vegas. Very poor service and terrible facilities. Motel 6 would have been a step-up, seriously!

Reviews.Title: “No Problems”
Reviews.Author: whoknows987
Reviews.Content: In spite of the bad reviews, I decided to stay at the Las Vegas Hilton as I was attending a conference that was held there and in the adjacent Las Vegas Convention Center. I stayed for 5 nights so got a pretty good look at it. The room showed signs of neglect: the carpet was well worn with some stains, there was caulking coming out just a bit around the tub, the toilet ran all of the time (which I was able to easily fix myself with a quick adjustment to the flapper chain) and the whole hotel away from the main floor just seemed a bit drab especially for glitzy Las Vegas. These things do not bother me but the traveler who is expecting everything to be perfect may see it differently. Housekeeping was good, the room furnishings were good, especially the bed. The room was quiet and the temperature control was good. In spite of some of the horror stories in other reviews about the staff, I found them universally very friendly and courteous. No complaints at all in that regard. A few complaints, however: The room internet quality was good but $14 a day is a ripoff. I stay in hotels at half the price where it is free. I had to pay $3.00 in order to log onto the hotel computer that allowed me to print off a boarding pass. Because I got caught there during a major weather disruption to air service throughout the nation, I ended up having to do this several times. Not a big cost consideration in the whole scheme of things but it gave the impression that they were not going to miss any opportunity to stick it to their guests. The hotel does not provide an airport shuttle which is okay, but the Concierge, while friendly, was surprisingly ignorant of the schedules and pickup procedures for the commercial shuttles that provide transportation to the airport. I guess they figure that if you could afford the hotel, you could afford a taxi. Of course the hotel is designed so that you have to walk through or by the casino every time you go somewhere and get to enjoy the second had cigarette smoke. However, the smoke control is good and I did not notice cigarette smoke elsewhere in the hotel. I spent a sum total of 0 cents on gambling during my 5-day stay so clearly I am no expert on the matter. However, it was my observation that the Hilton casino was dull and boring. There was no excitement like I saw in some other casinos that I walked through. The people who were there were just somberly going about the business of loosing their money. There are some real food bargains some places on the Strip but I didn't find any at the Hilton. However, the Paradise Cafe on the main floor was reasonable. It is just plain food but it ranged from decent to really good. I probably ate at leas a half-dozen meals there including breakfasts, lunches, and dinners. At peak times there was sometimes a bit of a line but I never had to wait to get a seat at the counter which is where I ate most of my meals. All in all, I would not see any reason to avoid this hotel. However, if you are headed to Las Vegas for fun and excitement, I would look elsewhere. Also, there are a ton of hotels in Vegas. I am sure there are some much better buys that are more convenient to the strip if you do a bit of looking around. If you are at a meeting in the Las Vegas Convention Center, it is worth considering this hotel for convenience. However, there are a couple other hotels that are conveniently located adjacent to the convention center as well including a Clarion right across the street from it. It would be worth checking out the alternatives. One final note, there is more than one Hilton Hotel in Las Vegas so make sure you know which one you are talking about if you are making reservations or looking at reviews.

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: BLR01
Reviews.Content: I had a great time at this hotel. The rooms are nice and the hotel food was really good. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “The Travelodge would have been better.”
Reviews.Author: AMDubII
Reviews.Content: I was a "guest" at the Las Vegas Hilton this weekend. There was a lot of mold on the ceiling of the first room that we had and our only option was to pay for an upgrade. We moved to the upgraded room. It appeared to be a lot better. Went to sleep and out on the town the next morning. We came back to the room for a nap and pulled back the covers and realized that we slept in a bed that had blood on the sheets. The blood was not ours because it was actually on the “comforter”, the part that you would pull up around your face. We called the front desk and the response was "ewwww, let me transfer you to housekeeping". We waited over 30 mins for someone to come and change the sheets. We went down to the desk and asked for a manager. Salvador Gonzalez told us he would have the housekeeping manger to come up to the room right away and said all he could do was offer us a free meal (that we were unable to use). We ended up waiting another 2 hours for housekeeping to come to the room. The housekeeping manager finally showed up and we left her to clean the room. When we came back, we found that she had not changed the bedding. She only removed the bloody bedding and threw a bag of clean bedding in the corner. We checked out (early) and was still charged. There were also charges for internet which we did not use and after 7 minutes of arguing with the clerk, the charges were removed. We walked the strip and after telling the people at Planet Hollywood our story we got a FREE room. If you are looking for a cheap room there is a Travelodge on the strip that was better than the Hilton.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay and sleep.”
Reviews.Author: Papabear75
Reviews.Content: Check in okay but did not get my room until 4:45 pm, rooms are very clean! Tj's Steakhouse rude service. When telling the waiter steak was overcooked he stated that I was wrong that only the very center would be medium. Danny was wrong the whole steak was well done, For the price my business was lost forever.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy, but a little old and smoky”
Reviews.Author: wilsonfish
Reviews.Content: The receptionist was friendly, but they had run out of non-smoking rooms. The smoking room didn't smell terribly, but it was very noticeable. The room was relatively clean, though there were a few stains on walls, fixtures, and in the shower. The building appears outdated (in the hallways and rooms, but not necessarily downstairs), especially compared to the rest of Las Vegas. Free parking was nice & convenient, and a monorail stop right outside takes you to the strip. It's off the strip, but not more than a mile. I most liked the price we paid for a simple night of sleep. However, I wish we had not been put in a smoking room against our wills.

Reviews.Title: “It could be so much better”
Reviews.Author: Treborwf
Reviews.Content: Not on the strip but the mono rail does have a stop here. Not sure how they can advertise a strip view room unless they mean a view of the tops of the strip hotels in the distance. Disappointed with a $3 daily charge for use of the safe, but unfortunately had to pay when having a laptop & video camera in tow - next they will be charging $1 for every time you use the bathroom. Loved the buffet, not the best food I’ve come across, but for less than $20 I wasn’t complaining when it included beer. The pizza place and some of the shops were closed but I guess this was due to lack of people as the place was empty. Hilton gold member so free breakfast and internet but had to double check with reception as when I checked in I wasn't given a letter detailing all my privileges.

Reviews.Title: “I am staying at the Hilton Las Vegas right now and so far the restaurant service has been horrible!”
Reviews.Author: Kelly195
Reviews.Content: The buffet Hostess needs to learn the definition of customer service. She is very rude. I watched her yell across the restaurant at customers. Talk under her breath bad mouthing customer in earshot. She acted like us, the customer, were an inconvenience to her. However the food was great.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value-easy location to all Vegas offers”
Reviews.Author: deh6646
Reviews.Content: Great Sports Book! Great Buffet! Easy access to rooms through quaint casino.

Reviews.Title: “What's next?”
Reviews.Author: ruby1952
Reviews.Content: We have stayed several times at this hotel over the years. However, it had been quite some since our last stay. Although we still like the property and its location our overall experience this time was not what we expected. We chose the Hilton "Resorts Package"-a nice perk overall-it includes morning continental-style breakfast, and in the evening refreshments and appetizers-cheese, fruit & vegetables, chips & dip, champagne, wine, beer and an assortment of juices and soft drinks. It also includes some room perks, bottled water, robes and slippers, a 37" flat screen TV. On our arrival we noticed only one robe in our closet, not a big deal but just the same we called the desk and were told that usually only one robe is provided. After explaining there were two of us staying in the room they agreed to send up another robe and did. Not a good start. It only went downhill from there. The hotel has a program allowing guests to opt-out of receiving daily housekeeping service, for doing so the guest receives daily a $10 coupon to be used in one of the property's restaurants. Since we enjoy having fresh linens and our bed made by while we're vacationing we chose not to participate in the program. After our second full day, and upon returning to our room late into the evening, housekeeping had opted-out for us. Upon calling the front desk to let them know our room had not been cleaned we were abruptly told we needed to call housekeeping ourselves. So we did only to be told that they thought we chose the no service program, and if we wanted to have our room made up that evening it would be at least a 45 minute wait before staff could get to it. So we went one day and night without housekeeping service but never received any compensation whatsoever. On our fifth evening we arrived at our room after an all day excursion only to find that our key cards would not open our door lock. Having remembered the Front Desk's "not our job" credo we decided to call Security. A security person-who was very professional and helpful-immediately came to our room with a pass key, and after checking our ID, which we appreciated, attempted to open our lock with his pass key but was unsuccessful. He then asked me to attempt to open the Resorts Room lock-located just down the hall- with my key. Upon being able to do that he determined our lock was malfunctioning and called the hotel's locksmith. At that point he explained that he was required to go on break and another security person would be there to stay with us until the locksmith arrived. That exchange took place but before the locksmith arrived the second security person needed to leave because of an emergency alarm call. Finally, the locksmith arrived and took the lock apart and determined its batteries were dead. Thirty minutes had elasped and we were not in our room yet. Since there was no security person present the locksmith was reluctant to let us into the room. We understood his dilemma and suggested he call Security, which he did. He received clearance to let us in but we still couldn't go in because he had to remove the framing in front of the bolt lock, stretch the door frame with a jack, and then, use a slip jack on the bolt to open the door. Another twenty minutes and we were finally in the room. Not done yet, he still had to replace the batteries in the lock. All in all over an hour after we had tried to open our door. We luckily had no pressing reservations for the night, and again, no apology from Management. On our sixth night we were abruptly awakened at 4am by an alarm that announced on the room's overhead speakers an emergency alarm had been triggered. The anouncement said this several times before finally announcing the emergency had been cleared and no other action was necessary. Again, and by now, expected, no further explanation or apology was given by Management. On our final morning we needed to check out early due to our flight and upon check out-which the guest is told can be done three easy ways-we chose to check out via TV screen only to find out that we could not receive a final total printout because it was too early in the day-5am. We were able to have the final emailed to us.

Reviews.Title: “Poor service competes with outdated rooms”
Reviews.Author: Trav-a-lot-from-Cali
Reviews.Content: Our visit to this property provides just one more experience demonstrating that the Hilton brand seems to be going from bad to worse. We came to Las Vegas for the Valentine's Day weekend to get away from everyday problems. I reserved the Valentine's Day package that promised us a bottle of champaign and chocolate dipped strawberries plus $100 in coupons. Upon arrival the check-in lady gave us the wrong set of coupons and informed us, incorrectly, that the room service folks will bring the champaign and strawberries to our room. After waiting for a while I called up the room service and got transferred to five different people and had to explain the same question to all of them. Finally, I was told that I have to go back to the check-in to get the coupon for the free champaign and strawberries to pick these up myself in a bar. There goes an hour of my time. We tried to use one dining coupon in a hotel restaurant but were told that this restaurant decided to shut early (at 8pm) on Valentine's Day weekend. After looking at the other hotel restaurants we decided that, even with coupons, we can get better experience for the same price elsewhere in LV so we ended up not using any of the coupons. The room was OK but the bathrooms are outdated and nowhere near the quality of what one gets in this price range at other LV hotels. Even though we were not directly near the elevator shafts (probably some 30 yards away), we could hear loud noises from elevators moving up and down all night. The HVAC fan was very loud, the kind of noise one would expect in a rural cheap motel, not LV Hilton. To top things up, during check-out I was double-charged for Internet. To their credit, they took the 2nd charge off as soon as I pointed it out. Finally, on the way to our car we found out that the elevators in the parking structure were not operating. The doors to one of them were wide open and the floor was splattered with blood. This place needs considerable investment, new management, and better trained employees. One would think that these days it would be easy to hire folks who are willing to treat customers right. Until such changes happen, we are not coming back.

Reviews.Title: “This was a terrible stay at the LV Hilton”
Reviews.Author: Sp0rty
Reviews.Content: We spent seven days at the LV Hilton and it was awful. First let me say that we love Las Vegas and spend from seven to ten days there 3 or 4 times each year. We like to stay at a different hotel each time, so I am familiar with the service (and respect) that other hotels still provide their customers. For seven days, we parked on the first floor of the hotel's garage. On Friday night, we were flagged down by a surly security guard and not permitted to park there. The reason was there was a concert held that night at the LV Hilton and we were forced to park on the roof. We were very lucky that the crowd was happy and respectful to us senior, but it could as easily not have worked out that well. We were given two rooms when we checked in and neither had any heat. Since they promised to fix the heat the next day, we decided to stay in the room. I had already unpacked and I wanted a shower. If we had stayed in the room the full seven days, the bathtub would never have drained. What a mess. Against my better judgment, I packed again and moved to another room. We were escorted by housekeeping, not a bellman, so we had not choice but to repack. The room we ended up with was used as a hospitality room, so the bed was a Murphy bed, smaller than a queen. The frame stuck out 2" all around and we kept running into it all week, but I didn't have to pack again. Oh, by the way, no heat in this room either. We were told by the manager that this room was an upgrade and he could not understand why the heat didn't work. Upgrade usually doesn't mean half the size, but at the LV Hilton it does. They fixed the heat and we stayed the 7 days. Never again. All the stores along the side entrance are empty -the pizza/yogurt/sandwich shop that has been there for years is only open on weekends. The whole place looks like a bizarre haunted house. Nasty. By the way, the housekeeping staff on the 26th floor was great - at least they are committed to customer service. More housekeeping, less "suits."

Reviews.Title: “Great service on 1/28/11; terrible service on 2/6-2/8 2011”
Reviews.Author: NHGrammyG
Reviews.Content: What a difference a week makes! Stayed one night on our way to Hawaii... Cecily at front desk was friendly and helpful with great smile... everyone happy to ensure a great stay... checked in late on 2/6 (close to midnight) front desk was slow and seemed like something was happening behind the scenes. Called down for towels twice on 2/7 and they never arrived... no morning paper... long lines because only one cashier at breakfast buffet... lots of trash and sort in hallway... what happened in one week? We like this hotel, the beds are comfortable (no bed bugs- I check!) Rooms are nice with large tub... monorail is convenient... too bad the service was off on our way back through!

Reviews.Title: “A very cold night”
Reviews.Author: donnacraig
Reviews.Content: Everything was very good but there was a problem with the air condition system call apound checkin to fix at 15:20 ad to caqll again at 17:50 and went to front desk at 19:46 called again at 22:24 and a service person came at 23:13 to fix He did adjust system but about 20minutes later it was putting out cold air again so we just had to deal with it. We had already call housekeeping for more blankets to keep warm so it was not really bad after we had them on beds. But we all have cold's today from the weekend with running noses. the hotel was great all others service were very good and super bowl party was better than the party at the pearl at the Palms. we were at both as a bonus GB won and we won at sportsbook. we did tell front dsesk again at checkout so that others will not have to deal with no heat and a cold room, they said that a workman would fix the problem. Donna R. Dawson

Reviews.Title: “The walls are paper thin, you can hear everything next door to you”
Reviews.Author: Bendtraveler24
Reviews.Content: When I booked my reservation, I did notice the reviews saying things like the carpet was old and the bathroom was too small. Since I was not planning to spend alot of time in my room except to sleep, I figured as long as it was clean, I did not care. While my room was clean, my neighbors drove me nuts. On both sides I had people with nasal/bronchial issues. I think at least one of them should have been seeing a doctor instead of being on vacation. They also had a problem with their "indoor voices" and I learned things they probably would not want a stranger to know about. Needless to say, I did not get alot of sleep in Vegas but not for the reasons you usually think of.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing for a Hilton”
Reviews.Author: RamieMIchigan
Reviews.Content: I was in town for a large conference at the end of January through early February and the official conference hotel was the LV Hilton. I stay in Hiltons regularly and was surprised at how dumpy this place was compared to other Hiltons. The lobby was dated and my room was even worse. It appeared that my room had not been updated since the 70s. Wallpaper was torn, carpets stained, toilet and tub were chipped, and the very small bathroom was covered in pink tile. Some of my colleagues were in nicer rooms, so I think I just got a bad draw. At least the room was quiet and had a nice bed. I was also disappointed in the restaurants. After checking out a lot of the other hotels in Vegas, I realized that the Hilton definitely was not the same quality as the Strip properties.

Reviews.Title: “Nickel and dimed”
Reviews.Author: mcsummer11
Reviews.Content: We were here for a conference and added a few extra days for fun. We paid over $200/per night and were told they don't charge "resort fees" as if that was going to save us money. Cons • $20/per hour fee to use the tennis courts • $1 per min local calls and toll free calls • Room reserved and paid for 6 wks in advance, the room still wasn’t guaranteed; ended up in a smoking room • Brunch buffet was overpriced for the quality of food • Pushy salesman in the lobby • Hotel restaurant offers a build your own omelet feature on the menu but the toppings are $2 each on top of a base charge of $11 • $13.99 per day charge for internet • $3 per day charge for in-room safe • No cable TV in the room! The channel lineup advertises 33 channels, however there are only 11 channels available. • Broken ice machine • Non ADA compliant bathtub/shower • $20/per day charge for the fitness center Pros • Friendly, helpful and gracious staff • Direct access to the monorail • Direct access to the convention center • Good views from hotel room

Reviews.Title: “Hilton should take the branding off of this one”
Reviews.Author: snowchick77
Reviews.Content: It's been a while since I reviewed a property, but this "Hilton" was so disappointing that I couldn't let it go. This hotel is so incredibly dated I feel bad for their marketing team to pretend it's a "great" destination. My bathroom smelled moldy - was clean enough, but smelled nasty. The carpet was disgustingly dirty, the casino was just nasty (not that I spent a lot of time there), and the Paradise Cafe, while reasonably good, was overpriced and not resort-worthy, either. The wait staff was lazy, and I'm sure while it was nice when Elvis lived there, it has fallen into disrepair (and it's well known in the area). Save money and take cabs. The hassle of cabbing to the convention center - which isn't even all that close--is worth not staying here.

Reviews.Title: “ONLY if you have too...”
Reviews.Author: LoriRNMichigan
Reviews.Content: Just returned last night from a business trip with my husband. Along with thousands of others who were attending the convention, we were booked at the LVH. Even though this place is the closest/most convienient to the convention center, you should look for another place to stay if you want service and updated accomodations. Our room shared a wall with the elevators so we heard this all night, every night. The room was spacious enough, but it seemed odd that there was no ottoman for the chair, no reading lamp and no light WHATSOEVER for the desk area. The desk chair was a cheap one that could've come right out of a Walmart. Bed just so-so; had way better at a much cheaper hotel. And my #1 beef is that there were just TWO lamps in the entire room! one with a 60watt bulb and the other with a 20 watt bulb that looked like it came out of a chandelier! I called housekeeping the first day and nothing. Second day I went to the front desk and the man wrote everything down and assured me that I would be given a floor lamp and a bulb change- I couldn't see to read!!! Checked out yesterday with no attention whatsoever to my complaints. I realize that we were two customers out of thousands, but the hotel's job is to provide value and customer service. Neither was given in my opinion.

Reviews.Title: “thoughtful & comfortable!”
Reviews.Author: mmmsmmmattie
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at many hotels in Las Vegas, in all price categories...ALL have something to offer...depending on what you are looking for...The Las Vegas Hilton is a smaller company that is up against some big competition...I have been impressed with their entertainment, and have enjoyed many shows and plays...I will be returning in April to see "Nunsence". The rooms have enough space for 2 adults and also have a fridge so that you can store leftovers for the next day...or chill that bottle of champagne...the resaurants are top-notch...from the buffet (I loved the weekend brunch including all the mimosas you wanted) to TJ's Steakhouse (absolutely fantastic) to Benihana's...to the relaxing bar area with asian-themed zen-like water sounds. The Hilton has everything you need without the high-price tag, and the people working there are NICE! The monorail is right there...and you buy a 24-hour monorail pass for $12 and go as many times as you like to any hotels...I liked to go all the way down to the MGM...for a variety of resaurants and entertainment...then I was happy to come back to my comfy room at The Hilton...this is an excellent Hotel for the money...some of the other reviews are not fair...I have stayed here on more than 6 occasions...and have not been disappointed...I have also stayed at The Wynn, The Venitian, Caesar's Palace, The Aria, The MGM, The Paris, The Imperial Palace, and many others...please be sure to compare apples to apples when deciding upon a place to stay...when I told them it was my anniversary...they delivered Champagne and chocolate strawberries in chocolate tuxedos! Yummy!

Reviews.Title: “This hotel was probably very fabulous about 50 years ago”
Reviews.Author: klalala60898
Reviews.Content: It's old, outdated and the service is AWFUL. I arrived last night to find that my reserved non-smoking room had been given away. So I'm in a musty, smoky smelly room. I realized I forgot toothpaste, but housekeeping doesn't provide toothpaste. I had to go searching for the gift shop at 1am my time zone to purchase toothpaste. The electric outlet beside my bed does not work. Today I went to the front desk and asked if I could have a refrigerator because I have celiac disease and need to stock up on food from offsite since these people don't even know what gluten IS and none of their restaurants can accommodate my dietary restriction. After the ladies finished b***hing about someone and turned to look at me, they told me I should go back up to my room and call housekeeping. Like, isn't that your job? I'm still waiting on a refrigerator two hours later. No microwave. The closest place I can get gluten-free food is a 20 dollar cab ride away roundtrip. Excessive fees: They charge $150 to receive packages and $14 a day for Internet. Such a ripoff. I will not come be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Potential NOT Used.”
Reviews.Author: stevenbrose
Reviews.Content: This property has so much potential. With its long history, I expected much more from this hotel. The Las Vegas Hilton needs serious updating and customer service is lacking. The hotel looks like it's straight out of the 80's. For the amount of money this hotel touts it recently spent on renovating, I have not seen the output. This hotel does not value its top-tier HHonors members. At check in, I received a generic letter welcoming me to the property and outlining the HHonors benefits I would be receiving. My VIP on-site benefits are set to a room upgrade and breakfast. The room upgrade was to a "renovated room". This "renovated room" had not been renovated in years. At some point, there must be a statute of limitations on how long you can call it "renovated". I would hate to see what the non-renovated rooms looked like. The letter also outlined that Gold and Diamond members would receive ONE free internet connection per day and each additional connection would be charged at the regular price of $13.99 per day. I do not believe this is what Hilton had in mind when they granted free internet as a published benefit to all members. HHonors members have computers, iPads, and cell phones that they would like to connect to the internet. On a positive note, the internet was reliable and fast. In addition, Gold & Diamond members get free access to the fitness center; I do not believe it's worth it for non HHonors Gold & Diamond members to pay for the use of this center. The buffet breakfast was pretty good. The weekend version was even better. HHonors Gold & Diamond members should bring their membership card with them in order to receive the breakfast. The front desk staff seemed bothered when I did not have my card and they had to issue breakfast certificates. This property has an on-site monorail station that connects with the other stops along the strip. The monorail is $5 per ride, $12 for unlimited rides for 24 hours, or $28 for unlimited for 72 hours of unlimited rides. The monorail was a nice benefit since the hotel is not on the strip. However, the monorail does not operate 24 hours a day, has few stops, and you must take a long walk through the casino of the hotel it stops at to reach the strip. As with all hotels in Las Vegas, smoking is allowed in the casino. However, the smoke at this property filtrates into other areas such as restaurants and the front desk area. Staff at this property were inattentive. They almost seemed bothered that guests were patronizing their hotel. I was very unimpressed by this property. I would not stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Love the 'Going Green Reward'!”
Reviews.Author: FTLOC
Reviews.Content: Many hotels offer the option of not having your towels or sheets changed daily but even when you leave your towels hanging as they ask you still get new ones. I haven't ever quite understood that. The Las Vegas Hilton however not only gives you a 'Go Green' door hanger to use if you'd like, which they abide by, you also receive a $10 off voucher for any of their restaurants as a reward for being green. While I would have used the door hanger anyway the voucher is an extra touch and hopefully it will incentivize other guests to do the same. I was also pleasantly surprised by the size of the room which was categorized as a 'Superior'. With a king size bed, a bench at the end of the bed and a luggage rack it gave plenty of places to put your 'stuff' and have room to move around. While I was a solo traveler there would have been plenty of room for my husband as well. The photo I used is to show the space. I was packing up at the time so the mess is my own :) and shouldn't reflect on the hotel staff in any way. And as far as the location, my business meeting was at a different hotel. The Monorail station is directly in front of the hotel which makes traveling to other areas extremely easy. I will definitely return to this hotel in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel despite reviews”
Reviews.Author: VSPE
Reviews.Content: I was uneasy booking this hotel based on latest reviews. I was in this hotel before around 1995-1996. The hotel is next door to convention center and its a main reason I decided to stay here. I have upgrade room on 14 floor in North tower and so far I can not make a bad comment. The room is spotless. Everything works. The check in around 7pm was easy with well explanation about free buffet. The parking a little bit far mainly because size of property. Internet is $13/day, but high speed. The food in buffet is plenty, but typical brekfast fare.

Reviews.Title: “Another Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: tatita21
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here 3 times, all in January and we really enjoy this hotel. The staff is friendly and helpful, buffet was not huge, but what they have is fresh and hot! We were offered an upgrade for $100 per night for a suite. We took it and were very happy we did. For under $300 a night we had a beautiful suite, Park Lane I think it was called. Nice jacuzzi tub that I used each morning while enjoying my Baileys & Coffee :) The only reason I did not give it a 5 is only because of it being off the strip. However the awesome prices would be not be had if it were so...... We have always had access to the resorts club lounge and I recommend booking for that. This hotel takes good care of their HiltonHonors members, we are gold. Thank you Hilton for another great stay!!! See you Jan 2012:)

Reviews.Title: “Tired old property that needs updating”
Reviews.Author: skitheridge
Reviews.Content: People stay here for the location at the convention center but it's worth a monorail ride to the strip to move there. Perhaps all would have been better if I'd sprung for the higher room price options but nothing worked in my filthy room - the toilet wouldn't flush right, the tiny refrigerator only worked as a freezer, the HD TV had a snowey picture, the window (strip view) was too dirty to see through. Food at every property restaurant I tried was very poor. This place is not worthy of the Hilton label.

Reviews.Title: “Not a bad stay at the Hilton LV...”
Reviews.Author: BMRosenberger
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a 4 night stay at the Hilton LV. We were attending a convention at the Sands Expo center, and got a great deal on the Hilton through their players club that we couldn't pass up. We used the monorail to get to the sands, and it was a bit of a hike to get to the expo center from the monorail but we liked the exercise (much less on day 4 than on day 1 though!) The hotel itself is older, but still decently maintained so it does look a bit dated, but not super run down. The rooms have been renovated, and while not as plush or luxurious as say the Wynn or the Venetian, definitely better than a motel 6. The beds were better than expected, again not Wynn level, but I didn't have a sore back or neck after 4 nights and I usually do when sleeping in hotel beds. We upgraded to a superior room in the North Tower and it was very convenient to the monorail and lobby. We ate the buffet 3 out of 4 nights, because it was right there and the price was good for what you get. It isn't overly huge or anything, but the food is decent and you get all the bud light you can drink with it. They also have complimentary wine, but being a wine snob I just couldn't bring myself to drink it. The Hilton also offers you a $10 voucher if you opt to not have the maid clean your room each day, so we got a free buffet out of the deal by not having her clean every day. I like that, thank you Hilton! We would definitely stay there again if we got a great deal, but if we can stay on the strip next time we will. It is off the strip a little ways even with the monorail it is not easy to get to the other side of the strip to see the new hotels and shopping areas. If you want to wander around the strip, the Hilton is not your place. If you don't mind taking cabs or using the monorail and walking, then the Hilton is a good deal.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed two years in a row---never again”
Reviews.Author: michigandunes
Reviews.Content: I have no agenda against this hotel, but truth be told, it is very antiquaited and needs significant updating. Perhaps for leisure travel, it is much more accomodating, but for the business traveler it is pathetic. Here are a list of subtle problems I had: My room was not ready on my day of arrival checking in at 6pm. I was not able to shower prior to business meeting. My room was not ready till after 7pm. The trash in my room was not emptied two consecutive days in a row. There is only one plug in my room to recharge my computer and phone. I had to pull out my nightstand to charge both at the same time. Expect to pay $14/night for internet connection! Bathrooms are circa 1980's, small and in serious need of updating. There are many better choices at this same price. Friends stayed at new hotels near the city center and I was sure jealous for what they got at the same price.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, off the strip though. Good Pool”
Reviews.Author: LBenko
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Las Vegas Hilton for a long weekend. The hotel itself is not within walking distance to the strip, but they do have free valet. The room was very spacious, but nothing special outside of the standard Hilton rooms. We enjoyed the pool during the afternoon. It was a good mix, some families, some couples and singles and overall a good time. The price was right for the trip and the rate was very reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Our home away from home”
Reviews.Author: momluc86
Reviews.Content: We love to stay at the Las Vegas Hilton. This was our fifth year there, and it was great. We know the cocktail waitress and she us, and that means alot. We already miss you all. Thanks for everything.

Reviews.Title: “Go for the upgrade”
Reviews.Author: DrEdOC
Reviews.Content: Ive stayed at the LV Hilton a few times in the past. I was offered an upgrade for $20 - best 40 bucks I spent in Vegas - huge room, modern, sofa, etc.... Go for the upgrade

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: GCF3060
Reviews.Content: My friends and I came to Vegas for a few days in July, but didn't have it in our budget to stay somewhere on the Strip. The Hilton was a great alternative. Not being right on the Strip didn't even really affect us, since there's a monorail stop right there. Service - Check in was great, our standard room was even upgraded to a grand room with gorgeous views of the golf course. However, we were in different towers from the rest of our group, and the hotel had no problem relocating them to another room in the same tower immediately. The man working at the front desk was so nice and helpful, he made it all easy. Rooms - Clean, comfortable beds. Spacious bathrooms with great products, as with any Hilton. Plenty of hangers in the closet too, which is always important. Food - We only tried the buffet, which was fine, for the price. After all, it's a buffet - quantity over quality, typically. There was a pretty good selection. Casino - The casino looks like it hasn't been redone in decades, so we stuck to the Strip for our gambling, which we'd planned on doing anyway. Nightlife - We were exhausted one night and decided to just come back to the hotel to check out the club within the Hilton and left after 15 minutes or so - the only people there looked like they were the friends of the DJ (there were less than 10 of them), and there were a total of 2 people dancing. Other - Wi-fi was expensive, but there are machines to print boarding passes in the lobby, so no need to pay the $15/day for internet in the room Overall, the hotel was great for being a hotel. Good value, clean and comfortable, good service, it's just no comparison to a real Las Vegas casino.

Reviews.Title: “Thinnest walls - noisiest room EVER!”
Reviews.Author: LeoStone
Reviews.Content: The walls are so thin (I presume) that I could hear the people in the next room talking and/or watching TV every time. The conversations and the TV did not seem overly loud; it's just that that all went through the walls. I couldn't sleep most nights.

Reviews.Title: “Loooooooong lines at check in”
Reviews.Author: bobinthebigapple
Reviews.Content: Like all Vegas hotels this offers good value, but I strongly recommend staying elsewhere as the check in lines go on forever. They have three people at the counter and lines running around the corner. You have to wait way longer than you should. Ridiculous.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money and Convention access”
Reviews.Author: Butschie
Reviews.Content: The LV Hilton is the only hotel with direct access to the LV convention center and this makes good for the a bit outdated style. Many rooms are renovated but still miss a modern appearance and the hotel can't compare with all the new exciting Vegas hotels on the strip. Many restaurants are offering various cuisines and there are several coffee shops, and gambling seems to be reduced now to offer more relax areas.Elevators are very slow and not sufficient, during a convention waiting time can be ten minutes.Several shows and a lot of activities.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: Mugsydogg
Reviews.Content: For $45/night, I wasn't expecting much, but I was disappointed with having the Hilton named associated with this hotel. Some not so bad things: the location,, yeah its off the strip but easy to get to and the monorail stops right there. Parking, valet, everything was pretty easy and close for such a massive hotel. I had a corner room on the 21st floor that was actually pretty quiet. The staff was really nice too. Not so good: I had NO hot water one morning in the shower. And speaking of the shower, it barely drained, so it filled up the tub every time. I've read other reviews on here with the same problem. The hotel is pretty old, and Hilton has tried to update it, but you can just tell the age of the rooms from the feel condition of the furniture (stained, chipped and worn down). Like I said, for $45/night, I'd put up with that but anything more I'd look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “This is not a Hilton Hotel, but does trade on the Hilton Name”
Reviews.Author: VistaSalderson
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hilton for New Year. Did not realize that this hotel is not owned by Hilton, however Hilton does allow the company that owns the casino to use the Hilton name and logo. Actually shame on Hilton for allowing the casino to ruin the name of Hilton. First, as a diamond member which means I stay in Hilton Hotels a great deal, I was able to take advantage of the buffet but only until 10:00 am. The buffet was available to other guests until much later. New Years Day, if we wanted to utilize our coupons we needed to eat by 10:00. Had to change our room because the walls are so thin we could hear everything and I mean everything because the walls are so thin. Attended the New Years Party which is sold as a Hilton Party. There was not enough wait staff. The young lady who took our drink orders did not know what scotch and soda was or vodka. The person who waited on our table was legally blind. Half of the people sitting at our table, received their food, the other half waited for about an hour. Wine bottles were available however they were not corked and the wait staff did not have cork screws. The rooms are adequate, however there are no coffee pots in the room. The sundries that were left in the room the lotion shampoo and conditioner had been used prior to our arrival. i strongly urge Hilton to rethink their arrangement with this particular casino. We always speak highly of Hilton and our status as diamond members speaks to our loyalty to this particular brand. I find it shameful that Hilton is willing to allow another business to ruin their reputation.

Reviews.Title: “Far from Strip hotel experience”
Reviews.Author: xster
Reviews.Content: In comparison with previous stay on the strip, it's day and night. The lobby was like a lobby of a hotel in Memphis or something. Rooms are normal non-Vegas style rooms. Price wasn't cheap for what we get. A good 15 minutes away from the strip via monorail, taxi or car. Room service very slow. Self-park far from hotel (in comparison to other hotels). 14$ internet...

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Miguel066_10
Reviews.Content: I am sorry to report that the Las Vegas Hilton was not able to exceed our expectations. The wall paper in the room was falling off the wall (I took a couple of pictures), the maid did a very lousy job cleaning the bathroom and some cheap hotel would have better towels than what the Hilton has to offer. I reported the issues to Priscilla at the front desk and basically there was nothing she can do because they were completely overbooked.

Reviews.Title: “Las Vegas Classic but Poor Service”
Reviews.Author: mke60
Reviews.Content: Due to late night flight and delays checked in at 2 am so I wasn't dealing with the staff's varsity. But this is Las Vegas that like NYC proports to never sleep, so I expected better. Traveling as a family, so booked a room with 2 beds, was told they had none. Pitched a minor fit and was tersely lectured that 2 beds was only a request, not a guarantee. Reservation was confrimed as 2 beds -2 adults / 2 children and received no explanation on how I was to accomplish that with one bed. After a 15 minute delay, they "found" a two bedded room and sent us on our way only to discover that it had one bed. Call to the desk - no apology - but was told to wait 20 more minutes - they were cleaning a room - and they would switch us. The room they were making up for our family of 4 ended up with 3 sets of towels but was too frustrated to have them fix that too, we made do. After an hour of horseing around we were eventually accomodated but it shouldn't have been that hard and the attitude of the staff at 2 am was not friendly or accomodating. That said, my bad for arrivng late and booking a family stay here - I couldn't resist the off peak rate. I'm willing to chalk my experience up as isolated. If I were traveling solo, as a couple, or on business for a convention, I would stay here again if good rate or on expense account. I like the retro feel of the place including Casino. Great Sports book. Off strip location adjacent to convention center is offset by having a monorail stop right at the hotel so best of both worlds if you have an event at the convention center yet want easy access to the sizzle on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Great value in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: arts123
Reviews.Content: This was my fifth trip to Vegas since June, 2010, and I stayed at the Hilton each of these times. It's off the strip, but accessible via the monorail. Parking is free and you can zip up Paradise to anywhere, which paid off brilliantly on New Year's eve night! The rooms are spotless. The beds are comfortable and very clean. There's no pressure to gamble, although they have a small casino. The food is a very good value for the price at both the coffee shop and the buffet, and they have several signature restaurants, as well. The front desk staff is the best I've seen, and I'm on the road almost every week. It is off strip, but drive to the strip and valet for tips at any hotel, or ride the monorail. What a deal! There's even a green credit for not getting housekeeping services any day of your stay, and the housekeeping staff happily offer you extra towels, amenities, etc., on those days.

Reviews.Title: “Will stay there again - like that location is off strip; monorail stop.”
Reviews.Author: Marvalita
Reviews.Content: Love the Hilton - great service. We took the monorail while we were there and was so happy that it stopped right at the Hilton.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible”
Reviews.Author: ReginaNip
Reviews.Content: Only thing that I like is the buffet coupon, other than that, everything is terrible. The sound proof in the room is terrible, I can hear my next door neighbor's baby/toddler whinning all night long. The bathtub pipe is leaking. The shower is terrible. I can still see the stain from previous user. I have to use their towel to clean the tub myself before I took my shower. No coffee maker inside my room. Very limited tv channel, I mean "LIMITED". I was staying in Treasure Island not long ago, they even have one chinese channel. LV Hilton doesn't even has Kids Channel. TERRIBLE!!! The elevator is horrible during check out hour. Took us 30 minutes waiting time. If my kid is not with me, I rather take the stairs from 14th floor.

Reviews.Title: “Far from Strip, need car or monorail to get around”
Reviews.Author: ToddNugent
Reviews.Content: The Hilton is one of those LV hotel that runs lots of promotions. Except when there are conferences, you can find good deals with offers for food/buffet/gambling, low room prices, etc. You need a car or buy a monorail pass to get to the Strip so factor that into your overall budget. Rooms are basic, comparable to Harrah's or Bally's. Buffet is okay, not as good as Bellagio or Spice Market but it was cheap. There is quite a bit of smoke in the casino, but that can happen at any casino, depends on how many smokers are there during your stay I guess. There are a few hotels such as the Platinum where it is all non-smoking if anyone is curious but the rates were a bit high when we were looking so we booked the Hilton instead. This is one of those place just to clean up and sleep and drive somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “hilton good and bad.”
Reviews.Author: rayace
Reviews.Content: We just got back from las vegas hilton staying four nights there. A quick review but honestly did not stay much in the rooms. We put the sign on the door not too clean our room and we got everyday 10 dollar voucher to be used for food anywhere in the hilton. With the price of coffee at 4 bux, that covered our coffee on our return trip home to the airport at 330 in the morning. What I did do was go to the end of the drive way to the corner gas station and got coffee for 1.49 way better and cheaper. Pizza hut was there so used the voucher for my late night snack coming home from the strip. One night I saw 4 ladies of the night there in the hotel offering there services, lol. From what I saw and from what I got , the machines were not paying out. The monorail is a great thing, saved alot of money using this, as we went up and down the strip. Took a cab to the premiem outlet mall, great deals. I was really surprised to see so many kids on this trip. We saw two shows, jersey boys and tribute to the beattles, both very good. If you are looking for a cheap meal and you have the monorail pass, go one stop to the sahara and there is a mcdonalds there. Monorail pass for three days is 28 dollars, to use the monorail once you pay 5. For those who care, there is smoking everywhere in the casino. We were in the east tower on the 18th floor, nice enough view. Two golf courses nearby for those who golf. Weather was surpisingly cold and i'm from canada, lol.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value at the LV Hilton”
Reviews.Author: glasgowcelticgirl
Reviews.Content: This was a return trip to the LV Hilton, it had been a couple of years since our last trip. I am now a Hilton Honors member and got a excellent AAA rate when booking our room. We booked a standard classic room and were upgraded supposedly to a premium room. We were in North Tower room 27106. Room was clean enough and had a view of the strip. Since we are Honors Gold we got the breakfast buffet for free with our rate. This was good value although I must admit by the third day the buffet was getting a bit old. Overall we were pleased with our stay, but the hotel looks like it needs a few upgrades to keep up with the competition.

Reviews.Title: “Las Vegas Hilton”
Reviews.Content: This Hilton is off the strip which can be nice for some of us who have been to Vegas so many times and cannot count. Nice to have rooms with a beautiful view of the golf course, and they were quiet not full of partying . This Hotel is well established it is easy to navigate inside and the casino is not so big you get lost. They have some excellent high end restaurants. I recommend the Chinese, but the Steakhouse and Benihana's is great also. The service people are friendly and helpful. We had a special deal, but I have stayed their many times before. The musical "Nunsence" was performing it was well done and funny a must see.

Reviews.Title: “Its less chaotic than being right on the strip”
Reviews.Author: lmarsh4131
Reviews.Content: I really enjoy the Las Vegas Hilton because it is a little off the strip. The hotels on the strip always seem so chaotic and intense to me, I like to get a little peace when I return to the place I'm staying. The monorail, however, stops right at the hotel, so its easy to get around if you want to go to the strip hotels. The Hilton staff is very pleasant and accommodating, the restaurants and bars are good, with plenty of choices. My only complaint was that I didn't win at the slots!

Reviews.Title: “Good for the Conventions”
Reviews.Author: azroyalsfan
Reviews.Content: Huge place that is accessible to the convention center. Gaming area is smaller than other strip area casinos. Everything was adequate here for attending a conference. However, I would not choose this location for a recreational Las Vegas trip.

Reviews.Title: “The Downfall of the Las Vegas Hilton”
Reviews.Author: TheTrillium
Reviews.Content: I have been a loyal and returning guest to the Las Vegas Hilton. I have stayed here 4 separate times in the calendar year 2010. I have even visited the casino and continued to give this hotel my business even on a one day trip to Las Vegas where I did not stay overnight. My wife and I have enjoyed our visits. Unfortunately, on the latest (currently still at the hotel) trip here - December 17 to December 19, I have been extremely disappointed. Upgrade problem: I flew in from the east coast on Friday evening - December 17. I was greeted warmly at the front desk, and was recognized as a Diamond member. Additionally I was told I had been upgraded for being a Diamond VIP. I highly doubt this was the case. In fact, on previous visits as a Gold VIP, I was actually upgraded to better rooms. I was even specific at the front desk to which time of room I wanted - and I wasn't asking for a suite. I simply wanted the updated bathrooms (and referenced the room I stayed in before earlier in the year). Instead, I received an ordinary 'Classic Room' without an updated bathroom. This was the least of my concern, as room cleanliness was even worse. See below. Room cleanliness: I am surprised that the Hilton thought this room was ready for check-in. The toilet wasn't 100% clean, my sheets had several stains on them along with several holes. I found hairs in the sink and inside the sheets of the bed. The shower curtain liner was extremely old and emitted a disgusting musty odor. So, even though I was tired, I actually packed up my belongings and returned to the front desk. Room Swap: The front desk listened to my concerns and did give me a new room - a resort room. The front desk had to point out the fact that since I didn't pay for a resort room, that the bottled water and safe were not free. I had thought all along I was allowed bottled water by being Gold VIP or higher? In fact, each time this year I had bottled water free of charge. As far as the room goes, even though it's called a 'Resort Room', it's no better than a regular 'Classic Room'. It's the same thing with the exception of having extra amenities included in the price - water, etc. I spoke with Van, a front desk supervisor on Saturday, December 18. He listened to my concerns but didn't do much more. He offered another room swap, but considering I was only in town for one additional evening, what did that actually accomplish? My expectations fell far short on this particular trip. While I was not treated rudely, I also felt that there was no sincerity in my discussions with the front desk. Also, I would have thought by returning to this hotel multiple times in one calendar year would actually mean something. Apparently both my wife and I were wrong about that. In summary, I will speak to the front desk when I check out today about my experience. I also plan on calling the hotel to speak to the highest possible manager I can reach. They should know about my experience and why a loyal Hilton member (both to the entire chain of hotels and to this particular hotel) will highly consider staying in a different hotel. There are plenty of options in Las Vegas. And one more thing: Apparently the hotel was having power issues. Some of the elevators were not in use because of this. Lines were growing really long to use them, and they are slow in the first place. I had to walk down the stairs to check out because I didn't have time to wait around. I was on the 25th floor. The final straw was the fact that they removed the Star Trek machines from Space Quest casino.

Reviews.Title: “Immer wieder gut”
Reviews.Author: brainbit
Reviews.Content: I come to Las vegas almost every year and stayed in several different Hotels at the Strip. The Las Vegas Hilton, were I already stayed several times has the best price-value relationship I encountered in Las Vegas, Only one block from the Strip - that means in walking distance, also connected with the monorail this partially new renovated Hotel is my best choice in LV.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate Stay”
Reviews.Author: EdUrias
Reviews.Content: I took advantage of an Escape to Vegas package for a three day jaunt to the Vegas area. I've stayed at this Hilton property prior, and really had a pleasurable experience taking advantage of the Resort Level floor, but I had failed to upgrade on this last trip and now regret it. I was provided a room on the East Tower and have found some unpleasantries uncommon with the Hilton name. I've included pictures of the room depicting its layout, plus some housekeeping and maintenance issues in the bathroom. This would include rust noted on the tub drain, missing anchor bolts on the toilet and the area behind the sink which was not cleaned by the housekeeper. The sit down bench had some stains noted on it, and the carpet looked tattered. It's a shame to note these items, especially after getting an excellent room rate, but this Hilton property has some room for improvement.

Reviews.Title: “Top Service!”
Reviews.Author: perthguy6
Reviews.Content: Arrived early and had to wait for room, we were upgraded and stayed in the East tower in a junior suite. Front desk was great with suggestions for the kids and help with Monorail which makes this hotel so convenient, we bought three day passes and didnt need taxis or pay tips etc 10 mins to MGM at the other end of the strip! Breakfast was fantastic and didnt experience bad smoke as per other reviewers and found other hotels much worse. The kids had a great time and we would definately recommend this hotel, and what a bargain to boot! Dont forget if you waive housekeeping you get $10 credit.

Reviews.Title: “A great stay for Las Vegas first-timers!”
Reviews.Author: clc122
Reviews.Content: I took my partner there for her 50th birthday and we had a fabulous time. I would go back again and look forward to doing so. The rooms: The hotel is enormous (not uncommon for Vegas) and so it was a a good walk from the room to the Casino but this was good for us because we would leave most of our money and credit cards in the safe in the room and only take what we planned on losing. The bed/bathroom/sofa/view was all spectacular. We got an upgrade at check-in. I just asked for one and they gave it to us! The room service was phenomenal. I have never stayed somewhere that room service was not only affordable but priced similar to the hotel restaurants. They do not add gratuity to the bill which I was surprised by--but I added the normal 20%. I think they should make this more well known because I suspect a lot of people assume it is added. The Hotel: The hotel is beautiful. It is not on the strip and is not like the fancier hotels like the Venetian or New York, New York but all of the appointments are spectacular. They really do the details well. There are several dining options, ranging from a japaneese steak house to a hot dog stand and everything in between. The breakfast buffet was immense. The Casino: If you like to sports gamble, this is the place to go. I only wish they had more non-smoking sections available in the sports book. The ventilation is not very good and it did become bothersome after a while. However, on Sundays during NFL season, they open the theatre and broadcast all games in a smoke free enviornment with cheap drinks, food and lots of free stuff. The slots and tables were adequate.
