I found the blackjack dealers to be a bit aggressive and for a first time table gambler, that was intimidating. Cons: Its Vegas and so be prepared to pay for EVERYTHING. The internet access was $20 per day per laptop. I found that to be excessive. They offer kiosks in the lobby to print out boarding passes for your flight home but they charge $3 a pass. Given that there are about 50 kiosks at the airport, don't bother. I did not find that the concerige was very helpful and we had better luck with just figuring stuff out on our own. Outside the hotel: If you get tired of gambling, go to Red Rocks in the Mojave Desert. It is only about 20 minutes away and it is truly breath-taking. Neither my partner nor I are early morning people but we did make it there for sunrise and it was spectacular.

Reviews.Title: “good price for a decent stay”
Reviews.Author: c1ndyr3lla714
Reviews.Content: bathroom needs a little more attention otherwise was a good stay

Reviews.Title: “We Enjoyed Our Stay!”
Reviews.Author: pammiegurl
Reviews.Content: The hotel room was up to date and clean! It was spacious, and cozy at the same time. We had a very romantic time together. Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Not a Bad Stay for a Hilton”
Reviews.Author: brnxslices
Reviews.Content: Most Hiltons that I have stayed are above average to very good. The Las Vegas Hilton was average. Not a bad stay for the price. Rooms were clean, food was overpriced and not that that good. The monorail stop is a convienent way to get around, so location of the hotel was not bad being off the strip. Tried to inquire about the spa but service there was not very good, so decided to go somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “No extras”
Reviews.Author: notaheiress
Reviews.Content: Room was nice and clean. Temp control was not working and Maintenace was prompt at fixing when reported. No coffee pot in room. internet was 13.99 a day. Hotel does give a $10 a day voucher if you do not have cleaning service.

Reviews.Title: “Very good, but not for the faint-hearted.”
Reviews.Author: Naillic
Reviews.Content: Just returned from the Las Vegas Hilton. I am a Diamond member so I use a lot of Hiltons. The hotel is about a 15 minute ride from the airport by taxi (about $25). When I arrived check-in was quite busy but I believe in high season it can be chaotic. Howvere that wasn't my experiencve and was sorted out within 10 mins. As a Diamond member I was due a complimentary upgrade to a Grand Room. However for an extra $40 per night I chose a resort club extra large room. I went up to that room, checked out the resort club lounge and went straight back to reception. Neither was worth the upgrade. The Club lounge is very small, has a very small selection of food and gets very busy. I use Executive lounges all the time in Hiltons. This is not worth it. The "upgraded more spacious resort club room" was not worth the $40 a night price tag. As it turned out, it was not much bigger than my Grand room, though it did have nicer Acca Kappa toiletries and bath robe/slippers etc. In fairness to the excellent front office staff, they had absolutely no issue with my change of mind and gave me a very comfortable Grand room on the 6th floor. In my opinion, a better room. The hotel itself is massive. It's a logistical miracle that the place is able to run but boy do they have the hotel running well. Staff are all excellent, in EVERY area I came across them. It's great idea to get a no quibble $10 voucher for not having housekeeping if you choose not to. This voucher can be spent in any of the food OR retail outlets in the hotel. I got a total of 3 and paid for a really nice dinner with them in TJ's steakhouse. Did I enjoy my stay? Absolutely. It suits all budgets and the staff were super.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't pay me to stay again...”
Reviews.Author: charlie_15050
Reviews.Content: I made reservations on line and booked two rooms. When i arrived at the front desk the girl was very rude. She put me in king room , I asked her how are four people supposed to fit in a king bed? she replied that it wasn't her problem. I finally was able to get her to put us in a room with two beds. She still put us in the wrong room, it was not what i booked. I spoke to the superivser Ross and the only thing he could do was give us the room at 3:00pm on our last day. I would never stay here again because of the service. Several of the people especially at the food places seemed to hate their jobs, the attitude and service was horrible. You would expect much more from a Hilton hotel and this hotel did not deliver at all. This was our first family vacation with all my kids and the Hilton and the staff made it very disapointing. From check in to check out it was a bad experience. Don't stay here if your looking for service.

Reviews.Title: “Beyond Expectation”
Reviews.Author: rena1945
Reviews.Content: I was very impressed with the service provided during my stay. This trip provided me an opportunity to see my great grand for the first time. Four generations was able to dine in the Honors dining room and the complimentary wine and beer totally unexpected was delightful, along with the special attention we received. attentative We all and have

Reviews.Title: “No resort fee. I'd rather have it then be nickle and dimed.”
Reviews.Author: gosskevin
Reviews.Content: Their big deal is they have no resort fee. I went to use the gym and they wanted 20 dollars a day. I tried to hook up wifi. How wbout 14 dollars a day. I would rather have the fee. Its very mis leading because they charge for everthing. I thought with no resort fee that was in the price. Needless to say never never again. There are way to many nice places to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value and Service”
Reviews.Author: BobbbyE
Reviews.Content: We found a great "Escape to Vegas" package deal at Hilton-Las Vegas for about $42/night -- and it included free breakfast buffet and free fitness center and NO RESORT FEES! Even though the hotel was showing it's age (e.g. needs paint and new towels), the room was clean and nicely furnished. Front Desk service was also above average and professional. The gaming facilities are acceptable -- the standard cadre of slot machines, etc. They do NOT have a poker room. No worries because Wynn hotel is "next door" -- about 1/2 mile walk or the next stop on the Monorail. Wynn Hotel has a nice Poker room. On the first night we were there, we had a awesome dinner TJ's Stakehouse. And the following evening, we had a delicious dinner at Benihana. Both are conveniently located near the Hotel lobby. Be careful if have Hilton Honors: You may have to diligently follow up with HH to ensure that you get your HH points. I'm still waiting to get my account credited for the 2 nights that I stayed in September. Enjoy and have fun.

Reviews.Title: “Amusingly Horrid.”
Reviews.Author: Danhedonia
Reviews.Content: Hhonors Gold member 'upgraded' to despicably cramped, ugly room: ancient linoleum and carpet floors, hideous furnishings. I lived in Vegas for years; this has always been a 'place to avoid' among locals putting up friends, and if I were not working tomorrow at the convention center, I would leave. The room is that bad - and shame on them for putting loyal customers of the chain in a room this bad. This is the bad side of typical Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Great Jacuzzi Tub!”
Reviews.Author: dvangury
Reviews.Content: The room was well Great!! -The extra space in the room, we had a jacuzi tub, very comfortable room, loved the pillows and the water pressure was awesome!! Very comfortable stay and well worth the price we paid!! :)

Reviews.Title: “Dirty Rooms, Sub-Par Food and Non-Existent Maintenance Staff!”
Reviews.Author: Maddshopr
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel the day before Thanksgiving for one night. I had previously booked a stay at another resort but got in the evening before and thought I would stay at the Hilton. I normally stay Hilton's because of the quality but this time I was sadly disappointed. The room we stayed in was stained, aged and dirty. When we first got to the room we noticed that it was chilly so we turned on the heat and went downstairs to grab dinner at the Paradise Cafe (which was sub-par and that is being generous). When we returned to the room it was still chilly. We called housekeeping to report the problem and were told that there were already numerous complaints and it may take a while for them to get to us. Because there were three adults we also requested a roll-away bed, after waiting over 30 minutes for it to be delivered we called back to cancel and just went to bed in the cold. No one ever contacted us about the heat but when we awoke it was near 68 degrees. We only had two towels so we once again called housekeeping to request some additional. WE waited a little over an hour and none were delivered so we decided to shower and check out. We couldn't get out of this hotel fast enough and I will never stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Beds in the World”
Reviews.Author: kiwi_karyn
Reviews.Content: My cousin and I stayed here on the final night of our CA road trip. We booked the room the night before via wotif and got it for $60US. When we arrived, we were aksed if we would like to upgrade for another $20 which we did - it was the last night of our holiday, arterall. We got a 2pm late check out for free. The beds and linen were superb. The beds had the biggest pillow tops I had ever seen. The room was a good size , complete w desk and lounge chair - the biggest of our trip. Clean, tidy, fairly luxurious for us Motel 6 travellers (-: The staff were very helpful - especially the valet parkers and the man who whistles up the taxis. For me the location was the downside, not being on the strip or right near a bus stop. We used the mono rail but it's not as handy as the bus. However, we stayed on the strip at the start of our trip.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing stay.”
Reviews.Author: eemsdad
Reviews.Content: We were very disappointed in our stay at the Las Vegas Hilton. The staff was rude at times and uninterested at others. The general treatment we received was not at all what I would expect from a Las Vegas hotel. One example: we had an issue with our in-room movies. We had been out on our feet for days, and we just wanted to crash and watch a movie. The system would not work , so we contacted maintenance. After waiting more than an hour, I called back down, and they acted like there was no problem. It was too late to watch a movie, so we went to sleep. Two nights later we went through the exact same fiasco. I finally called down and told them to forget it. 30 min. later the maintenance guy shows up to fix our TV. He never could get the movie we wanted to watch working, so we ended watching something totally different. During the debacle I tried to contact the hotel manager and was informed that they were in a meeting and wouldn't be available until the next day. I never received a call from the manager about this issue. I don't believe they cared at all. I'm certain that I would not stay in this hotel again on future trips to Vegas. There are simply too many amazing options to have such a disappointing experience.

Reviews.Title: “I was disappointed with the service in the restaurants”
Reviews.Author: dddaily
Reviews.Content: The hotel room was nice but I was extremely disappointed in two restaurants at the Las Vegas Hilton. The diner advertises all day dinning choices and lists choices but they only offer a limited menu. Also, at Casa Nicola the service was rude. Our group was on a business trip and needed receipts for our expenses and when we ask, the waiter said that they did not do that here and then the manager came over and spoke to us very disrespectfully. You would think for $27 a plate of pasta would be good to excellent but it was very poor. The food at a chain Italian restaurant makes what I ate seem garbage.

Reviews.Title: “house keeping nightmare”
Reviews.Author: mromo3
Reviews.Content: Had an extrememly hard time getting towels from housekeeping!! Six hours... really?? We also had to change rooms because we could hear the elevator all night long. Due to recent knee surgery I asked for room near elevator. We were unable to sleep the whole night b/c of the elevators operating every 5 minutes. I am a Hilton Honors owner. This is probably my tenth visit to your hotel. We usually have good experiences.

Reviews.Title: “Okay, if you are at a convention”
Reviews.Author: ErnieScar
Reviews.Content: I booked the top of the line "club" room at the Hilton for recent convention. The room was okay, the bathroom was in need of updating, the tap in the tub dripped all night which was bothersome. The room was average as was the hotel overall. Food was okay, service good, check in took only minutes. If I wasn't in town for a convention there are certainly more impressive choices on the strip in the same price range.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to have a quiet stay in LV”
Reviews.Author: GlendaleCA
Reviews.Content: So it is nice to be in the middle of all the action. But sometimes it gets annoying in Vegas after a day or two. The nice thing about the Hilton is that it is super close to the strip, yet just off and outside the traffic and hubbub. On the downside, it is often ULTRA-quiet. Almost too quiet. And if you are looking to play in the casino, it is nice to have more hubbub. Nonetheless, there are very nice staff here. And where else can you get a room upgrade without being a huge gambler! It's nice to have a Hilton Honors complex in Vegas. Rooms are nice. There are some things they could do a bit more modernly, like fix the celings in the rooms and bring them from the 70's to this decade. However in general I would say they are tastefully done. While not luxurious, I would say the room is a respite. Look for some great deals, here.You can often get great room prices... A big recommend for HHonors members and anyone interested in being in Vegas, but also interested in driving to a local restaurant as well and having easy access to do so. You gotta remember, it's a Hilton so it gonna generally be a decent place. You don't always know with some of the other hotels! As for food, I find their breakfast buffet to be quite good. Very disappointing that some of the restaurants are only open a couple days a week, though.

Reviews.Title: “Again, they exceeded our expectations!”
Reviews.Author: jrny69
Reviews.Content: It was a little getaway for myself and my wife. We were there to see HEART in concert and it was the best time we have ever had at the LV Hilton. The concert and the venue were fantastic but then we had the best time gambling and just walking around the property. I have no problem not being on the Strip especially when the monorail station is right there if I want to go anywhere else. I was happy just staying where I was and we had a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Close to the Las Vegas Convention Center...”
Reviews.Author: ExhibitsbyJody
Reviews.Content: I needed a place that was close to the Convention Center and I chose the LV Hilton because I am a Hilton Honors member. But I was pretty disappointed overall. They put me in the Central Tower- which is in desperate need of refurbishment. As a silver member I did receive access to the gym, but did not receive free Wi-FI or breakfast coupons or even a bottle of water. There is a brand new Renaissance that is next to the South Hall of the LVCC so if you need a place to stay for business that is close to the Hall, and it's a better deal for Marriott members, then pick the Renaissance brand over the Hilton brand

Reviews.Title: “Surpired, that a hotel such as THE HILTON, couldn't get my bags to my room !”
Reviews.Author: Migoko
Reviews.Content: For a hotel such as the Hilton, you would think the service person could, take a check with out sending someone to the cash cage. " In order for them to first say that the check could be taken or was good! Luck the person there was on it and didn't understand and called the desk to see why I was sent there? Also, why not have coffee machine in rooms? I find it convent to have one in the rooms. The staff not being the best at knowing their job. The check out person that I got first was the pitts, after being sent out of line and told to retrun to her by pass the line she won't help me tell after another person did and was closing out my bill!

Reviews.Title: “Poor Customer Service!”
Reviews.Author: lady-piLA
Reviews.Content: I was extremely disappointed with my stay. I excperienced numerous problems during my stay in which I brought to the front desk manager. He informed me that there wasn't anything that he could do for me and that I should have told him about my experiences earlier. I informed him that I was attending a conference which lasted through the morning and night. He informed me that when I stay at the hotel again, he would upgrade me to another room. I do NOT plan on staying at this hotel again nor will my employees. This was terrible customer service especially the way in which it was handled!

Reviews.Title: “overcharges cost me $100”
Reviews.Author: rgeble
Reviews.Content: Get the actual cost in advance and have it guaranteed. The rates were ajusted up daily and were never what was claimed when I made the reservation.

Reviews.Title: “only downside is cab fare to Strip”
Reviews.Author: sladana
Reviews.Content: Overall I had a nice stay at this hotel for a week. The maid service was top notch and unobtrusive. The staff and room service were commendable given the number of people at the convention. However, I would only recommend this hotel during peak periods. A number of bars and restaurants in the hotel are closed when the hotel is not operating with heavy attendance. Also, I have to concede that there was a different type of clientele and vibe once the conventioneers left the week I stayed. It was less positive and not what I expect of a Hilton. I suspect the prices come down significantly on the rooms when they are not full, and that affects who stays there. It seemed more like a 2-star motel, not business class. If you plan to go out each night, the $15 one- way cab fare to the Strip adds up and it makes sense to stay some place elase where you can walk to the nightlife.

Reviews.Title: “Vegas Hilton”
Reviews.Author: MrsShadetree
Reviews.Content: Cleanliness within the hotel was fine. Even though the staff did good housekeeping room duties, the room was old, needed paint, especially in the deco damaged bathroom. Dead light bulps were not replaced, not all outlets worked. Curtains didn't work properly, the HVAC never worked. The fan could be in the HIGH position only and there was NO temp control. The windows would not open. We did not change rooms as we feared another room might be worse. Location... this was a convention and we were able to walk to all the events Rooms, see above. the TV was ok, with only 1 local station. We had a fridg, unheard of in Vegas. Thank you. This was considered a Standard Room. It cost in the area of $200 a night. Service... wish we had not used the bell staff. When we arrived, if we had just managed our bags on our own, we would have had them 1 + hours prior to them holding them and bringing them to us. We called for them and the lady hung up as we did not speak fast enough. Unable to get through...finally a human voice on the phone ...then wait for delivery... we should have just dragged our own bags. Value, forget it. We paid for the location, location, location. Due to the economy, we understood that near by hotels (not quite as close) were a fraction of our prices. Sleep Quality -- Great... the beds were GREAT. (and clean) We had difficulty checking out ... Forget the check out via TV. Even though the hotel seems to push it. We finally checked out with no reciept. Today is now 6 days since checkout and still we have NO paperwork. No return e-mail, no fax, nothing we can turn in our expense report that should have been out of hear days ago. We've called the hotel 3 times and accounting has to handle it. Accounting has bankers hours including holidays. Thanks Hilton, for further delaying our reciept which we need to put in for our paycheck...wonder how many days longer before we get it from your accounting staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experiance”
Reviews.Author: NormaRmz
Reviews.Content: There was an error with the reservation, when I tried to check in my name was not even on the system. I had a bad experiance a few years ago with Hilton in Los Angeles so I honestly thought it was going to be another bad one. The people that helped me was great and at no point I felt unconfortable. They made sure everything was resolved within minutes and I was able to get a room as if nothing happened. The only thing was that the shower of the room where we stayed made a mess everytime we used it.

Reviews.Title: “Beds are very comfortable!”
Reviews.Author: wepink
Reviews.Content: The decor in the room was not very nice. The decor on the mirror as you walk in to the room is not very clean and you can get hurt by it>>> if your're not careful. The bed was very comfortable and we were able to sleep well. we appreciated it that.

Reviews.Title: “From great to good to bad.”
Reviews.Author: dlomangino
Reviews.Content: Over the years I have stayed at this Hilton 3 to 4 times a year. Most often with a group who play the horses. Plus I am a HH member so I like Hiltons. It is now one of the most inconvenient hotels to stay out. From the front desk clerks, to the Players Club clerks to the Casino manger. None of whom can make a decision. So you go around and around for a simple decision like a room upgrade. At first, I ask the front desk clerk for an upgrade, she said go to the Player Club desk and ask them? Then she checks me into a room that has not checked out. Up and down. My room was 2531 she writes on the room ticket 2351. So the lady in 2351 was thinking I was trying to break into her room Fun! This just gets longer with more up things to say however moreup and down as they cannot do the auto change to room keys for ex stays. The dealer have been their for some time so their mood is" why should we be nice when we know you're not coming back to this hotel" Maybe the disco pole dancers will help! Finally, the $3 charge to get a airline boarding pass! Reaally!

Reviews.Title: “Cold Rooms”
Reviews.Author: dreskr
Reviews.Content: We normally stay at the Las Vegas Hilton when I visit Las Vegas. This time wasn't very good. We checked in Friday after noon into room 1909 central tower. Around 3:00am we discovered the heater wasn't working. We called up a maintenance employee and he said the heater was busted so we had to move to another room. We move to room 2953 at 3:30am. After 30 mins of being there again we discovered the heater wasn't working and, we were right next to the elevator which kept us up most of the morning. I went to the front desk and explained our situation and asked to be moved again to another room. We were moved to room 2769 east tower. Once again, the heater blew cool air. We just turn in off used the blankets that were brought up to us and suffered through it. I will be stay at the Las Vegas Hilton again this weekend. Hope the stay is much much better.

Reviews.Title: “off the strip, but Monorail helps”
Reviews.Author: kittravel
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a long walk from the strip, but the Monorail ($5 per trip, $12 all day) stops in back of several hotel/casinos and are wheelchair/scooter accessible so only a one block walk at most. The main elevators and tower wings are around a 6-sided utility section with confusing signs and no instructions from staff. I went up and down twice before I found my room because the arrows pointed the wrong way. Their casino map is a bit out of date and confusing when trying to access restaurants. "You cant get there from here, must start from another hallway. Also, I suspect they are saving on staff costs by only opening a few restaurants at any one time. Then they can move staff to another venue and still appear to have many food choices (just not all at once.) I tried to visit the Garden of the Dragon for 1 1/2 weeks and always saw a "opening Thursday" sign, but never was it open. Neither was Casa Nicola. the Nunsense show was great, once you could figure out where the secret handicapped entrance was.

Reviews.Title: “Unfriendly Staff and Average Rooms”
Reviews.Author: glynnrieckhoff
Reviews.Content: The staff at the Hotel were so unfriendly, like you were spoiling their day asking for help. They had very bad attitudes and had no manners to guests. The Rooms were big but very sparse, with no pictures, no mini bar, no tea or coffee facilities. When we went to other hotels for shows, it made the Hilton look so much worse - Much more happening at the other hotels also and much better staff.

Reviews.Title: “A nightmare one night stay!”
Reviews.Author: Leisure2Travelers
Reviews.Content: The pictures of this hotel look great online. Don't be fooled. Our welcome included a revolving door that was out of order and roped off. There must have been a convention in house, because there was a long line of "conventioneers" trying to get through the single manual door adjacent to the revolving door. At 6:pm, the front desk attendant told us, "out of over 3,000 guestrooms, the only King-nonsmoking room available was next to an elevator". No worries I said, "As long as the guestroom is on an upper floor, there shouldn't be as much elevator traffic noise. This may have been true, but the mechanical, hydraulic noise was terrible! It was like sleeping next to a jet engine all night. These rooms should never be rented to guests. They should be used as maid's closets. The guestroom furniture was tacky and looked like a Wayne Newton or Liberace suite. The king size bed felt like a fat-assed Vegas buffet eater broke every spring in the box spring. Our room was equiped with a beautiful, big flat screen TV....with no remote and no way to turn on the TV. After two calls to housekeeping and 4 hours later, our remote was delivered to our room after our return from dinner.

Reviews.Title: “Needs a lot of improvement in housekeeping services”
Reviews.Author: pgehrphd
Reviews.Content: Room was comfortable , beautiful view of the golf course and mountains, pleasant ambience and decor ( although insufficient lighting-had to have all lights on during the day ! ), and great value . Major improvement needed in area of housekeeping. Upon arrival, we discovered leftover food in the room's minifridge. We placed the leftovers just outside our door which remained there for 3 days. We finally had to contact housekeeping in order to have it removed!

Reviews.Title: “Competitive tennis player”
Reviews.Author: Tennismama_10
Reviews.Content: Son was competing in tournament. Las Vegas Hilton is convenient and has nice tennis courts available. Rooms were nice and adults can have fun without leaving the building. We would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great bargain”
Reviews.Author: nysingle
Reviews.Content: Big rooms, small price, what else can you ask for? I wasn't sure what to expect after booking the rooms for a cheap-ish rate (about $50 / night), but we were pleasantly surprised by the big, pretty, clean rooms that awaited us. The Hilton is a little off the Strip, but it's really no biggie with the monorail available. The hotel has the usual Vegas amenities with the notable benefits of a coffee bar that's open late, a Pizza Hut (if you're into that), and tennis courts. The parking garage is not directly attached to the hotel and the WiFi is not free. On the other hand, the hotel doesn't charge the hidden resort fee so typical of other LV hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Great room rate/Average experience”
Reviews.Author: MortyCanada
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hilton Las Vegas for two one-night stays. We used the VIP checkin - immediate service. We stayed both nights on the 25th floor of the North Tower. The second night we upgraded to the "Resort Level." The room must have been recently renovated as it was clean and crisp. In addition to the comfortable king bed, a desk with chair, dresser (with small frig), a lounge chair and ottoman provided a comfortable environment. A large flat panel TV provided entertainment with a plentiful choice of channels. Resort rooms come with a printer, but the cable was missing (quickly provided upon a phone call) and the ink cartridges were out of ink (never replaced!) So much for printing boarding passes. The bathroom was small but adequately maintained and the amenities were about average for an Hilton Hotel. As an HIlton elite, we had access to the fitness facilities, internet and the spa, so the Resort fee only provided access to the Resort Lounge. The Resort Lounge is really spartan, and the wine/beer and snacks period in the evening was not at all impressive. Definitely not worth the fee! The pool, fitness facilities and the spa are adequate, but hardly opulent. That these are free for an Hilton elite is really an important benefit, however. Dinner in the buffett is worth little more than the $20 fee. Breakfast, on the other hand, provided a wide array of food and an excellent choice of fruit and melons. Again, free for an Hilton elite and so a very good benefit. I checked out in the VIP Lounge, and so that was quick and painless. Price is the key to staying at the HIlton. If you can get a rate of $50 for a Premium Room, you will be pleased with your stay. More than $100, and you should explore options.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Docmark320
Reviews.Content: I usually associated the Hilton name with high quality service, but this stay was very disappointing. No hair dryer, no coffee maker in the room, drawers that smell like dead fish, Was only part of the problem. When we arrived at our room, it was not made up, and it was 730pm. They told us to wait there until someone, would bring us keys to another room, but that took 45 minutes. The keys to the new room led us to a room occupied by another family. We had to wait in line another 45 minutes to get the keys to another room. The room was prepaid and I was still charged for the room and the matter has been toldmto me 3 times that it will be reversed, but so far no reversal. I had tom contact my credit card to file a protest.

Reviews.Title: “loved the green option; quiet floor; outdated bathroom”
Reviews.Author: charitytraveler
Reviews.Content: I had a very easy check-in (about 5 minutes' wait, tops), and my king-sized room was spacious. I was on a non-smoking floor, and it was very quiet (9th floor). The room was nice and modern, so it took me by surprise at how outdated the bathroom was (it looked like something from the early 90s), and the bathtub faucet leaked continually. The room fan was a little loud, but it acted like white noise, and helped me to sleep. Good variety of restaurants, decent room service, very convenient to the LVCC. My favorite part was the $10 coupon for declining housekeeping. I used this feature twice, and the coupon is good for any hotel restaurant and the gift shop. Nice touch! Would've given it 5 stars if the bathroom was up to par.

Reviews.Title: “Needs to be updated!!!”
Reviews.Author: HS2011
Reviews.Content: The room was average but the bathroom was horrendous!!! It was from the 70's, the shower head had no pressure, the tub was cracked, the jacuzzi was down for repair, the pool deck was chipped. they charge 13.99 per day for internet. Not the best impression, especially for the money.

Reviews.Title: “upgrade to non-smoking room”
Reviews.Author: ttrinh2
Reviews.Content: For some reason, this time around my experience with the hotel was not all that great. We arrived late Friday night thinking that our room has been already reserved. I booked it with the promo rate for $95. The check-in line was terrible. My girlfriend was tired and having to wait for another hour, she would be very upset. As I waited in line to be checked-in, my girlfriend waved over and said that VIP line was able to check us in. I was glad to hear that we would be able to do so. It sounded too good to be true. After all that the room was in a smoking area, two beds, and I got charged for a standard rate. To say the least, I was not happy with the stay. I had to check my credit card and found out that I was charged at the standard rate. I had to call the hotel and deal with all the leg work to do issue a credit back to my account. I really hope the next time I stay, I would not have to go through the same experience again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location. A la carte amenities”
Reviews.Author: DadOf9Kids
Reviews.Content: Check in lines can be long depending on the time of check-in. Staff was friendly. There is a 'green' program where you get a $10 coupon for use within the hotel if you choose not to have your room cleaned. One of the days we chose this they stiffed us for the coupon. I spoke with the front desk who directed me to housekeeping. Had to call housekeeping on three separate occasions over two days to get the stinking coupon. Not a lot of money, but it is the principle...especially since they charge you for internet and there is no in-room coffee maker. Did not like the $4/cup coffee at the 'Bistro' (I am a home coffee roaster), so we actually wound up buying a coffee maker and our own coffee. Not a great customer service model to books someone in a room, then offer them an 'upgrade' to the newer rooms with a 'more comfortable bed' for an extra $20/night....so, you mean the room I booked does NOT come with a comfortable bed? I realize it is Vegas, but I agree with the reviewer who said they nickel and dime you to death. Would not call this a family friendly place, as the board of tourism claims. If you don't gamble or have business here I'd recommend going elsewhere for your vacation. Unfortunately, we had business at the LVCC, so our options were limited. I would, however, recommend the Beni Hana complex in the hotel. The Chinese food was very good, and the terraced lounge with multi-story waterfall was a great meeting place with the best acoustic design (baffles and white noise) I have seen in years.

Reviews.Title: “SCARY AND DISHONOURABLE EXPERIENCE IN LAS VEGAS”
Reviews.Author: HKStyletraveler
Reviews.Content: Stay in Hilton Casino Las Vegas: at my arrival I did chek in and the front desk clarify my that since the reservation had been made using another web site I was not eligible for any upgrade (I want to clarifyand you can verify from my records that every time my booking had beenmade via Hilton web site, but this time there was troubles with the credit cards so I was able to book only using Expedia but any way I confirmed my devote).The stuff was totally uncompromising and they didn't considered anyway I was HH Gold member and they assigned me a room that when I opened the door shocked me. Pillow so small that you can not consider them as it, dirty all around; I complained with the manager and he assigned me a room "decent" but also this room have nothing to share with the brand Hilton. I have to ask if an Hilton hotel required to the guest to leave the laundry bag in the front desk, is it normal ?There are no room shoes, no body soap, the hair dryer is a remember of 80's years. I try to book a car using the hotel service and the lady she was so unfrendly and cold that you can't believe than I asked a car with GPS and she told me they haven't, so I asked if she would be so helpfull to recommend me a car rental or an address and she simply smiled me and said sorry I haven't: is this the help desk of a 5 star hotel ? One time I try to had my dinner in the steak house inside the hotel and guest and service was totally disgraceful (drunked peoples every where, one guest also did a burp in front of me (this is the average STD of guest) and when I seated I wait more than 10 minutes before someone come to take my order; I asked for olive oil and waiter came back with some kind of liquid was more like water than not olive oil, I took the salt case and this was totally dirty (full of oil allaround) so i decided to quit from my dinner and go back to the room. Before go back to the room I ask to talk to the front desk manager and I wait long time but he was too busy.........From my room I called two time more but the manager was "extremely busy" at the 3rd time he answered me and he confirmed me what I listen somewhere on these days: the Hilton is not a real Hilton but is handled by someone that is paying to use the Hilton's brand (underlicence) and this hotel is conisdered a 3 star. Well what to say (I was not expecting a Wynn or Bellagio scenario) but any way I was expecting to be cuddled by the Hilton's hospitality and quality but finally I'm guest of an "underlicence" 3 STAR hotel where service and environmental clearly show this status. How you can betray so clearly your guests ? And more how you can betray guests that represent for Hilton the best guests ? I've been in China in an "underlicence" Sheraton but outside the maindoor there is a big plate where is specify that hotel is underlicenceand is not a property of Sheraton. Talk about the buffet: so dirty and oiled food pliers that you can't believe, napkins of recycled yellow paper like toilet paper..... the atmosfere is like suburbia cafeteria. I find a towel in my room was blodded !! In the Casino area there was a basin to keep the water was coming from the roof.

Reviews.Title: “Should be called the "nickle and dime ya to death" hotel”
Reviews.Author: JoeyTwoShoes
Reviews.Content: Chose the Hilton only because Vince Gil was in concert...usually we stay on The Strip. There is a fee to use the in room safe. There is a fee to print your Boarding Pass. There is a fee to use the Wireless Internet service. They say it's because there is no "Resort Fee". Really? It's not a resort hotel...not by my definition. Gym towels, no soap dish at the sink, but on a good note, the "upgraded" bed was comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “PLEASE READ THIS FOR A TRUE GLIMPS INTO VEGAS HILTON.”
Reviews.Author: bombay546
Reviews.Content: To keep this as professional as possible, I would like to say that this hotel is not up to par. The Hilton in my home town of Portland, Or is better than the one in Vegas and the Portland Hilton would not qualify for a "Vegas type" hotel in my book. The service at the Hilton Vegas was bad even though they tried to accommodate us they put us in a smoke filled, uncleaned room that had stains on the floor and dirt by the night stands (I'm talking an actual pile of dirt and dust like if you were to empty a vacuum bag on the floor) The second room they tried to accommodate us with after we complained was had stains on the floor with a dirty bathroom (make-up smears on the counters, dirty glass, and toilet with "leftovers"). The worst thing was the ottoman foot stools for the chair and the bench at the end of the bed had "white stains" that I knew weren't from ice cream..... we called the travel broker we went through and complained and 20 min later the Hilton "hotel manager" tried one last time to accommodated us by giving us free tickets to there lounge bar area for our stay and a executive suite. With all that said the whole stay from the time we were booked in the executive suite to the time we left was sub-par. Aside from all the previous things the windows hadn't been washed in a while in each room we saw (looked like they did major construction right next to the window) the decor was outdated and the majority of the place smelled like cigarettes. It reminded me of a bad 80's experience. Go with a newer hotel or newly renovated place and i'm sure you will have better luck than we did.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap, clean and no problems”
Reviews.Author: mattypoika
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hilton for one night as we were passing through Vegas. We paid $40 bucks for the night and we both had double beds. The room was clean and had nice views out the window. We didn't have to wait to check-in and when we checked in the gave us a $25 voucher to use in their casino. The staff were friendly and basically we only used the room to sleep in after a big night out. It's not luxury, but it is a nice room.

Reviews.Title: “Seriously - it's not THAT bad!”
Reviews.Author: gibosity
Reviews.Content: I've never read so many mixed reviews of a hotel in my life! For this reason, I was a bit unsure what to expect. We scored a great deal - $520 for 5 nights. Upon checking in (we were lucky - check in at 7pm on a Friday night and only a 5 minute wait. At other times, the line was quite long) we found out we could upgrade to a premium room for only $20 extra per night. This included a fridge and newer room facilities, so we did. It was worth it. The room was pretty standard, and we had a nice view looking out towards the strip. Okay, so maybe the carpet looked a bit dated, but apart from that, the room was nice. Shower/bathroom was good, and there was plenty of room for our luggage. I should mention that the bed was incredibly comfortable, and my wife and I both slept extremely well thanks to this and the blackout curtains, which kept the room dark and quiet. One thing I REALLY liked is the room service is optional. If you choose to not have your room tidied, they give you a $10 voucher to use at any restaurant in the hotel. Considering the buffet breakfast is only $13.99, my wife and I used this every day and had a great, cheap breakfast every morning! Internet is $13 a day, which is a ripoff. That's probably my one complaint. Yes, there were some room service carts left in the hall for most of the day occasionally, but so what?! All you have to do is walk past them! We had to pay $3 a day for the safe, but since were had such a good room rate, I didn't mind. The safe didn't work at first, so we called the front desk and had a technician at our door in 5 minutes to fix it. The lobby is pretty crowded and cluttered with people and pokies, and overall, the "feel" of the lobby isn't that nice. But hey, I'm an Aussie who's used to non-smoking hotels and not so many people!:) In summary, there's nothing wrong with this hotel. Yes, there are faults and imperfections if you look for them, but honestly - some reviews here made it sound like a fleabag hellhole. I can assure you, it's nowhere near that bad!

Reviews.Title: “La Bella Wedding Chapel exceeded our expectations”
Reviews.Author: Artsychick30
Reviews.Content: We picked La Bella because of the value of the package and the feedback we had seen from others who have used their services. And they exceeded our expectations. We booked a very good package that included a limo ride to the Las Vegas Welcome Sign, the minister, the photographer and all photos and the flowers. Their payment plan was very reasonable, they answered all of my questions within a 24-hour period, and always offered to assist in any way. When we arrived at the chapel , they took control of every last detail, allowing us to fully enjoy the wedding. Everyone we worked with (limo driver, minister, photographer, chapel director) was wonderful. I truly believe our day would not have been so special without them. Thank you so much to everyone at La Bella Wedding Chapel for going above and beyond and making our day the best it could be.

Reviews.Title: “I really like the Premium room!”
Reviews.Author: SophiaBelle
Reviews.Content: Las Vegas Hilton is the best hotel compare than the other old hotels in the strip! I really like the cleanliness of the room and bathroom! There is a big space between the entry door and the bed, so the room is not too small for a good rate! This was the 4th time I stayed in Hilton, and I'd love to come back there!

Reviews.Title: “Tired & exhausted, well past prime!”
Reviews.Author: Tengak
Reviews.Content: I was here about twenty years ago and can notice the decline. My room needed maintenance with some lights not working and the faucets & toilets dripping. Furniture was chipped and the carpet worned out. The hotels' chrome fittings could do with a cut and polish. Also it is a fair distance from the main strip, but close to the Golf course.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the price tag”
Reviews.Author: DecafGwen
Reviews.Content: My sister and I were very excited when we got the Hilton/Benihana package for Las Vegas. However, there were several key things, such as picking up certain coupons for Benihana at the front desk that we were not told about until it was almost too late. Aside from the package, the hotel itself was a plain no frills kind of Hilton. I expected more due to the fact that it is the Hilton after all. Instead the bathroom was smaller, the shower had less pressure, and the beds were less comfortable than the hotel we had stayed in the night before (also in Vegas) for half the price! (Hilton package for two = over $200. The hotel the night before = $50 pre-tax) The worst part of this particular hotel was that it was actually off of the Strip though they claim to be. It is at least a quarter mile and no buses run to the Hilton. True, the Hilton is connected to the downtown by way of the monorail but it stops running at midnight. Who in Vegas stops anything at midnight? After all was said and done, it served its role of offering us a place to stay, but we would never go back. Vegas has much more worthy hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Desolate and isolating.”
Reviews.Author: mzmarna
Reviews.Content: The room however was definitely lacking some charm. I figured that the price was due to the off-strip location, not the lack of design aesthetic or modern fixtures. The style was sort of Southwest/Santa Fe/Art-Deco. Plain white walls, glaring flourscent tube lights mounted vertically in the vanity. LOW water pressure. The bed was comfortable. But the maids make a lot of noise yelling down the hall to one another and jingling all their metal keys. Then there was some construction the next morning. The hotel refunded $50 off my bill for the inconvenience, but the noise had already occurred. I told the front desk that they should wait until 12pm to start being so loud. Perhaps the rooms that cost the same as the ones on-strip would be better. I've stayed in nicer Best Westerns. I've always loved the gorgeous chandeliers in the casino. I gambled a little on the slot and was up about $60. Not bad.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, friendly, but everything is extra”
Reviews.Author: Coakster1966
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for four nights during our relocation to Nevada. I paid a little extra for an upgraded room and we got a very roomy and comfortable room. The bed was king size and the flat screen TV was nice. However, they will charge you for everything extra. The fitness center was $20 a day per person, the internet was another $14 a day and there was no coffee maker in the room. It's a little off the strip, but they do have a monorail station in the hotel. We paid the $12 per person all day ticket and used it frequently. You can purchase a 3-day ticket for $48 per person which is a wise investment if you have no car. The pool was nice and clean, but rather small for such a large hotel. The hot tub was nice size and well furnished with couches. There is a spa located near the pool, but it is another $20 per day per person to use. That just includes the saunas and additional hot tubs. If you want a clean quiet place to sleep, this is it. Just don't expect the pampering that goes along with the Hilton name unless you want to pay extra.

Reviews.Title: “Not Worth the Headaches!!”
Reviews.Author: K-shine
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately, I became ill on my birthday weekend in Vegas. First of all it started with the refrigerator not working in the room causing my beverages and meds become extremely warm instead of cold. I became ill and called the front desk stating I would be checking out at 12 the following day if I wasn’t feeling better. I felt worse so we checked out on Saturday. Upon checking out I was repeatedly charged instead of credited for my second night room stay. $331.88 in additional pending transactions in my checking account. *use a credit card if you must stay here*I spoke with two different managers. Saturday, I spoke with a male and he stated he was going to go out and talk to the rep and have a new receipt email to me. Never got is so I called him today only for him to be gone for the day. Just know the female manager who stated “she spoke with the front desk clerk and she already put in a call your bank to have them released the funds and I’m going to trouble you to put a call in to your bank as well.” I just said ok and hung up. No one offered an apology or anything! I won’t be back! This entire headache isn’t worth the stay there. The rooms aren’t all that “remodeled” that’s a joke!!! Save yourself the headache and stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “it's gamblers and smokers' paradise, oh yeah, and sunny”
Reviews.Author: harrisrivas
Reviews.Content: From the moment of our arrival, the first thing we saw was casino machines and a very strong cigarette smoke presence. Unfortunately, while the East Coast was battling storms our flights were delayed and we arrived to an empty airport; the ride to the hotel was very short on a beautiful cool night, or was it morning? Thankfully our room was very comfortable, the bathroom was large without the sink because that was right outside, that's a plus when you have family to share the bathroom with. Hungry at 3:30 a.m. we called for room service, but we couldn’t order because when the checked-in we were asked if we would charge anything to the room and not thinking clearly we said no, so we had to be in person at the front desk to authorize charges. We then found out that internet had to be paid there too, an additional charge not included in the room charge, that’s odd, isn’t it? Movies too, which we knew wouldn’t even have time to watch. So, back to the room and within half hour we had a huge breakfast, expensive, but it was complete with whipped cream for our chocolate, syrup for our pancakes, all in real dinnerware, and covered to keep it warm. By the time we finished our meal we didn't want to go to sleep, but for a few hours we relaxed in tranquility. The hotel also has a security check at 3:00 a.m. so we had to endure a security guard opening our door, which really was no inconvenience, actually I thought that was very thoughtful. Moving on, the buffet and restaurants in the hotel were near the casino area, which was always crowded, all day and a lot of people smoking, this affected my daughter and myself, we came back with sinus problems. I loved the exclusive stores and convenience store, along with specialty coffee and wine shops, all inside the hotel. Everything was a short distance away by taxi or monorail, right there. Taxi is preferable for several people traveling, it’s cheaper, even the person outside the hotel designated to call the taxis recommends that. S/he will also get you a taxi that accepts credit cards if you tell them. I really loved the hotel, but it would be better if they figure a good smoke extractor system or something to clean the air a little! The pool was large enough, and yet cozy, they had tons of lounge chairs to sun bathe and they provide you with a towel when you enter the pool area. They also have a small store for swimming necessities, and a bar to order your favorite drink by the pool, I can’t elaborate because I didn’t order anything. Anyhow, it’s enjoyable even with small children and extended family. I would go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for conventions”
Reviews.Author: dianita
Reviews.Content: We got upgraded after a slight problem w/ the dates of our stay. The room was great. Great view, nice amenities, good variety of restaurants, except no Mc Donald's. There was an option of declining room service and we took advantage of that after it looked like something was definitely not where it was and the cleaner may have gone through my drawer. Overall, a great stay w/ wonderful access to my convention.

Reviews.Title: “Resort Club Rooms, Rock!”
Reviews.Author: maxjude
Reviews.Content: It was especially nice o load up on grapes in the morning and evening. It was well worth the few extra bucks to have a room full of drinks and fruit from morn-evening. I would def suggest booking this level.

Reviews.Title: “great place for a heavy smokers who enjoy sharing hots tubs with obese naked people”
Reviews.Author: travel666
Reviews.Content: The hotel room was recently rennovated and very nice, but the rest of the hotel was awful. The hotel caters to smokers so nearly every public place smells like an ashtray, and they try to pressure you into taking a smoking room. The restaurants had food that was so bad and old fashion, I had not seen anything similar since New Jersey in the 1970s. The gym for 4000 guests is about 1000 sqft. The hotel guests are fairly unpleasant...loud smokers who use foul language; you will get to know them since the public places in the hotel are very crowded...including really obese naked guys in the hot tub. If you can, stay at the Mandarin Oriental (very nice quiet non-smoking hotel), the Marriott (non-smoking, quiet), or if you like gambling the Bellagio (very nice pool and better ventillation and natural lighting). However, if you just want a very nice room at a cheap price, this is okay but stay away from the hot tub or you will never eat a cookie again.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Place”
Reviews.Author: mrali52
Reviews.Content: Had been to Us for a family vacation so stayed in Hilton in Las Vegas. Must Say a value for money. The casino situated on ground floor is huge and has many activities going on. Room are super clean and luxurious. Plus a cheap deal too. Must Visit !!!

Reviews.Title: “Decent stay- if you're a Hilton rewards member...”
Reviews.Author: OnTyne
Reviews.Content: After reading reviews from other previous guests at the LV Hilton I've come to the conclusion that in order to have a decent room one must have a relatively high status with the Hilton rewards program. Thankfully my husband does. When we arrived on Friday we were told that the only room available to us was a double room on a smoking floor.. unacceptable. However, after giving the girl checking us in a decent stare down she "found" us a king room on a non-smoking floor. What luck, huh? Our room was decent. The bed was probably one of the most comfortable hotel beds that I've slept in in a very long time. We had a decent view from the 22nd floor, however, the gigantic Hilton sign shone right into our window at night- but the room had decent black-out curtains. The hotel overall was decent- at least for us. There were a few things that could use some attention, though- the hallways need to be cleaned BADLY. There are balls of dirt and lint along the baseboards and in the corners near the doors to rooms, elevators, etc.; glasses used in hotel rooms should be REPLACED after every guest checks out- not just wiped out with a dust rag and placed back on the counter for the next guest to use.. i know this was the case because of the fuzz in the bottom of all of our glasses- as well as random body hairs stuck to the inside of glasses. Disgusting! Other than that I can't really complain. We were in the north tower on a high floor, which I assume is reserved for rewards members. From what I can gleam from other reviews the lower the floor the worse the quality. Try to go higher up- it's not that bad!

Reviews.Title: “Needs Improvement”
Reviews.Author: elanger
Reviews.Content: The linens hadn't been changed and there was hair and make-up on the pillow cases. Yuck! The room was hot, A/C wasn't functioning well. To top it off, the front desk had the wrong room rate and it took a good while to get it straightened out.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Rooms”
Reviews.Author: njs71
Reviews.Content: The most outdated rooms that definitely don't look like the ones on website. Stayed in the Central Tower. Bed was a s hard as a rock and NO bath rug was provided for the bathtub. We had to lay towels down when stepping out of shower. I've seen motels in better shape.

Reviews.Title: “WHAT A DUMP”
Reviews.Author: stanzz71
Reviews.Content: This place is digrace to the Hilton Name--it is neither a resort( a joke-wher is the resort-I never saw it) or a hotel-simply a dang dump!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed...”
Reviews.Author: gamecock723
Reviews.Content: It's the Las Vegas Hilton, so it has to be nice, right? WRONG!!! I was extremely disappointed. First, we reserved a non-smoking room when we made our reservations online. When we got checked in, our room reeked of cigarette smoke. I called the front desk and they could only move us to another room on the same floor, which is supposedly a non-smoking floor (although I had one employee tell me that it was NOT a non-smoking floor). So we moved next door to another room, which was better but still had a hint of cigarrette smoke. I called the front desk again, and they told me all the non-smoking rooms were occupied and they couldn't move us. We decided to stay. The room was not clean -- not terribly dirty either, but not clean. There was a stain on the bed spread, there was a 1/4" thick layer of dust covering the air intake filter as if it hadn't been changed in a year, there was a layer of dusk on the night stand, there were cup rings on the table. It was just not what I would expect from a Hilton. Furthermore, the room was not a "Superior room" which we paid extra for. What kind of "Breathtaking views of the Las Vegas strip" can you get from the 4th floor? Plus we were supposed to have a refridgerator in our room & didn't. They did bring one to our room when I called and asked about it. There was a safe in the room as described in the room description, but you had to pay extra for it. And speaking of paying extra, how about the $4 waters & $13.99/day internet access charges. I mean, maybe this is standard for Vegas, but who charges for internet use these days. Most Hampton Inn's that I stay at offer free WiFi. Going back to the 4th floor being a non-smoking floor... there were no signs anywhere on the floor indicating non-smoking. Not on each room number sign or when you get off the elevator. And speaking of which, there was an ash tray as soon as you got off the elevator. So yeah, it was a smoking floor & the front desk just straight up LIED to me. Speaking of service, the cleaning people were nice enough, but the people downstairs were slack. On our flight out to Vegas, one of our bags got lost. We were told by the front desk that when our bag arrives they would call our room so that we could come & pick it up. They didn't. On the way out, we swung by just to check, and there it was. There were 2 girls sitting behind the desk with no customers to be helped. Why didn't they call us & let us know it was in? Thanks for nothing! I know for a fact that I will not go back to this hotel, nor will I recommend it to anyone. The location to the heart of the Vegas strip was not great, but the monorail stops at the Hilton. So that made it okay. But the terrible service, getting lied to by the employees, and not getting what paid for in terms of room quality just made the whole experience, well, disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “If only I could take the bed home with me!”
Reviews.Author: Periwinkletea
Reviews.Content: Life on the 25th floor is good, indeed! The non-smoking floor has beautiful rooms with extra large bath tubs and beds that make it difficult to choose the Strip over an indulgent lie-in. No coffee maker or fridge in the room, but there is a special lounge for guests of the upper floors, which offers lattes, breakfast breads, fresh fruit and other items in the morning and wine/cheese in the evening.

Reviews.Title: “LV Hilton is not that bad !!!”
Reviews.Author: UncleDom
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 4 nights arriving on a Wednesday from the UK and checked at at about 5 p.m. - there were no lines !!! I was unsure about staying here due to previous reviews but all was ok. I was allocated a room on the 8th floor overlooking the pool area. The tv was a modern flat screen and the furniture seemed new & the bed was big & comfortable. It was roomy & spacious. The bathroom was acceptable but could do with a bit of tlc otherwise okay.Good a/c but no fridge or coffee facilities in room. Booked Escape to Vegas package on hilton.com & got free breakfast buffet for 2 for 1 morning, breakfast - $28 value The quality of the food was good & special mention to the omelette station guy - he was great !!! 4 stars to him. The casino floor is not as busy as other hotels which is good as it is easy to navigate yourself & not get lost. Enjoyed time by the pool area to catch some sun & have a dip in the water, again good sized pool & never had a problem getting a sun lounger. Free pool towels & happy hour cocktails in the afternoon, plus NO RESORT FEE here. Do take advantage at least once of declining housekeeping - you get a $10 voucher to spend in the hotel each time you do so. The monorail is right outside the hotel $28 for 3 day pass - very reliable & runs till late better than waiting for a taxi. It is air conditioned too. Very good value. Also sign up for Total Rewards card ( it is free) at Harrahs rail stop for voucher book for $5 off Harrah breakfast buffet - again very good & other discounts & offers in the fun book - Eat at Grand Lux Cafe in the Venetian - it is fab or try Kelly Gourmet Burgers in Harrahs, great burger & chips in odd surroundings - Also enjoyed Mirage dinner buffet - 4 stars. Would recomend hotel but only if offer is good & there is nothing better on the strip, it realy is not that bad, the location is not too much of a problem with the monorail.

Reviews.Title: “clean and nice”
Reviews.Author: Melike2travel
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on Sept. 27-28-29 on a discount rate of $139.00 for 3 nights that I couldn't pass up. We opted for an up grade to a small suite for $20.00 a night more which gave us a little more room since we were staying longer. Rooms were nice, beds were great and bath was nice. This is the first hotel that I have stayed that pays you $10.00 not to need maid service. If you don't need new towels and a change of sheets every night they give you $10. coupon. That makes saving the planet that much more worth it. Now for the bad, the elevators are a long way from rooms because its such a large hotel and it needs to have a coffee pot and free internet service to be a perfect hotel. Also unless you have a car or ride the Tram this hotel is kind of out of the way unless you go through the Riviera which puts you right on the Strip. We didn't win much but we sure had a good time.

Reviews.Title: “Convention access was easy and deluxe”
Reviews.Author: eatcereal
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in the central tower and had a excellent view westward toward the strip. I was very happy with the clean room and firm bedding. I have been to Vegas 3 times before and this time was the most quite room I have been in. I did not hear people yacking and or any slamming doors or noise from the hallway or adjoining rooms above or below. The HVAC worked very wel lwith HEPA FIltering! I was too cheap to upgrade the TV as I didn’t need it any ways. The Paradise cafe was an excellent value. Benihana's is a great experience and convenient to have the high quality. The pool area was clean and spacious. Most of all They have life guards! Most hotels are too cheap to provide lifeguards. The uniformed security guards are present thru out the facility and I like this (safety)! Buffet was good. Sports’ betting was large area. Greeters outside excellent service always! Great to be on the Monorail system, just like being on the strip only not as congested!

Reviews.Title: “Good value for price but inconsistency in service and rooms”
Reviews.Author: TOTravelgirl
Reviews.Content: The initial experience and room would have me rating this holtel lower. Thank goodness we changed rooms. After the horrendous wait time to check-in things got better. Was disappointed the first room, which was to be non-smoking reeked of stale cigarettes. The decor was definitely older and dated, neither of which evoke cleanliness although the room was clean. The shower heads are way too low. They hit my neck and I'm well under 6'. The beds were soft and caused issues. Moved to a room with one King on a much higher floor and the room had been updated, had newer carpet, did not smell and the bed was much firmer. A much better experience. All service experience, with the exception of daytime check-in was exceptional. You definitely feel like you are their guest. It's very handy to the monorail, which is good since it's off the strip. We rented a car and the Valets were fantastic. What a great bunch of people. I'd definitely stay there again but would be very specific about room requirements.

Reviews.Title: “AVOID AT ALL COSTS !”
Reviews.Author: parochat
Reviews.Content: With the Hilton brand name , we thought it was a reasonably safe bet ...but we were wrong and how ! The location is straight away a BIG NO ...what you save on costs you spend on the commute by the monorail and if you chose walking well be prepared for some tired feet ! Second the rooms in the old tower ( where most of the promotions are ) are dingy and have a weird smell..basic amenities like lockers( only available downstairs ) , coffee maker are missing ...The entire hotel has a sense of decay and while it boasts of being the 'largest hilton' ...it could well be amongs the worst kept ! My advice pls spend extra on a hotel on the strip and stay away from this dinosaur ..if you still go ahead , then let me add that the food and service at its coffee shop ( paradise cafe) may well spell gastroenteritis !

Reviews.Title: “Check-in lines are long and seem to only...”
Reviews.Author: Xytoneboy
Reviews.Content: Check-in lines are long and seem to only have two staff checking people in during my trip. Very slow check in. Recommend checking in after 8pm if you must stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: brutus341
Reviews.Content: Over all was ok but I upgraded to the resort club and never could connect to the internet. I placed 2 calls to the front desk and it didnt help. Our card would not open the door for the resort club. We were told nobodies card on the 26th floor would open the door. It would have been nice to know that upfront. At the bar late Friday night and it looked like there were a lot of call girls working the place.

Reviews.Title: “The price was right, the hotel was clean...that is what's important!”
Reviews.Author: psu2010
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hilton Las Vegas using a website that discounts hotel rooms. The price was very good, as compared to others. When we arrived, I asked the clerk for an upgrade and he provided us with a better room with a nice view of the golf course and the pool. The hotel room was clean, however, the bathtub was damaged and very old looking. This was a shame because the tub was a whirlpool and we would have used it, but it just didn't look like something you would want to sit in. The room had doors connecting to rooms on either side of it and you could hear everything that was going on in these rooms. This was a major con for us. One good thing is that the hotel gives you an option to opt out of having your room cleaned and in exchange for this, you receive a $10 food credit for anywhere in the hotel. Self parking was convenient and free. This was the first time we stayed off the strip and we preferred the quiet and calm.

Reviews.Title: “Use it for the convention center ONLY”
Reviews.Author: rayu66
Reviews.Content: Defenitely the most disappointing Hilton I ever stayed in. The only reason for staying there can be that you attend something at the Convention Center - otherwiese I cannot recommend it. The rooms are old, not in good shape, not clean and a totally not customer interested staff - remember we talk about Hilton level. In my room the water was rinning into the tub 24 hours- water must be cheap in the desert. The buffer is ok for the price.

Reviews.Title: “the bad reviews are nearer the truth”
Reviews.Author: steve561979
Reviews.Content: reading some of the reviews on this dump the bad ones are more realistic of this hotel, i to was a victim of what one reviewer has called walking , i to had made and payed for a booking at the hilton , on arrival sent to the marriott as there was no room here .,what a way to run a hotel .very little compensation .The hotel is way out from the strip ,if there's more than two of you its cheaper to go to the strip by taxi than the monorail .This hotel should be bulldozed its old and tired the rooms are only 2star if that ,even 2 star rooms get a free safe, not the hilton,here you get no fridge no coffee making facility , the safe you pay for , broadband is very expensive ,old type tv ,its all very old and worn out .Add to this staff in a don't care attitude . The hotel only trades on a name which you would expect a lot more than this .I wonder how quick this review will be buried .With revues like what a lovely hotel ,if you want a nice time in Vegas don't stop here ,if you do your review will be like this one

Reviews.Title: “Ching, Ching, Ching!”
Reviews.Author: carlsoncarl
Reviews.Content: The price listed for the Hilton does not reflect their chintzy policies. Internet in your room costs $13.95 per day! (They want you to be out gambling) The room safe costs $3.00 a day. Using the fitness center is another $20 per day. The Cable TV has few channels to select. Fortunately, their swimming pool is free... at least for now. We were locked out of our room at 10pm when our room keys quit working. Security came. Their key also did not work. The locksmith then came up and got us in with new keys at about 10:45. We were happy. At 1am the front desk called our room, asking if we needed help getting into our room! Logically, if I had needed help getting into the room when they called at 1am, I would not have been able to answer the room telephone that they called to! I had trouble getting back to sleep after their 1am call. The next day, the front desk just shrugged off the whole thing. Disappointing experience! There is too much competition now for conference and tourism dollars in Vegas needing to tolerate chintnziness from a supposedly classy hotel. Stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Frustrated”
Reviews.Author: Michaeleslie
Reviews.Content: This was the first time we will stay at the Hilton in Las Vegas. Check in was a nightmare. The front desk didn't know about the internet specials they were advertizing. We had to use their computer to prove we had paid for an upgraded room. It was embarrassing! This should have been our first clue, The HVAC kept us up making a rattling noise. The toilet over flowed twice. The room was extremely dirty and the fact the room was an upgrade the printer’s driver’s was out dated. It didn’t help the internet had a slow connection making it impossible to use. You might be wondering if we gave them a chance to make it right. Yes, we called several times giving them plenty of opportunities to make things right. The fact they didn't show up for over two hours made the process too stressful. It was completely unacceptable customer service! In on call for services they didn't show up at all. Lastly, it took an hour plus to get luggage after checking out. You are forced to use valet if you have more than 4 pieces of luggage. You are forced to have them take luggage down for you downstairs while you settled your bill. During that process we discover they had charged us for the internet services it took additional 30 minutes to clear it up. Then you have to wait in another line 20 people deep to retrieve your luggage in a line. The hotel is quick taking luggage but are very s….l…o…w about getting it out to you. I should have stayed somewhere else. Michael [-]

Reviews.Title: “Would go back”
Reviews.Author: jackoNewmarket
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed 2 nights at the Hilton Las Vegas with my husband and have to say approached this hotel with some trepidation after reading most of the reviews already posted. Maybe we just got lucky but we stayed in the North tower on the 16th floor and the room was brilliant, clean, tidy and the bed was just sooooo comfortable I really didn't want to get up. I think it was probably one of the refurbished rooms. Our check in was easy only one person in front of us and check out was simple to. Pool area was clean as was the pool and the happy hour(s) was good value. Would agree that the Casino is quiet compare to some of the others on the strip but that suited us just fine. Would I come back, yes without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Nice safe hotel, elegant boutique & casino, but doesn't seem 4-star”
Reviews.Author: styx_fire
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice-looking elegant hotel inside. It is large, does contain a small deli and a restaurant, along with a few small shops for high-end clientele and the usual gambling facilities which were clean and well-lit. Wait lines at check-in are extremely long, and the 3-elevator system is confusing (can access floors only from certain elevators, so you may have to go all the way down to lobby and back up to visit another party). My bathtub faucet dripped constantly, which I did not expect at this level of hotel. All staff were courteous to me, but nothing above average. I think the building can house more customers than what the staff can effectively manage well. The hotel also advertises a lounge, fitness center, and business center and breakfast buffet, but I never saw them... it was just too large to easily access things. I had meetings all day (off-site) and didn't feel like searching for hotel amenities in the evening. Not sure where the boasted "nearby golf" is, but it is certainly not visible from the hotel which is located in an urban area. I would recommend this hotel because it's clean and safe, but I personally probably won't stay there again. Lots of choices in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “loved it!”
Reviews.Author: anneknowles
Reviews.Content: This August we spent 3 weeks in USA. On arrival we stayed at MGM Grand for 3 nights which was fab, 2 days before we came home we booked in at The Hilton. Now this hotel is much different than the massive, loud on the strip hotels. It seems to cater for the older crowd, which is fine for us as we are middle aged! We had a premium room overlooking the golf course. It was lovely!! Clean, comfy bed, good housekeeping etc. All the staff were very attentive, we enjoyed our time sround the pool and considering the great price we paid I can't fault it! It was a lovely hotel to relax in before we endured our long 12 hour flight back to UK Thank you Las Vegas Hilton, we will be back!!!

Reviews.Title: “nicest hotel on the strip”
Reviews.Author: tucsonfran
Reviews.Content: clean, quiet, good bargain.staff friendly and food was great. the spa has 1/2 off on tuesday and well worth the massage.just will star trek was still there. it is otherwise quiet boring

Reviews.Title: “room hadnt been dusted in weeks and i feel as if in motel 8”
Reviews.Author: julieoliva
Reviews.Content: i have stayed in several hiltons this is the first time i was disappointed. i would never stay there again. my husband and i had to sleep in seperates bed. i ordered king size. and the young lady gave us two full.

Reviews.Title: “they even have a name for it its called WALKING”
Reviews.Author: junekernow
Reviews.Content: in brief, booked this hotel with a name like the HILTON cannot go wrong, HA! turned up 1 am after a long travel only to be told yes yes you are booked in, but we have no room here , after a big argument we were told to go across the road{WHERE THERE WAS OTHER PEOPLE WHO HAD CHECKED IN AT THE HILTON THEY TO WERE }sent to the Marriot ,BUT I think the worst thing is that they do actually have a word for this its called "walking" and it does appear to be a common practice within the US. compensation was money back for one night stay in Marriot, 2 free cocktails, 1 free meal {at the buffet, CRAP} ,YOU WILL HAVE TO PAY TO USE THE ROOM SAFE, old tv, no coffee or tea making facilities in our room and no fridge, this by the way was supposedly an upgraded room! Going through complaints with the Hilton and we have got absolutely nowhere, they have said "Thank you for informing us of your stay". It seems it doesn;t matter how far up the Hilton chain you complain you are destined to get nowhere. Another surprise was that any negative review is buried straightaway by 3 good reviews on Tripadvisor. My adivce to anyone thinking of using this hotel is KEEP AWAY!

Reviews.Title: “dont stay”
Reviews.Author: ford88stu
Reviews.Content: this is not up to Hiltons standards. it is showing its age. service was not good. buffet was terrible. stay closer to the strip.

Reviews.Title: “This property does not represent the Hilton brand as other locations I have visited.”
Reviews.Author: MarkMusselman
Reviews.Content: I thought the overall quality of the hotel was average. It is old and a bit run down. If I were in Vegas for any other reason than a trade show located at the Convention Center I would never select this hotel. The location is convenient for trade show attendees, but other than that I has very few redeeming qualities. I am a Hilton Honors member and I was disappointed in the quality of this Hilton.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here unless you you enjoy your...”
Reviews.Author: voyger1
Reviews.Content: Don't stay here unless you you enjoy your pool side complete with piped loud poor elvis impersonator. Honestly I thought we had been transported to a cheap karaoke bar with non stop poor quaility country music. The hotel is massive with a small pool location is slightly off the strip which is ok as it is easy to connect using the monorail that stops in the lobby of the hotel. Nice Rooms but no tea coffee making facilities and no mini bar

Reviews.Title: “A great value for the money - especially deluxe rooms”
Reviews.Author: Victorjw
Reviews.Content: We booked a deluxe room at this hotel in August along with a friend who booked a standard room. As such, we were able to compare them. The majority of the negative reviews of this hotel seem to take issue with the fact that the hotel is not "Hilton Level." I can assure that the deluxe rooms, however, are. For only $10 extra per night (making the price still only a modest $59), they are some of the nicest rooms for the money one can find. The standard rooms, while a step down, were still fine though. The primary difference seemed to be a slightly more aged decor. However they were certainly an excellent value for $49 a night. On top of this, the hotel had an delicious buffet (which offered us a free breakfast with the package we purchased), two bars, plenty of gambling, and also had no resort fees. Everyone who is dissatisfied because the hotel is not "Hilton level" needs to either a) pay $10 extra or b) remember that they are in Las Vegas and paying only $49.

Reviews.Title: “great stay, great service, great value.....................”
Reviews.Author: jmelReno_Nevada
Reviews.Content: I would highly recommend this resort, the service was outstanding, the rooms were big, clean, quiet, the beds were fluffy and lots of pillows. The monorail came right too the hotel so you didnt have to rent a vehicle. The food was outstanding and they gave you large portions for your money.
