The resort was of off the strip so you had a chance to relax and enjoy the evenings without the noise or the hustle. Lovely sunsets over the evening with palm trees and the pools .......... Can't say enough. I will be back next year during my convention.

Reviews.Title: “Looking for an average stay in Las Vegas?”
Reviews.Author: jasontraci2006
Reviews.Content: Arrived at check in around 3:30pm, check in was a breeze as I was able to skip the lines because I am a Hilton HHONORS member. They gave me some free vouchers, but the toner was leaking all over the page and created a powered mess. That wasn't a good start to the stay. I had a suite, it was good size with a tube television on the bed side of the room while there was a flat panel TV mounted in the couch area. It looked out of place The back of the hotel room opened up to a patio where you could sit on chairs, however, you were connected and able to walk around to the other suties very easy which I did not like becasue it was not secure. We ate on-site at Behania's one night, it was good. Valet was quick to get the car. Hotel room walls very thin, I could hear my next door neighbor talking late at night. Overall, very average and won't probably won't stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great time to travel to Vegas and Great place to stay for the $!!”
Reviews.Author: amyathomeinstgeorge
Reviews.Content: We live in Southern UT and I traveled an hour and a half to pick up my husband from the airport and thought I'd surprise him by getting a room for a night and boy was he surprised! I booked one of the newly renovated rooms online but because of my later check in, the king size bed rooms were all gone but the staff was great and gave me the option of the same room with two queen beds or for a little additional fee, upgrading to a suite. I decided to go with the suite and it was absolutely amazing!! We enjoyed our luxurious room and had the best sleep on their comfortable mattress, we'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Is this really a Hilton”
Reviews.Author: erewards
Reviews.Content: Let me first start by saying the rooms are all decent. I've stayed in the basic rooms and the upgraded rooms. The basic rooms are the older ones, but still good enough. The upgraded rooms have nicer decor, but that seems to be all. The beds really are comfortable. That is the main reason I like to stay here. I generally like Hiltons, but this place needs some attention to detail. They need to clean up the common areas. I stayed three nights and I don't think the halls were ever vacuumed. I saw old room service dishes in the halls that would stay for as long as 24 hours. They stunk when I walked by them. The garage had an overflowing garbage can that didn't get emptied over the weekend. This should be unacceptable for any Hilton. If my room wasn't as nice as it was I would have gone somewhere else. This trip they had some go go dancers up on a table near the blackjack area. They weren't naked, but they were definitely nasty. It was kind of embarrassing to walk past them with my family. I might stay here again, but it won't be one of my top choices anymore.

Reviews.Title: “day of our dreams didnt go so well”
Reviews.Author: djshad
Reviews.Content: My wife and I made plans to have our wedding take place at this hotel. Wasnt really the hotel that we had a problem with, but the people in charge of providing wedding ceremonies. To start, the main guy in charge of handling everything was never available and took months to get back in contact with us. When we arrived at the hotel, our room wasnt even ready. Luckily we got upgraded to a suite. Come the day of the wedding, the flowers that we had sent to the hotel never made it to the person they were supposed to be shipped to, so they sat at the front desk for a few days and nearly died.......then when we went to get the package, the front desk charged us to receive the package. Continuing on........about an hr before the ceremony, the room wasnt complete and no one really seemed to care that it wasnt complete. After the wedding ceremony, our guests had to pour their own champagne, our wedding cake was completely wrong and my wife and I didnt even have a table designated for us to sit and eat the completely wrong cake!!! To sum it up, our wedding day was a BIG MESS!!!

Reviews.Title: “i was expected better quality and service.”
Reviews.Author: gorfou_6945
Reviews.Content: we had a room of a travelodge...for the price of a hilton !

Reviews.Title: “Great Makeover”
Reviews.Author: InsiemeSempre
Reviews.Content: Our disappointment of a few years ago vanished in August. Hilton has done a fine room renovation and an intensive (apparently) training for staff since there was a level of engagement and courtesy that just blew us away.

Reviews.Title: “It has a lot of potential”
Reviews.Author: biababy
Reviews.Content: First I booked a room at Bally's but by some sort of error they didn't have me in the system and apparently over there they were all booked( which was a lie), but that's how i ended going to the hilton. We loved the price, just to realize that they charge extra for almost everything: 13.99 internet/day, 4 dollars for bottle of water( that's right water is not complimentary). Then, they don't have a mini refrigerator in the room ( i thought Hilton has more to offer than other hotels). Still, the room was very clean, the bed was soooo comfortable and overal very quiet and relaxing. We had a great stay, the only few inconvieniences were the extra charges for some services that are complimentary at most hotels.

Reviews.Title: “It was decent, the Location was convenient and the rooms were nice”
Reviews.Author: eddie1lopez
Reviews.Content: The bed was a little stiff, and the air conditioner was one of those with out a thermal-state, you know it has no buttons its either off or cold or hot nothing else... but the price i got was very good and it was a short drive to all the prime locations. I would recommend this to a friend!

Reviews.Title: “TERRIBLE”
Reviews.Author: travelbug30232
Reviews.Content: We booked 2 non- smoking rooms two months in advance and our credit cards were charged at time of booking. Check-in time was 4:00pm and we arrived at 5:00pm and the only rooms available were smoking rooms and would not be ready for another 2 hours.

Reviews.Title: “Fist time LV Hilton did not meet my standards.”
Reviews.Author: ReneAngel
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the LV Hilton on 9/12 for 2 nights. I have stayed at the Hilton several times. This was the first time I had issues. I booked my reservation online. My reservation was for a premium non smoking King bed room. When I arrived to check in I was told the only non smoking rooms available were double bed rooms because the only rooms left with king beds-were SMOKING rooms. I had no choice but to accept the king SMOKING room. Upon exiting the elevator, my partner and I could smell the cigarette smoke. My allergies ended up acting up the entire time I was in the room due to the lingering cigarette smoke. To make matters worse, when we showered, the tub would not drain. I was up to my ankles in water because the bath tub would not drain. I literally would have to wait outside the tub for the water to drain AND then go back in the tub to wash off the soapy water from my feet. (RM 5105) We each only received one pillow. Normally 4 star hotels provide a total of 4 head pillows. We went to the pool, bought some drinks at the bar, returned to our lawn chairs and we notced there was a guest/lady laying on the concrete because apparently she had passed out in the pool. The police showed up and one of the hotel guests that was along side the past out lady, started yelling at the police telling them that they took too long to get help and that the lady could've died. More police kept arriving and then the paramedics showed up to take the passed out lady away on a stretcher. My boyfriend and I were worried about the past out lady because it took a good while for the paramedics to show up. Pool staff announced that all guests needed to exit the pool area because THEY CLOSED THE POOL. What I thought was extremely unprofessional was that one of the pool staff was going around telling other guests that he thought the past lady was on drugs...gossiping about someone when they are being carried away on a stretcher?! The hotel staff need more extensive training on customer service. I also want to add that I was not happy with the gentleman that checked me in, he was NOT friendly.(Hilton front desk staff are usually happy, chipper, always greet you with a smile).

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good for the price”
Reviews.Author: TracyHern
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Hilton every year in September since my husband found out about their Football Fantasy (all the football games broadcast in the theater on huge HD screens, smoke-free, cheap food and drink specials). It's not bad for the price, and since we got player's cards we usually get good deals like we did for our most recent trip at $35 a night (regular price is usually about $60-$100/night). The location is off the strip, so plan to drive or take the monorail if you want to head down to the strip (it has a monorail station connected to the hotel). It's nice to avoid all the weekend traffic on the strip, but requires some planning if you want to go down where all the action is. My three biggest problems with the hotel are: (1) the last three times we have stayed there when we check in to our room it has clearly not been vacuumed. We always have to call and complain about that because the floors can be pretty gross; (2) the shower heads are terrible, they feel like sandblasters; and (3) there are not a lot of casual dining options, and the one place they do have that is decent food (the Sportsbook Deli) has really weird hours so it's hard to find a time when it's open. The pool area is okay, but it's definitely not the "happening" pool scene that you can find at places like MGM Grand, The Palms, or Hard Rock Hotel. It's more a place you would go to relax for a while than to be seen. My husband loves the sports book, it is apparently the biggest in Vegas, so he likes to go and watch games down there. The casino is good, and you can usually find cheap gambling tables (we play blackjack) earlier in the day and on weeknights. On the negative side, they advertise on their website that they have "no resort fees" (which are apparently a mandatory fee between $5-$15 a night), but when you click on the list of hotels that do have resort fees, you notice that the resort fee includes things like free wireless internet, access to the fitness center, etc. At the LV Hilton you have to pay for all of these things, so if you're interested in using the fitness center ($20 a day) or you want wireless internet ($14 a day), you will end up paying a lot more for it than you would at a place that charges a $10/night fee and those things are included.

Reviews.Title: “decent stay”
Reviews.Author: princess_on_the_road
Reviews.Content: What can I say - it's Las Vegas, tabaco smoke everywhere (barely noticable in the room too) the good: price (not too bad comparing other ones on the strip), location (has the rail station right at front of the hotel - goes to the strip main attractions). Was quiet enough to sleep and great bedding! the bad: awful shower head (it hurts to take a shower!); the pool is nothing fancy and it closed way too early (about 5PM)

Reviews.Title: “Not Impressed”
Reviews.Author: Ishabirthday
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have been to Vegas several times, this was the first time we stayed at the Las Vegas Hilton. We thought this is going to be great (2) FREE buffet coupons and 3 nights for $130.00. First let me say the LV Hilton better be lucky I did not pay my money for that buffet because I would have asked for my money back. The buffet's in Arizona are larger and a have more of a variety than this hotel. You may think I am being picky, but when I think of a Las Vegas buffet I am thinking a large variety of foods and that was NOT the case here at the LV Hilton. The Deli ran out of hamburgers (this is all my husband eats besides breakfast) which was a huge issue and they had to solution or explanation. The "supervisor" had an attitude with me when I went to ask her what they plan on doing to get burgers. The shops and restaurants close around 10pm so we were forced to order a $20 burger from room service. It was 5 o'clock in the morning and we were both EXHAUSTED. I was upset that the "supervisor" did not offer to allow the special from the deli to apply to my room service burger. I thought the negative reviews were bad experiences, but now I see I should have believed what I read. NEVER again LV Hilton NEVER again! I told the supervisor that I was going to write a negative review about them and she did not seem to care.

Reviews.Title: “Great room rate very helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: ConnieConnie_10
Reviews.Content: The only complaint I have is one of the bathroom lights where out. Needed more light to put my make up on. And the TV quality could of been better our TV was a lil warped.

Reviews.Title: “$42 bucks...the good and the could be improved”
Reviews.Author: pulgadelmundo
Reviews.Content: First I have to say I was aware of the mixed TA reviews but since I wanted to stay in Vegas one more night (ie not drive home on a stressful Friday) I took the priceline risk... $42 + $10 taxes for a Friday night in Vegas 4 star was perfect for my budget...which I had committed to much more high-end strip hotels... I arrived later then expected on Friday...around 6pm which was just a reminded one why I not do Vegas on weekends anymore...Tons of people. Check in was not bad at 30 min considered the groups BUT what does need to be remedied is the VENTILATION at check-in. Newwer hotels have very high ceilings...This hotel felt stuff, hot and sweaty just while waiting in line.. The staff, once they got to me, was pleasant...I asked for a king near an elevator on a preferable higher floor, non-smoking...got all of the above. I was offered an upgrade for $20 and declined. My room, being from hotwire was sparse in decore...almost bare compared to the pictures online...Anyone else but me would of been bugged by being able to hear the elevators...non-issue here... What might of also been an issue was the singer/entertainment byt the pool that evening. I was on the 25 floor and he was PRETTY loud...If I had been any lower, I think it might have annoyed....I was on the pool/tennis court side of the building FYI. Since I was exhausted fromt partying the night before and gambling all day...I pretty much stayed in, slept and watched TV Kudos! I did order Room Service was was PERFECT...and much BETTER than I had anticipated... the Room Service I had ordered from another 5 star hotel previously in the week...I don't know about their $20 appetizers but the salad I had was delicious.Try the rice pudding...it was great! The casino is old Vegas...I didn't gamble here but it was smoky and dated. I had not seen the Star trek one since I was 21...and it looked it.. Nonetheless the Hilton served its purpose in the bind....

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel - comfy room. Would stay on the Strip next time.”
Reviews.Author: dazbrads
Reviews.Content: Good quality hotel. Clean and comfy rooms. Polite staff. Great buffet! A walk from the strip. Would stay on Strip next time. Free parking!

Reviews.Title: “Las Vegas Hilton: Value for money”
Reviews.Author: ChiragPune
Reviews.Content: I had the occasion of staying at the Las Vegas Hilton recently. I greatly enjoyed the stay at the Hilton. Actually it is off the strip a little bit but not by much. The hotel has a monorail service which guides you to about 80 percent of the strip. The prices for the rides are quite reasonable. The Vegas traffic remember is as busy as it gets but it sure is nice to just park and forget about it. Yes, free parking at the hotel. The rooms and the staff were great. The pool was a little small for such a huge hotel especially as it gets quite hot here in Vegas. It also offered great dinner options though. Another good thing about the hotel was they did not charge any bogus resort charges. The hotel is a terrific place but the one thing I didn’t like was the shower head. It only gave a small stream of water. And I do like good pressure. Another thing was I paid $40 for the upgrade to the club membership but a lot of things promised were not actually there. But apart from that the overall experience of staying at the hotel was nice. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great for our purposes”
Reviews.Author: hbhakh
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hilton for one night prior to driving to Utah. I got a great rate of $39. As an Hhonors gold member, I got an upgraded room, free valet parking, and two breakfast buffets. Our room was large and comfortable. It was convenient to the pool. The pool closed at 7 pm, which didn’t allow much time to enjoy it (I really object to pools in Vegas closing this early but we all know why). The pool area is not large for the size of the hotel and could use to be updated/expanded. I ate at the Italian restaurant on the property, which was very good. There were a variety of casual options as well as the buffet. This hotel was a good choice for our purposes and we’d stay again unless we are looking for a great pool.

Reviews.Title: “Horribly outdated and zero amenities”
Reviews.Author: ElSmashbo
Reviews.Content: We stayed here expecting good things since it was a Hilton and were very disappointed. Great, the Hilton Vegas hosted Elvis and it looks like they haven't bothered to update since, The room was musty with leaking faucets and stains on the walls and carpets. We were quite shocked to discover no coffee maker, hair dryer or other basic amenities in the room. Wanna check your email? A one day access code for the high speed Internet service was $15. Service in the two restaurants we ate at was absolutely horrendous. Food quality was very meh and grossly overpriced. We would have been better off finding a Denny's. I can think of nothing positive about our stay at this location.

Reviews.Title: “From the minute we attempted to check in...”
Reviews.Author: BraveKalel
Reviews.Content: From the minute we attempted to check in, we had nothing but hassles. Here's a list of what went wrong: 1. Upon check-in, they didn't have the room that we reserved. 2. We requested champagne, and received the hotels "sparkling wine." We were told that the wine is the hotels version of champagne. 3. The television didn't work. 4. The PPV movies didn't work. 5. When the room we requested was finally ready (a day later), it was no bigger than the room they put us in, and in a horrible location (reminded me of the hallway from 'The Shining.') We ended up leaving a day early. No, I'm not going back there....ever.

Reviews.Title: “Much Better”
Reviews.Author: Grahamwarrior
Reviews.Content: I last stayed in this hotel in 2009 and wrote a scathing review on here. What a difference a year makes. I was only tempted back to the hotel by the low rate and the promise of an upgrade given the poor service I had experienced last time. We stayed in a Club Resort Room, normally around $50 more expensive and well worth every penny. Free breakfast, internet and even nibbles in the Club lounge make this good value for money. One bad review, one good - heres hoping the next one is positive too

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable but a little faded”
Reviews.Author: TiburonTony
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights last week with a friend. The hotel Web site advertises itself as "Off strip", at least it's accurate. It is quite a walk from the major hotels on the strip, 30 minutes in 100 degree temperature feels forever. The room was more than adequate, large, two queen sized beds, desk for working and large flat panel television. Ethernet access was available for an additional $14 per day (I think this was the cost) and was adequate from a speed perspective, nothing to write home about but not a snail pace either. The bathroom was basic: small with two sinks, toilet and tub with shower head in it. Toiletries were on the lower end but plenty of towels of decent quality were supplied. The biggest problem with the bathroom was a lack of hot water in the mornings; out of four we had hot water once. We ate in the hotel one night, mediocre would be a generous description. The restaurant was TJs, the Italian restaurant was closed until later in September. The service was willing enough but not sophisticated - think upscale Olive Garden or Red Robin while the food was very expensive and the steak in particular was no better than adequate. The wine list (like all the restaurants we eat in) was very expensive. The gaming rooms and bars / night club looked very tired and reminiscent of the 70s or 80s. Early in the week they were deserted, not until Thursday evening did they come to life and even then it was hardly jumping. Overall a decent hotel if one can get a cheap room (I think we paid $60 per night) and one isn't planning on spending most of one's time in the areas around the Bellagio or Wynn.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Fall for the Hilton upgrade scam”
Reviews.Author: vegas511
Reviews.Content: When I checked in to t he Hilton they asked me if I wanted to upgrade my room for a $20 per night fee. (the info when I booked said it would be less). I readily agreed because on a previous visit to the Hilton they gave me an upgrade to room that was fantastic. But not so this time. The clerk alluded that to the work suite with a refrigerator. But this was no suite and the upgrade was hardly worth the fee. The upgrade was to a regular room that had been remodeled. New paint and average looking furnishings which will age quickly and some nice tile in the entrance way and bathroom. And there was a refrigerator. If this was the upgraded room I'd hate to see the regular room. To add salt to the wounds, there was no soap, the curtain switch didn't work, and the shower leaked. Also, our upgraded room was near the elevator and we were blessed with the elevators humming up and down all night long. They should ask people if they prefer to be near the elevators or not. The Internet broadband connection was too expensive at $13 per night. When we checked in there was a huge line and only two clerks handling check in. The fast check out on the tv is shoddy with no confirmation message. On the plus side, the cleaning staff was courteous and great. There was a neat MP3 device in the room. And the staff person at the roulette wheel was exceptional. The Hilton also seems to be doing an OK job (not super) of ventilating the smoke. Overall, this place isn't bad, I was just expecting more. It's not a dump but it's also not the Venetian. If I want to go low end and economical I'd rather stay at the Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay despite reviews.”
Reviews.Author: Duggs
Reviews.Content: Well ! It must be luck of the draw because we spent 3 nights at the Hilton, late August, and had a great stay. We had a recently modernised room in the North tower and found it to be excellent with all that we could ask for. The beds were amazingly comfortable and the room quiet. They had in-room safes and fridges along with large flat-screen HDTV. The buffet was to die for and staff very attentive. The only SLIGHT disadvantage is that its away from the Strip but for some, that may be a plus. We felt the monorail was a bit over priced and you would really think that the Casino's could afford to cover the charges...especially given that they want you to visit ? AND the final little bug bear, although all the Vegas Hotels seem guilty of this, is the expensive charge of using the Internet....the Hilton was expensive at 79c per min whereas the others were 50c per min. STILL way to expensive given that the little old Travelodge in San Francisco had free access. With the money they make it REALLY seems odd that they should charge internet access...afterall its a great place to leave the youngsters while parents are off gambling.....very strange ?? AND if he reads this....the sarcastic idiot who was running the "Business Centre" who said to me in front of wife and child.."show me a hotel in Vegas running the internet for less than 79c"....They ALL are cheaper than you jerk. !!

Reviews.Title: “The huge Hilton hotel”
Reviews.Author: polizzi82
Reviews.Content: Never realized how huge this place is... The hotel is as great as an old but classy renovated hotel can be. I liked the room-no problems there. Check in and p[arking are great. The entrance of the pool is a broken down fountain. The pool was overrun by rowdy kids. The spa (fee) makes an old '24 hour gym' sauna/steam room/hot tub look new. The dry sauna bench is falling apart, the steam room so bright it's hard to relax. The towel boys were too busy chilling out themselves to fill up bottled waters, etc. The buffet had sickly looking crab legs and mediocre desserts. Stay for the cheap rooms but don't hang around.

Reviews.Title: “old school cool.”
Reviews.Author: texan_world_traveler
Reviews.Content: This is a nice place to stay for someone who needs to retreat from the craziness. From the difference of my experience and some of the reviews, I think it is a good idea to get a premium room. Everything in my room was new and relatively nice and had good views. The tram is very nice and convenient, although not cheap, and it stops pratically in the hotel. I walked across the lot the Riviera, which is kind of a dump but has cool shows, and it felt midly dangerous. But the tram never felt dangerous. The restraunts were cool. Bennihanas - awesome Buffet - above average Tres Rios - crappy margaritas; ok tequila; only cool if you are a VInce Neil fan; if you are it is very cool.

Reviews.Title: “Nightmare at the Las Vegas Hilton”
Reviews.Author: jcvellen
Reviews.Content: I recently made my bi-yearly trip to the Las Vegas Hilton. I have found that service as well as security at the Hotel is sadly lacking. I flew in on the 20th of August and on the 21st of August early morning I went out to the lobby at 5:00am and got a coffee to take out to the bench right out side of the main entrance. I was on the phone with my wife in Tampa while drinking my coffee and having a cig.. I was not yet acclamented to the time change that is why I was up so early. I noticed a group of four youths harrassing the people coming in from the night. hey walked in and out of the Casino banging an empty bottle of bourbon against the revolving door. I kept sipping my coffee and talking to my wife on the cell phone. The four youth than walked by me smiled and hit me over the head with a flower vase that they had taken from the Hilton Lobby. I was shocked and screamed for help. It took security about ten minutes to finally come to my aid. The LV Police where very helpful and two of the boys where caught. I did not see which one of the boys hit me over the head and Hiltons Security Camera at the door was buzzy so that was no help. The police did arrest one or two of the boys for dui and assault. After this happened I went to the front dest and an employee told me that someone was mugged outside their door only a week ago and that the employees of the ilton are afraid to use the employee entrance a they where being followed. My question to the Hilton is; where was your security.

Reviews.Title: “XHotel exceeded expectations. This hotel...”
Reviews.Author: 4realpeople
Reviews.Content: XHotel exceeded expectations. This hotel is not on the strip but has the monorail station located at the hotel-very convenient and economical. Rooms are great size for 2 adults and were well appointed and clean. Breakfast buffet was delicious and offered good variety. Parking was free and ample. We asked for a late check out and were given a 2pm without cost. We highly recommend this hotel for everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay to Get Away at Great Price”
Reviews.Author: Iam14u2c
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for a place to stay in Las Vegas without having to deal with the traffic of the Strip, the Las Vegas Hilton is perfect. It has everything that Vegas has to offer. Also, if you want to visit the Strip, you have several options available to you, including walking, cab, riding the Las Vegas Monorail, or bus. The buffet isn't spectacular, but it's decent. Although, it's pricey for the quality of some of the foods. The spa is awesome. I suggest getting a day pass. Also, when you check-in, ask about a room upgrade to the Resorts Club. That is the Las Vegas Hilton's concierge level which includes many perks/benefits."

Reviews.Title: “Faded but very nice”
Reviews.Author: Flaesb
Reviews.Content: Being a gold Hilton member, I was given free beffet, ugraded room, and excellent service. Fri and Sat were less than $100/night and Sunday was less than $50. Tough to beat the room rate and our room! Easy metrorail stop (although the metro is not cheap at $12 pp day pass, and it leaves one off WAY behind the hotels on the strip....so it is still quite a walk to get to the front of the hotels). Check-in line at Hilton was usually long, but service was excellent, and the VIP line was short. Casino and lobby area are dated, but clean. One small problem I encountered was with housekeeping. I asked the room maid (who was in the hallway) for another bath towel, and she responded that her shift was nearly over, and she only had enough towels left for the rooms she was going to service before leaving! Hence, she refused to give me a towel! Pretty shabby!

Reviews.Title: “Fab Holiday!”
Reviews.Author: helliams
Reviews.Content: After reading some reviews I was a bit dubious about staying at the Hilton. However, I needn't of worried beccause it was great (apart from check in - there was a massive queue). We had a room on the 29th floor which had a balcony and a view over the strip (an amazing sight at night). The room wasn't particularly modern, however it was huge! Massive bed, couch, tv in room and separate bathroom area which included a jacuzzi bath and 2 washing areas. The maids came every day and were very friendly. The room was always cleaned and tidied for us. One bad thing about the hotel is that it is slightly out of the way. However the monorail stop is right outside which makes it eay to get to the main part of thee strip. Tickets are $5 for a single ride or $12 for a day pass. This will take you to any of the hotels on the strip and is far easier and cheaper than getting a taxi and getting stuck in the traffic! The casino in the hotel was a little outdated and not as busy as the other casinos on the strip. Whilst in Las Vegas must do: Outside bar between Flamingo/Harrahs. This was great fun - cheap drinks with loads of happy hours and live bands on. Premium outlet (near Fremont Street) great for shopping. Good Levi's shop with jeans for about £25. Also things like Ugg Boots - still not cheap (about £100) but cheaper than the UK. Good Guess shop with cheap clothes too. Fremont Street is a must! Really good fun and a taste of the old Vegas. Light shows on the ceiling are amazing. Cheaper places to eat here too. If you are going to Vegas you must also go to the Grand Canyon which is amazing! It takes about 4 hours to get there from Vegas but well worth it. We got a coach which was really comfy - air conditioned, dvd players, toilets etc. This cost about £100 each but also included breakfast and lunch. Overall Vegas is probably one of my favourite places in the world. This was my second time there and I would not hesitate to go back! You've got to see it to believe it!

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but not guest friendly”
Reviews.Author: travelmom12319
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my stay at the Hilton, however, they aren't very guest friendly in the hours of their pool, spa and restaurants. Everything was either closed, opened late or closed early. I will not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value but not as great as last year!”
Reviews.Author: jettingthenation
Reviews.Content: This is my second trip to Vegas w/i a year and the first time was AMAZING! This time was nice but I had a couple of problems. When I arrived I expected to receive the free upgraded room that I received the last year but was made aware that the rate was an extra $20/ night making it $62.95 per night. Other hotels right on the strip offered comparable rates with excellent location. The Good about the Hilton: The 1/2 off spa service was heavenly. The male tech Juan is excellent and my friend enjoyed her female tech Katie. Fransico in the Buffet was an awesome representative for the company along with the ladies at the front registers. Breakfast by far is the best in Vegas. The lunch buffet was ok the Luxor has great lunch buffet. Our bathroom smelled like mold and mildew and my allergies cut up all while we were there. The housekeeper sprayed some spray but it did not last long. Our floor did not have any face cloths therefore we called and they delivered some within the hour but a gentleman named Mr. Williams greeted my mother with an exhilarating spirit. Transportation: A nice addition was that the RTC bus Gold line stops at the convention center on the corner and will take you to the strip...this service was not available one year ago. Overall I would stay here again but I would need to have the upgraded room at a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Complete dump and I think I pissed off the check in lady”
Reviews.Author: lovewell
Reviews.Content: I travel at least twice monthly and I almost always stay in the Hilton family for points/status reasons so when I needed to go to a conference at the Riviera (which is across the street) staying here for between 40-70 bucks a night seemed like a no brainer. Pros: Walkable to the Riviera (convenient for my conference) On the monorail line Cheap 10 property credit per day for declining housekeeping Cons: Didn't get the room I paid for, and got a "revenge" room after saying something Awful rooms, hideously outdated casino Not up to Hilton standards by any stretch of the imagination This is probably the worst hotel I've stayed at this year. I paid for a strip view king bed room and after waiting a while for an elevator to stop at every floor, walking all the way down the hall I go to a double bed room. When I lugged my stuff back downstairs to ask for a King room the lady was snotty but eventually got me into a King room which didn't really have a strip view like the first one (it was probably stupid of me to pay for a view anyway) and was in horrible condition compared to the first room. The room had no toilet paper and had someones pants in the closet like it hadn't really been cleaned. Also by the "renovated rooms" they really mean rooms that haven't been cleaned or updated since 1960 with an LCD tv thrown in them to make them look modern. I think my main frustration was that it wasn't Hilton quality and that I could have stayed somewhere much nicer for about the same price since the economy is horrible and good rates are easy to find virtually everywhere on weekdays. I can say with certainty I will never stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Its a nice place but the old wing is Really Really old!”
Reviews.Author: Our_USA_trip
Reviews.Content: Its a nice place but unfortunately we were in the old Centre WIng.The rooms are huge and the kids had there own seperate room, but so old.I reckon the alarm clock radio was 50 years old and the bathrooms the same.Positives are its excellent value and comfortable.Avoid huge checkin/out lines around 12-3.00 pm and try to get a renovated room in the other wings.Parking is free but internet is not.

Reviews.Title: “your food and entertainment is terrible”
Reviews.Author: proffitt
Reviews.Content: The Mexican Cantina was the only place a guest could get hors d'oeuvres and drink and their t food was terrible so i sent it back and went to Piuzza Hut. Even that pizza was better than the chicken casadilla that tasted like wild game. My room service breakfast wasn't any better. The toast was cold and the omelet over cooked, dry and tasteless. The nice restaurants were almost empty but that would not be the case if you allowed them to serve hors d'oeuvres in their bars while guests waited or congregated after working at the convention hall. You are missing out on a lot of bar and restaurant business for this reason. Every bar adjacent to a restaurant at the Venetian is packed at happy hour after a trade show and all serves snacks and all have a waiting list for dinner with few exceptions. The only reason I might stay there again is the walking distance to the convention center...and then only if I get a $49 a night rate again. the savings on the room was the only saving grace ...that and how nice the employees were. Your employees are very nice and deserve to recognized for it. YOU REALLY NEED LIVE MUSIC AT ONE OF YOUR BARS! YOUR HOTEL HAS NO AMBIANCE TO HOLD PEOPLE THERE TO EAT, DRINK AND GAMBLE. UNLESS ALL THIS CHANGES YOU WILL CONTINUE TO FIND BUSINESS PEOPLE STAY FOR THE LOW ROOM RATE AND GO ELSWHERE TO PARTY AND SPEND MONEY. My husband is coming with me to vacation when I attend the next trade show in February. He prefers to stay at the Venetian or Bellagio. Our bill there for the week is usually 3-7 thousand dollars for 4-5 days as opposed to the $285.00 I spent this week at your hotel. Why? Because we EAT DRINK, DANCE AND GAMBLE at those hotels. Both hotels offer us everything above you do not. Kindest regards, Susan Proffitt Pres. / CEO PSES

Reviews.Title: “So much better than expected”
Reviews.Author: Iloveholidays095
Reviews.Content: I had booked a great deal online for the Las Vegas Hilton, and as our trip got closer the reviews on this site got worse, to the point that I thought if it was bad when we arrived we would simply move hotels. What a pleasent surprise we got. We arrived on a Thursday afternoon, and were in a line of about 4 people to check in. Check in was simple, easy, and done with a smile and we were in our room within 20 mins of arriving at the hotel. Our room was the biggest hotel room I have ever seen. It was on the 18th floor and overlooked the monorail and the front of the hotel. We had a king bed, a big plasma tv, a work desk,and a single arm chair. The bathroom was big enough and had a fantastic shower with great water pressure. Yes the tiles were pink as some other reviews have said, but they were pale pink, not the barbie pink I was almost expecting, and hardly enough to put you off staying there, it's only the bthroom. The hotel is a little away from all the action of the strip and we found this to our liking. We caught the monorail back and forth to the various hotel and came back to swim and relax. The monorail is reliable, runs frequently and best of all is airconditioned. We ate at the hotel buffet once for breakfast and once for dinner. The food was lovely and there was a good variety for both meals. We also ate in the "paradise cafe" one night. The service was a little slower, but the staff here are also somewhat older, but still very friendly. The food was fantastic. The meals were huge, and very cheap. We also used the coffee shop in the foyer to get our morning/evening coffee and tea. The staff there were friendly too. I can highly reccomend the hot sandwiches from here. They were fantastic. We loved the scheme they have rewarding you with a $10 voucher to use in any food and beverage outlet at the hotel if you declined to have your room cleaned. This gave us 1 vouchers to use each day, making the meals even better value. Overall I would recommend this hotel to everyone looking for a hotel that is clean, friendly, and a little out of the strip

Reviews.Title: “A aweful experience”
Reviews.Author: wenden_10
Reviews.Content: please check the account records on time that I called to complain. Woman manager said that she would send up the proper keys to my upgraded room... never happened......had magazines stolen from the pool area .. reported to hotel manager.. offered $15... when I went to front desk... there was no record,,...... when I chevked in they upgraded my room to C 981... told me to come back in 2 hours... I complied... they gave me keys to my other half of the suite... when I got to the room they gave me the keys to 981-C... another tower... not handled well

Reviews.Title: “Medicore At Best”
Reviews.Author: faithmarcus
Reviews.Content: When I checked into the hotel,my room was ready,but the computer system was down, and my keys could not be issued. I waited 45 minutes in the hallway outside my room for security. I had to call the front desk twice to be advised as to the status (I was initially told 5-10 minutes). When I went back to the front desk to get my keys,and notified them as to the inconvenience, I was offered a free drink coupon. Very poor considering the inconvenience. I ate in 3 restaurants, all I would say average in food quality, and two of them high in price. Very comfortable bed, but that was all. There are much better hotels in Las Vegas for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Like so many others, I was here for the...”
Reviews.Author: whenzombiesattack
Reviews.Content: Like so many others, I was here for the MAGIC show. I highly suggest the Hilton on the condition that 1) you are attending an event at the Las Vegas Convention Center and 2) that your purpose is heavily weighed towards business more than pleasure. I don't believe the Hilton positions itself as a party destination like the Hard Rock, so those looking for such a scene will probably be disappointed. For my experience, it was pretty much perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Believe The Bad Reviews - Excellent Stay at LV Hilton!!!”
Reviews.Author: vegasfanNj
Reviews.Content: Ok I was a little worried about the bad reviews of the Las Vegas Hilton but just came back from a three day stay here and was pleasantly surprised. The room was very nice for a standard room and had a nice couch infront of the TV for relaxing. Bed was very comfy and the bathroom was quite nice as well. (Only 1 issue was a little dirty grout in the corner, I'm not picky and this didnt bother me). My first night I had a subpar room but I checked in late and the Star Trek convention was in town. They promply moved me in the morning to the NICE room and that is what I am reviewing here. Had a great view on the 29th floor overlooking the Stratosphere tower. I booked a promo getting 6 free buffets and the buffet was very good. Dinner buffet had all the shrimp cocktail you could eat (already shelled). Breakfast buffet had nice selection and very good omelettes. The hotel really shines however in the staff, especially security guard Wayne. He made our stay terrific. Saw us playing the .25 cent Elvis machines and continued to take us on a behind the scenes tour of where Elvis played and told us some great stories. Wayne is an asset to the Las Vegas Hilton and really gave the hotel a personal touch. Thanks again Wayne we'll see you next time when we visit Vegas. Even the valet is quick and one of the gentlemen forgot his name made us laugh everytime, sometimes as the expense of the Star Trek visitors but hysterrical nonetheless. Great time at Las Vegas Hilton and would definetely stay again. Just an FYI (I am a seasoned Las Vegas visitor and have stayed nearly everywhere on the strip) On this strip I also stayed at The Palazzo and TheHotel so when I give a place 5 stars Im not comparing it to CircusCircus or anything. For its price point this place is a great choice.

Reviews.Title: “Surprisinly had the best time in Vegas at this hotel...had all we wanted so didn't have to leave.”
Reviews.Author: Travelers1371
Reviews.Content: Must visit Benehannas...great food and Tres Rios where they have the best nachos and drinks.

Reviews.Title: “3 stars hotel? Even Motel 6 has a refrigerator in room.”
Reviews.Author: tylee831
Reviews.Content: The room is awfully simple; does not even have a refrigerator in the room. Motel 6 seems to have better room than the one I stayed with cheaper price. I booked the room through the Internet with a package special price, but the front desk did not know the package at all and still charged me the full price for both nights. Even though I got a package special price, I still don’t think the money I paid is worth the deal.

Reviews.Title: “Served its purpose”
Reviews.Author: Helen1313
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights here before starting our road trip and 1 night 3 weeks later before we set off back home. First day room was very dusty and smelt of smoke even though we had specifically requested no smoking, spoke to front desk and they changed our room right away, got a much nicer room, used the green option and recieved a 10 dollar voucher to spend in resort. The whole hotel smells of smoke as soon as you walk in due to casinos allowing smoking, the smell seems to permeate through the whole hotel. We had arranged by phone to store our luggage at hotel for the 3 weeks we would be away, pick up again on our return, no problem we were told. When we came to leave luggage they didnt want to do it, it took approximately 1 hour to sort out but they eventually agreed. Having said all of these negatives, credit to staff they did sort out problems, monorail station in hotel so you can get straight to strip, water in room was expensive at 4 dollars a bottle but thats cheap compared to some hotels, The last night we stayed after our trip went without a hitch, clean room, lovely room, vey comfy bed, wet room, lovely.

Reviews.Title: “Really bad service and very over priced”
Reviews.Author: KiwiTrek
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed here in August to attend the Star Trek convention that was held here. Firstly the check-in line was long (even when we went past after midnight people would often be lined up for up to 10 minutes) and watching the staff interact with other customers was terrible - there was eye rolling, plenty of huffing and puffing, repeating things like you would to a child, etc. SO RUDE! Service over the phone was just as bad if not worse. No one went out of their way to be helpful, and if you asked for help or reported a problem they were very dismissive. After recounting our stories to other people at the convention they all had similar stories and many had long ago refused to stay at the Las Vegas Hilton again (the convention has actually been moved away from the Hilton next year to everyones relief). Also be careful with rates as I was charged $75 more than originally quoted and this had already been taken off my credit card before I had even arrived! Plus you get NOTHING included in your room rate and everything is extra (even the safe!!!) - no free breakfast or internet here - despite the high room rate. We upgraded to a "Superior room with Strip view" and were pleased with the room itself, although if it was "Superior" then I dread to think how basic their normal rooms are (this is one of the most expensive hotels I have ever stayed in and I was disapointed to find it was more basic than the mid-priced motels I stay at here in NZ!!!). The beds were incredibly comfortable though and the room was quiet which allowed us to get a good nights sleep which I guess was the main thing. Also the curtains blocked out 100% of the sunlight which is a must when living the nocturnal Vegas lifestyle! There were maintenance issues though with the toilet (although this was fixed quickly) and the TV internet system did not work and this was not rectified despite frequest requests (oh well we saved ourselves the ridiculous $14 a day fee). The view was very pretty but you couldn't see anything of the main features of the strip. This was my first time in Vegas so it was worth the extra money but next time the view won't factor in to my choice of hotel. We ate quite a bit at the hotel and really really enjoyed both the buffet and the Benihana restaurant. There were also small cafes and a Pizza Hut which were handy for food on the run. Overall I thought there was a good selection of restaurants and shops. And when you ran out of things to do there the monorail was very handy for getting to the strip hotels. So normally I would have rated this hotel higher but considering the very high price we paid, the really really poor service EVERY customer seemed to receive and the huge number of other options in town I could not recommend this hotel to anyone and will not stay here again when I come back to Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “I've stayed in better/cleaner hotels”
Reviews.Author: cocolinu
Reviews.Content: Stayed here one night Pros: *VIP Check-in and Buffet Serving (Hilton Member that is) *Yummy breakfast buffet *Conveniently located on the monorail route *Very cheap: 45$/night Cons: *22nd floor room was super dusty (about 2 inches or more of dust everywhere on the carpet). As soon as you made one move in the room, dust will start flying everywhere; and I do mean EVERYWHERE *Were charged 1$/collect call; now how does that one work? *Were greeted by either one of the following: super dirty-stinky socks, a skunk that got loose in the hallways, or someone smoking marijuana a few rooms down from us *Tinny bathroom *No hairdrier It may be cheap (or just got lucky to get it this cheap) but we won't stay here again. Upon returning to LAS a few days later, we stayed at the Renaissance just minutes down from the Hilton. A step in the right direction, but not perfect either.

Reviews.Title: “best sportsbook in town”
Reviews.Author: mazeandblue
Reviews.Content: I visited the Hilton sportsbook two or three times a day on my trip a week ago. They have the best sportsbook in town in my opinion. They don't require drink tickets. They just want you to show a betting ticket to get a drink. The odds on a majority of the bets are the best I noticed in town. If you're gambling on sporting events, this is the place to make the bets.

Reviews.Title: “What a dump :(”
Reviews.Author: sakcee
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a shame on the name of hilton, I usually stay at the signature at MGM, This is the first time I stayed here as a conference was being held in this hotel. It was not worth it. I asked fo rthe renovated room, but the service clerk still gave me old room, the paint on the bed was falling off. bath room was small and not comfortable. Food is bad. I tried the breakfast buffet , it was worse than strip buffets. At checkout they didnt let me do a late checkout. On top of it they wanted to give me a deal so that I can pay them $100 now and come back anytime next year. what a _ucking rip-off. I would never stay there again, stay at strip , take mono-rail here if you have to. bad , rude staff.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay at the Las Vegas Hilton if you're used to quality hotels.”
Reviews.Author: erstrucking
Reviews.Content: When we checked into the Las Vegas Hilton, we had high hopes of staying in a quality hotel with quality services provided, afterall, isn't that what Vegas is all about? Check in went ok, just a bit "cold" since there was no "Welcome to the Las Vegas Hilton" feeling from any of the staff. We went to our room... the "Grand" room... HAHA not so grand. Although it was large & spacious there was nothing grand about it. At this point I thought maybe I am just a bit spoiled, I am used to very nice things... then I used the bathroom. That's when I found pubic hairs in the bath tub... yupp... I was totally disgusted. My husband & I are very clean people & decided to wash out the bath tub & continue with our vacation. So we went down to the Casino... I played $1 slots & my husband played the tables.... Not one time was I offered a drink from any of the cocktail servers... So I thought maybe if I hit the $5 slots I will get some service.... NOPE. Not once was I offered a drink. Alomst a thousand dollars later I was pretty angry, so I gathered up my husband (who had been offered 2 drinks) and we went to another casino where I sat at a slot machine for MAYBE 5 minutes and was offered a cocktail right away. After a long night of gambling, we turned in for the night. We paid for the "Breakfast" deal with our room so the next morning we headed down to "The Buffet" (the ONLY place in the hotel that our "free breakfast" was available). The food was "ok" some of it, however, was NOT edible. Saturday night we decided to order room service, a romantic dinner in our room. I ordered the 10 oz. Ribeye steak dinner with mashed potatoes. The steak was DISGUSTING! My husband is NOT a picky eater and even he said it was awful! So after paying $32 for my plate, the ONLY thing on the plate that was edible was the mashed potatoes, I do reccommend them... they were great. Checking out of the hotel we found that the room rate was "increased due to the hotel being totally booked" so we ended up paying $75.00 a night more for our pubic infested room than we had originally thought. I will NEVER set foot into the Las Vegas Hilton ever again. We spent several thousand dollars in this hotel and received ZERO service, the food was terrible, the room was not what we expected & DIRTY by anyone's standards. We had a TERRIBLE expierience here and would advise others to stay away from the Hilton!!

Reviews.Title: “Screwed up our reservation in a good way.”
Reviews.Author: MTWiley
Reviews.Content: They messed up and gave away our room, but wound up upgrading our room for free to an Executive Suite on a floor that didn't allow kids (which is nice when you don't have any like us). It was the most amazing room that I have ever stayed in, Full Bar, Dining Room, Living Room, 1.5 Bathrooms(1 Shower, 1 Hot Tub, 2 Toilets, His and Her Sinks) Huge Bedroom with Automatic Everything. Right next to the Monorail which made it really easy to get around even though traffic in Vegas is terrible especially during Conventions like CES and DefCon both of which I've attended and the monorail made life so much simpler. I'm going back in a few weeks and will definitely be staying at there again and I would recommend it to anyone else visiting Las Vegas. Also they offer a 2 for 1 on their Buffet if you're a Foursquare User and if you're a mayor anywhere it's completely free, just talk to the nice people at the players club.

Reviews.Title: “Don't let them put you by the elevator!”
Reviews.Author: Eve529
Reviews.Content: This was my third visit to the LV Hilton. I stay here once a year for a conference, and the service was bad enough that I may stay elsewhere next year. The check-in line took nearly an hour, and once I did check in there was some pressure to upgrade my room. I was adamant and said no, I just need a nice quite room, I'll not be spending much time in it. The room they assigned to me was 1900. Beware if your room ends in 00! 1900 was adjacent to the elevators! It was so loud in the room that I called to ask for a room switch and I could hardly hear the clerk on the phone over the mechanical elevator noise. The clerk told me they didn't have a single room in my price category except a handicapped room. Fine. Anything is better than the elevator room. The kicker is that I had to schlep all of my stuff back down to the lobby and wait in another line for 25 minutes just to get the new key! (This time I got to wait in the VIP line, which was slightly shorter, but far too long considering the aggravation I had been through.) I've been in a similar situation at a couple of other hotels that were running short on certain rooms types and both other times I was upgraded to a slightly better room for the inconvenience I had been put through. At LV Hilton, no upgrade, no apology, just another line. The real kicker was that I had an hour off from my conference that I was using to check in, and I ended up being late and missing an important session. I explained that I was in a hurry to the clerk on the phone and asked if I could switch rooms later, but I was told, no, I couldn't leave my bag in the room and switch later. Suffice it to say, I did not feel values. I felt like one of a heard of cattle being chuffed in-and-out to keep hotel volume up. The Hilton staff gives lip-service to the hospitality ideal, but they fall short of it when you actually need them to help. I expressed my disappointment to two desk clerks and both spoke calmly but had a look in their eyes that said "what the heck do you want me to do about it can you see that this place is an overbooked zoo?" I honestly felt a little sorry for them. Most hotels go out of their way to make you happy because each individual guest matters. At LV Hilton is seems like more of a numbers game, and then can afford to treat some customers poorly. It could have been my timing, but there were also some really obnoxious intoxicated guests in the elevators. A few girls were antagonizing a woman who was alone in the elevator. It didn't get too bad, but I've never witnessed that at another Vegas Strip hotel and it left an impression about the changing clientele of the LV Hilton. I might also add not only must you pay for wi-fi, but the use of the in-room safe was an extra $3.50 (but nobody told me (no sign either) that until I had already used the in-room safe.) I considered fighting the charge, but it wasn't worth my time to wait in another line. If you do stay here, be sure to ask exactly where your room is at the check-in counter, and beware of getting nickeled and dimed. I'm pretty soured on the Hilton experience for now, and I'm warning my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Not the usual Hilton Standard”
Reviews.Author: blaze_03
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel at 12am and had to wait in line to register. As a Hilton Honors member I did have a shorter wait then other people. The welcome was not what I am used to but we got our room. The room seemed very nice although not the junior sweet we had signed up for as they didn't have any available. It turned out that the air conditioner was broken and the toilet seat hadn't been cleaned. The next morning we waited in line to ask for a new room and they said we would have the same style room but it wouldn't be ready until later in the day. When we came back from shopping at 4pm we got in line again to get our keys. Another less than warm welcome from the front desk. We went up to the our new room and found that it was smaller, the mirror in the bath was hanging off the wall and the ceiling vent was dirty and falling down. I called downstairs to explain the issue and I was told that they didn't have the larger room available and they would send up new keys for the room we would move to. We moved into our 3rd room and it was fine. However the next day the toilet backed up and it took them over 2 hours to respond to our call. It was the maid service that finally was able to get someone up to fix it. HOWEVER-- In fairness we had two other families traveling with us and neither of them had any problems with their rooms. The floor above ours was being renovated. I was advised they do not guarantee satisfaction. That is only available from the Hampton Inn. I guess we just had some bad luck. Otherwise the casino was nice, the rest of the hotel appeared clean, the publice restrooms were spotless and the buffet breakfast was really good. The line for the buffet was at times very long, but if you are an Honors member you get a shorter line. Food was good, hot, with plenty of variety. We had coupons so it was free. We picked this Hilton property because of the fact that it has the monorail stopping at the hotel. Be prepared to walk far everytime you use the monorail. It is always in the back of the hotels at each stop and you have to walk through mazes to find the entrance. If you don't want to drive or pay for cabs it is available as an alternavie and It is clean and not crowded. I was disappointed in the response to our room issues by the front desk staff. They have 3,000 rooms and they responded as if it is a normal occurance to have to move as often as we did. I would pick a different Hilton property next time.

Reviews.Title: “it is ok.”
Reviews.Author: noname60864
Reviews.Content: there isn't free internet access, this service is to expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Usually GOOD Pricing, Caution when AT CAPACITY, THOUGH!!!”
Reviews.Author: FINDERSKEEPERS1
Reviews.Content: As a Hilton Honors GOLD Member as is usually well. On this last stay on the 3rd Floor on my way to the pool, you could smell a "Skunk" smoky smell in the hallways which my husband says is Marijuana. The bathrooms are cleaned TOO QUICKLY with quality not on the priority list, but more so volume! I always take my Clorox Spray to disinfect the knobs and bathrooms and would suggest that YOU DO, TOO! A few months ago I stayed at the Hilton Garden in far away from the strip closer to the airport, and the rooms were SUPER CLEAN--the linen and the bathrooms smelled like they were washed in bleach!! The Las Vegas Hilton on Paradise road usually lures me there with great specials like 2 Night Stays with 6 Buffets, Discounts on the Restaurants and gift shops--all for $115.00. That is the ONLY reason why I am willing to bring my own CLOROX!!!

Reviews.Title: “Be aware of Bait and switch”
Reviews.Author: sharonarmao
Reviews.Content: Checked in and was told my suite ($149, great deal) had been canceled because the credit card on my husbands Hilton Honors account had expired (untrue). They sent an e-mail a few months ago saying the card had expired but when I phoned the hotel directly. I was told they had the reservation and the credit card on file was correct and up to date . When I checked in the clerk had to rebook the reservation in a regular room since they were "sold out." I said I did not want a bad room and that I wanted an upgrade to an executive room, which I did get. I was looking forward to a suite so it was very disappointing and felt scammed. I feel that they didn't want to give me a suite for only $149.00 per night, and that they canceled it on purpose. They knew they screwed up because they did rebook us into a regular room on the 9th floor. Every time I stay here I am always disappointed in some way or another. I stay here every August for the Star Trek convention and because we are Hilton Honors members but this particular hotel follows their own rules.

Reviews.Title: “Great place with Monorail access to Strip”
Reviews.Author: OklahomaMidwest
Reviews.Content: Was a great stay...Im a Diamond Member and it was like they rolled out the red carpet for me. They have a private VIP lounge where Diamonds can check in and out, go in an grab a beer or soda from the cooler free of charge, have a cookie or nuts also free. The rooms are quite big ( designed from the 70s ) vs some rooms these days. Service is great, the rates depending on dates are cheaper then motel 6. On this stay alone, my rate was 36 per night, yes 36 and that was AAA rate. The buffet is awesome, seperate line for Hilton Honor members to check in and bypass the long line. ( unfortunately some cant read and try to get in this line and they are nicely told they have to go in the other line....hey thats what perks are for ) Great service from dealers and pit bosses, alot of pretty ladies around as well. All in all a great location on the monorail line....

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: grammy83
Reviews.Content: When reserving the room I requested a smoking room. Upon arrival I again specified a smoking room. Twice. The agent assured me that the room was a smoking room. When we got to our room there were no ashtrays so my husband asked the maid to please bring one. Luckily we went downstairs and at the elevator on our floor (23) it said this is a non smoking floor. I went to the front desk and inquired as to why this happened. The agent said they could move us. I did not feel like packing up again after travel time of a 5 hour flight, and another 2 of getting to the airport and then the rental car in Vegas. My stay consisted of arising in the morning, making my coffee( brought a 4 cup pot) since there are none in the rooms, showering and then going downstairs to have my cigarette in the space lounge area.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay at the Hilton”
Reviews.Author: Dawn52
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hilton 7/21-7/24. I didn't know at the time it was the basket ball tournament weekend. Lots of big 7' kids running around the halls. It was elementary through high school. Some regular size kids too. Imagine walking down the hall hearing all this tramping of kids wearing the same jersey's and athletic shoes with duffel bags slung around their shoulders. It was taking place at the convention center next door. Lucky me. Had never stayed at the Hilton and the rates were good. I had visited once to see the Star Trek experience. It's mostly gone now. Quark's bar is still there. A lot of Star Trek decorations still there. The rooms were very nice, clean and large. Had a view of the Stratosphere and downtown Vegas. Didn't know what the buildings were until I saw the Plaza lit up. Only saw something dangling off the Stratosphere once. Too hot for jumping. I like the no bedspread look. The bed was comfortable. The walls were a little thin. I could hear those big kids having fun running down the hall enjoying the echos. The buffet was very crowded with families. There were no coupons for buffets. I did get in on the green choice, not to have the room made up every day gets you a $10 coupon for food anywhere on the property. I don't need the maid to make up the bed and change the towels every day. I had half-price buffets. I found the food everywhere to be very expensive. I also thought the Hilton was smaller than I thought it was. I guess I thought the convention area was part of the hotel. I have a car so driving wasn't bad if you take Paradise and other back roads to the strip. I took the monorail once, which has lower prices then a few years ago. Still not very handy as it is far from the hotels in the heat. Parking once you figure out where you are was good. The pool is very nice on the thrid floor. Went to the Friday pool party and it was gridlock to get down to the rooms. I do like to look around so I remembered another elevator the pool crowd didn't know about a few more steps down the hall. No waiting. Saw Love. It was so good. Sort of put my mind on vacation for a while down memory lane. Just two rows above the special effect. I would see that again. The Revolution bar was packed after that. It looked funny seeing people sitting in the Revolution letters like a commercial for the show. Saw Aria, very nice, and Chrystals mall. Another expensive shopping center with tourist milling around looking at it and no one in the stores or restaurants. How long will the mall attached to Casino's last. I guess I'm not a high roller. On the other hand the Outlet Mall on the South strip was very busy. I think the no buffet idea at New York is good. So many choices in the New York food section. Another hotel to ad to my list.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced completely”
Reviews.Author: SarahBrTyu
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for 2 nights and it was the worst experience ever! The stuff is rude, the room is ok but they had no hair dryer and show gel... We were staying at New York New York and we had even lysterine inside so not having basic essantials and paid 130 for the room is very dissapointing. The dining is limited . In the morning you have to pay at least $ 6 for a cup of tee ... And I forgot to mention you will find 2 bottles of water in your room, if you drink them they will charge you $4 each ... Be ready to get a bunch of non working anywhere coupons. Very dissappoiting you feel like everyone is trying to suck out your money !!!! Be prepared to live with your neighbors, you can hear kids crying and tv in from both of your neighbors.

Reviews.Title: “Monorail stop outside the door”
Reviews.Author: Rod100
Reviews.Content: OK, it does take a few minutes to get to the strip, but it is away from the craziness. Our room was as expected, clean spacious, and reasonably luxurious for the money. Directions to the self park garage were easy enough to follow and check in was also quick and easy.

Reviews.Title: “Just okay.”
Reviews.Author: lilsprstr
Reviews.Content: We stayed here because we had a Hilton Honors card and thought we may as well accumulate some additional points. It wasn't a bad place, but if I was going to Vegas again I'd stay somewhere else. The hotel is very smoky (but most hotels with Casinos were). We ate at a restaurant at The Renaissance and their hotel was non-smoking, which was nice. The Hilton was also extremely crowded and loud. I'm not sure if it would be the same on a weekday. The room itself was nice. We paid for an upgraded room and I was pleased with it. We also had a nice view from our room. The bed was very comfortable and the bedding was nice. The towels, however were not very soft and the shower head was extremely low and sprayed really hard. We were given the option of not having our sheets and towels changed for a day, and it return were given $10 to spend in the hotel. I liked the idea, so we did that. I thought they would at least come in and make the bed and clean up, they did not. We got no service at all. The $10 credit originally said it could be used in any food venue or shop, but it turned out to only be good for food and drink. We also were given a free breakfast with our reservation, but the line for the buffet at breakfast was outrageous! We skipped it on the first day because we didn't feel like waiting. We did go on the second day and it was okay. It would have been nice to be given instructions on how to redeem the free breakfast though because there was a cashier at he front charging $18.99 per person and we certainly weren't going to pay that. The food was good, but I would've preferred more breakfast food and less dinner food. It was a full buffet. The hotel was a little too far from the strip. I originally thought maybe we'd just take the Monorail to the strip, but the monorail tickets were $12/day pp, or $5/ride, which I thought was pretty high. We ended up driving to the strip, but the traffic was so bad that we ended up spending a lot of extra time sitting in the car. Maybe if it was cooler outside we would walk it, but it was very hot! I didn't use it, but I thought the fact that they charged $20 for the use of the gym was crazy! They really find every little thing to nickel and dime you for. $4 for a bottle of water, $3 for the use of the room safe, etc.

Reviews.Title: “This carcinogenic cesspool was more like a Motel 6 with a shiny facade ...”
Reviews.Author: PhDad
Reviews.Content: "Be my guest" ... if your idea of elegance is a registration line filled with wannabees dressed in "wife-beaters" smoking camels and drinking budweiser. There wasn't a smoke-free inch in this hotel. The rooms on the non-smoking floors smelled OK until you would turn off the A/C, and then the stale smoke smell would creep in. This place got everything wrong from start to finish, and they just frankly didn't seem to care about it one way or another ... we were assigned a room that was a step down from what we reserved ... we were told we could change rooms in several hours after one was cleaned for us (it was already 6 PM) ... we elected to stay put, but they agreed to provide an refrigerator for the room (standard with the room we had booked) ... they promptly delivered a fridge that spent 3 days seeking to achieve a temperature somewhere between cool and tepid ... the tv channel guide in the room was not even close to accurate ... the hotel guide said that free internet service was available in the coffee/wine shop -- but when I went down to use it I found that it was not free -- again, the information was outdated. We were traveling with young children, it was 100+ outside, the kids knew the hotel had a pool and were really looking forward to a swim -- but disappointment again! The pool was a 21 and over party every evening -- no kids allowed. And it closes at 8 PM (standard for hotels on the strip, I'm told -- great for getting adults into the casinos ... but for kids?) As for the cigarette smoke, our whole family was hacking by the time we left. This facility makes no effort whatsoever to separate smoking areas for the comfort of their guests. Apparently they also have no concern for the health of children. Their staff told me that their hotel was "focusing more and more on adult guests," but yet they were a host hotel for several youth sporting events during our stay. Most hotels seem to care if your stay doesn't meet your expectations. This one just didn't. Their website should carry a "NOT RECOMMENDED FOR CHILDREN" warning. Unless, of course, you prefer for your kids to swim in cigarette smoke rather than pools. I'll never stay here again. If you're traveling with a family, I recommend you stay on the outskirts of Vegas and venture onto the strip on your own terms, rather than immersing yourself in it 24/7. You're more likely to find a smoke-free hotel, as well as one that actually appreciates your patronage. You and Vegas will both be happier.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Value, Lovely Breakfast, Monorail station, Shops, Casino-Great!”
Reviews.Author: Williwillinui
Reviews.Content: First, it is important to note that I did not want to stay at a hotel right on the strip. I didn't want to deal with the extra cost and loud people. This hotel is near the strip with the monorail conveniently located at the hotel for easy access to the strip (12 dollars for a day pass). There are several restaurants on-site of varying price ranges as well as budget-savvy options like a Fortuna (little bistro with wine) and Pizza Hut. I got a great deal: 117 dollar including breakfast for 2 at the buffet. The buffet had almost limitless options, ranging from vast varieties of cake, hearty breakfast foods like potatoes and sausage, salmon, oriental noodles, mac&cheese, lobster, etc. The casino was a bit rowdy, and had scantily dressed dancers and several security guards. The parking is either valet or in a covered parking structure that is free. I enjoyed the convenience of getting to the hotel. From the 15th floor we could see some of the high-rise hotels, the pool, and tennis courts. My main complaint is smoking was allowed in the casino-which also meant cigarette butts were everywhere. The slot machines had wine glass and cigarettes all over them.

Reviews.Title: “It's "OK"”
Reviews.Author: revecz
Reviews.Content: Some of the hotel "theme" bars etc. seemed out-dated. Whole first floor could use some renovation. I found the casino staff to be either surly or disinterested. That's why I gamble at other sites. I know it must be a boring job at times but a little energy and enthusiasm might add some fun to the gambling experience. At other resorts I felt that I was being treated as a valued guest but at the Hilton I felt as if I was just another body to be "dealt with." I think the entire staff could use some "guest relations" training. Oddly enough, the person who went out of her way for me was the housekeeping attendant. Also, charging for internet service in this day and age is an outrage-or at least make the fee nominal.

Reviews.Title: “Like "Going Green"? This option is an excellent choice.”
Reviews.Author: MKnesel
Reviews.Content: We liked the option of not having housekeeping come in to change linens and towels. The $10 per day credit was a nice incentive for us to make our own beds and use towels more than once. We would have liked to have been able to use the $10 credit we received each day toward all purchases in the hotel, not just food. I believe coffee makers should be included in all rooms at no extra charge. This is my only complaint that coffee makers are an extra charge in the low-end rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Price Was Right”
Reviews.Author: SJaneSeattle_WA
Reviews.Content: Hilton Honors member got nicer room than co-workers. Refurbished room was clean and updated. Happy with accommodations. Adjoining room door (strangers) provided early moring carousing noise and subsequent hangover woes. Would rather not have been awakened by that! Bedding comfortable and room pleasant. Co-workers had some nasty rooms - so be sure to ask for refurbished. This is a large facility and a long walk to anywhere. Cafe was just so-so. This is a convention hotel and I would not stay here unless the price was right and there was a business need. Remember if you are an Honors member, you get in the special line at the breakfast buffet. I had to jump ahead of the gray foxes at breakfast who were slowly considering each item on the buffet line. Others followed suit and if you are friendly about this - just go in for the items you want rather than waiting for a long time in line behind. Cabs were easy and airport ride was fast. Better than NY NY.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed with the Hilton brand/image”
Reviews.Author: abdul100
Reviews.Content: Booked this via British Airways holiday service about 2 months previoulsy for 4 nights as the end of a 2 week touring trip holiday. We would be arriving on Saturday 3rd July. Having stayed at other Hiltons throughout the world, I was expecting a decent standard. Was I wrong! When we arrived, there was a huge queue at reception for check in where my family and I waited for about 30 minutes. There were only 2 people at check-in on a busy 4 July holiday weekend. When we checked in, we were told the 2 bedded room we had booked wasn't available ( we have 2 kids and this was now 8.30pm!!) and could we take an "upgraded room" for one night and they would provide a rollaway bed. After a 5.5 hour drive from San Diego I said we would go with that. When we got to our room, I found s smallish room with one double bed and 1 rollaway arrived about 30 mins later. When I queried this and said that I only had space for 3 people, I was asked if one of the kids could use the sofa!! Needless to say I wasn't happy with that and, miraculously, after a brief phone call to front desk they managed to find a suitable room on the 29th floor within seconds. That room was best described as reasonable. There were hardly any lights, the decor was dated, the safe didn't work to start with and the carpet was dirty. According to other guests at the hotel, the 29th floor was the "exclusive" floor! I would have hated to see the rest of the rooms. In a Hilton I expect certain standard which includes cleanliness. I was also amazed that there was no fridge, no doubt to make you buy their overpriced drinks downstairs. To top it all they tried to charge me $5/night for use of the safe which I strongly refused to do. They waived that charge. We stayed at the Hilton at Los Angeles airport for one night before our flight back and it was a million times better with great staff, clean rooms etc. Don't go to the LV Hilton. There must be better out there!

Reviews.Title: “Hilton is acceptable for exhibitions”
Reviews.Author: juvo
Reviews.Content: The Hilton was the right choice for the exhibition in the convention center. A 10 minute walk in the morninig is acceptable. If possible book or upgrade to a renovated room. The others became of age and are not recommended. The breakfast buffet was substantial and on the weekend pimped up with sparkling wine. The pole dancers in the casino area is questionable.

Reviews.Title: “A DUMP!”
Reviews.Author: EdinburghGraemekidd
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for the 1st time. It was July 4th weekend and hotel was full. The hotel is outdated and tired. Go-Go dancers in the hotel lobby bar,no decent places to eat except a Pizza Hut! The staff appeared not interested. The swimming pool was FILTHY and I mean filthy it was an absolute disgrace.
