The room had 2 connecting doors so was very noisey,could hear full conversations from neighbours. The room it's self was clean. If you are visiting Las Vegas look else where,there are Far better hotels in far better locations. This is definately "Trailor Park" Hotel!

Reviews.Title: “(Almost) Perfect for a business trip”
Reviews.Author: SDNative73
Reviews.Content: I stay at the Hilton quite often for my frequent business trips to Vegas. As a Hilton Honors member, I like the benefits I get for staying at the Hilton. And my company appreciates the money I save with my free breakfast buffets and spa usage. Not to mention the great rates the Hilton has been offering for the past year. I also enjoy the Hilton because it's off the Strip and is easier to get in and out than those busy hotels on the Strip. The parking is convenient, too--perfect for getting in and out. The food and restaurants are good, too. The only downside of the Hilton is the gym. It's WAY too small for the size of the hotel and the number of people that tend to use the gym, particularly the business travelers in the early morning and evening. Other than that, it's a fantastic place to stay, for a business or personal trip.

Reviews.Title: “Upon check in I was greeted by the most...”
Reviews.Author: Lonerider21
Reviews.Content: Upon check in I was greeted by the most helpful and delightful staff member at the front desk, his name was Randy. He was very pleasant and answered all my questions as if I was his top priority and made me feel very welcome. The room was excellent and better than I had imagined. Five Stars for sure, we had a blast in Vegas especially at the Blackjack Tables. We will be coming back next month, and I recommend the Las Vegas Hilton as the place to stay off the noise of the strip but close enough to enjoy the view.

Reviews.Title: “good value for the price. Treat their diamonds right”
Reviews.Author: jamesteroh
Reviews.Content: This hotel is old and outdated. I was given a renovated room when I checked in as an upgrade and even that room was kind of outdated. I was in the north tower which is near the monorail. Most monorail stops you have to walk through an entire casino to get on to the strip. It was nice taking the elevator down and having a short walk to it. I really didn't mind the location since it was on the monorail. One thing I ahte about hotel checks in for LV is typically there are long lines. If you are a diamond member of HHonors you can use the VIP lounge to check in off to the left. There was no waiting at all. You also get the breakfast buffet as your breakfast which is great and the really nice thing is you can use the VIP line so not waiting if you are a diamond. . You can also use the VIP as a diamond for the one cafe, even if you never have spent a penny gambling in the hotel. Was also nice having the two free (and very large) bottles of water. One other nice thing for HHonors members is that you can chose free internet for your my way for that hotel. I was told all diamond and golds get complimentary breakfast regardless of the my way benefit (even though I got an upgrade). I only gambled at their casino one day and the blackjack dealer did have an attitude and the casino is dated, but the ladies who do drinks were great about coming around freqnuenlty and they are generous with the alcohol. I liked the pool and spa as well, but the amount of equipment in teh fitness center was minimal. If the monorail wasn't there, I probably wouldn't recomend the hotel. If you are a diamond member I would definetly recomend this hotel. The breakfast buffet, free use of the spa and the free internet almost pay for the room right there.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid the pool after kids hours”
Reviews.Content: We went to this third floor swimming pool in late afternoon. We were suspicious when no one was in the water, as we showed our room key to the entrance to the obvious student summer job looking kids they kept chit chatting each other did not say anything. As we approached the water other lifeguard on the tower said " The pools is closed right now , someone threw up." The water surface was covered with the sun screen oil/grease and other substance like Santa Monica Bay or Jamaica Bay after the rain. I have an experience as a life guard for three years where they played water polo in the Olympic Games, when this happens, we were forced to empty the water and refill as someone have accident with the heavy stuff. After 11pm, it is hard to get the cocktail waitress near the sports book machines. The biggest reason to stay there is the least expensive to earn Hilton Honors points in Vegas with the casino. When the room rates this low, some people always talk for long time in the hall way either with person or cell phones. The glory of Vegas Hilton with the past legendary management team is lost forever. The good about the casino is still having a little older slots and keno machines as well as penny video poker machines. When you go dine at the Teru Sushi located withing the Benihana Village, do not order the Chirashi, instead order the Nigiri, Nigiri was prepared by Shuichi, famous chef but chirashi was done by Mr. Kondo who used owned and operated Kifune restaurant near the intersection of Rancho and Charleston then Hakase Restaurant at 3900 Paradise Rd., and he is the alumina of old Benihaha meaning he is not real sushi chef. Don't get me wrong he is still a nice guy. With the silver or above in the Hilton Hornors and enough gaming history would get you in the better room than you reserved every time. If the operator The Resort International gets serious to make more money, they would need the major renovation than face lift, but I like old Vegas was better, so I would leave as is.

Reviews.Title: “TOO FAR FROM STRIP”
Reviews.Author: Elmo1004
Reviews.Content: the big problem with all the hotels in vegas are that they are so huge and it takes half an hour just to get to the casino! the bigger problem with the hilton is that they are off the strip so it takes an hour and taxi ride to get on to the strip! Just pay the extra 20 bucks and stay on the STRIP! probably will come out cheaper if you count the taxi rides!!! The rooms are nice and clean, but just not worth the extra time...

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms but not close to anything.”
Reviews.Author: KLEwing
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 4 nights because the convention we were attending was next door at the Convention Center. We did not have a choice of where to stay. Had we had a choice, we would have stayed somewhere on the Strip and taken the monorail over. To me, location in Vegas is important and the Hilton isn't close to anything. There were two nice things about this hotel, the rooms and the pool. We reserved one of the larger regular rooms. It was larger and nicer than the rooms at the Excalibur and NYNY but not as nice as the Venetian. And it had a fridge in the room. It also cost us twice what our room at NYNY cost us. Given how little time we spent in the room, I didn't think the extra space was worth the extra money. Drawbacks other than location: old casino, the restaurants were expensive, and the staff didn't seem to be happy at all. Also, even though it is next to the Convention Center, it still took us 15 minutes to get from our room to the main hall of the CC, and you have to go outside.

Reviews.Title: “Only in Vegas and this hotel for an event”
Reviews.Author: carameliz
Reviews.Content: I didn't want to go to Vegas to begin with.....done it once, and that was good enough. However, a big event I wanted to attend that is normally in LA was at this hotel this year. We were upgraded without asking by a very friendly front desk person. Yet, I would've hated to see the classic room. Our room was a strip view room. It was comfortable enough for our short stay, but dated with peeling wallpaper and a rusted tub. Whoever on here said that the shower is made for someone 5ft and under or whatever, was not exaggerating. If you aren't a good limbo dancer, you'll be hurting to wash your hair. Speaking of hair, there was hair in our tub upon arrival....yuck! Most of the staff was friendly, and it is on the monorail line. Bed was pretty comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “This experience was horrible”
Reviews.Author: sagi_900
Reviews.Content: I must say that usually when, I travel to Vegas, I like to stay at the Hilton. Ive been going there now for 5 years of so.... But I have to say that their service has been getting sloppy.... I had made a reservation, and at check in, they didnt have our room ready... They had to offer us a Handicap room... which we ended up takin beacuse they werent even sure if they were going to have a reagular rooms ready for us... They we get to the room and we discover the shower was broken. When we called the front desk they had us running around to the other side of the entire towert with luggage and all.. We get there and the room is filled with personal items, as if someone was occupying the room... I go downstair to the front desk and they claim they dont show the room occupied??????? That in itself is very weird... All they did was apologize and give us two free buffets... This was my worst experience ever!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “terrible service...too bad they didnt remodel management”
Reviews.Author: humbleNRG
Reviews.Content: is a robe a luxury item? staying in one of the new remodeled suites...made 4 calls into 2 to the general mgr...told only the resort rooms are eligible for robe..no return calls to follow up even though promised by everyone from housekeeping to GM..no one could CARE LESS. and the "new" bath tub had a weird crack/hole in that looked like a giant bug was in it...scary!! apparently even things like a $10 coffee pot or an extra box of tissues (mine had two left) are considered super luxury too. and forgot about two people staying in the room...one tiny closet with 6 hangers... the location is terrible....isolated and remote...and the lobby/casino/stores have all the ambiance of a half empty strip mall with a 24 liquor store.. it may be cheap....but there are better deals

Reviews.Title: “This place is kind of ghetto, which I...”
Reviews.Author: LilOrbity
Reviews.Content: This place is kind of ghetto, which I didn't expect at all since it's a Hilton. For the same price, you could easily find an equal room right on the strip. The carpets were old and dirty, elevators were broken, floor tiles broken and missing. Our "view of the strip" was mostly a view of their huge obnoxios Hilton sign. I was really disappointed, which means a lot coming from me. I'm usually a pretty forgiving person but I felt cheated here. I would NOT recommed to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Miserable experience.”
Reviews.Author: freisner
Reviews.Content: It took 40 minutes to check in Sunday night. there was only 1 clerk on duty in the regular check in line. 1 in the VIP line. This was at 10 p.m. Room was paid for for two nights, your office only recorded one night. Next morning I called my office, they immediately sent over another confirmation to use company credit card. At 7:15 that night, still wasn't credited to my room. I spoke with Manager Kevin O'Brien. He checked faxes, couldn't find one from my company. He finally found it, and credited my account, alerted me to that fact at 4:45 A.M. by ringing the phone to leave me a voice mail. I didn't need to be woken up at that time of the EARLY morning. He did offer to allow me to have the room until 5:30 p.m. Tuesday, to allow me time to return from my class. When I got to my room, it was locked. I had to go downstairs to desk, they called security to come unlock the dooor so that I could retreive my luggage. The only responsible person there was Brenda, the Concierge. She was extremely helpful. Cheryl the other concierge blew me off, and then continued to stand there doing nothing. Room was dirty. Needed dusting. There was a smell of mildew coming from the drain in the sink.

Reviews.Title: “STAY AWAY FROM THE HILTON LAS VEGAS”
Reviews.Author: nasnkasndafjalfj
Reviews.Content: stay away they overbooked and gave my room away and then charged me. i had to go next door and was charged a crazy price for a night. I might also add Im a platnum HH member. They over book then send people to another Hilton next door which over charges you. Stay Away trust me.

Reviews.Title: “Not totally up to Hilton-standards”
Reviews.Author: Frequent001
Reviews.Content: Recent cost cutting has negative impact for guest at this Hilton. They have spent big bucks on renovations but have cut back on the things important to Hilton guests. The biggest cutback is that some rates are NOT ELIGIBLE FOR HHONORS PROGRAM, a fact they don't tell you. In the Health Club where one use to have the choice of eight or more juices now there are three and all the TVs except one are gone. Ask for a bathrobe in your room, you are told no. That all said, it is nice place with friendly service, a good health club and pool, a good bar/night club, Tempo (although not always adequately staffed), Good casino, resturant and buffet. Good access to strip via (expensive) monorail or new ACE gold line. ACE gold line also will take you quickly downtown. For fast, cheap transit to/from airport take CAT route 108. Faster and far cheaper than taxi or shuttle bus.

Reviews.Title: “Great price, not so great for a family”
Reviews.Author: alaypath
Reviews.Content: We stayed here one night en route to California. We got a great rate from Expedia that included two breakfast buffets (which was Sunday brunch for us). We were delighted with the brunch. We were traveling with two young children, ages 6 and 3. The Strip is only a block away, but it's the less interesting end (in our opinion). We drove to the strip and used the public parking there to see the Bellagio and other nearby casinos. Families are clearly not the Hilton's target market. The two beds in our room were doubles, not queens, so sleeping four in the room was crowded. The bathroom seemed a little old. We came home early from the Strip to put our kids to bed. Our kids love to watch the Disney Channel or Nickelodeon when we are on vacation, but the Hilton has zero kid-friendly channels and not much on TV overall. There are just a few networks, sports and news channels. I understand that they don't want you spending a lot of time in your room, but this was a disappointment for us. The complimentary self parking is far away. We had to walk to the far end of the large hotel and then even farther to get to the lot. We felt like it was almost as close to the Stratosphere as the Hilton. Again, a downer if you need to bring in bags for a family. Since it was only one night and we liked the price for a Saturday night, I do not regret our stay here and would consider doing it again under the same circumstances. However, I would first spend more time looking for a hotel that caters to families.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Duffster11
Reviews.Content: Convenient for monorail, nice comfy rooms, good buffet. Internet and extras are all a bit pricey but what you would expect from big hotels. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: Maurena
Reviews.Content: Expected a bit more quality with the Hilton name but definitely not bad for the price. Room was good. Shower head is so small that you get a narrow stream of water with a cold mist around it. I'm not a big person but felt that way. The beds are a bit vintage so to speak. Bottom line though, PRICE was very good. They have some amazing restaurants. The buffet had something for everyone and more. Staff was friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful accommodations! I will definitely keep coming back.”
Reviews.Author: MissKrisMarie
Reviews.Content: This is the second time I have stayed at the Las Vegas Hilton this year and I have been thoroughly impressed. Our flight arrived later in the evening and the only room available had two twin beds.... which is not ideal for any couple. Without hesitation the check in desk personnel upgraded our room for no extra cost and even pointed out some local restaurants still open so we could grab some food before getting some rest. Professionalism from staff and fun atmosphere all wrapped in one. From the front desk to the cleaning personnel everyone was extremely respectful and friendly. My boyfriend and I enjoyed the little escape from reality and the experience overall. Highly recommended! :)

Reviews.Title: “Internet service at $14/day--a rip-off”
Reviews.Author: SWRetiredTraveler
Reviews.Content: I couldn't believe it--almost thought it was a typo. But no, the internet service from your room at the Las Vegas Hilton is $14/day. (You'd think they would give it to you free, wanting you to spend time on the gambling floor and not in your room). You could go to the Business Center and use their computers at 80 cents a minute (all plus tax), and $1 a page to print out in b/w. I just find those rates the biggest greediest rip-off ever. I have stayed at less expensive hotels and gotten wifi for free with the room. The info book in the room did not have a layout (drawing/map) of the hotel main floor. The widescreen TV was big enough, but the picture was so distorted (poor quality screen/on air, and short squatty people). No TV schedule in the room. And I never did find any on-screen menu for programming. I will say that once I called the front desk for maintenance to fix the toilet (the chain was missing and it wouldn't flush), the man came within 10 minutes). Two of the restaurants were closed (one for 2 weeks), and I wasn't about to spend $39 for a dinner. To get to the convention hall area, you had to take a lengthy walk through the gambling area, which caused an asthma attack. The smoke was pretty bad. I was surprised not to find a coffee/tea maker in the room. Even a Motel 6 room has a pot. The room may have been reasonably priced, but the "amenities" were unbelievably expensive. The ice cream shoppe was way overpriced ($4.25 for 1 scoop). Just an overall way-too-expensive everything! I just expected more (wrongly, obviously) from a Hilton. The housekeeping staff was quite friendly, and the room was a nice size and clean. The front desk personnel were friendly. They had late check-out, up to 2 pm. I realize it is Las Vegas, but that city needs to get with the program on non-smoking, and block off (as in build walls/windows) the smoking area. No matter where you were on the main level, it was noisy, too.

Reviews.Title: “They gave me a room at the end of a long hallway”
Reviews.Author: LSinNNJ
Reviews.Content: I guess someone had to get the room, but I did. It was sizable and well appointed. Resorts club room had access for continental breakfast and free water/soft drinks (which I could stock in the fridge in the room). Pool was nice. Stayed here for a conference, but there are many better options in Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel but Not on the Strip”
Reviews.Author: JMCAtlanta
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night recently at the LV Hilton and thought it was very nice and an excellent deal for a quality hotel (about $130 for the night). We had the breakfast buffet ,which was excellent, and then walked over to the strip, which will take you about 15 minutes. Unfortunately, this puts you closer to the less nice end of the strip (by Sahara and Circus Circus), so if you are planning on spending a lot of time at the strip hotels or going to shows, then this probably isn't the hotel for you due to the location.

Reviews.Title: “VIP Service for Hilton Honors Members”
Reviews.Author: delicia_10
Reviews.Content: We just had a wonderful stay at the Las Vegas Hilton Hotel for 4 nights. They realy treat Hilton Gold Members with VIP service. We stayed in the East Tower, room was very nice and clean. Had free buffet breakfeast each day we stayed. The buffet is one of the best in town. The hotel is out of the beaten path. We had a rental so it was not a problem We would stay there again when we return.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it, we had a great time”
Reviews.Author: shannones1210
Reviews.Content: We had our wedding at La Bella Chapel inside of Hilton, so naturally we decided to stay there. Before we went there I was kind of worried about our decision of staying at LV Hilton after reading all the mixed reviews. Boy, we were so glad we stayed there. We had a great time and everything was just wonderful. We booked a resort club room, I'd definitely recommend to stay at their resort club rooms. We got to go to express check in line and they upgraded our room because other rooms were not ready yet. The lounge on the 24th floor had breakfast, snack and drinks, even beer and wine. Our room was the size of their Grand Room, very spacious and clean. I really need to say something about the bed in our room, it was so comfortable, amazingly comfortable. Our room was on the 26th floor of North Tower and the view was absolutely gorgeous. We could see Wynn and Encore from our room. The only thing I was not completely satisfied about is the bathroom, it was pretty small but with all the upgrades. We had plumbing issue the first night we stayed there. We called the front desk and they sent someone to fix it in 15 minutes, very satisfied about their prompt response. We stayed there for 4 days and we tried almost everything there. We went to the swimming pool, had spa and massage, got my hair done at the salon, tried four restaurants and also gambled at the casino. The swimming pool was smaller than I expected, I wished it could be bigger, especially for a such big hotel. We went to TJ's Steakhouse for dinner one night, the steak and lobster were really good, too bad we had to catch a show and couldn't stay longer to enjoy our meal. Talking about location, LV Hilton is not on the strip but Monorail stops right in front of it. It takes about 5 minutes to get to the strip. What can be more convenient than that? We were lucky to stay in North Tower, It's the closest tower to parking garage and monorail station. We loved our stay there, everything exceeded our expectation. Besides swimming pool and bathroom, I really could not think of anything to complain about. Most of our guests stayed there with us. We went to some of their rooms and here are my conclusions: LV Hilton is an old hotel and their classic rooms are not fully upgraded, one of our guests had a room with pink bathroom. Everything in that bathroom is pink, I'm not joking! It's also not worth it to book their suites if you don't plan to stay with bunch of people in the same room. One of our guests booked a East Tower suite, and it turned out it's just two rooms right next to each other, not one bedroom with a living room. I think our guest who stayed at the room with pink bathroom might have something different to say about his experience, but for us, we loved every bit of it.

Reviews.Title: “One of the most disappointing experience”
Reviews.Author: ciphershock
Reviews.Content: I travelled with my wife and parents. To our surprise in the room there was no Electric kettle, no refrigerator. Our rooms were completely different in layout and style. The sheets in my room were torn. The bathroom was very small and old with a rusted bath tub. In my parents room, they got body gel and toothpaste, we got none and on asking they said they dont have. The hotel is way off the strip, and I would definitely not recommend this hotel to anyone. .

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: weary_traveller25
Reviews.Content: I was recently in Las Vegas on business when I stayed at the Las Vegas Hilton. It is located just off the Las Vegas strip on Paradise Road. Depending on your preference, this can be good or bad. If you like to be in the middle of the action, this may not be the hotel for you. If you want to experience Las Vegas, but get away from the crowds at the end of the day, this could be the hotel for you. The hotel offers taxi and shuttle service, valet parking, and self parking. I found the self parking to be rather convenient. You might not need a car at all, considering that the monorail station is next to the hotel. The front desk staff was polite and very efficient, especially considering how many people are usually standing in line. They were able to assist most customers very quickly. I was impressed with the service I received. The hotel has ample shopping and dining choices, for both big and small spenders. They also have decent entertainment options, as well as the prerequisite casino. There is a very nice pool located on the third floor, along with a fitness center. The room was nice, but not great. The bed was very soft and comfortable. The room was clean, with the exception of the bathroom. The tiles were dirty and the tub and shower needed to be re-caulked. The shower head was one of the worst ones I have ever seen at any hotel in the country. The wireless internet service costs an additional $13.99 per night, and was extremely slow. Overall, I enjoyed my first trip to the Las Vegas Hilton.

Reviews.Title: “boys weekend out”
Reviews.Author: boysweekend
Reviews.Content: For the last 7yrs me and bout 12 -15 childhood friends come to Vegas the 1st weekend of June. We have stayed at 4 different hotels, and have had all kinds of problems.all we want is rooms on the same floor a couple together and service. a discount would be nice,the music by the pool &club made our trip one of the best since we started. Not all stayed at the Hilton but most came for the music and were blown away. 5 stayed at the Hilton &7 at Monty Carlo The rooms were just as nice for less money (69dollars) i think we just might all come to LVH next year.

Reviews.Title: “Just Plain Old”
Reviews.Author: milprizer
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a weekend stay and will not go back. Although the room was renovated and modernized, the rest of the hotel needs a MAJOR facelift. From the elevators to the pool to the restaurants. It was surprisingly crowded. Also, if you stay here, be prepared to pay a lot for taxis to get to the other areas!

Reviews.Title: “Not too bad......”
Reviews.Author: Juaners
Reviews.Content: It was our friend's 40th and he decided to celebrate it in Las Vegas. Not my type of city, but we went. Being that it was a lot of us, many of us did not want to spend a lot of money, so we chose the Hilton. A couple of things you should know, before you stay here. For the price? It was an amazing deal; 2 days on a holiday weekend less than $200. $194 to be exact and if you are Gold or higher HH member, you will get free breakfast (2 tickets) for their buffet. The rooms were clean and fairly big, but the beds were not queens, they were true double beds, so 2 people per bed made for not such a good night's sleep. The suitcase stand was broken! The hotel is big, huge actually, so there's a lot of walking from garage to your rooms, depending on which tower you are in. The other consideration is location. Normally we stay on the strip, but no matter how nice a hotel may be, I refused to pay over $180 in Las Vegas and that is already pushing it. The Hilton is far from the strip and you either should rent a car to get around or you can take the monorail, which is a big rip-off; $5 dollars a ride. However, it is much cheaper than a taxi. Overall, the hotel worked for our group, we were all happy and being away from the strip had its perks, it was less crowded. The casino was not too crowded either and the drinks kept coming, even if you play the nickel slots. Big plus for me, as I am not a gambler. The buffet was decent and for being free, I can't really complain. Those who stay over the weekend, should know that the HH buffet ticket includes free cheap champagne and free beer (I know!). Anyhow, good choice for us and probably a good option for families too. The pool is big and has a snack bar nearby.

Reviews.Title: “We liked it!”
Reviews.Author: james_owens
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were suprised at the neatness, quality, and the spaciousness of the room!! We enjoyed our stay there so much, that we would like to plan another trip soon with our children and then without them.

Reviews.Title: “Working on a return date now”
Reviews.Author: HenryBrentwood_TN
Reviews.Content: After reviewing the negative comments, I was leary when I walked through the doors. But being a Diamond Honor member, I could not pass up the opportunity to try the property. I had a blast. From the buffet in the morning, to the final drink at the casino bar at night, the day was great. The Spa is sufficient, and the size of the pool, allows for privacy without the noise of close confinement. I have stayed at the Four Season before and will not return because of the children noise. A band played friday night at the pool and they were great. However, I walked out of The Original Time Band Concert. Bathroom was spotless. It had granite floor, and great water pressure. Monorail is right outside the door, and you can go anywhere on the strip via the monorail. Last day I rented a car and the property has free parking, which was outside my North Tower room. Will return in the fall.

Reviews.Title: “Poor management customer service”
Reviews.Author: Hardcastle10
Reviews.Content: I stay in hotels quite often and I am a Hilton honours member However the treatment I received here was awful when I discovered my friends got a better room at a third cheaper price Whilst I was eventually credited the manager was unapologetic Then I was left in the room for over an hour waiting on someone to come to change it I got no apology for this and was told they were short staffed Most of the staff were very helpful and let down by duty manager I would not stay here again and found everything was charged for even for the room safe

Reviews.Title: “Guys Getaway”
Reviews.Author: Al-n-Angela
Reviews.Content: The Hilton has a great sports book. Could use some more waitress service or maybe some younger staff! The cocktail waitresses as a whole could have been more pleasant also. The rooms were better than expectedm clean & comfortable. The pool was very cold and could have used some heat...basically no one was in the water. Overall I look at this as a place to go only if there is a great deal or bargain.

Reviews.Title: “I like come back again.”
Reviews.Author: lisaxiaolinhuang
Reviews.Content: April who works at Frontdesk is not well-trained. She needs more skill to work at that position.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Service!!!”
Reviews.Author: preludex98
Reviews.Content: My friends and I stayed there for memorial weekend. The service was terrible! We asked for a non smoking room and we didn't get it till the next night. Best part is that they charged my credit card for the whole weekend weeks in advance. If they are going to charge my credit then they should give me the room that I wanted! They gave us a king room with a roll away in the mean time. The room didn't have a king bed. It was murphy bed. What 3 star hotel has a murphy bed?!! ! The carpet was torn, the sheets were dirty, bed was lumpy and the bath tub had some sort of apoxy patch work done to it (The new remodel rooms are better but not by much). The front desk person, Ceily, was absolutely rude about switching rooms. Actually rude is an understatement of her service. I have stayed at lower rated hotels and gotten better service and accomodations. Also what hotel does not offer free wifi??!!! Especially since they are near the convention center.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable beds, the rest was average”
Reviews.Author: MrsLopez21
Reviews.Content: I stayed here this month with my new husband while we were on our honeymoon. I reserved a room with a single king bed and then when we were checking in, we were told they upgraded our room. Unfortunately, this "upgrade" was to a room with two double beds. We were on our honeymoon - we don't want separate beds!! So we both snuggled into a tiny bed together. The beds were very comfortable, though. The rest of the room was nice, except for the shower. The shower head was old and cheap. Also, there is a note that you can leave the sign hanging on your door for them to not clean your room and you'll get a $5 dining credit - not true. We put that sign up and never received the credit.

Reviews.Title: “They Wowed us! Over the TOP! Best EVER!”
Reviews.Author: glennsmrs
Reviews.Content: We're used to being spoiled as Diamond members, but this property went over the top. Our upgrade consisted of two card keys. The first opened a beautiful suite with the huge Las Vegas style bed up on a platform with built-in make-up kiosks on both sides. The living room was ample with remote control draperies that opened to the panoramic view of the City. The wet bar was restocked with complementary quarts of mineral water daily. The OTHER key opened the suite across the hall (we were at one end of the floor) which was similarly sized but was a living room/dining room/wet bar with a murphy bed (in the upright position) - same free mineral water, internet and beautiful marble bathroom. Included in our reasonable price were two complementary champagne buffets everyday. A true Las Vegas experience!

Reviews.Title: “More than we expected”
Reviews.Author: Aluvus
Reviews.Content: We booked the Hilton for the Friday and Saturday nights of our ten nights in Vegas starting on the 9th of May. This meant our stay at the Hilton was sandwiched between 5 nights at Mandalay Bay and the final 3 at the Encore. While the Hilton is obviously not in the same class as those two hotels, we felt it offered great value for money. We had a clean quiet room containing a very commfortable bed that allowed us a long sleep in on Saturday after a late night enjoying the Fremont experience. In fact, my wife felt the bed at the Hilton was the most comfortable of the 3 hotels we visited. Taking the monorail on Saturday night to see KA' at the MGM was quick and convenient. We enjoyed gambling and the quick drink service in the Spacequest casino. We felt very relaxed at the Hilton, the buffet was great value against some of the others we tried. Check in and check out was smooth and all staff we came in contact with were very warm and helpful. Overall we had a very pleasant experience and would certainly consider staying at the Hilton again during any future trips to Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Not perfect but a GREAT deal.”
Reviews.Author: BlackVooduu
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights, Thurs and Fri, and I booked a Superior King/Strip View with a "eupgrade" to a Grand Room for $9.00 more. When we arrived, the valet line was fast and efficient (unlike some of the strip hotels where we have literally waited 45 minutes before a valet came); check in was just as quick (granted it was a Thursday night). We received our upgrade and had a view of the golf course. Room was large (a little dark) and was a smoking room (we requested a non smoking). The bathroom was ok (it is an old hotel - so I didn't really expect too much). Next time they re-do -- they need to concentrate on the tubs! Buffet was just ok - but since it was included in the Great Escape Vacation Package, I can't complain. Just stay away from the sausage...that's all I'm sayin'. Everyone was very nice, helpful, and efficient. The craps dealers were AWESOME! The fact that the monorail is RIGHT there is a huge bonus! Buy the 24 hour pass, it's so worth it.

Reviews.Title: “1st Visit & Stay”
Reviews.Author: SanDiegoJack57
Reviews.Content: The layout of the hotel is confusing, but I was able to find, with help, everything I was looking for. Elevators are convenient to all, but self-parking was quite a journey, so using the Valet is recommended (ask for covered parking, if available). The room was clean, even for a smoking room & the views were excellent. The buffett was actually pretty good, and if you get there just before 10:50 am, you can get both breakfast, and then lunch, when they change the items at 11 am. The very friendly staff was very accomodating too. Tried TJ"s Steak House, and the service and food was excellent as well (biggest doggone Idaho Potato I've ever seen was served there). The pool area was spacious, not much greenery, but not at all jammed up like most strip hotel pools. The Flamingo (formerly a Hilton Hotel) has one of the very best pools in Vegas & is a favorite of mine, but they crowd too many lounges together and I may not go back, but go to the Hilton instsead (it was that enjoyable). Overall, I would put this Las Vegas Hotel near the top of my list for a return visit.

Reviews.Title: “why stay on the strip when you have the hilton”
Reviews.Author: bassdisco
Reviews.Content: you go to vegas to be out and about, need a place to sleep and take a shower while there, maybe some food, then why go anywhere else, beds are top notch, hotel is very clean, it's a hilton!!! no need to stay at a ritz hotel on the strip...been going there for 10 years now, highly recommend!!!! Kevin the gerneral manager is very friendly and helpful...thanks hilton for 10 years of great stays

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: steelgirl58
Reviews.Content: Friendly staff. Never too busy to answer a question. Clean rooms, clean bathroom. Wish I could have won more money in the casino, but that's not their fault, i'm just not a lucky gambler :( Only a couple things I wish they would add... More restrooms on main floor. Few and FAR apart. And like most people i accumulate gobs of coins while in Vegas. They don't have any way to take your coins and turn into bills. No Coinstar machine and nothing at casino cage either. I stayed for 6 nights, enjoyed it very much. Priced right too. Casino cocktail waitresses were pretty good. Had one or two incidents where i placed an order and was forgotten. Located off strip, but just barely. I walked to Riviera every day to attend pool tournament. Took about 10 min to walk there - that's nothing.

Reviews.Title: “It's Complete”
Reviews.Author: Romnan
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is a Las Vegas Landmark. It is everything that you would expect a Hilton to be. The room accomidations are excellent,the service is professional and the selection of eatieries covers all needs. Gaming is a ersonal issue I was lucky and the machines were kind. I am not a show person but there is more than enough entertainment in the lounges to keep one occupied and happy. I used points that made the stay even nicer

Reviews.Title: “nice enough, but getting older”
Reviews.Author: merseyheart
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the HIlton to attend a concert taking place in their showroom. The hotel is getting older and it shows--the tile in the bathroom is old, my tub was chipped a bit, and the wallpaper was peeling off the wall near the elevators. But the bed was fine, there was a large screen television, and you get a $5 voucher for food and drink if you skip the housekeeping (which I did one day). I had a fine time laying in the sun out on the patio, and the Paradise Cafe had good service and good food. I appreciated that it is around the corner from the casino, so your meals there are quiet. The showroom, which hosted Elvis during his Vegas years, has been remodeled to theatre seating. The Monorail makes it really easy to get to the Strip. I was *not* happy with the scantily-clad, gyrating young women who danced on tables in the gaming rooms. If I want to be directly exposed to the exploitation of women, I'll buy tickets to one of those shows.

Reviews.Title: “great way to watch the Derby”
Reviews.Author: coachKC
Reviews.Content: We met our son and his friend in from LA(we live in Jersey) at the Hilton. We all were happy w/ our rooms and had a great dinner at Benihana. An attendant named Janet made our stay memorable when we were out by the pool. She helped my wife who is disabled to a more comfortable, shady area where we could still get some sun, have an adult beverage and watch the Kentucky Derby from our chairs. Janet was extremely kind and considerate to my wife and family- thank you. KC

Reviews.Title: “Gross Motel, not 3 or 4 Star Hotel”
Reviews.Author: kate0614
Reviews.Content: The check-in person gave us the wrong room keys, so after waiting ten minutes for the elevator and finally getting upstairs, we were locked out. We then waited another 20 minutes for security, in the dank, gross hallway, which is tastefully decorated with chipped paint, peeling wallpaper, and scuffed walls. When security finally got us into our room, it literally looked like a roadside motel. Cheapo furniture that looked like it was from the 70s or 80s, an old pink tile bathroom with moudly grout and flimsy shower curtain, etc. The bed was actually ok. I just couldn't believe this is billed as a 3 or 4 star hotel. It strains to be a two-star, and the service is bottoms. Also, clientel mostly scary frat types.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Travel Experience”
Reviews.Author: Julie55649
Reviews.Content: Avoid this hotel! Recently I stayed at the LV Hilton for a week long conference. I made my reservations 2 months in advance for a room on the "resort floor" along with several of my collegues from Texas. Upon arriving I had to wait 5 hours for "my room" to be cleaned. once I finally got to my room it was trashed! Literally! Housekeeping had not even been there and it was 4 in the afternoon. So I wait for another "resort room" which the front desk so rudely stated that they would be "stealing" from another customer. I finally get into the room and found the headboard trimming coming off the wall, carpet frayed, stains on the carpet and fabric chairs, the furniture scuffed and marked up and mold around the caulking of the bathtub. I immediately called the front desk who told me that I would have to wait until the next day to talk to someone in charge. Which of course I did. On that Monday I did get moved for the third time. Although the room was in better shape it was NOT what I had come to expect from Hilton. On wedneday I moved to the Aria and made sure that all of my collegues who had not checked into the Hilton yet moved as well. The best part of this hotel was the bell service!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel- good amenities”
Reviews.Author: ab1465
Reviews.Content: We were a little worried about staying here after reading previous reviews on trip advisor, but our stay at the Hilton went really well. We got a very cheap stay through an online travel package site. We were there four nights. All the staff were very helpful (except service at the Paradise Cafe took quite a while). They gave us a suite and breakfast coupons (AWESOME!) because of Gold Hilton Honors Membership. The suite was nice, and the free breakfasts helped save money. If you're HH Honors, there are separate marked lines for both the buffet and check-in. Once we realized that, getting in was a breeze. We bought monorail passes & reccomend anyone going to the Strip do so. The station was just outside the Hilton, and most of the other stops are at the back of hotels on the Strip. As a woman, if I were traveling alone I wouldn't walk back from the strip to the Hilton on my note- certainly not at night, and maybe not even during the day. Not a bad area, just very deserted. If you're looking for a Strip hotel, don't stay here. If you're looking for a nice hotel, with a variety of food choices, with access to the Strip, this hotel fits the bill. We'd definitely stay again at the Hilton, and though it was a great deal.

Reviews.Title: “disgusting.”
Reviews.Author: not22fussy
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the central tower on the 20th floor. The room and surrounding floor was in need of a remodel. The wallpaper was coming off the wall in the elevator bank. The lamp in my room had a ripped lamp shade. There were papers from the previous occupants stay left in the room when I arrived. There was a large stain on the carpeting and the general dinge made me not want to take off my socks under any circumstances to walk on the floor. The bathroom was rather cramped. The toliet did not flush well. The bright side was that the hotel is convenient to the conference center, the interactions I had with the staff were pleasant and I ended up sleeping well in the bed. However, there are far better "values" in Las Vegas with nicer accommodations for the price. WIth the monorail and shuttle service most hotels provide to teh conference center, the hotel's importance of location is minimized.

Reviews.Title: “Landmark hotel - nice rooms - friendly staff - gouge the heck out of you”
Reviews.Author: DavidRTX
Reviews.Content: I have been traveling to Las Vegas since the mid-80's and have always enjoyed the Hilton. It is roomy, good staff, nice rooms, and lots to do. Unfortunately, Las Vegas has changed a lot in 20 years. Now, just a simple meal at a hotel restaurant can run you $40-60 easily. In addition (pet peeve alert), if you want to get on the internet, that'll cost you another $14 a day. Just chaps my butt that, in 2010, when the lowliest Best Western offers free internet, the Las Vegas Hilton sticks it to their customers.

Reviews.Title: “very good service but the bathroom was less than perfect”
Reviews.Author: irieman39
Reviews.Content: We really like the hotel and the rooms but this trip our bathroom tub had mildew all around it. We reported it to the front desk and they offered to change our room but we liked the room and the location. We just wanted the mildew cleaned, which did'nt get done. Instead they gave us 2 buffets. (we would rather just had the mildew removed or reduce the rate on the room).

Reviews.Title: “A horrible experience”
Reviews.Author: Alexbelv
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a relaxing, upscale hotel to finish my 2 week driving holiday though the southwestern US and I chose the Hilton because of its reputation and the fact that it seemed to offer everything one would want to unwind and to also have a proper Las Vegas experience. Unfortunately the hotel did not live up to its 3.5 star rating. My wife and I arrived at the hotel at 10pm on the day of our check-in only to find that our room was not cleaned and that it had two double beds while I had explicitly asked for a king sized bed 3 weeks prior to the arrival. This is not something one would expect from a Hilton especially when you consider that we were checking in at 10pm and not at 7 in the morning, the hotel would have had plenty of time to get the room ready. You get better service in a 2 star hotel. When the staff managed to find us an upgraded king sized room, it was also not cleaned and thus we had to wait an hour before it was ready. As compensation the hotel manager offered us a 30$ credit for dinner at one of the hotel's restaurants but then the staff forgot to apply the credit to the bill when we were checking out...not to mentioned they weren't the friendliest of people to begin with. I paid 200$ total for the two nights that I stayed there and I did not feel like I received a warm welcome nor did I get the proper Las Vegas experience I expected. Please avoid staying at the Las Vegas Hilton.

Reviews.Title: “Provided less quality room than reserved and called it an upgrade”
Reviews.Author: Kevin-Memphis
Reviews.Content: Reserved a resort club room with all the amenties of a resort club room and even purchased an upgrade to a Lani suite. When I checked in they provided a standard room next to the elevator. The front desk called it an upgrade and said they have been reserved for me for a month. However, they still charged me for a resort club room and did not provide a reduced amount for this standard room. I had to call the front desk and speak with a supervisor who had no explanation for this problem. I call it bait and switch. The room I received was adequate for a one night stay but not what I reserved or paid for. The tub faucet dripped and wall art was missing from the room. One of the smaller hotel Mexican restaurants is now only a bar. the Paradise cafe was adequate, nothing special. Hotel signage on Paradise avenue did not adequately tell you where the front desk / reservations were located on property. TV channel desriptions did not match up to the channels on the TV screen; says CNN but could be ABC.

Reviews.Title: “I thought I was in a Motel 6! Wait Motel 6 is better!”
Reviews.Author: bayoubuckeye
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to Vegas and being from New Orleans it takes a lot to impress me. Lets break it down step by step. #1, the desk staff was almost inhumane. No personality and really not very helpful about anything. Ask the same question to ten people and get ten different answers. I would like to add I'm a gold honors member and can firmly say this is the worst Hilton I have stayed in, by far. I stayed on the 8th floor of the main tower. The rooms were very out dated. Very old tub, no fridge, no coffee pot, and the internet is another story. It cost $13.99 a day to use their internet. I was there on business and I'm a professional that has to have access so internet. This is the FIRST TIME I paid for internet service PERIOD! The bed was just ok, but the worst I have had in a Hilton. Also, the location is a long long did I say long way from everything. Nothing was within walking distance except a convenient store. Your options for transportation was, have your own car, taxi, which were very expensive, bus which took forever to get places, and the monorail is $14 dollars a day and a long walk to everything. There were several little restaurants in the hotel, but many were only open at night, so it left only a couple restaurants with limited menus as choices. NO FREE MOVIE CHANNEL! Very few channels on tv almost all were news channels, if you want to watch a movie, just like internet, YOU PAY! Things were very expensive. Just think of a ridiculous price than double it, that is how much everything cost. I was going to go to Studio 54 until I found out their cover charge was$10 for women, $25 for men, and $25 for both on the weekend. Not only is that sexist that is crazy! Penny slots were 25 cents. Yeah no kidding the slot machine say 1 cent, but you have to make a 25 line bet. We call those quarter slots back in New Orleans because it cost a quarter. In the conference of some 400 people there were a lot of grumblings, many I have mentioned. My suggestion is if your planning on going to Las Vegas go to New Orleans instead. It is far cheaper, better food, more things to do and the people are much more friendly. If you have to stay in Las Vegas try a different hotel.

Reviews.Title: “average rooms a bit overpriced for weekend stay...”
Reviews.Author: performance1
Reviews.Content: clean rooms, great staff, but for the weekend the price is just not worth being away from the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Hilton.....PISHHH more like Holiday Inn!!!”
Reviews.Author: IcyWhite901
Reviews.Content: I should've listened to the reviews and stayed else where. I booked my room 2 months in advance...then to make sure everything was going to be correct on my reservations i called 2 days before we got there and i was assured that i would have my King size room and it would be a strip view... HAAA so when i go to check in they tell me "here is your double bed room" I was like ehhhh no its suppose to be a king "oh we are sorry we dont have any king rooms call back down here in the morning and we will get you switched over to your king" Ok no problem i'll just do that. So we go up to the 27th floor open the door and.......no strip view im overlooking a golf course. So we take our bags back down to the front desk-this time im talking to a different person i tell him the whole situation about me switching rooms in the morning to my king room and i ask him can i at least get a room with a strip view??? He's tells me with a goofy grin on his his face "sure you can but theres only one problem we're not on the strip" YES i know this BUT your rooms say strip view rooms, so can i get one of them? "Ohhh yea we'll switch you over" thanks buddy let me get those keys so i can be on my way. Once we get to the room with the strip view we open the door and i feel like im staying at a Holiday Inn, not that there is anything wrong with a holiday inn but i paid for a hilton. So after a long night of drinking we get up the next morning and i call the front desk to get my king room and they tell me none are clean yet call back in a couple hours, so in a couple hours i dont call i go down there in person to get my room. I talk to the lady behind the counter and she says let me get u a supervisor...the supervisor comes out and says we are not going to have any king size rooms for you during your WEEK stay due to the volcano erupting overseas. Lol your joking right??? I mean im sure there are alot of people here from overseas but its a lil hard to believe there are no king size rooms in this whole hotel for a week. So after he pretty much just says it is what it is i dont get offered a comp of any kind, a upgrade, a nothing but a blank stare and we are sorry. I could go on and on about reasons NOT to stay here but im tired of typing and your prollay tired of reading sooo...... DONT NO STAY HERE!!!!!!!! I WILL be coming back to vegas just wont be gettting anywhere near this **** hole

Reviews.Title: “Not any other time”
Reviews.Author: Misssly
Reviews.Content: I only stayed at this hotel because of an annual event that is hosted there otherwise I would never stay at this hotel any other time. Our first room assigned to us smelled like mildew because the carpet in the entry way - next to the restroom was SOAKED. We had to wait till the afternoon of the next day to get another room. The choice of restaurants and places to eat is poor and on Sunday evening, most of the fine dining restaurants were either closed or closed early. There was only ONE open at 10 pm. You'll end up leaving to eat. Overall I think the hotel rate is not worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Unfortunately, LV Hilton matched my expectations”
Reviews.Author: hotelhound
Reviews.Content: I just completed a 1-week stay at the LV Hilton while participating in the NAB 2010 exposition. This was my first trip to Las Vegas and the Hilton, based on what I have read here and other places, would not have been my first choice however proximity to the Convention Center and my lack of knowledge about the area predetermined my choice. Pros -- size, friendly casino (although I just watched my colleagues play blackjack), and very friendly staff for the most part, margaritas, room was cleaned daily Cons -- location was too far removed from everything else, limited dining options for size, non-renovated room which was tired and bath which had rust stains and indeterminate growth on the shower walls as well as a toilet that need some coaxing to work, lines were much too long for taxis, dining, elevators, workout area was too small, and internet fee. Unfortunately, even though I was on a conference rate, I could have found much better rates myself at either the Hilton, the Marriott, or any of the newer resorts. If I return to Vegas, the Hilton will most definitely not be anywhere near my top 10 places to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Not Hilton standards by any means”
Reviews.Author: bringonthebeach4
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very old and needs some serious improvements. The lobby supposedly was just renovated and some of the rooms. However,if you want an updated room you have to pay $20 per night more. After the room I had for 5 nights it would have been worth it. The carpet looked like it was very old and had never been cleaned. The bedding and curtains were stained and the bathroom was hideous and very unclean. I stayed here not only because I am an Hilton Honors member but was attending the NAB conference at the convention center so the location was perfect. I did enjoy the buffet for breakfast and the Italian restaurant was actually quite good. The monorail location is wonderful and the staff was very pleasant and accomodating. Been to Las Vegas many many times and will not return to this place.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible hotel, one of the worst I have lived in”
Reviews.Author: roy79
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a week for conference during March. Booked a non-smoking room with breakfast. got a room that smelled smoke all over it. Next day when confronted the front desk I found out that I had been given a smoking room. Promptly got switched to a non-smoking room. The new room although is a non smoking one, looks like it had been cleaned a long time ago. There is dust balls in the entrance and also a big mold stain on the ceiling just outside the bath room which is quite disgusting. Some of the lamps didn't work either. Since I'll only stay for few days I didn't asked to switch room again. The view from the 18th floor is amazing. When checking out the cashier tried to double charge me the breakfast even it was included in the room rate. When complained she only removed one breakfast entry at each complaint, which got tiresome after a while. As a happy ending, the bill was correctly adjusted.

Reviews.Title: “Friends dont let friends stay at the Hilton LV”
Reviews.Author: briguyforever
Reviews.Content: Total BS..First off they charge $14 per day for wifi that doesn't work..By the way that is $14 PER DEVICE..So I had a phone, Ipod and Laptop that I had connected..you guessed it $50 per day in wifi bills..Bathtub didn't drain, and there was no hot water..The hot pink tile of the tiny bathroom will remind of you 1962. I travel 12 -15 times per year and this was the worst hotel I have stayed in all year..The best part is my friends were at Encore at $40 per night less...It is close to the LV convention center..but that is the ONLY thing going..When I checked out and found out about the bill I said "you are charging me $50 per night for wifi, the receptionist said "NO I AM NOT, Cox media is"...

Reviews.Title: “great value hotel”
Reviews.Author: chicagopeople
Reviews.Content: The hotel was way better than my expectation for what I paid. It was great value! We enjoyed it very much. The location is not the best, but it is still pretty easy to get around.

Reviews.Title: “I Would Do It Again!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Scrutchings
Reviews.Content: Wonderful place, lots of fun, great games, food and people. Can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Serious STRESS!!!”
Reviews.Author: foggydoggy
Reviews.Content: I will say the hotel appears to have a classic aura...especially if a guest has any familiarity with its history. The property has evolved from a hotel to a resort and the public areas are well maintained and elegantly designed. However, there is serious room for improvement regarding service and hospitality issues. Our visit began with a very long line at check in...there is a rope line not unlike rope lines at airports....a long, sleek check in counter with 15 or 20 stations...roughly a quarter of them staffed. Consequently, long lines and many minutes waiting with luggage. On a hopeful note, when it was finally our turn, we were offered a 'free upgrade' to a bigger room. What a surprise. When we entered our room, it was obvious that the room was already occupied..lights on, fan running, used towels on the counter, bed linens rumpled. I immediately called the desk and after many minutes waiting on hold, a 'manager' came aboard and instructed us to go up to another floor, and wait for security to escort us to a different room. Apparently, the first room was indeed registered to another guest but fortunately for all of us, the registered guest was not present when we barged in...nonetheless, it was an unsettling experience. Security escorted us to another room, unlocked the door with a house key and instructed us to return to the desk for new key cards...so after dropping off our luggage, we returned to the front desk...and the rope line. Our room was a very large king...dressing room, wardrobe mirrors, sitting area, large bathroom with an oversized tub, beautiful view from the twentysomething floor looking across to the strip. On a closer look, the bathroom is aging, lots of damaged tile and missing grout around the tub, mildew odors, stained shower curtain, banged up woodwork, black lacquer vanity that's scratched and aging, black granite counter top with spotty, discolored areas from water damage...a too small leaky faucet, soggy soap and no soap dish. Lovely make up mirror is a nice touch, however very dim lighting; the entire room had very dim lights. Bottled water for sale in the room, no coffee or tea. The furniture in the room consisted of painted black wood, squared off plain and functional design...a bit scratched and unpolished, not a bit dressy. $13.95 per day for internet connection. The bed was comfy, the linens very nice. After a day of travel, and hours of Las Vegas nightlife, we settled in...listening to the constant whir of the elevators all night long, and awakened every early in the morning by housekeepers slam banging carts and doors in the hallway, and shouting at one another in a high pitched frenzy...all of which echoed and bounced through our room. We finally gave up trying to sleep, and headed downstairs to the Paradise Cafe on the main floor for breakfast. The restaurant was somewhat busy, but there were plenty of empty tables and booths...many them dirty. We were the only guests waiting to be seated, and the hostess asked us to wait a moment longer so that a table could be cleared. Obviously, they were a bit short staffed. After we were seated, the hostess informed us our server would be with us shortly. We waited, and waited, and waited....after waiting 20 minutes for someone to offer to take our order, we finally left the cafe and headed off to an off site restaurant for a bite to eat... So...our stay the Las Vegas Hilton was a series of poor service mishaps...one after another. This a busy, impersonal hotel...clearly shuffling through as many quests as possible with minimal attention to personal service. On the other hand, the main casino is spacious and pleasant...one gentleman dealer chatted with me for many minutes, sharing memories of Elvis and stories of long ago. The crystal chandeliers are very showy, the orchids in the lobby are stunning, the pool area is upscale, well designed and sunny, but...with so many other resort and hotel choices available in Las Vegas offering impeccable hospitality with attention to fine details, there is no reason for us to choose the Hilton ever again.

Reviews.Title: “Wish we could have stayed longer!”
Reviews.Author: amrstack
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Las Vegas Hilton for one night (flew in a day early and our other hotel was booked that night.) We were travelling with our 9 year old daughter so as far as family friendly goes, there really wasn't much for her to do; however, as soon as we checked into our other hotel my husband and I agreed that if it was just the two of us, we probably would have headed back to the Hilton! The Hilton was clean, beautiful, and spacious. Our rooms were remodeled and just lovely. Beds are killer! We have intentions of staying here the next time we're in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Poor Service”
Reviews.Author: Raquelita27
Reviews.Content: Dont recommend to stay here at all.They charge for water, no coffee or tea. Bed Bugs, leaky faucet in bathroom, Sink plugger would not hold up with the lever so we took it out to lay on the counter. Was not worth staying if you want to enjoy your Las Vegas trip. Complained about our room and supervisor didnt want to help with any of the issues. Wasnt close to the strip, and there was nothing I liked at all about this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great for families”
Reviews.Author: utahopenroad
Reviews.Content: A good value for the money, the family liked the pool and spa. The spa was great, use your Hilton Honers for free access.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortably Affordable!”
Reviews.Author: justkj
Reviews.Content: The package deal was GREAT!! Thank you Hilton. We look forward to returning again soon.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel stay to take several tours”
Reviews.Author: alpenasandi
Reviews.Content: I am a loyal Hilton guest. The hotel is older and in need of some updates. However, the service was great. We upgraded to the Resort Club level (well worth the few extra dollars). Offered a decent continental breakfast, all day snacks and a nice wine, cheese, veggie and snack option each evening. On the down side the Resort Club Lounge hours are 6:00 a.m. - 8:00 p.m. some of the tours leave before 6:00 a.m. and return after 8:00 p.m. Again, the Hilton service is always wonderful as well as thier beds but this hotel is in need of some updates some of the furniture and carpeting in the rooms should be replaced, elevator doors in the North towers need refurbishing). All and all the value was good. Week days are far less hectic. We arrived on Tuesday it was great however, Friday and Saturday there were long waits for the elevators lots of people. The upscale resutrantes are pricey but worth the money great food and service. I liked being off the strip as the purpose of the trip was to take advantage of tours: Grand Canyon, Red Rock, Valley of Fire, Hoover Dam etc.

Reviews.Title: “Next Time I'm In Vegas - I'll Take An Other Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ezpass
Reviews.Content: We spent one night in this hotel, in a room for four. I hope there are better rooms in this hotel than where we were hosted. Overall, the stay was disappointing. The general level was not the usual Hilton (but the price was low for a Hilton ($ 105). The room was quite small, organized and clean, with no interesting view (Rooms with view probably costs more). You have to pay for everything. Internet in the room? Pay 14 Dollars. Want to use the in door safe? pay 3 Dollars. Breakfast? You can buy in the hotels restaurants (not cheap at all, by the way). Although we have activated the safe, for a fee, it did not work (we were credited at check put). The bell boy which handled the suitcases out of the car told us that he is not the guy who brings them to the room (a big hint that you need to tip each one of them separately). The location of the hotel was not very comfortable. To reach the Strip, you have to go take the monorail ($ 5 per passenger each way). In short - next time I'm in Vegas I'll take another hotel . One good thing to say - the mattresses were excellent and very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “second time in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: eddieliz01
Reviews.Content: Second time in Las Vegas and in this hotel. nothing fancy about it but the price was right. easy to get in and out of this location and not busy at all. rooms are nice and clean. their buffet is small but very busy, gotta get in line early. if you don't need the traffic and hectic atmosphere of the trendy hotels in Las Vegas, this is the place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Go somewhere Else...OMG”
Reviews.Author: dansterboy01
Reviews.Content: I am a Diamond Hilton Honors Member. I reserved a King, smoking suite. with a fantastic view. Upon check in. I was given a twin bed, (Bad mattress) No smoking floor and no mini bar. I was told on check in, what I reserved was not available. this is the Hilton name, but not really a Hilton, just smoke in the bathroom, as I was told...I flew in from Honolulu and was a late check in. I did, what the check in girl said. okay upon getting back to my room. I received from housekeeping a note and 5 cards around my room. (NON SMOKING ROOM) ect... just the beginning. I took the Craps class to learn how to play. Our teacher could have been so less interested in our gaming and fun experience. However, on a light note. We all went to the craps table and played for hours. The team that was there our first time, was phenominal...helped us, told us where to place our bets for the best returns. Had a fanstastic time. Then the shift change. Evil crew came on. no patience, yelled at me 2x's to get my dice to the end of the table. It was a total turn around. Talked to the night manager. She was at first kind and helpful. Brought me to a table to fill out a form, then left me for over 48 mins. I actually saw her laughing and talking with the very few people I was complaining about. Went over to her, said you left me sitting there. She said, Oh, nobody came to see you???? What/??? whatever.... I went to my room and left the next morning. NEVER AGAIN.......bye forever Las Vegas Hilton...for me forever. Palazzo................

Reviews.Title: “I was dissapointed in this Hilton as far as Hilton's go.”
Reviews.Author: CCut
Reviews.Content: I was very dissappointed in the food quality for the room service. I ordered in for breakfast and dinner and both breakfasts and the dinner were burnt. On the breakfast I ordered over easy eggs, bacon hashbrowns and toast. The bacon was burnt to a crisp. The hashbrowns were burned the back of the toast was black and my eggs were cooked hard on both days. Then dinner I ordered a filet mignon and one side was perfect and the other side was burnt and the whole thing tasted burned. I put a do not disturb sign on my door as I went out for an hour and came back and the cleaning people came in anyway and moved everything.

Reviews.Title: “almost perfect”
Reviews.Author: belindalnv
Reviews.Content: valet parking was full when we arrived for our reservation & the self parking garage is a long way from the front registration desk. very uncomfortable & annoying walk. other than that, we got an amazing deal: 2 nights valentines day weekend $130 PLUS coupons for free cocktails & buffet meals! staff was professional. rooms were perfect. clean. modern super comfy. will stay here again for sure. the monorail station is feet away from the main entrance. & if you prefer to stay away from the strip, then this hilton is perfect. we walked to circus circus w/no problem!

Reviews.Title: “Hilton remodeled rooms are good bet”
Reviews.Author: kevlarw
Reviews.Content: Stayed here as part of major conference at the convention center next door. Very convenient to the center. My 27th floor room looked recently remodeled and was quite comfortable. Broadband internet access was via WiFi with at $14/day charge. Great spa and pool. Nice range of restaurant options. Heard from others that their rooms were not as nice so be sure to check about getting a remodeled room.

Reviews.Title: “Dated Hotel with no service”
Reviews.Author: Persophonepb
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for a weekend for a medical conferance. It is far away from the main strip. However, the monorail station was right at the hotel. I bought a weekend pass with unlimited travel which made getting aroung very easy. The rooms are very clean and comfortable. The casino area was dated, including the Star Trek theme area! Seeing Barry Manilow's face everywhere was getting quite disturbing! The only coffee available was 4.50 for a small cup. The price of water was 6.00 a bottle.

Reviews.Title: “Remodled and quite nice...but parking is a pain”
Reviews.Author: ajcloward
Reviews.Content: The rooms were quite large and very comfortable. I had a view of the stratosphere and even on the 8th floor, the view was awesome. Beds were comfortable and the rooms were very quiet. Unfortunately internet access is a whopping $14 a day! I was taking online courses at the time, so I had no choice, but this is outrageous when other hotels offer it for free. The other pain is parking. If you self-park, you while walk FOREVER to get back inside the building and then another FOREVER to make it to your room. Not a place you'll want to stay if you will be doing a lot of "coming and going". All of the Star Trek stuff has gone away, but a lot of the structures still remain which kind of seem out of place in some areas. This is definitely a place to stay if you want somewhere off the strip (maybe a good spot for families).

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel if you don't need or want to stay on the strip”
Reviews.Author: lurch1
Reviews.Content: I don't understand the 'shabby' or 'cleanliness' reviews here...place was up with the typical Hilton right down to the carpet and wallpaper in the halls. I last stayed here in 1998 and after reading reviews concerned that maybe it got old and not kept up. I was happy when I arrived that the standards were not as expected...they were like I say...typical high Hilton standards. Very clean. very nice beds, decent sided room, friendly and helpful staff. I came for the Hoops Central NCAA event in the theater and it was so well run that for the first time in 24 years of Vegas visits I DID NOT LEAVE MY HOTEL, NOR DID I VISIT THE STRIP. The hilton had it all - gambling, grub, mid-high end dining, great events and sports book! Best part was Barry Manilow leaving for the Paris and allowing for the theater set-up for the NCAAs - 5 large screen TVs, plenty of seating, prizes, $2 beers, hot dogs, local betting books just outside the event, go-go dancers above the BJ tables...used to go to Paris for this event, but thats where Barry went so it shut down there. I will come to Hilton from now on...its run better and the hotel room prices are way better for the same quality room.

Reviews.Title: “Much Better Than Expected”
Reviews.Author: familyguyMN
Reviews.Content: With all the negs, we were hesitant but came away very pleased. We were looking for a spot that would not be too far from the action (walkable or a short ride to) but quieter than the strip, a nice pool and a decent price. We found exactly what we wanted at the Las Vegas Hilton. Upgraded to Resorts Club (highly recommend) room with lounge and awesome beds, adequate size. After reading reviews, you should know a few things: you are NOT on the strip so you will need to walk (10 mins. to Riviera, 20 mins. or so to Venitian), taxi, monorail, etc. to get there; upgraded room is worth it (amazing that people will think nothing of tossing out $25 or more on one hand of BJ or a roll of the dice but then skimp on room expense and then complain); standard rooms will NOT have free Internet; water will cost you; there are no coffee makers. All of this has been posted and yet people still complain about it. With the Resort Club room upgrade, we received free Internet, free bottled water, free power breakfast and snacks throught the day, free workout facility access, free newspaper, upgraded beds and renovated rooms, soft robes, special check-in priviledges and some other stuff. The upgrade cost was like $20 a day which all four of us thought was more than reasonable for the cost (i'm pretty sure we drank more than $20 in beverages each day alone). The food at both the cafe and buffet were better than expected. The cafe might be a little pricier than back home, but certainly not out of line compared to other places in town and surprisingly good and ample portions. The dinner buffet was decent, not high-end but not low end. For less than $20 each, we found it just fine. Rather than hitting someplace on the strip or elsewhere for ribs, we did it at the buffet, definitely for less. Overall, the property is not perfect and some details are overlooked (could you maybe fix the elevator button plates in the lobby of the north tower as that is what many people's first impression is going to be?). However, nothing of significance bothered us for five days. The weather was great so the pool area was used much and was just fine. Staff was friendly, service was decent. If you want a first-class experience, LVH is probably not what you are looking for. But if you are seeking a nice property for a decent price, plenty of amenities and a bit quieter experience than the hustle and bustle of the strip yet near enough to it, we highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient to the stip via Monorail”
Reviews.Author: Petalpalz
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel while attending a conference in this hotel. It was very convenient and comfortable with multiple options for dining. We had a value package with our conference. We chose the upgraded concierge lounge which included a number of very nice options, most particularly the free wine and snacks in the afternoon. I will post a photo of what the hours and the amenities included. This was a very good deal if you can get a good price for this. Access to the strip was a quick monorail ride away. I loved the monorail access and bought a 3 day pass for my stay. My only problem was I didn't realize the monorail closed sometime during the wee hours and I had to walk back to the Hotel. It was scarey and dark and there were loonies everywhere on the way to the hotel. A taxi driver quoted me $20 for a 2 mile ride which I thought was ridiculous. The walk took about 20 + minutes from where I ended up on the strip to the hotel room, although it was only a few miles away. (dumb thing to do) Casino is rather large and we had fair luck.

Reviews.Title: “Shabby but cheap and friendly”
Reviews.Author: JoanneTravels66
Reviews.Content: I got a room here on Priceline for $35, so we were prepared to be comfortable with whatever we got. At checkin, the receptionist told us they were out of king rooms, but when I told her it was our anniversary she found us a room with a king bed on the 28th floor, strip view. That was very nice. However, when we got to the room, two of our water glasses had been used and left dirty in the room. The bed was also mussed up as though people had been sitting on it. When I called housekeeping, there were pretty indifferent. The couch and chair were very shabby and uncomfortable. We were obviously in an un-renovated room with old furniture and decor. The next morning the bathroom ceiling started leaking when my husband was in the shower. Clearly there was a leak in the shower above. Water started pouring out of the fan vent, which was broken anyhow. The hotel manager was also indifferent when we told her about this and did not offer to move us to another room. The morning after that, a crack opened up in the ceiling and water started coming down in the middle of the bathroom. To sum up: the front desk staff was very helpful and we enjoyed our view. For $35 I was happy enough, but I would have been pretty pissed off if I had paid $135 per night.

Reviews.Title: “Hilton you draw on yesteryears glory”
Reviews.Author: move2dubai
Reviews.Content: Have been staying at this hotel every year since 1995 plus we are Hilton Gold Members, which once meant something. Our stay this time was with one word- unconvenient. The windows in the room were so dirty, that one hardly could see outside. The A/C fan and the dated fridge were so loud, that sleeping was impossible, with them on. Valet parking took forever, even though it was not busy. The whole staff was not very friendly at all. They said, the room was newly remodeled, but I guess, they just threw in a flatscreen, to keep their star-rating...

Reviews.Title: “A great stay with a great price.”
Reviews.Author: gd0521
Reviews.Content: all was good nice large clean rooms, good customer services. Only thing missing was better pillows or more of them and hand towels.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible Hotel”
Reviews.Author: UncleStu77
Reviews.Content: Incredible hotel. It is so big it has 3 towers and each tower has elevators. All the towers connect so it doesnt really matter what elevators you take.

Reviews.Title: “Very Friendly Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BeachDLT-50
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Las Vegas Hilton for three nights on a business trip. We were on the 24th floor (club lounge level). After reading previous reviews I asked for a room away from the elevators. The desk personnel were very accomodating. There is self parking that was close in proximity to the side of the hotel where our room was, so it was easy to get in and out without a long walk.
