I used the gym every day which was small but adequate. If you don't have Hilton Honors Gold or higher, it's $20 per day to use the gym. Breakfast was included and was perhaps the best breakfast buffet I've ever had! They have everything set up for all three meals although we were never there after 10:00 A.M. The club lounge on the 24th floor was comfortable and well stocked. It's open from 6:00 A.M. until 8:00 P.M. There's fruit, muffins and coffee in the morning and wine, cheese and beer in the evening. Although the hotel is not on the strip, it seems like you have to drive everywhere anyway, so it's no big deal. I'd definitely return when my travel plans take me to Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Do Not Stay Here!”
Reviews.Author: frausweetpea
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Las Vegas Hilton with a conference I attended. I was told when I booked my room I was going to receive a $100 coupon. At check out I was charged for the gift card. Even after I presented the hotel with the document stating the hotel was going to give me the coupon I was still charged for it. I tryed to contact Hilton and have been ignored. I would never stay at the Las Vegas Hiton again and I would advise anyone not to stay here. They have the worst customer service I have ever experienced.

Reviews.Title: “Urine, little hot water, etc., etc.”
Reviews.Author: Southside
Reviews.Content: Just spent a night at this property. On the positive side, the room (which I was told was recently renovated) was fine; the staff was very nice; the buffet included with my stay (as a Diamond) pretty good, and the folks handling the buffet--that is, the hostess and the busboy--actually quite impressive in terms of how they respectively moved people efficiently and cheerfully and kept the coffee coming despite being very busy. In fact, if there is a Champion Busboy award, that guy would win it. Still, there were a few problems with the place: 1. When I first stepped into the bathroom of the room, I found urine in the toilet. Not the worst problem in the world, and certainly one that went away with a quick flush, but still kind of gross. Makes me wonder what the staff does and doesn't do to prepare a room for new guests. 2. It took about 10 minutes for the shower to warm up, even given that it was mid-afternoon (and thus not a busy time of day) when I used it. The water got tolerably cool (as opposed to very cold) after a couple of minutes, but it was only as I was finishing that the hot water really kicked in. 3. The room clock was set to the wrong time and it wasn't clear how to adjust the time to fix that. 4. No coffee maker in room. 5. An extra charge and and extra step to use the room safe--the first time I've come across this in many, many hotel stays. More generally, the place has the feel of a mega-hotel in terms of it being very busy, having a casino in the lobby, etc., but is not very conveniently located. In and of itself these were not major problems for me, but the more specific matters I just listed would keep me from returning to the place.

Reviews.Title: “More Than I expected!!!!!1”
Reviews.Author: slotqueenEastCoast
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hilton Valentines Week to celebrate anniversary. As soon we arrived in the hotel there was mass confusion at front desk. A woman was raising holy he--!!! She said she was sent to two rooms full of mold and mildew!!! Oh no, here we go!!! My husband stepped up to the Hilton Honors Line, spoke with very nice young lady, and we were upgraded to a beautiful suite for an additional $100.00 per night!!! You should have seen the suite!!! BEAUTIFUL, I have no complaints about the rooms cleaniness. The food was delicious at the Paradise Cafe (best bacon cheeseburger I have ever tasted)!!!. The casino was well lit and properly ventilated. The security guard was not helpful!!!! Great location if you do not want to deal with the busy strip!!!

Reviews.Title: “starwars”
Reviews.Author: ripchix
Reviews.Content: awesome bar and ride a bit crowded during convention

Reviews.Title: “Meh... It's Vegas”
Reviews.Author: colinaz
Reviews.Content: I am not a Vegas kind of person. Sure, I'm probably in their prime demographic, but I've never had particularly good experiences there and find most everything about it annoying. BUT, I was passing through on a larger roadtrip and it just made sense to get a room for the night. I wasn't picky about where it was, but I wanted a decent neighborhood that would allow me to walk to things and I wanted a cheap room. What else is there for that in Vegas but the Strip? I was surprised to find a 3* on the Strip on Travelocity's relatively new blind booking system for $34. This turned out to be the Hilton. For a Saturday night near the Strip (or almost anywhere in Vegas), $34 is a steal, I think. Easy to find? How could you miss this hotel with its giant "H". That "H" out front sort of defines "ginormous." There was only one entrance, which was nice, as the elaborate layouts of some Vegas hotels can be confusing. Self-parking was at the back and required a drive through the valet area, which I expected. You can actually access it a lot easier on the street running behind the hotel. The parking garage was, of course, all the way on the other side of the hotel complex from the front desk. Again, I expect this only because I've stayed in these hotels enough to know how they work. A long walk through the casino and shopping complex led me to a line. There was the VIP line, the Hilton Vacations line and the regular Joe/you're not paying enough to be here line. It took maybe 5 minutes to get to a desk clerk and there, my reservations was not found. I looked up the confirmation on my phone and read off the number. The clerk placed a call and I was checked in. This was Travelocity's fault, as they had, I guess, not sent the reservation. I was given the choice of room type and smoking or non-smoking. I was also offered an "upgrade" to a "refurbished" room. No thanks, I'll stick with my excessively cheap room. Room was on the 14th floor on the southwest side of the hotel. I had a view of the Sahara, Stratosphere and the start of the Strip. The room included a flat-screen TV, desk, king bed, alarm clock, and a small closet. There was wired and wireless internet available but, of course, there was an excessive fee ($13 per 24 hours). But, again, I expected this. Now, I think where this room noticeably separated itself from the "refurbished" rooms (although I didn't see those) was the bathroom. It had pink tiles circa early 80's. The tub and shower were obviously fairly old, with rust on the tub drain, and the other fixtures were definitely dated as well. I've seen this in other hotels but, where this one came out ahead was the fact that this horrible tile and generally array of bathroom oldness was spotlessly clean. How they kept those tiles so clean for that many years is, I'm sure, a little bit of a secret, but I'd like to know. The bed was very comfortable. Even though I wasn't by the elevators, I could constantly hear some sort of motor that sounded a lot like that of an elevator behind my bed. I don't know what it was, but it was a little bit annoying. I still slept well though. In spite of my dislike for the Strip, I did walk down there at night, mainly in search of food, which is always excessively expensive in that area. If I were female and unaccompanied, I would have been a little worried about that walk. There are few people and it isn't terribly well-lit. It's also a good ten minutes from the front doors of the hotel to Las Vegas Blvd. I made it down to about Bally's and just took the monorail back. For a public transit option, it's definitely a bit of a rip-off, but it was convenient, especially considering that the Hilton has a station right out in front of it. For what I paid, I would say "exceptional." Overall though, I've seen a lot of better 3*'s out there. The room and hotel experience I had was worth quite a bit more than what I paid for it.

Reviews.Title: “Suite Deal in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Emoker
Reviews.Content: Check in was a breeze no lines at 5pm, was given key to room and a free $100 gift card to use on property as part of my suite vegas package purchased from the hilton website, this package also comes with acess to the resort club on the 24th floor. After being directed to my elevators I proceed up to the 3rd floor, which is the only floor the Lanai Suite is located on. As I open my room I am pleasantly suprised, the room is big and has very high cielings, a lower level sitting area and a slider to the roof top patio and private cabana with furniture. The room does not come w/ a fridge however I called down to the front desk and they had one brought right up within 20 minutes. The bathroom was very nice nothing super special. Drawbacks to room were the 2 1/2" gap under the door that connects the hotel room next door, after shoving a towel under it all was good. After settling in I decided to go check out the resort club on the 24th floor and see what they had to eat, after knocking on the door because front desk agent never gave me a gold key to enter, the attendant then allows me to enter only to then call down to front desk to figure out if I was allowed to be in there or not, well after almost 5 minutes she gets it figured out and I am allowed to eat the free fruit and cookies they have out, along with free beer and wine, no mixed drinks or hot snacks like the Hyatt Regency Clubs do, which really disapointed me since that was the level I expected from Hilton. After leaving the Resort Club room I went down to front desk to get proper gold color key card so as not to indure the embarassment I went through earlier trying to access the Resort Club room, I get the key and all is good no lines only took about 5 minutes for her to verify on the computer, quite a little bit to long if you ask me but who knows. Next day I go to resort club food is the same cookies and fruit no hot apps. at all nothing fancy just a bunch of cookies come on, grab a couple of free cokes and go back to room. Hotel will give a free $5 food voucher if you dont want them to clean your room each day, its there way of being green they say, so I recieved 3 $5 vouchers for declining housekeeping and was able to goto the buffet for free basically, this was a great program and hope more hotels will offer it. All in all I really enjoyed my stay here, the resort club food was what it was and who cares cause it was part of the package but if they try to sell it to you at the desk as an upgrade dont go for it, its not worth it. The Suite Vegas Package is however the best package deal I ever booked in Vegas if it is still around next time I will definetly book again.

Reviews.Title: “Las Vegas Trade Show Visit”
Reviews.Author: LawrenceH3
Reviews.Content: Excellent. VIP Check In Lounge. Upgrade to a suite!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good deal if you don't have to stay on the strip”
Reviews.Author: Jeff1456
Reviews.Content: The hotel was clean, comfortable and had a great buffet resturant. It is at the end of the strip so you have to rely on the monorail to get you where the action is. That's not necessarily bad as there is less noise and fewer people. They offer some really great deals.

Reviews.Title: “Las Vegas Hilton a wonderful time!”
Reviews.Author: RachaelM2
Reviews.Content: I very much enjoyed this Hotel. We stayed the last weekend of "The Star Trek Experience" and the famous Quarks Bar. My party and I had the most wonderful time.

Reviews.Title: “Not impressed”
Reviews.Author: laut0022
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for four nights in February 2010 for a conference. Overall, I was not impressed with my stay. I had two major gripes: 1) lack of a coffee maker in the room and 2) the fee of $20 a day to use the work out facilities. In addition, I was in a non-smoking room, however, the smoke smell was quite potent in my room. Other annoyances included: awful tasting water (they did offer bottled water for $4/bottle) and the in-room safe cost $3/day. There were some nice features of the hotel however. The bed was comfortable, view of the mountains was beautiful, and the room was quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible place to stay ~ DONT DO IT!”
Reviews.Author: BnM19
Reviews.Content: Even if you want to save some money, it definitely isn't worth it. We came at 1 oclock at night, and our reservation was sold out. We reserved the room a month in advance and their explanation was that we came too late. After some negotiation, they gave us a room but after we came to the 20th floor, we opened the door, only to find another family already in there. We had another lovely trip downstairs. They gave us another room, next to an elevator. This room was unbearably loud due to the adjacent elevator, so we take another trip downstairs (of course with our luggage at 2 oclock at night). They gave us a 3rd room (our reservation was gone huh?) and the room had a shower that didnt work and the drain in the bathtub was clogged, but we resigned to this room considering we were tired and it was already 2-30 oclock. We agreed to stay in this room, but requested the next morning we would recieve another room. The whole process took us an hour and a half and left us with a bitter taste in our mouths. We had never previously experienced such service in our lives. The manager was so nice this night, he gave us a 100 dollar credit for eating at any restaurant/bar in the Hilton. Of course, this was too good to be true, because of course this 100 dollar credit was charged out of our credit card, which took us another 40 minutes of negotiation. All in all, this was a most terrible experience, and we felt as though we stayed at some cheap motel, not the critically acclaimed Hilton "hotel". We wanted to save some money, but we concluded that it would be worth to spend a little more money so you can implement a little more enjoyment into your vacation.

Reviews.Title: “DONT STAY HERE”
Reviews.Author: wontgothere77
Reviews.Content: Just came back from Vegas and our hotel was so bad I am placing comment for the first time on trip advisor. We normally stay at embassy or tropicana. We decided to go out of the norm and booked a room at Hilton for Valentines Weekend. We stood in the central tower on 16th floor. Well first of all the area was very noisy-apparently the noise was coming from the elevator (we were three rooms away from elevator). Secondly, the air worked horribly- thank god weather was in the 60's. Thirdly, the bathroom- shower was dripping, bathtub was rusty. We stood there three nights and the last day, housekeeping only left one bath,hand,washcloth for the both of us. We asked them for at least one more bath towel and they only had washcloth. The price was economical, but to be truthful it still wasnt worth what we paid, $125 two nights, $89 last night. I will never stay there again!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Hilton needs updating”
Reviews.Author: TatertotTexas
Reviews.Content: Although the rooms were spacious, the furniture was scratched, chipped and scarred. No coffee makers in rooms. Bed very hard and uncomfortable for a premium room upgrade. My sons first trip to Las Vegas as an adult and he was DISAPPOINTED with his room also and had no view as promised with the room upgrade. Save your money if you are thinking about staying here. WOULD NOT RECOMMEND TO ANYONE. COULD USE better ventilation also very smokey.

Reviews.Title: “It is a constant; have been going for 25 years....”
Reviews.Author: chrisdaveabel
Reviews.Content: Each year we return to the Hilton, we are always satisfied, never dissapointed. The hotel is not the most lavish, but the rooms have been remodeled in the last few years. The Star Trek exhibit was there a LONG time but now there is something new... and we keep going back for THE SPORTSBOOK. Cant beat the sportsbook at the hilton. You can book your room and know it will be clean and the staff relatively nice, not rude ever. Beds are comfy and the food at the buffet and the hamburger place is great. It wont knock your socks off, but you can always count on it being a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “The Hilton Hotel/Casino”
Reviews.Author: TraciL3
Reviews.Content: The Hilton was a very clean, beautiful Hotel and Casino. The only thing I didn't like was they didn't have coffee pots in the guest rooms!! That's all I wasn't happy about.

Reviews.Title: “You could get something better and better located.”
Reviews.Author: YupiYey
Reviews.Content: This place it's old, far from the street, and has the ugliest Casin i've ever seen (It looks like the space mountain). and honestly it's not that cheap, so in my opinion there are better options where to stay in Las Vegas

Reviews.Title: “A little noisy, a little dated, but still would return”
Reviews.Author: dcpatti
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights booked at the last minute when we could not get through snowstorms on our flight back home. I picked this hotel because we'd been on the Strip for the "real" 4 nights of our getaway and they'd taken enough of our money, and because I've got Gold status with Hilton and trying to maintain it into next year. The lobby is spotless, very busy and full of people and a little confusing but once you've gotten your bearings, it's actually quite easy to navigate, even on the gaming floor, which is uncommon in many resorts and hotels out here. We had an early check-in and were given an option of waiting for a room, a ready room that didn't have our bed preference, or one with the bed preference that was ready but near an elevator. We took the near-the-elevator room and probably will not do that again. The elevator runs constantly and unlike other hotels where you might hear a ding now and then or people talking, you actually hear the whirring of the elevator up and down the elevator shaft. We did not complain about it because we agreed to this room, we're tired, and we can live with it but if we'd stayed another night, we would have to be moved. It is quite noisy and it's constant. If you are given a room near an elevator, think twice before accepting it. The room itself is very comfortable with nice decor, deep reds and golds, and we had a phenomenal view over the mountains. Lovely at sunrise. The room is spacious and very clean. Bed is comfortable but bedding is strange; seems like there are too many flat sheets on here, and they wrinkle easily. So while the bed is comfortable, the bedding makes it a little uncomfortable. Having a small fridge in the room is a nice touch. The bathtub is more round than a normal bathtub so one person can have a nice soak; the bathmat gives a dated, faded appearance and should be replaced or left out entirely. Hallway noise travels very easily to your room so our Superbowl night was interesting to say the least. But any Vegas hotel is going to have hallway noise and in all honesty this bed is far more comfortable than the one at Monte Carlo. Service in the casino was better than at the strip hotels; lots of cocktail waitresses and they actually wait on you, instead of having social hour with eachother like the ladies at the Mirage. There are plenty of table games and the sports book is massive but the slots are a litle dated, like they get the second pick after MGM has taken all the new and flashy ones. The restaurants--- we enjoyed the steakhouse (the creamed spinach is amazing) but were very disappointed that about half of the restaurants were closed on Sundays and Mondays--- the only nights we were here--- so plan accordingly. The buffet has fewer choices than some of the strip hotels but does all of those items very well so I like it better than others; who really cares if there's chinese food and pizza for breakfast if the pancakes are cold and rubbery? The food on their breakfast buffet at the Hilton is fresh and well-stocked, also seems to be cooked in smaller batches so it's always fresh. Nice pancakes :) Overall, we'd probably stay here again; it's not a bad hotel and definitely a great price plus we won a fair amount in the keno bar. But no way would I ever have another near-the-elevator room here, even if it was free.

Reviews.Title: “A Little Distant From Strip but Beautiful, Reasonable Price Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: 2Rio2016
Reviews.Content: It was my first time going to Las Vegas so I decided to book an inexpensive stay at The Hilton during January 16 to 20th, 2010 since I made it to Vegas two days before my girlfriends and they were booked at MGM Grand. I found that via travelocity it was cheaper to book hotel and air then booking air alone wich was $300 more without the hotel. Therefore I took what was the cheapest combination at that time Hilton + Air, I was very scared to stay at Hilton based on the negative reviews but I was pleasantly surprised when I arrived. Although it is at a $20 cab ride to the center of the strip the hotel is beautiful, clean and the room was spacious. I also found the Deli to serve delicious snacks at a reasonable price. I was able to go to the stratosphere only a few minutes north and check out the beautiful view. Circus Circus is only a few blocks from it but it was one sad circus. I really enjoyed my stay at Hilton and would recommend it to anyone hesitant the only negative is that its north of the strip and a long walking distance and cab rides are expensive but you can pay $7 and get on the bus for 24hrs.

Reviews.Title: “We had a great stay...contrary to some recent posted reviews”
Reviews.Author: picframer
Reviews.Content: We were leary of staying at the LV Hilton again after reading recent reviews. We had stayed there two years ago during a business conference and had a great room and good experience then. When we checked in mid-afternoon on Sat. Jan. 23 for another business conference, we walked right up and secured our room with no hassle. My husband did show his Hilton Honors card and we received our room documentation....a lovely king room on the non-smoking 23rd floor of the east tower. The room was well-kept, nicely furnished and clean...bath was well appointed and clean also. No coffee maker but did have a small refrigerator which suited us fine. There is a very nice coffee and pastry bar in the lobby and my sweet husband went down each morning for juice and muffins or rolls. Since this older property Hilton is away from much of the action, we bought a 3-day monorail pass and headed to the strip numerous times. It is very convenient, fast and safe. We didn't eat at the hotel restaurants this time because there are so many other options at other hotels. Our only complaint is that the casino is very smoky and not as trendy as some of the other hotels...but we are not gamblers and we only walked through the casino on our way to the conference center. We were contiually impressed by the the responsiveness and friendliness of the hotel staff. Checkout was fast and efficient at the end of our 4-day stay. We paid a conference rate of $89. a night for the room and felt it was a good value for an outstanding room and service. There is also a good business center where we were able to ship some materials back to our business with a very efficient and friendly staff. All in all, we were very satisfied and would have no hestiation to stay at this property again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Beam Me Up”
Reviews.Author: JamesS2
Reviews.Content: This is where they do the "Star Trek" experience/ tour. We got our fill of all things "Klingon" at the expo while staying in large clean rooms with great staff and service. Older end of the strip, its easy walking distance to many of the larger casinos. (Circus Circus, Excaliber)

Reviews.Title: “Nice room, average service”
Reviews.Author: kcweir
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this Hilton January 15th to 17th. This was my first time staying there as I was going with my mother, sister, her kids and my kids, my mother booked the rooms for us. There were supposed to be three ajoining rooms and we got three rooms fairly close to each other instead. That was a big problem for us because we had four young children with us and it would have been much easier to open the doors to our ajoining rooms instead of traipsing up and down the hall. We stayed in the newly remodeled tower and found the rooms to be nice. Comfortable beds. Lots of noise in the hallways at night, but it is Vegas. Overall, it was okay but I would have preferred a hotel closer to the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Alternative”
Reviews.Author: JohnroFlorida
Reviews.Content: Stayed this past weekend at the Las Vegas Hilton. Received an excellent rate and with Gold Status even received full complimentary breakfast (outstanding Sunday Brunch - left me even more pleased with my stay and choice of hotel). Free parking but $13.99 for internet. Hotel right on monorail line so can get to the strip in minutes. Can get expensive though if a lot of people in your party and multiple trips are made over a number of days. For my group and the rate received just couldn't beat the deal. Gold status also bumped me up to a deluxe room in the North Tower. Everything was great with the room - newer room - refrigerator - LCD TV. No issues with check-in - was taken care of in about 5 minutes and front desk fully staffed. Everyone on staff was friendly and helpful. I would definitely consider staying again next trip to Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Too far from Strip”
Reviews.Author: CLEMAUD
Reviews.Content: Ok if you are a good deal but very too far from strip... you could take the tramway but it is very expensive ! try to go in an other hotel the next time.

Reviews.Title: “Still a Very Nice Hotel, some Engineering prbms with room”
Reviews.Author: dctraveler004
Reviews.Content: Have stayed here 20+ times over 15 years and continue to enjoy the services for Hilton HH gold status and the quality of the rooms. Remodeled rooms are great, and the convenience of the hotel for someone driving is second to none among quality hotels. The Spa remains quite good and the breakfast buffet is near the top of the Vegas heap, especially if part of your room package. We did have trouble with the heat and a dripping bathtub faucet and engineers seemed in short supply, although it was over the Xmas holiday. But the rooms were very clean and the strip views remain great. Rates remain competitive for nonconvention periods. We'll stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “1-2 hour wait just to check in for prepaid room. I hope you like long lines.”
Reviews.Author: troobie
Reviews.Content: I purchased a room for 2 nights on the Las Vegas Hilton's website. I arrived about 11:30 PM and, after 15 minutes of searching for the lobby, rounded a corner to see the check in desk and what resembled a line at an amusement park. The line to check in wrapped back and forth 6 times before finally heading off into the distance. I could not even find the end of the line. There were family members lying all around the lobby waiting. I was told by a lady standing near the line that her husband had been waiting for well over an hour and that I should go get a coffee and relax because it would be a while. Instead of getting a coffee I called the hotel and after 20 minutes was able to get a "manager" on the phone to cancel my reservation without any penalties. For the record, there were only 3 people at the check in desk attending to customers.

Reviews.Title: “Very helpful staff, good in-room connectivity”
Reviews.Author: dpeyton
Reviews.Content: My only complaint is the layout of the first floor, which requires you to walk through a casino whenever you want to go from one point to another (lobby, room elevators, buffet, etc.), but most of the resorts on and near the strip have this "feature."

Reviews.Title: “Good value, quiet location at end of strip”
Reviews.Author: tresjolie1
Reviews.Content: Check in was easy and quick. We had made our reservations on line and everything was correct. Our room was oversized, a comfy bed, great view from the 25th floor and best of all two chairs; one with an ottoman. There was a also a small fridge. The building is located at the end of the strip and has a monorail stop and also a parking garage for guests that want to self park their cars. This was our second visit to the hotel and we felt it was a good visit. What could be improved? A reading lamp to go with the arm chairs, thicker towels, a coffee maker and a freshing up of the corridors. The small coffee/sandwich area in the main lobby has very tasty sandwiches. The other food we had there was average, but service was very good. Bear in mind that this is an older property, but well maintained and staffed and I think the rooms have been recently refurbished. Everything in our room had a fresh look..

Reviews.Title: “Jaded, faded and flawed.”
Reviews.Author: philsayer
Reviews.Content: I was staying a few nights for an exhibition (Power-Gen) and stayed on a few more days for sightseeing and R&R. Our convention rate was a staggering $140 per night (arranged thru a third party) but this dropped to a much more believable $50 a night when the power engineers (and the cowboys!) had left. A colleague and I decided that at $50 a night we'd stay on in the Hilton rather than waste half a day moving hotels - we were only staying another three days, and wanted to squeeze in a lot of activities. Frankly, it's barely worth $50, plus tax, plus broadband, plus smoke everywhere (even the non-smoking floors have ashtrays by the lifts - good grief) and very basic accommodation. Room safe too small to take a 13" Mac, no coffee maker, really zilch by way of pampering or extras. Air conditioning/heating is either on or off - single speed fan and no thermostat. You can choose to have it warmed or cooled. Ummm - this is 2009, right? Elsewhere, friendly staff, great concierge, Paradise Cafe not at all bad for breakfast and lunch but strangely it is closed for a few hours after lunch, leaving you with really next-to-no food option inside the hotel - even though their small Pizza Hut and other franchise places were totally closed for a refurb! You'd have thought... etc., etc. We had rooms in Central Tower (2040 and 2041 since you ask) which were handy for the lifts and had a reasonable view over towards the Strip and the mountains - glorious sunrises every morning. Room was slightly cleaned each day, probably - hard to say. The bed was made and the cheap soap occasionally replenished. Apparently, years ago, it was called the International, and Elvis played and stayed there. The star has faded.

Reviews.Title: “A relief from the strip”
Reviews.Author: localbeans
Reviews.Content: I stayed for one night at this hotel and was with my husband, Mother-in-law and brother-in-law. I thought this hotel was just "ok" until I stayed the next two nights at the MGM grand. Comparatively the Hilton was SO much better. It was far more relaxing and easier to navigate. If you are in Vegas for a party, this may not be the right hotel. But if you are in Vegas to have fun and log in some vacation time, this may be a better bet. This is not a chaotic hotel - nor will it be the focal point of your stay. But it will give you a peaceful place to stay when you are done with the day's excitement and just want to sleep. The rooms are standard up-scale, but not 5 star, hotel rooms. Though I think it is what people are starting to call outdated. The service was excellent - the valet gave us some great tips on where to park when we went to the rest of the strip to avoid confusing parking lots, congestion and too much walking (Harrah's). We are Gold members and were upgraded to an amazing two room suite. We wanted to switch rooms because we needed one more bed and we were switched right away - no questions asked. The buffet was good and vegetarian friendly. The shower was a little low on the water pressure and there aren't fans in the bathrooms so the mirror fogs up. Other reviews complained there were no coffee makers and that the casino was smoky. I've stayed in three hotels in the strip and none have coffee makers - this is a city that wants your money - why would they give you a coffee maker when they can sell it too you? I'm sensitive to smoke and while it was there, like in all casino's, it was not overwhelming. It is a little off the strip but I would stay there again. Careful of the time share people. If it seems to good to be true it probably is.

Reviews.Title: “Make sure to read the reviews, and then stay somewhere else.”
Reviews.Author: BflyVi
Reviews.Content: We tried to get the best deal possible so we could spend our money on shows and at the tables rather than on the room. I so wish we'd checked the reviews here, because they are right on target. This hotel should not have the Hilton name on it at all; it does not even come close to the standard you expect from that chain. The whole hotel is heavily worn and dirty, and next to even the downtown properties, looks like it has seen far better days. Non-smoking rooms are a joke, thanks to the highly interconnected ventilation system. Hot water is a sometimes treat, luke warm is about the most you can count on. The bed is uncomfortably soft, and the pillows all need to be replaced. When we asked for four firmer / non-feather pillows, we got one foam pillow about an inch thick and another sad bag of feathers. Housekeeping is very inconsistent, every day we've been missing lotion or wash cloths or something. No coffee / tea in the rooms, no mini-bar, and no premium TV channels (though that's probably common in Vegas) on the 42" TV. As for the rest of the property, the casinos are mostly empty all the time, which is not a good thing in Vegas. The front desk is ALWAYS (like at 12:30 a.m. last night) about 30 people deep; they just don't staff for good service. For some reason, we've also seen dozens of couples / families sitting in the lobby with all their luggage and bags for hours. No idea what this is about, but between them, the stroller traffic and the little kids playing tag, this feels a lot more like Disney than it should. Lastly, there's the location. Yes, it's on the monorail, but that is a) expensive and b) only stops in 7 places. If you want to go anywhere except the actual hotels on the stops, you are walking. A lot. This is also a good half mile away from the Deuce, which moves at a snails pace down the strip, runs far less often than advertised, and is often too full to board. If you have 3 or more in your party, stick with taxis, the price will be comparable and your feet will thank you. Next time, we'll look at staying at some of the Downtown properties. At least a couple that we saw there were very clean and much less smoky, and they are priced attractively compared to the strip. But don't take my word for it, read the other reviews and then STAY SOMEWHERE ELSE!

Reviews.Title: “i wont book for this hotel again”
Reviews.Author: king123456
Reviews.Content: 1 :the room and bathroom ventilation system is terrible,there's no fresh air to breathing . 2: we oringinaly book one room for 2 days online ,but something comes up,we have to stay one more night.we confirm the room price for the extra night with the front desk sever guy name "jose" was $79.66+tax, but when we check out, another front desk sever lady first mess up double charge us two night price....when we found out, she refund $84 something,but still charge higher price than the rate we confirmed with Jose before and without any explaination......i am so dispointed it.

Reviews.Title: “Very bad experience”
Reviews.Author: Fishingsnow
Reviews.Content: We checked in on Dec 20 and the font desk guy cannot verify my gold HH member status online just because my card shows only silver. He called the hhonor custom service and confirmed my gold card status but still no room upgrade, no complimentary breakfast, no free bottled water. Later I called the manager to ask for a complimentary wifi access as a trade and he was rude. He hang up my call and refuse to talk to me anymore. The room was old and the AC was not working well, a little bit cold during the night. Don't stay there if you don't want to be fooled.

Reviews.Title: “time to implode it”
Reviews.Author: SterlingGuy
Reviews.Content: Just checked out of the LV Hilton. It's going downhill fast: 1) casino is smokier than ever- and I lost my meager gambling stake in no time 2) no bottles or water in room (although promised at the desk that for HH members both bottles would be free) 3) no hot water from 8-10 am this AM (called the front desk and they told me the hot water heater had "blown up" and they were fixing it). Even at the $50 rate for a Saturday night it's just not worth it for a town with monster hotel deals.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty and now in a bad area”
Reviews.Author: salesmaven
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a reasonable rate for a one night stay. $59.00 and the Hilton name, what could be wrong with that? First of all, this hotel has the most confusing room numbering system in the world. The front desk lady wrote down my room number with an extra "1" in it, so I spent a lot of wasted time going up and down elevators in wrong towers. Worse than that, the hallways were filthy...hadn't been vaccuumed in days and leftover room service trays were everywhere. My room seemed to be clean, but after seeing the hallway, it may me think twice about it. The casino was so overheated that one could suffer a heat stroke in the dead of winter. The slot machines are old style and don't pay very well. This area around this hotel is not safe for anyone at night and the self-parking structure is riddled with signs advising you that you park there at your own risk. Which begs the question: why do they have to keep telling you that? Go down to the South Point for a clean room and a reasonable rate.

Reviews.Title: “Cost savings ?”
Reviews.Author: Mike D
Reviews.Content: As the LV casinos struggle with the consequences of gamblers and other spenders staying at home, it seems that cutting back on maintenance is the way to go. Or maybe not. I had a room in the central section where the sink would not drain, the water pressure out of the shower head was like nil, and the dirt accumulated on the filter of the air conditioner in the room was so thick that it would have warranted a call to the health department. The fact that the staff wasn't replacing soap and shampoo is, given the bigger issues, barely worth mentioning.

Reviews.Title: “Bad Experience”
Reviews.Author: Xaby1
Reviews.Content: At the time of booking (on the Hilton website) I reserved a central tower suite, which, from the pictures on the Hilton site, appeared to be a modern and large room. Upon arrival at 10:00pm the front desk staff informed me that there were no more central tower rooms left because they were 102% booked for the night. They instead gave us keys to two rooms (with adjoining doors) in the North Tower on the 28th floor. WHAT A DUMP!!! The room was extremely dated (likely not renovated since the early 1980's judging from the decor and amenities). The furniture was tired and stained and the bedroom only had two double beds (or a uncomfy queen sized murphy bed). The bathroom was tiny and run down and the bathtub was covered with short black hairs. In the morning, our shower had very little water pressure and water temperature was only luke warm. Extremely unsatisfied, I went to the front desk and complained at length to two managers after which I did get my stay for free (the primary reason for two stars instead of one). However, the poor conditions of this hotel did spoil one night of our vacation. This property is uncharacteristic of the Hilton brand; the renovated rooms in this hotel are probably much nicer but I would never stay here again because of the chance of getting a terrible room for the night.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: mnsunseeker
Reviews.Content: I was worried about staying here - and concerns were valid. Room in the North Tower was worn and tired-looking. I had asked for an upgraded room and was told that these rooms were the least used - what a great line! Everything looked like it needed to be updated. $15 for internet - who are they kidding? No coffee-maker in the room - just a Vegas rip-off

Reviews.Title: “There are Better Affordable Hotels on the Strip”
Reviews.Author: intlfoodtrvl
Reviews.Content: There is basically no reason to stay at the Las Vegas Hilton when you could enjoy one of the other fantastic options around town. First of all, the hotel is reminiscent of the 1970's, both in decor, patronage, and amenities. Case in point - both Barry Manilow and ABBA have had shows at the Hilton each time I have visited the spot. The rooms have been broken in, with outdated decor, older televisions, dirty tapestries, and more. The crowd is cheesy and older...Be prepared to see some interesting characters in wacky clothing. Lastly, the hotel is located off of the Strip and basically out of the way from all of the action. This is not your typical, upscale Hilton, but a budget Vegas hotel hiding behind a positive brand name. If you are looking for more affordable options, I would suggest checking into the Flamingo, Tropicana, Bally's, or something actually on the Strip. You might have a similar "cheese-factor" (as I like to call it), but at least you will enjoy a nice pool and a better location.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty pit...no customer service...Avoid like the Plague!!”
Reviews.Author: SulaGreen
Reviews.Content: Went to a convention at thought it would be good to just stay at host hotel for convenience and Hilton's prior reputation was one of excellence...ugh! Check in a nightmare. The day of the convention knowing how many people were going to check in and were understaffed. I felt like I was at Disney in a line during high season.Room was adequate in size etc. It had a jet tub that I was very excited about. Filled it up with hot water, got in turned on the jets, leaned back and closed my eyes....aaaahhhh....Opened my eyes EEEEWWWW black foamy crap...coming from the jets, I jumped out jumped in the shower and scrubbed..what the heck, someone else's dirt and skin...still feel ick just talking about it!. Went down to the front desk their response to this repulsive event..."hmm...that's odd..is there anything else we can help you with???" What???? NOT Even an apology, let alone compensation or even a free drink....WOW! Buffet was absolutely disgusting...McDonald's could have done better. We actually took the tram to Planet Hollywood as their buffet is awesome..to avoid eating at the hotel. Wouldn't recommend you keep your dog here....

Reviews.Title: “Good Hhonors perks”
Reviews.Author: CaptainPlanIt
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the LVH last week for one night. Booked a rate of $38.xx with the Visa 25% off special, but used my AMEX to pay once we got there. Checked in at the VIP room next to the front desk as I'm an Hhonors Diamond member. No upgrade offered or asked for - what the heck, we were only there for one night. I did have to ask about Diamond amenities and the check in clerk had to go look for a pre-printed sheet. The room was your basic Hilton quality room. Bed was very comfortable. Tub was huge. We had a nice west facing view of the strip from the 20th floor . The glass elevator at the north end of the north tower (closest to the parking deck) was quick with little wait and fun to be able to look out while riding up and down. The spa was very nice, and free for Diamond members. I also used my Diamond card to get the free breakfast buffet. Parking was free and convenient, although the three "15 minute limit" spaces for check in appeared to have long term parkers in them. We enjoyed just walking around the hotel, checking out the restaurants, casino and sports room, although we also went sight seeing at Caesars Palace and that was quite impressive. All in all it was a pleasant experience and well worth the cost.

Reviews.Title: “Met our Requirements”
Reviews.Author: ladyslw
Reviews.Content: We travelled to Las Vegas for a Birthday Bash with our adult children. As my husband is a member of the Hilton Honors we had used points for this holiday. We had requested rooms in the North Tower and adjacent to each other. When we arrived at the hotel there was a quick and pleasant allocation of rooms with a helpful receptionist. Our bags were quickly brought to us with no problems and the rooms were all very adequate for our needs. The only problem we did encounter was a dripping shower (a waste of water!). The rooms were well appointed, the beds very comfortable and kept clean very promptly by the cleaners. The hotel itself is a little tired, but it is one of the oldest. The buffet breakfast was excellent with a vast array of fresh fruit, cooked breakfast and a mountain of cakes and buns. You certainly could eat your fill. We did try the Paradise Cafe on the first night but the food was not that brilliant. We never ate in any of the other restaurants in the hotel preferring to visit the strip and some of the restaurants on Paradise Road. We ate a good chinese in P F Changs down from the hotel and had a very good steak in Ruth Chris Steak House. The casino in the hotel is quite small compared with others and we did find that it was not very loose with the winnings, having better luck in The Mirage and others on the strip. All in all after reading some of the reviews we were quite happy with our stay, but would prefer to stay on the strip as it is more convenient to get around at night. This hotel got very busy during our stay when a convention was on, so it is not prehaps best for the tourist who wants a leisurely time.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value for Money - Needs Some Updating”
Reviews.Author: justjayce
Reviews.Content: I booked this stay through Hotels.com and found a fabulous rate (note to all the folks who would try to invoke Hilton’s Best Rate Guarantee – this hotel is excluded from the policy). Check in was quick and easy since I am a Hilton Honors member. The person who checked me in gave us a room facing the strip on the 18th floor center tower. The room was large - very large. The amentias in the room were very modern, nice new desk, chairs and dresser which held the large flat screen TV. The bathroom, while clean, has this salmon colored tile on the walls and floors and there was some rust on the tub/shower. The only way to keep the shower from dripping constantly was to put a lot of pressure on the single knob that controlled the water flow. The carpet was atrocious with an orange colored stain in the middle that was so large that I went down to the front desk to let them know it wasn't me. The front desk offered to move us to another room, but it was not that big of a deal. The king bed had plenty of pillows and was comfy. When I finally did decide to get to bed I quickly learned that the water pipes from the other rooms around ours were loud and squeaked harsh tones when someone flushed the toilet or took a shower. In the morning I had the opportunity to use the spa/workout facilities. The workout room had 5 treadmills 2 elliptical and 4 bikes. However 3 of these machines were out of order. There was also a set of weightlifting machines and dumbbells to use. Fresh fruit was available for guests of the Spa for no charge. Food/coffee is expensive on property. My wife paid $6USD for a large coffee in the morning. I opted to walk across the street to the AM/PM mini market for my soda fix. Checkout left a lot to be desired - the front desk person I dealt with was downright rude. While this hotel is not on the strip it’s not a big deal for me. I always rent a car and the money I saved on this hotel basically paid for the rental car. If you don't get a car the monorail stops at the hotel. Overall this was a very good experience. If they did a bit of updating it would have been a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “It was fine!”
Reviews.Author: Goodpace
Reviews.Content: Due to the economy and my good fortune, I was able to grab some rooms for $35 a night and it was a real deal. The place is massive, but the room was quiet and well-appointed. The bed was quality with excellent linen and comfort. It was what one would expect from this major luxury chain. I suppose it didn't have all the bells and whistles of some of the newer finer luxury chains in the area, but for the price I paid...what a deal. The benfit of stepping out of the lobby onto the monorail was nice and convenient. No waiting for expensive taxis to buzz up to the strip. The bus stop for the Deuce (the double-decker public transport) is right out in front of the hotel as well. We did dine at Benihana's one night. It is teribly over-priced, but nice. I should have paid more attention to the fliers they gave me at check-in as there was a voucher for a signifigant discount at the restaurant had I been more attentive.

Reviews.Title: “Typicial Hilton”
Reviews.Author: neillwells
Reviews.Content: Off the strip but easy access to monorail. This Hilton is too large to offer their siginature service and the casino is not my favorite but overall a very good hotel.

Reviews.Title: “We LOVE The Hilton”
Reviews.Author: rioPortland_Or
Reviews.Content: We go to vegas as often as our pocketbook allows(shoot for 2-3 times a year) Both my husband and I can't say enough GREAT things about the place!!!!!! From the rooms,food,pool,location, and TERRIFIC STAFF(Tad our casino host, and Linda a.k.a. the frog lady cocktail waitress ) and everyone in between... The Hilton is the ONLY place we will EVER stay. Looking forward to our trip in March to plan my Husbands 60th in August knowing that the Hilton will treat us like royalty as they ALWAYS DO !!!!!!!! Teri Y.

Reviews.Title: “Blood on the sheets”
Reviews.Author: tazthedog
Reviews.Content: There was BLOOD ON THE SHEETS. Hotel seemed to blame us saying that it looked like fresh blood. This was our anniversary!

Reviews.Title: “Change the Shower Curtain”
Reviews.Author: spap
Reviews.Content: The room was in the Central Tower. When I entered the room, there was a mildew smell. I looked at the shower curtain and it was the stinky culprit. It was streaked with mold. I know the economy is rough, but is it so tough that the hotel can't afford to keep fresh shower curtains in the bathrooms? Gross. The sink drained so slowly, that by the time the water was hot, the sink was nearly overflowing. I tried to remove the sink stopper and it pulled up gobs of hair and other grossities. Otherwise, the room was old, but clean. The buffet was good and most of the staff were friendly. The chinese restaurant is overpriced. The cafe is fine, but the staff complain about management and other staff members right within earshot of the customers. The casino is pretty tight, but the player club is pretty good and offers good comps. A cocktail waitress told me that the hotel hired a new CEO who would be starting soon and she hoped for some changes. I hope so too. The LV Hilton needs some changes. I probably won't stay again and I can't really recommend this hotel. There are many much better choices and much better values in town.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel needs some modernization”
Reviews.Author: fredjkwak
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for a couple of nights, my room was next to a lift, so, a bit noisy. Rooms are spacious, big LCD tv, king size bed, bathroom could do with some more light; on my last day there was a problem with the hot water, so, I had to shower ( and the rest of my colleagues on the same floor) with lukewarm water. The buffet breakfast and lunch is good value for money,good selection of hot food,loads of cakes and average selection of starters ( salad, smoked salmon, cheese etc ). The coffee shop in the lobby I found it a bit expensive and also the fast food outlet by the sports gaming area. Nice and spacious pool area ( I wasn't at peak time, so plenty of empty chairs to choose from ). The monorail station is next to the hotel and runs until 2am, if only the single ticket was cheaper than 5$!!!

Reviews.Title: “A Servicable Hotel"”
Reviews.Author: mab313
Reviews.Content: Spent 4 nights here, burning up some of my Hilton Honors points. Since this hotel is connected to the conventon center, it really gets a lot of traffic from the trade shows-that's fine-I have stayed here for that purpose. Now, this hotel is getting a little worn around the edges, since it is one of the older ones in LV. We were "up-graded"-for $19/night extra-to the North Tower and one of the better rooms. Well, for one who has stayed at some pretty nice Hiltons in Houston, Minneapolis, LA, etc, this was more like a Holiday Inn level room. Don't expect those kind of nice appointments here in LV. It was clean though, the room and the bathroom. I wasn't impressed to see the overflowing trash cans outside near the garage or in the North Tower 1st floor hallway, however. The "scenic glass elevator" was in bad need of some good window washing. Around 4 to 6 PM, if there is a Trade Show, expect to see lines at the elevators. Lots of food options, and casino is big, lots of choices. They have a great Sunday NFL Party type of thing also. Of course, the location is a little off the way. You really need to use a cab or the over-priced monorail. We found a cab was just as cheap if there are 2 people or more going somewhere on the main Strip. All and all, don't expect Paris, Bellagio or Mirage type settings or rooms, but it works as a reasonable place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice value-underrated”
Reviews.Author: Chicagolady2
Reviews.Content: I just got back from staying this time at the MGM & Bally's. I decided to write a review of the Las Vegas Hilton from last year as I think the reviews on this site are biased on the negative side. I have stayed at this hotel at least 6 times over the last 10 years. I have also stayed at the Mirage, the Bellagio, the Wynn, the Stratosphere, and Circus Circus. While the location is not the best, the monorail is very convenient. The hotel is not as nice as the Bellagio or the Wynn, but I have always found the rooms to be clean and comfortable. If you are twenty-something, you may find the nightlife better at Planet Hollywood or MGM as these properties tend to have a younger crowd. The music is not blaring loud in the casino, which is a plus to me. As a slot player, the comps here (4 nights comped rooms including weekends) for moderate play are the best on the Strip. The slots are a bit looser too. Perhaps I am not as picky as others, but I have never had a bad stay here. Last time I checked-in my room was not ready & I had to wait an hour at 10pm, but they were apologetic & gave me 2 free buffets (even though my room was comped). I think I only came across one rude employee over the last 10 years. The Paradise Cafe is basic affordable food available 24 hrs which is nice option. The buffet is just average, but fine (Bellagio is my favorite). I thought the room service was good, though not exceptional. I never use hotel pools, so I can't comment. If you can find a nice deal on the price, take the reviews with a grain of salt. Personally, I think this hotel is a great value.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, big hotel, not on The Strip”
Reviews.Author: ingrid1975
Reviews.Content: The Vegas Hilton Hotel is a nice, but unperonal hotel. Rooms are clean and big, we were on the 23rd floor so we had a nice view. The pool is ok. Only drawback is that the hotel isn't on the strip. The monorail is quiet expensive, you are better of taking a cab. Next time in Vegas I would pay a bit more to stay in a hotel on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “An Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: melprophet
Reviews.Content: This was my second time staying at Las Vegas Hilton, the first time being back in 2005. In return for a reasonably priced stay off the strip, at LVH you get a clean room in excellent condition in a well maintained hotel. The cafe is good, it has a place for coffee, a couple of casual places to eat an an essentials shop that keeps late hours which is a good thing. It doesn't really have any major attractions, and isn't going to keep you busy and walking around looking at shops like many of the hotels on the strip, but it's a good place to stay if you'd rather spend your money on gambling than you would a room on the strip. The casino is significantly improved compared to what it was back in 2005. It's larger, has more table games and more slots to play than it did. In 2005, they were remodeling when I was there, and it was nice to see they did a good job. Service-wise, everyone I encountered was courteous and friendly, and that is a welcomed change in light of the bad experiences with customer service I've encountered at Atlantic City lately. The only potential down side I can see was the parking situation. The parking lot and garage is quite a hike from the hotel rooms, so if you rent a car be prepared to do some extra walking in addition to the walking you'll do around other places. Overall I'd say that if you're looking for a reasonably priced, decent hotel to rest your head in between seeing all the sites and places Vegas and the vacinity has to offer, then Las Vegas Hilton is a bargain and well worth the stay. If you're looking for one place in Vegas to stay, play and spend all your time in, then it's not the place for you as you'd be better off at a place on the strip such as MGM Grand or Mirage, where you can do all your gambling shopping and dining in one place.

Reviews.Title: “GOOD LOCATION.....”
Reviews.Author: sherbertal
Reviews.Content: Our rooms were not well cleaned during our stay. Hairs left from a previous guest were still on the bathroom floor when we arrived..and were not cleaned out at all. Bath not cleaned during our stay. Beds not made properly..just the top cover pulled up whilst the undersheets were left totally crumpled . The food in Paradise Cafe was lovely...but the snacks and drinks from the lobby bar were utterly tasteless. The hairdressing salon was outrageously priced and having to pay to use the internet was disgraceful....I've never had to pay before in any other country, not even Peru. Very disappointed as our first visit a few years ago was great.

Reviews.Title: “Get an "upgraded room" for a decent room”
Reviews.Author: biz_nasty
Reviews.Content: After checking in I was promised an "upgraded room" due to my HiltonHonor Gold status. When I got to the room, it looked pretty "standard" to me. I thought I'd grin and bear it b/c I here on business and don't spend much time in the room. There were a few things about the room that were just too much to take, so I went downstairs and complained that the "upgraded room" wasn't as described...somebody screwed up b/c I was in a standard room. They moved me and now I'm much happier. The standard room was very tired and dirtly. As you will see in the pictures, there were remnant of previous guests' food and used tissue...pretty gross. You will also see the the upgraded room images, which are nicer and more civilized. Not bad, but the big flat screen tv is totally useless because they don't have HD so everybody looks fat.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, but don't expect anything from the concierge!”
Reviews.Author: beckyf18
Reviews.Content: The valet and housekeeping provided good service. The c oncierge was almost worthless. It could have been a little cleaner (don't look behind the furniture!), but immediate view was clean. Overall, our stay there was good. The hotel is about 3 blocks off the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Misleading”
Reviews.Author: JustMeMinneapolis
Reviews.Content: 1. Reserved a Nonsmoking room and confirmed on check in that did indeed want non-smoking as I have difficulty breathing around smoke due to asthma. Given key for "nonsmoking" room only to exit the elevator to have to hold breath as was very smokey in hall. In the room was an ashtray and matches. Upon calling the front desk, was informed that they did not have any truly non-smoking rooms, so we were given a "smoking optional room" as "they usually don't smoke in there anyway." (Was able to downgrade to a smaller room that was on an entirely nonsmoking the next day.) 2. Someone used a key to open the door without authorization or reason (when latched) during the night while we were in our room resting. The Hotel said they have no way of tracking who entered the room. (The latch over the door prevented it from opening fully.) 3. To access the AMAZING, DELICIOUS restaurants, you must walk through very smokey casinos and have no way of getting there without going through smoke, which caused me to have an asthma attack trying to leave the Buffet. 4. Little to no soundproofing/insulation between rooms as could hear EVERYTHING (including basic conversations from those in nearby rooms as well as other sounds). 5. The downgrade room (grateful yes that it was nonsmoking) had the shower smaller -- lower ceiling and shower head causing someone 5'8" to have to duck. I'm surprised they are not made to at least accommodate someone 6'0". 6. Overall, HIGHLY recommend the resaurants as they are some of the best foods I have ever eaten. If you smoke or enjoy being around it, you would love this hotel. I simply was unable to fully enjoy it as prefer breathing.

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoK2
Reviews.Content: For my first trip to Las Vegas, I had hoped that I would be able to experience the luxury that I have heard about. Unfortunately, I did not have a very positive experience at the Las Vegas Hilton. I was booked into one of the older rooms in the hotel. It is a shame that not all rooms are updated - as my room didn't seem to have been modified much since the hotel was built. I tried to upgrade to a newer room, but was not successful. While the room was clean and large, it was extremely dated. The bathroom was pink, and the toilet and shower had seen better days. They were clean, but very worn. The shower head bracket was not securely attached to the wall, and the vents seemed broken in the bathroom. The room iteself was quite large and the bedding was new. As I was traveling for work, I was disappointed to see that not only was internet $14, but the fitness center was $20. This is after I realized my room rate was approximately $50 higher than the specials that were running that week. This hotel is attached to the Las Vegas Convention center and it seems that much of their business is for the convention center. If so, this hotel certainly does not cater to the business traveler. I can understand that these charges may be standard in Las Vegas. However, for a hotel which is not on the strip and needs to be a destination for many visitors, it seems that the amenities are not up to par.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed the stay at the LV Hilton,just wish it was on the Strip!”
Reviews.Author: dogsrule
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this luxurious hotel for the nights of October 14th and 15th with checkout on October 16,2009. I was there finishing up a Trafalgar bus tour,and this was the last stop on the tour entitled Best of the Canyonlands,which originated in Denver,Colorado. We checked in about 4:30pm,and we were on the 13th floor- didn't know that hotels use this number,I think a lot of hotels skip #13,but it wasn't unlucky for us...... I had a nice room,but an adjoining door in room next door allowed me to hear telephone calls that I didn't really wish to hear...........There was no free internet in the lobby which was a disappointment,as most hotels we travelled to now seem to offer this service. I liked the room very much,and the Crabtree & Evelyn bath supplies were lovely. We had 2 buffet breakfasts included and they were the best brekkies on our whole 11 day trip. For breakfast,you could have steak,pork chops,fresh fruit,grits,you name it, I couldn't have been more pleased with this buffet. Overall,the days at the LV Hilton were great. I just wish this hotel was closer to the strip as we didn't have a car.Took the convenient monorail once (through the StarTrek Casino to enter it),but next day I travelled on the bus.And,this meant a walk through the Riviera hotel and crossing the street to Circus Circus to get the strip bus.Next time,I might just stay at Circus Circus and be closer to the bus........ But,I have to say ,the LV Hilton is really a very nice spots,and I give it 2 thumbs up!

Reviews.Title: “Steady Performer”
Reviews.Author: tooluser
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 1 night (Thursday), as a walk-in with no reservation. Check-in was fairly quick (a short line) and efficient. For $50 I got a Central Tower corner 27th floor mini-suite. It was a very large room and I greatly enjoyed my stay. But all was not perfect. The windows of the room had many handprints on the inside. A beer bottle someone left in the elevator was there for several hours. I ate at the buffet for dinner, and while the seafood was very good, all the rest was mediocre. The gambling options are quite varied, good odds and nice selection (I still lost...) The people watching is not nearly as good as at Caesar's. But all in all a good value, met expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel OK, but experienced some customer service issues.”
Reviews.Author: midnitebreeze
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with a co-worker in June, 2009 for a conference for 5 nights. We got a conference rate of $69 a night for one of the "renovated" rooms, which was a good value. We arrived at about 10:00 in the evening, and since I am a Hilton Honors member, we got to go to the Honors check in line. We waited about 10 minutes, which by Las Vegas standards, is not bad at all. The front desk person was friendly and efficient. I have no complaints about our room. It was clean and updated as promised. Large flat screen TV, marble accented bathroom and comfortable beds. I had read ahead of time that there was no in-room coffee maker (pretty common at large Vegas properties), so I brought my own. We had a view of the golf course. For the rate we paid, I wasn't expecting a strip view. No major noise issues. For people looking for a hotel in the "middle of the action", this is probably not the place for you. But if you're looking for a quieter off-strip location with easy access to the strip (via the monorail) the Hilton is a good bet. Some people say the casino was "boring", but I actually enjoyed the fact that it was not overly crowded and you could usually play whatever you wanted to play. We did pretty well on the Star Trek machines (so well that they actually broke down on us, twice!) but the slot tech working that night was very friendly and patient. If you want to go downtown from the Hilton, I recommend taking a cab. Getting there wasn't too bad...we walked down to the Sahara bus stop and took the city bus to Freemont street without many issues. Be warned that the Deuce (double decker bus that runs between the strip and downtown) does NOT go by the Hilton. To catch "our" bus back, we found out we had to walk to the downtown bus terminal, which at 1:00 in the morning was quite scary for two females! Lunch choices were limited as we didn't have enough time to leave the Hilton during the conference. There's an "express" pizza hut, a deli near the pool and the sandwich shop by sports book (actually pretty good and reasonably priced.) We avoided the paradise cafe due to other reviews. We had the buffet one evening (so-so) but were usually out and about at dinnertime. Didn't do any of the "high end" on site dinner restaurants, so can't comment. The pool deck was nice, plenty of places to lounge. They have a half priced happy hour which we took advantage of once. The pool itself was a little smaller than it looked in the pictures, but still a nice place to relax. So why only the 3 star rating? Costumer service issue #1: 5:00 in the morning on our first night our phone rings. Neither of us answered it thinking it must have been a wrong number (anyone who wanted to reach us would have called our cell phones). But the light is blinking and there's a message from security. Apparently the previous occupant had left his cell phone charger in our room. REALLY??? You're going to call me at 5:00 in the morning because someone ELSE forgot their stuff in my room? This is MY problem now? Don't get me wrong, I am not opposed to helping someone else out, but I'm pretty sure the charger would have still been there a few hours later at a decent time of day! We couldn't even find it at first (wasted about 10 minutes of OUR time looking for it), but finally did. Called back and told them we would leave it out with a note on it as we had to get going. Came back to the room and it was still there. Another day goes by and it's still there. Finally my co-worker brings it down to the front desk (she is a better person than I am). I let them know I was not happy about being woken up at 5:00 in the morning over a lost cell phone charger. She said "well, the customer really needed itl." Apparently that's why it was left in our room for 2 more days? She was nice enough, but we really weren't offered an apology or "freebies" for our inconveneience. Customer service issue #2: Without going into all the boring details, I got the runaround by both this hotel and Hilton corporate when I needed to obtain a copy of my bill for work. Usually I can access it on my HHonors account online, but it wasn't there and neither were my honors points for that stay (I was told I would get them even though it was a conference rate when I initally called to book the room.) Eventually it got straightened out, but I talked to at LEAST 6 different people and wasted several hours of my time at work. Assuming these were isolated incidents, I would probably recommend this hotel to someone else, assuming they were OK with the location.

Reviews.Title: “Lack of airconditioning in the East Tower”
Reviews.Author: sfuji1
Reviews.Content: This is the second time we've stayed here and the rooms in the East Tower, although updated, lack air conditioning. The fan is adjustable from high/low only and the hallway is much cooler than the room itself. To get our room cooled, I had to leave my door open. At night, I had to shut the 'air' off because the fan was very loud. Fortunately, it was only in the 80's or I would have demanded a move. (Picture of the thermostat is attached.) The East tower is a long distance from anything else, and only discovered on our last day that it had it's own remote parking lot. We were happy with our first stay here, but not the second time around. I would have paid more $$ to stay elsewhere. I would recommend this hotel to others for a good cheap stay, but will not be staying here again, even with my HH Honors points.

Reviews.Title: “Not if you don't have to”
Reviews.Author: SallyFoodie
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 5 nights for a conference. Check-in was relatively smooth. The room was fine. The bathroom was old and worn, as was the carpet and furnishings. I find it hard to judge cleanliness when something is old, tired, and worn. The hotel is a great distance from anything else. This is difficult if you are here for a conference. You are held captive for coffee, breakfast, and lunch. Coffee in your room? That will be $40 for the week. I opted not to do that and stood in line for 30 minutes each morning for a $3.75 cup of mediocre coffee. Mind you, the hotel was filled for the conference. Lunch choices were very scarce. A general restaurant and Benihana were all that we found. Sat at your conference all day? Like some exercise? Be cautious when walking around the Hilton (or so the doorman will tell you). You can walk approximately 3/4 mile to the nearest 'store' - a drug store. ...or, you can pay $75 to use the fitness center. This was as disappointing as the coffee pot! The much advertised happy hour at the pool was interesting. It didn't appear all that busy, there were two bartenders, two waitresses; yet, it took nearly 35 minutes in line or 2 beers - Fosters on tap for $3 ro $4. I would never stay here if I were paying my own way. conference rate with tax was about $115. Save your money and stay on the strip!

Reviews.Title: “An excellent value for your dollar”
Reviews.Author: ronaki
Reviews.Content: While I am not big on luxurious hotels, while my seven-year-old only cares that there is a pool and other children present, and while my spouse is even less picky than we are, we all found the LV Hilton to be excellent in every respect. One block off the Strip, it was conveniently located, and the level of quality was consistent throughout the property. Parking was easy each and every time, including those times where parking was scarce. The pool was excellent (although catching the cocktail waitress' attention is tough, at times). The restaurants, although different from one another in ambiance, were so consistent in their high quality, that we suspect they shared a kitchen or bakery with one another. Room service, which is not something we indulge in usually, was so excellent, that we settled into a routine of ending the afternoon at the pool, ordering room service while we shower, and ending the night on a quiet note without having to go out to dinner. The room was spacious, clean, and housekeeping was thorough and...consistent.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: steelpa
Reviews.Content: fwe checked in on sept. 26th for 3 nights and we were in one of the newer rooms and i was very happy with our room. the bed and pillows were very comfortable, nice bathroom and we had an empty refrigerator so we stocked it up with bottled water that we bought at walmart on our way to the hotel. thank god cause it was extremely hot there. we had tickets for 2 buffets so we had to pay for 2 but the food was well worth the price. i guess it is what you want in a hotel but i recommend this hotel. it is away from the strip but it is peaceful and you take the monorail in. only negative is it is expensive riding it round trip. the hotel should offer a discount since or shuttle service since they are not within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel; not so great casino”
Reviews.Author: kidsnp
Reviews.Content: This is the third time that I stayed at the LV Hilton. THe rooms are very nice, especially the rooms in the North Tower. Try to stay there if you can. The rooms are large, very comfortble beds, nice bathrooms and relatvely quiet (for Vegas). You can get the monorail right at the hotel so it is easy to get around the rest of the city. THe cafe has decent food with a terrific turkey platter that is very inexpensive. The one area that needs improvement is the casino. I have always won some money playing slots at every casino i have ever played (east and west coast). NOT at the Hilton. As I looked around, no one was winning and folks were moving from one chair to the next. The smoking is heavy, the wiatresses look bored and you just lose your hard earned money. Stay here but don't play here.

Reviews.Title: “The Las Vegas Hilton does it again!”
Reviews.Author: pghVEGASguy
Reviews.Content: This was our 4th time staying at the Las Vegas Hilton and once again, we were impressed. Everything from check-in to check-out was wonderful. The hotel staff were very friendly and courtious at all times. The rooms were clean and roomy. For the price - you can't beat the Hilton! We will be back next year!

Reviews.Title: “Different room than promised”
Reviews.Author: lIlove2travel
Reviews.Content: We were disappointed to be given a standard room after reserving and paying for a Superior Strip View room . Our room was not available the first night. We were able to move rooms the second night. Only after I spoke with the Manager and requested the difference in price was an adjustment made for the additional money that we paid for the superior room. However, we have stayed at this hotel many times and this was the first negative experience. We like the convenient parking.

Reviews.Title: “Great Deal, Especially If You're On A Budget”
Reviews.Author: itc0uldbesweet
Reviews.Content: We decided to take a last minute trip to Vegas for the weekend of Sept 18. Little did we know that it was a fight weekend and hotels on the strip were ridiculously expensive(especially in this economy). Although I was hesitant about staying off the strip, with a AAA discount we would be getting the room for $65/night and it seemed like a deal we did not want to pass up. Since we were going with another couple we booked two of the "updated rooms" for Friday and Saturday (and stayed at Treasure Island on Thursday). I have to say that I was pleasantly surprised with the rooms. Because so many reviews on here were bad I was not expecting much. The rooms were clean, with new furnishings and they looked modern. So yea, the bathtub was chipped, whats the big deal?! I dont understand why people complain so much on these reviews; people really just need to relax. I felt that for $65, it would really have to be pretty terrible for me to complain. I have stayed at plenty of "higher class" hotels on the strip including Mirage, THEhotel and the Venetian. I think that when you book a room at the Hilton you have to keep in mind that you are not going to get the luxury of those types of hotels; nonetheless we were all satisfied with our stay. Yes, we did have a couple problems checking in (wrong beds, then rooms in two diff. floors) and it seems they overcharged the credit card, but despite those minor fixable errors I cant really complain. Most of the staff was very kind, except for the staff at the Paradise Cafe who tried to ignore us so they wouldnt have to take our to-go order (it was 20 mins before closing of the restaurant). When we called to inform management of the problem, they apologized and gave us credit to eat at another 24hr spot in the restaurant.. Although I do find it more convenient to stay on the strip since we do enjoy taking advantage of some of the nightlife, the benefit of staying at the Hilton is that you can avoid the Las Vegas Blvd. congestion by taking the back road the hotel is on. We found this to be very convenient, and having driven to las vegas, did not mind the small amount of extra driving we did. If you are on a budget (like we were this time around) or if you simply dont think its worth it to pay the extra money for bigger hotels on the strip then I would really recommend the Hilton. It isnt as far off the strip as some people make it out to be.

Reviews.Title: “Hit and miss on North Strip”
Reviews.Author: Sthomas68
Reviews.Content: The North Strip of Vegas seems to be getting rougher all the time and a good experience even harder to find. The Hilton, especially after closing down its popular Star Trek attraction, has definitely seen better days. The beds are about the only really good thing I can say about this place, other than the Italian restaurant and the Benihana. Service was practically nonexistent. Check in lines were very long and over an hour wait. Bellman service was poor and unorganized. The food at Paradise Cafe should be avoided. I ordered a taco salad with shredded beef and when it arrived the beef was undercooked. I sent it back and asked for a meatless salad. The waitress was indifferent about it, and actually tried to convince me that the chef said that what I was looking at was a tomato. I mean really! At breakfast another time, we waited nearly 30 minutes for our order to be taken when there were less than 20 people in the place. I had to get up from my seat to go find someone. In another instance, a manager chided an employee within earshot of us. Very unprofessional. The Mexican restaurant has been closed permanently but it doesn't tell you that anywhere.
