Usual dime and nickel in the room, $3 water bottles with Hilton Brand name so you can't drink it and replace it by a cheaper one from a supermarket. High speed internet at $12.99. Thank god for my laptop air card. Local phone calls at $1. Thank god for my cell. Fax number: not written on the room phone! Why? They don't want folks to receive faxes free! They want you to use the business center fax number where you will pay dearly! Still faxed myself my return flight boarding pass but had to pick it up downstairs and bluntly refuse to pay the $1 they wanted for the privilege. How cheap! ATM: don't withdraw cash there!!!! Apart from the usual $3 surchage, a colleague who tried to withdraw money was given instead a print out to take to the Casino cage because the machine had ran out of cash. There, he was asked to show his card and ID which were photocopied, sign some documents, appose his fingerprint (!) and wait for 10 mns before they reluctantly gave him his measly $100!!! UNBELIEVABLE! Convention Food: catered by Hilton: abysmal. Even though the organizers had payed for a packaged breakfast for the attendees, there was insufficient items. Bagels and hot water ran out after 10mns and were never replaced. A little reception around 6pm the first day had the worst appetizers I had tasted anywhere. I could go on and on but bottom line never again! If you can afford it, pay a bit more and go elsewhere or do your research and pay less and go elsewhere. Only come visit if you want to do the Star Trek experience or attend one of their shows which feature mostly have-beens anyway. I can't wait to give the same feedback when Hilton sends me a comment on your stay request as they always do!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: J0hnF
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for 3 nights. Staff is very friendly and efficiant, the rooms are super comfy and spacious. It's not the most amazing looking hotel in Vegas but I would still recommand it!

Reviews.Title: “Good service”
Reviews.Author: MC.Laval
Reviews.Content: Its our first stay at that hotel. Reaaly like service there. Entertain also at night.

Reviews.Title: “Very stately and very Hilton - a good hotel”
Reviews.Author: califbob
Reviews.Content: I took an extended weekend and flew to Vegas. I got a good price at the Hilton and booked a room there. It is a huge hotel and there was some construction going on, but mostly in the public spaces down below. The location is convenient enough, but not the greatest compared to, say, Bellagio/Paris/Caesar/Venetian/Wynn. It is a stop on the Las Vegas monorail (which makes me laugh because I always thought it was FREE and subsidized by the hotels, but it's NOT free). It is a little east of the Strip. Now, if one goes too far east of the hotel, the area goes downhill real fast. I used the health club which is nice and ate some fast food in the food court but did not use other amenities. However, as one would expect from a large important Hilton property, the room was large, comfortable, well-appointed and tasteful. It was on a higher floor, so the view was good, too. In short, I spent a comfortable couple of nights here. Depending on when you book it, this hotel can be expensive or it can be a bargain. If it's in the lower half of its "price spread" and you have a car to get you where you want to go, then go for it.

Reviews.Title: “Better than I expected.”
Reviews.Author: Spinyli
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Las Vegas Hilton over Labor Day Weekend 2007. Checking in didn't take long and we ended up receiving a strip view upgrade at no charge. The rooms were clean and we had no disputes with our bill. The pool was a little small and simple, but pleasant. On a personal note, the music was terrible at the pool. I'm a DJ and music, even background, can set the tone. Ambient bla early and played out 90s top 40 in the afternoon gets old, especially when they play the same songs in the same order each day (3 days to my knowledge). The casino was a little out-dated as far as look goes with the exception of the Star Trek theme section (which tended to be a mostly empty slot machine area). Being off the strip is really not an issue here. There is a monorail station at the hotel which is very convenient for getting to and from all major casinos and the strip. My only issue with the monorail is it stops running around 3am. If you rely on the monorail, you have to be aware of what time it is late night. Overall, if you're looking to stay in Las Vegas at a hotel that has all the standards you'd expect: casino, a few theme restaurants, and a pool scene, then the Las Vegas Hilton will do just fine.

Reviews.Title: “LVHilton attempted to charge over booked rate!”
Reviews.Author: SLYCAST
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at most of the hotels on the strip (Mandalay Bay, Caesar’s Palace, Paris, Mirage, Luxor, TI, MGM Grand, NYNY etc.) but wanted to try the LV Hilton because it has such a great history. I made a reservation using the Hilton website but then found a cheaper rate for a renovated room on the LVHilton website. I was not emailed a confirmation (but had a number) for the new less expensive rate and when we arrived at the hotel, the desk clerk tried to hurry us through check-in without a review of the terms. I knew better and asked to see them and as I suspected, the hotel had increased the room rate for one of the 3 nights of our stay significantly. I wonder if this could this could be a typical tactic for this hotel - we had to call a manager to get this matter corrected! Our stay at this hotel was off to a rough start. Strike one. Finally getting through the check-in process we were mostly pleased with the room. The LV Hilton made a good attempt to modernize the rooms, but the hallways are still something from the 1970’s. We were on a Non-smoking floor but during our first night, I could smell cigarette smoke like it was next door (maybe it was). And the satellite TV was out on New Year's Eve so we couldn't watch the Bowl Games as we dressed for the evening. Strike two. We never saw housekeeping, but our room was made up by the time we returned in the early afternoon every day. The bed was too soft and as soon as I hit those sheets, I developed a rash on my legs. Strike three. I normally visit the Spa and workout facilities when I stay in Vegas, but didn’t this time so I have no opinion on those (maybe I sub-consciously knew better). And we dined elsewhere, so I have no idea about the LV Hilton food. This hotel is in a good location if you want to be close to the action sans Las Vegas Blvd crowds and noise. The hotel is right on the Monorail, but if you have a car, parking is free. The casino and Sports Book are adequate but more comfortable and luxurious accommodations can be found elsewhere for the same price. I would advise staying here only if you find a rate less than $100 per night to compensate for the shortcomings of the property.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: marino22
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel with great rooms. It is off the beaten path a little but the monorail can get you where you need to go on the strip for 9.00 a day. Casino is nice but the service for drinks is not the best in the world. We checked in at midnight and it was extremely slow due to lack of staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great room but off strip”
Reviews.Author: dogfriendly2
Reviews.Content: The Hilton in Las Vegas had very nice rooms. We were upgrade to a sweet for our stay. The room was huge and the view was fantastic. The service was good at the hotel and the hotel coffee shop had great pasteries. The theme of the hotel is Star Trek which is no interest to me, but the hotel was great overall. The montarail has a stop at the Hilton so that is very handy as well.

Reviews.Title: “A Really Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: shedsWestSussex
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hilton for 3 nights in December and was very pleasantly surprised after reading all the reviews - take no notice of all the bad reviews - this hotel is great very clean extremely comfortable - all the staff were very helpful - we preferred being just off the strip - it is so easy to get anywhere with all the travel options - shopping at the premium outlet was great with only a $10 cab ride away - we could have stayed at our hotel for a week without having to go out anywhere there is just so much to see and do - the casino staff were very helpful and the room service food was great very quick and nicely presented and all for a really good price not ripped off - all in all I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel to anyone and would only stay at this Hilton on my return to Vegas. We looked at most of the other hotels and all they seemed to be were commercial money traps. the Hilton is the best value for money anywhere in Vegas and I would be prepared to pay more for the service we received.

Reviews.Title: “Too Noisey”
Reviews.Author: mikepYarm_UK
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a six night stay. Checkin was fine after a short wait. We upgraded to one of the refurbished rooms. The room, north tower, floor 25 was clean and comfortable. The shower was fine after a 2min wait for hot water to appear, the sink was just as bad. The bed was very comfortable. The new lcd tv was big and picture quality very poor, worst I've seen in USA! Finding a HP deskjet printer on the desk was unexpected and if I was on business a real bonus. The room had one major problem, NOISE. Noise from the corridor and adjacent rooms was always audible and frequently woke us up. On one occasion a family checked into the adjoining room at 1:30am and promptly had a loud argument. This was soon followed by the bellstaff hammering on the door to deliver luggage, then houskeeping hammering on the door. So even the staff have no respect for guests, despite the 'do not disturb signs' on many guest rooms. A complaint to the management was listened to but basically ignored with a 'just phone security'. The other major hotel problem was access. The North Tower has 4 lifts, only ever saw 3 working and 'waiting in line' to go up was frequent. Descending was far worse with many guests waiting 15 to 20 mins. The food at Paradise Cafe was ok, service was a bit slow at times. Our party had two meals at Casa Nicola, both very good with good service. To sum up, if you can sleep with loads of background noise, or like the air-conditioning flat out to drown the other noise, its a great hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: mom2w-h
Reviews.Content: We've just returned from a 3 night stay at the Hilton. This will be our 5th stay over the past 2 years. Overall, we've been happy with the hotel. We have relatives that we visit on a regular basis, so being off the strip a bit doesn't bother us since we have a car to use. Also, if you're there for a convention, you can't beat the location. If you're wanting to be close to the 'action' of the Strip, then it's not so convient. Yes, the monorail station is right by the front entrance but the monorail isn't running as often and the stops are usually in the back of all the properties, so you have to walk quite a ways to get to the casinos in the front. Here's a quick run down of the hotel: 1) Rooms: we've stayed in rooms at all the different towers--they're all similiar, except for the view. The view of the Strip is nice, but it's far away so it's not so spectacular. The rooms have all been remodeled--new large oval tubs and fixtures, new granite tiles, new furniture, flat screen TV's. The beds were excellent--it's the Hilton's version of Marriot's Heavenly bed. The bed linens were also upgraded with down pillows. The curtains are operated by a motor, the room we stayed in on this trip--it was broken already. Be careful about the 'complimentary' bottled water for Resort Club guests--don't use them unless you've paid or got upgraded to the 'Resort Club'--which isn't included for the standard rooms. If you're staying at the North tower, I'ld recommend walking down the hall and using the Central tower elevators since the North elevators were always full and seems smaller. 2) Restaurants: the buffet is okay. Not on the same level as the more expensive resorts (Bellagio, Paris, Wynn, etc.), but then again, you're not paying the $$$$. Often you can get some kind of comp/promotion and get it for free or 2 for 1--then it's worth it. The Asian garden (where the Asian restaurants are) is beautiful--the whole thing is indoors and is about 3 stories high and they simulate a rain fall every 10 minutes or so. You can walk in to look around or just have a drink in the bar/lounge area. We've eaten at the Chinese noodle restaurant (888 noodle house) and the food was excellent--it's an open kitchen and you can watch the chefs make your food. We've just eaten at the steak house(TJ's Steakhouse) and it's good--standard 'businessmen' steakhouse menu. Nothing trendy, but satifying(they have a 22oz. ribeyes and porterhouse steaks) There's a Pizza Hut express and a counter service take-out coffee shop at the back of the North tower--great for something quick and inexpensive. It's a ways back, but that's the entrance closest to the self-parking. 3) Service: Staff is good. Only complaint was that I couldn't reach anyone in housekeeping(kept on hold) to get extra towels one evening. 4) Casino: Good size, much bigger than Downtown casino's but not as large as the newer 'mega' resorts (Wynn, Venetian, MGM). Lots of penny slots. 5) Pool/spa: gym is on the smaller size and the pool is nice circular shape. Nothing fancy, but adequate to cool off if you're tanning by the pool. No waterfalls or slides. 6) Attractions: Star Trek--The Experience is awesome. Especially if you're a 'trekkie'! Even if you're not a big fan, the rides are fun. The Borg 3-D ride is a little scary for younger kids since you interact with 'borgs'. Quark's restaurant is fun--a little pricey, but you're paying for the 'experience' (be sure to get the flaming Ribs of Taurg and the different group drink specials). There's usually coupons for discounts to the show. The best discount that anyone can get is at the 1/2 price ticket outlets--they were selling tickets to the attraction for $21.50.

Reviews.Title: “A Very Pleasant Stay”
Reviews.Author: Wolftrapper
Reviews.Content: I stayed 3 nights at the Las Vegas Hilton during Christmas week 2007. The main reason that I chose this hotel was the excellent rate of $59.95 (and Hilton Honors points). I was given a very nice room on the 28th floor with a strip view and a 4 poster bed. Some nice amenities were also included such as robes, toiletries, two cocktails, spa visits, and a couple of buffets. Overall the hotel and casino were both nicer than I had expected. Service was good and the employees working the tables were friendly. I visit Vegas a couple times a year and try to stay at different properties (based on room rates). While the LV Hilton does not provide the same luxury as the Bellagio or the Wynn, I did have a very nice stay and would certainly return if the price was right.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel to stay as a family”
Reviews.Author: sudhu100
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel with our 2 sons (under 10) and we had a great time staying in this hotel. Hotel was clean and very well maintained in comparison to other hotels running under $100/night. Might be a disappointment for the gamblers bcoz of a small casino floor but you can always walk to other strip hotels for gambling. Its a great hotel in terms of service and peace. We choose this hotel against Stratosphere and Circus-Circus and were very pleased with our decision. Great hotel to stay as a family and/or business.

Reviews.Title: “The hilton needs a lot of help”
Reviews.Author: resfan
Reviews.Content: While the hilton is a very nice hotel. It has got some very annoying problems the room I was put in was clean the bed was okay but the carpet needed to be replaced. I found screws in the carpet and it looked like the housekeeping staff never vacumed it. The casino staff needs help they are very rude. I would tell everyone to look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel experience at Hilton Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: mcdeecpa
Reviews.Content: Eight of us booked 4 rooms for Monday, December 24, 2007 with reservation # 051058206-9 thru Hotel.com at Las Vegas Hilton. We drove from Los Angeles & reached Hilton 11:30pm. After a short wait at the line for our turn, the front desk person told us rooms were all dirty. We would have to wait for 1 ½ to 2 hrs. We were all upset since we were tired and needed rooms to sleep. To compensate for this terrible incident, she offered us complimentary meal to each of us to dine while waiting but we were not hungry, so we took the vouchers for next day instead. Lots of guests were mad. One front desk person was mad too. They exchanged words and the hotel rep slammed the telephone on the lady guest at the counter. After 1½ hours of waiting, we got our 1st room. We got the 2nd 3:20 am, the 3rd 3:35 am after begging and begging the housekeeper and room maids to clean them for us. The 4th room was not ready at the time and we did not know when it would be available. We could not wait any longer so we did not check in the 4th room. We just used 3 rooms for 8 of us. It was horrible experience for all of us to be treated like this. We stayed at other hotels in Las Vegas, such as the Mirage, Bellagio, MGM, Stratrosphere, Orleans before. None of them ever treated us like this. We would like to get a refund for the 4th room that we never got. Actually, we should have got refunds for all the rooms since we paid for them in advance and could not check in to get enough sleep even with those 3 rooms we got. We requested refund from the front desk rep name Reyna, she told us to get it from Hotel.com since the payment was made thru credit card charged by the Hotel.com. Also, we were supposed to get $25 chips with each booking (4 bookings = $100) but we never got. We were too busy running up and down the hotel trying just to get rooms to sleep for 8 of us. I am pretty sure at least about 20 to 30 guests were upset that night. WITT MCDEE mcdeecpa@hotmail.com

Reviews.Title: “Fine Hotel, Great Bed”
Reviews.Author: ThreeToedSloth
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Las Vegas Hilton with my wife for one night (Saturday) in mid-November for under $100/night. A preliminary note about booking: there are two websites for this hotel. The website through hilton.com and then the hotel has its own independent website. We got a much better deal through the independent website. The reason for the two websites, and actually one of the downsides for me, was that this is a franchise hotel. It's some other company that pays to use the Hilton name. I feel like I didn't get the level of service that I'm used to as a Gold Member (one small example: No HHonors check-in line). But on the flip side, they let us stay in our room until 6:00pm on Sunday because we were catching a late flight with no charge. That was very convenient and nice. The casino/lobby was pretty decent, what you'd expect for a nice Vegas Hotel. The best part was, like all Hiltons for me, the bed. It was very, very nice. Clean, comfortable, and large. The room itself was clean and well maintained. The hotel is connected to the strip by a monorail, although we ended up walking more than we thought (wife's warning: no high heels if you're taking the monorail). Conclusion: Great room, wonderful bed, good deals, decent hotel/casino, and decent service.

Reviews.Title: “Here are the facts, you decide.”
Reviews.Author: WeTryItOnce
Reviews.Content: As a reviewer, I have stayed at 10 different properties. I would recommend that you consider the age of the hotel and what you pay for the room. I booked with the Hilton directly for a classic room (that is what I was offered) for $95/night. That night I was emailed from the Hilton advertising rooms for $58/night. I spent a fair amount of time getting a price adjustment, but the email offer included free spa use, cocktails, 2 for 1 meals. The hotel is old and the rooms reflect this if you look. As previous reviewers has mentioned you can find defects in paint, tile, carpet, dust. The plumbing bangs all night and if smoke is a problem for you the room doors are 1/2" from the floor allowing smoke (on a non-smoking floor) to pass from the casino floor, up the elevator shafts and under the doors. Should you choose this hotel and self park in the north lot, take the view elevator up-over-and down to the lobby to avoid rolling suitcase traffic and bulky carpet. As with most things in Vegas the service personnel can look right through you unless you tip.

Reviews.Title: “Old and Tired”
Reviews.Author: BizTravelerNY
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel last week and DISAPPOINTING is the word I used with the hotel night manager. The staff is friendly enough but the hotel is out of date and not consistent at all with other Hiltons. I checked in at 10 PM at night and went up to my room to find it was not cleaned. I asked to switch to another room and after 20 minutes a bellman appeared with my key. He took me to my new room which was now two beds instead of one king. The bellman noted that with 1,100 empty rooms that night you think they would have found one with a king bed for me. The shower had an endless drip and the windows in both rooms were filthy. I called the night manager again to voice my displeasure but was tired of moving around so I stayed in that room. I think my new room was one of the refurbished ones but not sure which is not a good sign. Old and tired are the best words for this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Everything Else But Not Hilton”
Reviews.Author: Dp60
Reviews.Content: After been send to this hotel ONLY because the original hotel where I've made the booking was overbooked, I decide to go away the following day. If you think that this hotel named Hilton Las Vegas does match all cryteria of hilton standards than forget it, room are up-to-date, very common and basic furbished, NO Minibar either mini fridge, NO bathrobe, NO sleppers, NO courtesy amenities, NO good location against all main attractions in las vegas. Really if you're tourist and you go in las vegas for good time, go enywhere else but not at this hotel, got nothing to do with Hilton class and wonder why is belonging the hotel's chain, food is terrible and expensive, room are very noise, for the same price you can have better hotel better located against the strip way where all lifes goes on, if you love yourself you should never go there. small suggestions, MGM GRAND is your best deal at las vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel...can't say as much for the clientele”
Reviews.Author: K-Bot
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hilton for one night on a business trip. Would have liked the opportunity to stay longer as I'm a "Trekkie" but didn't have sufficient time to enjoy "The Star Trek Experience." Oh well.... First impressions were mixed. The desk clerk, Wesley, was very friendly and offered to upgrade me to a "newly renovated" room, which I declined. I was a bit dubious walking down the hallways as there were room service carts left sitting about and the carpet didn't look as though it had been vacuumed in awhile. But when I opened the door to my room, my first thought was "did Wesley upgrade me anyway?" My room was gorgeous and did look like it had been renovated. It was decorated in kind of a "pseudo art deco" style in maroon, black, yellow and beige - not your typical cheesy hotel decor. The bed was big and inviting and super-comfy. The big flat screen TV was great, and I had a wonderful view to the east of the hotel. Unfortunately I couldn't capture it on film 'cause the windows hadn't been washed in awhile. It was confusing at first on how to open the drapes... turns out you push a button on the wall next to the window. Also, the light in the bathroom was weird, every time you turned it off, it made a hissing sound, not like it had a short or anything, but it still kinda freaked me out at first. Our evening function let out at around midnight and I was looking forward to a good night's sleep in that wonderful bed.... well.... let me just tell all you 20-something men out there that if you're going to get drunk, loud and obnoxious, do it in the bar or the casino where you belong! Let the rest of us sleep! I had very noisy (male) neighbors who treated me to graphic descriptions of their sexual exploits in the wee hours of the morning. Grrrrrrrrrrrrrrr. Marred an otherwise pleasant stay. I would have rated this hotel higher had it not been for some very thin walls. Other on-site facilities I partook of were the Fortuna Coffee & Wine bar, where I had a very tasty afternoon snack of a latte and croissant, and the Buffet inside the Sportsbook, where we enjoyed a HEAVENLY Sunday brunch (see separate review). The location is just OK, but it's right next to a Monorail station, which is nice. I'd come back to the Hilton in a heartbeat. My major complaints were with the other patrons, not the hotel itself. I really want to do STE, Quark's bar & some of the other on-site attractions.

Reviews.Title: “been to vegas a lot? like the monorail and to stay off the strip?”
Reviews.Author: qualtyk9
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at the Hilton Las Vegas for the past 3 years in August of every year. It's a great location for us because we go for work. It is on the monorail which let's us work and then go to the strip or a play or a casino as we desire-but keeps us away from the traffic of the strip so we can get where we need to. There are restaurants on site (although we prefer the Ethiopian restaurant near by), there's a coffee shop for breakfast and the pool is nice - although the water is frigid for August room service is not fast but great if you are tired of the crowds- ?? We enjoy our trip and usually take in a play etc. Though Vegas is on the bottom of the list in places that I enjoy visiting (more into nature than materialistic stuff) but of course the theatre, food and entertainment is always superb. If you're a Star Trek Fan- the bar is a must. It's a real hoot. If you like Elvis- there's a cute little Elvis shop as well. The convenience store is a great place to get asprins, a 6 pack or bottle of wine (?)- or those basic necessities that you forget sometimes. Happy travels.

Reviews.Title: “Hated the Las Vegas Hilton”
Reviews.Author: lotoluck
Reviews.Content: The Las Vegas Hilston was the worst hotel that I have ever stayed at. The initial room that I was assigned to had broken fixtures, tile, shower curtain and burned out lights. I was upgraded to a basic room. The elevators did not work properly. The employees were not friendly or helpful. The service was terrible and they appeared to be under staffed in all areas of the hotel. No one smiled. Other travelers talked about how bad they were out side of the hotel, in public places. I could not recommend this hotel to anyone and will never stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay at the Las Vegas Hilton”
Reviews.Author: Dellliot
Reviews.Content: Overall, we had a very nice stay at the Las Vegas Hilton & would definately stay here again. Read the other reviews here, and you just have to understand the advantages of this property and how to make your stay even better -- if you don't 'get it' -- you may not be happy here and will be posting as an unhappy guest!! First, I upgraded for an additional $75. per night, and the room was lovely. It was a non smoking floor, and I did not smell any smoke. The bed was really comfortable/top notch with high quality sheets (5*s here!) and the tiled bathroom more than adequate (though not luxurious). By upgrading to this level, there was a private lounge on the 24th floor that served a light breakfast and refreshments/drinks all day + had a very helpful concierge. If you don't upgrade to the $50/$75 you may be disappointed with your 'older' room -- depending on what your expectations are. I was impressed with the seperate spa facility - borders luxury - (men's/women's had whirlppols, steam room, etc.) - and we had a nice relaxing time outside by the pool area. Depending on your room rate, there may be a charge for the spa (ie. $20/day -- well worth it - plus you'll easily loose this amount in slot play at any casino so treat yourself to the spa!) .The gym is a single room (not small though not spacious), and people got decent workouts here. THe LV Hilton is a few blocks off the strip...it is about a 20 minute walk to the Wynn Las Vegas, and close to a Walgreens ... this walk was fine for us, though not for eveyone. The monorail stops conveniently right at the hotel -- this is great esp. when you're going to the strip for the day or evening. I don't mind walking but note that when you get off at most of the 5 stops (ie. MGM or Harrahs), there is a LONG walk to the strip. There were short waits for taxis, and we were at the Bellagio or Mirage in under 20 minutes. The casino is on the small side (compared to the Wynn or Venetian), and didn't find the slots at all friendly. We ate at the buffet one day, and it was "adequate' though nothing special -- if you're looking for a gourmet feast -- eat elsewhere. There can be a very long line checking in -- though the earlier in AM or later in the PM, there was usually only a 5 minute wait. I found the hotel staff to be very friendly. So, read this review and some of the others here-- set your expectations right, - and you'll have a great time at the Las Vegas Hilton! By the way, some places to drive to off the strip -- Hoover Dam, Lake Mead recreational area, Red Rock canyon (scenic car ride) and Fremont Street experience.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing Special, Perfectly Fine”
Reviews.Author: DC_Traveler88
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a business trip because the convention was at the hotel. I will start with the cons: a used soap was still in the bathtub; housekeeping had forgotten to put new soap and lotion (I called housekeeping for them, and they promptly brought many); there were two small white stains on the carpet; the bathtub leaked a little (could not here it outside of the bathroom); room service food was horrible (had a salad and spaghetti). Despite what I just listed, this hotel is not bad. It is perfectly suited to the business traveler. Getting wireless was easy (although it is 12.99/day), the rooms were big and fairly quiet. They have a business center where you can print out documents and make copies, albeit for a very high price (It was approximately $7.50 for every 15 minutes on the internet, and 25 cents per copy or print out). There is a café near the elevators where you can get coffee before you retreat to your room. Nothing was bad here, but nothing was good either. It was just OK. My room also had a view of the strip, which was nice. No bathrobes. USA Today every morning.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Stay at the Las Vegas Hilton”
Reviews.Author: doremi1999
Reviews.Content: We checked in early and our North Tower room was ready; however, we requested one on a higher floor, so we had to wait a bit. The room was clean, spacious and did have a hair dryer in the bathroom this time. In the past, it was on request only. That was much appreciated. The bed is only made with a bottom sheet and a duvet, but housekeeping brought in an additional sheet and made up the bed when we asked with no problem. Bathrobes are usually available in the North Tower rooms, but for some reason were not this time. Room had a small refrigerator, safe, and pay internet access. The shower was great! A short walk to the elevator at either end of the hallway takes you to the lobby to one of two places for a quick cup of coffee in the morning. The lobby coffee bar is a wireless hot spot. I like the casino at this hotel. It's easy to navigate and the casino staff is friendly and professional. It's enjoyable to play here. There is also a great sports book. This hotel is not within reasonable walking distance of the other major casino/hotels, but is convenient to the monorail system of which we took advantage. We also saw two shows while we were here. We saw Earth, Wind and Fire and Barry Manilow. Both shows were excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Bumped to the Flamingo”
Reviews.Author: 57Lulu
Reviews.Content: I tried to check in on business but was told they could not accommodate my room choice - non smoking king, but I could "upgrade" for $75 more per night. I said no. They said I could be accommodated at the Flamingo and they would transfer the first night's deposit. When I got to the Flamingo it was a huge hassle straightening out how I would be billed. Plus there was a $55 difference in room rate from the Flamingo. I was actually DOWNGRADED! I called the Hilton and they are supposed to credit my first night's stay. I had to beg them to cancel my second night's reservation since I couldn't check in til 5pm and I was leaving at 6am the following morning. What's the point? I haven't stayed there in years and based on this experience, I won't be back. There customer service is AWFUL! The front desk clerk could care less. It's like they're being incented to get guests to pay the extra $75. This is how they treat their Honors members? I won't be back.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay, but be aware of a few things”
Reviews.Author: MrsBerry
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a 4 day stay at the Vegas Hilton. Overall, the stay was pleasant, but folks should understand a few things about this property. This Hilton is a Resorts International property. I'm not sure why or what that means, but there do seem to be some differences from other Hiltons. We checked in Friday night and were told there were no King rooms left. We were put in the central tower in a "normal" room. The room was OK; however the bed was exceptionally hard and the decor was dated and drab. We changed the next day to a king room and were given the option to upgrade to a renovated room for $50/night extra. We agreed and our room in the East tower was lovely. We definitely felt it was worth $50. We had used points, so it was a free room to start with. The renovated room had a bed with a double pillowtop mattress and oversized tub. Typically, Hiltons have Crabtree & Evelyn La Source toiletries, but not at this hotel. I missed them! As Gold Hilton Honors members, we did receive free water ($4/bottle), free safe ($3/night) and free breakfast buffet ($12/person.) During our time there, we did see very long lines at both check out & check in during the weekend, so be warned. There was a very large convention there that all seemed to arrive at the same time on Monday morning. For a hotel that has many conventions, it should have been better equipped to have extra staff on hand for these busy times. The convention also affected the lines at the breakfast buffet. Note to Hilton Honors members: there is a separate line for Honors members at the buffet. Don't wait in the long line, go around to the front and you will get right in. This hotel is off the strip, but the monorail is right there. Very easy to get onto the strip. There are advantages to being on the strip and some for being off. You will have to decide which you prefer. The casino is a bit smaller than some of the other hotels, but has plenty of variety of slot machines. I found the machines to be rather tight. My husband played 3 card poker every night. The dealers were all very nice. There are plenty of waitresses around for drinks. During the week they have gambling lessons. We attended the craps lessons. It was very informative and we got coupons for $10 match play and free dice. We ate at several of the restaurants. The breakfast buffet on the weekend was very good. It was more like a brunch with breakfast food, carving station, omelet station and free mimosas. It was good food, but nothing special. We had dinner at the Hacienda Margarita. The margaritas are delicious, but the food was just average. Our favorite dinner was at Benihanas. Very neat Japanese village setting that would be fun for a drink. The dinner was fabulous. We also bought lattes from the Fortuna coffee bar every day. They were great. Each night they had wine tastings that was a nice way to try some wines before you bought a whole glass. Overall, we had a very nice stay. The hotel is not quite as nice as most of the Hilton hotels in major cities, but I suspect that is Resorts International's problem. If you upgrade to a renovated room and are OK with taking the monorail to the strip, and go with the flow, you will have a very nice stay.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again”
Reviews.Author: Lkytrvlr
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel as part of a casino package they were doing--great deal. $139 for three nights which included a $25 dining credit and 2 cocktails. I had never stayed there before and was really looking forward to it. I was traveling with a big group--about 20 family members, and 17 of us stayed at the Hilton. After reading some negative reviews about the rooms, my husband and I decided to upgrade our room to a renovated one, which of course, cost us about $50 extra per night. Other family members did not do this upgrade, and some said the unrenovated rooms were fine, but some did not. My sister said her room was disgusting--moldly bathroom tub and carpet. She ended up upgrading adn paying. Our upgraded room was very nice and comfortable. That was the good. We ate in the paradise cafe which was like a Denny's or IHOP, at best. Not something you'd expect from such a great hotel chain. My family ate at the buffet on a friday morning and hated it--said it was really gross and not fresh. Then, they ate there on Sunday morning and said it was much better--i guess they do a fancier thing on the weekends. Here's the worst part. 10 out of the 17 of us that stayed there got extremely ill. It started wtih my 80 year old grandmother who spent all day saturday in the ER with severe vomiting, dehydration, etc (stomach issues). We thought it was an isolated incident--she is older and can get "bugs" easier than the rest of us. However, starting sunday night, every one else got the same thing. We do not think it is food poisening, but it is definitely some kind of stomach virus, and we are pretty sure we got it from somewhere in the hotel. It was horrible. My sister was so sick that she called the front desk to make them aware of the situation (how nearly everyone in our large group became ill), and they pretty much told her they couldn't do anything about it. Didn't even offer to comp their room. Horrible customer service. Will not stay here again, and I dont' think anyone else in our group will either. The location isn't ideal if you are wanting to explore the strip, and the casino sucks--too small and not enough tables.

Reviews.Title: “Worst 3-Star Hotel I ever stayed at”
Reviews.Author: myone88
Reviews.Content: I was extremely disappointed with my recent stay at Las Vegas Hilton. Problems: 1) Bed linens was stained when checked into the room. 2) There was a small refrigerator, unplugged, left abandoned by the entry hallway to the room. I called housekeeping right away, around 4 pm so that the stained linens can be replaced. I was put on hold for 20 minutes for someone to pick up the phone (20 mins for housekeeping?). So I told the lady nicely, that my bed linens were stained and appeared dirty and there was a refrigerator left abandoned in my room and asked if it can be taken away while my bed linens are replaced. I was told that someone will be right up to take care of the problems. So, I left for the night, and when I came back, the refrigerator was still there and the bed linens were not replaced. I just can't believe that this is the kind of service and quality that I received from Hilton, one of the biggest hotel chain in the world? I am absolutely disappointed and would try to avoid staying at Hilton again. The premise was so outdated, the rooms and decorations are old, the carpet was dirty, the restroom was too small for a 3 star hotel. I paid $180+ for the night, and with that amount of money, I can easily get any hotel rooms on the strip. It was a mistake and it totally changed my perception about Hilton hotels. I noticed some other reviewers mentioned that they stayed at the newer remodeled rooms. I just don't understand why I ended up in a room that was so outdated. Instead of staying at Hilton with the hassles to commute to the strip, stay at other newer and nicer hotels on the strip. I have stayed at most hotels on the strip and the rooms are way cleaner, offer better service, and at least they have bigger casino area that you can spend the night at.

Reviews.Title: “great remodeled room, casino just OK”
Reviews.Author: Corgimom
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hilton for three nights for a convention last week. I was hesitant due to some reviews, but I didn't want to travel to the hotel every day for exhibit hours. I had other business in town for two nights, then moved over to the Hilton for the last three. I'm so glad I did. I presented my Hilton VIP card to the desk and he told me they were full (I believe him - it was a madhouse all week) for regular renovated rooms, but he could upgrade me for $50 to a Jr suite. I took it, paying a total of $149 per night. The lobby of the hotel is nice, no line at check-in. Valet was a pain the entire time, due to only three or four valets, no matter how busy it was. There is a good self-park garage with a North Tower entrance on the north side of the hotel. North Tower elevators are small and there are only four for the entire tower. Sometimes, this was a pain, other times, no wait at all. My room was fantastic. A marble foyer, a large room with plasma TV, a chair, sofa and coffee table, two queen beds and a armoire type cabinet with a mini-fridge. Loved it. AC was great, and there was a clock radio that played your MP3 player if you had one. The beds were some of the most comfortable ever. Lots of pillows and a comfy duvet. The bathroom was small but had nice shelves and drawers to store your toiletries out of the way. My bath had a garden tub and a rainshower shower head. Towels were a bit of an upgrade from normal hotels, but not plush. The closet could have used a few more hangers, but for a three night stay, there were just enough. I was disappointed that no robe was offered with the Hilton VIP level. The Hilton itself was a bit dated. There is a coffee lounge (Fortuna) and a coffee shop, a nice gift shop and a food court all by the North Towers/Lobby. Not too many restaurant choices outside of higher end rip-off restuarants and a buffet. The sports book is one of the best in Vegas, though, and has a nice deli open late. The Hilton has a great location for conventions - and they must not have to try too hard for their players. I didn't see anyone winning, and there were open seats at all the tables, even on a Friday night. Slots seemed older than a typical hotel. There are plenty of video poker machines in the sportsbook, but very few full pay ones (typical for a larger casino). The Quark casino portion was pretty quiet and had no smoke. The entrance to the monorail is off this portion of the lobby - much closer to the hotel rooms than in other casinos. If I could book the same room, I'd stay there again, no problem. You will need car, though, or the patience to wait and pay for the monorail.

Reviews.Title: “Still a Las Vegas Classic”
Reviews.Author: MichWorldTraveler
Reviews.Content: I practically grew up at this hotel. My parents traveled frequently to Las Vegas, and would take the family there twice a year or so...Back 20 years ago, this was THE showplace of Las Vegas...The largest and most beautiful hotel in Vegas. Times change, and so has the Las Vegas Hilton... After changing ownership hands a few years ago, there's finally a good ownership group again. They've pumped all kinds of money into remodeling the rooms, upgrading the lobby and common areas and have improved the restaurants. I find myself in Vegas 4-5 times a year for business...So my review is from a business perspective. (I've done Vegas as a single guy partying with friends dozens of times, but not at the Hilton, nor do I recommend it for the 'party' group). For business, it's more than sufficient...The room is large, well lit, the bed is comfortable, and you hear NOTHING outside, contrary to some strip properties. If you're Hilton Gold and accustomed to often less-than-stellar 'free breakfasts for Gold and Diamond members', that's all out the window here. They give you their full $12.95-a-pop buffet breakfast...It's awesome. Other hotel restaurants are expensive but nice. I think Benihana is very over-rated, but love their steakhouse and their Chinese room. Their run-of-the-mill coffee shop is pretty good too. The rooms are big, well appointed, bathrooms are nice. I always get an 'upgraded room' which is VERY large, has a sofa and recliner and a 42'' plasma TV. They seem very hungry for the casino business. I'm by no means a big player, but apparently I play enough for free rooms there. Even when I go on business and only play $25-$50/hand blackjack for 2-3 hours a night, they welcome me with open arms. I called the hotel to get a casino rate (that's easy for almost any player)...After looking up my account, they told me to call a special number where I was put in touch with a casino host who said "No way are we charging you for the room--when do you want to come in and for how many nights?" Again, not the place for tourists...It's a chore to get to the strip or even to the next nearest casino. I'm not into Star Trek, so I can't rate how their 'Star Trek Experience' stacks up against other things to do in Vegas. But if you've got an event at the Las Vegas Convention Center, there is no closer hotel--super convenient! Even though I'm staying there gratis and get free breakfast, I've been very impressed with the Hilton lately...I've stayed there three times in 2007, and am looking forward to going back in '08!

Reviews.Title: “Suprising”
Reviews.Author: TaliaLT
Reviews.Content: I was hesitant to book a room with the Hilton based on my memories of it from five years ago. However, I was pleasantly suprised. Based on other reviews, I made sure to ask for a remodeled room upon check in, and my request was granted with a smile. Although it was not the finest las vegas room i have stayed in, it wasn't that bad. New down comforter, lots of pillows, comfortable bed, flat screen tv, remote controlled drapes....all makes for a fairly well apointed room. The tile was older and the bathroom reminded me a little bit of a motel 6 (with a showerhead that sprays everywhere)...but it was clean, everything worked, and overall it was a good room for a short trip to vegas. Other vegas rooms are better, and although you get what you pay for, i was suprised my dollar went as far as it did at the hilton. The hotel is also more easily navigated than many other vegas hotels, and has access to the monorail (a cheap, fast alternative to a cab ride or driving yourself) a tip on the monorail...a 24 hour unrestricted pass is the same price as a "two ride" ticket, make sure you choose the right one...and be prepared to walk a little. To get to the strip from the monorail stations you have to walk through the casinos, further than you might think.

Reviews.Title: “Vegas Honeymoon continues at LV Hilton”
Reviews.Author: Erikderek
Reviews.Content: + One of the most comfortable beds we slept in. Hacienda Margarita cantina. Pool. Friendly staff. - TJ's Steakhouse. Happy hour at the pool-bar, we never figured it out (it says 2-1 drinks but we always got charged for 2). Didn't get the WiFi to work correctly at Fortuna. We arrived at LV Hilton around 2:30 pm and dropped of the car at the valet, the bellman took care of our bags and we went inside to the check-in desk, no lines at all. The not so friendly clerk said she only had a room with two separate beds available, we declined since it was our honeymoon we would like a room with a king bed, her reply was, we'll have one ready in 2 hours, and off we went. Got back to LV Hilton at 5 pm, back to the check in desk, no line this time neither, was given a room on the 25th floor in the North Tower, very friendly guy at the check in desk, asked if we enjoyed our stay so far in Vegas, we replied yes and explained that this was our honeymoon, he congratulated us and of we went to our room. Arrived too our room, newly renovated with a big flat screen TV, and golf course view. Called bell desk and our bags arrived about no more than 10 minutes later, I tipped the bell woman accordingly (just as I did with bellman that first took care of our bags). After about an half hour it knocked on our door, I opened and room service entered with a chilled bottle of champagne and two glasses with a note from Stephen at the front desk, whishing us a happy honeymoon, really nice touch! If you read this Stephen, thank you! We used both the pool and spa frequently, nice to workout before breakfast. With HHonors Gold status you and a guest get free access to the Spa facilities, I was handed a printout at check in explaining all my perks as HHonors Gold (incl. no charge for the in room safe). Drinks where not expansive at the pool bar, about 5$ for a draft beer, 8$ for a drink, and they make them real strong, Mrs was tipsy after just one drink at noon on time, lol. (Bartender said after handing me the drink, oops a bit strong this one, hilarious). Pool was never crowded during our 4 day stay. We had breakfast every morning at the buffet (free for HHonors Elites), can't complain, huge selection of everything, like the made to order omelettes and the fresh fruit section. Used the ACG coupon for The Buffet the first night, not bad at all, big selection, fresh and good, also free MGD/Lite and wine. We had 100$ dining credit to use during our stay, we had a table reserved at the TJ's Steakhouse, we left after 20 minutes! We got our beverages, but then nothing happened, the waiter where to busy we the other two! tables assigned to him, I was furies, we left telling him we was disappointed without making a scene, we was offered a new table and new waiter by the manager but we refused and left, instead we had a fabulous dinner at the Benihana, where we met Ms Whale and her friend that where really nice and friendly, when it was time to pay, Mrs Whale decided to use her comps to pay for half our bill! Thank you Ms Whale! Last night we had nachos at Hacienda Margarita, we manage to hit during late happy-our, half price on appetizers and Mexican beverages, huge plate of nachos, we couldn't finish half of it, good thing we shared and only 4.95$, Coronas was 2.50$, margaritas around 4.50$, I recommend a visit to the Hacienda Margarita, there nachos are awesome, we had drinks there earlier during our stay, but only ate once. Mrs also tried Teru Sushi, well ok, but nothing more. Drink service on the casino floor was frequent and quick, buying drinks at the bars was not expansive at all 5$ for a domestic beer and about 8$ for a drink, not bad at all. We had a rental car which made the location excellent, we also tried the monorail witch was great, I had expected a lot more walking at the hotel after reading reviews but I guess American definition of "long walks" if different to Swedish, same applies to monorail station on the strip. Chek-out was quick, signed the slip and of we went. I really recommend LV Hilton. I like the fact that they hand you forint out about HHonors Elite benefits during check in. EK

Reviews.Title: “LV Hilton: Good, Bad & Ugly”
Reviews.Author: LuvBreezes
Reviews.Content: My BF and I stayed at the Hilton because we had a lot of Destiny Dollars to burn from Atlantic City. We've been to Vegas many times and knew what we were getting into, location-wise at least. As far as the hotel, the overall experience was not bad, but I would never stay there again if for no other reason than their proximity to anything else. The Good: Lots of bars scattered about; you never had to walk far to find your next drink. The restaurants we ate at (Benihana's, gourmet Italian (Casa di-Something) and Hacienda Margarita) were all excellent, though our reservation for Benihana's was for 8 pm and we didn't get started until after 9:00. We had a renovated room in the North tower close to the 'scenic' glass elevator; you are far from everything on the ground floor, except for a coffee shop nobody ever uses, which enabled us to skip the long lines at the main coffee shop near the lobby. The bed was the best part of the room, it was soooo soo comfortable we just didn't want to get up! A nice plasma TV and in-room fridge both got a workout. The Bad: In Vegas, location is everything. We found ourselves at the mercy of the monorail schedule, taxis, and finally the hotel's limo service to get around. We spent a lot of time waiting around, or in transit from one place to the next. Unless you want to stay at the Hilton exclusively, or use the monorail only a couple of times, you will find this becomes a big pain in the hiney very quickly. Also on the down side was that the pool closes way too early , and one day we got kicked out at 3:00 to accommodate a private party. The casino was not all that inspiring, and I found very few of what I consider the "fun slots." I never heard any bells going off or saw a single hand-pay being made. Most of the dealers were fun and friendly, but there were a couple with no sense of humor at all. The Ugly: The walls are so thin you could hear every word of conversation going on in the next room, not to mention the vacuum cleaner, heavy footsteps, laughter, knocking -- you get the drift. The ambient noise, combined with the loud rattling of the air conditioning system, robbed me of precious sleep in the little time I allowed my head to hit the pillow. We were awakened one morning by a fire alarm that nearly gave us both a heart attack. The announcement said they were going to investigate the cause and we should stay in our rooms until further notified. I guess they forgot to further notify us, because we went back to sleep and that was that. Their VIP room is not even close to it's equivalent (Chairman's Club) in Atlantic City. Call me spoiled, but I expected more than a bowl of nuts, some cookies, coffee, tea, and drinks you'd have to mix yourself from a limited selection. There was also a mini-fridge stocked with beer, water and fruit juice. All this is in a small room with about five employees who handle the VIP customers. Finally, the Hilton seems especially popular with the hookers who showed up en masse each night. These girls were obvious and and aggressive, and the fact that management allows this blatant behavior go on is disgraceful. I know it's part of the Vegas scene, but at least be a little covert about it. They were propositioning my boyfriend while I was standing right there!! Overall, a good time was had by all. Fortunately, we had enough destiny dollars to cover all expenses and ensure a good time; infractions seem so insignificant when you're not really paying for them. I was very disappointed to learn that the Star Trek Experience, Quark's Bar & Restaurant, and most of the shops are not owned by the Hilton and would not take destiny dollars. The beauty salon and spa were included, but I just couldn't bring myself to pay $65 for a pedicure under any circumstances. So the bottom line on the Las Vegas Hilton is that if the price is right and getting around is not an issue, it would suit your needs. If you are expecting five star treatment and lots of flexibiity, definitely stay more center-strip. Quickbits: We saw LOVE and it was awesome!! We had dinner at the Mirage buffet and gorged ourselves on crablegs and other good stuff. The best drinks while gambling are at Bellagio and Paris. Bikefest at the Cashman Center was more like a giant swap meet, but the downtown crowd was a lot of fun. An enormous new casino is going up next to the Wynn, and it looks really, really nice. Pretty soon I will be priced right off of the strip, which will be a shame as it is definitely the best place to be in Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: AngusY
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel away from the Strip. Our room was on the 27th floor and we had a great view. Bed was comfortable and room was very clean. Desk staff were helpful. The most irratating thing is all the extra charges for every little thing.For example the room safe was $3 a day (didnt work though) and we were charged two $13 twice for internet. I asked the front desk why and they removed it from the bill. The pool looked nice and the gym was small but good. The best thing was the buffet 2 for 1 voucher and the buffet itself, all you can eat and all you can drink (beer and wine) included in the price and the food was delicious. The lifts can be quite noisy, make sure not to have a room next to one.Unfortunatly Barry Mannilow was playing when we stayed but you could not hear him thankfully.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel... Will definately stay there again.”
Reviews.Author: nmmiller
Reviews.Content: Our 4 day stay at the LV Hilton was great. Be sure to get an upgraded room. The upgrade rooms have a better/softer bed, microwave and frig. We started out with the classic room, but the bed was too hard. We have a pillow-top bed at home. And the shower hardly worked lack of water pressure. So after the first night we went down and requested a new room. We received an upgraded room with a strip view. These remodeled rooms are great. It is definitely worth the extra $50.00 The pool area is very nice. The Spa was great, both my wife and I had a massage. I would definitely recommend one. All the food was perfect. The monorail was very convenient. I would recommend the $40 unlimited 3day pass.

Reviews.Title: “Just sort of OK for the price...”
Reviews.Author: Pippy437
Reviews.Content: First of all, my family and I stayed at this property solely due to the great deal we got (2 rooms for 3 weekend nights totaling $300 with 4 free buffet passes). I must say that prior to leaving, reading the reviews made me quite weary of the LV Hilton. Check-in: Arrived at the hotel around 3 pm and there was no line at check-in. Waited in the VIP line (Hilton HHonors VIP due to American Express upgrade). I tried to get upgraded to a renovated room for free but failed. Also, although we had reserved adjoining rooms, we were told they were totally sold out of adjoining rooms not unless we wanted to pay $50 extra per night per room in the renovated tower. Two hours and a different front desk person later we were finally able to check-in into two rooms that were next to each other but not adjoined by a door in between in the Central Tower. Luckily, the second front desk person tried "harder" to look for these rooms and even gave us rooms with a strip view and a complimentary fridge sent up to one room. The Rooms: Both rooms reeked of smoke (said non-smoking) so we were moved a couple rooms down the hall. The new rooms would periodically smell like smoke as well (smoke traveled through vents or something). The non-renovated room was aged but adequate. The bathroom water reeked of some nasty smell and they didn't even have towel racks. The bed that I inhabited gave me bed bugs (yuck!). I even took the advice from previous reviews by putting extra sheets above the mattress. Also, the walls were very thin. Luckily, the only time I was in my room was just to shower and sleep. The Hotel/Casino: Elevators were slow-operating at times and were often overcrowded. Since we were HHonors VIP we got complimentary access to the spa and fitness facilities (sign up for Hilton AmEx). Their version of "complimentary beverages and fruit" consisted of bottles of water, a coffee pot, and rotten apples and oranges. Otherwise, the fitness equipment was fine. There aren't very many casual food choices, aside from the buffet (pizza hut, ice cream, and 24 hr cafe). I do give the buffet a good rating though. Although the choice weren't as extensive as other Las Vegas buffets, the quality of the food was actually really good. We used our comp buffet passes for brunch, which includes champagne and beer. Finding parking is easy but is somewhat far from all towers except the North Tower. The slots were extremely TIGHT and believe it or not I had better luck on the strip. Overall: The Las Vegas Hilton was a good deal, especially for the weekend (look on Fatwallet about Santa Anita Package). Had I paid even 20 bucks more per night I would not have stayed here. It isn't as fun not being on the strip and having to drive everywhere (we did not want to spend $9 per person per day to use the monorail which takes you to the back of the hotel and still requiring much walking). Who knows, maybe once the WHOLE property is renovated, it'll be a more enjoyable and itch-free place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: TravisMT81
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night on a 65.00 dollar rate. Requested an upgrade to a newly renovated room and the request was honored. The room was spacious and nicely decorated with a very nice bed with a pillow topper andvery large lcd tv. The bathroom had been updated as well but still had an outdated garden tub. Ughh, I wish they had gotten rid of that and just put a shower. It is very awkward trying to get in for a shower when you have to straddle the ledge. That night we also checked out the Star Trek Experience and had dinner at Quarks. One thing that perturbed me was not the hotel but the casino, I sat down at the bar and started to play video poker and was asked what I wanted to drink. I ordered my drink and the guys said he would only comp the drink if I put at least 10 dollars in the machine, just the way he said it was very rude. I went ahead and put 10 dollars in and then won 25 dollars!! Other than that a great one night stay.

Reviews.Title: “Lousy front desk service, tired old place”
Reviews.Author: Kat&John
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this place many times in the past and finally gave up due to bad service and the large number of options in LV. Thought I'd give it another try after the big remodel. They should have spent less on the fine italian marble tiles in the lobby and more on training front desk staff. Long wait though there were only two of us in line, then surly service. I know that this is the largest Hilton in the world, but the size of the poor service is what's really remarkable. Mildew on the shower curtain, NO recognition of Diamond status. When the desk clerk at checkout asked about my stay I remarked that I wouldn't likely ever be back. She replied "well, have a nice day..." grrr.

Reviews.Title: “A very nice hotel at a very nice price”
Reviews.Author: Lobotrip
Reviews.Content: Staying at the Las Vegas Hilton was great. In spite of a VERY dated exterior, the interior was actually quite classy. I paid about $66 a night for the room, but it felt more like some of the MGM Grand's expensive rooms. The people at the desk and generally in the hotel were very responsive and nice. The room was clean, the bathroom, well it also was clean, but seemed a little run-down (one of the few small issues with the hotel). Everything worked. The decor of the room had been updated. It's as if someone had spent a day at the Grand, studying what they had done, and then emulated that style for the room at the Hilton. The only issue we had was with the swimming pool. They had one, but it's just not the kind of pool one really feels one could relax in. It's located on third floor, outside, but most of the surrounding is just concrete. There's very little shade and not much in the way of greenery. They did have a smoothie/sundry shop right next to it. The pool was about average sized, not the luxurious behemoths that the MGM Grand has (I guess that's what the extra money pays for). The Las Vegas Hilton is NOT on the strip, but there's a monorail stop right next to it. By that I mean that you step outside the hotel doors, walk up the steps and hellooo monorail. It will take you to most of the interesting places on the Strip. There's also the Star Trek Experience at the Hilton. They did this pretty well--lots of old Star Trek paraphernalia on the walls by the entry ramps. The actual rides(?) are kind of fun, too. There's also a little coffee/wine bar in the Hilton's lobby (the coffee was just okay). It's likely that I will stay at the Las Vegas Hilton again the next time I go through Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Tired hotel but great start to our holiday”
Reviews.Author: ZadaZainal
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Las Vegas at 10pm on a Sunday and decided to take advantage of their room rate of 100 USD for the night (cheapest out of the nicer hotels near the Strip). Lady at check-in counter very cursory, did not go out of her way to be friendly. Checked into the East Wing where the lift was not working properly, the carpets smelled funny and noise from kids running around was a bit intrusive. Then we got into our huge room, comfy bed, big TV, curtains that you opened at the touch of a switch, great view of the hills around las vegas and the pool (just).. all was forgiven!! Breakfast buffet was very affordable and delicious with friendly staff, and our waiter Kelly must have been the most discrete but efficient waiter in Las Vegas! We didn't bring any cash that morning but had to come back later just to give him the 5 dollars tip that he more than deserved. To top it off, as HiltonHonors members we were told at check out that breakfast was complimentary and got it off our bill! What a lovely way to spend our first night in Vegas!

Reviews.Title: “Badly in need of Remodeling!”
Reviews.Author: hamletjay
Reviews.Content: Just came back from a week in Vegas. I've stayed all over the strip, and the Hilton's price is Not worth being this far away from everything. All of the conference rooms were Freezing, with the exception of one, which had no A/C and no ventilation. I had to change rooms because of the noise of the elevator (my 2nd stay there with this problem), but noise was a constant problem anyway. There were two settings for the fan in the room: either horrendously loud or off. The grout and caulking in the bathroom was broken/missing or moldy. The bathroom sink is tiny, and the only amenity available is lotion. Some mornings I was awakened by the housekeeping staff, banging the vacuum cleaner into the wall and door of the connecting room. Or their walkie-talkies blasting outside of my door. The carpeting on the floor in the rooms is so absolutely disgusting, they ought to be ashamed to call themselves a Hilton. These reservations were made 4 months ago, and my friend and I requested adjoining rooms, but we were placed on completely different floors. Every single night between midnite and 3 am the "24 hour" restaurant has a sign that says "closed for cleaning", and the only option is Mexican food. There is no coffee maker and it costs over 14 dollars to have a pot of coffee sent to your room. Go elsewhere if you have a choice!

Reviews.Title: “Not impress with front desk”
Reviews.Author: Leilani07
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for 2 nights on 9/2-9/4/07. We checked in around 4.30-5pm and was given room 2250 Central Tower. When we came to the room, it was an end room with a pull down bed that wasn't even made. The refrigerator was rusty and dirty. Restroom was old. We came back to front desk and asked for room change. The same guy who checked us in told us that there were no room avail because they are busy since it's labor day weekend. The only room avail was for upgrade. I told him that I'm a Diamond member. He said i still have to pay for upgrade. Fine, we took the first room and he said we can move the next night to a suite. We came back to the room and i decided to call the front desk hoping to get a diff. person. I did and told him the situation and he apologize for giving that room and moved us to another room. We finally got moved to North Tower room 16-101 and it was a nicer, newly renovated room. I couldn't believe the first guy told us there were no room and other ppl just moved us within 5 min. The other thing went wrong was when it old the first front desk that i didn't bring my Diamond Card for breakfast comp and he said it's ok, the Buffet hostess/cashier will call front desk to confirm. Yet, when we went there, they asked us for Temporary Card for Diamond member, i was like what temp card. I sent them email complaining about the incident, but haven't heard from them yet. We stayed there about 3 yrs ago and we (6ppl) got a huge suite with no bed and no shower. They said it was because we checked in late (3am). I demanded to be move to another room or find us another hotel and finally they were able to get us 2 rooms with beds. I don't know how these people do their job. So beware when you check in and room didn't suit your reservation. Ask to be move to another room until you get one decent room.

Reviews.Title: “Take a break from the Strip”
Reviews.Author: souverain29
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews on the Las Vegas Hilton, I decided to take a chance and stay off the Strip for the first time ever. I'm happy to say it was definitely worth it. The North Wing, as promised, was great. I don't know about the other rooms that have not been remodeled, but the new ones are a great value. Everyone on the staff from the front desk to the night crew are extremely friendly and work hard to make guests feel at home. The rooms are well stocked, good size and very comfortable. The beds are amazing! My only disappointment was the size of the pool, which is small for the size of the hotel. Otherwise, I would definitely recommend it and I will stay there again. I'm done with the overpriced, impersonal big name Strip hotels. Keep up the good work LV Hilton!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely large room and great rate”
Reviews.Author: Sullivanstravels
Reviews.Content: Pre-booked the Hilton and got a very large 2 Double which had a sofa and chair - which we particularly liked for our family of 4. Very clean and a large welcome basket of fruit and other goodies on our arrival. Used the monorail to get around other hotels which where more impressive in terms of their themes etc, but for the price $145 and $75 to book additional days, we where very happy.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel! - Stayed for Labor Day Weekend”
Reviews.Author: fyt07
Reviews.Content: I was very skeptical over staying here because of some reviews I found on this website, the fact that it is a bit away from the strip, it's a little bit of the older hotels, there were just too many little things that made me skeptical about staying here. However, I could not have been any happier with where I stayed. I arrived at 2:00 on Friday and the line was super long, however within 10 minutes we were helped and had really nice service. We were upgraded to one of their newly remodeled rooms, for free at no extra charge, and he said that is little birthday gift from the Hilton to me. The room was beautiful, I absoultely loved it. The beds, linen, pillows were so comfortable, I could have slept in them for days!!!!! The bathrooms are a bit small, but they are so clean. One of the best bathrooms I have seen. There are a lot of cabinets to put things in, and they even have a refrigerator. Everyone was super friendly, the property is beautiful and it is only about 5 minute drive from the strip, taking the back way makes it even faster. The tram service worked great!!! It took us only about 5 minutes to wait for it and it got is to where we wanted in no time. Really convenient service. NEGATIVES: Small pool. They cleaned our room even if we had put the do not disturb sign, it wasn't until my friend complainted to the front desk and housekeeping, that they stopped going in. The people in the front desk were very helpful over the situation. Overall, I loved this place and I would have no problem staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel and Nice Location!”
Reviews.Author: EricinMD49
Reviews.Content: My son and I stayed for two nights at the Hilton in June as part of a sweepstakes I won. I had stayed there twice before in the 90's during conventions, and was not really impressed. This time, however, I found the hotel to be a pleasant surprise. We had quick check-in and the service was very good. I had to use VIP services to get concert tickets I had won, and they were also excellent. Our room, on an upper floor, was standard, but had a large window with an amazing view of the golf course and south Strip. The room was cool and inviting and had been recently renovated. The hallways were dingy, but inside the room it was very pleasant. The beds were fantastic and we slept well. The hotel itself is fine, nice casino and restaurants (we did not eat there though) and a fantastic pool and hot tub area. Be forewarned that the cement in Vegas in summer is blistering hot..wear footwear around the pool and spa! Lastly, we used the monorail to get down to the Strip and it was great! We bought day passes for only $8 each and got more than our money's worth. You do have a little walk from the stations through hotels, but it's fine and not a big deal. The trains were rarely crowded and we never had to wait long. Get a good deal and stay at the Hilton!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: rjl210
Reviews.Content: I just got back from a 3 night Stay at the Las Vegas Hilton, it's a Great Hotel. I'm 21, and didn't mind the location because the Monorail is right there and you can be at the MGM Grand within 5-10 minutes. Booked a Renovated room and it was great, Beds were Comfortable, Great TV and View of the Strip. Ate at the Breakfast Buffet every day and it was pretty good, although I have been to better ones on the Strip (TI, and the Mirage).... I must say that the Sports Book is the best I've ever been to, it's huge and fun to watch games at, only if your winning your bet. The Casino is a Good Size, and easy to get around, Play the Monte Carlo $1 Slots just outside the entrance to the S.B., they were lucky for me on my Last Day. It was ridicuously hot, approaching 110 degrees while I was there, so most of the time during the day was spent inside the hotel. If you need to be on the Strip, this isn't the place for you, but if you don't mind a quick monorail ride, then you will love it.

Reviews.Title: “Run down,very poor customer service,but cheap”
Reviews.Author: JohnGoodman
Reviews.Content: Few month ago me and a friend of mine stayed for a a long week-end at LV Hilton.I had quite high expectations about this place, being a HHonors Gold Member. Unfortunately this hotel is not up to Hilton standards.We have arrived early morning and has been told that we won't be able to check-in until 13.00 - quite disappointing. We have waited till 13.30 ( don't play them slot machines, all the previous reviewers are right, them are really tight ), want back to check-in - nope, the room is not ready yet and nobody knows when it will be! In the meantime I was able to see some people to check-in !So I have demanded to speak with a manager and miracle! A room have appeared.I have asked if them do offer any upgrades to Gold Members ( as all Hiltons do ) and has been rudely told that 1 - this hotel is not a Hilton, it's called "Hilton" but does not belongs to Hilton chain 2 - them do not offer any upgrades to Hhonors elite members 3 - I should consider myself lucky that them give me the HHonors points, as other hotels in Vegas do not do that ( a lie ) !After this pleasant welcome we went to our room - boy, was it bad! I have to say that it looked clean, but it was one of the oldest rooms that I have seen in my life!All furniture was really old and tired, the bathroom was showing the heavy signs of usage ( to the point that it was starting to look disgusting ) and so on...The alarm watch in the room is actually an 30-years old and dirty !The washbasin it actually in the room, not in the bathroom - really weird! Anyway, we was tired and just wanted to go in the bed to have some good sleep. Unfortunately there was a continuos rumour in the room that did not let us to have any sleep. We went away from this dump for a walk, went back few hours later and asked for the room change because of the rumour. Has been told "oh yes, this are our elevators" - so them know about the issue, but still do not do nothing to solve it!We have been told that them will move us to a different room, but on the next day we will need to change the room again, because the room that them will be moving us is more expensive !!!Very good customer service ( and remember, I am a Hilton elite member ! )...I have demanded to speak with the manager again and has been allowed to stay in the new room for both days at the end...I could continue with other issues, but I guess you got the idea.The only reason that I am giving 2 and not one star to this place was that them did offer me a free breakfast and it was pretty good ;-) To sum up this place is run down, them do not have any consideration towards them guests and the whole experience is just not what you would expect from a Hilton hotel.If you can get a very cheap rate ( quite often you can find the room for 60-75$ at this fake "Hilton" ) and all what you care is to have a place where to sleep it could be OK, but trust me, a nicer hotel will cost you only a fraction more and will make your holiday in Vegas much more enjoyable!

Reviews.Title: “Survivable, if you get a super-cheap rate like I did”
Reviews.Author: giromondo
Reviews.Content: The cheap package rate I got thru Travelocity was the only saving grace to my stay at the Hilton. Like JenniferPhoenix below, I arrived to my room only to find the maid had only just begun to clean it. Rather than hike back down to the lobby and wait in line again, I waited about 20 minutes for her to finish (I figured it probably wasn't her fault, but it's ridiculous that an established hotel cannot get something right that is so fundamental as having the room ready for the guest at checkin). The room was not one of the renovated ones - the furniture was tired, the carpet badly stained, the bed an "electromatic" model that looked as though it'd been unplugged for years. The room was quite large, but poorly laid out (at least for poor schmucks that go to Vegas on business and want a workspace with PC access that is better than a coffee table). The casino was much less impressive than any I've seen on the strip. The desk staff were generally brusque and unfriendly. The only thing to recommend this hotel is that (1) it's adjacent to the convention center if that's why you're in Vegas (2) it's home to Manilow and "Menopause the Musical" if you have limited mobility (3) you can get super-cheap rates if you shop around. It's on the monorail line, but $5 a ticket makes it one of the most expensive public transportation options in the country. To end on a positive note, the coffee shop downstairs offers free wi-fi access, allowing you to avoid the exhorbitant rates for in-room internet access. And the cappuccinos there are quite good.

Reviews.Title: “First time in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: sigs99
Reviews.Content: Here is the best and worst of my stay here at the Las Vegas Hilton. My checkin was great. The staff was friendly and helpful. They let me check in at 9 a.m. which I was very happy with. The room price was $120 after taxes (p/n) for a friday night saturday night stay. Not too bad compared to others.
