My room was large and in great shape. The view was awesome. The bed was extremely comfortable. It had a bread spread that I was not disgusted by like most hotels. The bad side of the room was the shower. I am 5'11''. The shower head was 5'2'' at best. The shower faucet never would shut off. They wanted 3 dollars a night for the use of their safe. I had never heard of that before especially at a casino. The casino is not large, but that was why I liked it. I never had a problem getting drinks. It was layed out nicely. The down side to the casino was their poker room. I found it small and the tables were crammed together. I like to be able to be able to push back from the table w/o hitting other players. The tram is the best feature here. It is right outside the doors. For 9 bucks you can ride it all day long. It will take you from one end of the strip to the other. Money well spent. The hotel is older and in some parts it shows. It was nice to get away from the strip once in awhile.

Reviews.Title: “Came for Manilow - Will come again !”
Reviews.Author: markp87
Reviews.Content: Understanding that the LV Hilton is not a 5-star hotel, and is not on the strip, we booked a ridiculously good deal through Expedia, and were pleasantly surprised after reading some of the reviews on this site. We did upgrade our room on check in, at a cost of $50 per night, which gave us a nice renovated room with King bedding. I'll admit I'd prefer a top and bottom sheet, instead of a bottom sheet and a duvet, but the room was very nice, and was certainly clean. The bed was very comfortable, the A/C worked very well, and we were impressed with the thoroughness of the daily housekeeping. We were also slightly annoyed that the safe had a daily charge, and we would have appreciated an inroom coffee maker, but the room service was always prompt and polite, and the food we ordered was excellent. The inroom high speed internet (again at an additional charge) was easy to set up and worked well. The casino is not huge, but is complete and we never found a time when we couldn't play on a table. (Since we're not rich gamblers, it mattered to us that not every table was playing $25 minimums.) The casino servers were always friendly, and often remembered our orders, even from previous days. We spent several full days at the pool, and sprang for a cabana each day, which gave us shelter from the sun (who even knew UV could reach 11?) and excellent service, from complimentary soft drinks and water to loads of towels. The pool does feel cold, especially in the early morning, but warmed up through the day, and was always refreshing. There were always children in the pool, but they never got in the way of a quiet swim. My spouse is a hugh 'fanilow', and saw Barry Manilow's show three nights running, as apparently did many others. We often spent time at the pool dissecting the previous night's show... We also found that the hotel was hosting a Star Trek convention over the time we were there, so it was not unusual to find Star Trek uniforms walking around the hotel at any time. Throw in some families and some business people, and the hotel was a real mix of travellers, which we thought was a lot of fun. Not too stuffy for non-Kennedy families, but above the frat-boy attitude found in some of the strip resorts. The monorail was very handy, and gave easy access to the rest of the strip. We certainly enjoyed our stay at the LV Hilton, and would certainly return. We found it to be a good value.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel! Stay in the renovated section!”
Reviews.Author: lisacas1
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Las Vegas Hilton July 6th - 9th for a wedding. We reserved a renovated room since they had a special running, but with my AAA membership discount we paid only $65 a night for the renovated room. We checked in about 10pm and there was no line (late evening check in seemed like the best way to go since they usually had long lines in the early morning and afternoon). We were upgraded to a corner room that was slightly larger than our original request. Check in was speedy and the front desk service was good. Our room was gorgeous! Very large and even had a nice plush leather couch. Large flat screen TV, desk and a very large area. It was very clean and the bedding was to die for. Extremely comfortable. The pillow top king was so heavenly to sleep in after a late flight. The bathroom was large and even the amenities (shampoo, lotion) were good (smelled wonderful!). Each time we called for room service, or even to ask for a pack of matches, they were quite quick and very courteous. The casino card desk folks were very nice as well and the line was always speedy. The casino itself is nice, but the waitress service was the worst. They rarely came around and when they did, you didn't get your drink for 20 minutes. The buffett food was really good. Brunch on Sunday is worth the price and everything tasted fresh and service was superb. There's a coupon for buy one get one free from the front desk if you purchase your room through a special, so I would definitely take advantage of it. Valet was courteous and always on the go, we always had no problems getting a taxi. The only downfall, since the Las Vegas Hilton is not located on the strip, we spent a lot of money going by cab. Usually $10 one way (to downtown or MGM area). There is a tram and you can purchase an all day ticket for $12 (look for coupons, they have books available at the front desk or in your hotel room or cab). I would definitely stay at the Hilton again, but rent a car. When you reserve a room BE SURE to request a renovated room. I hear that the other rooms are old and not as impressive at all. TIPS: Reserve a renovated room Use AAA discounts (you might get lucky they really don't check your for your card) Enjoy Sunday Brunch Bring your own water Rent a car or use tram

Reviews.Title: “Very enjoyable”
Reviews.Author: smitty195
Reviews.Content: I travel to Las Vegas about 7 to 8 times a year, and I have always avoided the Las Vegas Hilton because it is not located on The Strip, and it is also one of the older hotels that has been around for many years. But I had heard that the hotel was under new ownership, and many rooms and areas of the hotel had been refurbished. So I checked the rates, and I was able to get a Superior room at $90 per night (weekdays). The Superior room I had was on the 20th floor and overlooked the front of the hotel towards the Strip. My room was fantastic! Everything was new---carpets, tile floors in the entryway, furniture, TV (plasma), you name it. For 90 bucks a night, this was great! The Hilton has different categories of rooms, and I think their "classic" category are rooms that are not yet refurbished. I can't comment on those rooms since I did not see them, but my room was perfectly nice. I only have a few gripes about the room, which I will now mention: 1: The electronic curtain did not work. When I pushed the switch on the wall, I could hear the motor running to open/close the curtain, but the curtain never moved. Also, it's only the opaque (white) curtain that is electronic....the blackout curtains you still open and close by hand. 2: The plumbing for the shower needs attention. The water pressure was extremely low, and the temperature never got hotter then just barely lukewarm. 3: There was no hotel information booklet in the room, so you had to do some research to figure out what the hours were for the pool, the buffet, their locations, the channel lineup on TV, and so forth. Even though I encountered those negative issues, I still give the Hilton two thumbs up! There are many reasons for this. One of the biggest things I noticed while staying at the Hilton was that the type of people it attracts and the general "tone" of things is very low key and nice. I've stayed at all of the major Strip hotels, and this was completely different. Lots of families here on vacation with kids, and lots of business people as well (the Convention Center is located next door). It was also not very crowded, even though the hotel was at 100% occupancy. It was nice to not bump elbows with strangers as you try to walk through the casino or walk to a restaurant. It was a great feeling to be there compared to the young and drunk crowd on the Strip. But if you want to go to the Strip, just hop on the Monorail which stops at Hilton's front door. The cost for a 24 hour pass is only $9 (it was $15, so the cost has come down). The casino is a lot smaller than I thought it would be. But even when it's crowded, it's not "crowded" like it is on the Strip. I thought it was cute that the cocktail watiresses at the Hilton were all grandma types! There weren't any young babes wearing skimpy outfits here, and I thought that was great. The older women would come around and say, "Can I get you something darling?". And the pool area at the Hilton is great also. It's not an amusement park pool like you'll find at some of the hotels on the Strip. It's just a really nice, clean place to hang out. It's located on the 3rd floor, and there is plenty of room and lots of chairs. If you want shade, there are a few umbrellas and there are also some areas with chairs that are located underneath a mesh-screen roof. There's a cabana bar where you can get snacks and drinks, and there is live evening entertainment from 5:30PM until the pool closes at 8PM. During the day they play 80's and 90's soft rock through the speakers, and it was just a very relaxing place to hang out. The spa is located just outside the gate of the pool on the 3rd floor. You can get a massage or use their jacuzzi, steam room, or sauna. The room service at the Hilton was also excellent. It always arrived quickly, and the food was very good. I also loved the buffet! Again, it wasn't like the mega-hotels on the Strip where you wait in line for a half hour. You just walk right up to the entrance, pay your money, and go eat! The breakfast was 12 bucks, and dinner was 16 bucks. It opens at 6AM for breakfast, and remains open and changes to a lunch menu at 11AM. I highly recommend this hotel. I was pleasantly surprised with what I found here. I'm glad I finally decided to give it a shot after avoiding it for so long. Regarding the other reviews that encounter odd problems here and there and then the person says that it ruined their whole trip, well......you'll have to decide that for yourself. I travel frequently, so I know what to expect when I go somewhere. For people who do not travel frequently, they can get upset by one or two minor things and turn it into a big deal. Sort of like a bride on their wedding day thinking their life is ruined because a certain flower is wrong. That's just life.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't stay here again, ever!”
Reviews.Author: HoustonTravelsnob
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this Hilton because we were attending a huge convention, as exhibitors, at the Las Vegas Convention Center. Having attended conferences and conventions in Vegas in the past, we knew that it was essential to get as close to the convention venue as possible, due to long taxi and shuttle lines. After staying at this hotel, I would prefer to walk across broken glass, swim with sharks, or wait 2 hours in a taxi/shuttle line at 6 a.m. than to stay here again. I upgraded my room to a newly renovated one and when I arrived at my door, found broken glass on the carpet at the threshold. It took 45 minutes for my luggage to arrive. Unfortunately, the broken glass was still there 2 days later. I called and reported it and finally someone cleaned it up. The elevators in the renovated section of the hotel are incredibly slow and there are not enough of them to accommodate the layout of the hotel. While there are separate towers, they are all inter-connected, so elevator traffic is not tower specific. The wait for an elevator was upwards of 25 minutes on several occassions. The third day, I discovered that I had slept in a creepy hotel bed with no sheets......just the comforter and the mattress pad. I was completely horrified. The sinks and shower constantly backed up when used. The front desk staff was completely inept. When I went down to complain to the front desk, the manager was very helpful and even offered to comp my night and all of my upgrade charges. The night before I left, I checked on the status of the credit and my total bill and was shocked to find that the Manager had not followed through. The manager that I ended up dealing with that night was catty and rude. He finally agreed to honor the other manager's commitment and even comped more than the original offer. Unfortunately, they did not keep this commitment either. One month after my stay, they charged my credit card again and took back a chunk of the credit they had offered and issued. I will never stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “OK place”
Reviews.Author: RamfanFtCollins
Reviews.Content: Comfortable room, nice pool area - closed at 8:00 PM though. Front desk had computer trouble, took 1 hour and 15 minutes to check in. Never offered drinks while playing machines. Can get on Tram at Hotel (was $9.00 for 24 hr.ticket) vey good way to get around. Got a good deal on room so good bargain.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hilton Stay EVER!”
Reviews.Author: JenniferPhoenix
Reviews.Content: I booked a one-night stay at the Hilton Las Vegas - as I was in town on business. Upon arriving at the hotel, I was told that my reservation for a King Size bed - in the recently remodeled section of the hotel - had not been kept. I was given a room key for a Double. Upon opening the door to my room, I noticed that all the bedding was piled on the floor in a corner - Housekeeping had not finished cleaning to room. After calling the front desk, I was on hold for - no kidding - 20 minutes trying to explain that I wanted a room that was clean. This seemed to be a foreign concept to them. When I finally got a new room key, and after checking into that room, I noticed that the smell of the room was off and that the air conditioning sounded like a jet engine when on high. The only bearable level to run the AC was at low - with the air filter removed. And - I think that was the first time the air filter had ever been touched since it was placed in the vent. This recently renovated room was small, the carpet worn thin, and the wall paper peeling off. I would hate to see what an old room looks like. I am a Hilton Honors Gold Member - Diamond as recently as April of this year. This is the worst hotel I have ever stayed at - and I was treated terribly. I will never stay at this hotel again. I would go back to the Hampton Inn on Tropicana long before I would stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Hilton Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: nutmeg3869
Reviews.Content: This is a great place to stay in Las Vegas. I was especially impressed with the value, the extremely accomodating, professional people at the front desk, and the quality of the rooms. I paid only $80 with tax to stay at this four star hotel on a Friday night! I had a hard time finding a better price at even the one, two, and three star hotels in the area. Further, just because the hotel hadn't yet received my online reservation at the time I tried to check in, the hotel comped my boyfriend and I a meal and upgraded our room. The room was large, and the bed was extremely comfortable. I liked everything about my stay except for the number of kids in the swimming pool.

Reviews.Title: “Weekend in Vegas without the kids”
Reviews.Author: onoman
Reviews.Content: Spent a weekend in Vegas with two other couples sans kids. Had a good time at the Las Vegas Hilton. For the money, it was well worth it. Caught a special and stayed in hotel for $100/nite! Throw in Hilton Honors benefits--free breakfast buffet, free use of gym and it was a great deal. Not as luxurious as the Venetian, but away from the crowds of the Strip. Special notes--room nice, flat screen TV--poor reception, in morning AC brought smoke in from some other room, valet parking is free, self parking is available and if you don't want to drive around to the Strip, you can take the Las Vegas Monorail, which has a stop right outside the Hilton and will connect you to the other hotels on the East side of the Strip. I understand they are doing some renovating, it is an older hotel. Not much shopping in the hotel. Overall a good experience for the money, but I would not spend a fortune to stay here. Also remember, this is not a Strip Hotel and if you want to get to the other side of the Strip, Forum Shops or Bellagio--you will have to do some walking, even if you take the Monorail.

Reviews.Title: “Off the beaten path, but a good value”
Reviews.Author: elh
Reviews.Content: Although you are not in walking distance of the strip or any other hotels, the monorail is awesome. The Monorail has stops at the Flamingo, Imperial Palace, Harrah's, and MGM grand. The only unfortunate thing is that you are dropped on the back side of all of the hotels, so to get to the strip or the hotels on the other side of the strip (Bellagio, Caesar's, New York, New York), you have to hike through the hotel and navigate your way across the street. The monorail has a deal now for $8 a day (24 hours from when you first use your pass). We had one of the "tired" rooms that hasn't been updated. We were told we could have an updated room for $50 a night. The lady at the front desk told us it was "totally worth it." We decided against it and were barely in the hotel so the room was okay. The pool is all right. Not quite as spectacular as you might expect at a Hilton or a bigger resort. The gaming chip deal they give you online is a bit of a joke. You have to sign up for a "Hilton" card and can only use the $25 chip as $25 and it can't be used to play slots.

Reviews.Title: “Just okay...nothing to write home about”
Reviews.Author: swirlinabc
Reviews.Content: Stayed here last month on an overnight business meeting trip. The Las Vegas Hilton is not my top choice of hotels in Las Vegas, but given that our meeting was there, there's not much choice unless you want to take a cab to the meeting. The hotel is in the process of remodeling their rooms. Upon check in, they asked me if I'd like to upgrade to a remodeled room for $50 extra. They advertised it as new furniture, new decor, and plasma TV. Since I was only there overnight and wasn't planning on staying in the room, I declined. They placed me in one of their standard rooms which was okay. Comfortable, but nothing worth ooohing and ahhhing about. I went back to my room after my afternoon meeting. When I got off the elevator, I thought I was on the wrong floor. There was construction all over the place. Room doors were open, furniture in the hallway, ice chests and tools strewn everywhere. I had to double check my room number and found out I was correct. My room was okay, nothing touched. However, when I asked one of the workers if I was the only one staying on this floor, he replied yes. I immediately called downstairs to complain, and they changed me to another room on another floor. Ironically, I asked for, and was given an upgraded room at no charge. The new room, which they originally offered to me at $50 more, was okay. Yes, there was new furniture that looked like it was taken right from Ikea or Pottery Barn. Yes, there was a plasma TV, but there were no channels in HD, so it was basically for naught. The floors in the entry were granite, but the problem with that is that they're echoey. My neighbor, obviously on East Coast time, was chatting away in his entryway beginning about 6:00 am. Even with the adjoining door closed, I could hear every word of his telephone conversation. Unless you are in Las Vegas and had to stay at the LV Hilton for a very specific reason, I'd recommend somewhere else. There are so many more better choices than this tired old hotel.

Reviews.Title: “had to change rooms four times”
Reviews.Author: rantati7
Reviews.Content: Booked Las Vegas Hilton for three days on their website. In our first room the TV was flickering. This was one of the old rooms in the center tower. Went back to check in to change the room. In our second room the safe was out of order. By the way, Hilton charges 3 USD per day for using the safe. Went back again to check in to change the room. Obviously the manager was ... tired of our complaints and put us this time to a smoking room as a revenge. went back to lobby yet again and this time got some higher ranking manager to place us in a newly renovated room. Even this room was not without flaws. On the second day our toilet started leaking. As asummary: stay away from the old rooms - go for the newly renowated ones - if and only if you really need to stay in this place.

Reviews.Title: “Tired Rooms.”
Reviews.Author: JB101
Reviews.Content: I had a business meeting in Vegas that was scheduled at this property. When I checked in, I was told I could have a newer room for an additional $25.00 per night. I passed. My room had a pink tiled bathroom and a shower head that hit me at my chest. The television didn't have many chanels, including no HBO. The spa is nice and I did have a free pass to it, but I'm not sure it would be worth the $20.00 to use a treadmill. The buffet was very average. It was inexpensive to get to the strip via cab. From that perspective, it's not a problem being off the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Great Off-Strip Location”
Reviews.Author: warrenandlinda
Reviews.Content: First and foremost, we chose this hotel due to their resonable pricing. Because of it's location, it costs a lot less than comparable on strip hotels. Since we're already spending money at the hotel for meals, sundries and gambling, I can't justify $200+ just for a bed to sleep in. Really, how much time do you spend in your room. Our frist stay at LV Hilton was for 4 nights in November '06. We enjoyed the hotel enough to stay here again in the beginning of June for 4 nights. Both times we stayed in a "refurbished" room. The rooms are very comfortable and ours offered a great view of the strip. The restaurants here are very good and reasonably priced. The buffet is great for breakfast, but I wouldn't recommed it for lunch or dinner. Getting to the strip is cheap and easy as there is a monorail stop at the Hilton. It also appears that monorail pricing has dropped from the prices found online - an unlimited 24hr pass cost just $8. While my husband preferred gambling, I spent most of my days on the pool deck where it is tough to find shelter from the sun. So, for 2 days we rented a cabana - well worth the $150. It has a tv, abundant seating, and a beverage stocked mini-fridge (no alcohol). We also enjoyed our lunches here - great variety on the menu. The pool is small and FREEZING but more than adeuate. I am not a big gambler so to me the casino is just that, a casino. It's not as large as those on-strip, but you will find everything here. My husband loved the fact that there were numerous single-deck black jack tables. Overall, we enjoy staying here and will do so again.

Reviews.Title: “enjoyed our visit”
Reviews.Author: SherryH
Reviews.Content: After reading the previous reviews I was a bit scared, but, was pleasantly surprised. Yes, the check-in isn't very fast, but, we were there on a "time share presentation special" so I couldn't complain too much. We waited approx. 30 minutes because the Tahiti Village/Consolidated Resorts people didn't fax the Hilton Hotel our reservation information. But, after waiting, they gave us a nice room on the 21st floor in the Central Tower right by the elevator. It was a nice room, nothing special, but nice. We had a view of the strip and the mountains and the airport. The room was very roomy with tv, small frig, decent bathroom, nothing fancy, but nice nevertheless. We were offered a $50 upgrade to a newer renovated room, but this was nice enough. The dinner buffet in this hotel was above average, in fact, it was terrific. I dont' like buffets either. But they offered wine or beer with your dinner and everything seemed very fresh. They offer fresh steamed shrimp (no tail, no veins) every night, and the salads, prime rib, chicken, turkey, ham, desserts, everything was very good. The pool was too crowded with kids however. It was 110 outside. The hotel is located right on the monorail, however, be prepared to do a lot of walking because the monorail takes you behind all the casinos. So, the next day we took the bus because it was on the strip, but you still have to walk from the bus stop at the Riviera to the hotel (4+/- blocks in the heat).

Reviews.Title: “Mixed bag, more bad than good”
Reviews.Author: beth_bb99
Reviews.Content:
We went on a special promotional package, they sent us a coupon book and gave us coupons at the front desk at check-in. We only ended up using the buffet 2-for-1s so it didn't turn out to be a bargain. The line and the wait was quite long to check in. A few clerks only seemed happy when "chatting" together at the front desk, moving slowly, and they didn't seem concerned with the large number of people waiting to check in.

We were roomed in the North Tower in a "rennovated room". When we arrived I went to the restroom to wash my hands and discovered there was no soap, or shampoo, and the tub looked dirty. My husband called to let them know, they said they would send someone right up, we told them we were heading out for dinner but that they should come in and take care of things while we were gone. Otherwise, the room appeared nice, though not as clean as we expected. The room had modern furniture and a large flat screen tv as well as wireless access (for a daily fee). We tried their buffet, not very impressive (Mandalay Bay has the best we have seen so far). We tried the Hilton blackjack tables (only a few to choose from) and a slot or two but overall it is not a very happening place. Cheesy pictures of Manilow are everywhere (pretty much the only show that seemed available for a few weeks). With the hotel located off the strip, we had to take the monorail and walk quite a bit to find the real excitement of Vegas. Any staff members we approached for assistance or dealt with were not very friendly except for the bell hops–but they are after tips.

We returned to our room later in the evening finding no one had been to our room with soap, etc. My husband called them again letting them know the problem had still not been addressed. They promised (again) that they were sending someone right up. This time they did show up a few minutes later. We opened the bed and found no top sheet, when we questioned the maid about this (as she was cleaning the bathroom) she said it isn't standard for them to place top sheets and that we were expected to sleep under the heavy douvet. We asked for a top sheet and she brought us one, after explaining that the tub was already cleaned and that it looked that way (i.e. dirty) all the time because it was stained.

We spent the rest of our time elsewhere, taking taxi or monorail to downtown or the strip for more action.

Upon checking out we reviewed our hotel bill and noticed that the sushi place we ate at a few nights back overcharged us, we both distinctly remember the bill being around $50.00 with a $7.00 tip, because we discussed it carefully as my husband signed the bill at the sushi table and we compared the prices to our regular sushi place in Palo Alto. The hotel bill summary showed our sushi restaurant bill at around $70.00 and some odd cents. My husband rarely keeps his receipts so we had not way to contest it, seeing it after several days had gone by and having no proof or our original bill. Another thing that ended up being expensive was internet access. Most high quality hotels offer wireless as an no charge amenity, but not Hilton. Paying for several days of wireless service can really add up here. There are probably hotels that are better options because they are: friendlier, honest, have conscientious staff. We wont be staying at the Hilton again.

Reviews.Title: “Barry Manilow@ Las Vegas Hilton”
Reviews.Author: Vegastrip
Reviews.Content: I hate writing and reading bad reviews but that is the purpose of this forum. To inform others of the good and the bad. So, here we go. I found the property to be OK. The common area's were very crowd and I found the hotel somewhat out of the way and very smoke filled. That said, this review is only for Barry Manilow's show. I feel I should put this in this forum because his conduct reflects on this property. We will not return to this property because of the following...... Mr. Manilow plays in the Copacabana Room at the Las Vegas Hilton. The bar at the theater is the Copacabana Bar. You would think he would have played his biggest hit, his show closer, Yes? No would be the right answer. I am not a big fan of Mr. Manilow but my wife is/was. This was what she wanted to do in Vegas. I was all right with it. I figured it would be fun. He did say he was not feeling well 45 minutes into the show. This was after listen to "love is a many splendor thing" and "Moon light serenade." and two other songs that the crowd sat through that were cover songs. If you know your not feeling well cut the crap and play the hits. Bottom line, 2 tickets $397.00. 4 beers and a glow in the dark "fanilow" light stick (my wife's, not mine. haha) during a 53 minute show with no encore, $26.00 with tip. Giving back to Mr. Manilow what he gave the whole theater that night. Priceless. You deserve the only terrible rating I have ever given on this site.

Reviews.Title: “Good only for Fanilows and Trekkies”
Reviews.Author: Josie11
Reviews.Content: This is the home of Barry Manilow and Star Trek - the experience. Those are the two only reasons I can think that anyone would want to stay at this hotel. It was dirty. My boyfriend wore his flip flops in the shower. I don't think the rooms have been renovated (or possibly even cleaned) since the original Star Trek was aired in prime time and Barry was singing the Copa Cobana the first time around. The location is a bit far off the strip - at the very end. You can catch the monorail (which is pricey) to the middle - and then catch the Deuce (bus) for a couple bucks which runs up and down the strip all the way into the old Vegas area (Freemont Street). I was there for work - my boy friend tagged along because it was Vegas. I'm not a gambler - but he is - and was not impressed with the Poker Room at the Hilton (which didn't, incidentally, stop him from spending at least 7 hours sitting in there playing poker - so I'd take that with a grain of salt). Not a terrible place to stay - and they do occasionally have what appear to be great rates - but it's not convenient and really did appear tired and old. We're heading back to Vegas and we're not staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Birthday treat to see Barry Manilow”
Reviews.Author: ZandaSpain
Reviews.Content: This was a mystery trip until I got to the airport in the UK and found out that we were due to fly to Las Vegas as a birthday surprise from my family tickets to see Barry Manilow were included. We stayed 8 nights at the Hilton and had no problems at all with our room - superior in the central tower on the 24th floor - no smoking..................and NO smell of smoke. Room was spacious, had excellent views over the strip and mountains. Bed linen was changed every day, plenty of towels in a spotlessly clean bedroom, and more shower gel was left if you asked, which we did. Staff throughout this hotel were courteous, efficient and when I did complain to reception about the poor quality of the room internet $9.99 a day, they took the charge off the bill without hesitation. The buffet we used on 5 mornings for breakfast, which was varied and plentiful. Staff were efficient and pleasant. The Paradise Cafe served excellent breakfasts and dinner and we thought service was better during the day than in the evenings when it was slower. Barry Manilow was wonderful and the musicians and dancers too. We also saw Menopause the musical in a smaller theatre off the main casino. Very funny...............................well worth seeing. We can recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel for the Price”
Reviews.Author: ladybugx87
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the hilton Friday-Tuesday of Memorial Day weekend. We got an upgraded king room and had a great deal on the room, so I was pleasantly surprised. The room was spacious and clean- certainly not the nicest room I have seen but great for the price. We spent a lot of time in the hotel casino and enjoyed it- the people were nice, the drink lady came around often. We ate dinner at casa nicola for a nice dinner and it was really good- the service was great and the food was tasty, My husband said the filet was one of the best he has had. We also did the buffet for dinner one night- lots of choices and good desserts. I also liked the salad bar and whole fruit choices. We bought a half bottle of wine from the wine shop and drank it and people watched- the wine was very reasonably priced. The pool was nothing special but there are plenty of chairs and a good opportunity for sun.

Reviews.Title: “Check Your Bills Before You Check-Out”
Reviews.Author: Doraemon79
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel for the memorial day weekend far advance so secured a low rate. Called ahead of the time to make sure the room that I was request was available. However, once I arrived, I countered several issues that I normally don't encounter at the hilton property. Mixed feeling about this hotels: PRO: 1. The mattress is VERY comfortable (We did get upgraded to Northtower room for free), typical hilton bed that you can count on. 2. 42" Panasonic Plasma TV in the new renovated room. 3. Location can be nice if you don't like the Las Vegas Blvd Strip traffic. 4. Proximity to the LV convention center. 5. Cheap rates if you can find a deal (perhaps one of the cheapest 3.5* hotel in Vegas area). CON: 1. The hotel is VERY smokey, its bad that I was coughing all the time while I was inside the hotel. 2. Front desk staff - yes, they are quite RUDE compared to the other hotel's front desk. They tried to sell you the renovated room in the north tower for $50 and they told that not even HHonors Diamond member will receive the upgrade on promise. 3. Parking Garage is a bit of walk unless you stay in the North tower. 4. The buffet is average, don't waste ur time eating here. If you want a better buffet dining experience, try The Buffet @ Wynn or Spice Market buffet @ Planet Hollywood/Aladdin. 5. The spa is on the small scale compare to the size of the hotel, limited workout equipment. 6. It took me 3 calls to get things to deliver to my room, actually I had to go downstair to ask them personally (and the front desk was NOT happy about it). 7. The carpet is NOT vacummed!! Our room's floor got other people's leftover HAIRbrush and their luggage tag lefted on the floor, make sure to walk with a slipper in case something poke thru your feet! 8. VIP lounge is very plain, not ur typical HHonors Executive Lounge style. No complimentary waters or snacks. Difficult to upgrade at this property even with status. You'll be better off if you try the $20 trick 9. MAKE SURE TO VIEW UR HOTEL BILL BEFORE YOU CHECK OUT. PRINT UR RATE CONFIRMATION SO YOU CAN USE AS A BACKUP. I have heard that this happens to ALOT of the guests wwho stayed there (according to the clerk). So be aware, you have been warned in advance!

Reviews.Title: “Not bad at all”
Reviews.Author: thegirllowe
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the LV Hilton at the end of April 07. We got a good deal on both the flight and accommodation. We arrived at the hotel late-ish to a great check in, No queues! Brilliant after a long flight and we had heard the rumours about long check in lines in Vegas. We thought our room was fine for the length of our stay (6 nights). It was clean, roomy and the bed was amazingly comfortable. A few things could have been updated like the closet door was coming of it's track and. a layout of the hotel in the rooms would have been good as the hotel is huge (We kept finding new places every day). but these minor faults are not a big deal in the great scheme of things. We didn't have a strip view but had a beautiful view of the golf course and mountains behind the hotel. As some others have pointed out it's not on the strip and to some people it would be a pain but as it was our first time to Vegas we were not bothered. We just became wise to the monorail system. TIP: If you look in the free magazines and some hotel receptions you can find money off coupons for the monorail. We used the tram which runs along the strip one day but we found the journey very long and bumpy compared to the monorail. The hotel has many food and drink amenities. We took advantage of the paradise cafe for breakfast, which had plenty for any tastes or appetites. We also had a fun meal at Quark's Bar and Restaurant, it was certainly a meal to remember, and we're not even fans of star trek. The cocktails are a must. My husband and I were impressed with the overall LV Hilton experience. The staff we're friendly and the hotel had everything we needed. We'd definitely recommend the hotel but I'm not sure if I’d stay here again as a first choice hotel as there are other hotels which we saw which we'd like to try next time but if the price was right I wouldn't say no.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, not so great location”
Reviews.Author: Serge77
Reviews.Content: My hotel experience at the Las Vegas Hilton was good. I no complaints about noise, cleanliness, rude front desk, or amenities. I didn't receive one of the newer rooms, but was quite content with what I received. The rooms was larger than the room I stayed in at the MGM Grand. The rooms more than serves it purpose. The pool area was pretty basic. No real big luxurious pool area, just the basic. pool and chairs. The only downside to this hotel is the location and night entertainment. I am not a Manilow fan or Star Trek, so the nightlife at this hotel wasn't for me. One of the bars had some sort of cover group that sangs all types of songs, they were ok for awhile. The other bad part is the location. Unless you are going to a convention the hotel is away from the strip action. IF you are looking to be away from the strip and all the nightlife this hotel is perfect. The strip is at your fingertips using the monorail. I wouldn't suggest using the bus, even though its cheaper, its takes too long during the day. the monorail is the best bet. I wouldn't stay at this hotel just because next time I go to Vegas I would like to stay on the strip in the middle of all the action just to be close.

Reviews.Title: “a tired hotel”
Reviews.Author: rcaplice
Reviews.Content: Two friends and I spent four nights at the Las Vegas Hilton recently. The room size was decent and there was an additional vanity area outside of the bathroom which was helpful. The hotel is older (it's claim to fame is it's history as the hotel where Elvis had a regular performance venue) and off the Strip. Although it is located away from most of the action, it is located at one end of a monorail that provides transportation to several locations along the Strip. There were a number of annoyances about our stay. We had specifically booked a room with two queen sized beds but when we went to check in we found that the room had two double beds, not two queen sized beds. When we complained we were told that there were no rooms in the hotel with two queen beds so our reservation must have been a mistake! We were pleased to find a welcome basket with fruit and cheese in the room when we arrived. We munched on some of the goodies on the first day and created a dirty plate in the process. That dirty plate stayed in our room for 48 hours and then was moved to the hall outside our door where it remained for the duration of our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Hilton Las Vegas Not up to Hilton Standards”
Reviews.Author: soworthit
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at many Las Vegas properties and actually switched our reservation to this property due to an email invite called the SUMMER SIZZLE package. In addition to reduced room rates, the Summer Sizzle package came with lots of add-ons. The coupons for the add-ons were not given to us at check-in and had to be requested. The package advertises $25 credit toward a spa treatment, but we were never given this item. We booked "The Redesigned Superior Room with Stunning Strip View." This room, of course, cost more than the "Classic Room" or the "Redesigned Premium Room." I actually talked with a Hilton host and was assured that I was booking a king size bed. Additionally, my husband is a Hilton diamond card member. We checked in around 10 pm Thursday evening. There were about 20 people checking in. When we went to our room, the room was lovely, but did not have a strip view -- which we had paid for. We went back to check-in and learned that all the king rooms with a view were booked. We were given a room with a strip view and told that it had two queen size beds. We were told we could switch rooms on Friday. We also were given a list of benefits the diamond card members get, including the $4 bottles of water in the room are complimentary. The room did not have two queen size beds, but two double beds. Additionally, DO NOT PAY FOR A STRIP VIEW. We were on the 19th floor, and the view is completely unremarkable. You are overlooking the Hilton sign, a congested street and the old Riviera sign. There are no strip views -- don't waste the money. The beds do not have flat sheets. Instead, you lay right under the duvet and pray that the housecleaning staff honestly changes them every single time. It's gross. Friday, we went back to get the king sized room we'd been promise. Well, we got the king size bed -- without a strip view. Golf course is beautiful, though. Had to call and demand to be reimbursed the difference in price of a premium room and a superior room with stunning strip view. The $4 water bottles ended up added on to our bill. The hosts arranged for a limo to pick us up at the airport. Honestly, this was a great relief as the limo line was more than an hour wait. The limo driver was great. The charge added onto our bill for transportation was $40 (+ we had tipped him $20). Another complaint: the shower heads must have been installed by very small plumbers. I am 5'11" and the bottom of the showerhead is situated at about 5'8" .. meaning, to be comfortable, you should be no more than 5'5". Showering on my knees is not fun. Bottom line, with so, so many choices in Vegas -- don't bother choosing the Hilton.

Reviews.Title: “Good off-the-Strip hotel”
Reviews.Author: pillowsofwanderlust
Reviews.Content: Had a 3 night stay here over the busy May 5 weekend--the De La Hoya-Mayweather fight at the MGM, the Kentucky Derby, Cinco de Mayo. The best rates I could find originally were at the dumpy but well-located Imperial Palace, an old property with a prime Strip location. A coworker then told me about a promotion the Hilton was offering to Santa Anita Racetrack visitors--rooms for well under $100, plust breakfast buffet. We knew the Hilton wasn't on the Strip, but this was a great deal, especially for this weekend. The Hilton is an older Vegas property east of the Strip, adjacent to the Las Vegas Convention Center. Surely most of its business is from convention attendees. The Hilton has a Monorail stop for easy access to the Strip. Unlike most ot the Strip hotels where the monorail stops at the rear of the property, necessitating a long walk through the casinos to get to the Strip, the Hilton's station is right in front by the Star Trek casino and Experience. Look for coupons for discount monorail tickets in the many booklets found throughout Vegas, including the monorail stations themselves. Check-in was pretty quick, the line short. The check-in area is surprisingly small for such a large hotel--I can imagine there are long lines at times. We were not given our buffet vouchers at check-in, so we had to stand in line again later. The hotel is designed with 3 corridors of rooms radiating from a central core (the Central Tower), a common architechtural design also seen at Mandalay Bay, Monte Carlo, Bellagio, Mirage, Treasure Island and the original Venetian building. North and East Tower rooms were added later by extending 2 of the corridors outward--these towers have their own elevator banks but are still accessible from the Central Tower elevators also. The North Tower rooms have been renovated and cost more. We had an unrenovated "Classic" room in the Central Tower, and it was fine, fairly spacious. The decor was contemporary--the bed had a more modern white duvet, throw, pillow shams and neckroll pillow rather than the usual old-fashioned bedspread. The shams and neck pillow covers cannot be removed--they are covered with a cleansible vinylized fabric, but I personally would not lay on these. The carpet and chairs were a bit tired and worn. The bathroom needs more towel racks. The ceilng above the shower/tub is quite low due to AC equipment above it. The initial supply of towels and bath amenities was paltry but on subsequent days was replenished more substatially. The windows are tinted so during the day the room is a bit dark. The renovated rooms apparently have plasma TVs, but ours was not. Some features on the remote did not work--no movies or on-screen check-out. Also the TV did not swivel and channel selection was minimal. They obviously do not want you to spend much time in the room. There was no directory of hotel features or restaurants, only a room service menu. There is a charge for the in-room safe. If you have a car and want to self-park, the North Tower structure seems closer than the East Tower structure. The casino is on the small side but well equipped. The sportsbook is large. Unlike a lot of casinos that are dark and windowless and you cannot tell if it's night or day, the Hilton's casino is brightly lit with ballroom type lighting and during the day daylight from the front entrance pours well into the casino. The pool (on the casino roof) is small and simple but comtemporarily equipped with cabanas, daybeds and chaises. Tennis courts and the spa are also here. The breakfast buffet was not as lavish as others in Vegas but well done and not overcrowded during our visits. On weekends they only serve brunch starting at 8 AM, but our vouchers still were accepted. We did not try any of the other restaurants. The Hilton has several lounges, but no hot velvet rope nightclubs for Paris Hilton wannabees. Barry Manilow performs here, just as Elvis did 30 years ago. Vegas itself continues to transform and grow--there's something new each time we visit. Constant construction and deconstuction continues everywhere on the Strip. The Stardust is gone. The Aladdin is now the Planet Hollywood, and its Desert Passage Shops are now the Miracle Mile Shops. The Venetian and Wynn are adding new towers, Donald Trump's property north of the Fashion Show Mall is coming along, and the HUGE CityCenter development between Monte Carlo and the Bellagio that will include 5 seperate properties (hotels and/or residences) is well under way. CityCenter is being developed by MGM Mirage, which basically now owns the entire west side of the Strip from Mandalay Bay up to Treasure Island, except for Caesars Palace. If you must stay on the always hopping Strip, the Hilton may not be your first choice. It is worth considering, however, if you can get a good deal.

Reviews.Title: “I Love the Las Vegas Hilton”
Reviews.Author: Kishah
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 3 day weekend at the Las Vegas Hilton. The hotel is magnificent and I think this was my best experience ever. my reservation was for two attached rooms, one king size bed and 2 double beds in a none remodeled room. However when I was checking in they told me that they don't have a king size bed available but they offered to upgrade me to 2 attached remodeled rooms in the North Tower with double beds instead for free. Immediately I said yes because I read a lot of reviews about those old rooms. Thanks Jason. The minute we walked in our rooms we started to scream; It was so lovely. they had the best mattress, a flat screen TV that was huge, a printer , a fridge and a safe ( did not use safe). The bathroom was also so nice They charged me the same price as a none remodeled room. We were 4 adults and two children. Now this hotel is just great for children. It felt family oriented and we didn't get all the strip crowd trying to see the outside show or just jumping from hotel to hotel looking around. Most of the people who came here already had a room. We had 2 for 1 buffet vouchers that helped a lot and the food was great. Thank you Linda B at the buffet. The pizza hut was fun for the kids and they have a very cheap Deli in the sports room that also made a difference. Check it out. My husband did win in the casino but I can't say much since I didn't gamble here. The pool was great so was the jacuzzi. It was not as big as other hotels but more luxurious. Our children are 7 & 9 and they enjoyed it.The drinks at the pool side are not cheap but my children enjoyed the souvenir cups with the Hilton's name on them. They took so many pictures with those cups. Now that is what I call free advertisement. Bring a small cooler with you and put your own water and drinks. I saw a lot of people do that. Order something different just for the experience. The Spa is awesome too but make sure when you book your rooms try to get free admission to the spa. It cost $20 /day, but there is always a way of getting in free. Just talk to somebody at the check-in desk. If you decide on walking the only 3 hotels that you can walk to from Las Vegas Hilton is the Riviera, Circus Circus and Stratosphere. If you don't have a car, rent one if possible or take the Monorail (gets expensive if you are a huge party, but is cheap if your alone). They also have a Trolley that picks you up from the North tower of the hotel. my children and I enjoyed it a lot. If your not in a hurry and don't want to walk in the sun during the day this is great, but it is slow because it passes at almost most of the hotels for only 2.50 a ride and 6.50 for the whole day. they also have three day passes ...... If you have children you will feel very comfortable in this hotel. Even the other two adults that were with us enjoyed it. I saw some young enough children ride the elevators on their own. This is how safe it is over here. I will only recommend this hotel if you get a good price (Friday & Saturday $76 & Sunday $60). I booked my rooms about 2 month ahead of time). I hope you injoy your trip if you decide to go to the Hilton. Overall I would say this is probably the best hotel we have ever stayed in . Perhaps not the most convenient if all you want to do is be on the strip but not bad at all if you have a car since valet is free at all the hotels you just have to give a tip if you want. Tip: Drive on Paradise road if you don't like the strip traffic and the pedestrians.It is parallel to the Strip.

Reviews.Title: “North tower only!”
Reviews.Author: ranjean2003
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here twice. The North Tower room had been renovated but the central tower was old and dumpy. Guess which you will get if you book a "bargain". The North Tower is actually my favorite place to stay in Vegas. I can park in the ramp and access my room w/o going thru the casino or security. Some of the staff can give good tips if you are casual enough to deal with them on a personal level rather than as a shrill tourist. I like a quieter more private hotel for sleeping and this fits the bill. However, even though I am not overly picky, I can't relax in the old rooms. The furnishings are literally from the 1960's. And as much as I like the North tower - I wouldn't pay $200 a night for it. What I like are the granite counter tops and nice furnishings - kind of quiet quality. The casino is forgettable, so you will have to plan on travelling for your fun. I like to rent a car in Vegas. One warning is I may have left some claw marks in the elevators trying to get away from the constant Barry Manilow music in there.

Reviews.Title: “Far Away”
Reviews.Author: CVWorldtraveler
Reviews.Content: Too far from everything. Expensive restaurants with bad service. Room was nice and the maid service was good. I stayed here because my conference took place here, but otherwise would not stay because the lack of choice of restaurants and being far from the main attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Great!!!!”
Reviews.Author: EnglandLondon
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Las Vegas Hilton on the 10th April this year . I booked the hotel through websites called hotelanywhere.co.uk and goamerica.co.uk (we had 2 rooms) as those sites offered better rates than the hotel's own sites. Having stayed at the LV Hilton in April 2005 I knew of the location of the hotel and already had my basic opinions of it. I am pleased to say that not only did my stay this time support my previous opinion, it actually improved it. The rooms we had were in the Central Tower rooms 918 and 919, both with a lovely view of the golf course and mountains, the rooms were spotlessly clean, every night when we returned the beds had been made and the towels had been folded. It was a delight to stay in a hotel that had such lovely rooms, the bedding (white was a clean white duvet), the towels, the only small fault I could find was that one room did not have a towel rail by the sink, but this in no way caused any problems or inconveniences. Whilst staying at the LV Hilton I was a Gold Hilton Honors member, so my sister and I received free breakfast in the buffet. Once again, I could not fault the service nor the food. My Mum and Dad had to pay for their meals in the buffet, but the valve for money was still very good. The casino was as good as I would have expected, unfortunately I did not win, but I thoroughly enjoyed trying. I would certainly recommend this hotel to anyone. The cost for 3 nights was approximately £100 per room. Unfortunately the photos I took of the room did not come out, but I was in one of the 'normal', not the upgraded room. I can't see that the upgrade would have been worth the extra cost.

Reviews.Title: “Average Quality”
Reviews.Author: 2112ps
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hilton in April. Rooms are not worth over $89 per night standard or $119 deluxe this is compared to other similiar priced properties in vegas. It's basically a big above average Holiday Inn. The hotel is not owned or operated by Hilton which is why it is like an above average Holiday Inn.The hotel is franchised. In the early 1990's this was one of the top places in town for the upscale convention crowd. I have some fond memories with dear friends here.

Reviews.Title: “Great quiet hotel and casino”
Reviews.Author: myshnook
Reviews.Content: I had a great room at the Hilton. Everything was very clean, and the resort was quiet. Although my room was not one of the renovated ones, it was great. I was on the 27th floor, and had a spectacular view. I found the hotel easy to get in and out of. I used the valet parking, and everyone there was very friendly. I got free tickets to the Joe Piscopo Show, and there were no strings--free was free. You could order a drink if you wished, but were under no obligation to do so. The show was great, and you couldn't beat the price. I booked at an extremely cheap price though Expedia, but I was always treated as a valued guest. I found the employees to be friendly and helpful. The monorail is a great way for getting around. It is very convenient in the hotel, and is about the price for the day that you would spend to get to middle of the strip via taxi. The taxis, however were clean and the drivers were friendly. My daughter forgot her purse in a taxi, and other taxi drivers, along with the bell and valet staff at the hotel helped us find the taxi we were in. We were able to get her purse back thanks to their help. I would recommend the Hilton if you are looking for a nice, clean room with a quieter, more mature atmosphere. If you are looking for the excitement and noise of the strip, you won't find it here.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Away!!!!”
Reviews.Author: gottman
Reviews.Content: Never again. This was the worst Hilton experience I have ever had. Rooms were very run down. Staff could care less if you have a good experience. I even have status in the Hilton Honors program. Based on this Hilton stay I will be concentrating my hotel stays at other chains

Reviews.Title: “Ok for the price”
Reviews.Author: cliveasmith
Reviews.Content: Stayed here April 4/5. Had stayed here last year for a couple of nights so when we were asked at check in if we wanted to upgrade for extra we didn't. This time the room was not as good as the one we were given last time. The first stay was in the north tower and this time central, we prefered the north. Both rooms were unrenovated. Overall we found the Hilton value as we only paid $70 a night, if it had been any more we would have stayed elsewhere. I would only reccomend staying here if the price is low as there are far too many hotels which offer the same or more in a better location if you are paying a higher price.

Reviews.Title: “Stay april 8-13 with 10 family members 10 to 75”
Reviews.Author: nabreak
Reviews.Content: Caught a package deal with USAir. Air flight terrible. Got standard room, Room and pool was nice had space. Rent a car ( note Rent a CAR). lunch and dinner buffet was JUST OK. 1st day bought 3.00 coffee, (note go to sports room Deli has good coffee for 1.25) Front desk check in was Quick, Slots you have to choose wisely (l1st row in space quest, right corner area before sports book & buffet area slots were OK. Video Pokers sucks. Star Trek was worth the 1/2 price tickets. note this is my Second time to Las Vegas in 2yrs Vegas is going Down Hill fast. Not sure who they are trying to cater to but if they keep pace it's going to be another 80's city gone to dust

Reviews.Title: “Prefer "Old" Hilton”
Reviews.Author: champMinnesota
Reviews.Content: Weather and pool area were fabulous. Rest of Hilton was like Vegas - overhyped with little substance. Hotel was too large, as were most of their prices. Rooms adequate. $20/day for exercise room which they call a "Spa" - even for hotel guests. $3 coffee. Bring your laptop if you have to communicate electronically - $7.50 for 15 minutes of Internet access in their "Business Center". Slot machines that didn't even tease me for a little while; had better luck elsewhere, including at the airport. We stayed at this location before it became the "New" Hilton and prefer the old. Thank goodness for the wonderful weather......

Reviews.Title: “What a disappointment.”
Reviews.Author: Debs42
Reviews.Content: I booked months ahead of time. I was really coming to see Barry Manilow one more time before, well, one more time. I'm here now, and Barry was truly great. The Hilton is truly average. I booked a renovated room with a super strip view. I got the renovated room alright, but they forgot to clean the construction mess up, and they forgot to provide the fab strip view. I went downstairs and had my room changed. The bell staff were going to help me move my bags, but they never showed up. After 45 minutes, I gave up on them and moved myself. It took me three trips. This Hilton charges $3 per day for the inroom safe. (The Hilton I visited in Austin last week provided one at no charge. Why are they different?) There's no in-room coffee, no minibar, no mouthwash, no soapdish and only one drinking glass. The remote doesn't fully work; I reported it 6 hours ago. Oddly, there are no sources of information in the room. No instructions on how to get on the internet (another daily charge, $12 per day, and it's not wifi). No map of the facility, no list of restaurants. I find this whole experience to be almost like they aren't expecting any guests, and are surprised when someone rings guest services with a question. (When I rang guest services for help connecting my laptop to the internet, she told me I had to do it throught my television. Eventually she provided a number for me to ring for assistance.) I'm disappointed. Barry was great, but the hotel is tired, scruffy and the service is poor. I won't be back.

Reviews.Title: “Blah experience”
Reviews.Author: Geoggirl
Reviews.Content: As a gold member in the HiltonHonors programs, I had pretty high expectations for my stay at the Las Vegas Hilton. I would have to say that my room was comparable to a Motel 6 I have stayed at for $45, not a Hilton that cost nearly $200/night. This was definitely not an upgraded room. It was large but seemed very basic. My husband and I were quite surprised that our bed was actually a murphy bed (the kind pulled down from the wall)! I believe it was a queen and only had a comforter and a very poorly fitted bottom sheet. The bed was the quality of a sofa bed, low to the ground and somewhat lumpy. Very minimal amenities in the room. I did not see any way to provide feedback on the room to the management, no comment form or anything like that. I won't be in a rush to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value, Nice Casino and Pool, Overall Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: andrew_branham
Reviews.Content: I travel every week for work and typcially stay in Hilton hotels to accumulate Hilton Honors points. Because of this, I decided to give the Hilton Las Vegas a try (rathar than a hotel on the strip). I was very pleased with my overall stay at the Hilton. If you are a HH member, you will get upgraded to a new room with plasma tvs, huge marble bathrooms, and "Sweet Dreams' beds. The hotel has a very nice casino and very nice heated pool with cabanas. I did not try the restaurants here but did have roomservice one night and it was very good. As a HH member, you also receive a full breakfast each day. The fact that the Hilton is not directly on the strip is more a bonus than a negative. For $4, you can jump on the Monorail (in the Hilton) and you are dropped off at any spot on the trip in five mins (and they run every five mins). This avoids traffic and expensive cabs. I really enjoyed the Hilton and will be back for sure. Also, don't miss the VIP lounge if you are a HH Diamond member (many benefits plus free open bar with top shelf liquor.....all you can drink)

Reviews.Title: “Used tripadvisor for trip advice”
Reviews.Author: xxqsme
Reviews.Content: I used Trip Advisor for Trip Advice. I read about the hotel after the room and a show was booked. Yikes!!! What have I gotten us into? So, I used the reviews. I called the hotel and requested a room in the renovated part of the property and offered to pay the $50.00 upgrade. No problem. The room was just fine, not like the many other reviews with respect to the older parts of the hotel. The room was clean and quiet. This is a REALLY big hotel. It was fine for a 45 minute flight from California for a one night stay and show. I wouldn't stay here again or eat or gamble here for that matter. Trip Advisor just helped make a not so good hotel tolerable. Thanks to all who wrote before me!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed the Stay”
Reviews.Author: Richland34
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the LV Hilton for 3 days for a conference nearby. We chose the Hilton because their rates were significantly better than the "conference rates" offered by the hotel hosting our conference. I stayed in a "regular" room (vs. "upgraded") and thought it was fine. Very spacious, nice bedding, decent bathroom, etc. Nothing elaborate, but certainly comfortable and clean. For the money spent, it was an unbelievably good value. I don't usually spend the extra $$ to eat at the upscale restaurants in LV because there are so many options which cost far less. However, our small group decided to go to the Italian restaurant in the Hilton. It was expensive (my perception) but a very worthwhile splurge. I ordered a pasta entree which had large piecesof lobster in it, as well as some other seafood. The price was $32 and worth every penny....absolutely wonderful! We had an outstanding bottle of Chianti too. The absolute BEST feature of the LV Hilton is their Fortuna Coffee and Wine "experience" in the main lobby. They serve Illy coffee which is an Italian brand I discovered and fell in love with while in Europe last year. Would certainly stay at the LV Hilton again. No, it doesn't have a volcano, dancing fountains or gondolas on a canal, but it DOES have an excellent cup of coffee!

Reviews.Title: “Great time at the Hilton”
Reviews.Author: annieAustin
Reviews.Content: Great time at the Hilton. It is a huge place, but easy to get around and with easy access to the monorail, you can get around Vegas, as well. Our room was nice and spacious with large windows and great views. We were close to the elevator, but never heard it, very quiet inside the room. The buffet and other hotel restaurants were very good. The pool is large with plenty of lounge chairs, towels and service. We really enjoyed our stay. We have been there before and plan to stay there again. We have stayed at several other places in Vegas, but for an all around nice, pleasant stay, the Hilton is the one we like the best.

Reviews.Title: “Third-rate place at first class prices, never again”
Reviews.Author: dmac5356
Reviews.Content: Arrived to a 30 minute line to check-in. The room is okay, but old and tattered. Although a non-smoking room, the air coming through the vents has a continuous flow of cigarette smoke. The shower water was cool at best. The fire alarm went off one night, a few people joined me in walking down the stairs, but none of the Hotel employees seemed to even know that it had gone off, or if it was real. I bought a small rum and Coke that was 90% ice that cost $8. Finally, although the hotel is next to the LV Convention Center, it is several long blocks from The Strip. There is a monorail to take you there, but it is time consuming and costs $9 round trip. I stayed at this same hotel many years ago - early 1980's. At that time I thought it was a nice place. Unfortunately, it has not held up well over the years. This is a third-rate place at first class prices. Never again.

Reviews.Title: “Too many negatives”
Reviews.Author: almcclymont
Reviews.Content: The first thing the receptionist said to me was "Would you like to upgrade to a brand dew room for $50/night?" Uh, no thanks, I'll stick with the cruddy room you've got planned for me. Thus began my disappointing stay. In a nutshell, the Hilton Las Vegas seems dated. I've been to much, much better hotels around the world for the price I paid here (some $260 a night). Note that the Hilton charges for absolutely everything! I received several packages during my week-long stay. The hotel charges $7 per piece, more if they're heavier! This blew my mind. To be fair, when she saw my exasperation, the manager did get me a 50% discount, but still... No wifi (only in the coffee shop downstairs). In-room safe, $3 a day. Gym, $20 a day. 800 and local calls. No in-room coffee, no minibar, not even a pen (they later left one), just a few rumpled sheets of letter paper and envelopes. The clock radio was circa 1970. The wake up service, 1975. The only pluses: proximity to the convention center, well within walking distance. And my room was quite spacious. I am sure there are better hotels for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel”
Reviews.Author: dat72
Reviews.Content: As a whole, I'd say the Hilton is average. Went with a large group and service and rooms varied. We paid to upgrade to some of the recently remodeled rooms in the North Tower. Beds were pillow topped and comfortable and flat screen tvs were a nice touch. Others were in non remodeled rooms in the center tower that were a bit dated. Boiler went down in that tower and many people were forced to take cold showers. After some complaining mgt. comped a free buffet. Kind of cheap in my opinion. Speaking of the buffet, waited in line for over 30 minutes on a Thursday night while seeing many open tables, even the comped line was waiting. Seemed very understaffed there. Stopped waiting and went to BeniHanas. Good food and service but a bit overpriced, like most everthing in Vegas. Location is a hike from the main strip but being a monorail stop is nice. $5 for one ride on the steep side but $15 for the day pass gets you to the strip and up and down for about the price of a round trip taxi.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Wedding & Reception”
Reviews.Author: dadogladyCalifornia
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had our wedding on Feb. 10 at the Las Vegas Hilton - new chapel - LaBella Wedding Chapel which was fabulous along with a reception in the Tempo Lounge which was just as fabulous it was everything I could have asked for and the Wedding Coordinators and Photographer made it "Picture Perfect Plus our Honeymoon Suite was so gorgeous I couldn't believe it was so perfect. I recommend this Chapel and having a reception in the Tempo Lounge a must. The reception was arranged by the Wedding Coordinators and was part of my Wedding Package, "A Moment Like This". Fabulous!

Reviews.Title: “Outdated and Poor Service”
Reviews.Author: jp5o
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel 3 times, because I was forced to due due to work ... It survives only because of its location next to the Convention Center. It is probably the worst value for the money (other than location) of all of the hotels in the area. Their serivce is poor and their rooms are outdated.

Reviews.Title: “We can't wait to return next year!”
Reviews.Author: KatMacSavannah
Reviews.Content: One of our best vacations ever! Everything about our 5 day stay was great! Wonderful room (which was located on the 26th floor of the North Tower), excellent restaurants (best meal ever at Quarks) and Professional staff and management. We can't wait to return next year!

Reviews.Title: “Only for conventions”
Reviews.Author: bpdogs
Reviews.Content: Sorry about this late review, but I think it's important. I have been visiting Vegas for about 27 years. I have stayed at probably 20 different hotels over that time, many now long gone. My first visit to this hotel was in 1980. Back then this was a special place. Even the pool was one of the best back then. Unfortunately, it's still the same! A lot has changed since then, just not at the Hilton. No major hotel has fallen so far behind over the years in Vegas than this one. Now, that doesn't mean it's a bad hotel. However, this is Vegas, and there are so many choices now! Not only is this hotel overpriced in every category,(food, shops, etc) but being one long block off the strip doesn't help. Plus, it's the old more run down part of the strip. The addition of the monorail helps, but even that is overpriced! The problem is the convention center its connected to. The convention center has grown so much over the years and now is constantly hosting something. Because of this, the Hilton has no reason to spend money on anything but small upgrades. You see, this is THE place to stay if you are attending a convention due to the fact that it is literally connected to the convention center. Unless of course you don't care shuttling from the center to a different hotel. I personally don't like to do that. However, when I am in Vegas for entertainment, there are so many other better choices.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay at the Vegas Hilton”
Reviews.Author: Dapzilla
Reviews.Content: CHECK-IN: Our arrival was approximately 1:30PM on a Thursday. Taxis drop right outside the lobby/check-in area. We had no wait to check in, since there were multiple attendants available. The process was quick and smooth, and our attendant was very accommodating of requests. Note: if you are paying for your room with a Visa/Debit or MC/Debit card, the hotel will place an extra hold of $50 per night on your card (in the event you wish to use room services or charge items to your room.) If you want to strictly pay for the room on your card you must specifically instruct the attendant in order to avoid the hold! LAYOUT: The hotel is easy to navigate. Room are located within 3 towers, all of which are an easy walk from the lobby and casino areas. There are 2 casinos at the Hilton: The Spacequest Casino and the Crystal Casino. The Crystal is fairly standard fare, but the Spacequest is a fun, different look, with overhead lasers, changing lighting in the floors, chromed-out detailing, and neon-chased tubes. Shops and services are all located en route to the room elevators, so overall hotel access is well-planned. Taxis are plentiful off the lobby area, but best of all, the Hilton is a monorail stop, so this hotel makes for easy access to all points of the Strip. ROOMS: We booked a king-size/non-smoking room, and were very pleased with the room appearance. It looked so much nicer in person than online!! Lots of marble and granite touches, plush bed coverlet, modern lighting, inner bathroom sink, outer vanity area sink, and a spacious tub were all positive impressions. Large windows gave a great view of the Stratosphere. We were only a few doors away from the elevators, and had no problems with noise. My only complaint was that the Serta Perfect Sleeper beds were very, very firm. My husband ended up sleeping in the (very comfortable) chair in the room, because the bed was so hard on his back. 3 pillows were provided with the bedding, and a spare was in the closet. Iron, hairdryer, luggage stands, and lockable safe were all provided. The room was thoroughly cleaned and restocked with fresh towels/shampoo/soaps every day. RESTAURANTS: There is a wide variety of food options at the Hilton - hibachi, sushi, Chinese, all-American, Mexican, or buffet. Prices varied, but were all reasonable. We enjoyed the buffet immensely - breakfast, champagne brunch, and dinners. Choice of beer and wines were included with dinner buffet, and meat-eaters, rejoice! There was no shortage of meat and seafood options at this buffet, both breakfasts and dinners alike. We enjoyed several stops at Quark's Bar for lunches, dinners, and drinks. Their food is fun to order, and is presented in a unique way. I love the atmosphere there... even if you are not a Trekkie, it's good stuff. ATTRACTIONS: The shops were somewhat of a letdown for me. Very overpriced, in my opinion, and nothing out of the ordinary. There are not a lot of shopping options at the Hilton, but I did appreciate the "business center," a packaging/mail station that would make this hotel a good spot for business travelers. The Star Trek Experience would have been too costly at full-price, but at the Half Price ticket location, $20 per person was well worth it! Both the Borg Invasion and the Klingon Encounter were amazing, and I'm not even really "into" the whole Trek thing. I think that you would need to be die-hard Trekkie to enjoy the Trek museum and shopping options in the Spacequest area, but the 4-D rides are a great experience. Spring for it! The pool looks very nice, but we didn't use them during this visit, so I can't make any comment to that end. Casino and Sports Book aside, we didn't really sense much of a night-pulse at the Hilton. The Tempo Lounge was mellow, and there isn't a night club onsite. Hop the monorail to livelier locales, if you are seeking nighttime attractions. CHECK-OUT: Smooth sailing, once again. Our bill was accurate, and while we had no wait at all, there was also drop-box check-out available. Taxis were available right outside. It's about a $30 trip to the airport, with heavy traffic. OTHER: Overall, we had a very good experience at the Hilton! If you book on the hotel website, be sure to check back frequently for rate changes. They are happy to adjust any daily rate downward with a simple phone call, if the price dips at all.

Reviews.Title: “Get what you pay for.”
Reviews.Author: luv2trvlots
Reviews.Content: Had different experience than previous reviewer. Not a bad stay but nothing to write home about. Have stayed at the Hilton twice, both times in December coming in for the National Finals Rodeo which made this choice very convenient for us. The hotel has/and is still is undergoing renovations. If you get a renovated room, and I definitely recommend you request one, they are great. One of the best beds in Vegas with Down comforters and pillow bed toppers... slept like a baby… but be careful not to get above/below/or on the same level as where the renvoations are taking place! Hotel is off the beaten path but you can take the Monterail to strip hotel very easily and inexpensively compared to a taxi. Hotel casino is nothing much and pretty small. Pool is very basic as well.(Prefer the Paris if staying in Vegas for anything other than the rodeo!)

Reviews.Title: “Good Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: Travelfool11
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the LV Hilton for one night the week between Christmas and Thanksgiving. It was my second trip to the hotel in a year and found it be be a pretty good experience. I am a Hilton Honors Diamond Member and as advertised I received an upgrade from the standard room to a junior suite. We had a great view of the strip and free full breakfast buffet. (TIP - If you're an Honors Gold or Diamond Member and stay over the weekend you get a free Champagne Brunch, very good!) We did not however receive our advertised two bottles of water. The room was very large and clean. Like some other reviewers suggested the bed was not the most comfortable and some of the furnishings need updating. Although my room had been updated there were a few small things that needed to be improved including the alarm clock which not only didn't work but kept going off at odd hours and wouldn't shut off. All in all this is a really petty complaint though. As other reviewers mentioned, this hotel is not on the strip and is not the place to go when you want the true Vegas experience. It is however a good value during peak seasons or when the other casinos aren't running good specials. The monorail is located right in the hotel and will take you to the larger casinos in just a few minutes. Just keep in mind the monorail is expensive (one day pass cost us $15 per person). If you're going to Vegas for business of pleasure and can find a great deal at one of the larger, newer casinos, I'd definitely stay there. If however you can get a good deal at the Hilton its definitely decent although not what you're normally expect from a Hilton. If you're a Gold or Diamond Honors member you do get treated like a VIP (including front of the line privileges at most of the restauarants). Most other casinos save these privileges only for their "high rollers".

Reviews.Title: “Time for renovation”
Reviews.Author: ks-bike-rider
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the LV Hilton many times over the last 10-15 years and each time it seems more run down. My last visit in Dec 06 for a conference will be my last visit there until it is bulldozed and rebuilt, or completely remodeled. The casino area and check-in area was fine, but once you get away from there, everything starts to get shabby. The hallway carpets were worn, restaurant decors were dated, the rooms were in need of updating, and there was a complete loss of water one morning, which I discovered after working out! Another morning I was greeted with only cold water. For the price that I paid, there are MANY other choices in newer and refurbished hotels that are as convenient to the convention center.
