Reviews.Title: “Good value at the price we paid”
Reviews.Author: dfwguy
Reviews.Content: This hotel is branded Hilton- but as a Hilton Gold member I know that the Hilton LV is not up to the usual standards of the Hilton chain. We were in the Central Tower -17th floor. Diamond and Gold Hhonors members can expect: 2 free bottles water in the room at check-in Free admission to buffet (for member and 1 guest) free admin to the health club (where the bottled water is free- hint-hint) Free in room-safe Pros: Room was very clean - Housekeeping was always very prompt linens were nice (extra pillows, too) All staff encountered from housekeeping to buffet were fantastic close to the monorail Internet connection $11.95 per 24 hours Cons: Elevators are always crowded and always slow Temperature controls for rooms don't work well (we were uncomfortably warm) the entire stay. Ice machines (2 of them) on the floors perpetually out of ice by 5 pm No casino "fun books" or "coupon books" at check-in No in-room hotel directory listing hotel restaurants-services, etc. (the hotel TV channel did not offer this data either) - we asked at the front desk and were told they did not offer these ! (?) No coffee pot/brewer in room The buffet was good (we had breakfast there every day)- lots of the usual breakfast fare -wait staff was plentiful and efficient -getting re-fiils on drinks was never a problem . Hilton LV is a good deal if the price is right (we paid $55.) but at double that or higher I would probably go to a competitor.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Stay away from Javier at the front desk !!”
Reviews.Author: wafaacar
Reviews.Content: Stayed here four times this year--all great experiences. Just stay away from JAVIER. This front desk supervisor has tried to ruin two consecutive visits. If you have a request at this hotel make sure JAVIER does not get involved in it. My wife and I stay at Hilton Hotels over 100 nights a year. Hilton rewards frequent guests with upgrades and free meals. JAVIER told us he could not do this. When I asked why he said, "well this isnt really a Hilton Hotel". I had to spend 15 minutes on the phone with Hilton HHonors to get someone to call and explain to JAVIER that he actually DID work at a Hilton. Took twenty minutes to check in and finally get the right room. Great way to start the visit. THANKS JAVIER. Other than that, it was great as always. Excellent rooms. Great rates. Nice spa, they run specials for about $65 a night that includes a massage. OK buffet (they include beer and wine with the buffet for dinner--nice touch). Like all the strip hotels they have 10+ restaurants, one for every taste and budget. Excellent sports book. Small card room full of locals waiting to prey on the fish. The parking garage is easy access and security is always present.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: Barry1972
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Las Vegas Hilton from 20th-23rd November 06. Had a very enjoyable stay throughout and found the hotel fantastic value for money.($60 p/n). Rooms large with all expected amenities & good housekeeping standards.Staff always polite & efficient, though maybe lacked a little warmth... but in such a huge hotel and with such vast numbers of guests to deal with, is this surprising. Always found more than enough staff on hand to cope with the volume of people around. All in all, great value stay in a good hotel. Huge buffets breakfast with excellent choice & good value for money, but also try the fresh food in the 24hr coffee shop.

Reviews.Title: “Too far from strip”
Reviews.Author: RLBow
Reviews.Content: This was a very nice hotel with very helpful staff, but if you want the bright lights of the strip, the LV Hilton is not for you. Although the monorail is nearby, this is a more expensive way of travelling around. Vegas is very tiring anyway as its so big, but we found that it was a nightmare going out for the day onto the strip as we couldn't come back in the evening to freshen up to go out as the hotel was simply too far away from all the action. The hotel itself was very clean and a very pleasant stay with fab views of the strip. However if your prime reason for visiting Vegas is to enjoy the bright lights of the strip I would highly recommend paying that little bit more and staying on the strip itself & it will be worth it.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: quickybird
Reviews.Content: Very nice room. Large enough with a comfartable bed. The hotel was very smokey. Our room was a non-smoking and the room itself smelled ok, but every night our room became overwhelmed with smoke though the vents. Free breakfast buffet for hilton diamond members. Unless you are really into star trek, do not do the star trek experience. It was LAME!

Reviews.Title: “Has it's +s and -s, I recommed the newer renovated rooms”
Reviews.Author: freykr
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this hotel before a few times. A tip I learned from first stay. DONT get a room even remotely near the elevator, the noise is horrendous. This trip my double was offered, I was alone asked for a king, they said only available King's were next to elevator, I opted for a double away from the shaft. If you book this hotel at the right times [non convention in town] the price/value is great, this trip got a group rate of 4179 per night, I tried to add on a Saturday, which would have been $450 a night [I passed] I've booked this other times for $79, watch the rates book well in advance. Initially I had a problem, the average bland room I was given, it was 60 degrees, outside it was 64, I wanted my room warmer, but the heater didnt work. After many attempts of getting it looked at by housekeeping or engineering, they finally moved me to an upgraded recently renovated room in the North tower. WOW what a difference. MUCH nice rooms and amenities. 42" plasma screen TV, printer in room, new furniture and much nicer bedding, European style pillows and comforters. Scale in bathroom in case one monitors the results of Las Vegas buffets, just much better then their average rooms. I am told that eventually all rooms will be the new renovated style. The highlight of my stay this trip [Nov 12-17th 2006] was getting invited to a private party in the "Elvis suite" on the top floor. WOW what a suite, neat stories abut the suite that Elvis stayed in back when it was the International Hotel. HUGE suite, many rooms, 14,000 sq ft, thats 6 times the size of my house!

Reviews.Title: “Thanks Giving Weekend 2006”
Reviews.Author: dolphinview
Reviews.Content: We booked through Tripreservations.com. The nice Receptionist, a redhaired lady by the name of " Donna " made us feel very welcome. Our room was spcacious, on the 11th floor, non smoking,with 2 beds, table, desk & chair, bathroom incl. tub and shower. We felt so comfortable there that we did not leave the HOTEL for 2 days, just ate at Thank's Giving at the Beautiful Buffet which had lots of Lox & Bagles, and all kinds of selected fine meats and deserts. We ate there 3 times. We will go to this Hotel again, which has luxurious fine features, clean air and friendly personel throughout the hotel and casino. We did not see many families there with children. Thank you Hotel "Hilton "for a very nice relaxing stay ! Donald F. & Katharina Avery

Reviews.Title: “So so Hilton”
Reviews.Author: HikeBiker
Reviews.Content: One of my friends set up this trip with his points so the hotel was free. I am glad I didn't have to pay for this hotel because it really would not have been worth it. As you may or may not know the Hilton is WAY off the strip. Luckily the monorail has a station at the hotel so you are able to get around fairly easily. One other bonus is that it is near some of the older parts of the strip so if you are into gambling there are some low table minimums. Not to mention you are closer to some of the more "colorful" parts of Vegas. If you are not as into color as much as I am I would suggest taking the monorail south to the flashy hotels. The hotel itself is sort of a Bally's kind of place, which means no theme and very little character of it's own. The rooms are decent, like any nice Motel 6 and the like. Somewhat rundown with little details that are starting to fail like the towel caddy in the bathroom one nut from collapse. The floors, ceiling and walls are very thin and you can hear everything, and I mean everything around you. The staff are average in their service and quality with nothing to crow about or cry about. The tables at the Hilton are usually $10 no matter what time of the day and the slots are pretty tight. The sports book is another subject all together, this place is huge. How can you not like a place with more screens than anywhere else and football beers holding 50 ounces of malted goodness. Overall it was a decent hotel. I would not recommend it to anyone and I wouldn't stay there again, unless someone used their points again to make it a free stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel Comfortable Casino”
Reviews.Author: TennRoadWarrior
Reviews.Content: Checked in on Thanksgving and out on Monday Nov 27th. Was staying for free on Hilton Honors points, so I love the price. We got a room in the East Tower on the 22nd floor. There were a bunch of screaming kids in the room next door so we called down a requested a room change. The front desk sent a bellman and we were moved to the 14th floor. The room was a standard room...king bed...all granite counters and tabletops. The room was clean and fulfilled our needs. The casino is small enough to be comfortable but large enough to be able to get a seat at a table. The sports book is the best in town. I will be staying here again...but on points.

Reviews.Title: “Not taking care of their regulars”
Reviews.Author: coastalbrett
Reviews.Content: I have been staying at the Hilton for many years. They have always taken good care of me with promotions and discounts. Unfortunately they have changed with new ownership and corporate policies. As do many properties, they send me mailers advertising specials. I went to make a new reservation for December and there are so many restrictions that I have now decided to change my loyalty. No Saturday arrivals, etc... I hope they take better care of their regular guests in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Truly Disappointing!”
Reviews.Author: beadgirl32
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a 3 night stay at this hotel and will never stay there again. I checked in on a Sunday morning and the staff was very rude. I was in a room on the 14th floor that had not been rennovated. The room (and hallways) reeked of smoke. My room itself was dingy and dirty - in fact, the maid had mistakenly left her feather duster on the tv. Most of my outlets did not work and one was coming out of the wall completely. The bathroom was disgusting - hair on the floor, mold and the faucet was coming out of the wall. The only positive I can find is that I had a nice view of the strip. Considering I paid $170+ per night, I certainly expected much more. If I attend a convention again I will definitely stay anywhere else and use the monorail.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised!”
Reviews.Author: ROCKMO62
Reviews.Content: My husband had a trade show at the convention center. They offered a special discount if you were there for that. ($159.00) We got there at 10am Saturday. We had no wait, and were offered an upgrade in the north tower for $50.00 more. I am so glad we took them up on it.The north tower has been redone within the last two months.We had a king size bed with a pillow top. A flat screen tv,robes,slippers & huge bathtub.After reading all the negative reviews I had kept my expectations low. I was pleasantly surprised. We had dinner at the Steakhouse which was very good. Room service for breakfast that was right on time & quite hot! We took the monorail downtown to the Mirage to see Danny Gans. (great show!!) The slot machines were quite cold, but we did ok playing blackjack. The gym is terrible!! They also charge $18.00 per day. The internet is $11.99 per day. I feel that this day in age none of these things should be charged extra. The convenience in staying here is if you have a show at the convention center it makes everthing easier. It is not near any of the big hotels but it was perfect for all our needs. We come to Vegas every two years and have stayed at the Bellagio, Luxor, Mandalay Bay, and the Mirage. Our next trip will be to the Wynn. We had lunch by the pool there and it was magnificent! All in all the Hilton is fine if you are there for a convention. Otherwise I would recommend staying closer to the action.Also request the north tower only! From what people told me, the east tower is horrible! Old and very dated! Have fun & good luck playing!!

Reviews.Title: “Definitly a hotel for business not pleasure”
Reviews.Author: bluestark8
Reviews.Content: First off the hotel is far away from the action but the monorail outside was very convient. The rooms were nice and large but werent anything special and definitly not the luxury you would expect from the hilton chain. The pool area was slighlty dated and wasnt any service to be found. my advice is if your going to vegas on business and dont want to be distracted then stay here, but if your looking for action and fun stay in a theme hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel !”
Reviews.Author: ggm78
Reviews.Content: I had read many negative reviews about the hotel so wasn't sure what it would be like. However, when we arrived we were offered an upgrade to one of the newly refurbished rooms in the North Tower, this was an extra $50 per night, but was well worth it, great bed, great bathroom, 32inch plasma TV and great views of the las vegas strip !.. Didn't really use the casino much as we went to other hotels on the strip... The monorail stops at the hotel, so it's easy to get to the other strip hotels.. We had freinds staying at Luxor and Circus Circus and i can tell you the Hilton rooms are much nicer !!.. (although this is based on one of the newly refurbished rooms)... However, it's beyond me that anyone can give this 1 star !, we had a great stay !

Reviews.Title: “HHonors Diamond Member Very Unhapppy”
Reviews.Author: Nerdgrrlliz
Reviews.Content: I've been a Diamond member in the Hilton Honors program for over 10 years and have stayed in many Hiltons throughout the world. This was my worst hotel stay ever. Started with check-in. I found the line that was for HHonors members, but yet it still took almost 30 minutes to check in. The front desk staff member was not friendly. When I finally got to my room, I discovered that not only did I not get the room type that I reserved, I was not even upgraded. I realize that as a Diamond member you can't always get an upgrade, but this room was beyond bad. Stains on the rug, mold in the shower and the worst bed I have ever slept on. The room smelled of smoke (even though it was a non-smoking room). There was no hair-dryer in the room (what room in this day does not have a hair dryer??). When I called to request a room change, they refused. An to top off this stay, I was told has a Diamond member, I received free Internet. When I received my bill, there were charges for the Internet and it took forever for them to take it off the bill. Looking for a great hotel in Vegas, try THEhotel instead. Now that's a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Star Trek Convention”
Reviews.Author: jpheinl
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful site for the hotel. My husband and I went out for the 40th Star Trek Convention, August 16-20th,2006. It was wonderful. I can not say enough about the hotel staff-FANTASTIC-could be one word. They were all so caring and hands on for everything we encountered.Your regular dumb questions,to common directions were given as though we were the first ones to ever ask. Our room was perfect every day. Housekeeping was FANTASTIC as well. Our room was perfect every day. We found the food at 'Quark's" the absolute best ...mainly due to the bartenders,and servers there. FAST service, Friendly, Efficent..I would have anyone consider this site as "a great getaway"... the strip is only a hop away from the hotel... "MONORAIL' was great! Great hotel value. Hilton Las Vegas is on our next trip planning.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Rooms”
Reviews.Author: marky_mark896
Reviews.Content: I have read many reviews for this hotel, and I wanted to post my thoughts about it, as I think the negative reviews are too harsh. My wife and I took our children and my parents out to Vegas for the AOA convention, so we decided to stay at the Hilton, since it is next to the convention center. We were worried about how our stay would be after reading some of the overly critical reviews. We are used to staying at nice hotels, and didn't want a bad one. We were very happily suprised after checking in, to see that our room was very nice, and clean, and suprised also, that it was not one of the renovated rooms. We had marble counters and shelves, and a desk under the window which stretched the entire length of the room. The windows had automatic curtains. The room was in great shape. It is off the strip a 1/2 mile or so, so it is quite a walk to go to the other hotels. We did it a couple times, but we also rented a minivan with GPS, so we used it and parked in the other hotel's garages (which all have free parking) often. It was nice to get off the strip and back to the hotel to get out of the crowd. The parking garage at the Hilton is well lit, and clean, and has security in front of it all night long. We only ate at the Hilton one time all week. I wouldn't recommend it. At least not where we ate, which was the mexican restaurant. The food was forgettable, and the margaritas, which were 11 dollars, were watered down. Best bet for food is to go to the newest hotels on the strip and find their buffets. We ate at Paris, Mandalay Bay, Aladin. All these hotels' buffets were amazing! I also heard Wynn's buffet was great too. We also ate at Alan Albert's for dinner one night (awesome), and at Pinot's in Venetian (excellent). But by all means, don't be scared off from staying at the Hilton. It's a beautiful hotel. Have fun in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay at Las Vegas Hilton”
Reviews.Author: AJR61
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the LV Hilton for 3 nights and what a great stay! A lovely room (mountain facing), spotlessly clean, the hotel itself had everything we needed including a great restaurant for breakfast. We ate at The Steakhouse - the food and service were very good. We didn't do the Star Trek Experience but I did go to see Menopause The musical - great fun! I also used the spa - relaxer package - very good value. Staff were courteous throughout our stay. I am sorry if other people have not had such a good experience but I have to say we loved it - that monorail is very handy too!

Reviews.Title: “Run down, tired Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jesbal
Reviews.Content: We stayed here because the rates were decent for the weekend in Las Vegas and were sadly disappointed. The first room we checked into had the bathroom completely torn apart and we were moved without any compensation for our inconvience. Rooms are old, bathrooms are falling apart and the hotel is set too far away from things. There is a shuttle that runs for a cost, which is nice. Staff were sbrupt, but not rude. Pool and fitness center was nice. Star Trek Experience is a rip off, but if you are a Hilton Honors member you can buy one get one free. This is not offered unless you ask.

Reviews.Title: “Hilton was ok”
Reviews.Author: avalonsidh
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hilton for 6 nights and it was a good value for the money. I was concerned about it not being close to the strip, but with the monorail stopping there, it was not a problem. We actually loved the monorail. We got a 3 day pass and just rode unlimited. The Hilton was under construction and I was disappointed that we were not told. Several bars, lounges and the dance club were closed. There were no kids and not much for them to do. That was a plus for us. The buffet was not very good, but we went to breakfast and lunch. I can't speak for the dinner buffet. The 24 hr coffee shop restaurant was fantastic! We went almost every night. The New York steak was great. And a great value for the money. Staff was nice. Rooms were needing some updating but clean. I didn't smell any smoke on our non smoking floor. Star Trek enthusiasts will enjoy the Hilton. Quarks restaurant was interesting but overpriced. We did not enjoy the Star trek rides however. Kind of cheesy. Only kids/teens and die hard trekkies will like them. All in all it was an ok hotel for the money. I've stayed for more at Excalibur and Sahara and the Hilton was by far the better hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good price/quality mix at the Hilton”
Reviews.Author: Starless73
Reviews.Content: I was a bit wary visiting the LV Hilton given some of the negative reviews on Tripadvisor, but I was very satisfied with my recent visit. We were looking for two rooms in town over Columbus Day weekend, and found good rates at the Hilton when most of the Strip hotels were asking outrageous prices. Check-in at 1:30pm on Wednesday was a breeze. We were able to get into the rooms right away, before the 3:00pm official check-in time. We were offered recently upgraded rooms for an extra $50/night, but decided to pass. We were given rooms on the 10th floor, with a (distant) view of the Strip. We found the standard rooms to be clean and comfortable, what one would expect from Hilton, except a bit larger in size. The bathroom was spacious and water pressure and temperature were good. There was a make-up table and mirror just outside the bathroom, which my wife appreciated. The king size bed was comfortable. Service quality was good. We requsted more clothes hangers for the closet and they were delivered promptly; the bulb was broken on our floor lamp and this was fixed promptly; housekeeping was thorough and efficient. The pool area is nice and spacious, perhaps slighlty above average for LV. The spa was worth the $20 use fee in my opinion; it appeared newly remodeled, with good quality aerobic and weights machines, and three whirpools in the men's facility. The casino has all the games you could want and then some. Table limits don't push out the low roller. The sports book is huge with more big screens than I could count. The monorail is especially convenient with a stop directly at the hotel, making travel to Strip properties easier. A few minor complaints: - Room temperature is adjusted by manually turning the fan on/off and moving a slider between hot and cold. It's sensitive in switching between heating and air conditioning, and hard to get to "just right". A thermostat would be much better. - There is an $11.99 charge for 24 hours of internet access in the room; free would be better, but I think most LV hotels apply a similar charge. Laptop internet is via ethernet cable, no wireless available. It looked like there was free wireless access available in the coffee shop downstairs, judging by the number of patrons using laptops there, but I did not try this out. - There is a fee to use the in-room safe. Again, some other LV hotels do this too but I think it's really taking the nickel-and-dime thing too far. All in all, a good quality and reasonably priced option in LV.

Reviews.Title: “Better than I thought”
Reviews.Author: tgaff
Reviews.Content: I read the mixed reviews about the Hilton and was prepared for the worst. But my wife and I were happy with our 5-night stay. We stayed in a remodeled room and it was fine. All personnel were courteous and helpful. We didn't eat there much, but did like the breakfast buffet (we went twice). Also a hidden gem was Vegas Subs in the sports book area. We liked their breakfast egg muffins and their subs were outstanding. Our only complaint was the pool area and it had nothing to do with the Hilton. The pool at any hotel is a place to relax, nap, read and let your mind wander into oblivion. Cell phone users ruin the atmosphere at this pool. Constant calls and loud conversations by users ruined the comfort level. On Sunday, Sept. 24, a woman from New York City area (she made constant references to the city) gabbed to five diff people. Only once did i see a proper way to handle a cell call in a crowded, small pool area -- a man walked a short distance out the gate and talked there, where no one was around. Other than that, the Hilton was fine.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Nice room for great price”
Reviews.Author: Rebecca1109
Reviews.Content: The lobby is classy and clean. Not too many smoking people are around you. The casino is also quite clean. The room is clean and big. After our horrible experience in Riveria, it's like paradise. The only place that we don't like is the location. It's a little far from the center of the Strip. The weather is not suitable to walk all day. In general, I like this hotel when it offers reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty and Dangerous”
Reviews.Author: miafairy
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here September 16 - 18 and we will never stay at this Hilton again. My mother booked the room for us as we were coming out for her wedding. Our room was right next to the elevator shaft and that was all we heard all night. We could not sleep from all the noise. On our second day there, while sitting in the chairs by the bed, we noticed all kinds of disgusting food and crumbs under the bed. It looked as though it hadn't been vacuumed in years. I'm not just talking liitle crumbs either - I mean chunks of pretzles, etc. Later that night when getting ready for bed, I found broken glass all over the floor. There were huges pieces of glass between the nightstand and the bed and we found smaller pieces out on the floor where we could have stepped on it. We did not use the glasses the hotel provided in the room, so there is no way this was from us. They do NOT do a good job of cleaning and we could've gotten hurt because of it. We switched hotels the next morning. We notified the desk when checking out and they didn't seem to care. Ironically, I stepped on a piece of broken glass in our room at the Paris. Word of advice - where you shoes in your room in Vegas!

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Good for the Money”
Reviews.Author: sea_fury
Reviews.Content: Stayed: North Tower, 18th Floor, King-Size Bed, Non-Smoking I'm a college student, and was looking for an upper-class hotel while saving money. Most of the hotels directly on the strip are relatively expensive, so when the price came to roughly $60/night with taxes for the Hilton, it seemed very reasonable. This place is not a Ritz Carlton. It is, however, not a Motel 6. It's a very decent casino/hotel for the money. The Hilton is located in the north, relatively far from the actual strip. There is a monorail that I used everyday to get to the Strip hotels (monorail is hardly used, very underrated). It wasn't great having to stay about 5 minutes from the Strip, but I saved money staying @ the Hilton. Some of my statistics/opinions: - The television/network doesn't work well and is outdated. - Room bathroom is decent. Large tub/shower. - The beds are hard and sub-par. - Casino is small, but clean. Not too many people. + Maid service was good. + The hall decor was somewhat classy, but the room interior is quite bare. + Room is fairly spacious. + Spa is pretty nice (got in for free w/ coupons) + Hotel was practically empty compared to other Strip hotels (saw long lines to check-in at other places) Definitely recommend if you don't mind staying off the strip and having to commute 5 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Bad rooms, not exactly pleasant.”
Reviews.Author: ralphr
Reviews.Content: Ok, you get what you pay for here! Room was very poor by Hilton standards. I was lucky to get a transfer because I complained but you might not be that lucky. It really needs a renovation big time. The room I moved to was decent but nothing to write home about. Buffet was average. Note this hotel is FAR from the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely Good Deal Over The Holiday Weekend!! :o)”
Reviews.Author: Lubaby
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the terribly negative reviews, I was a little nervous. But much to my surprise, we had an awesome experience!! Not only did we get a phenomenal deal (~75/night, including spa deal for two of those nights, on a holiday weekend!!!) but we also had a room with an awesome view of the strip! The front desk staff was very accomodating and check in was a breeze. I recommend you specifically ask for one of their 'newly renovated rooms' in the north tower. The casino was nice because it wasn't jam packed with people, even on Friday and Saturday night when all the strip casinos were stuffed with holiday travelers. There were plenty of $.05 video poker machines, and most of them paid enough to let you play for awhile on their dollar. The Paradise Cafe had good food, but was a bit overpriced. We totally enjoyed the breakfast, lunch and dinner buffets in the hotel. Reasonably priced with a pretty diverse range of choices. Their mini macadamia pies were to die for!!! :o) The rooms were pleasantly decorated and suprisingly quite. One night my husband did have to get up at 4:30am to break up the hallway party, but that was the extent of any noise or disturbance. If you are going to Vegas for a little R & R, I highly recommend spending the $150 for a private cabana in the pool area. We spent a wonderfully relaxing day with our friends playing games, watching the plasma screen TV, drinking cocktails, eating delicously fattening foods and indulging in an occaisional nap. The cabana boy (David) was very accomodating and kept us cool with the occaisional misting from his water bottle. For all of you considering staying at the Hilton, just remember, it is what you make it. If you treat the staff with respect, they in turn will treat you with respect and see to it that your needs are met. For anyone who has left a negative review, I can only wonder what it was that has made you so sour. I just can't imagine having a bad time at this hotel. :o)

Reviews.Title: “Free is too expensive”
Reviews.Author: hacmco
Reviews.Content: The hotel is old and it shows. Not only that, but it is also dirty, from the hallways to the rooms. Staff is unfriendly and they don't seem to care. I've stayed at this hotel many times, but this is the first time in over one year. It has gone downhill !!! Furniture is outdated, lots of scratches and stains and it serves very little ptractical purposes. The hotel is located next to the convention center, which is about the only positive thing, if you're in town for a convention. Food at the hotel's restaurants (not the specialty ones) is mediocre at best. Will not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “this is a off strip hotel with a great pool”
Reviews.Author: rajkophonicHiFi
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this property over the labor day weekend and really enjoyed the time. Was a little worried after reading a lot of negative reviews, but found it was above our expectations. We checked in as Hilton Honors members, and were given a nice room in the east tower. The room had been upgraded with lots of granite in the bathroom and the window desk/shelf. No issues as previous posters had with crappy peeling wallpaper rooms. The pool area was great as it has a large pool with an even larger deck area on multi levels. You can see the pool from all points on the deck no matter how far away you chose to sit. It's important to be able to see the pool from your chaise. This meant we were able to hang out where we wanted, but did not feel crampled. There were areas with shade and misting systems, and even a dude who came by and misted you with a pocket sprayer. There was music pumped throught out the area but with small speakers everywhere, the sound was never loud or annoying, The music was a mix of everything from the 80's to todays hits. There was a 2 for 1 happy hour from 5 to 8pm. In addition there was a one man band for entertainment. Now that sounds goofy but he put on a great show. His Strat electric guitar and mike were hooked up via wireless to the PA. The rest of his band is in his laptop,which was connected to the PA as well. He strolls around the deck and sings and interacts with everyone. Drank too much bit had a great time. Lets compare that to the pool at the Alladin where we also stayed. It has two smaller pools with chaise lounge chairs around the perimiter. That's where everyone wants to hang out and its gets very crowded. The rest of the deck area is large ,unshaded, and you can't see the pool. That's why the pool deck is crowded, yet the rest of the deck goes unoccupied. It would feel like you are tanning on a chaise in the middle of a concrete parking lot, without a view of the pool. So we enjoyed the Hilton Pool which was lively and a lot of fun. The monorail is outside the doors of the Hilton. It is great to be able to use this form of transport to get to other hotels. We went to the Beach at Mandalay to catch the UB40 show. The cost is almost ten bucks return but is less than a cab. It is what it is, and can't be compared to the cost of public transport. Interestingly after dark, the monorail car interior lights are bright when loading, but dim down as soon as the mono starts moving. Thats a great feature when returning back to the Hilton late in the evening. PS Most hotels charge for high speed internet in the room. Hilton does as well, but the Fortuna cofee shop near the check in lobby has free wireless. It you sit at the high counter along the back wall. you find lots of plugs to connnect your laptop power supply as well. We ate in the Star Trek restaurant, which serves basic Applebees type of food that was OK. It was neat to have the Ferengi's and Romulans roaming around as you dine. It's the experience and decor rather than the food. Had dinner in Benihana's as well. Our chef was boring, and could have mailed in his performance. Would stay at the Hilton again....

Reviews.Title: “What a Dump!”
Reviews.Author: SeattleWa365
Reviews.Content: This has to be one of the most disgusting hotel rooms that I have been in. The carpet was filthy, the bath towels had holes and the sheets were torn. Not to mention the toilet that didn't flush. Not kidding! I did find the staff to be extremely pleasant and very helpful though. Spend the extra money and stay at a nicer place.

Reviews.Title: “Hilton Startrek Experience Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Hsamfat
Reviews.Content: Very friendly staff, rooms kept clean, frequent change of linen. Probably needs a bit of an upgrade but overall very good. Would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Surprised at the size and quality of the room.”
Reviews.Author: crvse06
Reviews.Content: Stayed there from 8-21-06 to 8-23-06. Based in the reviews by other people, I did not know what to expect. When I got there check-in was very easy with no one in line. I was surprised that they let be check in at about 1:30 PM. I asked for a room in the North Tower (reading the reviews it appeared to be the one with the least complaints) but was informed that they did not have any King sized non-smoking in that tower with a strip view. I was then given a room in the East Tower. To my surpise the room was huge, I mean like 500+ sq ft. There was nothing wrong with the room, but the view was not of the southern side of the strip, but of the northern side of the strip. The room was clean and looked to have been remodeled in the last year or so. No strains on the carpet or chairs. The tile was a little slick when wet so watch out. The service might have been the only downfall. 1) The curbside check in for the luggage was bizzare as they indicated that I would need to pick my bags back at the lobby. Most hotels have the option to have your bags brought up to your room. Confirmed this at check in as well. When I went to get my bags the bell person asked if I wanted it delivered to my room. I was a bit confused. 2) When I checked in they person forgot to print me my $25.00 gambling voucher. This caused a minor wait as I had to get back in line to get the voucher. This took less than 5 minutes. 3) Asked for a "Do not Distrub Sign" for the room and an extra pillow. The person on the phone told me it would be about 30 minutes and it took about 45 minutes. This is a push as we were no longer going out for the evening. As far as location goes, the monorail runs about every 6-7 minutes and your can get an 24 hours pass for $15 each. Please be aware that the pass last for 24 hours so hold off on buying one till you have to. For the 3 days that I was there, I only had to buy one. (Well someone did give me a pass with about 12 hours remaining). For me at least, I have found a place to stay at my annual vegas trip.

Reviews.Title: “LV HIlton good for Handicapped”
Reviews.Author: TrekkerGirl
Reviews.Content: Just returned from the Star Trek convention celebrating 40 years of Trek! My stay at the LV Hilton couldn’t have been better. Here in brief are my experiences, under GOOD WORK and NEEDS WORK. GOOD WORK The food at Benihana’s, Quark’s, and Paradise Café was very good. The lines at Margarita Grill were too long (40 minute wait, usually). The sandwiches available outside the convention area were fresh and very tasty. When my disabled brother needed a break from walking back and forth from his room to the convention, a motorized scooter was available for only $30/day. It made a world of difference for him. We were able to utilize the Handicapped line at the Paradise Café so wait-time was minimal. Thank you, LV Hilton. Sorry to everyone who we pre-empted. My room was large, with two beds, a gorgeous view of the Strip, nice big tub and bathroom, with lots of space for everything. Early check-in (noon) was hassle-free, thanks to the young lady (Tiffany?), who was helpful and polite. I had changed my flight arrival time, but hadn’t thought to call and request early check-in. But Tiffany handled it graciously. She called the bell desk because I needed help with my bags. I waited and waited. Nobody showed up, so I had to haul them to my room myself. Nice exercise. Really. Housekeeping always did a good job tidying up daily. The AC was perfect, with the settings easily changed. Access to the Monorail was easy and much appreciated. My brother was able to take the scooter on it. We were able to dash over to the MGM Grand to catch Tom Jones Sunday night. NEEDS WORK I missed Fox News and will write Hilton requesting that they carry it. I missed having an exercise center. When I walked around the hotel one afternoon, it was way too hot so I gave up exercising while I was there. But I was on vacation, after all. The only difficulty with the staff was when I requested the check one night at dinner at the Paradise Café. At breakfast, it took forever to get our check, so at dinner, I decided to ask for it when the waiter brought our meal. For some odd reason, the waiter (a short, chubby fellow with –thar in his name) kept forgetting to bring it. I politely asked him several times, but he kept brushing me off. It took four requests to get our check! How odd. I only gave him a 10% tip. Had he brought it in a timely manner, he would have had a 20% tip with an honorable mention here. Poor –thar. Oh, yeah, having dragged myself downstairs around 4:30 am for breakfast so I could catch at early flight, nobody was around to take my order for nearly 10 minutes. It was all addressed quickly when I politely mentioned it. The hostess was profuse in her apologies and very, very kind. Overall, it was a very pleasant stay. I heartily recommend the LV Hilton.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed with Hiltons downgrade”
Reviews.Author: dinibell
Reviews.Content: This property should be a 1 star equal to the worst Super 8 type motel you could think of. I usually stay in moderate to expensive hotels and when travelling with my 2 teenagers will sometimes stay in 2-3 star. I missed my flight from Ft. Laud. to California and was sent to Vegas for an overnight. Figured oh well, could be stuck in a worse place. Had no hesitation when hotels.com told me that there was a Hilton available and booked it. I paid $65.00 and thought it might be dumpy but I had stayed at Treasure Island for $39 and it was more than fine so I booked it. Well, upon walking into the room there were horrible stains and tears in the carpet and furniture, everywhere we looked it got more disgusting. Problems with room service, air-conditioning, requested feather pillows and they poked your face when you layed down on them, it was just AWFUL! Don't stay here for any price. Also, in the lobby the casino is filled with 1 and 5 cent slots so guess what kind of element is in there... I am so shocked that Hilton would have its name on this hotel and I don't think I'll ever stay in another one.

Reviews.Title: “Never again!”
Reviews.Author: JaniB
Reviews.Content: This is the absolute worse Hilton I have ever stayed at. I read the reviews and hoped that others were exaggerating but they were not! Don't bother to reserve a particular type of room (i.e. king/smoking) because when you get there, you'll get whatever they have, if they have anything. One night was all we could take. Our non-smoking king room we reserved ended up being a smoking queen (with two doubles - too small to be queens). The front desk personnel were not friendly and not accommodating at all. It's too far from anything. Yes, the monorail does come there, if you want to spend $5.50 every time you want to go somewhere. The area of town is not very conducive to walking either. If this is your first trip to Las Vegas, do yourself a favor and don't stay here. The cheap rates are just not worth the aggravation. You get what you pay for! I'm a big Hilton fan, but I would never recommend this place to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: luvvacay
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for several nights to attend a conference that was being held at the hotel. Overall, I was very satisfied with this hotel. Check-in was quick and the desk clerk was friendly, although when I got to my room it hadn't been made up. Due to plane delays, I didn't get to the hotel until 11:00 pm, and was a little annoyed at this. I called housekeeping and within 5 minutes they were there and they made up the room. I appreciated the quick response, and this ended up not being a big deal. I found the room to be very clean and it was huge for a Vegas hotel room (it was about the size of 2 normal rooms - it has 2 beds plus a seating area with a couch). I stayed in the North tower on the 5th floor. Bed was not the the most comfortable, but it was ok. I've stayed at other resorts on and off the strip (Luxor, Paris, Rio, Riveria, Bally's, Monte Carlo) and this room was just as nice, if not nicer, than the rooms at those resorts. Casino is on the small side compared to the big resorts on the strip. The monorail was very convenient -- it cost $5/ride, or two rides for $9. There are not many "fast food" restaurants at this hotel (just a Pizza Hut Express and a sandwich place and an ice cream place) -- kind of a pain during lunch time. The conference facilities were nice, but bring a sweater because the A/C works really well! It was definitely chilly -- some people brought towels from their room to use cover up with! I would not hesitate to stay here again if the price was right or if I had another conference to attend.

Reviews.Title: “Will never stay here again”
Reviews.Author: Jpgirl
Reviews.Content: I attended a convention from 7/24-7/30 and was duped a second time into staying at this hotel. Last year the hotel was in bad condition. The rumor was it was to be completely renovated. Central reservations and the direct hotel confirmed this. I even recieved an email from the person organizing the convention that the hotel had been renovated. I arrived and was given a room with the same worn carpet and the matresses were actually sagging in the middle-wallpaper was marked up and falling off the walls in some places. I immediately called the front desk and was given a new room. It was a bigger room but just as worn. The carpet was dirty and had rolls in it. The shower curtain had mildew all over it. The maid service was prompt but inconsistent. We'd get 1 bar of soap for 2 sinks and the shower. We'd ask for extra towels that never came. The maids were nice but the rest of the staff was surly at best. I don't consider myself extremely particular about accomodations but this place is a dump. I wish we had booked at the Marriot Suites-it's just as close to the convention center and the rooms are big and clean. I ended up getting bumped from my flight and they put me up at the Motel 8-it was cleaner and better taken care of-believe it or not.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for the money”
Reviews.Author: nocturnalgirl72
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel since we got a great deal we could not refuse. $75.00 a night for Fri and Sat 'Pamper me" Spa package off of their website. Included in that I received a 25 minute massage and a bunch of coupons for the restraunts and buffet. That was a steal for a weekend in Vegas. It is located off the strip but still close enough so that if you had alot of energy you can walk or take a cab. We were given a King Room. Huge room. Plenty of room for all the briedesmaids to get ready. TV had cable. Bathroom was good size, but only complaint was no fan and we had a hard time getting the shower knob to work. Probably not as luxurious and updated as alot of Hiltons, this is an older one but for the money and the outrageous price the strip casinos charge on the weekends, this was a GREAT deal.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't believe this was a Hilton!”
Reviews.Author: PDXFolks
Reviews.Content: I accompanied a friend who was booked at the Hilton through a group rate. I'm a Corporate Travel Agent and was nothing short of shocked when we first saw our room! Suffice it to say, I've travelled extensively and this was the absolute worst I've EVER seen! To be specific, the carpet was not only so old and worn, you couldn't make out the colors or pattern, it was filthy. I would step out of the shower and after walking around, my feet were black on the bottom. The baseboards were carpeted as well and where they met the floor, there was dirt caked into the crack between. The vanity had no soap dish, so our bar of soap was left to sit on the countertop. The bathroom and shower were extremely outdated with chipped tiles on the floor. The towels were worn and and desperately needed to be replaced. We went to open a bottled water and it had already been opened and a sip taken out. We called housekeeping and they told us to call back on Wednesday (it was Sunday). I took it to the front desk where the clerk was happy to help. We ate at a restaurant I believe was called the Paradise Cafe. The waitress could barely manage to write down our order. The food was so so. I must say, the pool was clean and fairly nice. Fun happy hour with reggae music. The front desk staff and curbside staff were friendly and helpful. While the common areas were decent, the room was so disgusting, I would never in this lifetime book a client into the Las Vegas Hilton! In fact, this experience leads me to question the consistency of the Hilton brand altogether!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - poor service”
Reviews.Author: product-of-canada
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Hilton Las Vegas for 7 nights from July 1st to 8th, 2006. I had read many reviews on this site before booking the Hilton, and I must say that the Hilton was better than what I expected. Positive experiences with the Hilton: 1. Quick, hassle-free check-in. There was no line-up, and the process was quick and painless. Mind you, we checked in early in the morning. Technically they didn't have to give us a room until official check-in time, but they gave us one right away. 2. Our room was big and clean. I was surprised at how big our room was - lots of room for opened luggage and bags. And it was really clean - no unpleasant surprises anywhere. 3. This hotel is not as hectic as some of the others. Hotels/casinos that are more central on the strip (Casino Royale; Bellagio; Paris; Ceasars; Flamingo; MGM) are absolutely packed with pedestrian traffic, inside and outside. The Hilton Las Vegas provides relief from this environment - something we appreciated at the end of the day. 4. I think we did all right in the price department. I paid just under $80 CAN per night for two people. This came with a free $25 gaming chip, which we blew all at once on the roulette table (we should have bet on black). I find that you can get good package deals to the US at [------------]. Negative experiences with Hilton: 1. Really it comes down to one major negative experience - hotel service. And I can give two major examples: First, the lady at the designated Hilton help desk, which is in the same area as check-in, was completely useless. We asked her what was going on at the Convention Centre, which is next to the Hilton, and she had no idea. She suggested we look for ads/billboards on the street that might inform us. She made no attempt to place calls on our behalf, to use the computer in front of her, or ask a competent colleague. After that, we asked her about the Las Vegas city transit system, such as the fare system and day passes. Once again she had no idea, and suggested we find out by asking the bus driver. I think a trained monkey would have been more helpful. Secondly, the drink servers in the slot machine areas were horrible at the Hilton - particularly in the Star Trek-themed area. We could be playing the slots for an hour, and no one would stop by to take our drink order. My wife hunted them down, and found two of them socializing together by the bar. When she asked them to get us drinks, they layed on the attitude and said to wait for the designated server to come to our slot machine area. Slot machine drink service was much better at other hotels, such as the Golden Nugget, Treasure Island, and especially Paris. Once again, bring in the trained monkeys, Hilton. (Oh yeah, there was one day the maid did not replace our used towels with fresh ones, but I'm assuming that this was just an oversight. We had been tipping both the maids and the drink servers). If it weren't for these negative customer service experiences, I would have given the Hilton Las Vegas a perfect score. There are other minor negative experiences that I could mention: The pool is small and easily crowded (by kids); Barry Manilow is so expensive - over $100/person for the cheapest tickets; It's about a 15-minute walk to the strip from the hotel; the Star Trek Experience (which is in the Hilton) was quite a let-down, especially for the price - don't go unless you're a Trekker/Trekkie). I was going to order a Warp Core Breach drink at Quark's bar until I found out it was $25 US each. Other helpful tips (that don't have to do with Hilton): * The Las Vegas city bus system is deplorable. It makes the Toronto bus transit system look stellar, which is saying a lot. There were 3 separate occassions in which we were waiting for the bus for at least an hour (they're supposed to run every 30 minutes) - two times at two different outlet malls, and one time in downtown Vegas. In the latter example, we waited such a long time for a bus in downtown Vegas that we decided to walk South until it came along - well we walked all the way to the North strip and the bus never came. Also, riding the bus along the dense, congested strip will be one of the most frustrating experiences of your life - I'm pretty sure I saw 90-year-olds passing us on foot. * The good thing about the transit system is that for $5/person you get an all-day bus pass that lasts for 24 hours. But good luck finding a bus when you need one. * Shopping: Look for a store called "Ross" on the north part of the strip, not too far from the Riviera. It doesn't look like much from the outside, but we found great deals here on brand name clothing. I would say it was even better than the outlets. You just have to do some digging to find some good items (it's like a Winners, only much cheaper, and even less organized). Surprisingly, we even found deals at the Fashion Mall on the strip. * Never pay full price for shows. There are a few discount ticket booths along the strip, including one just south of the Riviera. We got discounted tickets to David Copperfield, Mystere, Legends, Crazy Girls, and the Star Trek Experience. The first two shows mentioned were amazing, Mystere being the best. * There are some free shows, such as the MGM lions, the (Mirage?) volcano, the Treasure Island pirate/ship battle, and Ceasar's creepy automatrons. My favourite was the Bellagio water fountains synchronized to music (I believe it occurs every 30 minutes starting at 3:00 PM). * The Shark Reef at the Mandalay is worth the trip and price. I love aquariums, so I'm a little biased. I've included an interesting picture here from the Shark Reef. If you go after 6:00 PM, you get discounted tickets. * Drinks are free at all the casinos! As long as you're gambling (even the penny slots), and as long as you're not expecting service at the Hilton, you get free alcoholic beverages. And I'm not talking about cheap beer. We got Coronas, Heiniken (spelling?), strawberry daiquiris, and Long Island iced teas. * You can freely drink alcohol on the street!

Reviews.Title: “Trekker Heaven”
Reviews.Author: LittleRedhead
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed at the Las Vegas Hilton July 14th-July 17th and enjoyed our stay. When I had reserved our room there were no rooms with two beds available, so I settled for a deluxe room with a King bed. I had booked online at a 3rd party website so a couple weeks before we were to arrive at the hotel I called the Hilton directly and not only confirmed the reservation, but I also asked about a room with two beds. I was told by the Hilton that there were still no rooms with two beds available. I requested that a note be placed on my account requesting a room with two beds. When I checked in the front desk attendant told me there were still no rooms with two beds available. The front desk attendant said the hotel would give me a free upgrade to a suite and have a rollaway bed brought up. He also gave me a $25.00 voucher for their casino. The only disappointment with our stay was that my friend and I had to keep calling downstairs to the front desk and housekeeping before the rollaway bed was delivered around 1:30am. I had checked in around 7pm so there was a delay in getting the rollaway bed, but everything was fine once the bed was delivered. My friend and I enjoy Sci Fi so we loved Quark's Bar and the Star Trek Experience. Quark's Bar and Restaurant is moderately pricey but the portions are large and food is well prepared. Having actors walk around, dressed as Star Trek aliens who mingled with the guests at the restaurant was great. I recommended the Warp Corp Breech for those who enjoy alcoholic drinks. We did some gambling in the casino and played the slots some but that got rather boring for us after awhile and we didn't do a whole lot of that stuff.

Reviews.Title: “Very Decent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Iluvehotels
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hilton for one night. We traveled with another family and had connecting rooms on the 23rd floor of the East Tower. The rooms were very clean, modern and quiet. Only drawback, personally, was that it's a bit of walking distance to the covered parking and lobby areas and also to the main strip, especially in hot weather. The Hilton is one of the trolley stops which is $5.00 per person which is a good deal if you are there all day. We did the dinner buffet at the Palace Station which was decent and affordable. Our children, age ranges 9-17, loved the Adventure Dome at Circus Circus (look for their dollars off coupon in the Las Vegas book left in your room!) and loved the Hilton's pool area. We payed $74.00/night at i4vegas. Good deal for a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Not my favorite”
Reviews.Author: SenoraSofia
Reviews.Content: The Las Vegas Hilton is OK, but not my favorite. We stayed: Treasure Island, June 25 - 28 the Rio June 28 - July 2 the Las Vegas Hilton July 2 - 7. The Las Vegas Hilton is owned by Resorts International, a casino chain that we know from our trips to Atlantic City. It was first opened by a Hilton, and it still has preserved an old world charm. I especially liked the crystal chandeliers in the casino and the elegent hallways in the hotel. We were there for the 4th of July. Several of the other guests were badly behaved, mostly due to drunkeness. That made the experience much less fun. We witnessed a horrible verbal fight at the elevators that would have turned into a fist fight if one nasty man had not been held back by a family member. It started when another guest said to him, "The line for the elevator is back here." The fat pig drunk started swearing and swinging his fists. He appeared to have several small children in tow - great parent, not. There were other incidents at the pool and at the buffet where the guests seemed very piggish. I have never seen so much food wasted as what the guests left behind at the Hilton buffet. The buffet dining area was trashed by the guests! We only ate there twice. The offerings, preparations and presentations were fine. The hotel room was very old fashion, but I do like old fashion, especially if it is clean and well preserved, which it was. The room was much smaller than what we had at TI and Rio, but we were comfortable and fine. The AC was great. We we located in the north tower, 11th floor overlooking the strip. Great view! I had never been to Las Vegas Hilton. My husband had played there previously only briefly after attending work at the convention center. We received a summer rate promotion which reeled us in. We paid and average of $50 a night, plus $3 per night for the in room safe. We did not receive food vouchers nor free play as in other casinos. Our cash back credit covered one night and several meals upon check out, but still the comps were better at the previous two stays during this trip. I loved the Space Quest Casino, especially in the evening when they showed 80's music videos. The bar at Space Quest was good, the bartender was very nice. The best for me was the proximity to the monorail. We came down our elevator, walked through the Space Quest Casino and walked directly to the monorail entrance. We purchased the 72 hour pass and spent our last 72 hours tripping down the strip. We found ourselves returning to Harrah's to eat and gamble. Their 3 million give away with daily swipes and give aways lured us away from the Hilton. The woman who checked us into the Hilton, the towel handlers at the pool, the bartender at the Space Quest and the young boy who held our bags after check out were great. All other employees were rather worthless. Especially bad were the desk employees at the Bell desk and the front desk employees on the evening of July 4th. I wish I had taken their names, I would file a formal complaint. They were unhelpful and lacked knowledge when asked questions. The front desk people gave very incorrect information about the fireworks that the Hilton displayed that evening. Also poor were the employees at the Rewards booth. We had been their several times and no one offered us information about the Thursday night "spin the wheel" in the Space Quest Casino. We only received entries for our last day there. We lost five days of entries because no one mentioned it. The restaurants and shops were very overpriced. Things cost much more than at the TI and the Rio, both being more upscale places than the Hilton. Once we purchased the monorail pass, we left the Hilton for all meals and purchases. Lastly, before checking out I moved the two blue bottles of water from the cabinet over the television to replace on the desk. After considering the other guests and their nasty behaviors, I examined the bottles and noticed that the caps were not attached to the bottles! I called in a maid, Regina (by now I decided I had better start recording names). I showed her the bottles and said, "You have cleaned this room. You know that these bottles were over the television. We did not drink them." She responded that whoever cleaned the room after the last guests checked out must have not noticed, that normally the bottles are checked, that this has been a problem in the past, and she commented that it was good that I had checked. I only wish that I had checked when we arrived. Bottled water in the room is a stupid idea! I expect that the Hilton will send offers, because we played a fairly large amount of money. But, I would hope the other places we played at book us first. I would probably return to the Hilton, but would rather be elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for the Price”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just returned from the Las Vegas Hilton yesterday and found that it was above my expections. From the reviews that I had read I was a little nervous about staying there but once we were there I was relieved. We booked with Travelocity and only payed $497 for 7 nights which included tax and the Travelocity fee. Check in was quick and easy. We stayed on the 10th floor of the east wing and our room was clean and nice sized. Yes there are no coffee makers in the room b/c they want you to buy the coffee from the coffee shop in the room. I know most of your Vegas hotels don't have coffee makers in the room b/c they all have coffee shops. We also had some friends staying at Ceasars while we there and they said our room was just as nice if not nicer, they said it was definitely bigger. The only downfall is that it is off the strip (which we were aware of before booking) an monorails could add up to some money if you don't have a car. We had a rental car so it was not a problem getting to strip locations. The only downfall I found of this hotel is that if you don't gamble enough to get $10 or more in comps then you have to spend your comp money in their gift shop. I rec'd $9.52 so I had buy something from one of their shops & I had $4 in comps from sports book gambling and I had to use those comps in their sandwich shop Vegas Subs. Overall I found this hotel to be a great value. I have stayed at the Luxor, TI, Monte Carlo, Excalibur and I found that the Hilton is just as nice as any of these hotels and a lot cheaper.

Reviews.Title: “great for the price”
Reviews.Author: llaney
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the LV Hilton July 1-3, 2006. Chose this hotel as we were coming to Vegas to see Barry Manilow show. Room rates were $69 for Saturday night and $59 for Sunday night (AAA rate). That is the lowest rate for a hotel in Vegas that I have seen even this time of year (hot summer!!). Check-in was pleasant; front desk clerk was helpful and courteous. Our room was on 21st floor of North Tower, we had a view of the Strip, the Hilton sign and even of the pool. We did take the monorail to the Strip, very convenient however it broke down the second evening so we took a cab the next day and that was fine too. Hop in the cab, tell the driver you have $15 or $20 to spend and that how quickly they get to the location you want on the Strip determines how much is left for their tip; you'd be surprised how quickly they can get to the destination of your choice. The Hilton was not terribly fancy, however all we really did was sleep there and have one quick bite to eat in the 24-hour coffee shop after the 10:00 p.m. show. The casino chandelier was very! sparkly! and! pretty! All the rest of the time we spent in the casinos of Bally's, Caesar's, Paris, Bellagio, etc. and those hotel rooms were twice what we paid at the Hilton. Our room was clean, had plenty of towels, hot water, etc. Did not have mini-bar or fridge, but heck who needs to pay mini-bar prices??? Checkout was easy, and the desk clerk let us keep our hotel "keys" (credit card thingys) that had Barry Manilow picture and show advertisement on them -- nice souvenir for free. For the room price, this was just fine, even considering monorail or taxi fees, still much less than other hotels for two people.

Reviews.Title: “Worth what we paid (which was nothing....)”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Las Vegas Hilton over the July 4th holiday. Our room was free because we were scheduled to attend a timeshare presentation, and the time share company booked the room for us. We requested a non-smoking room, with a king sized bed. The room had a king sized bed, which was comfortable, but "non-smoking" must have been a recent change...the stench of stale smoke was awful......and we were not the only one complaining on our "non-smoking" floor - I heard the maids explaining to MANY people that the rooms WERE non-smoking...they just smelled that way because they USED to be smoking rooms (when, oh when, will hotels realize that it isn't only FRESH smoke that is the issue???). The shower had such poor water pressure that I spent the whole second day we were there feeling like my hair wasn't clean - finally realized that because of the water pressure, I never got all the shampoo rinsed out! One of my pet peeves..... Oh, and they play the whole "in order to conserve water, we'll only change the sheets if you leave this card on the pillow" game - but even though we DID leave the card on the pillow, they definitely didn't change the sheets..... Add to that the fact that there was no working ice machine, and a couple of other minor issues (like a voicemail system that you couldn't get thru to, even when you had a message....and the longest wait for a bellman I think I've EVER suffered through), and it just was not a pleasant stay. We OFTEN stay at off the strip hotels in Vegas, but won't be back at the Hilton.

Reviews.Title: “Sci-Fi Fun”
Reviews.Author: salorsay
Reviews.Content: If you're a Trekkie, you'll love the Nemesis Package deal that's offered on the Hotels website! www.lvhilton.com/offers/nemesis.shtml Quarks Bar is a hoot and the food was awesome and plenty! Employees were authentically dressed in the characters costumes and conversed with us as if it was real! The Star Trek rides were fun and that whole area was Sci-Fi cool but the fantasy only lasted a few hours. I suggest doing all of that the next day when you are all excited and energized. Don't even look that way or you'll spoil it for yourself. It's somewhat small, make it an experience. The Hilton was a classy looking hotel with it's crystal chandeliers and water fountains. It was very lively with a variety of ages and restaurants. I was pleasantly surprised for the package price we paid. After the Star Trek experience and a few pulls on the slots, you can hop on the Monorail and go to the Strip. We also saw Barry Manilow. Expect a concert not a show. He sang great but I would have liked to have seen a production with dancers or something. It was still a good time. All in all, I really liked the Hilton but we really didn't have any desire to do the Star Trek experience over again. I thought this hotel's package price was a great value!

Reviews.Title: “Eh, have had better service at other LV hotels”
Reviews.Author: yahlowtweety
Reviews.Content: Went for a soccer tournament and stayed at the hotel for 5 days and 4 nights. You'd figure you'd get good service for the length of your stay. Staff to check in was pathetic. We had 1 person servicing a line full of people while there were 4 staff servicing the "VIP's". So the wait was about 15 minutes. They charged my credit card twice, had to call them to resolve this issue. Valet sucked, so I ended up parking on my own. Why put a sign that says "Pull up and wait for valet" if you have to get out of your car to tell the valet you are there? Makes no sense. The restaurant service was just as bad at the buffet and the 24 hour restaurant. All in all the only thing I really liked was the show "Menopause"!!! Other than that, I'll be staying at another hotel on my next trip thank you very much!!!

Reviews.Title: “This is the only place to stay in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: CeeJayRocker
Reviews.Content: I've been going with the same two to three guys to this hotel since 1998. Between the four of us, we've stayed in hotels all over the country, including Las Vegas hotels in all areas at all levels (IP, Nugget, Plaza, Monte Carlo, MGM, TI, Riviera, Harrah's . . . you get the picture). I know people who've stayed at most of the other strip resorts and I've talked with them about their experiences. I have relatives, one of whom is included in my Las Vegas Hilton annual extravaganza, who have worked in the hotel industry for years. I can tell you this . . . . The Las Vegas Hilton is, bar none, the finest Las Vegas experience going. I continue to be amazed that people fail to realize that a hotel, any hotel, when the lights go out, is this: Two double beds, a bathroom and a color television. That's it. A standard room at the swankiest hotel on the strip is no better than the base room at a Motel 6 when the lights go out, so long as these rules apply: 1. The door locks. 2. The TV works. 3. The toilet flushes. 4. The plumbing drains. 5. The water is hot. 6. The air conditioning allows you to hang meat in the room. 7. The room is relatively clean. That's it. The snobs who complain that the pillows weren't right, the air conditioner rattled a little or the safe cost $3 to hide their $2000 watch are just that, snobs, who won't be pleased if they are hung with a new rope. Hotel service employees don't make much money, and to expect them to kiss your toes because they don't make coffee and bring it to your room with a smile and the paper is quite frankly pompous and annoying. You're sleeping there. If you're spending that much time in your room, you should stay home and save money. It's a place to sleep, pee and shower. That's it. The Hilton offers all of the essentials I noted above. I've stayed on most floors, in all three towers, and at most price ranges. The staff has been accomodating to our needs, which aren't much. Our biggest fight comes when we want to stuff two rollaways into a two queen room, and we've won that argument every time, most trips only paying for one of the rollaways. In addition, the casino is large, wonderful, bright, and has $5 tables at most times. The coffee shop offers what a coffee shop should, which is two eggs over easy and a steak to a drunk guy at 2 am for about $5, less when they have the special. People who want to be served with a smile and a kiss at a Las Vegas coffee shop at 2 a.m. need to get over it. Eat and go to bed. The mexican place has good food, and the steak house is spectacular. There's a Pizza Hut Express, a foo foo coffee and bagel shop, and a mighty fine Japanes place. The sports book is by far the best in the city. The waitresses in that book are fast, they remember gamblers from year to year, and a $1 ($2 every so often) tip keeps the beer coming cold and often. When you're hungry back there, go to Vegas Subs and grab an Arthur Godfrey, or the pastrami special. If you order what's on the menu, and don't get a Reuben, but without the sauerkraut, and on a hoagie instead of rye, and with rare roast beef instead of corned beef, with mayo, instead of mustard, you'll be pleased. The monorail is RIGHT IN FRONT OF THE HOTEL. I'll repeat that . . .IT'S RIGHT IN FRONT OF THE HOTEL. Thirty seconds from the casino and any restaurant, a minute from the show room. Yeah, it costs $5, but better passes are available, and remember, you're planning to park your can on a slot stool and shove $50 to $100 into a machine that doesn't take you anywhere. A cab ride, with a $3.20 meter drop and 25 cents for 1/8 of a mile, will be twice that to anywhere except the Riviera, which you can walk to if you can get your rear end out of your Rascal. The pool is the best I've seen. Bar right close, great hot tub, pool deep enough to actually swim, free towels, reasonable cabanas, televisions to keep track of your football parlay cards, restroom close by, and FANTASTIC VIEW OF THE STRIP. Check in is generally smooth. I've arrived at all hours, from 7:00 a.m. to midnight, and my room has always been ready. I don't gamble enough to draw the attention of the comp guys (that's not true, actually . . .I don't draw attention to my gambling enough by shouting "HEY, I PUT $10 IN THIS MACHINE, I NEED TICKETS TO PENN AND FREAKING TELLER AND A BUFFET PASS OVER HERE), but quite frankly I've never asked, and I don't plan to. I don't care about getting stuff I don't need or want free just because it's supposedly "coming to me." I want to bet on sports and horse racing, I want to drink free (for tips) while I'm doing that, and I want to toss the dice and look at cards. When I get tired of that, I want to go to the pool and drink beer, or I want to take a nap. If I don't like where I'm presently losing my money at, I want to move on easily. The Hilton offers all of this. The Hilton is big enough to offer all the amenities one wants, and it's small enough to keep one from hyperventilating when moving from place to place. The rooms offer sleep and security. It's on the monorail, there are always cabs, and the rates are right. Stay here . . . And if you're there over Columbus Day weekend, look up the three or four drunk guys in the sports book that look like they're having a great time and say "Hey" Maybe we'll tell our favorite waitress to bring you a beer on her next trip through. I'm sure she will. And we'll throw in the buck . . ..

Reviews.Title: “Decent stay, nothing special.”
Reviews.Author: lauraleigh9mm
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hilton for a convention for two nights June 8-10. I stayed in the east wing on the 19th floor. My room was fine. Nothing special. the best thing about my room was the tub. It was a very large, easy to lay down in. The room was nicely furnished but I thought the bed was too firm. I ate in the cafe, which I don't recommend. It was a contracted rate of $109 which is a good deal a weekend in Vegas. I don't think I would ever choose to stay there but it was fine for this time. there was one very bad thing that does stand out, they have the most horrible elevators!

Reviews.Title: “Pathetic”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: For starters: 1. No coffee maker in the rooms. 2. No refrigerator in the rooms. 3. Buffet was horrible. Hardly any choices. 4. Beds were hard. 5. Bathroom fan did not work. 6. Had to pay for hot water to be brought up to the room. 7. Poor restaurants. 8. Not on strip. 9. Rude staff. I know why the Hilton's are so rich. Because they are "chincy" on everything. I called when we first got to the room for a coffee maker. They said you have to ask for one but they were all out. I called the second day. Same thing. I called the third day and they said they didn't have coffee makers. Which is it? No refrigerators are in the rooms. Couldn't even keep a soda cold overnight. (Not all of us drink.) We were put all the way at the end of the hall and there was only one ice maker which was on the other end. The window elevator was "out of service" the entire 5 days we were there. No soda machines anywhere because they want you to pay $3.00 a bottle for them in the sundries store. There are only Pepsi products sold. The buffet has no selection. It is the smallest buffet I have ever seen. Is NOT worth the $18.31 for dinner nor the $16.00 for lunch or breakfast. The beds were so hard you couldn't get comfortable. They had to be as old as the hotel is. The fan in the bathroom did not work. You had to wait for 30 min after your shower for the mirror to defog. Brought my own cappuccino but couldn't get hot enough tap water for it. They wanted me to pay for hot water. The restaurant selection was poor. The Margarita Grill was slow. They were telling people an hour wait and there was like 20 empty tables. Not enough staff. Had to ask for tea refill. The Paradise Cafe had greasy food. Another down side is it isn't on the strip and you must travel by far on foot or still far enough on the monorail to get anywhere. Staff acted like you should move around them even though you are the one toting luggage.

Reviews.Title: “Not an ornate strip hotel, but good for the price!”
Reviews.Author: Vinewbie
Reviews.Content: The Las Vegas Hilton was a great place for the price we payed ($431 per person for flight from Philadelphia and 4 nights hotel stay). The room and bathroom were very clean. The champagne brunch was as good as The Bellagio breakfast buffet. The pool was refreshing (the temperature outside was between 95-100 degrees during the day). Although, the Hilton is not on the strip, the monorail stops there and has several stops on the strip. Overall, what we paid for 2 people, only one could stay at one of the fancy strip hotels. If you find a deal like this, take advantage of it.

Reviews.Title: “Worse than Paris sex tape”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Staff rude,rooms dirty and out dated. I could write a book but the bottom line is if the Hiltons did sell this property they should sue to get thier name off the property. I will never stay in this hotel agian.

Reviews.Title: “good stay”
Reviews.Author: tarynD
Reviews.Content: just got back yesterday from 3 nights at hilton. paid 115/night due to long weekend rates. stayed in North Tower. Beds were comfortable. Marble countertops and bathroom clean and nice. two sitting chairs in room. on 11th floor overlooked golf course and downtown hotels. self parked at North tower garage and walked to entrance where there was a sign for elevator with a view. it was a glass elevator and our room was three doors down. it was great to bypass the lobby and wait for main elevators.We did not eat at the hotel just got a bagel at the ice cream/pizza hut on ground floor of looby. the pool area was nice and plently of chairs available at 2pm when we got there

Reviews.Title: “Guaranteed laugh, ridiculous stay!”
Reviews.Author: Tariki
Reviews.Content: First, I am not a snobby tourist who pays for cheap hotels but expects total luxury. I grew up camping and backpacking, staying in cheap and seedy hotels, and just being excited to have a hot shower....so a stay at a hilton is luxury to me! That being said....I recently had an experience at the LV Hilton that I am never going to forget! Let me briefly set the scene....I was really excited to go to Vegas for two reasons: 1) I'd never been there and 2) I was going to Vegas to get married. I lived in Florida and my fiance is a sailor in the navy, stationed in California. So Vegas was a nice neutral place to throw two families together. My family isn't made of money, so we were looking for a reasonably priced hotel, that was comfortable, but wouldn't break the bank for anyone coming to the wedding. The Hilton had solid reviews and a good price tag. So away we went! I arrived with my family a day before my fiance got into Vegas. We checked in, I received 2 full beds instead of 2 queens, which was sort of annoying, but I'm not picky. Our main complaint at this point was that our entire wedding party (twenty people and about 12 rooms) were scattered all over the hotel. We booked a solid 2 months ahead, and called two weeks, and a week before we got there to make sure that our rooms were together. They never were...but oh well!
