That first night I went to bed and woke up at roughly 6 am to a sound that I can only describe as a mix between a jet engine and an earthquake. At first I thought it was the air conditioner, so I played with that, to no avail. Then I figured out it was the pipes. I went into the bathroom and played with the faucet on the bathtub until I thought I had figured out how to make it go away. It did it again at 8 am when I was in the bathtub...there I am in the tub relaxing and all of a sudden I thought a plane was about to take off in my hotel room. It stopped after about 5 minutes and a lot of jiggling with the faucet. So the next day my fiance got in, I hadn't seen him in 2 months and all I wanted to do was lay in our hotel room and spend some time together. We went to sleep at around 11 and at 2 am the plane decided to take off again in our room, it scared the bejesus out of my fiance and I proceeded to bound out of bed into the cold hotel room to play with the faucet on my bathtub. It did it again at 6 am and at this point we were just too tired and annoyed to care and just laid there for the 5 minutes until it decided to go away by itself. I had given up on the idea of sleeping well anytime in the next 3 days but my father found out about our room and got us a new one. We packed up our stuff that afternoon and headed over to our new room. We had places to go and wedding stuff to do so we just dropped our luggage off in the room and took off. We had dinner at Hard Rock that night with my family (loads of fun, they made us stand on top of chairs and blow out a candle on a sundae when they found out we were getting married, and I'll never forget my entire family doing YMCA along with the music as long as I live) and then KA (at the MGM Grand....if youve got the money...go see it!!!!!!). We got back pretty late from KA, at around 12:30 at night, and just wanted to get into our bed and sleep. We got back to the hotel and I walked straight to my luggage and my fiance went into the bathroom to pee. At that instant he yelled "did you leave the sink running???!!!"...."ummmm no" I said, and came over to see what he was talking about. The tile floor in our bathroom and leading into our bedroom was covered in water. At that moment I put two and two together. When we had first gotten into the new room I noticed what looked like silt on the inside of the sink. I thought nothing of it and just rinsed out the sink and the black silt and left. When we found the room flooded I figured it out, our sinks had backed up and overflown. So I sent him down to get us a new room and packed all out stuff back up for the second move of our 3 day trip. They wouldn't give him the keys because the room was under my name...at this piont I was getting annoyed and went back downstairs with him to get us a new room. The woman was nice, but...well...when I told her our room was flooded...she said "do you need a new room right now??" and I, in the most polite way I could muster, said "let me explain, our room is flooded, as in both sinks are filled with water and our floor is covered with water...its completely unusable". So....they upgraded us to a second floor luxury room....and by 1:30 we made it into our new room. It was impressive to say the least.....two flat screen tv's, marble sinks and tile, a walk in shower with a waterfall showerhead, down pillows and comforter, a living room area, and a king size bed. But before we got to bed, we throughly walked through and inspected the room, because my fiance and I were absolutly convinced there had to be something wrong with it. Well we didn't find anything and had an excellent nights sleep. Now you would think this would be the end of our adventure at the LV Hilton, but you would be sooooo wrong. We got up that morning, with only enough time to take a shower before we had to head off. So we decided to save time and simply take a shower together. We got in and lathered up, but we had left the sliding door to the shower/toilet room open (it was seperate from the sinks). My fiance wanted to close it so we could get some nice sauna/hot air action going on in the shower. So he popped out, half in the shower, half out, and gently pulled the lever on the sliding door to shut it. Well it shut...and when it did, 3 tiles came flying off the wall in the shower at me. I screamed and then started laughing....there's what we were looking for last night....there HAD to be something wrong with the room. He wanted to get out immediately but it was just some broken tile and we really didnt have time to deal with it, so I just pushed it into a corner with my foot. We continued our nice shower, although, we often accidently stepped on a peice of tiny broken tile I had missed. When my father checked us out he told them what had happened, with all three rooms, and they did give us 7 buffet vouchers.....but I honestly just don't think that was enough. I had to laugh though, no one else in our wedding party had quite the time that we did...there stays were all quite normal and I was happy for that. So, that being said, I'm not sure how to sum up my experience with the LV Hilton. It is a hotel that is certainly showing it's age, that is certain. Are you guaranteed an experience anywhere close to mine? No....but the thing to remember....is that it is possible....because it happened to me. Some people might think I made this up.....but I don't think I could have made this experience up if I tried!

Reviews.Title: “Just like other Vegas rooms”
Reviews.Author: SoCalTrekker
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just came back from an impromptu trip to Vegas and stayed at the LV Hilton. Got a great rate but proceeded hesistantly based on the rating here. While the hotel is not the top of line, it is a very nice hotel and I would definitely stay there again (depending on the price) Location: The Hilton is pretty far from the strip (about 3 miles). Not a problem for us because we drove but the Tram station is right next to the hotel. Hilton is also close to the Stratesphere, the Sahara and the Stardust so it has somewhat of a Strip feel to it. Hotel: Exterior: Standard Vegas hotel-bright with a giant marquee. The shape of the hotel is interesting but otherwise unexciting. Self-parking is a fairly long drive from the entrance and somewhat confusing (two entrances). Also the road leading to the parking garage is rough because of the uneven stones/bricks. Interior: Star Trek Theme with Barry Manilow pictures. The self parking was quite a ways from the Check-in counter but I guess that's fair for trying to save on the valet tip. The feel was quite new and the casino was lively but not too loud. Not too much smoke. Check-in: Went well, no problems. Room: Pretty standard Vegas room. The bathroom was a little small with shower and toilet in a separate room while the sink/make-up area was part of the "bedroom". The furniture was a little dated but not bad. The room had a great view and was comfortable. Carpet was a little worn and rough but oh well. Overall, pretty good. Can't comment about anything else in the hotel, didn't stay around to do anything there. Overal the experience was good and the staff helpful. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Not Wonderful / Not Awful”
Reviews.Author: nanaju
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the LV Hilton May 14-17 to attend a conferance. My room, in the central tower was clean although rather worn. (I did look for bedbugs---none seen!) Housekeeping came early in the mornings while I was out---replacement of ammenities was rather "hit and miss". All hotel staff that I encountered were pleasant and helpful. Dining: Courtyard cafe was pleasant. Benihana's was nice if you enjoy that cousine. The buffet was ok but the deserts were very good. Dining at Quark's was a really fun experience and the food was good. Casino: TIGHT!!! Enjoyed the space theme casino more than the regular casino. I was not favorably impressed with the dealers at the table games. Entertainment: Menapause, the musical was fantastic!! (--if one is appropriately aged and female!) I might consider staying here again but only if I got a fantastic rate.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: Gags
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Vegas a day earlier then expected, so being a Gold Card member, naturally checked into the Hilton - which had the best deal anyway! Got a free breakfast for being a Gold Card member and there is even a separate dining area for Gold/Platinum members, if you feel like it! Room was better than expected, very large, even by American Standards. We were in the North Tower on the 17th floor, I am not sure how old it is. I guess the bathroom was a little worn, but very clean. We had 2 queen beds - very comfortable. Hotel location is off the strip, but you can walk if you are fit enough. As explained in these reviews the monrail has a station in the Hotel - $5 o/w $9 return $15 day ticket. Pool area was large and clean - used it briefly. Overall very good hotel - we had nothing to complain about.

Reviews.Title: “I thought it was fine”
Reviews.Author: Dorsalfin
Reviews.Content: I attended a friend's 40th birthday last weekend, too (looking at the above post, I don't recall anyone from Portland). I thought the hotel was fine. Oddly, I was placed in a handicapped suite (I guess they surmised I was mentally disabled). Everything was at the touch of a button. My room was made up every morning. I always use the "don't change the sheets" sign, so I don't know whether they would otherwise change the sheets. The hotel is on the monorail stop so hitting the strip was no problem. I could easily access the O show at the Bellagio and other attractions. I got a deal because the group I was with was so large (37...for a BIRTHDAY party). I thought the pool was fine and the margarita's poolside were bliss. The breakfast buffet was a deal, I could gorge in the morning and eat enough to hold me till dinner. Bottom line, sure, I'd stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Inconveniently located & needs updating”
Reviews.Author: oregonswim
Reviews.Content: My husband & I attended a friend's 40th birthday celebration last weekend. The friend & his wife arranged the accomodations. Since I had never been to Vegas, I decided to stay at the hotel even though I read scary reviews on this website. I hoped for the best. (First thing I did when I checked in was inspect the room INCLUDING the bedding. Whew! All clean except the tub was a bit grimy. I took showers and prayed for no foot fungus.) The hotel is showing it's age. The elevators were slow and too few for that large of a hotel. (We were on the 21st floor in the North Tower.) We had a decent view towards the strip, but the daytime look isn't much to get excited about. My chief complaint is the distance to the strip. You can hop in a taxi (about $10 + tip) or onto the monorail ($5/one way-$15/all day) to get down to the strip. The monorail is a great deal, but one day we were in hurry to return to the Hilton when we stood for 30 minutes during a mechanical problem (and they didn't communicate to us when or if it would resume working) and ended up hopping a taxi anyways. Otherwise our experience with the monorail was smooth and reliable. We found the staff at the hotel to be helpful, but no one goes out of their way. We didn't require any special attention so we were not disappointed. We did not use the pool as we were there for only two days. I will say this: I'm not a trekkie and the whole Star Trek thing is not my bag. I'm also not 21 and watching young drunk adults walking around with a 1/2 yard long marguerita at all hours of the day was a bit like stumbling into spring break daytona beach. I can now understand how the outer resorts like Green Valley Ranch do so well being so far from the strip. The HIlton can be a great deal if you book a cheap package and don't expect much from the staff. But know that you are not conveniently located to the heart of Las Vegas Strip.

Reviews.Title: “Decorated by the Golden Girls (when they were young!)”
Reviews.Author: WITWIL
Reviews.Content: This horrible hotel doen't come close to Hilton standards and is strongly NOT recommended. The hotel is divided into the central tower, the North Wing, and the East Wing. The central Tower is the oldest and the most worn. In the central tower my room was awful. The single florecent lamp over the sink was very very very dim. The toilet ran constantly. The shower head was at my neck. It used the low water head that shoots water at you at the speed of sound. The water drills through your body and passes through you with out actually getting you wet. The cloth shower curtain, then caught in the hurricane force winds generated by the utra sonic shower head, wraps around your body which is when you actually get wet. Decorated in pink I really expected Rose and Dorthey to arrive at the door The carpet was filthy and had several areas that appeared to have gum in them. I did move to the north tower. The room was better, much closer to the style that Blanch would prefer for her few hours in a hotel. In the north tower the bathroom had a garden tub and a waterpick shower head. The lights worked well in the bath. The carpet was poor but not as dirty. Staff was VERY rude to customers. Overall.... It's time to use the wrecking ball on this place and the staff

Reviews.Title: “Bedbugs ”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Las Vegas Hilton with a friend on April 21 and 22, 2006. In the early morning hours of the 22nd I awoke with a feeling of something crawling on me. I put on the lights and to my horror I had what I now know as bedbugs crawling all over myself and my bed. As I crushed them between the sheets they exploded blood (a good sign that they had just gotten done feeding on me). We immediately checked my friend's bed and that too was infested with the bugs. After placing a call to the front desk, security was immediately dispatched to our room. The security officers took pictures and samples of the critters for their report. I had actually gotten bitten twice on my back and once on my leg. Since we were leaving the hotel that afternoon we declined a room change and just took quick showers and got the heck out of there. Upon leaving the hotel I went to the front desk (i was actually crying at this point) to tell them that I was very upset about the situation and that I didn't expect to be paying for my stay. I was told that only one night would be taken off of my bill and that I would need to dispute the second night. The front desk manager was called and quite frankly he treated me as if I had found a candy wrapper on my floor instead of being waken up covered with bedbugs. The Las Vegas Hilton needs to get rid of its infested beds, get a good exterminator and also put its employees (especially its managers) through sensitivity training.

Reviews.Title: “Great Price -- Hotel a little long in the tooth”
Reviews.Author: Bob2222
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hilton in April during the week. Got a terrific package through Southwest Airlines. ($264 roundtrip from Oakland, two nights stay, $25 gambling token). I stayed on the third floor East tower with a view of the golf course. Since they were out of king size beds, I was given a free upgrade to a mini suite, which is actually two normal rooms with the wall removed. Think of it as one big room with no bedroom privacy. The non-bed half has some furniture and a bar with sink and refrigerator (no honor bar). I would not pay the $125/night upgrade for this room, however. Highlights: Great rate, pleasant staff Room was clean. Highspeed Internet access is available for $10.99/24 hours. I tested it at 1299 kbps up, 114 down which is fair. LowLights: Ice machine was out, walked to 4th floor, ice machine was out. Room service took 2 phone calls and 45 minutes. Nonsmoking room had ashtrays! Ashtrays were clean, though, and I couldn't detect any residual smoke. Furniture was pretty old. All phone calls are $1 minimum, 10c/minute after 30 minutes, even 800 numbers so bring your cell phone. Other people have commented on the distance. Yes, it's far from the 'hot' hotels, but there were always taxis available; didn't try the monorail whose price has been raised to $5 OW, $9 RT.

Reviews.Title: “good value for money but still expensive”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: service good as usual, friendly and efficient. In the standard of the Hilton Group.

Reviews.Title: “OK, but dosn't meet standards of most Hiltons.”
Reviews.Author: natura11
Reviews.Content: I stay at Hiltons >50x a year and although this hotel was not bad, it didn't meet the expectations that I had based on other Hiltons. No frills rooms,old tv, pretty comfortable beds, but not the upgraded version that are standard at most Hiltons now. No robes, no conditioner, good views. Pretty good breakfast buffet and great sports book. I would'nt recomend this hotel if other hotels on the srip are available at a compareable price becasue it's pretty far from everything else.

Reviews.Title: “LV Hilton, great value, good stay, yucky beds.....won't stay again”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just got back from our stay in Vegas. We stayed at the LVHIlton for 5 nights. We were happy with nearly everything but the beds were very uncomfortable and the pillows were lumpy! I would stay there again if it weren't for the beds. We did, however, save a bunch of money staying there! The Paradise cafe is awesome for breakfast and not too pricey. Just watch out for a few cranky wait staff........we asked for tea and the woman sighed as if we asked her for a big favor. Then we asked our waiter for milk instead of cream twice and he was mumbling under his breath......luckily we only had these 2 clowns one morning, the rest were nice. Other stuff: Avoid Treasure Island's Buffet, "Dishes".......horrible!!!!!! Bally's buffet was top notch and less money than Bilagio which was equally good. The Luxor buffet was ok in comparison to the 2. We saw Mystere Cirque du Soleil, I thought it was a great show but disappointing since I saw a much better show in NY.....so I expected more. This one was more artistic than anything. I highly recommend, Vision tours, for the Grand canyon.......we opted for the flight over hoover damn and landing to look at 2 different look out points........if we go back we will definately do the helicopter. It was worth every penny, the views were breathtaking! Must see! ( the lunch was pretty gross, so bring a snack) Buses go up and down the strip for $2 each way, plus u can take it to the Fremont section, but maybe just during the day. I didn't feel as safe there. Golden Nugget was cool!

Reviews.Title: “Really enjoyed the Hilton”
Reviews.Author: JackieGarrard
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from a really enjoyable trip to Las Vegas and the Hilton. Four of us travelled to Las Vegas on 4th April and booked to stay at the Hilton because it was one of the lower priced options (we'd rather spend our money on enjoying ourselves than on a hotel that we're hardly going to see). Had another great flight with Virgin Atlantic and arrived at the hotel at around 4.00pm. There was no queue at check in and the rooms were available. I asked if we could have adjoining high floor rooms overlooking the strip and we were extremely pleased with the rooms we got. Yes, I've stayed in nicer hotel rooms, however the room was clean, large and had all of the facilities that you would expect from a large chain hotel (except tea/coffee/minibar, but they don't want you drinking in your rooms - they want you to spend money downstairs in the casino). We ate at the buffet twice and it was extremely good both times. We did have to queue for about 40 minutes second time round though because it was a Sunday morning and very busy. Didn't really gamble much as it's not our thing but we did try the poker at the bar where you get constant free drinks (we were actually gaining here because we were drinking more than we were gambling)!! Also tried the blackjack but didn't have any luck. All of the staff we encountered at the hotel were extremely friendly. We purchased monorail tickets to get us to the strip ($35 for a ten ride shareable pass). We had to buy two of these over the 5 day visit. We also got a few taxis at night but these were only around $10 which is nothing between four people. The fact that the hotel was off strip was quite nice because you didn't have as many people wandering round the hotel. Didn't do the Star Trek experience as we didn't have time but it did look quite good. Went to see Mystere whilst we were there at Treasure Island. Very good show but not really our cup of tea. We also went to Hoover Dam which is definitely worth seeing. Restaurants we visited which were excellent were Mon Ami Gabi (Paris Hotel), Cafe Ba Ba Reeba (Fashion Show Mall), Caneletto (Venetian) and Cheesecake Factory (Caesars P). All in all we had a great time. If I returned to Vegas I would definitely stay at the Las Vegas Hilton.

Reviews.Title: “Thr greatest Buffet in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: matthewcookies930407
Reviews.Content: I don't know why the reviews of other people are not so good. I extremely love this hotel. The room is even better than Mirage, the 5 stars hotels. The buffet is the best. There are over 500 kinds of food to choose. The fees are fine. About USD $15 per person. (much expensive than circus circus and sahara but it worths this price) Overall truely 5 stars for this hotel. Highly recommend to all of you.

Reviews.Title: “What a treat!!!”
Reviews.Author: dcamp2
Reviews.Content: After a night in our hometown following our wedding earlier that day, we headed to Vegas to begin our six-day adventure. What a way to be greeted in Vegas!!! The Hilton was so nice. The room was lovely, the staff was quite friendly. And the breakfast buffet was the best I've ever experienced (worth the $11.99, I think). Meats, cheeses, lox, dozens of pastries and breads to go with above average breakfast staples. I encourage you to give it a try. We were there on a Sunday night and made it to the breakfast around 10:00. Superb!!! and that's not just the 'honeymoon' talking. I hope we can visit again!

Reviews.Title: “Nice but worn”
Reviews.Author: JiminCortez
Reviews.Content: I arrived alone at the Las Vegas Hilton at 2pm and was told I would have to wait 2 hours for my room to be ready. I had to stand in line to check my luggage and wait for the room to be cleaned. The casino is nice and pleasant. The wait staff in the Margarita Grill were exceptional and friendly. Quark's bar was a disappointment as the wait staff were not at all eager to wait on me. A character dressed as a Ferengi was downright rude to me. Overall, it is an OK property, but there are better on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed here 4 nights....”
Reviews.Author: Ping Golf
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 4 nights in October 05'. For those of you who think this is a Hilton property, your wrong, Hilton sold this some time ago but the current owners have kept the name, however there are rumors of a name change coming this year. This hotel is dated and worn and I agree with others that the service lacks in all aspects. I did however win some $$ on the slots which appear to be a bit more loose than the casino's on the strip or it was just my lucky trip.... :-) Since this is no longer a true Hilton, the HHonors program, while still accepted will be phased out when a name change comes about, and it shows already in their attitude. Another user complained about no upgrades, paper, etc..for being a GOLD member. Everyone is a GOLD member the day they sign up for HHonors, I am a Diamond member and was informed that they do not upgrade, etc. for HHonors members. This has been consistant for years here. They do not look at HHonors for upgrades since they reserve to do that for gamblers, which is the right thing to do in my opinion. If you want upgrades, stay at a Hampton Inn, Hilton Garden Inn, etc...... Would I stay here again, probably not. It is next door to the convention center, which is a plus if your attending a convention, but if you in Las Vegas for fun, I would choose a different property.

Reviews.Title: “Family vacation at the Hilton...great”
Reviews.Author: dryice
Reviews.Content: The reason we chose the Hilton we used our Amercian Casino Guide 2006, and got a rate of $55 per night, 2 night max, cant beat that. Once we arrived, it only took 5 minutes to get checked in, the staff was very friendly and professional. They had our players cards all ready printed up. We got in the room, and it was twice the size of normal rooms, with a fridge and a bathtub that can hold 2 people. The room didnt contain a coffee maker, and we dont drink coffee, no big deal. We needed 4 more pillows and we noticed the lightbulb was burned out, but housekeeping was up in a flash.

Reviews.Title: “another reason to lock your doors”
Reviews.Author: luuluu
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Las Vegas Hilton for one night March 10 by redeeming Hilton Honors points to get a free room. Got excited at check in when the front desk person upgraded us (myself and 2 teens) to a suite "since we were Honors members". When we got to 'our room', the key card worked, but the safety latch inside the door was engaged. Picked up the nearby house phone and a hotel security person soon arrived. He found a second door to the room, key card worked, but due to the suitcases inside, this was already someone else's room. Friendly and professional security person offered to stay with the kids and luggage while I went back to the front desk. Same front desk person didn't offer an apology, just 'it's been a busy night'. When I relayed this to security person, he said "yeah the front desk staff does this a lot." Hmmm... All the more reason to never leave valuables in room and always use the security latch when you are in the room - in ANY HOTEL. The Hilton itself was o.k., showing it's wear a bit. The room was large, clean, check out was easy.

Reviews.Title: “good value for money if you are lucky”
Reviews.Author: markell1
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 2 nights and was the cheapest I could get for a Strip or close to the Strip hotel with good reviews on Tripadvisor. It was our first time in Vegas and we did not want to stay in one of those overpriced mega places. Hilton Las Vegas is still large but you do not feel lost (we looked around in the MGM Grand, Venetian, Paris, Treasure Island and you need maps to get around in them). Checkin was quick but not friendly. I have a HHonors Gold VIP card but checkin person did not seem to care. No free breakfast, upgrades or other comps. Room was good. I could not compare with other rooms but it was spacious and looked renovated. Room was located in the central tower on the 24th floor. View of Stratosphere tower and the hotel delivery entrance was ok but not great. A lot of noise came from what looked like central airconditioning (I could clearly see the big ventilators) even though we were on the 24th floor and I was wondering what this must sound like on the 5th floor. Could not find construction work but then again did not walk around on the floors. After complaining with the front desk on the second day about the Hilton HHonors extras that we did not get we were informed that the hotel did not provide room upgrades, I should get a paper delivered, should get free breakfast and free health club access. Breakfast buffet ended at 11.00. For HHonors at 10.00. I complained at 10.15 but got nothing (so missed one free breakfast for 2). No excuses made. She informed me that I should get this days paper today (special delivery) and tomorrows paper tomorrow but nothing happened. No papers delivered. Was not bothered to complain. When you are in Vegas you should party and not complain. Good things about the hotel: because we were gambling (not a lot, spend about $150), we got: - comp free buffet dinner for 2 - comp free meal in Paradise Cafe for 2 - comp drinks (probably worth over $100) this made up for the HHonors issue and unfriendlyness of the front desk staff but was not thanks to being a gold VIP. What else to say: buffet (breakfast and dinner) is good quality if you like buffets. Good choice of food and it is warm for a change. Paradise Cafe looks like it could use a 20 years update (if anyone from Hilton is reading this: it is not the eighties anymore!) both for the restaurant and the staff. Food is overpriced looking at value for money. Vegas Subs: better close this down and open a new subs place. One of the most outdated places in the entire hotel. Ordered a tuna sandwich and a bagel and only got the tuna sandwich. How difficult is it to deliver what was ordered. Staff was joking around among themselves all the time we were there (sat down for 45 minutes) and did not seem to care about customers. Regarding the Monorail: quick access (it is actually attached to the hotel) but it has got some technical issues (a number of times it was delayed and a computer voice informed us it was because of technical problems). If you expect that the Monorail will save you a lot of walking: mistake. Monorail brings you to the back of the major hotels on the Venetian site of the Strip. If you want to go to the strip itself or hotels accross the street (like Belaggio) it is still a lot of walking. Overall, the Hilton Las Vegas is outdated. It is not as glamourous as the other famous hotels. But is has got a nice atmosphere and is not as crowded as other hotels. Only if I got a good deal I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Okay for the convenience”
Reviews.Author: Seattlite4
Reviews.Content: We stay at the LV Hilton each time we're attending a tradeshow at the LV Convention Center (about 4 times per year). In the past year, some obvious improvements have been made such as the newly remodeled lobby and new carpets in some rooms, but other aspects remain the same. The bathrooms are out of date and a bit grimey. In the past, we have informed the staff of our disatisfaction with the bathrooms (ie. disconnected soap dish showing black mold behind the tiles, wet carpets, etc) and every effort has been made to fix the problem. We were even credited two nights on one occasion due to the bathroom condition. The staff is usually very friendly and helpful. One thing that could use improvement would be the customer service in the reservation process. There have been times when I have asked for my confirmation information to be faxed or emailed up to three or four times before receiving a response. I've even had a reservationist impatiently say that they'll "send it again" although I had not received it the first time. Each time I call, I feel like I'm in a lottery and I cross my fingers each time that I'll get one of the few reservationists who are friendly and helpful. Overall, for the convenince of being so close to the convention center, the hotel serves its purpose. However, for a Hilton, this hotel is probably at the bottom of the barrel as far as condition goes. Realizing this is one of the oldest hotels on the strip, it could still use some improvements to make the rooms feel a little less used.

Reviews.Title: “Getting Better All the Time”
Reviews.Author: GoingEverywhere
Reviews.Content: We went to the Michael Buble' shows in February and chose to stay here simply because the show was at the LV Hilton (btw: fantastic show!). I read some earlier reviews about construction, so we were pleasantly surprised not to see any! It's a big hotel, so we may have missed some of the public areas, but we liked what we saw. The rooms aren't bad, either, although ours had not been upgraded to Hilton's new standards yet. It was still rather comfortable and the view from the North Tower was fantastic. Get a higher floor if you can, facing the strip. My problem with the hotel was slow -- and at one point, downright rude -- service. We had some wine in our room and ordered a corkscrew at check-in. Four hours and two calls later, it finally arrived. We went to the only open restaurant around 4AM and were literally watched by someone who seemed to be the manager. He sat at a table a few feet away. When we ordered a bottle of wine (for three, not unreasonable), the wait staff was perplexed. They seemed only to know about individual drinks... yes, whole bottles were on the menu. The same guy who was watching us then came over and asked if we were staying in the hotel. Only then did the wine come out, in individual glasses. We had been very polite, not at all loud, and had simply asked for a bottle of wine. It's amazing we were treated this way, but I'll take it as an isolated incident. I've never been treated like this at a hotel. The rest of the stay was terrific, and room service was fast! I'd stay here again in a pinch, or if the price is right. Obviously, there are a lot of better places in Las Vegas, but the Hilton is not bad.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service & very comfortable”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband & I took my parents to The Hilton from 20th - 27th February 2006 for their wedding anniversary and to see Barry Manilow. We had an excellent time at this hotel. The staff were great and very friendly and helpful at all times. The rooms we had were overlooking the strip and were lovely & clean and comfortable, with two double beds in the room and a good sized bathroom. The buffet was great, with plenty of choice (and free beer and wine in the evenings!)and although it was a bit more pricey than some places was great value. (you would probably pay at least twice the price for the same thing in the UK). I don't really know much about gambling, so my mum and I only used the slot machines, which are rather addictive it has to be said! The pool is a little small and i imagine could get quite crowded in the summer months, but this isn't really a criticism. The Hilton runs parallel to the strip; it is not on it. I know some people would see this as a minus point, but having visted the mega resorts on the strip such as the MGM Grand and Caesar's Palace, I find they are way too big for my taste. Great to visit, but overwhelming.The Hilton is still large, but not so large you get lost! The monorail service stops at the hotel and is quick and regular for trips to the strip. Overall, The Hilton is a lovely place to stay, both for business or pleasure. Don't be put off by its not being on the strip; this is a very small issue indeed.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: LWluv2travel
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Las Vegas Hilton 2/23 - 2/26 and it was a great place to stay. The check in service was quick - in fact we arrived in Vegas at 11:00 a.m. and went straight to the hotel. They allowed us to check in at that time. The rooms were large and very clean. Nice views from the 19th floor. The monorail was a very convenient way to go to the strip for shows, and dining. It only took about 20 minutes to make it all the way to the other end of the strip on the monorail. The Hilton has been remodeled and looked lovely. We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great if you are attending MAGIC”
Reviews.Author: nitebird
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hilton mainly because it is so convenient to the convention center. It is nice to walk and not deal with cab lines. My room was at the end of the hallway on the 25th floor. A bit of a walk, but the room was much larger then the other rooms, with a seperate tub and shower... almost like a suite! Plus, the view was great! I has express room service twice (just for hot tea) and the service was great. Not over the top luxury, but for convenience, well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “It was OK, but I'd pick somewhere else”
Reviews.Author: BJL
Reviews.Content: I stayed here while attending a trade show in late January & early February 2006. I chose it because it was attached to the convention center and convenient. It is an old hotel and is out of the way from everything and probably wouldn't survive if not connected to the convention center. I think if I were to attend another show in Las Vegas I would chose something nicer on the strip and deal with the shuttle. Overall, it was just OK. I felt that the choice of restaurants available in the hotel were below that of other hotels I visited. I was aware that there were renovations happening and requested a renovated room, and the one I got may or may not have been a renovated room. Hard to tell... The room as was large, but not what I would call comfortable. No coffee maker, so I either had to order room service coffee every morning or wait until I was showered and dressed to go downstairs to get coffee. Speaking of room service, twice I called in the morning for breakfast and was told it would at least 1-1/2 hours to receive breakfast. However, coffee only did come within 20 minutes. I then called ahead the night before for breakfast to be delivered at a certain time and was often told that "that time is full" and that I couldn't get it until later or much earlier. I had ordered breakfast ahead the night before for the morning I was leaving. A half hour after it was supposed to be delivered, I called room service and they had no record of it ever being ordered. Also, the ice maker on my floor - which was a l-o-n-g distance from my room - was not operational, so I had to go down a floor to get ice. I am not into gambling, so I can't comment on the casinos. The monorail was very convenient and I got a kick out of the ipod vending machine near the entrance of the Star Trek bar. I visited the spa one morning for a facial that was just OK. The spa itself was clean and the staff very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Very nice Hotel and very clean. Does not smell of smoke in the Casino. Good buffet a little pricy but good not the best i hav had but it will fill you up for sure. Friendly Cocktail Waitress but Linda at the machines cloest to the front door of the Hotel was the best we have ever had. Not on the strip but the monorail stops her and makes about 7 stops and will put you on strip location almost anywhere you want to start from begining to end. Skip the Star Wars thing here its an experience but if you are not into Star Wars stuff it won't do much for you. Nice shops and if you are into that sports book stuff it's the best i have ever seen.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice and a good price”
Reviews.Author: Cats4smm
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Las Vegas for the first time last May. The purpose of my trip was to see Barry Manilow so the Hilton was the obvious choice. My room was lovely - large, airy with a view of the strip. The temperature was regulated nicely too. There was some construction work being done but it wasn't too intrusive. The only thing that was lacking was good take-away food places in the Hilton or nearby. The in-house Pizza Hut is pretty sad. What I also liked about the Hilton was not having to walk miles to get in and out, I'm going again this May and will definitely ask for a room near the first lift lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: cop1007
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hilton in August and were quite pleased. We got the room at a great rate from an internet travel site for about $300 per person which included air travel (at that time couldn't get a flight from Pit. airport for under $250 even checking on flights from March untill June). When we checked in, the staff was very friendly and didn't wait more than 5 min. to check in. The room was very clean, great bed, air condition worked great, and a fantastic view. We ate at the buffett when we got there on Monday and the food was good and included all you can drink wine and beer. The casino was nice and we played a little there and the star trek theme was nice. Its not as fancy as Paris or Belligo or anything like that, but WELL worth the price. Its a little off the strip, but we always rent a car so that didn't matter at all. I was a little nervous as to what to expect from the Hilton after reading some of the reviews here, but I will say I would DEFINITELY stay there again! We were not dissapointed at all!

Reviews.Title: “Hilton fine everytime”
Reviews.Author: Keleka
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the LV Hilton three times in two months for a total of eight nights: Two nights in mid-October and six in mid-December. Yes, there is a good bit of renovation going on, but each time I've been back, it's been less intrusive. As the work is done in each little area, they open it back up. The elevators were throwing some fits because one bank at a time was closed while new marble floors were being installed and the work load on the remaining banks was heavy. However, you can get to any of the banks on every floor so just walk down the hall a ways to get to another set if the ones you're waiting for are slow. I think they'll be finished with the elevators very soon. Yes, in the casino there is a smoky smell, but much less than I had expected from what I'd read about casinos. I walked through another dozen casinos in LV and the Hilton's was certainly not the worst smoky smell. I ran across no other foul odors in the Hilton. I've stayed in three different rooms, one in each tower. I found the two queens room in the north tower and the king room in the east tower to be wonderful. The king room was nearly as big as my apartment. All it was missing was a kitchen and balcony. The beds have all been comfortable and clean. The king room in the center tower was not quite as good but still fine. I think maybe they just haven't renovated that tower yet. Housekeeping was very friendly. One lady went beyond the call of duty helping me find the internet connection which had, for some reason, been hidden behind the TV (probably by the previous occupant). Many of the housekeeping personnel I ran into didn't seem to speak great English; they sounded almost like eastern Europeans. Despite their poor English, they were always friendly and if they didn't understand me, they would find another employee who could speak better English to help me. Every time I stayed I asked for late checkout because my flights didn't leave until 7:30 pm and I didn't want to have to lug my bag around LV all day. One time they couldn't accomodate me because they were booked solid. The other two times, they let me keep my room until 4:30pm without additional charge which I thought was mighty generous. I wish the Internet connection was free, but considering I paid only $50/night for the rooms, I can understand why they charge. However, when people are paying $100, $200, and during CES even over $400/night, I really think it should be free. The connection worked great, too. Unfortunately, they put the connection too far from the desk so you've got to work at a little table. Also, bring a power strip because they have used all the power plugs and you've got to unplug the TV or the light if you're going to use your notebook at the table where the Internet connection is. I bought one at the Walgreens on the strip just so I could use my computer with light and TV both on. I've eaten at both the Paradise Cafe and the Buffet. I'm on a low carb diet so I really like the Buffet as it lets me pick and choose. The food was good, the price was good, the service was good. The cafe was your typical coffee shop fare, but it was fine, too. The waiter we had was a little sullen, but he warmed up to us. He seemed a little thrown when I tried to substitute something for the potato that came with the steak, but eventually he got the point that I was avoiding carbs and he came up with some veggies for me. The Hilton Theatre has lots of history but doesn't seem to have been updated (at least the part the audience sits in) in a long time. It would be nice if they'd spiff it up a bit and fix it so not everyone had to stream out of the one door when the show is over. It takes forever to get out and if you're coming back for the second show, it doesn't leave much time for bathroom breaks, etc. It's also usually too loud, so bring some earplugs just in case. The Johnny Mathis Christmas concert was just right, but Barry Manilow's shows are sometimes painfully loud, and sometimes okay. Yes, I go a lot. I did the Star Trek Experience and found it to be a waste of money, and I like Star Trek. If it had cost $10, fine. But for over $30, I expected more. Of the three stays I've made so far, check-in was trying once. The line was long and I had to go through it twice because they didn't give me the concert coupons they were supposed to. The other two times, it was a snap. I'm going back on January for two nights, in March for two nights, and in July for five. I'll take pictures and add construction updates, etc., each time if people think it'll help.

Reviews.Title: “Everything was fine, nothing was outstanding”
Reviews.Author: fromdelmar
Reviews.Content: I tend to agree with the recent reviews below. Everything was fine, nothing was outstanding. Although not the largest, this is a very large hotel with 5000 rooms. Apparently, during times of low occupancy, they offer very competitive rates. You really can't go wrong staying here, but don't expect the glitz of some of the newer places.

Reviews.Title: “Just a place to stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I frequent Vegas at least twice a year and usually stay on the strip, such as Mandalay Bay, Venettian, Aladdin.., but never at Hilton LV. Read up on the reviews posted on this site, decided to stay for a night before meeting up with friends at their 'new home' during Christmas week. My experiences: 1. Great deal of $51 on Sun, Dec 25th, which came with 2-1 buffett coupon and $25 off spa coupons 2. Valet parking was good. No cars waiting since we pulled in around 7:30pm. 3. Check in took longer than expected, since there was only 3 hotel agents at the registration desk. 4. I recalled reviews stating to request the North Tower. Before I could even request this, we were informed that we have the North Tower, 18th floor with a view of the Strip. Not bad for $51. Keep in mind, Hilton LV is one small street east of the Strip and more North on the Strip. 5. Construction was minimal 6. Elevators were small and old, but functional 7. Renovation was above average: glass mirrow closet doors, small powder area (cute), faux marble counter tops for the bathroom, marble table top underneath the entire length of the window, small one seat lounge chair. 8. Room didn't feel very well lit until all 4 lights were turned on. 9. Shower was dripping upon arrival. There was a pool of water collecting. Since we were only going to be staying here to just 'sleep', didn't bother changing rooms. I believe this was an isolated incident: the shower head and the tub water would both run when the water was turned on 10. The walls are thin. We could hear the kids next door and you can hear people talking out in the hallway. 12. Casino gaming area is pretty small, compared with the larger casino's on the strip. We did a few runs around the casino to make sure this was it. Yes, it was. 13. There is a monorail station, but didn't have time to utilize it. 14. Excited to use the buffett coupon: lunch was $11.99, unfortuantely, I think this was one of the worst buffett's I've had. 15. Bell desk: dropped off our luggage after doing an express check out, this didn't take long at all. Picking up our luggage took 20 minutes. No one was at the bell desk, tried to get someone's attention at the registration line but given that it was the day after Christmas around 1:30pm, the line was 20 deep. Eventually got our luggage. Overall, this hotel was just another average hotel to stay at. I honestly don't know how this hotel can be considered a 4 star, but somehow it is and maybe from other people's prospectives, it is. For me, it was average. If you're looking for a great deal, on a budget and don't mind being off the strip (and having to either take the monorail, taxi, or drive to the other casino's to gamble), the Hilton LV should be sufficient accommodation.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate at a Good Price”
Reviews.Author: LostHorizon59
Reviews.Content: We booked at the Hilton because of the price, which was about the lowest we could find at the time for a 12/18-12/21 stay at a big-name place. Being budget travelers we did our homework and found we could take a city bus (CAT, or Citizens Area Transport) from the airport to the Hilton for $1.25 each. For getting around the Strip we found the Monorail deal ($20 for 10 one-way trips) to be the most efficient option since the Hilton is a bit of a walk from most places of interest. Service was as service is. On check-in we were efficiently processed and assigned a room. Same as eight million other people arriving in Vegas that day. Same as we have always been processed in Vegas no matter what we pay. Our service at the Hilton was no more or less than at anywhere else we've stayed in Vegas. We wish it were more personal. The hotel is still being renovated. We don't know what it looked like before they started the reno, but it should look pretty nice when they're done. Very rich marble (in brown, black, and cream colors) is going into the floors - after a day of wandering we noticed the same brown, black and cream colors on the marble floors at Bellagio and Venetian and wondered how many millions Hilton is putting in to keep up with the Jones's. New lighting, columns, and paint give an elegant look to the lobby and elevators. The problem with the renovation is the noise it causes and the sometimes bawdy conversation of the construction workers. For the sake of the hotel and everyone who stays there we hope this work is completed soon. We were happy with our room on the 10th floor of the East tower. It had been renovated and was clean and stylish, with a very cool cutout in the wall by the spare sink so you could look out over downtown while shaving. The bed was comfortably firm and lighting was good all around. Noise from other rooms was not a problem. The bathroom was roomy, with a big soaking tub, but the shower was unfortunately equipped with one of those water-pik things that seem to vomit water rather than spray it - it's a gimmick that doesn't work. If only they would install a wide-brim showerhead so a person could take a civilized shower without having to wrestle with a Rube Goldberg water-flayer. And it would be cheaper. We don't know what to say about the Star Trek wing. The warp-drive column and laser blasters didn't match the brown, black and cream marble and diamond chandeliers in the rest of the lobby level. There were no aliens in the bar; and on top of that the bartender said he could not make a Mojito! It seemed like a movie set after all the actors had gone home, but they forgot to turn out the lights. Dining was Vegas standard. We ate at the buffet, which seemed to us to be better than average for the price. We could not afford to eat in the restaurants in this hotel's fine restaurant section. We were disappointed that the "Margarita Grille" Mexican restaurant was closed, without explanation, during our stay. On the morning of our checkout, while I was seeking coffee in the lobby at 4:30 am, I was greeted by a smartly-dressed lady of the morning - who inquired if I was alone. Notwithstanding Vegas' "what happens here stays here" slogan, we hope this is not a feature of hotel stays for tourists who do not ask for it. All in all, our stay was a bargain; we prefer to stay right on the Strip or in Downtown but we would stay at the Hilton again if they offered a similar deal.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay & Great Value”
Reviews.Author: AntiGravity
Reviews.Content: I got a weekend room for around $50/night, which is quite a steal. Prices here flucuate based on whether a convention is going on. This was actually my fourth stay at this hotel; each stay has been enjoyable. The rooms are comfortable and they usually find me a decent strip view. Parking and the monorail station are convenient. If you're a Hilton Honors member, you get free access to the spa, which has some very nice amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Pleased and would return at the right rate!”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoBearsFan650
Reviews.Content: Room: space and décor: Very large room. I had a fantastic view looking towards the strip with the mountains in the background. The window was gigantic, and had a nice desk and chair so you could sit and enjoy the view. The furniture and bed were all fairly new, comfortable and currently styled. The bathroom was fairly recently redone. There was nothing fancy about the room. It was what you'd expect to find at any airport hotel. Room: Cleanliness Everything appeared to be completely clean. Hotel: Amenities (Restaurant, room service, workout facilities, pool, transportation) Casino: A rather small casino by Las Vegas standards, but a nice atmosphere. The Star Trek casino adds a different twist to the rest of the rather ordinary Flamingo casino. The games are space and Star Trek themed, but the odds remain the same! The dealers and casino bartenders were all quite friendly. The sports book is one of the best around. Restaurants: The Buffet - I ate lunch at the buffet. Sometime within the last few years the buffet was moved to the sportsbook and significantly upgraded and modernized. The selection was good, though not overwhelming. Its mostly typical buffet faire, but well prepared and served fairly fresh. Margarita Grille - My dinner at Margarita grill was quite good. I expected nothing more than a glorified Taco Bell, but there were original menu offerings that made it memorable. The service was slow, but since I was having a nice dinner with friends, I didn't mind lingering over some margaritas. Paradise Cafe - the 24 hour coffee shop. Normally, these are my favorite Las Vegas restaurants. My first impression of the Paradise Cafe was that it was over-priced. The first day I arrived, I ordered chicken strips and a bowl of chicken soup. The bill was over $16.00, which seemed a bit extreme. Las Vegas is getting expensive these days, and I haven't had the opportunity to compare the prices of the Paradise Cafe to other hotels' coffee shops. The food was good, however. The chicken strips were hot, and the chicken soup had a very homemade feel to it. Vegas Subs - the deli adjacent to the sports book. The subs were quite good. They had a good selection of deli meats. The style reminds me of the older sub chains - shredded lettuce, oil and vinegar, thinly sliced red onions, tomatoes, italian meats, etc. I was pretty happy with the sandwiches, although the people behind the counter were more involved with their own conversations than serving the customers. Perk Place - Coffee bar located near the Star Trek Casino. My only beef with this place is that it got ridiculously crowded in the morning, and they did not seem to have a good system for getting people through quickly. The coffee was good, but everything was a tad bit overpriced. Hotel: Location Although the Las Vegas Hilton itself hasn't moved, the location has greatly improved with the addition of the monorail. Now that it seems to be operating regularly, its easy to access the rest of the strip. Though it may sound ridiculous to some, walking from the Las Vegas Hilton can be a welcome break from drinking, eating and gambling. I recommend walking to Paradise Rd and turning left. Then, turn right on Convention Center Dr. From there, its less than a 2/3 mile straight shot to Las Vegas Blvd. From there, you can go north or south. I've done this walk a few times, and I find it nice and relaxing. Hotel: Staff – courtesy, attitude and promptness I arrived in the afternoon on a weekday. There were a few other people in front of me in line, but I didn't wait more than 10 minutes. The front desk clerk was quite friendly. I'm a cigar smoker, and requested a smoking room, and she joked with me about not too many people requesting smoking rooms any more. She told me to call down if I had any questions about the hotel. I was really pleased with her attitude. Value: I paid a convention rate of roughly $90.00. For this rate, I was completely satisfied. It may not be the most glamorous hotel, but with the addition of the monorail, it should be considered alongside most other strip hotels, if the rate is right. I would be happy staying here up to about $150.00.

Reviews.Title: “If I Had To Pay...”
Reviews.Author: LP_RULES
Reviews.Content: I stayed free as a Hilton Hhonors member for 4 nights Dec 11-15, 2005, a great deal of course. I'm a 36 year old single guy traveling alone with moderate expectations, simply looking for a comfortable place to shower and crash, while spending the majority of my time on the strip. Don't pay more than $100-120 a night, or you will possibly be very unhappy. This is because of the major ongoing renovation project throughout the lobby, restaurant row and fringe casino areas. The finished areas look great, but you'll need to dodge wheelbarrows and jackhammers all times of day, with congested hallways through the construction areas. Because of the inconvenience, call the hotel directly and they may be willing to quote a good price during an off peak time of the week. The property has all the standard Vegas things to do, just nothing extraordinary like locations along the strip. Perhaps entertainment acts are a bit above average if Barry Manilow & David Brenner are your speed. Casino area is small, but newly renovated with sparkling crystals adorning the ceiling. All staff personnel were friendly to expectation and the front desk graciously granted a complimentary late checkout to 3:00PM upon my request. I only ate at 'The Buffet' for breakfast, everyday, for a reasonable $10.95 per day. Food was tasty, hot and moist - drinks were refilled quickly. I heavily recommend requesting a room in the North Tower where my renovated room was nicely appointed in the 3-star range (saying this is a 4 or 5 star property is a probably a stretch). The room was clean, shiny new, and very adequate for my modest needs. The cable channel selection was weak (no HBO, ESPN2, History Channel, FoxNews, HGTV, Lifetime, etc), but who watches much TV in Vegas. I hate the crummy alarm clock/radios most chains put in their rooms. Hilton could offer a daily complementary bottle of water, considering you are in the desert. Bottled water was $4(ouch), so pickup a $2 bottle from the vending machines when exiting the monorail. Coupon book presented at check-in for hotel restaurants and shops did nothing to interest me. As a single traveller, too much food needed to be purchased to realize the special deal for example. The prized asset here is the incomparable monorail access taking you to the strip. The North Tower elevators are just a couple minutes walk to the fabulous monorail that takes you to 4 or 5 stops along the strip in less than 15 minutes. You know it's a great thing because the cabbies complain about all the fares they're losing. No other property in Vegas has such a short walk based on my ventures. Go for the 3 day unlimited deal for $25 per person. Cab meters start at $3.20 now, so a round trip to MGM with tip would have to run at least $12-$15 plus traffic. Warm regards and happy trails!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Bad Location”
Reviews.Author: bunitraveller
Reviews.Content: The Hilton was a nice hotel, the rooms were nicely furnished, the restaurants/cafes/buffet were great. However the location was average, about 15 minute walk to the strip and then you were right down one end of the strip, however there is a monorail stop at the hilton which we used mostly which took you right to the "action".

Reviews.Title: “Great value--quite pleased!”
Reviews.Author: lebelgo
Reviews.Content: Although I felt I got a pretty good deal on the room ($80 a night), I was pleased to receive a room with a view to the north (downtown, as opposed to the strip, howver) on the 24th floor. I don't know if having Silver VIP status had anything to do with it. The room was large, clean, and comfortable. It has electric drapes, and an ample supply of large towels. Housekeeping was available most of the day (i.e. you could get your towels changed twice if you really needed it). It had a nice pool, which was open even in late November. The spa and gym were beautiful, with a hot sauna, dry sauna, and a steam room, and ample exercise equipment in good working order. They even provided free bottled water (although I think there would be a charge if you weren't Silver VIP or above). I found the self-parking to be very convenient. You did NOT have to walk through the casino or through a shopping mall the size of Houston to get to your room or to the front desk. In fact, if your room was in the North tower, you could take the glass elevator (great views) and walk 90 seconds to your car. Of course, the valet parking is free, but if a convention comes out when you're ready to get your car, you'll have to wait. The Star Trek Experience is a must for any Star Trek fan, and the gift store has a lot of unique star trek items (including some actual props for sale). As a hint, though, get your tickets at Tix4Tonight for just over half price. Tix4Tonight is located in the Hawaiian shopping mall just south of the Harley Davidson Cafe (and Aladdin). The Star Trek experience is probably the most technically sophisticated and interesting ride in Las Vegas. Finally, the direct connection with the monorail is a big plus if you don't have your own car (or if you have one car, and one person needs it because the other is at a convention or meeting). Is this the most visually stunning or luxurious hotel in Las Vegas? No. However, I feel anyone but the most demanding traveler will be satisfied that this hotel is an excellent value. Although I have to add that the Golden Nugget downtown is probably the best hotel value on the planet, if you want a hotel that's convenient to the Strip or Convention Center, and can get a decent rate, you should be very happy with the Las Vegas Hilton.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing special”
Reviews.Author: gggaut
Reviews.Content: Spend three nights at the Las Vegas Hilton. I had great expectations about staying at the Hilton, but it is a little bit away from the Las Vegas Strip (about 10 minute walk). The view from the room was very nice (15th floor North Tower). Unfortunately they were renovating the lobby. My biggest complaint is the high prices for everything including internet service.

Reviews.Title: “brillient place”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Hi there, this is my 5th time staying at the hilton and i have found the service and welcome to be really great..Top tip if you play a lot in the casino either on the machines or the main casino floor..make sure you get to meet a host,,they will make your stay even better....A great place to stay and gamble..this is what vegas is about...5 star..*****

Reviews.Title: “Love the Hilton - reply on Star Trek Experience”
Reviews.Author: clownsj
Reviews.Content: I love the Hilton. My girlfriend (considered a high roller by the Hilton) and I were there 10 times last year and 5 this year. The Hilton treats us like royalty. The Steakhouse is great, but everything is ala-carte. The baked potato is about 2 pounds. Benihanna's is also great except for the salad but that's because they have a weird dressing I'm not used to. The Paradise never closes and has great cheesecake. There is a Pizza Hut and TCBY if you want fast food. The buffet is big and includes free beer and wine during certain times. On our last trip the check-in/check-out was being redone so it was harder than usual to get around but that's progress. Regarding 'The Star Trek Experience' - I've been through it 6 times - includes unlimited rides on both the Borg Invasion and the Klingon Encounter, all you have to do is show them your ticket stub to keep returning. There is no map showing where to go but at the end of both rides you are dumped into the shop area and you have to exit and climb the stairs to re-enter the museum and ride. The monorail is convienent and goes north to the Strat or south to the MGM. We are returning to the Hilton in December for another fun filled weekend. I would definatly recommend a stay with them.

Reviews.Title: “Good as ever”
Reviews.Author: all8
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a four night stay and as usual the Hilton more than met expectations. Arrived at 10:30 on a Fri morning and was amazed at how much construction is going on, the front desk/lobby area was in complete disarray, but the signs pointing us where to go to register were very helpful. After a 10 minute wait, I pressed a $20 bill into the front desk agents hand and got a renovated North Tower non smoking room on the 20th floor, with a strip view. The agent checked for a good 5 minutes before finding us something not in the Central or East Towers, and we appreciated that. The valet parking area is also under major construction as well, but didn`t really notice it being a problem as far as dropping off or picking up our car. Wait to pickup was never more than 5 or 10 minutes tops all weekend. Back to the room...nice to see they double sheet the bed (sheet that`s over the blanket), that`s the wifes pet peeve, and the bedspread looked brand new (of course that gets folded up and deposited in a corner for the duration of our stay). Room was very clean, and the large oval tub had good water pressure. Again, the bathroom looked and smelled very clean. We did our usual Sat. night dinner at Benihanas and it was as good and entertaining as always. Love the Hibachi special (lobster and steak) as well as the saki! Also ate at the buffet once for dinner, and it`s OK at best, we had a 2 for 1 coupon so we had to go. Actually the NY steak and sauteed mushrooms were good, as well as the the tiger prawns and linguini. The all you can drink beer/wine bar doesn`t hurt either! Never used the monorail because there were five of us, and it`s actually cheaper to get a cab than spend $3 per person each way. $12 up to the MGM, walked down the strip to TI, then it`s maybe $7 back to the Hilton. In closing, this is about our 10th stay at the LVH in the past four years and while it`s not Bellagio, it has that Vegas feel about it. Quiet and classy!, They give you some great travel packages in the mail once you sign up at the Players Club for any future visits (we paid $99 for two nights, $129 for the third on this trip), so that`s the first thing a new visitor should do when staying there. Can`t wait `til the NHRA is back in town next April...I know where we`ll be staying.

Reviews.Title: “Not so bad”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I attended a conference last week at the Las Vegas Hilton and stayed in the hotel for 3 nights. After my plans were set, I read a number of the negative posts on this property and was very concerned - I even tried to cancel my reservation, but it would have cost me one night. While the hotel has issues, my stay was fine. Here are my thoughts: No question that the Hilton has seen better days - I would only stay here again if I was attending a conference in the Hilton. Ask for a renovated room in the North tower - these are in pretty good shape. I encountered no problems with the staff The monorail is a convenient way to get back and forth from the strip - the stop for the Hilton is close to the hotel (not true with many of the other stops).

Reviews.Title: “Solid room and super clean”
Reviews.Author: wr70beh
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in 8/2005 for a week. Great room. Clean, roomy....just what you'd expect a luxury hotel to be. There was even a separate area by the window where you could make phone calls and/or plug your laptop in much like an office. The hotel has amenities galore, such as great restaurants and attractions. There is a monorail stop right in front of the hotel so getting down the strip is a breeze (at least the east side of the strip, the other side requires a walk).

Reviews.Title: “Old but comfortable”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: On September 18,2005 we checked into the Las Vegas Hilton we were a bit taken back by how old and tattered everything looked. The Hilton is still listed as a four-star resort so we were quite shocked at check-in. The hotel is under renovation so I'm sure in time it will be a star resort once more. We were given a very roomy suite. Old decor but comfortable. We were satisfied with the room but it over looked the roof so we asked if we could be moved a few floors up. I guess the desk clerk didn't understand because he moved us to a different tower that was so far from everthing it was like taking a hike to get to it. When we finally got to our room it was two rooms not a suite just two rooms with two keys one room had a bed the other had two chairs! We decided to keep the room with the view of the roof since the clerk that my husband tipped twenty dollars to was nowhere to be found. But upon check-out the manager gave us his card and told us he would be sure to take care of us next time we're in town.The casino is also very small and old.But the buffet breakfast is great and the monorail comes right to the doors of the Hilton which is great. We would try the Las Vegas Hilton again.

Reviews.Title: “Star Trek Experience a Rip Off!!!”
Reviews.Author: pleos2
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I spent $35.00, each, to Experience Star Trek. The museum is ok but, the entrances to the three experiences, included in the price, were hard to find and it was very dark in there. We only took part in "Borg Invasion" since we found the entrance to that part of the exhibit. After we were done, we were left saying to ourselves: "Where was the entrance to the Enterprise 1701-D bridge? and Where was the Klingon Encounter?". The girls in the booth that took our money and gave us our tickets did not bother to smile nor explained where each exhibit/experience entrance were. We looked through the iformation we were given and there wasn't even a map to the museum included. We went back to the ticket booth at the entrance of the museum and were told that we would have to pay again to get into the other two experiences and there were no refunds. We left feeling like ripped off idoits. The ticket price was too high! Paying $20 per person is more reasonable. For $35 per person; they should have thrown in a souvenier instead of giving you a 10% discount coupon for a picture of yourself with the different crews where you were added into an already existing cast picture. Now for the hotel...it is extremely outdated. We felt as if it hasn't been remodled in years. It has an late 80's feel to it. The rooms were ok but, not as extravagent as the "Hilton" name would make you feel it should be. The price per room was more than we should have paid.

Reviews.Title: “left after 2 nights”
Reviews.Author: LSS
Reviews.Content: This hotel is more like Motel 6. Hard to get in from the cab drop off area due to the construction. Then wind your way down the stairs and through the casino to check in. I asked for a renovated room and the room I got was clean, but no way had it been renovated. however, you could hear the people out in the hall all night long and I could even hear the person snoring in the room next door. --may have been because there was a connecting door in the front part of the room near the bathroom. They also charge $3 a day for the safe. Mine was locked when I got there and I had to wait in the room for somebody to come and unlock it. A car would have saved me $$$ that I spent every day on taxis and the monorail. On Sunday when I decided to leave ( I was booked for 5 nights, but left after 2), the taxi line was very long and moved so slow. Several people in front of me were also leaving to go check in elsewhere. Oh, almost forgot to mention that you could hear the drilling and hammering going on as you were playing in the casino...that is all you could hear. Because the front glass is out for the construction, the casino was very hot. Would not stay here again if they gave it to me for free. and even somebody attending a convention could find somewhere on the monorail line and avoid this place. Not worth the money. This is not up to Hilton standards, maybe it will get better after the renovation is complete, but I won't be back to find out.

Reviews.Title: “Great handicap rooms”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My first experience at the Las Hilton was great. I have read other travelers stories and didn't know what to expect. The check-in personnel were very friendly and had my handicap room reserved. The rooms need to be updated, but they were clean. I ate breakfast in the Cafe and had great service. Stayed in the East Towers and had a great view of Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Nice... i guess”
Reviews.Author: yoyo5
Reviews.Content: To lazy to write a hole review, so ill just say i give it five stars. Has a Small charm, good if your going to a convention. nice rooms,good restaurants, sort of a paradice, more like a quiet place in las vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Stay away from the Hilton!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Old property and not has been updated for the last thirty years. One place to get coffee in the morning and let me tell you, long lines and quite expensive. Slot machines are extremely old, tight, slow and many are not equipped with payout slips. Everything is more expensive than hotels on the strip. Fitness center in the Spa is old, small and cramped. Spa attendents are nowhere to be found. I am a Hilton Honors person and quite frankly, if it were not for Embassy Suites, I would dump my membership, as Hiltons in general, are not what one should expect from a better than average hotel chain. Ranking my five day stay, I would say a 1, on a scale of 1 to 10. My advice, stay down the street at the Embassy Suites or go to Treasure Island, Venetian or one of the other GREAT strip hotels.

Reviews.Title: “disappointing overall”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I stayed at the Las Vegas Hilton for 3 nights over a weekend. The check-in was fast and our room was ready right away even though we got there around 11am. The room we had was clean but very outdated. The whole hotel has a very outdated appearance in all public areas. The funniest part was the bathroom. There were scratches all over the inside of the toilet and I have no idea what might have been trying to claw its way out of there! The vent in the ceiling above the shower was full of dust and muck. The food and service in the mexican grill were great! We had breakfast in the Cafe and the food came out cold and undercooked. We had to get up and get our own coffee because the waitress who didn't speak english never brought us any. The buffet was good but not as good as the one at the Flamingo. I've stayed at the Luxor and the Paris and I would never choose this hotel again. The pool was extrememly small and overcrowded and it took us 3 laps of walking around it before we found a lounge chair. Overall, the other hotels give you much more for your money. I was surprised that Hilton hasn't done a thing to renovatet this property. It certainly doesn't measure up to other Hiltons at all. The monorail isn't a convenience, its a "necessity" while staying here. Do yourself a favor and stay in a nice 3 star property on the strip. It's well worth the extra $20-30 per night.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay of for the money”
Reviews.Author: kbullard
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have stayed at the Hilton twice and we have reservations for a third trip in Nov. Now that they are on the Monorail, there is not a better deal for price and location. Yes the hotel is older, but how much time do you spend in the room while in Vegas anyway. Staff is very friendly and did not find the slots to be any tighter than anywhere else on the strip. Give the Hilton a try and spend the difference in price on a show or dining.

Reviews.Title: “old property, shabby rooms, packed pool”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Location far from strip, but there is a monorail stop at the property. Our room was shabby and tired. The pool was very crowded. The breakfast buffet was disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “Wasn't impressed!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Las Vegas Hilton in August of 2005. I was not impressed by the hotel. My boyfriend and I had to change rooms twice in one night. First, they provided a room that was not cleaned. The beds were were not made, and the bathroom was a mess. The second time we had to switch rooms because we were located near the elevator. I would suggest you request the newly remodeled rooms if you decide to go.

Reviews.Title: “Las Vegas Hilton”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Hello All, We just got back from Las Vegas, My Partner and I went down on a business/Fact Finding Mission we got there on Sat Sept 17 and left on Sept 19th. We checked into our hotel around 2 pm. I am a Hilton Card Holder when we checked in we asked for a high floor, non smoking the room was ready for us. The room was very clean and very very well taken care of. The Las Vegas Hilton is going to a massive redone and it should be done in about 5 years. Never did I hear a jackhammers or anyone in the hall ways at night. We ate at there Mexican Resturant one night when we where there food was very good and the drinks where great. The only bad thing I saw in the hotel room was that there was no coffee maker, But that to me is not a big deal. I just had to go down and get it from there coffee shop. Yes I took the long way around and stopped at a few tables on way. But all in all I would recommended the Las Vegas Hilto

Reviews.Title: “Quiet retreat at the end of the day”
Reviews.Author: Duster4260
Reviews.Content: Stayed over Labor day as first part of a 6 day stay. The Hilton is not the place for the person who must always be in the middle of the action. It is quiet, almost subdue. That is nice at the end of the day when you want a quiet place to sleep. Rooms are large and clean. Yes, the bedspreads are amazingly fresh! There was little special about our room, but that is okay. There was also no running children in the halls or late night drunks partying their way home. Without the monorail this place would be too far off the strip to be really enjoyable. But the monorial stop is just out the door of the Hilton. The trains arrive every 5-7 minutes so it takes very little time to get anywhere. The pool is small but nicely arranged for sun bathing. It was never too crowded. My roommate did see someone famous - she was chatting with a "nice couple" when the were asked for their autograph. They then excused themselves saying that they would need to relocate since their "cover" was blown. My roommate who keeps track of nothing "pop culture" could not say who they were other than to call the woman "very attractive." I liked other places on the strip better for their energy, but for a good price I found the Hilton and nice stopping off place. The slots were average - giving out enough to keep me happy and drinking for free, but not making any real money. Others had better luck. The food places are very average. Eat elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “disappointed”
Reviews.Author: SarahD1978
