Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here September 9-10, 2005 and we were not very impressed. We used Hilton Honors points for this stay and didn't have to pay anything (thank god). Our room was gigantic but it seemed like our room probably doubled as a conference room when needed. It had a 2 sets of chairs along two walls, a couch, and a small dining table in the center with 4 more chairs. (How many chairs does a hotel room need? This room had enough chairs for 10 people) It also had a small kitchenette. The bed was a murphy bed and behind the bed was terribly dusty and dirty. The bathroom was very small and the faucet on the tub looked like it was barely attached. The knob you pull to make the water come out of the shower head was very hard to pull up completely and I had to let it come out of the faucet and the shower head at the same time because I couldn't get it up. (and then, I was standing in water up to my shins while I showered) The room was somewhat clean but the carpet behind the bed and along the walls was dusty and dirty. The tv was in a amoire and it didn't sit on a swivel base so from the bed, you could hardly see it and even at that, the tv was hanging half off the shelf. We were on the third floor and didn't have much of a view. This hotel is far from the strip but it does have easy access to the monorail. We found the monorail much cheaper than using cabs but it involved a lot of walking and it took a lot more time. The monorail runs behind the hotels on the strip and to get to the strip from any of the monorail staions, it involes walking through entire casinos to get to the street. From the hilton, the monorail took at least 25 minutes to get to the MGM. The restaurants in the hotel were not impressive either. (Overpriced and mediocre food) Finally, we had friends that stayed on the strip at the Excalibur and pricewise their hotel cost about the same as Hilton and their hotel had a lot more to offer in regards to food and shops and it was right on the strip. For the price of a room at this hotel, you'd be better off staying on the strip and not wasting your money here. This hotel would be suitable if you were in Las Vegas for a convention at the Convention Center(which was right next door) and your company was footing the bill. This hotel would not be good for first time visitor to Vegas or anyone that is not able to do a lot of walking. From this hotel, you have to walk very far to get anywhere, even from the monorail stations.

Reviews.Title: “very nice stay”
Reviews.Author: leesgrl
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my husband and his dad and step mom and my mom and sister and we had a great time . We stayed here August 25-27 and we have no complaints we were treating great and we always are .The rooms were great except the beds they are a lilttle un comfortable they could use new ones but that is it . The bathrooms were clean and we had plenty of towels and overall room was clean we had a ok view of the city and the monarail was great .I would recommend to saty here spen the extra money and get wht you deserve .We are staying here agin on sept 30th 2005 we were going to stay somewhere else but not worth metioning it is a dump i will spend the extra bucks and know what i am getting. nicci

Reviews.Title: “wonderful time at the hilton”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: my friends and i go to vegas every year and stay at one of the big hotels. this was our first time at the hilton. though i'd been to the hotel a couple of years ago to catch the sheena easton concert, i didn't know what to expect. a few days before leaving for vegas, i got a message from a fortune cookie stating that i would be surrounded by luxury. it turned out to be true, as our large 22nd floor room in the north tower had a magnificent view; handsome furniture; plush, pristine carpeting; and a spacious bathroom with a roman tub. the sheets were crisp and clean and i noticed that the bedspreads were in sealed plastic bags when houskeeping changed them between guests. when i got tired from walking around all day, i'd head up to my room; it was a private sanctuary (although if the a/c was off, you could hear the noise from the hallway). the casino had different sections to explore and plenty of exciting, new penny slots (my favorite was the babooshka slot). a woman won 1.2 million a few feet away from us on a wheel of fortune quarter machine. i didn't win quite that much, but $20 would last for hours playing at the hilton unlike other casinos. i was able to get cash back through the players club and most of my meals were free. the dining options were fine. the best was the cozy and charming paradise cafe. the worst was the buffet, which had a nice atmosphere but limited choices (especially for vegetarians like myself). the soy lattes at perk place were a great way to start the day. though not on the strip, the monorail (easily accessible directly through the casino) whisked us to wherever we wanted to go. the medium-sized pool area was busy, but once immersed in the hot tub i looked at the surrounding palms and mountains and forgot about the crowd. the staff was super-friendly everywhere, from the restaurants to the front desk. check-in/out was a breeze. next time we want to stay at mgm or caesars (now they have an incredible pool!), but one day we will surely return to the hilton. the hotel is very well-kept (almost seems brand-new) and has a more homey, comfortable and intimate feel than places like the venetian, bellagio, or wynn (though you must see the wynn because it is gorgeous).

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel if you don't mind being off the strip”
Reviews.Author: lrd9191
Reviews.Content: my husband & I stayed here in August 2005 for a long weekend/anniversary celebration. my husband had many many Hilton Honors points, so the room was free. THANK GOD! I am one that LOVES to be on the strip & where the action is. Overall, the hotel was clean & the staff was friendly. The breakfast buffet (which was complimentary for us) was excellent. The made-to-order omeletes were my favorite. I would stay here again if it was free but if I was paying I would stay elsewhere. I think if you have a convention to attend or like to stay somewhere off the strip then this is your place.

Reviews.Title: “Hilton was great”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hilton for the Star Trek Convention. The place was run very professionaly. No trouble at check-in. Check out was automated. There are three casinos and you can gamble round the clock. The room we were in was very nice, great view (from the 24th floor), and the bathroom had a nice big tub. The elevators were great- the ones we took all the time were express from 3-15 and zoomed up to the 24th floor like a rocket. We ate at most of the restaurants. Loved the Steakhouse, and Andiamo. The Buffet was great, the Paradise coffee shop very good and the Mexican place was good. We never had a bad meal here. We swam in the pool every morning and loved it. The Monorail stops just outside the hotel-very convenient. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: ChinaShrek
Reviews.Content: I just stayed at the LV Hilton for two nights in order to attend a Star Trek convention. I was very pleased with the service and quality of the hotel. I stayed on the 27th floor of the North Tower. The room was large and immaculate, and the beds were comfortable. The view of the strip was nice too. I ate the breakfast and dinner buffets during my stay. Some of the dishes were great; others were poor. The hotel is not close to the main part of the strip, so if you are planning to walk around the strip a lot then this may not be the hotel for you. I would happily stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “More Like the Hanoi Hilton”
Reviews.Author: symantix
Reviews.Content: OK, so it wasn't quite that bad. This was, however, not a very positive Hilton experience. While there was no line at check-in, the clerk took about 15 minutes to properly get us checked in. Apparently it was his first day and he moved VERY slowly. This is to be expected from a first-day employee, but perhaps he could have used a little more training BEFORE dealing with customers. I expect better service from a AAA 4-Diamond Resort (yes, that's the same prestigious rating as the beautiful Bellagio and Wynn). When we went up to our room we first noticed an unmade bed and towels on the ground. Upon further inspection, we saw luggage. It appeared that our first day employee made a boo boo, as this room was still occupied. We trekked what seemed like 1 mile back to the lobby, explained our situation, and did not even get an apology. At this point I asked if they had any upgrades/suites available. The clerk disappeared into a hidden room for a few minutes and came back with an offer of a 1 bedroom suite for an additional $125 more per night. I negotiated the rate down to $75 additional and we had a deal. Here's the fun part that they didn't explain at the front desk: the Hilton's 1 bedroom suites are literally 2 individual hotel rooms with a connecting door. Yes, I really mean 2 seperate hotel rooms with 2 seperate keys and 2 seperate doors. What an amazingly stupid design! We made another trip down to the lobby and decided to keep only 1 of our rooms and cancelled the additional charge. Now, a bit about the room: it was about 15 years overdue for a remodel, had horrible light, and the bathroom had some of the lowest ceilings I've ever experienced in a hotel (I could touch the ceiling without stretching). Our room was missing the TV remote control and the toiletries were utter junk. The A/C controls were either full cold or full hot. To make matters worse, the ice machine for our floor was not producing ice. Finally - and I'll cut this short - we checked out, started driving home, and realized that we left some hanging clothes in the room. We called the hotel and got bounced around from the Operator to the Front Desk to Housekeeping to Security. Finally security said that they had no record of any clothes being turned in and that they were probably gone for good. We hung up, called again and asked for the manager on duty. He apologized for the security staff and gave us the number for the Housekeeping manager. He said that if the housekeeping manager can't find the clothes then we will be reimbursed. This hilton is closer to a 3-star for accommodations and a 2-star for service. We won't be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “OK”
Reviews.Author: canadabound
Reviews.Content: we stayed 2 nights using hilton reward points-unfortunately got home to find they had charged us for 1 night-awaiting reimbursement. we got a room in the North Tower on the non smoking 22nd floor with a good view of the strip. Being a gold hilton hhonors member we got 2 free breakfasts each morning and free spa entry instead of a room upgrade-fair enough,the standard room was very nice. Best value restaurant was the dinner buffet with a good choice for $15-complimentary beer and wine. The pool area was nice but my kids complained that the water was fairly murky looking. we had been interested in visiting the Star Trek experience but not enough to pay $34 each-pricey for a family of 4 Would have expected family tickets or discounts for hotel residents available

Reviews.Title: “Not what I expected”
Reviews.Author: NYLady55
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights last September. As other posters mentioned, the bedding and mattress were shaby and stained, the water in the bathroom dripped all night and no one could fix it or give me another room, the tub was stained,,,,,,,,yuk. I received an offer to stay at the Hilton for $49./night weekend rate on my upcoming trip and refused their offer. I am paying triple the price to stay at another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for the money”
Reviews.Author: Constantine-TA
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Las Vegas Hilton between July 31 and August 4th, and we really liked it. Check in only took about 10 minutes. We asked about staying in the North Tower, and we were actually given a room with an oversized King bed on the 16th floor. Our room was clean, and the bed was nicely made and fresh towels provided upon our return to the room after breakfast around 9:15 a.m. We had an excellent view of the strip. The hotel has two casinos. We visited both of them several times and both seemed OK. The Quark's Bar is fun albeit cold. We ate only in the buffet restaurant. It's good value for the money, and beer/wine is free between 5:00 and 10:00 p.m. Overall, it was a very pleasant stay. Although Hilton is not on the Strip, it's connected to all the major hotels by monorail. Besides, Hilton is not as crowded as MGM Grand or Bellagio, but much cheaper.

Reviews.Title: “Nice experience with the Hilton”
Reviews.Author: KarenOK
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hilton Las Vegas for 5 nights (July 10-15). Check in was smooth and only took about 10 minutes. We asked about staying in a newly remodeled room and was actually given a room upgrade to an oversized King room on the 26th floor of the North Tower. We did not have the best view of the strip, but we could still see the Stratosphere and the Stardust hotels from our window. Our room was clean and tidy upon arrival. We tipped the maids about $3.00 each day, leaving the money on the pillows. They gave us extra lotion, shampoo, towels, and soap. Our room was always clean and the bed nicely made upon our return to the room. The hotel has two casinos. We visited both of them frequently and really enjoyed them equally. It seemed that the Star Trek Casino was less crowded and noisy. We didn't win as much there as the main casino. We loved Quark's Bar located in the Star Trek casino. If you are a Star Trek fan this a place you must visit. We rented a car from Sav-Mor Car Rental. We got a wonderful deal for a midsized car for about $125 for 5 days. Sav Mor had a shuttle to and from the airport that was handy. As far as parking in the parking garage at the hotel, it really isn't that big of a deal. It isn't a very long walk and we thought the location of the garage was convenient. We ate at a couple of the restaurants in the hotel. They served good food for a decent price. We chose to eat at different places away from the Hilton and the strip on many occasions. If you want something romantic to do, then you must have dinner at the Top of the World Restaurant in the Stratosphere. It is pricey, but you are paying for the view and the romance of it all. Overall the Hilton is an older hotel, and it may not have coffee makers, or it is not right on the strip, but for the value and experience you can't go wrong. Without hesitation, we would definitely stay at the Hilton Las Vegas again.

Reviews.Title: “Hilton Hotel Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Roeina
Reviews.Content: Hilton, the best hotel experience I've ever had in Las Vegas or anywhere for that matter. I paid for a "basic" suite. I thought they would give us two connecting rooms. Instead they must have upgraded us (they never said anything at check in?). I must also add here that Expedia is the best! This suite usually costs $650.00 a night - and thru Expedia we got it for $225.00 - unbeleivable... what can I say? 26th floor, dinning room table, modern furniture, soaking jett tub, two 27 inch tv's, marble everywhere, wet bar. Best of all was that my dad's room, and the living room where I slept had there own private balcony's. We stayed for four nights and really wished it was longer! Usually my trips to Vegas are two, and sometimes three nights at most. My girlfriends and I are hoping to catch this same deal thru expedia again!! Oh, also its right on the train/tram line so you can go anywhere on the strip....

Reviews.Title: “Decent Stay - Good Value”
Reviews.Author: mbtravels
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a weekend at the Las Vegas Hilton. We paid $178 total for two nights, Saturday and Sunday. No waiting at check-in, it was quick and easy at 2:00 pm. We never experienced any lineups at elevators or at the front desk, which can sometimes be a problem in Vegas. We had a king room in the East Tower 18th floor. Nice room with a nice view. The room appeared to have been updated with granite counters and new fixtures in the bathroom. The room was clean and quiet and that's all we really cared about. There are 2 restaurants and a buffet which were okay, not great. This hotel is located off the strip but one of the best features was the monorail to the strip which was very convenient and easy.

Reviews.Title: “Count me out as a repeat guest!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel July 5 to July 10, 2005. I was attending a fitness convention by myself and wanted quick safe access to the convention center. My discount rate for attending was $100 per night. I reviewed the Hiltons website before traveling to check room ammenities. They advertised coffee maker and hair dryer in every suite- not!!!! Staff at the front desk informed me they do not allow coffee makers because of a fire hazard. When I called room service to inquire, they could bring one up for $30 per day! (I bought a 10 cup coffee maker for $12). They didn't have enough hairdryers to bring me one. No skirts on beds, gross looking mattress shows when you take the spread off. Sheets are not fitted, bed sloppily made, and comes apart during the night exposing the mattress. Stains on carpets, heavy smell of cigerettes, windows filthy, no air circulation and ac barely worked. You get the feeling they are cutting corners, and pinching pennies. This has never been my previous experience staying in Hiltons. The fitness convention will return next year, so will I, but I will not stay at the Hilton or recomend it. Hula Girl You get the feeling they are penny pinching and cutting as many corners as possible. I would never stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Average, average, average”
Reviews.Author: my_gs300
Reviews.Content: I stayed here 7/6/05 - 7/9/05, for an anniversary trip. I want to start by saying, this is a old hotel. My room was on the 25th floor and suppossedly newly remodeled in the central tower. It had not been remodeled, carpet was in very bad shape, shower head needed to be replaced, and the air conditioner didn't work too well. There was nothing special about this hotel. Buffet was very good, 24 hr. cafe was outdated, including menu. Hotel does have a monorail station, it was simple to use. It's a long walk from self parking to hotel, so just valet, they were very good. Overall, I've stayed at several Hilton's, this one just didn't feel like a Hilton Hotel. It really needs to be completely remodeled, it just feels old and tired.

Reviews.Title: “Great quality for the price”
Reviews.Author: mfsista
Reviews.Content: The hilton is a little outdated but for the price it is clean and the people are very friendly. Since it is not on the strip you will need a car or pay $3 for the tram that goes to the strip. Since all the parking is free in Vegas it isn't such a big deal. The Star Trek experience is really great if your a trekkie.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed there from July 2-6. I received an offer in the mail for buy one night at $75, and get another night free, so I paid $150 total for 4 nights. I couldn't beat the price, and decided since it was on the monorail to stay there. My expectations were low after reading the reviews here, but I coudn't have been happier. The place is wonderful. Clean, bright, up to date lobby and casino. I was able to use the VIP check in line, and being a Hilton Honors Silver Member, I got a free breakfast buffet in the mornings (average food, nothing special) and free spa admission (not worth paying for). I was in a newly remodeled king room in the central tower. Very nice. It was, however, right next to the elevator, so every few seconds I would hear the elevators whiz by. It was like hearing the roller coasters in an amusement park. But the time I generally pretty drunk by the time I went to bed, so it didn't bother me. Overall, great value. I would stay there again. If the monorail wasn't there, or wasn't working, it would get a little expensive taking cabs to and from the strip. Also, the casino does not have a poker room, but they are opening one soon. All of the Barry Manilow playing in the elevators and the monorail made me listen to his CD when I got home. Also, I just LOVE the big white Hilton sign, it is so 1972!

Reviews.Title: “Horrible”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This place is a dump. The self parking garage is separate from the hotel so after a guest parks he/she has to walk to the hotel. The walk from the parking garage to the registration area is a task in itself. The whole hotel reeks of cigarette smoke including the non smoking room which we asked for. There is no ventilation and I had to gasp for air in the lobby. The service was absolutely horrible. The check in line was a mile long and it was like waiting in line for a Disneyland ride. There were over 30 people waiting to check in and only 3 people working the front desk. The elevators were so slow and by the time one came down, there were 15 people waiting to go up. The room we stayed in, which was in the north tower, was horrible. The whole non smoking room reeked of cigarette smoke, incluing the towels. The ventilation was non existent and it was as if the room ventilation was connected to the lobby's, so all the smoke traveled up through the whole ventilation system. I would never ever stay here again no matter how cheap the rates are. Thank God we only paid 79.00 for a Saturday night, which is pretty cheap for Vegas. I wasn't expecting the Wynn hotel or anything, but I also wasn't expecting to wake up choking from my sleep. The mattress was really bad also and I woke up with back pains, keep in mind that I am 27 and should not be having back pains. I guess you really do get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “Great price!”
Reviews.Author: p0inttravel
Reviews.Content: We just came back from Las Vegas Hilton. It was a great stay at a bargain price. $ 57 per night. We got upgraded to a nice suite in the central tower. The spa has very nice facilities. The buffet is not bad either. and the slots were not too stingy. overall, highly recommend it over the strip hotels. You get to stay here at a fraction of the price of the strip hotels.

Reviews.Title: “$20 trick worked again!”
Reviews.Author: johnnyvegas12
Reviews.Content: SURPRISED! I too read some of the reviews here and on other sites and I was not expecting much from the Las Vegas Hilton. I had been there when in the 80’s as a kid, and visited about 10 years ago and boy was it old. When my stay at the Tropicanna was cut short (See review on that one) I decided to take a chance since I had a $45 room rate coupon through “The Las Vegas Advisor”. So I figured I had nothing to lose. On check-in I tried the $20 trick (show a $20 dollar bill, $50 if it is Bellagio/Wynn or that type, and ask if there is an upgrade available. Typically the clerk jumps on the $20 and will offer a suite or a better room and the regular price. Well it worked, like a charm! We checked in on a Monday, but the clerk said they were close to capacity from the convention center. So I thought I would not get an upgrade. We did! She gave us a Lanai Suite. Venetian style. It had just been remodeled. Bedroom on top, a couple steps down to the living area about the size of 2 regular rooms. AWESOME! Then on the 2nd night I wanted to extend the stay 2 more so I called the $20 clerk. The room I was in was not available, but she had another. We got a roller suite. 1 big room, with a couch, chair, dry bar with fridge. The room was huge. 2 windows, huge bathroom with spa tub. 2 person! As for the Buffet it was bad. Not worth $5. Room Service was great, food too! Fast, friendly and not overpriced. They also gave us 4 coupon books. We only used a couple. But it was cool anyway. Changed my opinion for sure!

Reviews.Title: “A Very Comfortable Week”
Reviews.Author: Fifer9
Reviews.Content: We spent 7 nights here and have no complaints to report. Efficient check-in as a Gold Hilton Honors member, fine room with clear views to the Strip and the hills beyond, a buffet breakfast for $5, a choice of casual and fine dining in the complex, a lovely pool deck and cabana bar and best of all a dedicated monorail station. On top of that we got an excellent flight+hotel deal with Expedia which meant there was absolutely no reason to try anywhere else. We loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service and Value”
Reviews.Author: IndigoEyes
Reviews.Content: We stayed over Fri/Sat/Sun. Upon checkin, I told the clerk we were celebrating our 5th wedding anny, and slipped her a $10 - we were upgraded to a corner suite on a high floor with a great view, and she had them deliver a bottle of wine to our room, courtesy of the hotel. The room while not overly fancy, was large and comfortable (no free internet, however). The casino was adequate for me (I play BJ and video poker) and I spent hours there. We always have a great time in the spacequest casino and at the spacequest bar as well. We ate at the Quarks Restaurant a couple times as well - it's a bit overpriced (but so are most hotel restaurants in Vegas) but the food is good and it's a fun atmosphere. If you're there on a Sunday check out the South Beach Pool party, it's also a lot of fun, with a bikini contest. They have a HUGE hot tub/Jacuzzi with great frozen drinks at the poolside bar. Overall, a great stay for the price, we would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time for a great price”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I made reservations at the Hilton before finding this sight. They gave the Hilton mixed revues. We give it a "big thumbs up". We got 2 rooms for $54.00 each a night. It did take awhile to check-in. During the check-in process, I explained it was our first time in Vegas and the wonderful lady at the desk up-graded our rooms and moved us to the north tower so the kids to see the lights. The rooms were awesome. We enjoyed the pool and had a great time. Having the Monorail service in the Hotel is awesome. While waiting to board the monorail, they had a prize wheel and we won some cool prizes from the Hotel. We played their casino bucks and won. We used the coupon book we got when checking in. We're not big gamblers but enjoyed playing the .01 and .05 slots for a couple of hours. We also had thier star trek drinks in the souvenier glasses. The green and blue ones are good. The next day we checked out but they kept our luggage in the airconditioning so we could take the kids to Circus Circus no charge. The kids loved their time at Circus Circus but we knew we had stayed at the right hotel. We would stay at the Hilton again in a heartbeat. We are not hard to please but believe in recognizing a good job. We loved our stay at the Hilton. It was a great value for the money!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleasant Experience at the Hilton”
Reviews.Author: AFNBerlin
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hilton the 1st week of June during InfoComm 2005. I was a bit apprehensive based on the reviews I read but I wanted to stay in the HQ hotel so I would be convenient to functions that weren't going on in the LVCC. Some of the reviews I had read mentioned dated furnishings and fixtures that were there when Elvis left the building. Didn't notice anything that out of date. It wasn't the Wynn or Venetian or the Bellagio. It was the Hilton. Pure and Simple. Although I was hosed on the rack rate through our association's travel planner, it was well worth the charges. Skybridge or monorail to the LVCC was a real plus. My room faced due West so the sunsets were awesome! The room had a low counter that was a desk and table in-one that looked out the panoramic window. The only fault I would have with the hotel is the rather quirky check-out system they have. Most hotels have a quest operated checkout system through the TV. Not the Hilton. There they WANT you to sign a BLANK checkout form and leave it in your room and then toss the key card(s) into a box in the lobby. I didn't sign the form since I could potentially be signing for who-knows-what and since the card keys were provided by one of the vendors at the show, I kept them. Would I go back again? Yes. Would I check-out differently next time? Ya Betcha!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing hotel”
Reviews.Author: mayflowerfan
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Las Vegas Hilton in June 2005. East Tower room was definitely dated and worn looking. Did not look like it was one of the renovated rooms spoken of in previous reviews. Our room was not filthy, but not spotless, either. Floors in room and hallway looked like they hadn't been vacuumed in quite some time. Personally, I would not pay more than $59 or $69 a night here. I expected much nicer, updated, cleaner accommodations for the rates that we paid during our stay. The Hilton monorail stop is one bright spot. It made getting from the Hilton and around the strip extremely fast and convenient.

Reviews.Title: “NOt what i was expecting”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the reviews i was not expecting much from The HIlton. I decided to take a chance since i was able to get a great rate for a standard room. I was very happy with the Hilton. The room was huge! it was soo roomy and the bathroom was great. It looked like it had just been remodeled. They give you a really great coupon book when you check in. You can get 2 for 1 drinks and 25% off at the buffet just to name a few. The best feature was the monorail. It is very easy to get to the monorail and really helps you get around vegas. WE ate at 2 resturants there. The Buffet and the CAfe. I really enjoyed the buffet. It was reasonbally priced and had a good selection of food for the size. The Cafe had a very limited selection and food was ok. The hilton is limited in entertainment. They had 2 entertainers, wayne newton and barry manilow. There are a few shops and i think a club. I think the only thing i would like to see would be some more shops and things to do besides gambling. Overall a great hotel. I would love to stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Better than I expected..”
Reviews.Author: BreathinStephen
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for only one night on wed May 25th. Flew in specifically to see Barry Manilow's Music & Passion Show. Had booked in advance directly from their website and also received the AAA discount. The room rate came to less than $50.00, cant beat that! Arrived at the Hotel at 11 am, check-in took less than 5 minutes, the room was located in the central tower 7 th floor with a view of the mountains. The room itself was clean and comfortable, nothing fancy but looked recently remodeled. The room was very quite, though I think the hotel was not very full .The AC worked fine. The bed was comfortable but the pillows were way to thin. The bathroom was average but the shower water pressure was aweful. I thought the casino was just the right size and the sports book was huge and nice and dark. Wasnt really interested in the Star Trek stuff.,so cant comment on that. Most of the staff that I encountered were very courteous. The Hilton theater was the perfect size and Barry Manilow was incredible! Overall, I found this hotel to be a very good, especially for the price. I would definately stay here again.. I would say that if your flying in to see Barry Manilow or any of the other shows at the Hilton and arent really interested in the strip, this is the place to stay!!!

Reviews.Title: “It's just OK”
Reviews.Author: newtont
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights mostly for the low cost of 49.00 a night. Would not pay anymore than that. The monorail is great and takes you right to the end at MGM. The rooms were below average compared to the Monte Carlo and the Aladdin. We moved to the Mirage for the two nights also, what a difference, but the bathrooms were the same size. Only ate at the Mexican restaurant, just ok. The pool was extremely small for that size of hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: blesseddaily
Reviews.Content: I stay at the Hilton based on someone else's review on this site, and I myself was tremendously satisfied. The rooms were excellent and clean. The air conditioning freezing though, it's a good thing you could control the thermostat from within the room. Monorail pick up, in front of the hotel a big plus. My biggest compliant if you could call it one. No coffee pot in room. Had to go downstairs every morning and pay $4.00 for a large cup of coffee. Very friendly staff too.

Reviews.Title: “Yuck”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the North Tower, and the rooms were so small. The rooms are old, ugly and outdated. This hotel needs to be torn down and updated like the rest of them. I expected a lot more from The Hilton then what I received. The casino is very small compared to the other better hotels on the strip. It is out of the way from everything. I would not recomend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “LV Hilton Wonderful!!”
Reviews.Author: Madipuppy
Reviews.Content: I have read some good and some bad reviews of the Hilton. My wife and I stayed there recently and loved it. The only drawback is that it is not on the strip, but you are a cab-ride away in about 10 minutes. Our room in the east wing was great, always clean and a nice size. The staff was excellent. The sportsbook is as good as it gets in Vegas, better than Ceasars. The casino itself as far as table games is on the small size, but there were $10 tables on a Saturday night after the Manilow concert. Barry is wonderful, of course. The pool was nice too, smaller than the photo you see, but not overly crowded like some other Vegas pools can get. We got a cabana and the staff was constantly asking if we needed anything. Ok, they were after a tip, but they still were really nice. I would highly recommend the Hilton. We got a great deall too, about 1/3 the price of the Mirage and Ceasars.

Reviews.Title: “excellent value”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed only one night, but the hotel is nice and has a lot to offer. It is a little off the strip, but it is connected via the railway. The room was big, nice and clean, excellent value for the $75 we paied. There is no frigobar in the room, and room temperature water comes at $4 per bottle. The buffet for breakfast was ok.

Reviews.Title: “Typical convention hotel”
Reviews.Author: Cheesehead1
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Las Vegas Hilton for a trade show in May 2005, and have stayed here many times. It is a vast, impersonal convention hotel. You can't beat the location for a trade show at the adjacent LV convention center. The hotel dates to the 1960s and some public areas are a little tired and in need of updating (some of the lower floors were being gutted and remodeled during our stay). It was last thoroughly remodeled in about 2001, but gets very heavy usage from conventions. My room on the 26th floor overlooking the Strip and the new Wynns was large and comfortable, although the furnishings etc. are nothing special. The bathroom looked a little tired...the large oval bathtub was stained black on the bottom Yuck! 4 in our group got sick from the food at the 24 hour lobby restaurant, including me. On a previous trip, one person in our party had to go to the hospital for three days from food poisoning at the same restaurant. He stayed at Embassy Suites this trip. The overall service is OK for a convention hotel. Many of the staff have been there for 30 years. The casino is very large and there is a gigantic off track betting facility. The buffet restaurant, steak restaurant and Italian restaurant are quite good, and there is a hokey Benihana quasi-Japanese restaurant which you can skip. The management will take every opportunity to ding you for more money. Check your reservation dates carefully...if you need to add days, the hotel will jam you with a huge increase in the rate and will show no mercy (triple your original convention rate). Check your bill carefully when checking out. The 3rd floor pool area is outstanding if you get a chance to use it, very large with shaded areas and a large shaded spa and a nice pool. The location is not very close to the Strip, and the taxi lines can be endless during a show. The new monorail is finally operating ($3.00/ride) and can be much faster than a taxi during peak hours, and is directly accessible from the hotel. You can walk but distances are farther than they look since all the hotels are so huge.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for the cost”
Reviews.Author: phasmid
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the L.V. Hilton in May 2005 and got what we expected, a decent room at a reasonable price. Check-in was excellent (very nice clerk). Our room was in the North Tower. Nice, but it could have used some upgrading and maintenance (our A/C was noisy and the air filter looked like it hadn’t been changed in year or two). Come to think about it, the whole hotel could use a redo. The pool area was very average with very little shade. The parking deck was about 75 yards from the hotel so you had to go outside to get to your car. Not a big deal but why didn’t they just attach it (they had the space) like the other hotels is beyond me. The breakfast buffet was fine. The monorail picks up at the Hilton, which makes it very convenient to the strip. Don’t walk it’s to far.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: Lady23
Reviews.Content: I usually stay on the strip when I'm in Vegas, so I wasn't sure I would like staying at the Hilton. But I was pleasantly surprised! I arrived at 10:00am and was checked in immediately! The King room was very large and I had a beautiful view of the mountains. There is marble on the bathroom counter, the dresser and instead of a wooden desk, the counter extended the whole window, creating an interesting desk space. Finally I have found a hotel room with a safe in it! It did cost $3 a night but I felt my things were safe in my room and I could get to them when I wanted to. Housekeeping kept the room very clean and well stocked with towels. The Monorail made it very easy to get to the southern end of the strip, but it would have been nice if it stayed open beyond 1:00am. I paid $12 to take a taxi from the southern end back to the Hilton. The Nightclub at the Hilton has live bands and it's fun watching the bartenders singing and dancing to the music. I only snacked there because I'm not a buffet eater, but everything I did eat tasted fresh. I would highly recommend this hotel to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Not the greatest”
Reviews.Author: sdnewman21
Reviews.Content: This wasn't the best experience. Some low-lites: 1) Checkin process took forever, and when I got there, they didn't have a room, so they gave me half of a suite, that had a murphy bed which was slanted and uncomfortable. I had to call the next morning and switch rooms, which sucked, and got no credit for this. 2) The rooms were kind of old and run down. Not bad, but not what you'd expect for the price. 3) Elevators were slow, and dirty. And manilow played nonstop in the elevators. Brings new meaning to "elevator music." 4) Far from everything (but the monorail stop was nice). Some highlights: 1) Star trek experience was overpriced, but still worth it :) Amazing experience. 2) The sportsclub was large and very nice. There's a sub sandwich place there that has great turkey sandwiches and cookies. I ate there twice. 3) The pool service and Cabana was great. Cabana was only $50 for a half day, and came with all you can drink soda and water, and great service.

Reviews.Title: “Nice”
Reviews.Author: chocorocko
Reviews.Content: Not quite what I was expecting out of a Hilton. We booked about 2 weeks before our trip, it was just a stop threw on our way to Hawaii. We had a very late check in (about midnight) and the person checking us in was very curious about our trip and what we were doing in Vegas. When we told her we were just stopping threw, she tried her best to use our 7ish hours in Vegas before going to the airport again. The recommended monorail showed us the basics of Las Vegas and made us think about making a return visit. After, we went to the in hotel cafe, Paridise Cafe. We had desert and hot chocolate and went to bed in our room. It was gorgeous, beds soft and bathroom nice, except one thing... the toilet wouldn't flush. We called maintenince and they fixed it at about 7 am, when we were leaving. All in all, it was a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Room for The Price”
Reviews.Author: AWTSc
Reviews.Content: While most folks think of the LV Hilton as the home of Star Trek: The Experience, it is also a nice hotel. The modern, clean rooms are huge with large picture windows. The bathroom is large and has a separate washroom from the shower/commode area. I stayed for $25 a night, thanks to Priceline. The buffets are of average quality for the price. The elevators and restaurants are a lot easier to find than in other Vegas properties which force you to meander through their casinos. Check-in and Check-out were a breeze with the friendly staff. Best deal in "Lost Wages!"

Reviews.Title: “Close to convention good! Far from Strip bad!”
Reviews.Author: jetsetera
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in February of 2004 for a convention inside the Hilton. I understand why so many people stay here though as it's a convenient location for the LVCC. The hotel is definitely not up to Hilton standards though. It's old and probably only gets customers because of its name and proximity to the convention centre. We tried the breakfast buffet on our last day. It was horrible. I think it's about $14 or so but gosh....never again. I had a breakfast buffet at a locals casino in Summerlin that was better for half the price. We also ordered a lot of room service because we were so tired. The food was average...if we had more energy it would definitely have been much better to go out and eat. I probably would only stay here because I had a convention to attend. Not because of the facility itself.

Reviews.Title: “Hated it!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Although a Hilton Club diamond member, there was no special check-in or check-out. I was in a shabby room (no different than most of the rooms my friends tell me) with an uncomfortable bed. I went to a supermarket to stock up on snacks as there is a line for everything-even the slots at the Hilton! I stayed there solely because I was attending a convention at the Convention Center. However, if I had known how far a walk it was to the Center from the Hilton's lobby, I would have stayed on the strip and taken a taxi to the Center. In 107 degeee heat, it would have been worth the cost of a taxi each way. This was my first trip to Las Vegas and likely my last. I prefer Lake Tahoe and Reno--at least there you don't have to reserve a show months in advance! I would suggest they build climate controlled connected walkways or provide shuttles between hotels on the strip--unless you visit in the winter or spring, summer and fall is too hot!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: AlexnSC
Reviews.Content: My second trip to the Hilton and this was even better than the first. Not sure why someone would say cocktail hostess are slow. I never had a problem getting a beverage at anytime during the day or night. Went out to watch the LPGA golf and the location was great. Next door to Hilton. This time I eat at the Hilton Steak house and it was wonderful. Tried the Chinesse next night and it as well was great and price was good with more food than I could eat. Saw plenty of jackpots hit and did well myself. This is my place in Veags now. Rooms above average and staff great.

Reviews.Title: “nice place....”
Reviews.Author: kygregor
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff was EXTREMELY nice and the rooms were average . You would think that a hotel that had such HUGE events years ago i.e Ali fights, Evel kenivel jumps, Elvis and Sinatra etc... would be more up to date. I would have no problem staying here again, but if I could get a better deal elsewhere I would probably take the better deal. The casino was fine, nothing special or different than the rest of the hotels (dont give the cocktail waitress a nice tip expecting her to take care of you in the future. The free drinks people brag about when going to vegas didnt happen too much at the Hilton) The only bad thing I can say about the hotel is the buffet. The wait staff (when you could find them) was horrible, the food was average at best (if you can find a golden corral you could save about $5 and get the same type of food). It was the ONLY time I have never tipped a waittress, and I tip fairly well for good service.... PS if you like seafood, go to the Rio. The buffet is a little on the expensive side $35 for a Sunday night, but the food and wait staff was EXCELLENT (Lobster tail, crab legs and any kind of fish you could think of) and made it worth the extra cash for a buffet

Reviews.Title: “A very nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: portuguesa
Reviews.Content: I had read with some apprehension the past six months' comments about this hotel prior to our visit 4/1 - 4/3/05. In terms of the hotel, we had a wonderful experience. When we requested a non-smoking room, we were upgraded to a semi-suite, and we are not members of their club. The room had a beautiful view, was quiet, and everything was comfortable and well-maintained. The fact that it was on a monorail stop was a real bonus, and made getting around Vegas very easy. Faster and cheaper than a taxi! In terms of the hotel restaurants, the Paradise Cafe was pretty average. The Buffet, however, was very nice for brunch, and compared very well to the Bellagio buffet that everyone seems so excited about. The fact that this hotel was somewhat off the Strip was a bonus for us--a little quieter and more laid-back than the others. The Barry Manilow show we went to was fabulous!

Reviews.Title: “great price”
Reviews.Author: stori2431
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 4 day trip to Las Vegas Hilton. We go every year & try to stay somewhere different each trip. We were trying to find a good deal & definately got one at the Hilton. The rooms were very nice & we loved the pool area. We used the monorail twice to get to the strip, it was very convenient and easy to get to. The food was average, but I would stay there again & recommend it to anyone looking to travel to a nice hotel on a bargain price.

Reviews.Title: “Hilton Large Room”
Reviews.Author: GraemeKaren
Reviews.Content: The Hilton Las Vegas is a great value hotel. Off the strip, but access to the monorail. Large rooms. Unfortunately, they put us in a room that was close to the elevator and ice machine, so a little noisy. We transferred to another room and it was much quieter. The only problem that we had was the security didn't seem to mind that there were a group of prostitutes after 9:00 with their pimp trying to make a buck. I thought security in hotels would notice something like this, and not think it was adequate, but I guess not.

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleased with The Hilton”
Reviews.Author: marc1976
Reviews.Content: My father and I recently stayed at The Hilton Las Vegas from March 5th to March 8th. I was very impressed with the Hilton. I only paid $98.00 a night for a standard room. I’m not a smoker, but I did have to stay in a smoking room. Luckily for me I did not notice any disgusting cigarette odors. The hotel is an older hotel, but still very nice. The rooms were of average size and clean. The beds were very comfortable and the sheets felt to be of a good quality. The alarm clock in room 1425 must have been about 15-20 years old, but it still worked fine. The bathroom was very average, although the ceiling in the shower was very low for someone 6’5 like myself. A maid cleaned our room thoroughly every single day. Everyone we dealt with at the hotel was very courteous. I enjoyed the breakfast and brunch buffets. We ate at the Paradise Café, which was also good. The channel selections were not very good, but I guess the hotel does not want you watching TV when you could be gambling away your heard-earned money (not me though, I won $105 playing Blackjack by the book). I had a few questions before I arrived at the hotel. A manager by the name of David Verdugo gave me very useful information about the hotel and transportation arrangements. The hot tub outside was cold the second day I was here and the pool was a little chilly. The pool area was large and nicely decorated. The hotel is a stop on the monorail system, which made traveling up and down the strip very convenient. A single ride is $3.00. I’d recommend walking to the World’s Largest Souvenir Store located between the Stratosphere and The Sahara for good deals. The casino had a lot of low-limit table games, which appeals to responsible, recreational, “low-rollers” like myself who want to play for a fun and a small amount of money. Overall I very much liked the Hilton and would stay here again. I also think I got a great deal for my money.

Reviews.Title: “Staying at the Las Vegas Hilton”
Reviews.Author: Bigfus
Reviews.Content: I used HiltonHonors points for my room, so it was free for me. The room was adequate. We received a king size bed and a non-smoking room as requested. I phoned a second time to make sure I got a non-smoking room, because I had read that this wasn't guaranteed until arrival. The bed was comfortable and there were no problems with the room at all. They provide bars of soap, shampoo, lotion and shower caps. When I asked for a second bar of soap so that we'd have one in the shower and at the sink, we were over supplied the next day. :-) The property and the furnishings are a bit old, so they are a little more shabby than what you'd expect from a Hilton. But, from TripAdvisor I can see that the prices are not the usual Hilton prices, so I guess you get what you pay for. Everything in the Hilton is as expensive as you'd expect. But, if you go out the front entrance and down the hill, there is an AM/PM mini market across the street. I got coffee and water for the room there. The $4 bottles of water in the room have a huge tag on them explaining that they are $4, so if you assume they are complimentary, you are foolish. Coffee was a few dollars in the coffee shop in the hotel and there was a line to get it. It was worth it to me to walk a block or two for a cheaper price. The monorail is running and there is a stop at the Hilton. If you want to go downtown, you can get the CAT 108 bus out on Paradise Road. You will most certainly meet unsavory characters on the bus but the bus gets you around cheaply. The bus takes forever getting up and down the strip, so I'd use the monorail then. There's not much traffic going from the Hilton to downtown though. I liked downtown and here are a few tips. Both the Golden Nugget and Main Street Station have tasty affordable buffets. We liked Main Street Station better. Main Street Station has the 777 Brewery and Restaurant. The beer is very good and at happy hour it's only $2 for a 16 ounce glass. Definitely get a 99 cent shrimp cocktail at the Golden Gate and sit and listen to the piano music. If you are there anyway, I think it's fun to go outside for the Fremont Street experience on the hour, starting at 6pm. It's neat and it only lasts a few minutes. At the Plaza there are shows in the Comedy Zone at 2pm, 4pm, 6pm and 8pm. There are two-fer coupons in some of the mags; they are offering free tickets if you win them by spinning the free slot at the front of the hotel and it's only $8 to pay for the shows (includes a drink and a ticket to get another drink for $1) The magic show and the man of 1000 voices were both good. We're not big gamblers but we did drink free Corona's with lime at the Hilton one night while playing penny slots. I thought everyone at the hotel was pleasant and attentive. You could ask any employee a question and each one was friendly and helpful. I would stay at the Las Vegas Hilton again. It's a little inconvenient because it's a few blocks off the strip, but the monorail and bus make it more accessible.

Reviews.Title: “Good price for a great room”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Although I only stayed a single night at the end of a business trip, I enjoyed my stay. I requested (and received) a North Tower room for it was closest to my car, parked in the North Tower garage. The room was HUGE, bathroom clean and well stocked, and the bed was very comfortable. Despite the age of the hotel, the room was in excellant shape and nicely decorated. The view of the mountains was spectacular. Check in was fast and my interactions with the staff was good. My only complaint? The buffet was down right mediocre! I would only choose to eat there again in a pinch. The coffee shop (Paradise Cafe) was a better choice. With the monorail, there is now good access to the strip. Management has changed recently so perhaps some of the issues raised by myself and others will be addressed. I WOULD stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Loved this Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: dergenie
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this very nice hotel from Feb. 2-7, 2005. My husband had a business convention at the Convention center,and we went for both business and pleasure. Most people, it seems, like to stay on the Strip, but we liked this more quiet location, away from the Strip. The room was large in size with a very comfortable king size bed. Everything was very clean, and service was great. We had room service breakfast every day, and they bent over backwards to please us. Everyday a table for two, with linen tablecloth, napkins and silver and china, appeared at our door. We had dinner a couple of evenings in the room and that was great also. Food was great. We did video checkout and everything went smoothly there. We often ate in the Paradise Cafe and found the food and service quite fine. Would definitely stay here again. Another plus is that this hotel is one of the Monorail stops.

Reviews.Title: “what a view”
Reviews.Author: royeun
Reviews.Content: I connot praiase the hilton enough the service was brill view was brill the buffet was brill and the price was brill could not fault any thing. love to go back

Reviews.Title: “great special”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed there 4 nights in May04 excellent over all extramely clean huge rooms and bath plus a VIEW!!!!!! Just sorry to see the special we had gotten is no longer available since it cost $49 for 2 $79 for us 3 excellent price for what we thought was a 5 star hotal.Lost $700 on keno but felt with the savings on the room I could afford it and did not feel at all bad about losing.We hope to again be able to stay there again if and when they have a special like that again making it affordable to families to stay there without breaking the bank since not everyone wants to pay huge sums for a 5 star hotal.Great food great everything.....if you get a chance to stay here you will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Hotel on 30 December 2004 for two nights and had a great stay. Both rooms were large and had nice fittings and fixtures and excellent housekeeping. Great views of Las Vegas. Found all public areas well maintanied, clean and interesting. Nice shops and great casino. Dined two nights in the Margerita Mexican Restaurant and found the atmosphere , food and all staff excellent. Monorail ran from hotel along the strip and made access easy to the strip and sightseeing. Found the whole two days in the hotel wonderful and would go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Star Trek the experience wedding”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I wanted something a little different. As we both love Sci Fi we searched for the ultimate wedding. It was fantastic getting married on the bridge of the USS Enterprise TNG. It did not look like boxes taped together and spray painted as we had expected - it was as true to the bridge as possible. The floor vibrated as though the ship were moving, the massive viewer looked as though we were flying through space and the Klingon, Fergue and Borg actors look life like in their costumes. The experience rides afterwards were out of this world, Really brilliant. I now know what 4D intails! My dad and partner, my older brother and his wife, my younger brother, my fiances's mother and twin brother and sister and our 2 friends travelled from England to join us on our special day and they all agreed it was a fantastic day, never to be forgotten.

Reviews.Title: “Big Name”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Worest dining ever I had in Vegas, I actually had to through up what I ate they made me formally fill complaint, no apologies was made. If you wanna be sick, blotted out and spoil your vacation this is a place for you, the bed is worse than sleeping on the floor. I couldn't say much more it was my worest time in Las Vegas. One thing I know nobody I know will stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Ausome View”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I thought that the hotel was very exciting. Arcade was ausome. The best part was the view from the window. I would love to come back again. I thought it has excelent service and very expensive food. The room was very spacious and has very good arconditoning!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel great price”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I am a travel agent and probably one of the toughest critics out there. My Family stayed at the Las Vegas Hilton from November 22, 20004 thru November 26, 2004. We have stayed here a couple of times in the past and we have stayed on the strip. The staff was great. Check in went very smooth same with the check out. Yes it is an old hotel that was to be updated in the last year which they have not done. I heard that it was sold recently, not sure to whom. The rooms are clean; the hotel from what we saw was kept clean. We do not gamble but I do have clients who will only stay at the Hilton for the casino, but would like to see it updated. If we asked for anything from the room staff it was taken care of immediately. The only problem was on the Hilton TV channel advertised a steak dinner in the café for $5.95 per person we get down there after having our flight delayed over 4 hours very tired and were informed that the hotel has been sold and they no longer have any specials. Then we ate at Quarks and it seems to be 95% of the time your get great service but the other 5% of the time you do not even want to leave a tip. We ate there twice one time great the other no tip and explained why. Beth Caldwell A Touch of Gold Travel ----------

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: marcwalker5
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Las Vegas Hilton on two separate occasions in November. Hotel was above average and very inexpensive for Vegas (double room in the Central tower for $49, $80 in the more modern North Tower). Good views from both rooms, comfortable beds and decent facilities in the room. The Buffet at the rear of the casino is fantastic and hotel residents receive a 25% discount on up to ten people to use once during your stay. Definitely one of the better deals in Vegas. As for the $4 water bottles...... read the notice on them and then it won't come as a surprise!

Reviews.Title: “Met all our expectations”
Reviews.Author: murphds
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this property on Nov. 6th for only one night. Was the best rate $$$$ in Vegas for a Saturday night. Paid 129.00. Hotel was clean, staff were very helpful, and check in/ check out was fine. No problems. We had the brunch in the buffet restaurant and were quite satisfied. Location is out of the way though for the price we really can't complain. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Beware!”
Reviews.Author: PMattLA
Reviews.Content: Took my family here for a long weekend. We all got lice. BEWARE!!!

Reviews.Title: “Felt well served”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I'm in Vegas on business and had to move hotels due to a lack of internet connectivity. The bad reviews here gave me pause about the Hilton. But the price was right and I was able to get a room on a weekend where everything was very very tight so I went for it. It's my first time in a gaming hotel. I've been pleasantly surprised! The staff has been very courteous - and that goes from the pit bosses right through the room service staff. I requested a room with a view and received it. I ordered room service for 8am and it was right on time... As for the widely divergent accounts of room comfort, furniture, noisy air conditioners etc...I can only say that I stayed on the 18th floor of the central tower and everything was great with one exception: when I moved the desk chair back from the desk, it broke. Housekeeping arrived with a different chair in 10 minutes explaining that some of the new furniture was clearly defective and they're replacing it. Additionally, I do really appreciate is that the whole floor is reserved for non-smokers. The $11 high speed internet connection is fast and works great. And amazingly for a large corporate enterprise, the art in the room is tolerable. I even like some of it. That's a big one for me as I'm an artist. As for the much discussed $4 bottles of water - the price is clearly marked on the bottle. It's a drag to have to walk across the steet to the AM/PM to get water at a reasonable price. Certainly the Hilton would spread a little good will by comping a bottle of water especially as the tap water is undrinkable. The rest of my stay made up for that small inconvenience. I recommend the Hilton without hesitation. CB

Reviews.Title: “LV Hilton not what it use to be !!”
Reviews.Author: pwr1658
Reviews.Content: Stayed for the first & last time, Oct. 25-29. The new owner has done all they can to get by as cheep as they can. Only basic items in bathroom, hand soap, shampoo & lotion. Sheets to small for bed, carpet had cuts & stuff stuck on it. Place for mini-bar but no frig. Food was O.K., but not great like other hotels. Players card was a joke, this was the first time in 3 years I didn`t get My food compt. I played more & got less. My last trip in July, I was able to ride the monorail, but with it not running, I was trapped. Taxi`s cost Me over $60 for just a few trips to the strip. I won`t make this mistake again. Next trip will be at a hotel on the strip only !!!!

Reviews.Title: “I love this hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: If you are a Star Trek fan, the hotel's "Nemesis Package" is for you. Excellent rates, very nice rooms. Heck, even if you aren't a Star Trek fan, it's a good deal. The hotel itself is clean and the staff was helpful. Our room was nice and large enough for two people. The only bad thing about our trip was the long line for check-in. It took about an hour. The hotel is off the strip, but we liked that because we didn't want to be in the middle of everything. You can walk it easily from the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Older hotel in poor location”
Reviews.Author: hakko936
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Las Vegas Hilton Oct. 11-Oct.14 2004. We found the check-in process to be quick and easy. The lady that took care of us was friendly enough and did smile. Our room was clean, comfortable, quite large, and had a nice garden tub in the bathroom. The hotel staff seemed friendly enough. Anytime I passed a staff member in the halls, they always gave a nice hello. The checkout process was fast and easy although it would be nice if they did the express checkout by putting your bill under your door. Now, the complaints. The cost for the business center is outrageuos to handle a package or send/receive faxes. The casino is dead quiet and not much action. Restaurants were "chain" quality at high end prices. Location, location, location. If you want to see "The Strip", don't plan on getting there easily or economically from the LV Hilton (not hotel's fault). Bus service is non-existent, monorail is not operation indefinitely, and cab fare is high (isn't all cab fare?). Walking is not really an option are very far from the "nice" strip hotels. All in all, I would say this. If the price is right, stay here, but only if the monorail is operating or you like to pay cab fare. It was a nice enough hotel that you won't be grumping about the room. If I could get the same room on the strip, I would be VERY happy! The hotel as a whole is old. It looks old and it feels old particularly when compared to the new strip hotels. They were playing a message in the elevators about the hotel being purchased by a group. Hopefully they will update it so you have a reason to not only sleep there, but play there.

Reviews.Title: “Who is doing quality control at the Hilton chain? 3rd rate hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Pointe Hilton in Phoenix and it was exceptional. I won't ever come back to the Las Vegas Hilton. The only pleasant staff were in the Mexican restaurant and the gift shop. What would it take for a front desk person to even smile? The restaurants and the gift shop were 3rd rate. The interior design and furnishings are dated and worn out. Worst indignity - they charge $20 per day if you want to use a treadmill! I travel for business and always make sure that the hotel I'm staying in has a fitness facility so I can keep up my fitness routine. There's no way my company or I will pay the extra $20. This charge is plain cheesy and reflects badly on the Hilton chain. Wake up hotel execs - bad experiences like these influence busness travelers in their future hotel choices!

Reviews.Title: “Beam Me Up”
Reviews.Author: angeliad
Reviews.Content: This was my 5th trip to Vegas and my first stay in the Hilton. I chose this hotel because of the package they offered which inccluded passes to the Star Trek Experience for 2 people. The cost of these tickets is $35 each so having them included in the cost of a three night stay at $145 was great. We also recieved a free meal at Quarks restaurant (from a limited menu, but food was very nice). The pool here is very nice but if you are looking for somewhere quiet to sit this is not the place - its is full of kids, ive never seem a hotel in Vegas have so many kids at the pool!!! Eating in the Hilton is great as well, the Buffett offers free beer and wine with your meal, and the choice of food is amazing. The only downside to the Hilton is the location, its miles away form the 'happening' end of the strip. We arrived on Sept 7th 2004 and the monorail worked for about 1 day during our 2 week stay so we either had to walk or geta taxi. In total we ended up staying here for 5 nights then moved up to the strip. I also found that the AMPM store across the street offered great burgers for only $1.99, a lot better value than the $7 you were being charged at the pool!!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the view”
Reviews.Author: AGSicilyBound
Reviews.Content: Our first stay in Vegas, and we were not disappointed. Excellent, we shall certainly come back again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Las Vegas Hilton!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to Las Vegas, so I didn't have a clue on which hotel was better than others. I chose the Hilton in a package hotel/flight deal. I was very pleased when we arrived to check in. The hotel appeared to be clean and nice. The hotel is walking distance to the strip, but it's far enough that you don't feel like you're in the middle of everything at night. The room was very clean and well decorated. All of the hotel staff that we had contact with was very friendly and helpful. The parking garage was clean and well-lit. The restaurants, stores and swimming pool were nice. Overall, I was very satisfied and would recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: JohnnyCanuck49
Reviews.Content: This was our second visit to Las Vegas. We chose the Hilton for this trip mainly because it didn't charge for our 14 year old daughter. We found the Hilton to be very clean and well maintained, the food in the restaurants was good (although we found Quarks pricey), and the service was excellent. We were given a non-smoking room per our request with no problems and actually upgraded for no charge to a slightly better room. Check in was immediate, but we were told this was a slow week at the hotel. The location was not a problem as it was only a 15 minute walk to the strip and the new monorail really adds options to travel. The pool shows its age a bit, but was still OK, and the spa was great. The gambling was good, the comps good, in fact everything was good. We would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “great place to get away from the strip crowds.”
Reviews.Author: ink701
Reviews.Content: Loved it...great deal on a great room, nice spa, nice cozy casino, less crowded than the other big strip hotels and with the new monorail system easy to get to anywhere on the strip....it was great to come back to the hilton after we had enough of the overcrowed strip action...great little 24 hour restraunt/diner..we ate breakfast there every morning...the ommlettes were a tad pricy..but excellent...the room had a nice view and a romantub...all in all we loved it and would go back again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “very disappointing”
Reviews.Author: holidaymakeruk
Reviews.Content: Having decided to have two weeks holiday in vegas we booked the Hilton for our first week (2nd at Caesars). We have visited the hotel on previous holidays and thought it should be Ok- What a disappointment ! The receptionist put us in a smoking room even though we had booked non smoking, when I called them to see if I could have a change of room the answer was No. Apparently non smoking rooms cannot be guaranteed ! Several hours later when I could nt sleep because of the effect the smoke was having on my sinuses etc I got up and went down to reception. By this time my eyes were streaming and my voice was getting croaky (THIS WAS AT 2 AM) The relief receptionist found me a room straight away and even though it was near a lift and it sounded like there was a train going by the door every few minuites it was preferable to the smokey atmosphere of the room we vacated. I have to agree with other comments on this site about the cleanliness of the rooms and in fact before we left my husband was checking cupboards to make sure we hadnt left any belongings and he looked under the bed and found a remains of broken glass!! Not from us I may add. We left it there because we had the feeling they wouldnt have been worried about it anyway. Even the pool attendants were sloppy - the music was terrible and far too loud (not at all soothing or relaxing) Unfortunately there is little positive I can say about this Hotel, We have now stayed at seven different hotels all on the strip but this has been our worst experience. Ther only favourable comment I can make is that the Monorail is very convenient being right outside the Hotel It was altogether a dissapointing experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great Casino Personel”
Reviews.Author: HeberSparky
Reviews.Content: My wife and I went to Vegas for a show and decided to stay at the Hilton because it was the cheapest rate by far for a "Brand Hotel". The check-in staff on the phone were fantastic. I requested a room high up with a view and got it! The actual check in person was not as pleasant! But I got a nice clean room. I picked up a Players Club card, which I have never done before because I'm not a big gambler, and hit the Space Quest Casino. This is pretty cool. Not like anything I've seen before. Alt Rock music and Laser lights that are just distracting enough to make you look up from time to time, and only four single hand black jack tables, four dealers and one Pit Boss. This was fun because you get to know the dealers who were all a lot of fun. The best part was handing the Pit Boss, Russel, my card when I sat down. He really made me feel like a big spender even though I was only playing $5 hands. The next day I went back down and Russel welcomed me by my first name and shot the breeze for a little bit. Very cool. To sum it up: The hotel is nice, Russel made my gambling experience a lot of fun and the Benihanna restaurant was a blast. Check out the Sports Book just to see it! Lastly, rent a cabana by the pool. $90 all day on the weekends. Totally worth it! Fridge, ceiling fan, TV, comped water and soda and cocktail service I would gladly stay here again

Reviews.Title: “All the bad reviews are right!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Everything that I read about the Hilton in Las Vegas were correct. The rooms were filthy, the air-conditioning extremely noisy, fridge not turned on, stinky towels and the rudest check in staff I have ever encountered. I booked a deal over the internet and when I arrived they told me that if I wanted that particular package I would have to pay an additional $USD40 over and above what I had agreed to despite the fact that I had a valid booking and had paid a 50% deposit. Then when I went to check out they tried to overcharge me Do not stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Accomodations”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Met with family over 4th of July weekend. My husband and I stayed at the Las Vegas Hilton and had an absolutely wonderful room. Was only a king bed room, but was so large it could have been a suite. Elegantly decorated and the room rate was unbelievably low. A third of what my brother paid for his extremely small room at Treasure Island. I would definitely stay at the Hilton whenever we are in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Las Vegas Hilton”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Although the Vegas Hilton is not on the Strip, it is a nice hotel and the rooms are in good shape and good sized. The new monorail starts at the Hilton and goes to the Strip so now the Hilton is a nice alternative to the Strip hotels, i.e., you can stay off the Strip where it is a little quieter but still get to the action quickly. I did feel like the hotel could have done a better job catering to kids (I was with my 6 year old son) as the arcade closed at 9:45 (they advertised 10 pm) and the worker there was very rude. It is my understanding the Hilton is going to go through a major facelift soon and should be a good destination in the future. I would definitely stay there again. Friendly staff, good food and entertainment options and Star Trek Experience make for a nice stay.

Reviews.Title: “Sucky”
Reviews.Author: mekachu
Reviews.Content: Old hotel, so the king sized beds are tiny - I'm only 5'10" and my feet stuck out the end! They gave us an uncleaned room at first, and when we complained "upgraded" us to one that was cleaned but still crappy. The beds are rock hard and lumpy - and the pillows are lumpy and small. I woke up with a sprained neck after 4 hours sleep and we got out of that place asap and went to caeser's palace which was overpriced and a small improvement comfortwise. At least there was less white-trash everywhere. I expected a lot more from a Hilton.

Reviews.Title: “Not that great”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for first 2 nights at Vegas. Rooms were renovated, but old. Booked 2 rooms, and both rooms have problem with the drain backed up. Must be due to the old plumbing. Nothing much in the hotel in terms of attractions other than the Star Trek exibit which was pretty pricey and lame for a star trek fan. Location is fairly inconvenient. Rooms are fairly large in size, need to pay to use safe and cooling system is not the greatest. Noisy and not that cold. For $49 a night, should have paid an extra $10-20 and got a room at Aladdin, which we stayed for the next 2 nights.

Reviews.Title: “Not what I expected!”
Reviews.Author: Derohn
Reviews.Content: I went to Las Vegas the 26-29 of May. I made the reservation for the hotel on Hotels. The reason I stayed at this hotel was of course the price, I paid $69/night but the rep at Hotels told me it was a block from the strip. Now never once did it occur to me that Vegas blocks are as long as football fields! I should have remembered where it was (location wise) because I went in 99, but for some odd reason I couldnt remember. Anyway, we get there and a good thing that I found out (insiders tip) is that you can check in at the airport. In baggage claim right behind carousel #1 (and thats all of the Hilton properties in Vegas. i.e. Paris, Flamingo, Las Vegas Hilton, etc). Check in was fast and they gave me a room as I requested which was to be on the highest floor possible with a view of the strip. They placed me right on floor 26. The problem I have with the hotel was that it was NOT convenient. Hell, the money that I paid on taxi's to get back and forth to places I wanted to go was the cost of another room. It cost me $14 to get to the Mandalay Bay. Now you figure I am leaving the room in the morning, sometime that afternoon I am going to want to go back and shower and change. So now I have to pay to get back, and then you want to go back on the strip at night, so you pay to get back on the strip. Doing this over the course of 4 days adds up. What really burned me up was that I found a room at the MGM Grand 2 days before I left that was $89/night, but of course I couldnt cancel without being charged a fee because I had to cancel 72 hours prior. The room was average, the buffet was nothing to shout about, and to make matters worse I lost alot of money in the casino. I swear casino's marketing strategy to give you free liquor while you gamble is a trick of the devil. I hit a STRAIGHT FLUSH playing poker (and I never played the game before in my life)...Gave back ALL of the house money, and then $300 of my own before I sobered up enough to realize I was reaching in my pocket and pulling out MY OWN CASH!!!!! So all in all, for me not to be a big gambler my feelings were truly hurt!! If I ever go back I am staying at the Paris or something. Somewhere where I dont feel trapped cause I truthfully believed I would have left the casino faster if I knew I could just walk outside and be on the strip!

Reviews.Title: “classy,great room & food no problems”
Reviews.Author: f100zardoz
Reviews.Content: We travelled to Vegas to get married by the KING and stayed in the hilton for a week. I was apprehensive about the hotel because of some bad reviews,but fond it great. Our room was huge with a great veiw .The buffet was great & the staff very nice. While a little older than the newer hotels the hilton is more classy ,not as much or maybe not as obviously a tourest trap. great stay !!!

Reviews.Title: “Great value! Nice people!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a two night stay at the Las Vegas Hilton, July 5 - 7, 2004. Have stayed at this hotel once before several years ago and enjoyed that visit. This trip I decided that I was tired of paying high prices for bad service and filthy rooms at some of the newer, pretentious "luxury" hotels in Las Vegas (i.e. The Venetian).
