I decided to give my business back to the Las Vegas Hilton and am glad that I did. This hotel is older, yes, and not as "wow" as some of the new places. However, it is very comfortable, clean, and the staff at the Las Vegas Hilton are genuinely friendly and helpful. I would classify the Las Vegas Hilton as a "Golden Oldie". When we arrived the front desk agent was friendly and completely accomodating to our request for a high floor, king bed room. He gave us a fantastic view room on the 19th floor, facing the strip. I have paid triple the room rate for what I paid at the Hilton at other "luxury" hotels and have never had as nice a view as this room had. The room itself was amply sized, even with the king bed, and included an upholstered chair with ottoman, an upholstered desk chair for use at the large granite top window desk (with plenty of electical plugs located conveniently under the desk), and an entertainment armoire. All hard surfaces on the furniture and counters were covered with a black and white colored granite, which I thought was a nice touch. The large panoramic windows had an electrically controlled opening/closing system, which I got a kick out of (easily amused I guess). Bathroom was very clean, had a granite counter as well, excellent lighting, and a very large oval bathtub/shower combo. Towels were of good quality and fluffy. Nice adjustable massaging shower head with good water pressure. The tub itself looked a bit worn, but all of the tile was clean and in good shape, and I did not see mold anywhere (the Las Vegas Hilton housekeepers could teach the Venetian hotel's housekeepers how to clean a bathroom, and how to remove mold from the showers.....). There was a granite topped vanity with good lighting and small stool in the area outside the bathroom next to the closet. An iron, ironing board, two luggage racks, and extra folding chair were located in the closet. The king size bed was extremely comfortable and firm, had good linens, and down pillows. I think I had the best nights sleep ever in a hotel room both nights. No sounds detectable other than the sound masking white noise humm from the ventilation system, which in my opinion makes for a great sleeping environment. We ate dinner at the Hilton's Italian restaurant, "Andiamo", the first night. I experienced what I would say is one of the best dishes I've ever ate in a restaurant at "Andiamo" - it was called "Fettucini Portofino". This dish was absolutely perfect! Seafood pasta consisting of lobster meat, jumbo scallops, shrimp, and squid in a beautiful tomato/herb sauce over fettucini. If I'm in Las Vegas, no matter where I stay in the future, I will visit this restaurant for this dish alone! Fantastic! And the service was efficiently top notch, too. Highly recommend! Second night we met local friends for dinner at the Hilton's "Steakhouse" restaurant . We've been here before and were not disappointed this second visit. Our waitress was a complete doll (I'm terrible with names, but she has a very long name and has been there awhile - ask for the waitress with the long name and they will know who you mean!). Food was perfect and outstanding, as was service, and this is another restaurant which will get our business again. Pool area is large, and even though it was busy with a lot of children (I assume summer vacations), we had no problem locating a quiet area to relax. A full service bar is conveniently located at the pool, and there are quite a few private cabanas which looked like a nice way to spend a lazy afternoon (price was $45 for four hours rental, or $75 for full day, which I thought was reasonable). There is also a snack grill located in this area which makes it convenient to grab a hamburger or hot dog for a quick lunch without going back into the hotel. Bottom line, you get a lot of bang for your buck at the Las Vegas Hilton. We were given a coupon book at check-in and used two coupons to save a total of $20 on wine both nights in their restuarants (and the wine list is very reasonable priced), and even $4.50 on the breakfast buffet for two of us. There were quite a few other nice money saving coupons in that booklet as well. One more big plus, lots of real nickel slots (yes, I'm a big player, ha ha) which were fairly loose, and even the quarter slots gave me quite a few wins. I ended up breaking even after two heavy days and nights of gambling, so that left me in a happy mood! I noticed that they recently changed ownership (in June), so I hope that if changes are made, they are only to update areas that need a little spiffing up (like the elevator banks). My suggestions to the new owners. Staff elevator banks with Security Guards to at least check for key cards - there are no guards currently, so anyone can go up to guest room floors. Coffee makers in the room are something I always enjoy and there were none here. Eliminate the petty $3.00 per day charge to use the room safe, too. I recommend the Las Vegas Hilton to anyone who is visiting Las Vegas for business or pleasure, who doesn't want to spend a fortune on a decent hotel room, who isn't concerned with pretention and the "status" of the so called luxury properties (which really are not, folks, no matter how hard they pretend to be - just remember, no matter where you stay you ARE in Las Vegas, so get over it), and who enjoys good service from nice people. Looking forward to my next visit to this property! Check their website out directly for terrific rates and packages. I saw a great package for a room with two half hour spa massages included for $78 per night! Now that's a deal!

Reviews.Title: “Pathetic Security Staff!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed here April 2004 for a trade show. I had the noisy drunk neighbors from hell to and fro the casino all night banging doors. I called security twice. All they did is wait outside the door for a few minutes....didn't even knock on it! I got no sleep and it was a business trip. Only when I told them I would call the police - did they contact these people in the next room.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: Eddie1438
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 3 night stay at the Las Vegas Hilton and I was pleasantly surprised with the property. They were in the process of a systems conversion due to its recent sale from Caesars Entertainment, but everything still went very smoothly. The check-in was extremely quick and friendly (even though I had to go back outside and get my car out of the valet parking because I needed my driver's license to register), the rooms were great including a full width countertop at the window looking out over the Las Vegas Country Club golf course, the swimming pool was plenty large with an abundance of seating (splurge one day and get the cabana - well worth the $45), the casino personell (at the crap tables anyhow) were more than friendly and chatty, and the price couldn't be beat. I don't know what new ownership will bring, but they're spending big bucks on expansion and updating. There were only two downsides. Its location, tt's back from the strip and you'll need a car to get around although there is a monorail station nearby, and the fact that there is no poker room. I would recommend this property to anyone. Good luck!!!

Reviews.Title: “Only if you must”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel 3 times in the last year, and most recently in early June. The service is not good, the rooms are generally worn-out, and they do not have a customer friendly attitude. What they do have is the most convenient hotel to the convention center, and I believe they take advantage of that fact. The convenience level is so high, that they do not have to be a good hotelier to have plenty of business. Therefore, my reco is to stay there only if you must, i.e., you need to be close to the convention center. Otherwise, stay somewhere else that will be glad to have your business and show it.

Reviews.Title: “Old Las Vegas Charm”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Las Vegas Hilton the last weekend in April 2004. We arrived very late (about 2am) and even though we didn't get our king size bed request, the frontdesk person upgraded us to a larger room with a murphy bed. You could host a small gathering and everyone would be comfortable. We are frequent visitors to Las Vegas and the Las Vegas Hilton. We try to stay at this Hilton each time and are never disappointed. We have stayed at many other hotels in Las Vegas and regret not staying at this hotel. You will not be disappointed. The rooms are clean, the buffet is great and the 24hour cafe good too. There is plenty of parking and it's out of the way of busy Vegas streets.

Reviews.Title: “Great value!”
Reviews.Author: grram1
Reviews.Content: If you book through the Las Vegas Hilton website (www.lvhilton.com) you'll get a deal that can't be beat. True, the hotel shows its' age a little, but it is tastefully decorated and the room I had was large, clean & comfortable. If you have a car then the drive to the strip is a breeze (I wouldn't want to walk it though). The casino is a little on the small side compared to some of the strip hotels, but it has all of the games that I enjoy and generally isn't as crowded as the strip properties. Overall I feel that this is a great VALUE for your entertainment dollar. I will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Reviews”
Reviews.Author: raul90606
Reviews.Content: Anyone that writes a negative review about the LV Hilton is hard to please. This hotel is wonderful, it has everything a 4 * hotel should have. And the value, who can beat that. You negative people get a life........

Reviews.Title: “Great time at the Hilton”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I've been to Vegas twice now and both times stayed at the Hilton. I've looked at other hotel/casinos and while many appear very nice, I like the location of the Hilton (not to mention my husband is a big Star Trek fan). Both times, we really enjoyed ourselves and found the desk staff and casino staff to be exceptionally friendly and helpful. Although, I consider staying elsewhere just to soak in as much as possible of Vegas, we'll probably always end up at the Hilton because our experiences have been quite pleasing. The rooms were nice and the huge tubs were a pleasant surprise. Quarks is a really fun place to hang out (even for non-Trek fans) and we had a wonderful, romantic (and reasonably priced) dinner at Andiamo. Overall, this was a really great place.

Reviews.Title: “Good Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Not great, but not as bad as some reviews on here. Check in took 5 min, however, a/c in the room I was given on the 4th floor East Tower barely worked. There was just an on/off button, no HI, Med, Low, no way to regulate it. Since that week it was in the 100's that was totally unacceptable. Called the Desk Supervisor who was very nice, helpful and very quick give me another room in the North Tower on the 19th fl to see if that would be colder. It was perfect, freezing, but could be regulated - lg rm, 2 queen beds and wonderful view. Rm was cleaned on time everyday - pool area is very nice. Casino is smaller but more comfortable than the strip hotels, not as, in your face. Restaurants very overpriced. Water in rm - $4.! Asked about late checkout and immediately received a 2pm ck out which was perfect for my flight. Getting to the strip still requires cab or the trolley which is a drawback but all in all, not bad for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Some problems OK for trade shows.”
Reviews.Author: rollin59
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel several times for work. The front desk checkin process during major trade show crowds is pathetic and worse every time. During ICA show each customer took 45 minutes to an hour to check in due to "computer problems". Check your dates before leaving the desk...they tripled my show rate to a "stayover" rate for my last night because of error in booking. Offered to let me check out at 11PM to avoid the ripoff rate...but all hotels were booked so they had me cornered. Finally agreed to 'discount' to more than 2x the show rate. Took 4 phone calls to get correction made in my bill. Rooms are OK (slightly tired carpeting) and nice pool area. The sit-down restaurants are OK but way overpriced. The buffet is pretty good and a good value. Very convenient location for shows at LV Convention Center. Don't expect much service but good spot for doing trade shows.

Reviews.Title: “The Place To go!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I go to the Hilton at least six (6) times a year and I could not ask for a better value. I am not a big gambler by any means, but with the park place card I have not payed for a room in over a year. Shure, every one that works there is not polite all of the time, but this is Vegas! what do you expect. They send us MONEY to play with in the mail and you get comp dollars for playing that can be used to cover meals.That more than makes up for a couple of funky attitudes from some unhappy worker. Overall the staff is polite and they are good at what they do.The water in the rooms is expensive, but thats what playing beverages are for.I always rent a car so I drive to the strip if I feel like it and I love the margareta grill.It can get crowded during conventions, but overall the Las Vegas Hilton has won me over.

Reviews.Title: “Black List”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The rooms were not cleaned, as a ex smoker the room smelled like cigarettes even though I was assured that it was a nonsmok room, very poor ammenties-no coffee pot, no free local calls, excessively charged for bottled water. Overall very disappointing stay. Not Recommended. Friends that were with us will also not recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, shame about the frontdesk service”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I spent five nights at the Hilton as part of a wedding group. The hotel was very nice, with a light and airy casino (unlike some of the dark and dirty ones you get on the strip). My room was large with a great view and was cleaned as soon as I left each morning. The buffet is very good value (much better than the Sahara for example) and although the hotel is off the strip, transport is easy to obtain and relatively cheap (especially the trolley bus). The only complaint I have concerns the front desk. Despite booking months in advance, we were told that the rooms we had requested weren't available and that if we'd arrived later there might not have been any rooms at all!! They even tried to put the wedding couple in twin beds! Then, when we were due to leave, we were told that our transfer bus would leave from the East exit. In fact, it left from the front exit without us! We complained to the front desk who gave us $50 towards our bus fare. Luckily we made it on time for our flight, no thanks to the front desk. Overall, a very pleasant hotel but the service could be improved.

Reviews.Title: “Will never stay there again”
Reviews.Author: audreyport2001
Reviews.Content: Never again. After being looked straight in the eyeballs by the check-in clerke as she LIED to us about there being no King bed rooms left (which we requested), we were sent up to a room with 2 queen beds. The toilet didn't flush in that room so I called for a manager and voila--Next thing you know, we're in a room that has a King bed. Funny how those front desk clerks are such LIARS.The location is bad--way off strip. We usually are at Bellagio, but wanted to try something a bit different.Our room service breakfast arrived without any utensils--Did they expect us to eat it with our fingers?The casino is too small and was jammed. Not enough table games with mid-range betting 10-25. Too many high limit tables.I'm back at Bellagio the next time...Paris and Nicky Hilton can have this junker of a resort.

HotelInfo.Name: LVH - Las Vegas Hotel & Casino
HotelInfo.Address: 3000 Paradise Rd, Las Vegas, NV 89109 (Formerly Las Vegas Hilton)
